reviews.review: wow. the views from this area are amazing as you can see the whole of Budapest if you don't fancy the climb you can use the railway or a buggy ride

Great Overlook Spot. Castle Hill rises above the Danube in Buda, just across chain bridge. Ancient ruined ramparts support construction that has been added in the last 75 years or so. There is a large church with a wonderful mosaic rooftop. There are interesting streets to wander and shops, but the highlight is the magnificent views of the river, Parliament buildings and Pest.

entire castle area. We were fortunate to have a very good walking tour of the castle area. She took us around the whole area at the back of Mathias Church. There are several streets here with interesting shops, views out to Buda. Don't just do the Mathias Church and Fishermans Bastion. Much more to see if you walk left of the Bastion turrents.

Views outwards better than the place itself!. Really we made our way up here to view the sensational Modigliani exhibition and we were delighted we did because it was a great show. The views over Pest from up here are really good so it is well worth the walk or taxi ride. There is an ambitious programme of re-building proposed so the area can only become better in the future.

Amazingly picturesque. Lovely area of a beautiful city, you can walk up on foot or take the funicular railway ( around 7 mins) steeped in history and some lovely little shops and delicious selection of classy restaurants ... A must to visit in Budapest

Marvelous View from Castle Hill. If on the Pest city of Budapest you can cross the Chain Bridge to the other side of Buda. You can walk up the hill or if you want to save your feet take the funicular and in just 2 minutes you're up at the Hill. Have a nice walk around and admire the number of buildings with different tastes. You can take a break and sip a coffee or take a snack at one of the coffee shops/restaurants and enjoy the surroundings and tourists going around.Walking by you can visit St Matthias Church, St Stephen's statue,the Holy Trinity column and Fisherman's Bastion besides other interesting places and monuments. You can stop at one of the many souvenir shops and buy your souvenirs.
GORGEOUS. Just stand and watch the lights for a while at night- it's magical. Climb to the top for great views!

Very worthwhile. Big Bus drop on drop off company provided free walking tours up here. Very knowledgeable tour guide. If you don't take the tour taking the walk (after going up the funicular is worth it). You see the castle, walk the length of the hill to fisherman's bastion. Lots of shops, eateries, and beautiful architecture on the way. At fisherman's bastion end is also St Matyas church that is well worth taking in. Beautiful views.

Nice place to see the city during the night. You can see all city lightened, a perfect place to enjoy the panorama of the city by night! I suggest to buy a bottle of wine sit in some spot and enjoy the lights!
Gorgeous. This is one of the areas worth a visit both during the day and at night when the area is lit up. To appreciate the true splendor its best to spend half a day here

Go in the early morning to see the river and sights without crowds. I walked across the Chain Bridge from Pest at 8 am, and saw the sun shining on the Buda side as I crossed the Danube. I walked to Fisherman's Bastion from the Castle, and the streets were empty. The Bastion was also empty, which allowed for fabulous photos. Later that day I returned with my sister, and the crowds were there in droves. Still lovely, but I was very glad I'd gone earlier so I could experience Castle hill without the crowds. Take the time to stop at a coafe, and there is a post office on the main road that supplies post cards and stamps.
Another must do . Another must do during a visit to Budapest - easily accessible and with beautiful views of the city.

Nice tour at the gallery. The castel itself is not very impressive, and on the inside you cant possibly guess what it looked like in the past. But the art collection is really beatiful, it gives a nice feeling of the atmosphere during different times in Hungarian history, like when the Ottomans rulled Hungary. We paid 1800 HUF for adults in all ages but Euro citizens have discounts.

Restored grandeur. The Castle Hill and Old Town areas suffered as a result of wars, but have been restored to their former glory. The funicular is a popular tourist trap, which we did not used, but rather too the hop-on hop-off bus and used one of the lifts, some of which are free.
Stay on the Buda Side. Charming and safe area of Budapest to stay. Walking access to small shops, sights and lots of restaurants.

So much to see and do! Plan for a full day!!!. There is much to see and do there including the Coronation Church and the Fishermen's Bastion...museums and places galore to eat! Great views of Pest. You can ride the funicular or walk up the steps to get there!
Impressive at night. Almost whole monuments and buildings in Budapest are impressive at night, specially this one makes me huge impression either during day.

If you only do one thing this is it. Be prepared to spend at least half a day up there. Was kinda like "ok so this is Budapest... " when I first arrived in pest, but upon going over to Castle Hill, I was just so impressed and I totally take back what I had said lol

Beautiful walk!. Between the church, museum and castle, this is a great day's activity. We stayed downtown and had a lovely walk across the Chain Bridge to the funicular, which is a fun ride to the top of the hill (do not walk). There are beautiful views of the Danube and the city, and it is fun to walk around this area.
A great place to spend the whole day!. If you don't visit, you miss!!! You can visit the museum, have coffee break admiring the view, walk around the area!

Castle Hill Budapest. We went up castle hill with the funicular. This is a small town with many tourist. It has a nice castle but we didn't go in since it's not pushchair accessible. Also there is a labyrinth under the castle which is accessible by pushchair. it was worth the visit. There are many restaurants where you can sit back and relax. And the fisherman's bastions are definitely worth a visit.

Most impressive buildings and views of Budapest. Walk up to the Castle through small lanes and th en enjoy the most beautiful view of whole Budapest! Many interesting museums and buildings are waiting for you, nice restaurants, too. You have a Choice between are Short snack and the most expensive meal, but everything worth the Money you spend. But culture is the important thing to Go for...
Picture Perfect. Such an amazing place to just wonder around. A complete contrast to the hustle and bustle of Pest. The buildings are like something from Hansel and Gretel, just picture perfect.
Must be on your list. These old buildings are ageless and beautiful and at night it transforms into a wonderland of light and colour. The size and beauty will captivate you.

beautiful part of Buda. Unfortunately, we could not tour the castle because it was Sunday, but we got to see the outside and all of the areas around it. This is a gorgeous part of the city. It is on the Buda side, and there is a lot of steep climbing to get here.

Beautiful. Oh, so worth the visit. This place is gorgeous and full of charm. We were with a guide who helped us see and understand all that we could see. We recommend a guide for your first adventure into this beautiful place.
Become a part of fairy tail!. You wish you could live in such amazing palace. It really looks phenomenal and it's very pleasant time to walk through the garden.

A must see site. The Castle is one of the main icons of Budapest. Towering high above the on the Buda hills it allows for a fantastic panoramic view of the whole city. It is usually hosting permanent or temporary Art Exhibitions. When we were there they had Modigliani on display...The Castle can be reached either using the cable train (a fun thing to do), by Elevator or by foot. Walking up is not easy though, you need to be able to walk several hundred meters uphills in order to try this.Around the Castle there are a lot of attractions that can amuse both adults and children - like arrow shooting in a medieval setup.Walking away northwards from the Castle will take you to the Mathias Cathedral and the Fishermen's Bastion.Be ready to spend at least a whole day in this place, you will not regret it
Very nice!. Nice place and good views over the city. There was also a nice terrace with views, nice to eat or have a meal.

Imperial spendor with a view!. Next to the Parliament, this is the # 2 Must See attraction in the city! It is awesome and beautiful with the castle, a cathedral, the Fisherman's Village, and more, and surrounded by quaint little streets winding up and down hills should you need a break from being overpowered.

Cool views & Free. You can walk up and around Castle Hill for free, some pretty gardens and incredible views. If you don't want a massive treck - go up by the gardens, where there is an escalator and then a lift! Or take the Funicular (but that costs a little).

Budapest in less than 24hours has to include Castle Hill. Spent less than 20 hours in Budapest. Hit the ground running by doing a Yellow Zebra Bike Tour from 11a.m to 230p.m. Followed by self directed tour of Castle Hill complex--Buda Castle, grounds, Fisherman's Bastion, St Matthias' church. Do not miss it!.
Excellent Tourist Location. Castle Hill on the Buda side of the Danube is a great place to visit. Full of history and great views over the river.
Allow plenty of time. The Castle Hill District is full of wonderful old buildings and hidden corners with statues and places of interest. Allow at least a day if you want to see everything.

Lovely day out. We intended to visit the site via the funicular, but the queue was very long so we decided to walk the perimeter instead. We were pleasantly surprised to find an escalator that took us to the castle, without any queue. Added bonus was enjoying all the lovely sights on the backside of the castle. Well worth exploring!
Great view of the city. The view from the castle district gives you the best overview of the three separate areas the comprise Budapest.

Good Views. Funicular or walk. The queue for the funicular was 40 mins which is about the same as walking. The views make it worth it. It has wonderful views from the castle which is a lovely building apart from plastic Windows.

Very Easy to Climb . We had read somewhere that it was rather a steep climb so decided to take the funicular. However when getting closer we saw there were many lifts to get you up there if not the stairs. It was very easy to do and some beautiful photo opportunities along the way. All the attractions up there are well signed and easy to walk to.
Good to look at - go at night . Go at night when it's lit up. It looks good when all lit up which most of the city does at night. Worth taking a trip round at night.
Definitely worth it. it is breath taking, whatever you do in budapest DON'T miss this. you get an amazing view of the entire budapest and the famous danube, it is a must when in budapest
Worth the Climb. Top of the hill but buses and furnicular available for those who need or wnat to save their energy for walking round venue. Lots to see and do once up there.
More Grand Views. If you are in Budapest you will not miss this - a nice walking tour is wonderful in the day or night.

Great views from the top. Walked up here as part of the free walking tour. Lots of steps to climb but the view when you get to the top is worth it. There is a lift you can ride, however the queues are long

A Mixture of Experiences. Castle Hill has something for everyone. A beautiful church, some shopping, a flavor of the alps, scenic views and history. We took the Funicular up and back down, but the walk down would have been pretty easy. There are decent restaurants to chose from whether for just soup and a glass of wine or a whole meal. We didn't know a lot of what all there was to see here but you can definitely spend almost a whole day exploring. We spent a couple of hours here and ate at two establishments and the food was good at both.

It's a must!. We decided to spend our day in the Buda side (our apartment was in Pest) and we didn't regret it at all. First of all the view of the Pest from the top of the hill is beautiful. There are a lot of tourist, the atmosphere is gorgeous!! Just go up the hill, walk around, chill and enjoy the perfect view :)
Beautiful hill with spectacular views of the city. A must go place for the views and pictures. You can take a furnicular to go up the hill. its a very beautiful place.

A visit to a film setting.. When you step back in time and see what the old Buda Castle hill looked like.. many old houses and quaint little streets with the magnificent Matthias Church and Fishermans Bastion overlooking the Pest side with the majestic Parliament and the Basilica towering above Pest! What a view! Visit a little restaurant with local specialist dishes and avoid Jamie Oliver's newest restaurant! Pricey and not worth it!
Fantastic Views. It is beautiful up on the Castle Hill. Cracking views and lovely shops and an ice cream parlour. Worth a visit. We saw two weddings at the Church up there.
Budapests most famous landmark. The castle hill is Budapests most famous landmark - and rightfully so. The place is beautiful and also gives you a great view over the city and the river.
Spend the Day, Eat and Shop. We spent the day on the hill visiting the cathedral and walking around all of the little streets. Great shopping and outdoor cafes.

A Highlight of Budapest (Buda Side). Be sure to include this area on your list of things. We took the funicular up the hill from the Chain Bridge (this is a cable railway that goes up the steep Hill to the castle area). . You can spend an hour or two at the castle but can also easily take over a half day, exploring the back areas, the museums, the village area with shops/restaurants and St Matthias church. Plan on lots of history, great views of the Pest side of the city and some beautiful buildings to see.

Lots to see!. Lots to see in this area, could probably spend a day just looking around here. Would have liked to have gone in the funicular but didn't get the time. Got lots of great photos and would definitely have liked to have spent more time here.
Step back n time. A lovely area to walk around lots of lovely buildings quiet streets and nice coffee shops. Go early to save queuing to long for the funicular and before it gets busy with visitors.
A beautiful vista point. This is a must do activity on the Buda side of the city. The buildings are beautiful and historic but the scene below is incredible from up here.

Full of attractions. A kilometre long limestone plateau of height 170m above the River Danube, consists of some historical landmarks and museums on the Buda side of Budapest. From afar, one can see the Buda castle. At Buda castle , we proceeded to visit Budapest History Museum and Sandor Palace. We were there at the right time as there was a changing of guards. After the show, we went to Matthias Church and Fisherman's Bastion. In between the two attractions stands the monument of the first king of Hungary, King Stephen I.

Phototaking point over Budapest. Castle Hill on the Buda side of River Danube was a nice phototaking point over Budapest. You either have to take the funicular uphill or just walk up via a side path. We took a taxi this time in order to catch up the time (9am) in snapshooting the change of guards performance in front of the castle apart from taking advantage of skipping the huge crowd of tourists by middle of the day. It was really worthwhile as you could get more time to take photos here and there at ease. Recommended to others to make use of this tip.

Great for an hour or a day. We visited the area twice. First, just to get a feel for the area and then went back as there was so much to see. Spent art of our time shopping, visiting the cathedral, and then dining. There is so much to do in this area from seeing sites to the museum. Plan your time accordingly. Oh, and unless you want to stand in line, just take the 16 bus up the hill and skip the funicular.

Take the funicular. Take the funicular and avoid the taxi con about having to wait 45 minutes in line to buy funicular tickets (took about 10 minutes).This area is definitely worth spending some time to see and be sure to wander around the hill for great architecture, great views, and interesting happenings. See the guards at the government buildings change guard houses and other interesting events.

Only for the pictures. Teaming with tourist because it is the only thing to do in Buda (?) we went on a small group tour of only four people and a guide. Did see inside of Hyatt which was cool if you like how modern architecture can reuse old structures. But felt crowded the whole time and a bit like any other tourist. Have to say you of corse get a great view of Pest. And the only place in the city to see a modern art collection. Taking a tram bus or meto is easy don't pay the 10 euros for ride on viniculare

Buda. Have to see, best take a tour to get know all the information about history. With Budapest card there are two Nice museums in palace. The national galery Has a great view on Peszt from the higher levels

Beautiful and Intricate. You could spend days on castle hill and still not experience everything. The history, culture, and food of Hungary are all on display up here. Uniquely, going down into the cave system under the hill is also no to be missed.

Place of high "must-see" density. Many of the main attractions of Buda are located on this hill. It offers great views, the chance to really take in some of the culture of Budapest and can be very interesting and educational (especially the military history museum).

Great place!. We been with friends and our choise been gomobility, litle harley to drive around. Thats been perfect! We avoid lines, people waiting to cach up funicular, save somme time, area is big. And is fun!!!! You find this electrical bikes down in the city. Around 50 euro for whole day.

A must for sightseeing!. Definitely recommend a visit to the castle. Plenty to see, great views, museum, places for lunch. To get there we went via the hop on / off buses and then took the Funicular up too the top (this is extra on the bus pass). You can walk up to the castle via a side entrance walk way not to strengthous and plenty of people doing this.
Great Walk with amazing view. We were up for a nice walk to Castle Hill. I was really happy with my sneakers because it's a real "climb" with lots of "Kodak" moments.

Magical from afar and beautiful from anear . The Buda side of the river, the hilly side, is well worth the visit and a walk about, not just a visit to Mathias Church, Fisherman's Bastion, the Palace and the other grand tourist attractions, but to see the many charming neighborhoods, winding streets, inns, hotels, bars, and restaurants. And the views of the Pest side are breathtaking!! The lighting at night turns the whole place magical. You can get wonderful photos right there, from any of the bridges, or on the opposite side of the river.

A Magnificent Castle. We walked to the castle from our hotel, but there are also buses and tours available. The castle itself and its many buildings, as well as the fantastic views from the top are a must see!
Fantastic. Over looking he pest side, beautiful statuses . Feeling like going back in times with knighits and arrows ( our kids even tried shooting arrows with ancient bow)
Exquisite site at night. We walked past Castle Hill at night, and my goodness, what a site! One of the most beautiful in all of Budapest.
Nice 😊. Did not go inside just around the area . Very clean and nice with a little garden bellow. Wheelchair accessible by a lift moving stairs if you can't walk it
Stunning. Lovely place to visit, amazing views, impressive buildings, nice castle walks, market and ample parking

Not worth the effort. This is an inaccurate reproduction of the original buildings and although it adds to the local skyline especially at night, it is not worthwhile to take the time to see up close or inside.

Beautiful Historic Old Town Buildings, Great Hungarian Food & Wonderful Views. A scenic journey to Castle Hill (aka Castle District) generally begins with walking across Budapest’s famous Chain Bridge (“Széchenyi Lánchíd” in Hungarian), and then taking the cable car ride (originally built in 1870) up Buda Hill. The Chain Bridge connects Buda and Pest, and spans the Danube River. An easier way to Castle Hill is to get the bus # 16 which you can get on about 50 metres from the main entrance door of the Four Seasons Hotel Gresham Palace. Of course, there are many other stops on the bus route where one can get on. Since I’ve been to Budapest over 60 times, I have walked up Buda Hill from the Buda end of the Chain Chain Bridge to the Castle District; although it is good exercise, there is little tourist value to the walk. The Castle District (a Unesco World Heritage Site) is home to many of Hungary’s most significant medieval monuments and museums. The attractions include the Buda Castle, the Royal Palace and its many courtyards, the Matthias Church (Mátyás Templom), medieval architecture and houses of both royalty and commoners, winding stone roads, good Hungarian restaurants, cafes, wine tasting in Buda Castle at the Faust Wine Cellar, the Dominican Monastery, the breathtaking view and a fine Hungarian cuisine available at both the Halászbástya Restaurant and the certain seats in the Hilton restaurant from which one can have a panoramic view of the Danube river and Pest, various stone-walled caves, and many more exciting things to view. A few of the stores on Castle Hill sell Herend, a world class fine porcelain. I’ve purchased over 200 pieces, some being at the Herend store on Castle Hill, others at the Herend store/manufacturing plant in Herend (a village outside of Papa, Hungary), and other stores in Hungary. Personally I like the animal figurines.

Well worth the trip up the steep hill. Comprising of several very white stone gleaming buildings, due to being rebuilt after heavy damage during the war, you have to pay to enter but just walking around admiring the structures themselves with added sculptures and a magnificent fountain is reward enough.There are also the foundations of the first medieval palace to view, along with the changing of the guard but the best view is of the whole of Budapest below.Located on top of a steep hill on the Buda side of the Danube, you can join the long queue for the rebuilt but historically accurate funicular or get fit negotiating the many paths to the top.

Nice place to wonder. We didn't go inside but we still enjoyed the walk round. There are some amazing views of the city. We saw the changing of the guard twice. It happened just before the hour. Everybody stands waiting near the arch but we just happened to be walking past on the left and that is where the whole show starts. Lucky us!

Great City Views!. Beautiful buildings to explore with great city views. You can take the Vernicular from the Chain Bridge. Some sight seeing bus tickets includes the Vernicular ticket, however you need to claim this from the driver otherwise you will have to pay to go up - and no, the drivers do not say anything.... The vernicular is great fun. It is definitely worth a trip up!

Very nice.. We walked up the stairs instead of taking the funicular. It was plenty of walking in the area of town. Really very interesting architecture and views. It's a must-see for a tour of Budapest. Much of it was reconstructed after World War II.
Worth a visit for the views + cute cafes at the top. We got the furnicular up, it was worth the wait for the scenic ride. At the top is a little castle district with gorgeous views across the city.
Beautiful/Fascinatiing. A wonderful place to walk around. I couldn't believe what all was there, some of which was not accessible to us because of a wine festival.
A must visit spot. This is a great place to visit. Great access up via steps or road or cable car.Easy to fin and access. Great views over Budapest.
Stunning views!. Castle Hill is worth the climb! The view from that top is stunning with lots to see and do! It's a must!

Castle on the hill. Castle hill is a huge castle on top of the hill with views of Buda and Pest. There are a lot of steps to take to get up there (or you can use the elevator) but its totally worth it.
Must site. Very interesting site, should be visited if you're in Budapest. Improved a lot since our last visit.

Strategic location on top of the hill.. An absolutely magical view over the Danube and the majestic Parliament House across the water.
Aside a permanent exhibition there was the most perfect and complete exhibition of the life and work of Modigliani with paintings and sculptures coming from musea all over the world. Sensational !

Beautiful views of parliament across the water. The small gardens, fountain and statues around the castle, along with its location on the hilltop make for a very picturesque setting. I was pleasantly surprised and felt that this was one of the highlights of my trip to Budapest.
Breathtaking. Absolutely breathtaking, the view as well as climbing the hill. Love that the gardens are opened until midnight, which less visitors.

Absolutely Beautiful. Wonderful views. Awesome architecture. Great for strolling and people watching. St Mathias church is a must see. Loved all the statues with famous Hungarians on horseback. A must visit area in Budapest.

Worth a visit!. When visiting Budapest, it is a must to visit this place. Such a lovely place to visit and also amazing views. If you have elderly people or any young children with pushchairs it is better to use the hill funicular as otherwise there is quite a long way up hill. We've seen the changing of the guards at around noon, just near the funicular. We also had the chance to experience the wine festival for which we had to pay the entrance fee and were given a wine glass each. The atmosphere was superb with good food and good wine, wooden stalls and a lot of people creating such an amazing atmosphere. The view in the evening is marvelous especially the scenery overlooking Chains Bridge and the Parliament.

Stunning . OMG... what can I say, probably one of the most beautiful skylines I've seen since Norway,,,, hardly any high rise buildings, architecture is absolutely stunning, we spent a whole day wandering around here, stopping in a few places for a drink, hundreds of folk wandering around with tour guides,, there is nothing to this place that anyone could find boring or mundane,,, it's s must on traveling to Budapest

Nice and good view. Well, a lot of things to see at Castle hill, and the architecture of all buildings there is excellent. The view of the Danube river, Parliament and the Pesta riverfront is also fantastic!

Splendid Views. We strolled the length of Castle Hill today. It was outstanding. This is a "must do" item during any visit to Budapest. The views of the Danube, the bridges, Parliament, St Stephen's Basilica and The Pest side of the city are absolutely spectacular. The statuary and the architecture are wonderful. There are numerous cafe's and coffee shops to relax.

Amazing to visit, the best panorama of Budapest. The old Castle District is linked to Clark Ádám Square (along the river) by the Castle Hill Funicular. o by bus from the same square. Sitting in the Buda Hills, high above the Danube, the Castle District (Budai Várhegy) is amazing to visit during the day and extremely beautiful while lit up at nigh; From there you can great a great view of the city
Gorgeous. Walking the grounds or admiring the castle from afar it is a stunning sight, both day and night. Treat yourselves to the funicular on the way up and take your time to walk down!
Just a nice building. It is a nice building and the view from here is amazing. But there is not much to see. Donot skip this but if you are not interested in museums it will be short visit.

Must see European beauty . If you are looking for history, beauty, and safe places to wander, this is it. We stayed in a hotel here for a week, and were so happy be away from the big city bustle of Pest. The best restaurants are booked solid between 7-9, so either ask the hotel to reserve early or work around it. It is a gated area, and although the tourists are many from 11-4, you can wander off the beaten tracks for gorgeous vistas and solitude. We walked everywhere from here - both up and down. However if you aren't into the exercise (we averaged 10 miles a day), you can pay for the vernacular OR take the FREE escalator up - it's open 24 hrs. The Fishermans Bastion charges during the busy tourist hours, but if you are up early or late you can get up there without charge. We were blessed with a free classical piano concert honoring Hungarian and Christian roots one night outside Matthias Chapel (climb the bell tower for a must -see view). We went to the Labyrinth hesitantly, but we're very pleased to find it was history focused rather than Twilight/Dracula falsehoods.

Must See in Budapest. Definitely a must see area in Budapest . The buildings and architecture are interesting and the views really good , although I believe the views from Fisherman's Bastion are even better.

Amazing by night. We visited at night (in a thunderstorm!) and it was a truly splendid view across the city with all the lights, particularly on the bridges. We came down by funicular, which was great fun.
Worth a visit just for the views. It's a great to visit during the day or evening. Accros the river you will see amazing views at night, looks spectacular

Great view of the city. Just minutes from the Chain bridge, it is an easy walk to the top to enjoy the great view. The museum is very popular and the cafe there is a good place to take a break and refuel.

A must visit in Budapest!. I think Castle Hill is a must visit for tourists. The first time we went up was part of a free walking tour. We walked across the Chain Bridge. Once you are across, you will see the line for the funicular. To the left of that, you will see some small businesses selling lemonade, etc. Our guide said, if we bought something, and I think everyone needed a drink it was so hot, the receipt would allow us entrance to the WC. This was our pit spot on the tour. Now, the WCs are between the funicular and drink stand and towards the back. I mention this as I am not sure we would have noticed it.To ascend the hill, just past the drink stands is a small street, on the left, walk up there and look for an opening in the wall on your right. If you enter there, in no time, you will be in a parkland setting and will see a dirt path and stairs. Follow either one to the top. You will come out near the National Art Gallery.There's a fee to enter the gallery but the view is free! There's also souvenir vendors and an outdoor cafe. If you stay away from the gallery and head to the right, you will see another viewing opportunity and if you keep heading in that direction, you will find the church, Fishermen's Bastion, etc. Your camera will be going click, click. By the time we finished our tour, we had been up well over 30 hours as it was our arrival day, so we took the funicular down. We were able to get some more photos and it is one of those fun things you do as a tourist.We visited the area three more times on our stay and we just walked up and down using the path I described. It's not a really long walk but perhaps a bit steep for people who are not regular walkers. On the way, we saw a violinist busking and people having quiet time. There's a lookout part way up where you can see the funicular going up and down.We didn't patronize any of the shops but had a quick lunch at Bazaar which was very nice and set in some ruins. Not sure how to describe that area. It's further past the Castle but going away from the church and bastion. I think of it as being south but not sure if that's right. It was found by chance. We found very few people in that area. We were on a walk to the Cave Church and Gellert Hill that day.Finally, if you are interested in visiting the National Art Gallery, which is housed in the big castle building, there's a view from the cupola included in your fee. Wherever you look from, the view is awesome and it most cases, it's free.

Crowded with Beautiful Views. Top tourist area. Funicular poorly run and crowded; explore alternative approaches. Nice to walk through, but that is about it. From the north end, there are lovely steps down that will take you through a non-touristy area of Buda. From there you can walk across a bridge or take a boat bus across the river.

Cool architecture . This is a very nice architectural place to see. Full of details to see and take note for thouse with an appetite for architecture. Not only that but while in the city,why not having a taste of the local culture ;-)
Gave a go....see for yourself

beautifull view. must go overhere, a super beautifull view from this castle.
go up with the Buda Hill Funicular. 1800 huf a €6,- for return.
When you are upstairs it is breathtaking. capture the view over the donau.

Definitely worth a visit for the views. Taking a bus is probably the best option although there is a funicular train that takes you up the from the hill. The views from the terrace by the royal palace are stunning and gets better if you make it to the cupola on the National Gallery.

Beautiful sight; no directional signage or tourist info once you get there. The view is magnificent from high on the hill. Admission to the grounds (not the buildings or museums) is free. But not a single sign directs a tourist or gives any access information. No tourist info on site or handout maps. Be prepared to climb.Good photo op, nice historical flavor if you do your research ahead of time. Budapest Tourist Authority, if there is one, needs to do a much better job.

Great views. We took the funicular up and down without realising that this place is accessible by bus with some walking. Views at the top was great for photographs of the river and across. Castle building walls was not as well maintained as others and we did not see it's interiors (some exhibition on). Great to visit for the views from here but again the views can be captured from Fisherman Bastion too.

Views and gallery. Lot of people visit this place because of promise of wonderful views. But there are much better places on the Buda side of Danube to view Pesti Parliament. Castle hill offers much more - the National Gallery. It offers best Hungarian collection of art pieces. Carefully plan your visit. Best and mostly used access is from Clark's square either by the funicular (bit overpriced) or walking up the hill. But during tourists peak hours waiting time for funicular could be rather long.
Great views . We took the funicular up to the castle which was a great way to avoid the stairs, and not very expensive. The views from the top were great
scenic views and great photos. This is a must see area of Buda. There is so much to see and do. Come during day and also at night for great views of city below

On the Buda side of Budapest. There are so many spots to stop and enjoy the different views once you reach the top, either of the Danube and Pest or behind Budavari itself. Enjoy the funicular ride up one way for 1200Huf and then walk back down through the park to grab opportunities for different perspectives of Pest. Up the top you can drop in on Dracula's labyrinth or Houdini's home but we opted for the famous cream cake at Ruszwurm tea shop. If you want to climb the bell tower of Mattias Templom book your tickets early so you aren't waiting around as groups are limited to 25 at a time.

Don't miss location and gallery . Another stunning building in Budapest but with the best views and an amazing gallery too. Historic and modern, and don't forget the dome, hardly anyone seemed to go up there!
We caught the Modigliani exhibition here and hadn't booked ahead.
The cafe is reasonably priced and you can grab a sandwich to eat outside with that view.
Beautiful plae. Very nice historical place to walk around, visit the National Gallery. In September it was still pretty crowded, lots of visitors.

Views. Another great view point of the city. We went up in the funicular and came down by foot, which is very doable. We came down a flat sloping path as it is a little on the steep the funicular path route.

Lovely views and a wine festival. Lovely views and a wine festival what more do you want. We got the funicular yup to the top of the castle and a taxi back to our hotel after we had finished sampling the lovely wines. I have never seen so many different types in one place. It was also free to go into the museum.
Visit at Night. Spectacular when lit up at night and from the castle you have amazing views of the river and Parliament building

Best views in town. Lots of history...great walks to the top and we'll worth the trek for the panoramic city views once on top.
The Castle side is my favourite area of the city
beautiful. You get an amazing view of the city from the Castle Hill. If you like arts, check out the National Gallery inside the Buda Castle as well! ;)

Night city. We rode the #16 bus from Szent Kal Men Ter which was a quick 10 minutes. (We have also walked up the hill which is 30 minutes.) It was approaching dusk and people were lined along Fishermans Bastion to see the city light up. We watched as the bridges lit, then the Parliament and all the Pest buildings one by one as the sun retreated. As the light of the sun faded the light of the city grew more magnificent and we were able to watch it all from a perfect vantage. We walked down to the castle and enjoyed the view from that side. Then we found a lift that took us down a couple floors, steps to another lift and then street level. We walked along the tram line to board a tram that took us home. We felt very safe walking at night and enjoyed our time this evening.

Plenty to see and do. We ended up here while on a free walking tour. We spent the rest of the day around this area enjoying the sites. There's plenty of decent, cheap food if your willing to explore the back streets. There's also plenty to do here from walking around the castle grounds o going inside and around the church to the hospital in the rock. Unfortunately there's no metro stop on the hill so you'll have to take the bus which is generally cramped and takes about 20 minutes to reach Pest.

Exclusive place in Budapest night and day. Don't miss to visit here! Enjoy the unique panorama of the entire city especially the Chain Bridge, the Parliament and the Danube in both directions. Many tourist attractions located here for example Matthias Church (Mátyás-templom in Hungarian), Hungarian National Gallery with great exhibitons, Lions Court (Oroszlános Udvar), and famous restaurants and cafés (Ruszwurm Café and Pastry Shop with tradition), etc.

Good views and nice area. You have nice views to the Pest side of Buda-pest. Up and around the hill are some nice streets with monuments, views to all sides and several restaurants and bars. There are also several museums (mainly art and history).

Amazing. This Castle is just wonderful. We went there and find the wine festival. We had to pay for the entrance becuase of the wine festival. But it was so very nice with a lot of wine and food. It's a must to visit it.

Interesting. I have already reviews Fishermans Bastion so will not repeat about the great views. There is plenty on offer in the Castle Hill area and was the first area we visited. If you time it right (on the hour) you will get to see the changing of the guard whilst not as slick as seeing the changing of the guard in London it is still worth some of your time.

Great museum. Yes, the views and architecture are great, but this was one of the best museums we visited in three weeks that included Germany, Austria and Prague. Permanent exhibit was very good and special exhibits on Picasso and Modigliani were absolutely world class. Well written commentaries and background information. Best thing in Budapest!

Amazing views. The views are amazing from up there and there are lots of places to eat and drink - lovely atmosphere - the church is stunning outside (sadly didn't get to go inside) - at night time it is just magincal up there. The funicular is expensive and we thought uneventful especially when you can catch the bus up and down if you don't fancy the walk (no. 6 I think!) - the chair lifts on buda hills are much better value for money and so peaceful. We ate twice at the Pest Buda restaurant - food was very good.

Well worth seeing. We bought a ticket for the train ride up the hill to the castle along with our hop on hop off bus ticket. As you ascend the hill on the train, the view of the Pest area of the city is fabulous. When we reached the Palace level the panoramic view was stunning. We wandered through and decided that, rather than go in the Palace, we would wander through the residential area. The buildings are beautiful. Stunning medieval style churches and houses to match the period. Instead of taking the train back down, we wandered through the winding streets to reach the bottom. This is a hidden gem in the Buda side of the city and is waiting to be explored. Fantastic day and highly recommended.
Must see - don't be put off by the walk!. Absolutely lovely and very impressive. We were there during the wine festival (and had 4 day tickets) so particularly good!!

Fantastic architecture and stunning views . Castle Hill is almost worth a visit just for the spectacular views of Budapest alone. Almost! Add into the mix some beautiful architecture, Matthias Church, Matthias Fountain, Fisherman's Bastion and quaint cobbled streets and you can't go wrong. Take the Funicular up the hill for a fun experience.
A GREAT PLACE. It´s a great place to visit and a great view of the city of Pest. You don´t need to visit the inside building.
Beautiful building. This building is stunning, even though I visited during the day and didn't have the pleasure of seeing it lit up

Castle. You can easily spend a few hours wandering about the castle area. It's very big. There are various buildings, streets, bars, restaurants and shops. We should have got a map. There was a huge queue at the funicular railway which takes you to a big courtyard on the hill. We couldn't be bothered waiting in a 30 min queue so we took a wander up the hill to the left only to be stopped from travelling any further due to a wine festival which you had to pay to get in. Okay if you are a wine drinker, I guess. We had to backtrack then eventually found our way to the top.

Magical walk.. Castle hill is just a really nice area to go for a stroll around. If you participate in one of the free walking tours then most likely they will finish there like mine. Grab an ice cream for a couple hundred HUF and just take a stroll around the beautiful church, the castle, admire the view all while listening to beautiful buskers on the street. It is an expensive part of town so if you're planning on eating in that area be prepared to spend more than other places. xx

Beautiful place with a beautiful view onto the city. It is always pleasure to visit the Castle Hill with the Castle of Buda and the nearby narrow streets with the historic buildings. A unique atmosphere in every period of the year.

A grand historical building. This is a magnificent historical castle. It is high on a hill over looking the Danube river . Its a bit of a climb to walk up but there is a small train that will take people up. It is worth it to go up to the top and walk around to see the great statues and ramparts around the castle. The view from there is fantastic .You can see for miles and miles. You can see all of Budapest including all the beautiful bridges.

Fisherman's Bastion. A magical place. Must see at night. For a cheap evening sightseeing tour, take bus 16 down the hill to cross the chain bridge, then go back up. Makes a loop. A beautiful ride in the evening!

simply breathtaking and superb. No visit to Budapest is complete without a visit to Castle Hill.The views, grounds, buildings are magnificent.This is a major highlight of Budapest and simply cannot be missed. Go early to avoid crowds and heat.

Castle Hill;. One can visit the castle by furnicular, car, taxi, cycle or walk to the top. One can walk around and see a lovely view over the Danube from the Buda side, Cafes there, We saw the changing of the guards.. .
picturesque. A lovely area to wander around. A vast selection of cafes to stop off at, and lots of attractions to go in and visit. Go up the hill via the escalator, its free!

A must!. Going there on your trip to Budapest is simply a must! The Pest skyline is a reminder of the history of the city as part of the Austrian Hungarian empire.. you can have a meal at one of the restaurants on the castle area but be careful - many of them are quite pricey...

Stunning & Spectacular. In my opinion,castle hill is the best place to spend your first afternoon in Budapest and have a great looking over the Buda part of Budapest. I strongly recommend you neve miss it. Explore the rest by yourself.
Stunning view. The castle hill view is stunning especially at night. It can be seen during the bus tour. The Castle is magnificient.
Beautiful. Worth seeing this place during the day and evening. I love viewing these buildings from the waterfront area

Beautiful Castle situation in nice area with great views. This castle is situated on a hill which gives you great views over pest. Behind the castle you get some views of Buda and you can see the contrast difference of the two areas. There are plenty of walkways around the castle grounds to appreciate the views. Would recommend!
Incredible views of Pest. I did not enter the castle, but the highlight here is the incredible views you can get from Pest, across the Danube.

Not The think i was hoping for. A big castle, not as great As i thought.
It was extremly hot this Day and all The stairs are Hard, even for a well trained person

Matyas Church is amazing!. The palace section of the castle district was closed due to a wine festival but the other half made up for it! The church as incredible and we even returned for an organ concert on Friday evening. Wonderful buildings and views.

Perfect for First Day. Castle Hill is the best place to spend your first day in Budapest. It offers fantastic sweeping views across the city which will orient you for the coming days of travel and has a host of sites you can spend your day discovering. Even though it's very touristy I recommend stopping for coffee (or indeed a beer!) at the Panoramia Cafe overlooking the city. They have a good craft beer as well regular local drinks but the food is pretty basic so only try the burger if you must. To cover several sites on your first day instead of just the top the hill take the funicular back down and cross the Chain Bridge over the river on foot.

Great fun to walk!. We walked up to this area everyday that we were in Budapest. Lovely area! Amazing views - think a certain river cruise ad showing the Parliament. The views overlooking the river are beautiful. So are the views overlooking the hills. There is a section that is pedestrian full of real people's apartments, including children. There also is an archeological dig up behind the castle area.Something for everyone. Views, museums, bars, markets.

Great place to see. I love this place, the view was great and there are lots of places to see. Make sure that you wear comfortable shoes because its a lot of walking to do. Beautiful in the day time and beautiful in the night time.

Great by day, greater by night. We spent whole day here at the wine festival. If there is anything on go! It was unbelievable how they set the event up and to see everyone and all the bright lights. Great views of the Danube and city lights as well.

Great walking tour. Arm yourself with lots of water and snacks and go for a walk towards the Castle hill. Loads of things to see and visit, most of them free to the public, others require an entry fee. You can take the funicular up, but I'd recommend you take a walk up because you have lots of beautiful buildings along the way. Take your time and explore every street. Worth visiting!

A Must Do. Quite frankly not only is this the best area to take photographs and enjoy the stunning views of the Pest side of the Danube, also with the stunning Matthias Church and Fishermans Bastion being on Castle Hill side it's a no brainer spend a day there !!
A sight to see. The grounds are a nice place to spend a day. It is a popular tourist location but was so big, it was not overcrowded.

Extremely beautiful, no matter during day or night. You might walk up to the hilltop to view the city, or directly take a cable car. It's 1200Ft per person and provides a short but adorable trip to go up. The palace was surrounded by wooden vendors which look to open at Xmas time.

Worth Seeing. We went to the Castle Hill area and spent most of the day there. There is a lot to do and see. It's very beautiful! Keep in mind there no longer is a castle, however, there is the National Library, the National History Museum, Matthias Church, Fisherman's Bastion, shops, restaurants, and much more (we went to the Faust Wine Cellar which I highly recommend. Castle Hill has beautiful views of the city and the Danube.

Lots to see in this area of Buda. Well worth the visit to the area. Lots to see, Buda Castle and Gardens, Matthias Church, Fisherman Bastion and the street are very old and quaint. They look very Germanic! Very pretty place to spend the day!

A must do for Budapest. I would certainly advise going for a walk up to Castle Hill. We went to the Cave Church, walked up to the Citadel, ( a bit of a hike on a hot day) and then walked down and over to Casle Hill. The views are stunning, you can really appreciate Budapest from up on the hill. I took my teenage son and he enjoyed it too. And it's all free, so even better.
Wonderful flavour of Budapest. We loved this visit with so much to see inside and outside. Great cafe choice and fabulous views. The church is spectacular.

Gorgeous Malorgous!. This was literally the first thing i saw from across the danube. I was sitting in my hotel room in awe. It was night time. Later I crossed the bridge and went up the funicular and saw it up close. Amazing. I walked the grounds. Took about 50 minutes. They had a little dance thing going on at the entrance stairs. It was cool... i didn't get to go into the art museum as I was low on time but totally enjoyed the afternoon there.
Awesome!. A great place to visit, I've took the free walking tour and we went up to the hill. The view is breathtaking.

Must spend time here. Castle hill is a lovely afternoon experience. The views are amazing, the castle beautiful and lovely to wander round. Ruins of original castle there too. We did archery in the grounds. Short walk to fishermens bastion from here. We went up on the funicular but it's easily walkable
Very Nice view very good place to go. t is worth a visit. It is not only the castle visit or the view. The surroundings have cheurches worth to visit. there are good options in restaurants also.
Gorgeous at night and day. One of Budapest's top tourist sites, this castle is well worth the inside tour. Lovely history and awesome sights of the city.
Stunning views and great shopping. Plenty of locally handmade products. Be sure to check out the amber jewelry and the embroidery. Best prices in Budapest.
Amazing. So worth visiting this landmark during the day but the views from Pest at night is even better.great views from the hill. So worth it

Take the adorable cable car and admire the view.. Even if you don't go into the museum, it is worth going up there to see the city views, walk in the gardens, and watch the guards in front of the president's palace.
An amazing view and must see.. No trip to Budapest would be complete with out seeing this area. The walk around is amazing. It also connects to the other areas on the hill.

Castle hill. Highly recommended. ..plenty to see..breath taking views..totally Panaramic spectacular views...take your camera! !...Cafe at top of castle hill....ladies you need to pay 200 huf .to use toilet ...appears to be the norm

Beautiful area with a lot of charm. This district is beautiful. The surrounding buildings in this district are in great condition with wonderful architecture and plenty of restaurants which are more expensive here. A must visit when in Budapest

A place all must visit, but a lot of construction going on. Castle Hill combines most of the must see sights on the Buda side. This is the place to go to do a nice walking tour of these attractions just taking ones time. We covered all these attractions and I will give more detail on an individual sight seeing adventure. You must see this area or you have not seen Budapest.

Great views!. It is absolutely the most beautiful place in Budapest! You can get to the hill by bus nr.16, by Funicular or just by steps. The Trinity Square, Matthias Church, the Fisherman's Bastion and the stunning views make the Castle Hill unique and unforgettable!

Castle Hill. A long walk up the steps to the top, it's well worth it for the river views alone.
At the top, stalls selling all sorts from tourist tat to food. As you'd expect, not the cheapest prices.
The Castle Hill is nice, but very crowded. Tge Castle was not open to the public nor did we want to see it.. but the area does provide a stunning view of Pest.

Beautiful afternoon. The castle area is absolutely worth a visit. There's so much you can do for free! The castle grounds and gardens are extensive and everything outside is free. The streets are fun to walk along

Lots to see. Multiple castles and churches high up in the Buda Hills. Nice to walk around. Beautiful buildings and views.
Be careful of the pickpockets and con artists who like to frequent the area.
Mrs. The sights from the castle are wonderful. Although there isn't much there it's still very interesting to go if only for the views of the city

Worth ever minute. Castle Hlll sets on the Buda side of the Danube. It is a fair hike up the hill, or take the funicular. Once there, the sites are simply breathtaking. The hill has much to see and is a photographer dream Don't miss this walk!

High point to see Budapest. Castle Hill provides best view of Budapest. You will have good view of the city, Chain Bridge and Parliament. The St Matthias Church is also in walking distance. The line to the top can be very long but there is alternate way of getting to the top for free and with fewer crowds. There are guides giving free flyers with directions. Instead of paying for the lift you can go up for free by using the other entrance which is 5 mins walk to the left after you get off Chain Bridge.

Beauty of Castle Hill. The Castle Hill grounds are beautiful and provide gorgeous views of the river & Pest! It's very fun to wonder around the Castle grounds and find different areas & pockets of interest. Be aware though, that you really do not go into the Castle to view "the Castle interior," but rather the Castle contains 2 museums that you can tour depending on your interests.

Great views. Like Fisherman's Bastion, the area is a must to visit in Budapest. The views are spectacular, but the droves of tourists are a bit of a pain. A visit early in the morning would be the best strategy.
Sightseeing. A large landmark of Budapest. The climb is long so elderly may want to catch a taxi there. You can see the whole city.

Walk around and night ... safe and breathtaking. Walking around the Castle complex housing the museums is a great night walk especially if you are staying in the Castle district 1 since many places close before 10. Tranquil, quiet and romantic.
Great place to walk around. Had a good afternoon walking around here and the views were fantastic. I would recommend visiting here if you get the time.
Budpest Visit.. Castle Hill is worth a look if you are interested in Hungarian Art. It is located on a hill with great views over the river and the city.
safe area. Stayed at the Hilton in this area and loved it! Safe and some good food options around. The castle is also fun to visit. make sure to go see draculas grave
Lovely castle. Very nice walk through the castle and you get a great view as you walk up. The castle itself has great architecture and history
Very quaint. Similar to that of Prague. nice to walk around, and quite a hike to get to the top. Those with weight problems or mobility issues will not be able to handle it.

Beautiful . Just beautiful, the gardens are so quite, beautiful fountains and the views are amazing.
I like Castel Hill more then Fisherman's bastion.

Beautiful! Don't miss this!. Everything about Castle Hill is charming. The restaurants, the churches, the overlooks, everything. You don't even need to pay for the tours of the sights, just take the funicular up and spend a few hours walking around. I loved getting lost on the little pathways around Buda Castle. There are plenty of gelato and water trucks around, as well as dining options. And don't forget to walk around at night! Looking at Pest from Buda is a wonderful experience. Breathtaking views.

Impressive view of the city; must visit. Quite touristy with regards to shops and cafés but hey we are tourists after all ; the view was really nice even though you have to pay to get to the area with a better view ; we were fortunate to be there well they had a national folklore arts and craft event which was really really nice ;I would definitely return to Budapest it was awesome

Stunning view of Budapest from the top of Castle Hill. Great place to visit if you are in Budapest. Once you're at the top, you get a stunning view of the entire city of Budapest. I would recommend taking the Segway tour up the hill.

Lovely. The castle itself (more of a palace) was very grand and imposing, and although work was being done in the gardens at the back it was still well worth a visit. The hill itself was very old and quaint and had many cute cafes and boutiques (as well as tourist souvenir shops). Castle hill is definitely a must see attraction of Budapest.

Great view of the Danube. Make sure to walk around and check out the new Castle Grounds/museum. Take the funicular up the hill to get the most out of the experience and make sure to look around at the wrought iron gates with the mythical birds.

Modern and Old. You can access by a steep uphill walk, a funicular tram or a no. 16 bus from outside the Four Seasons hotel. At the top, you have beautiful old buildings with architecture to marvel at. You have a huge choice of restaurants and bars including Jamie Olivers. Watch out for traffic as it is not totally pedestrianised. Hilton hotel is right there with fantastic views. The views across the Danube are brilliant and you can see the magnificent parliament building on the Pest side. There is a market on Sunday's - its big but there is a charge.

Historic and Modern. The Castle Hill is a large complex of historical buildings and modern facilities. Everything blends in very well with each other and makes a fascinating way to spend a day, or even longer.Access is easy, but can be confusing. There are slopes and steps to walk up; a Funicular Railway and public transport. We took the 16 bus route from outside of the Gresham Four Seasons hotel into the complex. The choice of museums, art galleries, sightseeing and restaurants is very good. Of course there are a lot of tourists, in my view too many coaches are allowed into the complex - I know people have to get there but at one point we counted 9 coaches lined up to drop people off, or collect them. At least they are restricted to one end of the old town, so the main body of the town is relatively light on traffic, just cars and the occasional delivery vehicle, plus the blue public transport buses: 16, 16a and 116.
A must-see. You must see this at night. Take the public transit (ferries are part of the public transit) or schedule a boat tour. Budapest is not expensive, but the sights are gorgeous.

Great city view!. While in Budapest it's definitely worth checking out the view from Castle Hill looking over the Danube and Pest. Once you cross the bridge you will see a funicular you can take up for a small fee, but we opted to take the free waking path to the right of the funicular. It's a little steep with switch backs up the hill, but worth well worth it for the view of the city!

Beautiful views . Such lovely views from the top of Castle Hill, you get a beautiful panoramic sight of the entire pest side of the city. Well worth a visit and the walk up isn't too bad either if you don't fancy spending four euros to get to the top and having to queue !

Very impressive. Took one of the hop on hop off tours and spent several hours walking around the castle grounds. Amazing views, only made it through one of the museums and lots of time roaming the grounds.

To spend or not to spend. amazing buildings, but there is a charge for entry into everything- can cost a bit as there are little places such as the old chemist 3euro, the short history video 5euro and so on

King of the hill!. You can conquer this hill with a slow stroll, to by the Funicular. Some hungrarians prefer to go straight up the steep, grassy slope. That is usually on hands and feet. The return down that path is quite precipitous. Many of the best attractions are found on this hill. It is very busy with both tourists and locals. It does not rain here very often. A good umbrella would do the trick if you have limited time on a rainy day. People of all ages walk the ramps and steps up to the top of Castle Hill. The walk or ride up is less crowded later in the day.

My favourite place. Excellent views on the city in day and night time. The history is present on every street. You can simply have a walk around. Besides the museums and the Matyas church don't miss the maze, it's great fun.

A lovely spot to explore and see the city from above. Any way you get there, the trip up and down is interesting. There is no one set path, so you are free to wander where your interest takes you. There is history to be explored as well as art, scenery, and a cluster of small shops and restaurants at the top. Colourful row houses on the western edge of the hill look out to the city beyond the river, and from this pinnacle one gets a feeling for the strategic spot where the castle grounds are, high above the valley on one side and the Danube below. Take your time and plan for a relaxing half day if you stay up there for a meal or for a visit through the art museum.

Wide variety of top attractions in a relative small place. High class museum in the former Royal Palace (good option in rainy weather), convenient approach including cable-car (ascending from the Chain Bridge) and public transportation (Bus 16). Impressive medieval atmosphere of the streets, Matthias-church (sometimes with organ performances) and excellent panoramic view-points on the Danube and Pest. Spectacular view from the promenade on the NW side.

so interesting and very beautiful - as was most of the city!. Perhaps use the excellent 'Hop on - Hop Off' bus to get to the top of the hill. We used the 24/48 hour use of the bus that covers all the major sites to pretty mcuh cover the city at leisure.

Magical. With the renovation work complete the entire area is a Disney like fairytale but this IS REAL AND OLD! Walk along both end of the wall inc. the castle wall towards The Buda Hills. Don't miss the Hilton hotel built on ancient walls!

Cosy and beautiful. Take your time in visiting this one, follow the small streets, enjoy the garden, the view, the climb up, just enjoy it. But the building could use a clean up (allot of building in Budapest could).
Beauty. This is an eye candy. Must visit attraction after the sunset. Dont forget your SLR/DSLR because this definitely is a place to see
Great views from Capital Hill.. Wonderful views of Budapest. Many tourist attractions, including museums, art exhibits, religious sites, and historic buildings. But, it's the views. Must see.

Family Visit. We have taken family and friends up to the Castle and Várkert Bazar, which ties in with the Castle, many times over the past couple of years and everyone, including us, can't get enough of the buildings, and the views from up there. So full of Hungarian history!
A must in Budapest. When you visit Budapest do not pass over to see Castle Hill. View is marvelous, and you will have a panoramic sight from there.

Amazing views, beautiful architecture.. Beautiful architecture and amazing view from up on the hill. There's a lift that will take you up/down the hill. We chose to walk down. The Chain Bridge is right below Castle Hill and we walked across.
Very pretty . Pretty views and good food in the Buda castle. Great place for families or romantic strolls. Very safe. I didn't feel like I was gonna get robbed like I did in other areas of the city.
Worth a visit. Make sure you visit Castle Hill, lots to see albeit you will have to pay various entry costs.Downside is cost to visit toilet, quite expensive

Use the free escalator or lift in the Varkert next door. Views are the best we found in Buda. You can ascend by the expensive funicular railway (and its frequently long queues) or walk left along the road to the Varkert (lovely in and of itself) and ascend using the free escalators and or lift. These are brilliant and even open in the evening. The Hungarian art in the National Gallery is superb so if you like art make sure you go there.
Main attraction in Budapest. Panorama from this point is awesome and also there are lots of museums in this area. You can see fontaine, historical monuments and some culture here.

The view. Walked up to Castle Hill for the view whilst the sun is setting.. It is much cooler than if you walk up in the day time.. Popular with locals and students when we walked up, definitely worth the walk for the stunning view over Budapest whilst the sun is setting..

A hike to get here but worth the visit. We took the metro and then got ourselves turned around when we got off. Good to have google maps on your phone to help find your way. Lots of stairs but a beautiful walk. Great views. Probably could have spent more time here but it was the end of what was already a long day.
A lovely Walk. A lovely walk around with many fine buildings to see and brilliant veiw over the city spread out before you.

It's cherry on top when you are visiting Buda hill. When you are in there, you will go centuries back. I won't tell you nothing more, just will give you a few advices:1) Take your most comfortable shoes because you will walk a lot2) Take your camera and, if it's possible, replacement battery3) Take a lot of water especially in summer time4) Be prepared on climbing if you come from the other side of the river5) Be prepared that you will spend all day if you like museums and art
Amazing views. Good little find this place is amazing with breath taking views and gardens it's free to enter, there is a museum you can go in but I think you have to pay it go inside there.
Must visit. Budapest trip is not complete unless you are here. Built on the Hill, this gives a beautiful view of Pest city and Danube.

Lovely place. A must visit whilst in Budapest. We took funicular railway to the top. Lovey walk and coffee shops at the top and bottom. 18.000 forint for a return on the funicular.
Toilets are close by too. Then a walk over the chain bridge. Great place

History within your reach. Budapest is a living historical city. The castle on the top of the Buda hills is majestic, old and beautiful. The view from the Fishermen's Bastion to the Parliament is unparalleled. A must see for all tourists. You will meet locals of all ages wandering the old streets of the Castle district.
Great views. A short walk from Fisherman's bastion and Chain Bridge, it is worth walking along to castle hill. You get great views of the river

Get ready to walk. We put some miles in but we're able to get some amazing photos. We went at dusk on an August evening and it was perfect. The sunset and lighting couldn't be any better. You can easily take 100 photos. Good thing for the cloud. Not sure how I would have been able to take the pics I wanted with a roll of film:)

The Budapest bump!. It's a small bump they call mountain. Short climb up from the Buda side. Ironic part is that there is no longer a castle on castle hill! But the place is nice to spend an afternoon or evening, looking over great views of the Pest side.
Pretty neighborhood. We went to a wine tasting on the Castle Hill. So we roamed around the area and enjoyed the architecture. There are also nice views of the Pest side of the city here.

A city in a city. Castle Hill (and Castle District) is a definite must in Budapest. A lot of museums, great views and a lot of history. It is beautiful by night, even though the views are more impressive during daytime. Don't miss out on the Royale Palace museum!

Great views of the city. A lovely little area! You can easily walk up but you can also do a short walk to a bus that can take you up. It's free to look at the views or I think you can also pay to do a tour and see other parts. The church up there is magnificent in itself. There is a cafe that is open during the day and a restaurant at night. The restaurant is a little pricey but the view would be incredible

Castle Hill = Budapest. Castle Hill is World Heritage site which has Palace (Buda Castle), Church (Matthias Church), Parliament, monuments, gardens..you will be missing Budapest if you haven't visit Castle Hill! It is like missing Montserrat when you are in Barcelona(Cataloina)! And remember, Castle hill is so city centre and accessible! Only the rich stays there..no cars allowed, pubic transport is accessible. We took Buda funicular up/down due to time rush..you can always walk up hill. There are many ways to get up/down hill if you can walk (good walking shoes). Infact, so convenient that many people revisited castle hill over span of few days. oh..yes, there are also plenty of bars and restaurants! So enjoy!

great view, lots to see. a must-see in budapest, really interesting place. you can walk up and enjoy the view, the statues, the old buildings. when you are on the top you can walk around from the castle and check out mathias church, the view from the fisherman bastion (i didnt pay to see it, was good enough to just watch it from the "free place") and get a taste of the old buda :)
Charming Castle . Charming estern europe style castle, a must visit place in Budapest. Lovely view from the top..the castle is well maintained.

Great views of chain bridge. Went to visit castle hill this month with my girlfriend. Very enjoyable experience of castle hill in the day and also at night time. Most tourists were using a paid train/tram to reach the top of the hill however, there is also a lift and elevator you can take if you walk down the street to the left. This saves you 4/5 pounds which is Costs to take the train/tram.
Nice for a walk and chill, good views.... Ok for a walk, nice views of the city and good place to chill. Little maintains going on when We visited, but I guess thats good in a long run.
a nice castle on Danube. beautiful in the day light and spectacular at night :) I am sure you are going to find a good spot for photo once you are here

The views are worth the trip up the hill. It was interesting to go up Castle Hill and see the views. I didn't have time for the art museums at the castle, which was too bad because they were having a Picasso exhibit that sounded fantastic.

Prefer to go at late afternoon. Prefer afternoon. You can see the hill by day and you can see the beautiful night lighting of the buildings their and the city across the Danube at the night.I take the hop on hop off buses during all my vacation to Budapest (i have only 2 days there)., with a valid ticket for 2 days (extra discount for students)The castle is free to see it outsideAnd of course it has amazing view to Danube and to the whole city.

Great views and ambience. Budapest has many wonderful sites.Castle Hill is a must see area and world heritage site with great views of parliament and the city.Palaces, monuments, gardens, churches it's a great area to just walk aroundPlenty of bars and restaurants too

Huge place to walk through. The place is huge so schedule for at least 3 hours, even if you are skipping the insides. It's a good walk and I'd say to skip the funicular since it's actually not too long a walk to go up on the left side.
Great Views. Lots to see here when things are open. Before you go make sure that the museums are open. Lots of walking around the castle.

Climb up, you'll be happy you did!. You will really enjoy walking around up on Castle Hill. There are so many restaurants, cafes, shops and monuments to view. Take lots of pictures! At night it is all lit up, and so beautiful.

Classic Old Buda. A wonderful, must see spot in Buda. A 'world heritage' location for a reason.
Old (and carefully restored after devastating WW2 bombing) section with imperial palaces, church and buildings make for a fun and historical visit. Best views in Budapest - especially at night. Great restaurants - plenty of fine choices
Eye Catching. Once you have visited the Castle hill it is paramount to have a night cruise on the Danube to really appreciate the sights alongs its banks. This is a wonderfully well lit building

best place to take picture of budapest. there is a cable car that take you to the top. II went there both during the day and at night. it is the best place to take picture. especially at night. the cable car stops at 10pm.
So much to see. What a beautiful part of the city, wonderful views overlooking the river and the Parliament building. Reasonably priced places to eat and plenty of grounds to wander around.
Great!. Great view over the city! It's free too! They served mulled wine at the top which was a nice touch. Public transport there is excellent!

Great view. We took the long way up, walking instead of the cable car. However, the view is still the same and just as spectacular. There is a cafe at the top of the cable car for drinks and there are stalls for buying souveniers.

Cool place worth visiting. The castle hill is pretty impressive. Lots of great views, shops, architecture and history. I spent about an hour and a half wandering around and observing. This area is on almost all of the tours.

Great scenery of the entire city of Pest. We walked over the chain bridge to visit the Castle Hill district which is well worth the effort. The scenery is unbeatable. We took the tram down the hill and the elevator and escalator up the castle. The tram is somewhat pricey for a short ride but a good experience overall.

Must visit if you're spending even one day in Budapest!. A great place to catch up with friends and also a romantic spot for many couples. Me and my wife had a casual time strolling the grounds of Castle hill and the nearby attractions. Many spots to take unforgettable photos! you get an unbelievable view of the starry city including the Chain bridge and the Parliament which gets lit up at sunset time in a gradual process!
Beautiful scene. You really should visit the catacombs also. There was part of route wich were without lights so it was quite intersting to walk in total darkness.

Nice walk. We went on a full hike from our hotel on the Pest side of the river and walked all the way up to the top. We took the stairs down at the left side of the approach and did not take the rail lift. The stairs can be hard going, if you are not fit enough but I am approaching 60 and done it no problem. At the top of the hill there is a whole village as well as the castle, there is a monastery, church and various eating places and walks

Visit at night. In broad daylight it may not seem as much but at night it is fantastic. it was one of my favourite places to be. the main bus routes were there and I think there is a mall nearby so yep, I liked it. good for history lovers.

Stunning view across the city. Having spent a couple of days extremely ill when in Budapest, I ventured up to Castle Hill where I was pleasantly surprised by the peacefulness you feel when up there. There is plenty to see, and I even got in a bit of archery practice! I would definitely go back if I ended up in Budapest again.
Nice. Nice castle beautiful surroundings. In the evening beautiful illumination.It is recommended several times to go..
A hill with a caste on it. What more could you want from a hill. And thanks to the American tourist who helped fix my bike. A true hero.
Best thing I did in Budapest!. Went up with some friends in the afternoon and by the time we got up the sun had set and we were able to see the city lights over Budapest. A magical experience!

Avoiding the rush.. We visited here early evening and so avoided the mad rush and queues. Although the castle was not open, we mainly went to see the outside of the castle and to see the outstanding view of Budapest.

Beautiful, just beautiful and interesting. If you have more than 2 days in this lovely City then you must do the Castle. Use the Metro or the trams to get round. Excellent value public transport, so frequent. If you are EU citizen and 65+ then trams are free to use.

One of the most beautiful old town in Europe . In my view not Lisabon but Budapest it's the most beautiful capital in Europe and the castle area of Buda is one of the reasons
You have to go if you are in the area and please take time to stroll through the streets

Visit Castle Hill a Must See. Take a stroll from the Pest side to the Buda side over the Chain Bridge and then take the funicular (cable car) up the hill to visit Castle Hill. Lots of great picture opportunities and tons of little restaurants to enjoy a coffee or lunch. Venture off the main streets to find some really cool little places to grab a snack or glass of wine.

One of many amazing places to visit in Budapest. We didn't view at night but during the day you get spectacular views of the city across the Danube. You can access by steps/travellator or take the Funicular,

from above. We had a very good time strolling around the Caste Hill and looking at palaces and at the entire town from above. We did not enter the museum. There were a lot of people and the place was a bit too busy for us.

Lovely, but not as nice as other places in Budapest. All pleasant and some lovely gardens, but did not find it quite as awe inspring as St Stephens Basilica or St Mattias. Very good for a stroll about - if you don't fancy the queue for the funicular, you can walk up, which is a steepish 10-15 mins up, or if you go to the left there is an escalator thing (we never noticed this until we were up there). I'm afraid we found the museum/art gallery up there a bit boring (esp for children) but this is probably not the case for those who are very interested in Hungarian history - the buildings were nice enough. Worth a visit if you have time.
