A tourist hotspot, but still a must-do for all visitors to Budapest!Forget the funicular and walk up, it only takes 10mins or so and saves the queueing :)Such a pleasant walk around the castle with all of its nooks and crannies, and the views are absolutely outstanding of the entire of BudapestPick a lovely sunny day, get your walking shoes on and off you go :)
The top of Budapest. Once you come to Budapest you HAVE TO check the castle area. It will be a place that you'll remember for your whole life.
Wonderfull place for a walk. . After a day up in the palace surroundings we walked down from the historic museum to the river. A peacefull stroll in a lovely aerea.
Must see. A place well worth the time go left of the vertical tram to find free lifts. Best views in town you can see all of pest and then walk down to the river and Citadel, just a very nice spot.

Possibly the best views in Budapest. Taking the funicular up to Castle hill and then touring around the area was a very special experience. The views all around the city were magnificent and with clear blue skies, the photos came out perfect.Well worth the time and effort to make it up here. A bit tiresome waiting in a long line at the bottom of the funicular in the hot sun, so maker sure you have your hat!
Castle Hill, Budapest. This is a good place to stroll and see a lot of sights in one place and get a good look at the city in various directions.

History in Buda.... Castle Hill was only a short walk, up a lot of steps, from our hotel. To be fair, there is an elevator to make the last bit of the walk easier. You can also take a bus from the second to last stop on the red metro line. The area is full of history with a number of pretty churches and sights. We managed to catch the changing of the guard which was nice. The actual 'castle' is a collection of buildings on top of what originally was a Roman site. The main building hosts a museum which currently has a Picasso exhibition. If you walk to the river side then you can take the stairs or escalator down or walk towards the chain bridge and take the funicular. Please bear in mind that most things don't open until ten so plan accordingly.

A Great Walk & View. Take the funicular to the top of Castle Hill, here you will find stunning views and many buildings to marvel at. In the evenings locals set up there stalls and sell there folk art. A great place to visit and lots to see and do.
Brillaint. Wonderful views of the Pest side of the Danube. Lovely architecture, in fact quite stunning. Take the camera and you will get some amazing photographs.
Superb panorama!. We took the funiculaire up to the top of the castle near Chain bridge. The view outstanding and it is fun to wonder through the little streets back to the danube.

Heart of the City. If you go to Budapest and are interested in its history and culture, Castle Hill is a must! There are separate museums, a cathedral, a palace garden and so much more! It can easily take half a day to look at everything and really longer to truly immerse yourself. I spent the day and thoroughly enjoyed it!

Walk uphill is a must, with good shoes!. If it's a hot day, please take the bus. The walk towards the castle isn't easy and you need good shoes. But the view is amazing. I wasn't impressed by the castle itself. A lot of workmen surrounding it and (i hate this) a big commercialsign was covering the front. I don't get why they do this... it makes the building look so ugly. But anyway. Be sure to check out every corner on the outside, the views on the Donau to the left and right are nice! I've heard that the inside of the castle isn't a must-see, because it was stripped to the walls during WWII and they haven't restored it fully, but maybe this has changed now. But we didn't go in.

Historic area to walk around . Castle Hill is where the Royal Palace, National Gallery, and Matthias Church are located. You can and should spend several hours or part of a day in the area exploring and visiting these sites. Great views of Pest from here.

Stunning.. As across the city, and in particular the Buda side, you get stunning views and superb architecture, with inbuilt history, museums, etc.. View the changing of the guadrs, the National Library, the beautiful surrounding streets, restaurants, cafes, etc..

Good time spent 2 hours to see all sights nearby. Take the hop on , hop off bus BIG BUSES (do not take the giraffe tours) they are cheap and one can see most of Budapest in 1 day if one starts early at. 10 am. They are convenient and gives the tourist time to look around . Buses are stoping every 30mins to pick up passengers for the next sightseeing. At the top there are some nice restaurants and ice cream parlours.

Brilliant Budapest. For me Castle Hill is one of the best things about Budapest offering great views of the Danube, city and the Castle itself, great for history buffs and lovers of architecture. Do not miss this when in Budapest.

spectacular walk to Buda Castle. Terraces and grassy areas (an escalator too) take you to the top for wonderful views, courtyards, a museum, and then to Matyas church and Fisherman's Bastion. Coffee and pastry at historic Ruzswurm Café, a walk through patrician Buda - a great independent walking tour that can be a few hours or a whole day.

Beautiful. I really preferred to see Castle Hill from the other side of the river but it is worth a visit, its a good place for a day trip lots of little things to see and do but can get quite touristy!

Lovely historic area, perfect for strolling and browsing. Castle Hill is probably a must-do for most tourists, and we were no exception. We enjoyed our metro ride across from Pest followed by a stroll up to the Castle District. We were content to wander around the many medieval monuments and museums, never tempted to enter any of them however, on account of the hordes of fellow snap-happy tourists (should have visited early in the morning).There were lots of inviting cafes and shops to distract us, and some great photo opportunities, and we enjoyed a whole morning wandering the beautiful streets admiring the buildings before riding back down on the Siklo funicular railway.

Plan a Day in Buda!. There are so many things to explore and wonderful restaurants, you really should set aside a day of your Budapest visit for "the hill!" Take the 15 bus across the Chain Bridge (or better still, walk it) and then climb or take the funicular to the top. Visit the Hungarian National Museum, walk to Matyas Church and the Fisherman's Bastion for wonderful photo ops - particularly of Parliament across the Danube. Dine at Pest-Buda near the church and enjoy a truly remarkable day.
Great views. A must place to visit using the funicular railway. Souvenirs tended to be a little more expensive than in the town. Great views especially at night
Castle on the Mountain. The view from the Castle allows you to see Buda and Pest. The view is spectacular. We were there on a cloudy day but, were still able to see the City in total

Amazing views . Whenever you are looking down over the Danube towards the city you are always in Buda, when you look up towards the city then you are in Pest. Some of the most amazing views of the city and the Danube you will find here at Castle Hill.

Hard to work out what is what!. All a bit of a muddle really. National Gallery, History Museum and National Library all in amongst what is known as either the castle or palace. You can't really differentiate any of them so the buildings themselves are nothing special. Great views over the Danube and the Pest side so worth going if just for that.
Impressive. The Castle Hill district is well worth seeing. Many historical landmarks, very impressive architecture, panoramic views.
Great for views of the city and visiting different sites. This stretch of 1.5km approximately is great for walking around and visiting the different sites. Also locates different good restaurants.
Great art and views of the city.. Good art in the national museum. View from the terrace is spectacular. Changing of the guard at 10:00 AM is worth seeing.

Pretty cool place. I visited Castle Hill / Buda Castle my birthday trip to Budapest. It's kind of cool there are several vendors available for food as well as souvenirs. There is a guy that sells coffee that was so delicious. We did not do a tour of the castle (not sure if you could), but if you can I recommend it.If you go early enough and go around to the back of the Castle they have a place for tourist to do archery which seems kind of cool but we missed it. I also recommend taking the trolley to the top vs. walking. It's just kind of cool. The best part is you can see the entire city, both sides Buda and Pest, from the top of the hill.

Recommended small cable car. by small cable car we were able to see the residence of President of the Republic, national gallery with city view. It was very beautiful, many shops selling souvenirs, café and restaurants as well. At least need half day to explore it
Beautiful place. This place is really beautiful. You could spend hours discovering it. I recomend to go walking, less crowded way. When you get on top, wow, the view.

Such a special place. Very cool place! Make sure to go all the way to the right of the cast (your right when you're facing the city your left if you're facing the castle). There is a walkway along the wall that leads to a 360 platform where you can get the best pictures!

Must visit in the day and also in the night!. You could easily spend half a day exploring the castle hill. The view of the city is very nice. Remember to make a stop also in the night because the city lights from the hill are wonderful.

beautiful setting. Castle Hill, a plateau containing many of Budapest's most important historic sites and attractions, is a fantastic area to be explored. Settlement dates as far back as the Stone Age, resulting in an interesting mix of important medieval ruins and architectural highlights from the last few centuries.The most prominent building is Buda Castle, a building that dominates the hill and offers exceptional views over river the Danube. Like much of Budapest, it's a great area to explore at night as it's lit up in spectacular way. Do not forget to see the Castle Funicular Railway, which departs from the Buda end of the Chain Bridge.

Wonderful viewpoint. Historic castle remains and Royal Palace which is now the National Art gallery. Wonderful views across the river to Pest. Plenty to do and can be reached on the funicular railway. Watch the change ok the guard outside the presidential palace.

Castle and views!. You have to go here if you go to Budapest. You can see the the whole of Pest from the Buda side! The Castle itself is worth visiting and you will find yourself in the midst of the old historic area where you can savour the view and get some refreshment.
fantastic views. jumped off bus tour here - worth a nose around not only for the beautiful buildings around but the views of the city - breathtaking

Grounded in history, crowned by beauty. Castle hill is clearly the most exciting and interesting part of visiting Budapest. Overlooking a gentle curve of the Danube and a broad view of Pest, Castle Hill has seen thousands of years of history. Well before the Romans, there were settlements in this area, due to the favorable strategic location of the hill, the transportation facility provided by the river and the surrounding fertile fields that provided food. The Hungarian royal family built the Royal residence here, on top of previously built settlements. The Castle Museum provides a unique glimpse at the multiple levels, starting at the top of the hill and going through multiple "layers" until reaching the level of the river. It is an exploration not to be missed. The Royal palace at the top offers a Baroque building that replaced several earlier verions destroyed by multiple wars and occupations. Even in recent centuries it suffered damage during the 1848 war of independence, World War II and the 1956 revolution. The National National Gallery is housed in one wing of the Palace. It is one of the most delightful collection of visual arts from the 18th-20th century and well worth a visit. The national Library is also housed here and provides treasures for the literately oriented guests, with documents in Latin, German, Hungarian and other languages, The rest of Castle Hill deserves several hours. Take in the good weather and just walk through the cobblestone streets. Trinity square, Mathias church, Fisherman's Bastion, and the many boutiques and shops in the area provide for an interesting day. Visit the Wine cellar underneath the Hilton hotel to taste a variety of Hungarian wines; enjoy Hungarian pastries at Ruszwurm or Korona. Or just step into one of the many restaurants in the area and explore Hungarian cuisine.

Another Stunning Part Of The City!. Castle hill is just along from the Matthius Church and Fisherman's Bastion. The architecture and the gardens of the castle and leading up to the castle are just magnificent.It is like you are travelling back in time! You must visit here!

Would deserve 6 stars .... The Castle has a fantastic location; its permanent exhibition is really beautiful; the market in front of the castle was exclusively reserved for local products: what a refreshing idea to support local commerce, handcraft, natural materials, ethical products, good local food; but the biggest surprise: a full exhibition of Pablo Picasso with a hundred masterpieces and more: the whole for 6 euros: 30 seconds cueing to buy tickets, and ample space to see the masterpieces from different angles and go back and forth for full admiration: this luxury seems to be reserved for Budapest (I saw an equally fantastic exhibition of William Turner a few years ago). Maybe you could consider flying to Budapest to see the exhibitions: you would save time and money and gain fantastic comfort, compared to other western capitals.

Worth a visit.. We took the finiculaar up but there is an escalator further along to the left and a gentle stroll. Lovely views from the top and easy to spend a whole day visiting the attractions available
Magical. At nighttime this is a very magical area......So pretty and well kept....really breathtaking. would recommend this highly.

Be there early... Or late!. Castle Hill proudly overlooks the Danube and the Pest side of the city. It is magnificent. Sure, it gets extremely crowded but that is unsurprising as it is just such a must visit place. As we were on a photography holiday, we were there both early and late. The views are amazing at all times but I think that there is something really special when the lights are on!

Really interesting tour and much to see. A tour of Castle Hill is a must, I think. So much to see there, all the different buildings and architecture, plan half a day for this tour if you really want to explore it beyond a superficial first view!

Blame World War II. Fantastic views of the city, huge palace, and a really cool piece of history. However, you can tell that World War II did its damage on the palace, as on some of the outside walls you can still see bullet holes. The Cold War didn't help either, as the government didn't restore the palace to its former glory. The result is that the windows were cheaply replaced, and the domes and ornamentation are similar but not as stately as they used to be. However, I do completely recommend visiting this area, as it is a great part of Hungarian history. Just looking at pre and post World War photos of the castle bum me out!
Fantastic view from the Castle district to the city. In the night it is just beautiful as you can wonder the well lighted buildings, bridges. OK you need clear weather (no fog no heavy rain)
buda castle. already reviewed it in the "main part" of this site. a place not to be missed when in Budapest. devote a few hours.
Beautiful buildings. Great buildings, loads of history, saw the " changing of the guard" Busy place but relaxed, nice views, worth a visit.

Scenic view . Steep hill to walk up. We took the bus. See all over Pest on one side. See over Buda at back. There is an art gallery. There was a market when we went. Take your camera. Walk down back Road and see the old buildings.

Amazing Architecture with Lots of Attractions and a Beautiful View of the City. Went there on my last day in Budapest on a bus which goes all the way up. It's a very nice place to walk around and enjoy the view. A lot of things to do there, but also rather crowded with tourists.
Visit Buda Castle/Palace and surrounds. If able-bodied not necessary to queue and take funicular - just 10mins walk up hill and even quicker coming down steps at end of Palace
beautiful view. funicular rail very slow ,long queues, nice atmosphere amongst the visitors,prices of food and drink etc.in this area of Buda much dearer than budapest centre.

Wonderful time exploring this amazing area. We caught the local bus (no16) and spent a few hours wandering around the area. There was a great local market the day we were there but not sure how often it runs. Great views and lots to see.
great. went to an exhibition here, was well worth the long walk up the hill and the stepping over of countless beggars to get there and look down on the city
Beautiful view. Wander around, look at the view, just enjoy yourself. Not really recommended for people having trouble walking.

Disappointing. On the day of our visit there was a great deal of activity at the front preparing for a musical event I think, and at the rear again only a very limited access was available. However the views of Budapest and the Danube are worth the trip up here
Great place to run. We went for a run and going to Castle Hill was perfect. They have a great street up there with no traffic. Since we love to sight see during our runs it was a nice combination.
Breathtaking views. Very interesting old architecture from centuries ago. The views over Budapest are stunning, definetly give it a go when in Budapest. Quite easy to reach by tram and bus combo.

Nice view. We didn't have much time there because it was a rainy day which cut our visit short. But the view was very nice and the building is what you'd expect to see of an old castle.
We also did not visit the Interiors so I cannot comment. I recommend for at least one visit

Beautuful views over the Danube, Buda side, great by night.. Again this hugely under-rated city has some amazing architecture. You can take the vehicular rail up the hill and see many views, parts of the old city, and good choices of places to eat or have a drink. Market stalls traditional one, nearby, and each side you can see down as this was originally a Roman Garrison area. Still bein excavated, it is a unique part of the city not to be missed, terrific camera opportunities, nice traditional places to eat, and much to do. More character than Pest side of the city and far quieter.

Day and night: different sense.. This must visit place exudes a dominance in the day but beautifies itself at night under the glow of the yellow lights.
To save some money, catch the bus number 16 from Deark terrace, in front of the Ritz Carlton to go to Matthias church area.)//

Fascinating Place. Helped by the weather this is simply beautiful. There may be a long queue for the funicular railway but worth it. The views from Fisherman's Bastion are wonderful, free English language guided tour! Lovely architecture, friendly people and it doesn't cost a fortune to eat up there (English attractions take note) I'd recommend a couple of hours at least to take it in, I missed the underground hospital, apparently fascinating, but make sure you go
Great architecture and landscape. You have to enjoy a walk through Castle Hill - both for its architecture and landscape. I would also recommend eating desert next to the castle.
Very interesting. Views from here are stunning. A lot of walking but well worth it. You are able to see the city... Definitely worth our time. The architecture is amazing

So much to see. Be prepare to spend a whole day there. You could look at the view across the Danube River for hours to begin with and you could walk around the castle ground and relax there a whole day, when you get tire then take a rest in one of those little cafes nearby. We spent a whole day there with not enough time to visit any of those great buildings. Definitely we will have to go back there when we get another chance.
Chilling . Castle hill amazing place only u need 30min in the castle but I guess u will stay around hours outside the view amazing and the weather as well , must see the castle

Great castle, awesome view. Once again a beautiful building in budapest. Hungarians took it advantage of it and they created a very unique tourist place. Especially the view of pest is so relaxing. Definitely recommened place!
Nice area . Lovely area to wander around and soak up the history, lots of lovely bars and cafes to try and some great views of the city. Would recommend visiting.

Views and art. Close to the Matthias church and Bastillion. The National Gallery is also here and we visited the Picasso exhibit. The permanent collection is also very beautiful. Entrance fee was approx €5,00. Furthermore the views again are great and there is a different side of pest than from the Bastillion.
Perfect view to the opposite side. From the hill opens the perfect view to the opposite side, for example - the Parliament building.Especially beautiful at night

Beautiful . It was very close to our bed and breakfast. It as a climb up all the steps but beautiful and so lovely. A lot of people but worth the climb. A definite place to go to see the views across the Daube.

Castle Hill. Castle Hill is the highlight of our City Break to Budapest.
The historic amazing architecture of this area is well worth visiting.
The views are fantastic and in the main the area is not open to traffic so is a perfect place to wander round and enjoy the sites and excellent dining places at reasonable prices

Don't Miss While in Budapest!. This is a total tourist mecca, but still worth the trip up the hill. You'll find the Fisherman's Bastion, Matthias church, and the Royal Palace, all within a short stroll. I wouldn't plan more than a couple of hours up here, with most of the time in the church. But still, I wouldn't come all the way to Budapest and not check it out.
Castle Hill View. The view from the Castle is a must see. We took the Hop on / Hop off bus and then too a reasonably easy walk down through the woods.
Beautiful. The architecture of this huge castle is amazing. Stunning view from the top. Great photo opportunity points.
Great place. Old part of Budapest with great Panorama view all over Budapest. Take a day to visit the Buda part and to visit the museum.

Great views. Visiting the Castle Hill is a must for every tourist in Budapest. I recommend taking the "Siklo" (a small cable car) from the Buda side of the "Lanchid" (Chain Bridge). Take a look at the residence of the President of the Republic, with regular change of guards at the door. Walk in front the the National Gallery, with views to the city. Take the small passage to the West side of the building and walk back all the way to the other end, to the Matthias Church and the Fishermen's Bastion. If you can plan ahead, buy the ticket to the "Siklo" in the off-hours the they before. If you have the ticket you do not need to stay the long line that develops in the morning, when everybody is trying to get up the hill.

Worth a full day. My only regret is that I only had about an hour up on the hill. It was beautiful, wide clean streets with beautiful flowers growing by the side, shops selling souvenirs and cafes and restaurants. The old buildings have been very nicely renovated and maintained, with every corner good enough for photo opportunities. I only had 1 hour up on the hill, and regret that I didn't have at least half a day to walk the grounds and soak in the sights and sounds.
Awesome view - dont miss the night view. One of the places not to be missed in Budapest. I thought the day time was better - unitl i saw it during the night
Night boat trip. Highly recommend a night boat trip on the Danube. Budapest is displayed in all its historical grandeur.

All day long and more!. So many beautiful and interesting sights on Castle Hill. Museums filed with awe inspiring displays. Architecture on an amazing scale. Guards changing at the Palace. The Labyrinth...and Dracula! Food, food, food. A cathedral to inspire anyone. The Fisherman's Bastion. Views worthy of post cards and TV specials. This place is a destination all it's own and you can easily spend one very long or two leisurely says being entertained and amazed.

For history lovers . The castle area offers an awesome view on the whole city. It is also a nice walk uphill if you decide not to take a bus or taxi. There are some overpriced cafés and restaurants in the area as well and you can see some shops selling folk items. Don't buy here tough but it's worth a look. If you're with friends, family or in couple it's still a must see.
Castle Hill is a must see.. and take your time :). Castle Hill is a full day experience. There is a restaurant/bar area at the top where you can see across to Parliament and the Danube River.

Beautiful castle with a lot to see. This is a great place to visit after you've been to Fisherman's Bastion and Matthias Church. It's a quick and beautiful walk from there. I went into the museum but if you aren't into history and artifacts you could skip it. The museum contains old pieces from the castle, old battle gear, art, and some interesting cloth pieces. It was a nice way to learn more about Buda Castle. The grounds are spectacular and very large. The gardens are really pretty and the statues are extremely detailed and interesting. Along the back side of the castle there was an area where you could pay to shoot arrows with different bows. This might be a fun activity for kids. I don't remember it being too expensive.

Stayed in the Castle Hill district & loved it. The walled city in Buda allows a great view of Pest. It's quiet and scenic away from fisherman do bastion and the church. Lovely for an evening walk. Several nice restaurants in the area. Plus there are stairs down to little bars an inexpensive restaurants. Work some of the calories off on the way back up. I felt very safe walking around at night.

Soak up the beauty. Castle Hill is a lovely area. We were here the last weekend in April, a really nice time to visit. The weather was warm and the gardens and parkland were beautiful. There is so much to see and it's a photographers dream. The views over the Danube and the city is breathtaking.

Very nice view from the top. We took bus no. 16 which goes from the main square in Pest to the castle hill in a few minutes.On the top you can spend 1-2 hours walking around and looking at the beautiful view.I recommend going down on foot, it is less than 10 minutes to get back to the river.

Beautiful castle. Also visit at night for wonderful views of Budapest. I didn't visit the museum but the castle grounds themselves are pretty amazing and we'll worth the visit. Walk up or take the funicular railway. This is a must see of any trip to Budapest

Must see. If you are in Budapest this is a must see/do. You can see change of the guards in front of the president building, varius interesting museums (one of them offers Picasso exhibition) and most importantly great views on Budapest.
Amazing views!. The steep hacking was rewarded by the great vews of the city below including all the bridges, Parlament building and Saint Stephen basilica.

Camera a must........... .........probably the prettiest part of Budapest to visit. Clean and well laid out for tourists. Plenty of nice shops which don't set their stall out for visitors - you would want to visit this anyway

Best part of Budapest!. I went here 3 times during my 5 day trip in Budapest. I got wonderful pictures during the day. But my tip would be to head up here close to sunset to take pictures of the city with daylight. Then wait until it gets dark and you'll see the whole city all lit up. It's absolutely gorgeous. Also try the archery-- you get 5 arrows for like 2 dollars! You'll get some cool pictures too!

Rebuild a castel in the wrong way. . The castel has been destroid in WW2. During the Russin time it was rebuild in a very poor way. Norhing of the old glamour is there any more. The castel is an empty shell.
Castle Hill, Budapest. Dominated by the Royal Palace, which is a mixture several buildings housing museums and the hungarian national gallery , offers good views of the city

Stunning!. We were lucky to have beautiful weather during our visit and spent a lovely morning walking up the hill and around the castle grounds. Lots of nooks and crannies to explore and great views across the city.

Outstanding Day. The Buda Castle and the hill are undoubtedly a must visit in Budapeste. It takes the whole day to go up, explore the castle and the museans. Have a lunch up there. Continue walking towards the Mathias Cathedral and the Fisherman Bastion. Explore the sunset and go down. Outstanding Program.

Epic views . Would definitely recommend to visit. Breath taking views and architecture.Easy to get to on your tour bus and also take the silko up to he top where you can see the presidency residence. Lovely shops and village to walk through with a beautiful church.Museum, library and gallery. Mesmerising views of the Danube and pest.

Lots to see. A must do visit when in Budapest easy to get there on the No16 bus route or any of the tourist hop on - hop off routes So much too see and do shops,restaurants and the castle which is now the national gallery
Must see at night!. We went up here at night to view the entire city!! Perfect location to get excellent night-time photos of the Parliament and the Pest side.

Best city view !!!. The best way to start your stay in budapest is to go the castle.It's definitely the best city view.Don't be lazy and walk !! do not use the tramway to get up, you will spend a lot of time waiting for it.The panorama is fantastic, it's giving you an overview of pest and parts of buda.The castle itself is really big and you can do a quick tour of it.Perfect way to start your trip !!!

Spectacular. . Lovely area to wander around and see the historic buildings, which are extremely well looked after and some of the most beautiful in Europe. Any fan of architecture really needs to see this castle.
Fabulous district of old Budapest. Most beautiful district of Budapest embracing the Royal Palace, Burgher houses, fabulous views & historical landmarks
Nice stroll. We enjoyed strolling this area to enjoy the view of the Danube and Parliament on the other side. Highly recommended
Stunning views of Budapest. I went just before sunset when its not so busy , great place to walk around and great views of the river and the city. Would recommend you make this one of your stops.
National History Museum.. This History Museum gives a clear picture of how Budapest developed, the various wars that occurred and describes the rulers and other important people.

Amazing place, Amazing views!. Castle Hill is a must when visiting Budapest. It is located in the Buda part of the city. You can also catch some great views of the Pest side and the danub River from here. You can take some amazing pictures. Worth visiting during the day and night since they are two different experiences.
Nice location. Great location with lots of touristic places, yet be careful of the restaurants and bars can cost at least 3x times more than the Pest side of the city

A day full of architectural beauty. Castle Hill requires the whole day set aside for exploring as it has a few of the best Budapest attractions gathered here: Buda Castle (and National Gallery), Fisherman Bastion etc. Not to mention Budapest views from atop!

Old Buda at its best. A must. There is a totally different village atmosphere up on top of the hill. Access via foot (long uphill walk), funicular from the end of the bridge over the Danube or (best) catch the Number 16 bus up from the city.Multiple attractions here: Museums, church, Fisherman's Bastion. Places to eat (and stay) and several shops. The views over Budapest and up and down the Danube are stunning. Well worth a detour.

Intimate at night. I used to live in this area for a whole year and I got to see an other face of this beautiful part. It is worth to go up any time. But I would recommend to go up after 10-11 PM. When everyone goes to sleep, all the tourists are gone, the area is very quiet and intimate. You might can't go into the Matthias church or any other building but you can feel the special atmosphere of the streets. At 1 AM the city turns off the lights of the Chain Bridge, the Parliament and of other monuments and it is really cool to see it from above. It is also worth to see the sunrise from the Fisherman's Bastion. You got to see the whole Pest side and the beautiful colors of the sunrise.Than you can walk down to Széll Kálmán tér and you can be in the city with the tram within 15 minutes (since the 4-6 tramline is 0-24).
Very nice view.... Wonderful view of Budapest... Nice historical buildings. There is no so much information about how you can go there with public transport.

Lovely Views and Architecture. Walking around proved a good way to get a feel for the whole complex. The day was beautiful which meant countless throngs of people around. Taking pictures which was my objective was difficult at best. However, sunny days were a rarity that week and so we eked out a few pictures. We walked down afterwards for quite a way and that afforded more good photo ops.

You can see the whole Budapest!. The Castle is amazing and the view is breathtaking! Behind the castle they have also a very nice walk path with trees with pink leafs (honestly one of my favourite spots ever). MUST to visit!!
Great place to visit. Lots to see and do. Walked over the Chain Bridge then got the little train up the hill. Brilliant views and a nice place to wonder.
Great view. Nice walk. Great view of the city. Bus 16 goes to the top and you can walk down the hill instead of climbing up.
Castle. Very easy to go by sight seeing buses or can walk from the Chain bridge.... Nice view and enjoy full feeling.... St Mathias church and fishermen bastion also very near ... Must visit
beautiful. especially at night. Saw this on city tour. Went back for a close up. Very beautifulbring your camera. Lots of excellent photo ops

Views of Danube and Pest side are best from here, TAKE the Vernacular. There's just not many bad pictures to be taken in Budapest! But from the Castle area on the Buda side you get perspectives that are truly stunning. Early and late are better than when the tour folks are hoarding through. The logging and restaurants are more gentrified and relaxed that the Pest side with its hustle and bustle.
Beautiful area . Beautiful area with history and very nice architecture. Nice views. You can go for example by funicular or bus and of course walk too.
Castle Hill. The Royal Palace, is a MUST,and the Hungarian National Gallery housed in side is well worth a visit, and take a walk up to the dome, the veiw over the Chain Bridge, is worth the walk.
Lovely few hours. We spent a lovely few hours here, so much to see and plenty of places to eat and drink. Took are funicular up and walked down on a beautiful sunny day. Recomend
Great walk. Walking around this building is like getting back 150 year in time. The view on the city below is magnificent and the view on Pecs at the backside is refreshing.
a most beautiful building. a simply wonderful place to visit , walk around, shop and generally enjoy that is without mentioning the National Gallery

Absolutely stunning. Once in the castle, or at least on it, you can expect a beautiful view of Budapest. It's truly the most beautiful thing I've seen so far. The walk from the Metro to the castle was rather long (but probably only because my friend and I got out at one that was a little farther away) but the parc we walked through was gorgeous. Once we arrived at the castle, I couldn't believe the view. You have the left wing, another monument in the center and the right wing. We only saw the left wing- but boy, it was nice! We ate lunch at the lovely cafe in the center and then walked the path down to the Danube. Breathtaking- the greatest MUST of Budapest, if you ask me. And it looks beautiful at night too!

Best view of the city at night--let your imagination take you to long-ago times.. Having visited other European cities and many other places in the world, I knew we would love Castle Hill and Budapest in general, but it was still a surprise. Walk around Castle Hill at night -- and visit again in the daytime -- and bring your camera. Just amazing. Best views of the Parliament at night from the Hill. Just a quick walk to Fisherman's Bastian -- also a wonderful night time treat. Get there via the funicular if you have time -- well worth the short wait (fast line).

The old city on the Castle hill. The Castle Hill includes a lot of sites.The white house where you can see the soldiers guarding the houce the nice streets of the old city,Hilton hotel the Wine Museum The Fisher Bastion and other wonderful places.
Amazing night view. Budapest is divided by river into Buda and Pest area. Night view of the Buda Castle hill is amazing from chain bridge.
Holiday. Lovely building we walked all around the building the are lovely gardens but the best his the fantastic views.

Castle Hill. We walked this visit to the top of Castle Hill. the views are beautiful once you reach the top and there are restaurants and cafes if you should be inclined to partake it local food and people watch!

Beautiful . Loved it here. Walked the area both at day and after dark. Stunning views. Beautiful architecture. Very well maintained. Particularly good view of the Parliament Building when lit up after dark.

First stop. This is a good place to start your tour of Budapest; from the Castle you will have a great view of Pest spread out before you and will be able to pick out all the major landmark buildings for your visit.
NIce monument and great views. Great place to visit, different face during the day and at night. Take a tour around and do not miss visit of underground as well.

A great deal to see and do on the hill. Great views, shopping, museums and cafes makes this a nice day trip. Great people watching. Make sure to explore the perimeter not just the central aspect of the castle as there is so much to see.
What views!. We could have spent the entire day in this area. The variation, with something different round every corner is fantastic

Views of Budapest. There are many views in this world but not many leave such an impression ... I was fortunate enough to have my hotel directly opposite this place and I could not get enough of it. Excellent View. Then take a tour, the history of this place will not disappoint you - there is enough magic and tragedy that you would expect from a city that has a past that does Budapest.

Glorious perfection. An absolute must-see for any visitor to Budapest.Castle Hill dominates the skyline from both sides of the river, by day and night. I'd suggest paying to go up by the wonderful old funicular at the end of Chain Bridge and then walking through the beautiful streets after your visit.The exterior of the castle/palace is beautiful, and the gardens and surroundings delightful. The walks around and the views are tremendous. Just enjoy
Nice. It is totally worth it adding this place to your visit list in Budapest. You get a nice view all over the city and the architecture is really amazing.

You shall go. Climb it or take the funicular, but it is really worth doing up there. Best views of the city. Also the area up there is very particular (we didn't visit the inside of castle as we were advised that isn't worth).
Walk the citadel . If you want views you must walk the citadel. It was such a nice evening walk. After a hot day a nice way to chill out and get some great views over the whole city!! Well worth it.

Amazing views. The views from the castle area was great and you could see the Chain Bridge while climbing up the stairs. This area also has a beautiful garden which you can take nice photos from the steps.

An amazing castle. An enormous castle it will take you at least all day just to walk round you can visit various parts inside but they all have different fees which you obtain from a central box office at the castle but all the outside access is free don't be put off by the walk up to the castle there is a ropeway car that goes up from the bottom a fee is payable and a bus runs to the top every ten minutes just to walk round the grounds is a great day out.

Love it!. We loved the whole area. This has been one of the highlights of Budapest and will come back..My teens and younger children wish to come back each of the days we have stayed, but only managed to come twice!
wonderful views from castle. Very interesting area - lots of shops surrounding the castle - plenty of eating places - great views from the castle - coffee shop in castle grounds

If you have extra time, it is nice to visit!. Across the Danube and couple of stairs up is located Castle Hill. It is free, there are a few souvenir shops and a public paid parking along the way to the top. Great panorama of Budapest at the top!

Great view from the Castle. We didn't have much time when visiting Castle Hill. I can tell you that the view from up there is beautiful. We just had time for a photo opt. Wish we could have had more time to enjoy it. It's a definite while in Budapest.

Fantastic!. We were staying on the Pest side. Walked over the Chain bridge and took the Fenicular railway to the top.The views were incredible. Overlooking the Danube and Pest.We were lucky enough to see a military parade being done whilst we were there. Highly recommend a visit to here.
Worth the climb. We walked up the many steps to get to Castle Hill. The museums at the Castle are a must see. The view of the city is spectacular!
A must see in Budapest. We were sensible and took the funicular up and then walked gently down. The views of Pest are very good. Stout shoes are best on the pebbles.

Way up the hill. Castle that is not a real castle.. Way up the hill on Buda side. Can take the inclined tram (charge) walk (climb) or escalator/elevator (free) to get there. Outside is rebuilt castle and inside is museum and admin. offices. Beautiful regardless. Easy walk from Pest side, across bridge. Takes a spectacular photo from Pest side at night.

Great Views of Pest. You either have to go here or Gellert Hill to enjoy incredible views of Pest from across the Danube. There are 3 things to see here: Mathias Church, Fishermans Bastion and Buda Castle. All are good and in walking distance of one another. You can take the 16 bus to Mathias Church instead of paying the $$ for the funicular to the Castle. These are great views from Fishermans Bastion and Buda Castle. You cannot tour inside Buda Castle as it is only museums now.

Great sight in Europe. This is a fantastic sight in Europe, during the day, more so at night
Stay in the castle hill - the Hilton is terrific

Nice afternoon. There are plenty of things to see. The castle museum is nice and the Matthias Church is beautiful. Plenty of cafes and just a nice place to walk around and admire the view. I'd recommend going down the back side of the hill to the Hospital in the Rock.

Gorgeous Grounds!. Take the time to walk around and through he Castle grounds. Very impressive structure and beautiful artwork. Great views of the city as well. We were here in March, not yet full bloom, and still breathtaking. You can pay to have a tour of the Castle as well. Great distance view from the Pest side of the river.

Brilliant views. Walked across the Elizabeth Bridge up to the Citadel then back down and across to Castle Hill, views were brilliant though we dropped on with bright, hot sunny days.,Got some excellent views across Budapest. On this visit we didn't bother with the museums just walked the Castle paths then over past the Presidential Residence (Sandor Palace) and over to Matthias Church stop off for drinks at Var Bistro.It was a fair walk that we did but very enjoyable, excellent sights and no cost beyond refreshments.The walk we did would not have been as good if it was bad weather but the castle does now house the National Museum and the history museum so would be good on wet days.

Absolutely stunning. I'm not sure if some of the previous reviewers visited the same place we did, as saying that the views were rubbish and there was nothing to see is simply not true! We caught the metro from our hotel and walked up to castle hill, we didn't bother with the funicular railway as I'd read that it was quite expensive and the hill really isn't that much of a challenge if you're relatively fit and healthy! There are several routes up, some steeper than others but plenty of places to stop and take a breather should you so wish. Once at the top the views are stunning. We were fortunate enough to have very good weather so you can see for miles. It's worth going up there purely for the view. There are plenty of little cafes at the top, shops and a marzipan museum!! We got there in time to stumble across the changing of the guard which was brilliant to watch. The view changes as you move along castle hill so there are plenty of different photo opportunities. If you're in it for the panoramic, I'd also suggest taking a yomp up to the citadel (no funicular this time) as that's situated even higher and you can see even more!

Not to be missed. Great view of the city from here. Lots to do including archery, medieval weaponry and the castle tour itself. I Would recommend taking the cable car up for anyone who struggles with walking as its quite a tough hike to the top.
Castle hill. Must see! Funicular has fab views and is approx £5 for return ticket! We walked to fisherman bastion - which is equally amazing.

nice walk up. We took the winding road up to the Castle and went to the Art Museum. We also saw some excavations of some of the ancient ruins from the village that once was inside the castle walls. Very nice.

Bus No 18 cathc - hilarious. We explored the Castle Hill for almost the entire day. Matthias Church (Mátyás templom) and Fishermen’s Bastion (Halászbástya) are must see. Make sure the weather is sunny in order to take the most of it. Be aware that is a huge complex so plan accordingly your time. We laughed to tears on the transport arrangement back form the Hill to the Gellert hotel where we staid. While we reached the Castle Hill up just fine with Bus No 16, on our way back we asked the bus drivers which bus should we take to continue to the hotel neighborhood. Not only that he clearly said No 18 but he also wrote that to us, and showed as where to cross the street and on which bus station to wait. Well, when we went there, surprise , surprise: on the bus schedule was no bus No. 18 at all. We checked the near ones as well - the same. Than, we saw a tram station and went there in believe that maybe the tram was mistaken with a bus. There one kind gentlemen explained us in fluid English that indeed on that location there is a direct transport to the Gellert Hotel, but it was no Bus No 18, but tram No 56.  So, pleas note that bus No.18 on Hungarian means tram No. 56 on English. He, he, he. We had great time, the Hungarian people, at least the ones we interacted wit, were all warm and helpful. Except some of the taxi drivers, but that is another story.

Best to visit at night. We visited the castle hill both during the day and in the evening and I much more preferred it in the evening. When the sky is dark and all the lights are on the bridges, Parliament and around the castle itself...the view is just breathtaking

Must see for any trip to Budapest. A truly lovely part of the city, with the feel of a small medieval town unlike the rest of the city. Very tastefully renovated and not crowded on an April weekday (much busier at weekends). At night, like other major sites in central Budapest, it is lit perfectly. Lovely.

Discovering Budapest. When I was seeing it from my room at the hotel I wanted to visit it... At the moment I visit it, I was astonished from it's hugeness, took me 2 and half hours to visit all the rooms in it without the special rooms that needed a special ticket.
I highly recommending it for people who LOVE ARTS.

Buda Castle.. Delightful beautiful architecture, absolutely stunning venue with fantastic views of the city. Changing of the guard was interesting, my wife believed the soldiers were dummy's until they moved. Funicular railway saves the legs but a bit pricey, would be better to stroll up the hill, downwards not a problem, gravity dies the work. Great visitor attraction, recommended.

Beautiful Views and Music. The hill gives beautiful views across the city and when we were there a violinist and guitarist were busking which added to the ambience. We took the tourist bus up and walked down to cross the Chain Bridge-well worth the walk.

Stunning oasis of tranquility.. To say that Castle Hill is in the heart of a fast paced modern European capital city it is in another world. A little oasis of calm a complete opposite from the frenetic nature of Pest it comes a welcome relief from the sirens, traffic and city life. Castle Hill can be reached by walking up the steep path or road or for the less energetic by the Budavári Sikló (funicular railway) from Adam Clark Square. The Hill, as the name suggests, is home to the Buda Castle, Fisherman's Bastion, Sándor Palace (home of the President) and the Labyrinth. The Castle is an art gallery (or it was when we went) Fisherman's Bastion is the best place to get a view over Pest best viewed at night when the Parliament building is lit up. The Labyrinth is strange mixture of historic artefacts, an opera and Dracula. I don't recommend it if you are claustrophobic. Castle Hill is beautiful at night and well worth a visit. During the day there is a market with touristy items on sale near the Castle and there are several restaurants to choose from.
One of symbols of budapest. Located on buda side. Can be seen from everywhere in budapest. So many architecture, sculptures and most important so beautiful view of budapest.
Amazing view. The castle is a great place to visit; I particularly love seeing it in the later hours when all the lights are on because it gives the whole place a bit extra.

Spend at least half a day. This whole hilltop area is so different to Pest and great to wander, explore, sit with a coffee, relax.A photographers heaven with many attractions for all ages. Art lovers and history lovers the most....and fans of Dracula!Travelling up by the funicular a must.
First on your list. This is a must. The castle itself is amazing. Give yourself plenty of time here as we spent 4 hours here. Views are spectacular.

A great day. You can spend a good few hours walking around the castle taking pictures and exploring the grounds. Thrre are some fantastic views from here and be sure to visit after dark too... it's a whole other experience at night.
Amazing view from top!!!!. Get on top and admire the entire city. Beyond history, the view is magnificent and certainly one of the best places to take pictures!

Astonishment. Exuberant exhibition, gothic arches and cobblestone streets. The castle is located in a hill which is part of the Castle complex. Nowadays it's considered a town. Spare a whole day for a visit at its museums, art galleries, cafes, patisseries and souvenir shops and loose yourself in this amazing place surrounded by huge medieval walls.

Stunning. Day and night!. Great views of the danube, Chain bridge, st stephens basilica and the parliament. Home to the national gallery, and only a short 5 minute walk from matthias church and the fishermans bastion! This castle is not like many in europe. It was burnt down many years ago and has no history relating to the monarchy, This Buda castle is purely the home to the national gallery. Enjoy your time here!

Amazing view!. Wonderful Castle Hill view opens from the Pest side. And an overwhelming desire appears to explore the Castle, to wander through the old streets... The easiest way to climb the Hill is to take a funicular. It’s a double pleasure: old cabins and saving you forces for a long time walk around. The castle houses an art gallery, but if you're not particular fan of fine art, you can just stroll around, enjoying views of the Danube and Pest. Then you can go in the direction of Fisherman's Bastion and St. Matthias Church. A small gallery near the church will give you an unforgettable experience on the species. Fishermen's Bastion, a fairy-tale tower, is perfect! Here you can have a snack in the cafe or visit the small museum of marzipan.
Not that great. So, getting up here on the cable car is cool and the view is nice but there are better views from the Buda side and when you get up there its only so-so

Fabulous Views. The Castle was only a short walk from our hotel. There is an option of getting a tram to the top but to be honest I would suggest walking up as by the time you get to the top of the queue then wait for the tram to come down and bring you up you will have reached the top. The walk up isnt that long or difficult and the views are amazing at the top. Do watch out for guys trying to sell u tours on your way over, some tried telling us that the trams weren't working to try and persuade us to go with them. But you could see them moving while walking over the bridge.
Very good view. The building is outstanding, but really you have to walk arround the castle, specially behind the castle to take a look of pest side
Beautiful. This is one of the must see places in Budapest. Beautiful view of the city, just walk around and enjoy it!
15th century castle. 15th century castle, situated in Buda, great panorama. Old city. Museums. A lot of history hidden in those walls! Fast way to get there from Var Kert Bazar.
Amazing Location. Amazing location offering stunning views of Budapest! Well worth a visit! Great opportunity for family photos! Definitely one of the top attractions in Budapest!
Great view of the city. Awesome place to see the whole city! Great to see the changing of the guards also which happens around 1pm. Gorgeous church at the top also.
For special view. At night or during day time, you can get the most amazing views of the city and the Danube! Not to be missed for best photo shots!

A must see in Budapest. Castle Hill just has so much to see. Plan one afternoon at least to make sure to see everything. Start the day with a walk from Pest and cross the chain bridge, take afterwards the cable car up to castle hill and explore the entire hill. Over summer and fall they have different, small, festivals - like the sausage and pálinka fesztival. After a long walk you can rest there and eat and drink local specialities.
Beutiful Castle. I'd recommend visiting you can acces either with sightseeing buses or by public transportation. Good view over the city!

Great views. The area has a lot to see and is easily accesible from Fishermans Bastion area, which i think is the better thing to see. There is a lot of renovation work being done around the castle when we went but still it is a great place to visit. The views from the whole area are superb and if you are lucky you get to see the changing of the guard. The place is lit up at night and is a wonderful site.
Nice view to the city. This is one of the best sight of Budapest. You can walk up or go with the "siklo". You can have a nice walk between the beautiful buildings with nice view on the side.
Castle view . This was one of the first places we wanted to see and when we got there it was better than in the books and on the Internet

Worth going to. Took the vernacular up for a decent price. The artwork in the museum was interesting. Mix of old and new. Eastern European style tipping, you have no choice. Well done, you poured some hot water, why should you force money out of me.
Maybe best spot in Buda. Incredible architecture and panoramic views of the Danube and Pest make a trip up Castle Hill a must destination.

Perfect View.... Visit the castle hill either by climbing the stairs, or using the funicular (1.200 HUF, 4 Euros one way - 1.800 HUF, 6 Euros with return). in front of Chain bridge. The view from the hill is astonishing. You can see Pest, the Danube, the Parliament, the bridges and the top of St Stephen basilica. You have to pay only if you want to visit one of the museums of the Castle. Pass to the back side of the Palace and walk till the Fisherman's Bastion and St Matthias church. The view from this point is also fantastic. There is a coffe place here if you want to rest. If you stay at the city center and you are too tired to return on foot, you can take the buss number 16 that passes in front of St Matthias church and goes to metro station Deac Ferenc ter (Metro lines 1,2 nad 3).

Superb. Originally a royal palace surrounded by a fortress, this area is one of the top attractions in the capital city. The National Gallery, the National library (Szechenyi), the presidents palace, the museum of history are all within walkning distance. A little further away you find the neo-Gothic Mathias church, the Fishermen's bastion, and cozy small streets from the Middle ages. The Hilton is one of the best situated in Europe overlooking the Danube. Its Dominican courtyard is used for concerts. The Castle Hill has some other sites like the Hospital in the Rock and a labyrinth. after having walked around a bit you may relax, either in a restaurant or in one of the cafes, like Ruszwurm or Korona! Take the funicular down to the suspension bridge and walk over to the Pest side....

Beautiful Castle. Amazing architecture and wonderful views of the River Danube and Pest. Looks beautiful in the day and lit up at night. We went up on the Funicular Railway and walked down through the Castle gardens.
Great views. Good way to see this area is to go on the Hop on off bus, and take a stroll around, you get great views over the river Danube seeing Pest side

worth the walk. it is steep to get up the hill although there is a lift for those who want it. Worth the climb though with really impressive views of Budapest and several buildings to explore - church, palace, museum and nice cafes. The medieval street was a bit disappointing but otherwise great.

So much to see, take the funicular up!. Castle Hill is deceptively large, and there is so much to see you will need to set aside at least a couple of hours to do the job well. We started with a funicular ride to the top which is historic in its own right having been built in 1870 and still going strong. We made it to the top in time to see a changing of the guards - a little less pomp than some I've seen but it was actually quite special to be able to be so close. It was a blazing, warm day so we felt for the poor guys in heavy clothes and gloves. The area overall gives excellent views of the Parliament, the river and the city in all directions and with plenty of room, lots of history and real life bustling around you, it's an area rich in accessible history and stories.

So many attractions in one place. It's possible to spend a whole day wandering around,exploring the amazing sights located in this area and it can all be done on foot.The architecture of the main sights is stunning.Added to that are little extra activities you can do like having an archery lesson.My seven-year-old particularly enjoyed this and the instructor was very patient and encouraging.We also came across a labyrinth of 'scary' dungeons which are worth exploring.There are also a few little art galleries dotted around which you can look around for free.This area is unmissable !
Great building, great view. The Várhegy is one of the must-sees in Budapest. Not only the castle is beautiful, it also offers a marvelous view over the city.

Nice view of Pest. You can reach the castle with a funicular or by walking up steps. I'm in bad shape, but it still only took me five minutes to climb all the way up from the river. There was a long line to the funicular, so keep this in mind.There's a changing of guards in the square next to the Buda Castle. Pretty fun to watch. The view of Pest is better from the Fishermen's Bastion.Inside the castle there's a museum, so I didn't bother going inside

Beautiful, especially from the Pest side at night.. Castle Hill is famous for Buda Castle that is located right on the top of the hill. The best way to observe the beauty of the hill is from the bank of the Pest side, especially during night. However, if you are on the hill, you can also enjoy its views as well as the view of Pest. There are also many other places to see like Fisherman's Bastion and Matthias Church on Castle Hill, so be ready to spend half of a day there.All in all, step on the Castle Hill or walk by as it is pretty in any way.
Great view for pictures!. Beautiful place, nice walk, nice spot for pictures. Go there during the day (a sunny day) for the best pictures ! You won't regret it !

Best of Budapest. My #1 recommendation when visiting Budapest. There are several museums on the Castle Hill area. If you'd like to see them all plan on spending more than 3 hours. Even if you skip the inside of the building, it's still an amazing place to walk around.You could easily walk up the hill or ride the Castle Hill Funicular (tram). I recommend walking at least one way. The cobble stone path leading to the top offers some great photo ops! Make sure you walk around the back of the building to take in all that the area has to offer.Truly one of the most beautiful sites in Budapest.

Beautiful. We visited this during the day and at night and both times we saw something different we didn't see before. Views from here are breathtaking. You can get some food here and it was reasonably priced.
Nice outside, evening spectacle. Worth climbing all the way up the hill to view. In the evening it lights up and looks great. COmbine this with a tour around the old town up top.
Museums. My son visited the art gallery and loved it. We visited the library and History museum and it was very good.

The historic part of Budapest. There are a lot to see at the Castle Hill. The best way to explore the area to walk up at one of the numerous walkway from the bank of the Danube between Bathyany tér and the Elizabeth Bridge. All of the stairs, roads leading up to the Castle Hill. The walkways show a great panoramic wiev of the city at every turn. If you are not up for walking, you can take the "Budavári Sikló" located at the Buda side of the Chain Bridge, or a bus 16 from Széll Kálmán tér or Deák Ferenc tér. This is the oldest part of the city there are part of the old fortress, midevial buildings, the king's Palace, Mathias Church, Fishermen's Bastion, musums, underground labirinth, restaurants, shops etc. You can spend a whole day there just walking around and discover something interesting at every corner. A lot of festivals are being held here (Wine, pálinka, beer, food, craft fairs through all summer long.

Castle Hill. Look at a brochure of the Castle Hill tour and decide what you want to see and when. It is a museum and an operational area for the country's government's leading administration so it is a good idea to know what interests you the most and when that information is available. - It is an outstanding tour within Europe and characteristic ofEuropean Historical sites; to learn the most from historical developments, art and architectures spend some time to look at the available brochures and historical summaries. I have been here many times with family and visiting friends.

stunning architecture. A walk around the Castle Hill area is a must do if you enjoy great architecture and stunning views. The views from the hill are awesome and combining the Fisherman's Bastion and walls make's for a great place to just chill out. The architecture is fantastic with superb building every were you turn and the great view's of the mighty River Danube which are outstanding. You also have the changing of the guard which is a great tourist attraction in its own right.A great tourist destination and well worth checking out, don't forget your camera.

Worth a look. With the old town of Buda right next door, having a look at the Castle and then ambling through the pedestrian roads is worth your while. Snap a panaroma overlooking Pest and the Danube and perhaps grab some lunch in one of the less touristic locals off in the hard to find, difficult to pronounce side streets.

A city gem!. We are staying in Pest and Castle Hill is one of the premier views. However it demands closer inspection. It is a beautiful area to walk around with numerous viewpoints and photo opportunities. The narrow streets and architecture are full of interest. It is also evident how many locals are taking in the same walk. Pride in their city which is well founded.

Great for wandering around. This is a really historic area with much to see as well as lovely cafe's to rest in. We were lucky to see the changing of the guard so I'd recommend you try and time your visit for then. There is a funicular railway but you can easily walk up here. Don't miss it.
Amazing views and architecture!. Beautiful architecture and great views from here across the city and river! Ensure you take a camera.

Breathtaking. My boyfriend and I walked all around Fishermans Bastion and Castle Hill after walking up Gellert Hill in the evening and it was simply breathtaking. We will be going back for a full tour.

Hours of Possibilities. Stayed on castle hill and loved it! Hours of walking opportunities with beautiful architecture everywhere you look. Guard changes regularly and plenty of exhibitions to choose from.

Great views of Pest. Interesting museum and Church. We walked over the Chain Bridge from Buda and took the funicular up (but walked down). It's 1200 one way, 1800 round trip to save a 5 minute walk up the stairs or a more roundabout 15 minute windy path. If you happen to arrive near the top of the hour, there is a very, very short changing of the guards ceremony at the top of every hour. If you happen to be there then, fine, if not, it's not worth much of a wait. Top highlights of the area are the Budapest History Museum at the south end and the Matthias Church and Fishermans Bastion towards the north end. Views over the Danube toward the Pest side are great.

A must do.. Fine views over the Danube from the extensive terraces offering a panorama of the bridges and the Pest side of the city. Lots of steps to climb to get up there so best to take the tour bus or the little No.16 bus that operates from the city centre, picking up at Clarke Adam Square by the Chain Bridge and traversing across the top if the hill.

Good views and architecture. The building is nice enough to work around explore the whole of castle hill, which then leads on to Fisherman's Bastion. We saw them changing the guard too when we came up the cable car (I wouldn't bother with this to be fair, just go up the slope to the left it's a nice walk and you can take in the views. It's not difficult or far). Didn't bother with art or museum just looked around grounds. Lot of construction work going on to around this area which does detract a little but not unexpected for type of area. Best part the views, as we'd just got to Budapest it was a good way of getting a high view to get a scope of where everything is in relation!

Closed on Mondays. The museums and galleries are closed on a Monday but we still enjoyed our walk around the outside areas of the building looking at the magnificent scultures ( waterfall is switched off until May ) and gates as well as the buildings themselves

The area to visit!. If you have limited time in Budapest, take a walk over the Chain Bridge into the Buda side of the city. Castle Hill offers great views of the Pest side and all the attractions are located close to one another. You can take the funicular up (about 6 euros for 5 minutes) or walk 15 minutes on an easy path. After coming up, take a walk around, explore St. Matthias Church and buy a slice of cake from Ruszwurm. However, most restaurants are expensive up here so if you want to eat, head back to Pest.
Great Views. Great for pictures and views of Budapest.Can walk up if fit otherwise funicular ride which costs 1800 huf each.

Beautiful in and out, extraordinary art. The Castle Hill is located on a hill :), wonderful view on the city especially at night.It has several attraction, the only one that we visited was the National Gallery.Amazing collection of Hungarian art works mainly painting. Very important to see for art lovers. The castle hill is a must.
Don't miss it!. this is definitely worthy of a walk. It takes about 2 hours to walk around & to take in the sights. Scenery from the top is amazing

Good history museum and underground castle remains. Not a castle in the conventional sense three distinct areas including an art gallery and the national history museum. Accessto the vaults under the curent structures is through the history museum. Many artifacts found locally and some brought back to the castle.

Great views of Pest. The hill is populated by many buildings including the presidential palace. Didn't get the museums-next time. But the views are worth the walk. don't take the funicular. The walk is easy 8 min and worth the effort.

Something to see around every corner!. The view from the top alone is worth the visit. But the castle and museum are spectacular. They have blended history, with art, traditional and modern sculpture in a fabulous and unique way. Be sure to go around all sides of the building and enjoy the views.

The other must-visit place in the city. The castle district has several other attractions (noted separately on TripAdvisor), though these are all in walking distance, so spending a day (or just couple of hours) here you can enjoy a great variety of experiences: breathtaking views, architectural beauties, historical cafes, various museums, and a living tradition (as the many-hundred-year-old houses are inhabited by a distinguished community). Every few minutes can be a new experience...Yes, there may be tourists, but hey, who is talking (the place is not crowded though unless there is a big event). If you want solitude (or even if you don't) go and visit the ruined gardens of the Historical Museum, and walk down from there to the riverbank.

Sight seeing. If you get of the big bus tour near the funicular railway there is a nice cafe just over the road before you take the trip up to the top we where there in March and there was a bit of a Que. to go up so I think in summer it could be very busy but is worth the wait it is not expensive to go up and once up there the views are spectacular don't buy anything from the stalls up there as they are expensive by comparison with the main shopping in pest

Wonderful walking environment with lots to see and do. This district is worth nearly a day of your time. Between all the historic sites (castle, St. Matthias Church, Fisherman's Bastion) the museums (art museum, Budapest museum, military museum, music museum), the Labyrinth under the castle, AND all the cafes and shops, you can really explore these lovely winding streets. The metro gets close and/or the 16 and 16A buses will take you through the district. There is also a funicular that connects you will the Chain Bridge and you can catch the 16 there across the river.

A Let Down...... We were staying in an apartment at the foot of the castle and the view of it was wonderful. We went up by funicular railway but once at the top we were highly disappointed. The views are great but the 'castle' isn't really a castle and its run down and not very cared for. Its obviously used now as offices for something but the whole place had a very unloved feel about it. Seeing the soldiers do their 'change of guard' was good but didn't really make up for the let down.

Large complex buildings. The hill is composed of Buda castle (now a museum), presidential palace, church and the fisherman bastion. The view from the fisherman bastion (the highlight) should be awesome if the weather is goof. However, it was really snowing and foggy in winter that we could hardly see anything. Therefore, visiting in summer is much more recommended. The funicular will take you near to the presidential palace. I hope I will have a chance to visit again in summer!

Absolutely stunning. Wonderful, beautiful, stunning, excellent- not enough to describe the place. ;) Located in the "Buda" part it offers couple of historical buildings, museums, monuments, restaurants and wonderful views. Looks magical after sunset and pretty in the daylight. Even the walk to the top of it is exciting and you can do that from many points. I would recommend reserving more than 2 hours to walk there, see and enjoy the beauty of the city.
free visit. Nice architecture. Free place to visit to spend a few hours exploring. Great views across the river and views of pest.

Great walk. It was great walk. If you like a bit of challenge yourself, it's great place to go. There is just unsure where to go as there is no proper signage apart from marks on trees. :) there is plenty areas to get up there, it's like a labyrinth. Highly recommend to everyone.

Amazing. Great place worth visiting and knowing the history of Buda pest, its the otehr side of the city know as Buda, majorly residential area, earlier this was vineyard hill but an epidemic hit which washed away all the crops and then nothing grew there Just enjoy the location
One of our visits highlights. This is a spectacular area of Budapest with loads to see. It is part of Budapest's colourful history.

Great views . The hill is great to visit and see the views over the river. There is a cafe at the top to sit down and have a drink, appetizer or a meal while people watching, relaxing and enjoying the view.

A must see when in Budapest. The Castle Hill is a must see when you are in Budapest. The Castle is a masterpiece and it is a great place to just look out over Pest. Can definitely recommend taking the cable car to the top!Don't forget to bring a camera, it's a must if you are going there!

Impressive hill and building. Me and my friend went there after we have went to citadel, and we have admired the beauty especially in the architecture of the buildings one find on this hill. The most building that impressed us was the Buda Castle which is simply amazing and worth to see. Moreover, from here one can take advantage and admire more the city of Budapest.
If you miss it - you miss the highlight.. Go up there to the Castle Hill to see the view from above. Take photo of the Chain Bridge - it's amazingly beautiful!!!! Don't miss it.
Essential. There's no way you can visit Budapest and not come up here. There's quite a bit to just wander around if you don't want to pay to enter either the art gallery or the museum.
Beautiful Building. Great for photographers! Got some great night shots of this building and the chain bridge. Great to wonder around on the cobble stone streets.

Astonishing. When I was in Buda's side, I couldn't take my eyes of the castle on the other side. It's definitely worth the visit, if you're willing to walk I truly recommend to go there by foot and enjoy the view
Stunning . Breathtaking views & a beautiful place to stroll through. Don't bother taking a tour ....just walk across the bridge. It's a nice walk.

Amazing 5 Star World Heritage Site. With so many must-see attractions, medieval architecture, Gothic arches, Baroque style houses and cobblestone streets, Castle Hill is a truly wonderful place to spend the day. The stroll around castle hill feels like a walk back in time, where practically every house has a plaque indicating the century in which it built and the associated history.The best option is to walk along the cobblestone streets and discover Castle Hill at your own pace. Take your time, as there is a lot to see and do, and exploring Castle Hill will need time. If you don’t have much time, visit Trinity Square, Matthias Church (Mátyás templom) and Fishermen’s Bastion. Beautiful views of the Danube and attractions on the other bank in Pest are seen from here and I would definitely recommend staying for the amazing night views. Soft golden lights will light up on both sides of the river including the parliament. A truly breathtaking view NOT to be missed.

Something extraordinary . We came to visit this castle hill and we were amazed! You can walk and walk around it or just visit some museum inside of it. This is rlly nice tourist sightseeing place. Go and visit. :)
A highlight of our trip. I loved wandering around this area.. from the museums, to the views to the optional archery on grounds. So awesome!! Don't forget to find Draculas layer!

A History Buff's Paradise!. The Castle District of Buda is dream come true for a history lover. No wonder it is a UNESCO World Heritage site. The area is over flowing with historical monuments. The district it self is located on a limestone hill overlooking the Danube. It is composed of two sections the Old Town, which was for the commoners, and the Royal Section, which was for the monarchy. The must see buildings of this district are the Royal Palace, the Matyas Church and the beautiful Fisherman's Bastion. The view of Pest from this district is truly awesome.Tip: If you cannot climb all the steep steps you can take the funicular train up the hill.

The Castle Hill rocks ! (literally). We went there during the night and there was a concert taking place there from a Hungarian rock band. The building itself was beautiful and an overall fun atmosphere. I highly recommend you to visit !
Good views. Good views and some interesting buildings and sights. An easy 10 minute walk if you don't fancy paying what seems like a huge amount for a minute in the funicular.

An absolute must visit. The entire area is immaculate. Was not able to visit the Castle due to some timing issues. Loved just walking around and enjoying the area. Fabulous views over the river to Pest. There are also a multitude of vendors who were so much fun to talk to.

Beautiful at night.. This is one of the first buildings I noticed when we arrived - huge beautiful castle which is all lit up at night. We didn't go inside but walked all around and there are some wonderful monuments and statues, plus the views are fantastic.

Beautiful buildings and great views of Budapest. Well worth either walking up to the top or taking the furnicular. Amazing views, lots of sites churches and museums and you could easily spend a whole day.

Best city virw. The Royal Hill is named so because of the Royal Palace, which now serves as The Hungarian National Gallery of fine arts. This place is popular both among locals and tourists, who love nature, architecture and arts.
Remarkable!. Who visits Budapest should definitely have a look around the capital's historic castle. Beautiful apartments, nice people, remarkabel view of the city. Don't miss out!
Great to walk . Nice fresh place to walk around with great views. There are lots of statues and monuments to see and it's nice to be able to wander around freely
