Stunnig. Impossible to miss the beautiful building which is stunning in the day, but even more incredible when its all light up at night. We didn't go in, we walked around after visiting fisherman's bastion, but it is definitely a must to see the beautiful architecture while in the city.

Forget the funicular. Unless you really, really want to ride the funicular (with tickets separate from the Budapest transit tickets), take Bus 16 from Deák Ferenc tér. And don't limit your visit to Buda Castle and Fisherman's Bastion, be sure to stroll the streets to Maria Magdalene Tower, the National Archives and the interesting period houses along the narrow streets.
Beautiful and Historic. This is a definite must to visit! It has great views of the city and river. I definitely enjoyed this the most during my stay in Budapest! You won't be disappointed!
Lovely place . I love here very much and went once in day time and one at night time. Buildings was nice with historical design. Very good place to have bird view of the city from here!

Family celebration.. Lovely tide up and down in the funicular railway - we walked around, had a go at the archery stall' good fun. And most of all admired the wonderful views of Budapest. A very enjoyable afternoon.

Beautiful with wonderful views.. This whole area is full of surprises whichever way you turn. The area's history dates back to the 13th century and has now been classified as a World Heritage Site, which it thoroughly deserves. Avoid going on Monday as the museums are closed. There are also some good wine tasting venues in this area.

Beautiful and nice walk. It's a nice walk the steps are not too steep so it's an easy walk. Budapest in general is so small. It was a fee to enter the museum. We chose to just walk around and enjoy the view.

Old time Castle. With a stunning view to Danube and The Parliament bulding this castle is one of the most beautiful places in Budapest. Try to have some time to combine this visit with the Fishershman Bastion and the Gellert HIll.
Beautiful views. We didn't go inside, but walked around the outside which was beautiful, great architecture. Saw changing of the guard which is done on the hour.

Magical at Night. You should first take in the view by taking the tram no 1 which runs along the Danube. Then take a bus to the top and see it close up. Finally you should do the river cruise and see it at night.

Magnificente building . One of the main things to visit in the city, a very gigantic palace, like a reggia di Caserta on the hill! Here you can enjoy a fantastic view over the other part of the city, Pest, and the Danube river! Unfortunatile I visited it during a rainy day but it worth it at the same! I Really recommend to go here and enjoy what is in the nearby :)

A Must See at Night. I can't comment on the museum or anything inside the Buda Castle, but I can comment on the exterior and the views you get from the top of Castle Hill.We went to the top of Castle Hill twice during our time in Budapest - once on the first night we were there to get great views of the city and Danube, and again during the Budapest Wine Festival, which was an experience I will always remember. There's something magical about being at Buda Castle at night, with the lights on and the lights of Budapest illuminating buildings as far as you can see. The Castle is gorgeous and has tons of great architecture, and there's a beautiful fountain you will need to see, too.Even if you just have 30 minutes, make sure you take the trip to the top of Castle Hill and take in the beauty of this majestic place.
A hill with castles. This is a place we saw on a guided bus tour and a is on the Buda side of Buda Pest. Buda and Pest are two different parts of Budapest.

Great view point of Budapest . We spent a very wet day on Castle Hill so certainly didn't get to enjoy it in all its glory. However it is a lovely place to look out on the city and there are museums and galleries and churches which means there is something for everyone. Travelling with teenagers we decided to enjoy the view and do one thing. They opted for Hospital in the Rock which is a museum outlining the history of a subterranean hospital hewn out of the rock in Castle Hill and the role it played in WW2, the uprising in the 50's , and the Cold War.

Mesmerising beauty. I strolled up this hill in the evening when the the sun was down and Budapest comes to life. The lighting on the structures are mesmerising and highly recommend viewing the structures up close. You can choose to pay 1,200huf to take the tram up the hil or u can walk up the hill in 5-10mins. It's great to look out at The Pest side of the city from atop the hill.

Beautiful views, underwhelming attractions. Ok so you have to go to Castle Hill if you are visiting Budapest. But set your expectations lower if you have visited other European Capitols like Athens, Vienna, Rome, etc. These monuments and building are just not to that level. Good weather is a must for this visit as you are exposed on top of the hill. The best part is that its basically free unless you take the venicular up the hill.

Excelent Castle and museum. Very impressive building and the museum inside has just been renovated. There are 2 entrances to the museum and it's best to use the lower entrance. By using this entrance you start in the foundations and work your way up floor by floor through history.
Nice place with a view . Great views of the river from here and the Buda side of the city too. Well worth walking around as their are many different photo opportunities around castle hill.

Plan to spend a day here!. Castle Hill really describes the whole of this particular area of Buda and it really is a good day of wandering and exploring, just to look at all of the architecture, sites, and to take time to admire the stunning views. We had a Budacard so decided to make the most of our free bus travel - we came up the hill via the No 16 bus from the Parliament building (near our hotel) which drops you right in the centre of the main square. Just wandering around with a guidebook is a great way to spend the day, as is spending time in the main sites - churches the National Gallery and Museums etc. The only disappointment was the Labyrinths which were ok but not the highlight of the day. We missed the Hospital inter Rock, which we walked past without realising it was there. If we had done that too, it would have been a pretty long, but very worthwhile day!

A beautiful stroll through history. We did not go inside to any of the exhibits, but walked around on the beautiful grounds, took in the majestic views and watched the changing of the guards. My kids loved it

Fabulous views, lovely building and an amazing art gallery. We visited castle hill area and spent a good half day in the area. The area is accessed via the Funicular railway and at the top of the Funicular is the Castle to the right and the President's residence to the left. The castle houses the National Art Gallery which in turn houses a very large collection of both national and international works of art. We paid about £2.00 entrance fee which was excellent value and the building itself is of great interest. After enjoying a well earned sit down and coffee in the Gallery,s cafe we ventured out and followed the guided walk of the area from our Marco Polo Budapest Guide. This was excellent and took us around side streets of the area to see buildings of historical interest as well as the better known attractions such as the Fisherman,s Bastion Church. The whole area is well worthy of a day looking around and there are many eateries in the area. Expect to pay more for your food and drink in this area but the prices are still good in comparison to UK prices. Beautiful views of the Danube and attractions on the other bank in Pest are seen from here and there are excellent photo opportunities. Well worth a visit.

A Day's Worth of Activities. Castle Hill provides stunning views of the city, several museums to tour, and the Hungarian President's residence. A tip to save money is to take public transportation to Dózsa György tér (tram 18, buses 5, 178) and spend 200 forint to take an elevator to the top of the castle where the national library and museums are located. Then you can walk down or take the funicular one way. (There was no line to take the funicular down, but a huge line to go up.)
Great day at the castle district. It's not a tough hike and it's worth the visit. The castle is beautiful and so are the views. A must-do!

Amazing Castle Hill!. We visited Castle Hill in late January. The weather was cloudy with light rain but we tried to maximize our trip so didn't miss the chance to visit castle. Finally we were impressed with the beauty...I think the view on Pest from there is one of the best!

Gorgeous View & Pleasant Walk. The view of the pest side and Danube from the top of the hill is breathtaking. We ended up wandering around and getting the view from multiple different places on the hill which I really recommend doing. It wasn't too crowded at 11 on a Sunday but by 1 there was a sizable crowd.

Recommended. Excellent way to walk off lunch, take the camera. Plenty of variety if you have the whole afternoon but also recommended if you have only a couple of hours to spare. Look for the Franklin Steps for the return down. Reminiscent of the steps at Montmartre but with an excellent and more remote photo opportunity to capture the Parliament building

Lots to see and do. Go early. . From cafes, amazing bakery/ ice creams, views, the castle- hidden away places to walk round. You don't have to be amongst the crowds. Get there early though to have the place to yourself. If you are able walk from the bottom. Makes it more interesting and rewarding. Some great buildings to see. Another reason to go early in summer as it gets hot. Take water. Lots of choices of eats and drinks at top.

Budapest looks like a film set. This just looks like a set from a Disney film. Amazing that it was all rebuilt and looks so fabulous. The place is easy to walk around and is quiet. The views are stunning and the architecture is varied.

Great view of Pest side is in this Buda side. If you'r looking for a great view of Pest side from the Buda side, this place is perfect. Thought it could be crowded with tourist and its aplace to enjoy the view.
Castle Hill. A great part of the city with fabulous views of the Pest side and Buda hills with easy access to many other sites like Fisherman's Bastion and Matthias Church.
History Walk. Castle is a great place to spend a day in Budapest. It offers great views of the city with some lovely architecture and lots of history

Even in the rain it is worth the visit. Unfortunately on the day we had set a sdie for sightseeing started with rain but we decided to make the most of it.We took the vernacular railway which is £5 return to the top of the hill.The castle itself strikes you immediately with its size and the imposing nature it has over the city from the Buda side overlooking Pest is just increased when up close.There are two museums that you can avail of when there, the Art and History museums. Due to time and my interest being more of history we chose the latter. Approx £4 each entry here.The museum is a labyrinth of passages and floors taking you from the medieval history of the hill, the city and the archaeological digs that helped re-discover the story of it all through to the more recent years that tell of the German occupation and then Soviet control of the country.I would say we easily spent 90 minutes in all taking in the story and exhibits and it is well worth the visit.Afterwards take a walk around the walls and get a good view of the Buda side and it is chalk and cheese from the Pest side.On a nicer day we could have walked the top of the hill to various sites and statues but alas the rain dictated that lunch was preferable and time to dry out!

Great view of the city. Breath-taking view of the city. Very quaint and charming however there were some local store owners who were not so friendly and speak little to no english. They also still do not accept EUR in most stores. Be prepared and bring or exchange to Forint before hitting the shops.
Beautiful and awesome. This is one site that you should visit during the day and at night to experience the different atmosphere.
Another fine Budapest sight. Cool looking from afar and still cool up close. Worth it just to get the view of the city over the Danube.

Impressive Structure. You can get a really good view of the city from there. I used the lift but it is not worth it. You can use the public bus to go the top. On the day I visited it was very cold and very foggy so some of the sights were blurry.

Must see attraction of Budapest. Great panorama and historical atmosphere are around you, every day of the year. It is usually crowded, but worth it. During winter you can sip hot wine with some gulyas soup, while with a warmer temperature you can taste coldHungarian specialties as well.
Stunning architecture is guaranteed!

A must do in Budapest, beautiful views. We took a walk up the Castle hill on a day strolling around the city and it was well worth the visit.It is quite a leisurely walk up the hill even though it looks quite steep as the path gradually winds its way up to the top. There is an option to get a little tram up but there was a huge queue when we visited.At the top of the hill there are fantastic views of the Danube and looking out across the city. It wasn't the best of days when we were there but it was clear enough to appreciate the view.The architecture at the top of the hill is beautiful and there is plenty to look at, especially a brilliant fountain towards the back of the complex.I can't recommend this enough. It is definitely a must do while in Budapest!

Gorgeous views!. Castle Hill is an excellent place to spend a full or half day. Views across the Danube and up Buda's hills are fantastic. There are several sights worth visiting and excellent for pedestrian sightseeing.
Castle Hill. Stunning views of the whole city from Castle Hill. Fabulous architecture and cobble stone streets. Loved it up here! A must see when visiting Busapest!

Castle Hill - The pinnacle of Budapest. Great place to walk around and have a nice view of Danube from top. The Buda Castle due to its location on higher grounds allow the tourists to have a nice view of the Danube and Chains Bridge and one can also see the Parliament building at a distance.

Romantic island over Budapest. Exploring the beautiful mostly medieval, and baroque buildings and 19th-century houses and streets can occupy an entire day. You can enjoy the beautiful landscape to the city an Buda Hills as well. There are museums, churches worth to visit. One of the most romantic places of Budapest day or night time as well.

Old Budapest at its Best!. So many of us are not aware of the history that accompanies this city and here is a great place to begin to learn. If you can, get a guided tour--the history is formidable! The views across the river are breathtaking.

One of the things you must visit. The view from the hill to the Danube are unparalleled. The are has recently been restored and on the evening we visited there were some nice activities, with a local traditional Hungarian band and fire juggling artists... Certainly worthwhile visiting if the weather is nice.

Castle Hill is Beautiful and great to Walk Around. Great place to walk and see the churches, views, shops and just stroll the balustrade. Views of Pest across the Danube are beautiful and quite a vision to remember. Best to stay in Pest however.

Beautiful area. We visited this area as part of the city tour, we would recommend you try to make your own way there as time is very limited when you go in an organised trip, there is loads to see, well worth the visit

Nice view. It was easy to reach by bus. We spent a few hours strolling around all the beautiful buildings and looking at the view over Budapest. On our back home we took a walk down the hill to the river.

Beautiful Historic Area and Views over the City. Make this a top priority if in Budapest...The Castle Bastion is beautiful with stunning views over the City. It can easily be walked up graduated steps or take the lift.

Depends on the weather. As recommended we visited Castle Hill during our holiday in Budapest. We could see that from the top of the hill the view was vast and beautiful, however, unfortunately on that particular day the weather was very foggy so we could hardly see let alone take any photos. So, although this place is very nice, do not bother to go if the visibility is not clear.

beautiful area. the best area to visit in Budapest, the castle the bastion and the district. Everything is accessible on foot. To get up to the castle district take the bus which has a very good frequency. once you are up you can explore on foot. lots of cafes and shops.
Great Views. Amazing views over the Danube and Pest. The architecture of the buildings is stunning. Well worth visiting at night also when all lit up
Wonderful architecture and a fantastic view. The view from the Castle is very impressive, and provides a stunning panoramic view across the whole city

Spend a day getting lost in history - beautiful!. I was on a whirlwind walking tour and ended up spending an entire afternoon on Castle Hill. Could easily dedicate a leisurely day to exploring this beautiful part of Buda. You can wander around the whole hill for free enjoying the buildings and the view and have a lovely time, or can pay to go inside some museums and linger a bit. Easy to walk up if you're an active person (I'd recommend it, because then you can work up an appetite for the outstanding cake at Ruszwurm - seriously, GO). I toured the Hospital in the Rock, and found it fascinating and worthwhile. Linger here and skip the citadel, imho :)
A must do - but plan your trip!. There's almost too much to do, and too much you wouldn't want to do, so plan your trip well so you're not a deer caught in headlights.
Stunning!. Walking through Budapest is a treat, especially at night when all of the buildings and bridges are lit up and sparkle in the night.
Fantastic castle hill. This is a city on its own. Lots to see both stunning views and buildings . You could spend all day up there. Beautiful
Must see when in Budapest. Must see when in Budapest. Easily to combine in half a day with some other landmarks on the Buda side. Nice but extensive museum.

Buda castle wine festival on September. Buda is beautiful and the views overlooking pest is well worth the stop. the wine festival it's astounding and the quality of the wines are absolutely excellent

First visit to Hungary. I was visiting the area with my son. Looked like the castle and surrounding area would be a good place to visit for the day we were not disappointed diffuse from around the castle were beautiful. we went into the Budapest historical Museum which was interesting not the best museum I've been to but it was OK. Admission was a little over six dollars a person. We had to take an elevator up from the north side of the hill. Unfortunately they only take on Hungarian currency. Fortunately I found somebody who took my euros in exchange and we were able to go up the elevator and down it's 200 forint each way. About $.70. Make sure you exit on the river side of the museum for a beautiful long walk overlooking the river and Pest.

Nice gardens, views and atmosphere!. Castle Hill and the Castle itself were lovely, with a slow bimble up to the top ideal before looking at the castle or walking to the Hospital in the Rock or Labyrinth. We did the walk multiple times, as there are a few different routes up to the top. Worth taking the time to stop and appreciate different views of the city as well on the way up.

A nice half day outing. The Castle is a good walk and the museums there are worth the visit. The art museum in particular is worth a visit of a couple of hours. It presents Hungarian art; very interesting.
Wonderful views. Visited on a very cold and snowy day. The snow made the fantastic views of the city even more special. A must do if you visit Budapest
splendid architecture with a view on a fantastic city. beautiful surroundings, a lot of fresh air and space, fantastic views, good commodities. It's very nice even walking up there on foot.

Lovely way to spend an evening. There's a funicular railway at the end of the szechenyi bridge. Around 1200 ft to get to the top. Takes a few mins but a cool ride. The views at the top are lovely as you can see pest on the other side. There's the museum which I didn't get a chance to go to. But wandering the grounds is lovely in itself. Especially as the buildings are lit up at night. Highly recommend.

Beautiful Palace. So much to see and wonderful views ... We took the short train ride up the hill in the front carriage for the best view and visited the fishermans bastionne, the palace and castle museum.

Fantastic. This is one of those places you would like to spend hours absorbing, but unfortunately, our itinerary was changed at the last moment and so we spent the first afternoon wandering around admiring the splendours of this magnificient complex after a long flight. But even so, is was full of awe leaving us wanting more.

Beautiful building. Well worth a visit. Can recommend the tour, didn't cost much but very interesting
Beautiful interiors. And had English speaking guidep
Definitely a must see !. I'd highly recommend going up there if you only have 1 thing to do in Budapest. Definitely made our trip special, worth the journey and the walk ;)

confusing. Hard to distinguish between the castle , gallery and museums plus not really signposted either. Nice photo opportunity however more a place to tick off your list. Didn't visit the galleries or museums in here so not sure about them. Depending on what architecture you like ... This was actually a bit drab and imposing neo-classical design.

We were threatened to be deported. . We crossed a chain with no signs or any type of 'no enter' restriction, the chain was very minuscule and could be broken with enough weight, yet we took a step over and had the little guard threaten us with deportation because we got too close to a building - castle hill is not an attraction - it's a place you get shouted by workers and you can maybe get one good photo

Must Visit Castle & the surrounding area. No visit to this area should miss out this gem which sums up Buda. The views are splendid and the overall splendour of the area is a MUST do we visited it twice once at night. The temperature difference was the only downside but hey this is why the Hilton was so inviting
Great from a distance. It's beautiful from a distance but up close a bit of a disappointment. It's not original and looks like it up close.
Give yourself plenty of time!!. There's so much to see inside of here!! Make sure you give yourself plenty of time to soak everything in and explore all the castle has to offer!
Castle Hill. the building stands proudly on the hill looking down on Budapest . it really is a majestic looking building especially at night lit up.

Beautiful at night . We stayed in a hotel that sits at the foot of castle hill. On our first day we got on the hop on hop off bus but didn't hop off just travelled the whole route to scope it out. We knew we needed to go back as the views from the top of the hill were spectacular. We decided one evening to bundle up (it was minus 10) and talk a walk up the hill. The path was well lit and wasn't half as daunting as it originally looked. You can see right over the Danube and pest from the top which looks fantastic during the day and evening more stunning at night. We didn't enter the castle as it was late and everything was closed but you can climb the steps of parts of it and take pictures/ admire the architecture. I have uploaded some pictures but please bear in mind these were taken on the standard iPhone camera and don't really do it justice.
Gorgeous castle. We spent the morning wandering around the grounds... Beautifully preserved and a must see in Budapest!!

Artist's Paradise. I must confess my ignorance of many European Artists I was unaware of until visiting 'The Castle'. Absolutely spectacular artworks from all over Europe, along with sculptures and other mediums. The grounds alone are amazing with views over all of Budapest.

Great views and great hot chocolate!. The castle area in Buda is arguably the nicest part of Budapest. The elevated views of the Danube river, parliament, and the Pest riverbank is superb. We took the hop on hop off bus up to this area and wandered around the precinct. It was very very bloody cold -10 at times! The staff at various spots were very friendly and helpful, we snuck into the Hilton Hotel and used their toilets that were warn and clean.

Great views. Great views, there is also a museum with some interesting exhibitions throughout the year. There is also a cable car thingy going up the hill if you are not interested walking up or down the hill/steps

The Castle Appears as if it were Glowing once the Sky turns Pitch Black - Absolutely Majestic. The castle resting on top of the hill is absolutely majestic. It was a magnificent and impressive structure. Once the sky turned pitch black, the castle structure appeared as if it were glowing above the Danube River.
Great Walking Tour. We did the Rick Steves walking tour to view the Royal Palace, Matthias Church and Hospital in the Rock. It was a nice walk even in the winter through the old town.

Unfortunately closed on Mondays. We went up for a wander and were going to visit the museums but they are closed on Mondays! The castle is really pretty and worth the trek up the hills. The streets around there made us think of Italy. The architecture was so different to that on the Pest side of the river
Best view of the Danube. This is a short walk from Fisherman's Bastion. We were fortunate enough to see the changing of the guard while we were there. The view of the Danube is absolutely stunning.
well worth an afternoon. Gorgeous spot with so much history! You can easily spend a full afternoon on castle hill -- make sure to walk up so you get the full experience.

The Palace and art gallery. I went on a day it was snowing and it was, although it did need some walking in the snow to get to, the perfect refuge. The collection is worth it and it is easy to get round and there is a café.

wanderfull building and panorama. A must visit for all peaple who like architecture. Looks like the france versailles. Well restored with the use off modern elements. Beautifull scenery and panorama over the donau
One of the must sees in Budapest. This Palace has a rich history and is one of the Must sees of Budapest, Great pics from across the river and very informative up close.

Beautiful View of the City. If you take the tram up the hill, you will find yourself with a breathtaking view of the city, as well as within easy walking distance of the many museums on the hilltop, and the Fisherman's Bastion. It's a must-see for your time in Budapest!

Lovely walk. Walked from the bottom of the funicular to the castle. Definitely a nice way to see it - free and great views all the way up. Lots to see around the castle, a few quaint stalls selling food and souvenirs and a fun archery/crossbow activity at the back. There is also the gallery and museum which we didn't do. Was great views and a lovely walk. I would not miss this!
great view from the hill. the Castle hill is popular for walks, you can get there on foot or by a cable car, the views are excellent over the whole Budapest, worth seeing
A must. This is just another great tourist spot in Budapest. It really provides a glimpse into the vast, rich history of the area. It's gotta be on every tourists short list.
awesome. a most incredible place, beautifully lit at night, full of history.A must visit venue for all travelers to Budapest.

Can't miss this!. Have to visit Castle Hill when in Budapest. So much to see here! Too much to take in at once. We were here on the afternoon of Christmas Eve. It was cold and foggy but still beautiful! Wear comfortable walking shoes.

Nice castle but nothing extraordinary.. Nice castle,most of it reconstructed with excellent view of Pest.I visited the castle museum which is ok with exhibitions of the castle but also exhibitions from ancient years (2nd floor) till today. I didn't visit the gallery. Don't go by teleferic. It's expensive and on foot is 4 minutes and the way is easy.

Elegant Visuals of the Past. Well worth the visit, or even the stay in this area. Beautiful historical buildings, the Castle is here, and it now house the museum of National Art while the museum at Hero's Square is under renovbation
A lovely place, lovely views. Beautiful building with lots of sights to see, lots of statues and other things to appreciate, a must see for Budapest.
Nice walk. We were lucky because the weather was sunny and we could walk around!! The view is remarkable!!! We were told that it's better to walk than to take the stairs. True!!

Excellent way to spend a day. We had the Budapest travel card which we hadn't thought of using until we accidentally stumbled across the castle... We walked up the back, and ended up in the museumWith the cards, a couple of the museums are free, and full of interesting facts about the castle and its surroundings and also the sad history of Budapest As it was sub zero out side we wondered through the castle and the museums for the afternoons, again a beautiful view of the city at night, and also a beautiful place itself at night.Worth a visit and a wonder

Fantastic views, especially in the evening. Castle hill itself is really just a historical and attractive part of Buda, surrounded by the old city walls, but there are lots of nice buildings, several museums, excellent views and nice places to eat or drink, as well as the funicular railway. Definitely worth a visit- a couple of hours with no museum trips- potentially days if you like museums!

Spent a whole day. I spent the whole day wandering around castle hill. There are many attractions in this area including the Buda Castle Palace, Matthias Church and Fisherman's Bastion. Time well spent. Gorgeous views of Budapest city
Must do!. Loads of history and charm and very photogenic, well worth the effort to walk up to, though buses are frequent anyway.
Go for the view!. Its not necessary to go inside the castle to enjoy the spectacular views of Pest from castle hill!!!
Well worth a visit. We spent a few hours here, wandering around, visiting cafes along the way. Beautiful part of the city, with lots to see.

Wonderful view of landmarks. We were lucky enough to stay in the Castle District, we got to view the city in different lights, early am, snowing, and at night. The best view is at night, but no view is bad. You can take public transportation to this site. The church is also a great photo op. Walk around and you will get different views of the city,

Worth a walk around... We visited Castle hill late in our visit and after viewing many other stunning buildings and churches, this was very average. Unfortunately the gardens were not in bloom as it was late December.
Worthwhile. The view along the Danube is best observed from this point in Budapest. The buildings at this high point of the city are a treat.
Loved it! Great way to spend the day. I walked up and took some of the best pictures I've ever taken. It was a great day. A short walk to the Fishermens Bastion and other sites.
A must to visit. In Buda this is a lovely area to wander around with shops, restaurants and stunning architecture. The Labyrinth is worth a visit while there.

MUST SEE!!!. The Royal Palace is a fantastic attraction!!Even if it is day or night you can not stop looking at it!Once you get there,you are able to have the breathtaking views of the Pest side of the city and the Danube River!Really interesting architecture on a perfect location!Don't miss to visit the Hungarian National Gallery which is housed at the Royal Palace,along with the Hungarian National Museum.

Quaint. Enjoyable walk up Castle Hill. Great views of the Danube and both sides of the city. My only criticism is some of the paths need refurbishment as many of the steps and stones have fallen into disrepair.

amazing place in the evening. From this point (the Buda side, castle hill) you have an amazing view of the river Donau and the pest part of Budapest. Also, the castle premises are an amazing site to see.

Beautiful Castle Hill with so much history that is a MUST see.. Castle Hill is absolutely stunning and filled with so many places to see. It is beautifully lit up at night which was seen from Marriott Hotel Executive Lounge outside patio. You can spend all day on the Hill and have delicious food and drink while visiting.

Don't miss it!. We spent almost 4 hours here & was well-worth it as there is a lot to see. Even though we had to wait in the queue getting the funicular up was the way to go.The views of Pest are amazing. Hungary's Parliament building looks fantastic! We topped it off with a nice meal at a restaurant @ Fisherman's Bastion.

Well worth visiting. If you plan to visit Fisherman's Bastion, then you should also visit the palace that is just a couple of minutes away from it. Best part about it, greats vistas all around, beautiful statues and fountains, a art museum nearby and you can also try archery in a small courtyard nearby. Well worth it
Fantastic!. best in summer...with the wine festival..and than evening. stunning view over Budapest to the Parliament

We visited here on our European tour last year. Great place. Leave plenty of time to see everything at Castle Hill. We were on a tour and would have loved to spend a lot more time here. There are some steps involved. Try to avoid when crowded as hard to get really good pics with so many people around
speachless. you can feel the dinasty and the monarhy around you. and the view from the castle is great. just do it through day when the sun shines and you will fell like you are in another century.
Very nice view. You will have a magnificent viewpoint from this locations. The atmosphere is also very charming. Many building were renovated recently. Must see attraction

Amazing vistas, steps were fabulous exploring.. Loved a ramble around the steps, seeing the stunning architecture. It was fun to climb up and down, though in the ice on the slopes was risky so thankful for the handrail. There wasn't too many places to sit and take it in with winter weather that I found.

Couldn't see much, thanks to David Cameron!. There were police everywhere, sirens going, helicopter overhead, we feared some terrorist attach, but it was only David Cameron visiting on his 'drum up support for my EU campaign' tour. As a result we could only visit parts of the Castle grounds, but the shops and architecture, and the views, were lovely.
great views. Very nice for a walk, great views on the chain bridge, the city center . There are bars, a museum, some statues etc...

Good photo opportunity. Best place to see or photograph the city, if you take the free walking tour, you will visit,
Even on a cloudy day the view is good, can be cold in winter so wear something warm

Fascinating. No matter what your interests are there is something to explore here! After ascending the hillside in the historically classic funicular we spent the day ambling from one museum to another. There were historic castles to explore, fine art to gaze upon, military facts, and Hungarian history presented. Had we had more time we would have returned for a second day of exploration

Extravagant !. amazing experience to walk all the way up there, we even did two walks, once at night and once during the morning: totally different outcomes in terms of how we perceived the entire site!

Worth the visit.. The Castle is well worth a visit, it is on the bus route for the city tour bus, and well worth the money for two days of travel, also can be accessed via the very good Tram network and the finicular railway.

Wasn't impressed . The castle isn't that much of a beauty, looks pretty much the same as most of the buildings in Budapest which are very beautiful but the castle itself just did not leave any impression on me. I do recommend to travel around, spent a great time with my family looking on the view of Budapest from the hight.
Beautiful view and sort of a must. Just go here. It's worth little walk! There is a little kiosk right at the castle that sells hot and cold drinks, wich is nice.
A piece of history. Climb the hill, enjoy the views of Pest and the Danube or the bridges. Turn your head and look at the impressive castle.

Another Budapest "Must". You have to go here, for the views and the history. We didn't go into any of the museums just wandered around. Not a huge amount to see without going inside but the views are worth it as is the architecture. It was a nice relaxing wander.The fountain at the rear is worth sitting opposite for a while and taking in.

Nice trek to Castle Hill worth visiting. Beware that they close at 4 and they refused us entrance at 3:30. So I cannot tell you of interior but the gardens, fountains and exteriors were alone worth the trek there. They are majestic, quiet and beautiful. There is a particular fountain with dogs in it that fascinated me (being a dog lover) See picture.

Excellent view. The castle Hill have spectacular view, nearby are some nice restaurant, you can get there by public transport or by walking through the bridge, you can see the 3D movies of Hungarian history.
Amazing location. Fantastic views across the city and great photo opportunity for pictures if the river. Easy to get to on the tour buses that are extremely reasonably priced. Well worth a visit.

Should not be missed. We intended to spend an hour in this magnificent museum, and instead spent 4 hours there, and still didn't see all of it. The displays are beautifully presented, and the descriptions are dual language (Hungarian and English).

New Year. You must visit this area. We have been before in Summer but this year we braved the freezing cold.Wonderful buildings and views over Pest from here. At night,the buildings are all floodlit and really impressive....also view them from the Pest waterfront..you cannot really miss them.
A nice walk. You will love the walk by the Buda hills. The castle and the surroundings are lovely day and night. Don't forget to visit the National Museum inside the Castle.

Amazing view of the Pest side . It gives you an amazing view of the Pest side. I really enjoyed walking around. The uphill it's totally walkable, it's an only 5 min walk uphill and the view totally worth it. Also the Buda Castle it's a really nice building.
Again, views to die for!. If you have a wander around on the Castle Hill you can see stunning buildings, views, you can find beautiful a bit overpriced shops and restaurants.
Stunning Building. Beautiful Building and views... would recommend visiting this area at night time as it is fully illuminated and looks lovley.
Never Ending Walk. Do the full walk up Castle Hill and see the castle grounds. You'll also find some of the best views of the Danube from up there!

Must do. A simple attraction that you shouldn't miss at all
very quiet area and lovely especialy at night ...

Great view and dramatic architecture!. We went here at night to see the city monuments light up and with the river as a bonus eye candy.Both the area it self and the view was absolutely stunning! So so beatiful.We were however, very dissapointed that the city turned off the lights for the monuments at 00:00. When the lights went away there was really no point in staying here.Next time I will be here earlier during the day.

Perfect!. Magnificent castle in Buda overlooking Pest. Nicea shops, cafés and restaurants nearby. Excellent view of the Danube and the promenade as well as the bridges. Fire up the camera and do not stop shooting post card level pictures!
Beautiful by day, even prettier at night. Like so many of Budapest's landmarks, Castle Hill is imposing by day but at night when lit up and reflecting off the Danube, even more impressive.
great view. It requires climbing the hill but when you get to the top you ll have a great view to other side of the city.

Amazing . Great place to go and top your culture tank up. Really enjoyed our visit to the gallery and beautiful views from the palace and grounds. Staff spoke great English. Tickets were cheap. Cloakroom free of charge which is unheard of in the eastern block countries. Awesome few hours :)

Castle Hill & Art Gallery. Very Beautiful grounds! Very foggy on the day we went up so couldn't enjoy a view of the city. We visited the impressive Art Gallery for an hour or so. Excellent collection of Hungarian art!
Beautiful. This is a lovely hill with the spectacular castle on top and all the museums and grounds around everywhere. Lots to see and do.

Travel dairies - Budapest. One of the local suggested me to see the Castle hill . It was really amazing view of Budapest from the top of castle hill. Take funicular which may cost 1200 HUF ( one side ) and walk down the hill .

Get ready for being dizzy. It's surrounded by a big area. You walk, you follow your map, the signs, other visitors- you believe that there is not something else to see and something new appears. Needs some time to explore this part of Budapest, but it really worth it.

Beautiful View. Not too bad of a hike. There is a tram you can take up but the line was ridiculous. When you are up there you can see views of the whole city plus the changing of the guards on the hour.

Hill of history and views. Lovely grand buildings, churches and cafes, not to mention some of the best city views in Europe. Even if the cable car queue is huge, it's only a 10min hike up the hill. Good idea to head up an hour or two before sunset, see Budapest by daylight, then find a small cafe for cakes, and head back out to witness a beautiful city switch on its lights.
A must in the Buda side. Very nice area. There are many attractions on the hill. Walking around and exploring the region is very nice, specially at night or in sunny days.
impressive at night when all lit up. Looks amazing at night when its all lit up...U can see it from the buda side but u can also visit it when ur on the pest side..

A guide book is essential.. This complex is simply huge. Made up of several large and stunning buildings most of which are barred to the public the exceptions being the Art Gallery and a temporary exhibition Hall. You have to buy tickets to gain entry into the cathedral. It takes hours to make a round trip on foot. While there are plenty of cafes restaurants a footsore visitor can take a break in it is still hard work. We made our visit in late December but we soon learned cold is no deterrent to crowds so I’m thinking crowds in the high season must be of nightmarish proportions. Budapest is full of marvellous architecture and while the view from the Castle across the Danube gives an outstanding perspective of Budapest across the Danube it is not tourist friendly and little signage explaining what you are looking at exists. I am not sure the rewarding views are worth the time and shoe leather.

Nightmare . To get to the castle you can buy a ticket for a train which takes you up. It was not sure where exactly this was going and if it could use Budapest card. The lady at the cash desk was the rudest person ever. Never again. The castle itself is magnificent but that experience day.

Cool Place to Walk Around. We took the steps up the hill because there was a long line for the little railway that takes you up. It is not a climb for those that are very out of shape, but I can't say it was a hard hill to get up. This is a very touristy area, so the prices in the area are a bit high. The views are spectacular and allow a nice view of both the Buda and Pest sides of the city. It is free to just walk around, but if you are looking for ways to spend money there is plenty to do even on a rainy day. Among other things, there was an archery demonstration and you could pay a couple euro to shoot various crossbows/ bows. I spent about 20 minutes walking around and doing the touristy thing before continuing my trek to Fisherman's Grotto

Amazing views from Buda overlooking Pest. We walked over the Chain Bridge from Buda and rather than waiting in line with at least 200 people for the Funicular, we took the steps. There are about 186 steps (my wife counted as we climbed them) from the bottom to the top but there are stretches of pathways with no steps so you can take a breather. The entire climb took us all about 20 minutes in total. We didn't actually go in the Castle but managed to spend over an hour walking around taking some stunning photos of the views over the Danube. The views are amazing and it is well worth the walk up to see them. Even better, its free!!

Scenic and relaxing . Took the funicular for £3 each. Worth it. Turn right once you get put and goto opposite side to get great views of Buda. Near the top corner there is a cage on the corner - cakes are fab. Carry on walking up the street to the church. The cloister walls offer amazing views across the Danube to Pest. At 3pm ish the sun setting on the parliament building is exquisite. Great photo opportunities all round. We walked down the hill and along to the green bridge for am amazing chill out at Gellert Spa.
A must. Your not in budapest tull you've been to the castle district.The view from up there is absolutely wonderful, the whole place is filled with amazing architecture and interesting museums

Must see place in Budapest. It's must to go to this place to complete your trip to Budapest :-).. Nice buildings, lots of places to visit within the surroundings (Budapest History Museum, Hungarian National Art Gallery..)It's beautiful during night when fully illuminated..Can be reached by Funicular or Public Transport (Bus No. 16, 105)

You have not truly visited Budapest without a walk,a bus or the fernicular railway to the Castle District... I am a Brit and live below the Castle district..Whether it is illuminated as it is now at 10 p.m. or in the daytime it is spectacular..The Mathias Church is one of the jewels but one of many.The caves, The Fishermans wharf,or just the incredible view accross the city..Museums are in abundance and just walking through the streets and sampling a coffee ,lunch or dinner is one of the experiences of so many experiences in the city..The fernicular railway is a popular means of transport but the No 16 bus that travels from Deak Square will take you over the Chain Bridge and then up and through the castle district..You can alight at Mathias Church or if you are short on time just sit and the bus will return to Deak Square.Whichever way you decide you will enjoy I guarantee..Each night as I walk my dog I look up at this wonderful sight...

beautiful night and day. the photos at night are all bathed in golden light and by day the buildings are beautiful also - try to get the whole building into the photo - there was fireworks for Christmas the night we were there
Great. I recommend it, especially when it is illuminated at night. The beautiful building is worth seeing, and photos. Neat, clean surroundings and building guards.

Second Visit. This was my second visit to Castle Hill (the previous one being in 2003) and I enjoyed it every bit as much as in 2003. The view from the area is stunning. My one bit of advice is keep away from the guy with the bead and the three little plastic cups as you will not win from him. I saw many tourists losing large sums of money to him and the only ones winning are in partnership with him.

Beautiful place, spectacular view. The castle hill can be reached once you cross the Chain Bridge and then you can either walk to the top (if the weather is on your side) or via the cable car which costs approximately 5 Euros for a return ticket. The hill itself offers a spectacular view of both Budapest and the Danube river and I would highly recommend it for anyone visiting Budapest for the first time. On the hill you have access to the palace which now houses the National Gallery, the Fisherman's Bastion and Matthias church amongst others.Once you are on the hill you can capture amazing photos, stop for a cup of hot chocolate or coffee and wander around the small souvenir stands. I believe it's one of the "must" things to do while in Budapest

The major sight in Budapest. With the museums, churches and vantage points, you can easily spend a couple of days on the hill. The musts are the Matthias Church and the Fisherman's Bastion. However, if you want to learn more about local history and culture a visit to the National Gallery and the History museum can be very rewarding.

A beautiful and fulfilling area.. Can be reached via the Chain Bridge or the funicular railway, or by the Big Bus tours or local 16 bus. A must for any tourist. Spectacular views. Fantastic architecture, lovely walks, great market shopping and reasonably priced restaurants and bars. Just perfect.

Too much to see!. It's worth allocating a whole day for Castle Hill as there is so much to see. The main attraction is the National Gallery which maybe needs to be done in two bigots. The other buildings and the fishermans' bastion are worth seeing and the views across the river are splendid.

Grand tour and beauty. The Castle Hill is iconic scenery of Budapest. It looks so grand and great no matter it's during the day or under the moon light. The boat trip will take you round the building in the front to take good pictures, only the micro phone quality of the introduction was really poor and the explanations are of such mono tones- it drove us into deep sleep twice!Take tram number 2 to go and visit Castle Hill... the views there is another treat!

Beautiful with nice views. This castle is lovely, and sits massively on top of Castle Hill so you can't miss it from anywhere. If you go up to the Castle you can go on the grounds and see the views of Pest from there. The actual castle itself is now a museum that showcases art from Hungarian artists and sculptors. I'm not a big museum person but I went anyway and I liked some of the stuff there such as the gothic style church altars.
Amazing view!. The castle hill is amazing! It is big and beautiful. The caslte up is also beautiful. You can do diffrent things like shooting with bow,... It is amazing!
Nice view. You can see most of Budapest on the hill. and you can see the Parliament, Chain Bridge etc clearly, if you are lucky enough and go there on a sunny day.

Enjoyed walking the area. We really enjoyed walking this area. It seemed on ever turn there was more to explore. The views of the city is amazing. Every hour there is a changing of the guard. The architecture is beautiful. This area is a must see. We did not view the museums.
Spectular View. It is one of the best river views in the world , the buildings are specular , lots of side streets behind to enjoy coffee cake and ice cream
Beautiful. Can get right up close to the building, very impressive. Looks lovely at night. Good for taking lots of touristy photos!
Must See. You can see this when you go to the Fisherman's Basilica. You can go by tour coach or be tough and walk it...we did!
Tough walk. This is a tough walk but most able bodied people should be able to do it. Once at the top you will be rewarded with some wonderful views of Pest
Must see. Everyone must visit the Castle Hill area, it is easy on the hop on hop off bus but you see so much more by walking. Well worth the steps and hills

Lots to admire. Huge grounds, palatial buildings and lovely sculptures to admire. Often rented out for exhibitions and fairs makes it difficult to enter many areas of Castle Hill.The large statue of the mythical bird Turul is a landmark. The gardens are also beautiful.

Scenic views. The castle of Castle Hill is a lovely structure, and it's museum is very interesting. The view from Castle Hill is fantastic, looking down to the Danube and across to the newer Pest of Budapest. No visit to Budapest would be complete without a stop on Castle Hill.

Lots to enjoy. We were told by the receptionist at our hotel that Castle Hill was very difficult to get to with a change on the metro and 2 changes on the tram! After a bit of research we discovered we just had to hop on either No 4 or No 6 tram to the end of the line, which is quite close to the Vienna Gate - just a short walk up a hill. There's lots to see inside the castle district, and there's choice of cafes and restaurants and shops. The painted walls and ceilings of St Matthias Church are amazing, for me one of the best things to see in the castle district. It was bitterly cold (1C) the day we visited and so felt the need to dive into places to warm up. We had a delicious pumpkin soup at a small cafe in the area and spent time looking at the local handicrafts in some of the shops. The Hungarian National Gallery is located at the far end of the castle district and is definitely worth a visit. I was not at all familiar with Hungarian artists before my visit to Budapest but was really impressed with the paintings and sculptures on display at the gallery. There is also a small collection of French Impressionist paintings there which I hadn't seen on exhibition before.
Interesting. It's a village within itself. There's a lot of little cafe's and restaurants alongside the tourist attractions. The Labyrinth and the Hospital in the Rock is worth a visit.

Impressive Site. This is an absolute must see site. You can easily spend an entire date exploring the castle and it's surroundings, not to mention take some awesome pictures. If you are traveling with a "selfie" individual, you are in serious trouble!! It tends to get crowded, but, there are plenty of places to explore that will take you away from the masses. The architecture is out of this world!! We traveled by motor coach to the top and then walked back across the river, which is all down hill. You would probably be quite sweaty climbing up in the heat of the summer.

Any weather! . We went on an early low light wintery morning and were amazed. Lovely bit of architecture with some amazing views back over the Danube and Pest. A great mix of authentic, old and new materials and styles. Lots to do culturally in the area too.

Worth of visiting/ Stojí za to vidět!. As this sight was reconstructed in 2014, it is in great condition and the access to the cactle is modernized. You can either walk there (I'd recommend this option), use stairs or an escalator which is located on the left side of the building. There is also national gallery which you can find upstairs. Enjoy!Díky rekonstrukci roku 2014 je památka ve skvělém stavu, modernizován je také přístup k budově. Buď můžete jít pěšky (tuhle variantu doporučuji), použít schody a nebo také jezdící schody, které jsou trochu skryté na levé straně budovy. Nahoře se nachází mimo jiné také národní galerie.
worth a visit. Great set of buildings on this hill with fabulous views if you walk back go via the vanicular to go over the bridge and back to city

Imposing. Beautiful , yet again another fabulous historical attraction steeped in history where we where delighted to experience the changing of theThe Guards at The Royal Palace , this was a band of Soldiers playing drum roll and marching with guns , it was a great sight to see.

Spectacular Architecture and Views. What can I say here then what has not already been said. It is a must-see attraction. If you are in Budapest just walk on the bridge and go enjoy Castle Hill and the neighborhood behind it. We had a very good time. Excellent pictures as well.

Fascinating views and castle.. Castle hill is a really - easy to reach - fascinating place to get a nice view of Budapest. Next to that the castle and its history itself is impressive to see. Be sure it is opened before starting the 'climb', because the castle can be closed on mondays and some public holidays.

Worth the effort. Went via the funicular railway, go early if you don't like queues. The palace has wonderful architecture and contains some wonderful museums which are free entry and try & catch the change of the guard

Beautiful Budapest. One can see the best way the Castle Hill from the another side of the Danube.Then you can walk thorough the Lánchíd to Buda,then to throll up the Budai vár-Castle Hill.And to watch Pest and the beautiful Parlament.

Walking on the crown of a disappeared empire. During the day so majestic, during the night so magic.. Outside so huge, inside so sumptous.. A castle for no kings or emperor, full of history. And a great spot on the city/cities of Buda and Pest

Castle Hill a site with a great view. Combine a trip to Castle Hill with a trip on the funicular railway to access the site. Nice to explore the site and take in the views across the city and the river Danube

step ahoy. we visited the castle in buda and bought a one way ticket,,,the view from the top is amazing, great photo oppertunity,picked up a few sovineers and came down the steps,, not a good idea there are loads of steps in really bad repair my wife nearly broke her ankle ,so please guys buy a return ticket,,,well worth it,,enjoy

The Most Beautiful Part of Budapest. This area, with it's cobbled streets and small alleys takes one back to a time long past when there were no autos and life in cities was busting with people walking the streets and conversing with neighbors, doing business outdoors in markets, and young children freely playing in the streets without the concern of crime or dangerous drivers.This area is a must see in Budapest. It is also the quietest and nicest area to stay in as far as hotels go. The other side of the river is busier and more bustling, but if you want to do business in a quiet very high class environment, this is the best area. The same holds true for any family trip to Budapest. This is the area to stay. It may cost a bit more for food, but generally speaking, things there are 1/2-1/3 the cost of a city in the USA, Germany, or the UK.Loved it!
Must see in Budapest. Architecture is impressive and full of history. Art is everywhere. No entrance fee. Experience the old times once you see it from the outside and explore it inside.

It is a hike but worth every step . We were walking about and had no idea what to expect- breath taking - even the spooky stairs - the outdoor music and just the feel of the whole experience. We stayed far longer than we intended and had no idea what we were heading towards - a must see!!
Excellent. Castle Hill was the former Palace good views of the City and well worth a visit easily acessable via the Venicular

On top of the world!. Once you complete the moderate walk up to the top of Buda Castle the view is just magnificent. It over looks the whole of Pest. Make sure to walk around, there is a fair amount of pretty spots to explore around the top of the castle.
Beautiful and great views. I loved the castle - huge with lots to see and do, and places to eat, as well as just an enjoyable walk. Really recommend if in Budapest.

Good views . Some excellent views across to Pest. A few shops but nothing exciting. The museums, church and ramparts are the only real tourist bits. Otherwise the Hilton hotel is worth seeing.. as a massive eyesore. Someone must had signed a very large cheque.. You can't miss it.. supprise it's not on the tourist maps.

Big structure, perfect views. I visited this castle and its court/garden in the evening. Amazing views of Budapest, the garden is very big, and there are many expositions inside the castle. No need to pay for the funicular to go uphill, there is a conveyor-belt at the left side of the castle. Also care should be taken when walking the outside during the night, there are several obstacles closing stairs, doors steps etc. and they ar not visible as the lights are dim. Spare at least 1 hour only for the exterior walk and viewing Budapest.

Impressive. There are a number of impressive buildings to see here including the Buda castle, Saint Stephens church and some walkable battlements overlooking the Danube.Many cafes and tourist shops and a Hilton hotel.
The Views. One of the best set of historic monuments and unbeatable views of both the Buda side and the Pest side of the river. A great place to see first when exploring Budapest

Amazing area. This is a spectacular area of Buda. There are incredible views from every side of the hill. The buildings are all impeccable, the area is quiet. The walk around the outside of castle hill on the backside is also incredible. The old city walls are impressive and the neighbourhood surrounding it is beautiful. The 19 tram from Liberty bridge will take you to the backside perfect for an evening or early morning walk.

For some of the Best Views in Budapest. You can go here many times and always see something new. Make sure to check out the side streets and look at all the details in the architecture. The back side of castle hill (non-river side) also makes a nice, "less touristy" walk. Castle Hill is nice at night too with all of the lights on.
Nice spot!. Beautiful Place to see the entire city and the river separating Buda and Pest! Better to take a tour... It usually lasts 2-3 hours.
Amazing at night. It's amazing at night. And in December there is no people. You can walk alone and feel great atmosphere of this place. Must visit.

Nice location, nice view, what a history!. Not to be missed, when on a vacation in Budapest. The Castle district is a must. The Matthias Church is nearby, and Halasbastya as well. Need to see. And the view... amazing.

Well worth the time. Stunning views of the city, lots of things to see. The museums are fabulous and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The sikla will save you climbing the hill but costs 1200 each ride.

Wow. I am not sure if the view of castle hill is nicer from pest side or the view of pest from castle hill is nicer :) so much history and beauty it was really an amazing walk and experience.. The only disappointment we had was the fact that the castle's interior is not maintained and was destroyed...
Another Grand Budapest building. Just another grand building that is one of many in Budapest. Worth going to see if you are into architecture.

You feel the history on your skin. Beautiful buildings, all very well preserved, although there are some places where you can see bulletprints on the wall, maybe they are from the WWII.
Beautiful place to visit

Wonderful Historic Area. A really amazing place to walk around and explore. Up on Castle Hill you can see many different attractions in Budapest, and it features pretty amazing views of the river and the city.

The real view of Budapest. The castle looks great at night as it is perfectly illuminated. It isn't so beautiful in a day light but everyone who wants to see what Budapest really likes must go up the castle hill. You can see beautiful old town from above but you'll also have a possibility to see all the ugly things Budapest owes to comunism. In the casltle there's a shop where you can buy interesting things.
Another good place to visit. Castle Hill is a must on your Budapest visit. We only allowed a morning which really isn't long enough. Very interesting place with good views of the city.
Great Building and Arhitect. Great Building and Arhitect, best view from the pest side of the town, from the river side, I 've liked budapest very much.

Great Views across the City of Pest. You can see quite a long way from the hill, across the Danube to the Pest side of Budapest and on a clear day the chance of a good photo opportunity should not be one that you should miss whilst in this city
Easy to reach by local bus transportation that goes directly up the hill
Recommended
Enjoy
Beautiful views: up & down. Castle Hill is one of those "must see" locations when visiting Budapest. High above the city it is as beautiful to look at as the panorama from the castle looking back.
Spectacular place and views across the city. This is a must see place and you can easily spend the whole day up here, so much to see and beautiful buildings to look at, highly recommended to visit

Spend the day here, lots to see and do. Take the 'cliff lift' railway up to the Castle for some great views of the city as you rise up. Breathtaking views of the city, including both directions along the river from the grounds around the Art Gallery. Gallery is fantastic, with predominance of work from this part of Europe rather than styles you would see or are familiar with in Western Europe. There's also a wonderful, stylish, old town alongside the Royal Palace buildings, somewhat dominated by tourist focused shops. Plenty of choices for food here. Our choice was a very high standard for a modest cost.
Great view of city from the castle. This place will take up almost half your day so plan accordingly and don't miss exploring any corners of this castle.
Stunning.. Stunning attraction with so much to see and do here.Great photo opportunities and great for all the family.A place not to be missed.

Simply breath-taking. I might be just a tad biased so I'm basing my opinion on other visitor's unbiased opinions. It's a must-see, that's all. I couldn't get tired of it in over 10 year, and I've become an immigrant in this country partly because of this sight. (Even though my name is Hungarian, I wasn't born here, and I actually gave up my lifestyle and residence in Los Angeles to live here.)
Nice. It is Picturesque and has wonderful views well worth a visit take the hop on hop off giraffe open top bus

Worth to visit. this place is worth to visit, you can go by bus no 16 or walking. we decided to walk cross the bridge because the view surrounding is amazing. if you do not climb, try to have lift ride - you need to pay but it is a great experience.the view from the hill is great... so if you do not have much time to spend time in Budapest, this is will be the first one in the list.
A Quiet Part of Budapest. A UNESCO World Heritage Site that is a must if you are in Budapest. On the Buda side of the city away from the hustle and bustle of Pest
Very nice indeed!!. Beautiful place indeed!!! Extremely well preserved old city, nice walking around, great views of the city, packed with cafes, restaurants and small shops.
Historical, great views. To get the full experience, it's great to walk the trail up (on a nice day) and then walk the grounds and over to Old Town and then back down towards the river.
Overlooking Pest. Nice view from the "hill" of the Danube and the Pest side of Budapest. But there were a lot of people there on a Saturday - huge crowds. The changing of the guard was nice.
So much to see on the hill. You need to make at least a day of sightseeing on Castle Hill on the Buda side. Fisherman's Bastion, St. Matthias, the museums. etc

Nice view but Long walks . When we arrived via walking over the Chain bridge, the funicular unfortunately broke down, hence we had to climb the stairs all the way to reach the top. It was quite tiring but you get to admire the scenery on the way up. You should visit this place before sunset so you can soak in the amazing views!

Lovely place. Definitely worth a visit especially for the scenery. The cable car is not free. I would suggest getting a single trip so you can get the bus down on the other side of the castle otherwise it's a long walk back to catch return cable car.

Castle Hill a Must. Whether you come day or night this is where you must come during your visit. You can easily spend a half or full day here seeing all the sights. From Mathias Church to the National Gallery and History Museum there's so much to do. Lots of small quaint restaurants abound. It is quite a walk up from the Danube. However there is a funicular that is highly recommended. There are so many stairs and steps that there are too many to count. Take the ride!
Tourist. expensive funicular ride to castle district. Once at the top the castle is now a museum. No evidence of palaces glory remains though. Good museum and fab views

Gorgeous Architecture!. This is a must see! Gorgeous architecture of Buda Castle Matthias Church and Fisherman's Bastions. Amazing photo opportunity! Buda Castel was not open on the day we were there but we did see changing of the guard and walked around the compound. Really quite beautiful! The architecture is gorgeous to see, especially at night when all lit up. We had the good fortune to have stayed in the Sofitel Hotel in Pest, directly accross from the Castle. Talk about a million dollar view! Fisherman's Bastion another must see attraction. It is a terrace where you will be able to take amazing pictures of Parliamen, the Danube, St Stephens, the Chain Bridge, etc...St Matthias Church's Gothic architecture is simply gorgeous! Built in the 14th century and largely renovated between 1950 to 1970. We did not visit the art musuem within so I cannot comment on that.Buda Castle was closed the day we visited Castle Hill, however we did see a changing of the guard and walked the grounds which we thoroughly enjoyed. Fisherman's Bastion, a gorgeous terrace offered amazing vistas for photo opportunities including St Stephens Basilica, the Danube, Parliament , the Chain Bridge etc....Matthias Church's architecture is most beautiful!!!! Castle Hill is definitely a must see!! Highly recommend a nearby restaurant, Edeni Vegen Etterem.
Great views. Just a quick visit to Castle Hill gave a great experience and opportunity to see the great views of Budapest

Excellent view of the city ( go in nice weather!). The castle is fairly easily reached by foot if the queues for the cable car are too long (not recommended if you have mobility issues however). Great views of the city and river above, well worth the effort!
Fantastic view. Don't need to say more ...At 4pm, the sky already gets dark. The view of Buda is splendid. You can see the Chain Bridge and the Parliament very well.
Wonderful. The Castle was Wonderful!We did not know if We can visit it.When you are at the Castle, you can see all the city pest!You van take the funicular to go up or go down! I think it was 1200f.

Nice at Night. We chose to take the cable car up the hill one night. The nighttime views of Budapest and the Danube after dark were spectacular. It was a bit nippy at the top, but never fear - a vendor was selling hot wine.

Passing through Budapest. On our way to Prague we stay for one night in Budapest. In the morning when we wake up we enjoy a sunny day for visiting the Castel hill.Do not miss a walk on this domain: you will find more about history of Hungary.

Very beautiful. Once you go upthere, you can see Castle hill, St. stephen's basilica and Fisherman's bastion.tip: take the metro to Szell Kalman ter. from there get the 16 or 16A bus. it stops right outside of this!!! don't use the funicular to go upthere. Maybe it looks fantastic but it costs a lot for this small ride..
Perfect landscape. The place worth visiting as landscape is perfect, you can take beautiful photos here. I would recommend going from top to bottom as it is much easier.

Atop the mountain . I went here on a tour while on a Viking River Cruise. The whole area was really great. Beyond the fabulous castle, the shopping in the area was also lots of fun. The prices here for Hungarian paprika was pretty.

Peak of Hungary. Be prepared to climb a steep hill, failing that you can get a cable car or a taxi, get to the top and you will have the most amazing view of Budapest, worth the visit and you can get a nice hot drink when you get to the top.

Pick the right day for it. We had to go here on a super cold, snowy and windy day. It was not a pleasant experience since the main attraction is just strolling around outdoors. We thought there would be a main castle to enter, like Versailles, but it's used for different museum activities and doesn't necessarily look like a castle inside. There are plenty of things to do but If you end up on the hill on a bad day like we did, check beforehand what indoor activities are available there, like museums, cafés, churches etc so you don't end up walking around aimlessly too long.

What a view!. We were in Budapest for 2 days in late October and happened to have amazing weather. Make sure you walk across the Chain Bridge and take the Buda Hill Funicular up to the top just for fun. You could spend a day at least going through the museums and the town at the top. We didn't hit any of the museums but walked from one point to the other in the morning. The view are great. Make sure you get up there as early as you can manage to avoid the crowds. The Fisherman's Bastion was packed even by 10 AM in late October.

fantastic views. It is a great walk up to the Castle although you can use the lift to make it easier.The best views can be had of the Danube, Parliament buildings and many other places from the castle.It was closed to go inside but you can visit.The Cafe has lovely hot Chocolate and cakes.So cheap!Make the effort , it's worth it.

A great place to stay and visit. I would highly recommend Castle Hill as a place to stay and visit, not just visit. There is so much to see and do here that the average day visitor will either miss or not enjoy that it is sad not to stay here. Especially when you get to enjoy the views and lighted up buildings (including those across the Danube) with little crowding that occurs during the day. There are a number of lovely hotels to stay at (including the St George where I stayed) that are also reasonable. There is a small grocery store and many restaurants as well as all the museums and historical buildings to enjoy. Right at the Fisherman's Bastion is a coffee house which has the most amazing views. Stopping there for a drink is a must. I stayed two nights and wish I had stayed longer. Originally I was going to stay on the Pest side but am so glad I changed my mind. If you are the type of traveler who likes to absorb and enjoy rather than see and flee, then stay on the Buda side on Castle Hill.

Great Views!. Well worth the hike up the hill, for you will be greeted with some incredible views of Budapest, you can either take the funicular to the right side of the hill or take a walk whichever way you like! Some historic monuments are littered everywhere on this hill.

Must see!. The view from here is spectacular and the statues are very impressive. There are large pictures of the bridge in history, from when the nazis bombed it to block the Russians from entering the castle to the modern day rebuild. The history here is so unique and any chance you can get a bird's eye view of the city you absolutely must. Beautiful!

A beautiful area to walk around. We spent a lot of time walking around the extensive castle area, went to the museum, watched the changing of the guard and saw where they are still digging to discover more about the castle's history. There are a lot of steps, but the funicular is a fun way to get there and back from the River

Amazing. As we did not find any parking space outside, we parked the car in the garage and as we wanted to get out we came to the something looking like a dungeon - new doors and brick walls with stairs going nowhere. Then finally doors to the outside. We went up the stairs and walked around the castle and everywhere you looked, something new or old or amazing to see. New vs. modern (old stairs and electric and lifts and galleries and oh so much more). You could be there all day but still find something, it never ends. Really must see.

Great view of Budapest. Great view of Budapest! You can purchase a one way ticket or return ticket up a trolley but the walk wasn't long at all and there are elevators and shortcuts along the way. Great to go back during the night as well.

Don't miss this amazing landmark. It's true what everyone says; this place is beautiful at night and the views of Pest at night are a treat too. I also came here during the day and the viewpoints looking over the Pest side are just stunning. I spent about an hour just roaming around the grounds as the gallery I wanted to see was closed for renovations, however I have heard that the art gallery is a must see if you can. You can easily walk to Fisherman's Bastion from here in 10 mins.
Must see in Budapest. A compact but charming old town. Wandering the narrow old streets is a pleasant escape from the hustle of the city.
Beautiful views. Many interesting things to see on Castle Hill. Walk up or take the funicular to the castle, art gallery, Mathias Church, shopping and more. Great city views

Very interesting, must see hill . Great atmosphere, the castle itself is impressive. Take a walk on the hill and enjoy the view and statues around. Don't miss the Hungarian art museum it is worth spending some time inside.
GREAT ART GALLERY. We walked around Castle Hill in the Buda (hilly) area. Great views can be had from Castle Hill. This is now an Art Gallery

night lights. The poorer Eastern European countries show most beautifully at night when the dismal old buildings and streets in disrepair do not show. We took a night bus tour of the capital and enjoyed the beauty of the famous buildings with lights on them. The area was very safe and pro-American, we felt. We never felt ill at ease.

Lots to do and amazing views of Pest. Many attractions, restaurants and shops. Fun to take the funicular up from the chain bridge and explore the National Museum, Mathias Church, watch the changing of the guards and have a great lunch at Cafe Peirrot - worth a full day at least
amazing views. So at night this place just looks amazing but in the day its amazing too. If you go around 12 you can see the change of guard , amazing as well. Def a must see

Awesome view from the top. More than its historical value, the hike to the Castle Hill or the ride through Funicular to reach the peak, will provide you the awesome view of the city....the magnificent Danube River, the significant buildings that line the shores, the bridges, the houses on the slopes, and the cool wind that will swift your hair away from your face.
Awesome. Right infront of the chain bridge. Simply loved the place. Back part is more beautiful. Dont forget to drop a visit in night.

Amazing view and lovely architecture . I would highly recommend a visit to Castle Hill where you can enjoy an amazing view of the River Danube and Budapest, as well as admire the wonderful architecture of the buildings and statues. There are also nice little cafes to stop and have a coffee, although prices are a little higher than the city centre.
Definitely worth exploring. This area of the city is the center of the old town with interesting museums, palaces and the church as well as beautiful views of the city.

Amazing View from this beautiful location.. TThis was one of our stops on our bus tour of this majestic city that is split in two by the Danube. We could only visit this place for a just 90 minutes and could have easily spent 3-4 hours wandering through the streets and shops along their cobblestone streets. The shopping is worthwhile, prices are reasonable. Try to get there sometime before sunset and enjoy the view as the city lights up during the evening hours.
Like a little world all of its own. Well worth a visit. We stopped off on the hop on hop off bus tour but you could quite easily spend a day here especially if the sun was shining

Of course to go up and to walk there.
