Do not take the small teleferic.walk some meters more and the steps to go up are funner very easy.some people say you will be tired and thinga like that..do not pay go up and walk.we visist 3 times 2 in the morning and ine at night and it ia fantastic area.one syggestion.first because there are not english sign outeside of the building maybe you will be confused.so ask the people.secondly please visit the hospital of the rocks(do not confused and go the the other hospital next to marrhias schurch) walk some meters away and take the elevator to go down.fantastic....believe me..and the price is 4000ft with free base budapest card you take2800 and tou exchange there euro ft around 1euro 320ft

Steps to the Castle. Great trip for friends coming from another country. The walk up to the hill is not hard at all I prefer that to taking the bus. In the castle you can find the national gallery which is also a nice place to visit. Good to visit both daylight and night.
GREAT VIEW. This is a must easy to get too, over the Chain Bridge, its like a little city in a big city really nice streets but well worth a visit.
Very good. Try to visit with a guided tour if you want to know and understand the story of This wonderful city.

Great views. 22nd October 2015. We took the cog railway up here having crossed the Danube on the Chain Bridge. Great views of Gellert Hill; Liberty Statue, the Danube, and the Parliament Building. The buildings here are impressive, but it's the wonderful views that most people come for.

Perfectly preserved and almost restored 16th Century Town. This is a breathtaking world heritage site in a astonishing state of preservation with the houses still in occupation. If you like architecture you will love this place where even the light fittings have been preserved but converted from gas operation. I was not expecting to find this area which is not well promoted but within the castle walls to the back of the church.  Just wonderful.

Great Place - Walk up and down. The view from the castle is the best, especially on a day with good weather.
Don´t take the cablecar up, walk, it is not that far up if you´re healthy!

Hill of Lights. Plenty of buildings to explore. If you want to tour museums, allow more time. Watch the changing of the guard, tour Matthias Church, enjoy local cuisine. Take in all the architecture. Great views of Pest and the Danube.
Great. The hill is really big and beautiful. The gardens and yards in it are very nice. This is an important place to see when you are in Budapest
Nice place to go touristing. If you want to look around and look at different buildings and perhaps go in a museum or two, this is a good place to go.

Must see.. Had a great time staying in the Castle district. Walked all over the area and rode the 16 Bus back and forth to get to Pest side. It's only 450 fts for a one way ticket and takes you down to the center square for connections to all points in the city. Things do seem to close in the district at eight pm sharp. There are a few very good restaurants that are open later, but not much going on after eight. Beautiful views of the city looking over the Dandue at Sunrise.

Great Architecture, but no Interior Palatial furnishings. Castle Hill is a highlight of any visit to Budapest, but be careful to allot an entire day. There are no palatial furnishings at the castle, a la Vienna or Versailles. Instead, there is a museum. However, it closes promptly at 4pm in the winter, so to get your money's worth for the admission, enter it no later than 1pm. That means that you will have to plan to see all the other parts of Castle Hill beforehand.

A beatiful place to explore. I strolled along with no specific route in mind, just wanted to keep going up. Started at the bottom of the funicular, walked South along the river about a block and then turned right to head up the hill. Found myself walking through one beautiful space after another. Down a winding cobblestone street, up stairs into courtyards with scupltures, a garden, and eventually the entrance to the history museum. There was a really thoughtful combination of old and modern architecture and design which complemented each other.

Time for a slow walking tour. This is a wonderful walk round old, old streets, with fine architecture and atmosphere, as well as modern tourist tat. It may be taken by day or by night. Watch out for the small, and not so small things (like the polished parts of he general's horse!)
another great view of the city. i recommend visiting during sunset, you will enjoy a romantic view of the city (but probably miss the buda castle)
Must see. We walked here at the end of a walking tour. It was a great way to end the tour and explore on our own. Another interesting part of Budapest to see.

Well worth a visit. This is a great place to visit to get a good view back over the Danube toward Pest. The architecture of the buildings is something to behold. There are plenty of good places to get food and it's well worth spending the whole day here.

A full day's worth of sightseeing.. Just the Castle Hill alone will take you a day, even longer, to see. There is so much architectural beauty and history in the structures up this hill. It is also a great location to see all of Budapest from the Buda side. Take your time and see all that this hill offers. And while you're at it, try one of several very good restaurants within walking distance of the sites.

Historic Area. Fabulous historic area - lovely to walk round especially at night when everything is lit up and crowds are low. The area is very well kept and clean with lots of viewpoints over the city and river as well as several museums to visit.
The place to be at. Probably the most visited place in Budapest well deserves its reputation. Tons of mediaeval remnants and the best panorama of the Danube.

An absolute must. Castle Hill includes a number of significant place to visit. It can get fairly crowded during the day, but it's manageable. Matthias Church, Fisherman's Bastion, the Art Museum, numerous shops and restaurants, some quiet parks. We stayed nearby and had it virtually to ourselves in the evening in late October. Beautiful. Also: the #16 bus is a great way to get there; it runs, like, every 5 minutes.
go for the view. awesome in size and sizzles with the power of the old Hapsburg empire the views are outstanding and the building enormous

Gorgeous Setting for the Annual Wine Festival. Sitting high above the Danube River, on the Buda side of Budapest, sits the majestic Buda Castle. Lucky for me, the weekend I was in Budapest was also the weekend of the Budapest Wine Festival. Amazing wine plus breathtaking scenery equaled one amazing first experience in beautiful Budapest!

Beautiful part of Budapest - worth adding to the visit list. From the moment you arrive in Budapest you can't help but take in the beautiful architecture and notice the castle from a far. A prominent part of Buda's skyline, we captured great pictures from over in Pest and loved it just as much when we got up on the hill. Greeted by their own changing of the guard when we departed the vanicular we thoroughly enjoyed. The detail up close is lovely and the views back to Pest are fab. The walks along near the castle are very pleasant and relaxing. And the posh cake store not far away certainly added to our visit on castle hill. A definite place to visit whilst in Budapest.

Great views...takes a whole day. We walked over the Chain Bridge and took the fenicular up to the top of the hill (quite a pricey and underwhelming way of doing it!). The views however are really impressive, over the Pest side and the parliament building along the Danube. There is a lot to see around the castle complex including the castle museum, Hungarian national art gallery and the president's palace. You can walk along the historic Lord's Street to the fisherman's Bastion and St. Matthias church and spend a whole day vowing the various attractions. It's a bit of a walk to the nearest metro stop but it's pleasant enough to meander back through the streets down to the Danube. It's a proper 'touristy' day seeing the main sights.

When you cross the wall of the Buda and Pest.... Easily accessed the hill that shows a certain difference between the two parts of the city: Buda and Pest. There are many things to see on the hill, and what was totally charming that it is still central, but so quiet and relaxing. The atmosphere there while surfing all those nice and quiet streets is so cozy and nice. Just loved the place!

Beautiful Views. Located on top the hill adjacent to the Fisherman's Bastion, Matthais Church, Buda Castle and the National Gallery. Roman ruins are located on the top of the hill near the archery range. The streets are cobblestoned so wear good shoes. This excellent location offers great pictures over the Danube, both day and night. You can wait in line to purchase tickets for the funicular, or you can walk up the path/stairs. This will take 10 to 15 minutes and affords stops for excellent photos. Many restaurants and shops are located on the top.

Fabulous Place. This place is simply awesome, one of my favourite places in Budapest. Instead of joining the hop on hop off buses, my friend and I purchase the 24 hours pass (1650 HUF) which is cheaper and flexible. The easiest way to get here is by taking bus no. 16 (towards Szell Kalman Ter) from Deak Ferenc Ter and stops in Disz ter. Disz ter is the stop nearest to Buda Hill. Only about 2 minutes walk. Other stops require walking uphill! The whole place is huge and beautiful. You could spend half a day here. The view overlooking the city center from the Castle Hill is just superb. For those who love photography, they could come over during the evening when the Parliament across the Danube is lighted.
One of the Best views in Budapest. Historically relevant and nice views. Make sure you visit the totality of the citadel. Views from the back of the palace is also a must
Very Beautiful place. Very Beautiful place, definitely visit historical part of the castle, best view on all parts of the city

Almost a village atmosphere!. Despite all the tourists, Castle Hill has lots to offer - the Fisherman`s Bastion, St, Matthias Church, the National Gallery and some unusual museums plus the Funicular Railway. There are places to eat and a little market area (Tesco is much cheaper.. for things like paprika..) Castle Hill has a rather relaxed feel to it and you would think you were in a small town with spectacular views. The No.16 bus from the Pest side is a good way to get there

beautiful, but you should set time for it. like everything in Budapest the Buda-castle is quite impressive. we very much enjoyed our visit, took great pictures both of the castle but also of the view over the Danube and the Pest side. but we had underestimated the size of the place - it's like amini village with cobbled streets and everything. so go well prepared, with a map and a route, and ensure you have at least half a day.

Just stunning . So we stumbled across this as we met so many people walking around Budapest with wine glasses around their necks. They sent us to the wine festival up here. Great experience with some ridiculously good wines. The ice wine in particular was wonderful. I would recommend coming to Budapest just for this wine festival!

Castle Hill. There is a funicular at the bottom of Castle hill that carts tourists to Buda castle which is built on the Southern tip of Castle hill.Castle hill is a 170 Meters tall limestone plateau about 1 Km long.Walked up the small steep hill to Castle hill which houses Buda Castle .Castle hill is a UNESCO heritage site as it houses some of Budapests most important historical edifices,museums and monuments including Buda Castle.

Highlight of Budapest!. Right next to Fisherman's Bastion is Buda Castle, on the Buda side, with beautiful views overlooking the Danube river and Pest. I went to both just before sunset - it's so photogenic! The night views are very different from the day version, as it gets lit up at night. I'll be posting some of my favorite photos of it from Visit50.com
Wonderful view.. Even if you do not wish to visit Buda Castle interior, it is worthy to go to Castle Hill in order to see the view.
Wonderful. This was one of the loveliest places visited once again so much to see.We had a full day in this area .

Nice,breathtaking view to the city. I think that it is one of the best places to enjoy the magnificent panoramic view of Budapest.There are many sightseeing places too,such as the national gallery,the royal palace,,the fishermen's tower and the Matthyas church.There are many restaurants and cafés up there too.The negative point is the fact that the access to the top of the hill is a bit confusing.I think that there are 5 ways:-On foot/by stairs-By free elevators from the Taban territory-By bus-By cable car(charged 500 HUF)-By the express elevator(Gyórslift-charged 100 HUF)

A Budapest Must See. This is another attraction to visit both during the day and at night. It is a beautiful building which offers great photo ops and views of the city and river. There are rewstaurants and cafes in the area as well. If you visit here it is an easy walk to the Fisherman's Bastion as well as the church. There are Roman ruins to be seen as well.

Spectacular. Wonderful complex, supetbly iluminated. The thing about Budapest is you need to see it from all angles. From parliament, river, bridges and the various hills, and if possibble the air. Just go snd enjoy the sight, day or night.
Amazing at night!. You should climb the stairs before sunset, make some wonderful sunset pictures of the Pest-side and then enjoy they castle hill and all it's lights when it's dark.
Castle Hill. The main attraction for us on Castle Hill was the Hungarian Art collection, a lovely museum, spacious and well laid-out. Very good collection, nicely displayed.

Beautiful Castle and even better view. This is a great place to walk and enjoy the view of Budapest. Make sure you get an ice cream from the oldest cafe just near the Matthias Church. If you stay until after sunset you have a chance to view the whole of Budapest up in lights which is a very beautiful sight. The river Danube goes straight through the centre and all the bridges are lit up as well. Parliament House is stunning. From there you can walk along the banks of the river or catch a bus anywhere you need to go.

HISTORY, MISTERY, FUN, FOOD AND WHAT A VIEW. We love this place! You can spend days there exploring different areas. I highly recommend to get an audio guide or a normal walking tour around this area as there is so much to learn and know that you will probably not find all on your own. Some highlights from us:- Fishermen Bastion with St. Stephen's sculpture ( tickets on the right hand side before you walk up ) WHAT A MAGICAL VIEW! a bit of a shame about the restaurant on a UNESCO Heritage building...- Holy Trinity Square with Matthias Church ( MUST SEE ) , Old Town Hall, Trinity Coloumn, - Further away on the corner of Uri and Szentharomsag street is Cafe Miro where you must try the Somloi Galuska which is a decadent wonderful desert.- Still going further down some stairs the Sziklakorhaz ( Cave Hospital ) which I will talk about separately but it is a must to all who loves history.- Ferenc Erkel's memorail plaque ( he lived here for 11 years and he is the one who composed the music for the Hungarian National Anthem. Uri utca 24- Behind Matthias Church and Hilton hotel is a Marzipan Museum where you see some fantastic artwork made out of marzipan. Very interesting!- Matthias Fountain, National Gallery cultural must!! - Siklo funicular to get down ( ticket for it at the entry ) from the HillThese are just some of the highlights of this area but allow plenty of time to explore and ask away if you have a question. There is also an info centre near the Matthias Church with plenty of maps, info etc.
Neat and tidy showcase of history. It is good to see that effort and money has been spent wisely to restore and clean up this very special district of the town!
The definition of a landmark. Must visit place. Many museums and palaces are located. No need to take the lift, it's quite easy to walk up the hill and walk around the castle.
History at each step. The extensive complex of historical buildings from different periods. View to both parts of the city - Buda and Pest
Wonderful visit with restaurants and bars. Excellent views by day and night , an absolute must visit . Walking around the grounds and gardens a wow factor
Magnificent point of view. Get up there by the cable car, you'll see the view from Buda side to Pest side. It's a must to go when you reach Budapest.

Head up here for amazing views over the city. The views over Budapest are truly incredible. A stunning place, well worth seeing. The castle is gorgeous as well. Make sure you visit at nighttime to see the whole city lit up
beautiful place to walk around. Even though it was raining we had a lovely time walking over the bridge to castle hill. We took the funicular up and explored the area.
cool building!. this was cool to see and walk around. plenty of nice photos can be took here. it is stunning at night.

Stunning views, charming area. We did NOT enter the castle but admired it from the outside, which was enough for us. The towers were magical, and the area was just charming. We walked up and down, but that was hard on my old knees- I recommend taking the funicular at least one way. If you have the time, do include this in your Budapest tour!

Great area to go. The entire castle hill is very nice. Visited as a part of city tour. This requires some uphill walking. The views of pest side and danube are amazing. Its a simple hill area with some old photographs and literature showing history of Budapest.
Fascinating part of the city. It was cold and rainy when I visited castle hill, but it was still fascinating to see all the history there.

CASTLE HILL ( FOR A GREAT VIEW OVER THE CITY ). We visited Castle Hill a while back, great view over the city, especially the Parliament House. Same lovely monuments. Nice cafes if you want to seat and have a rest.

Beautiful view of the city. The castle, and church, and the general area around it is just so beautiful, it has to be seen whilst in Budapest! You can also get a guided tour of the chirch and tower for only 1000 HUF (students)! The area offers a really nice view of the city and the river!
Spend the day. Great views, good cafe, good walking. Museum was worth a visit for the medieval section and the timeline display of Hungary. rest was a bit sparse.

Beautiful by day and night. Very much love this building. At night the lights make it even more spectacular from a distance. You can take the elevator, but I recommand walking your way up, it's really worth it!

Views of the city, some history and very good food. We picked up a guide after we used the funicular (great views as it goes up) up the hill. A walk through the palace grounds with all the history thrown in made the trip worthwhile. We walked through town to St Mathias( which may be one of the most impressive pieces of church architecture I've seen). Very good lunch spots and some shopping also available.
Beautiful, could spend an afternoon. Lots to see and the views are breath taking. Little shops and cafes, so you could take your time, then sit for a while.

A must do/go. Well worth the time and ride. There are many ways to get there and well worth it, as the views are lovely, there are many attractions and it is highly recommended you go without hesitation.
Spectacular. There are spectacular views, wonderful museums, lovely shops and good, reasonably priced restaurants. Plan on spending a day here.
Loooooong walk. It's a hard walk up but you can use public transport if you like amazing views and plenty of points of interest once you are there.

A wonderful place to wander.. The castle district is a lovely place to wander for an afternoon. There are a number of museums including the National Gallery and other historical attractions like the Matthias Church. There are also often performances of traditional music and dance. One afternoon I was up there with a friend and we followed the sound of folk music to find a group performing traditional Hungarian folk dances. There are lots of restaurants and coffee shops if you need a rest. I was once here with a friend as a summer thunderstorm was breaking up over Budapest leaving us with a rainbow over the whole city for our pictures.

A stroll in the past. The Castle district has so much to offer for visitors from a grand view of the Pest side with the Parliament building to the Fisherman's Bastion and Mathias church and National Gallery Take a walk in the narrow streets, visit little shops and cafes where they have delicious Hungarian pastry like strudels (retes) or different cakes like Dobos torta or Zserbo.
Stunniing views. Not to be missed, the Castle district offers great Museums, hotels and restaurants and wonderful views of Parliament and Pest

Only for the views... The views are amazing. But again, like all other attractions on Castle hill, they are just worth it for the obligatory photo stop. So if you have half a day, take a bus up, take pictures, have some coffee and if you stay long enough, you will get amazing night shots of the parliament house minus the crowds. More time of course if you plan to see the museum and Matthias Church. The cloister in the Hilton hotel is closed for renovation.
Highlight of our trip.. Just breathtaking views and incredible scenery. Don't take the railway up the hill, it looks tough to walk up, but is broken up often by platforms to view and rest.
Great views. Ride the funicular to get here. There are amazing views and lots of other attractions once you get up there from churches to museums.

Great view!. City castle is the main attraction for any tourist. Once can easily reach by any of the travel options available. Funicular trip one way would be interesting. Many toursit attractions are thre on the hill and offers a great view of the city.
Now THIS is a view. One can get fabulous shots of both sides of the Danube and all the city. Especially with the fall colors right now...

Good place and great views. It has some great views of the city. You can either go up by the funicular or walk it up. Walking will take just 5 mins though and you might have to wait a longer time for the funicular.
Excellent walk up or take the tram. We walked from the pest side in the walking tour and thoroughly enjoyed the tour. you should take the tram up to the castle again splendid views from top.
Beautiful Views!. Well worth the trip up for the amazing views of Budapest! Be sure to go on a clear day as you will not be able to see much otherwise!
good view of the city. Budapest is one of my favorite cities in Europe. Castle Hill is a must see if you are ever there. Be sure you see both sides of the river.
AMAZING VIEW. Great views. and very beautiful area. The only problem is the amount of tourists that are there. Makes it hard to take a picture sometimes. But it's definitely worth seeing.
Go at night for spectacular views of city. On the night tour bus route and worth a visit independently as the bus stops for a very limited time.

Fantastic views. This is a great spot to head high above the city on the Buda side, views are really great of the river and parliament building. A number of shops and a small market area, a few bars and cafes for a bite to eat. Also a number of other nice sights right up in the square. Worth the ride/walk up.

Memorable site. There's some melancholy attached to this site that speaks volumes of the history of the city. There were some excavations when I last visited that can yet tell more of how this town came to be

The Castle Hill. This area is very interesting and you will need some time to valk around here! It is a very nice area, and it has all you want, from funicular, churches,museums view points, a lot of cafe and restaurants to shopping streets!

Peaceful, high above the hubbub. Castle Hill feels much like a separate town, removed from the normal bustle of the city. While the Castle itself is visually impressive, it is a cold-looking building that doesn't invite interest. Walking through the town on the other side of the hill is more rewarding, with smaller streets, some beautiful views, and a some-what cleaned up idea of what life was like here over the last 300 years

Beautiful area. The whole area is beautiful and well worth a visit for the view over the Danube and Pest. It's quite hilly with plenty of steps, but there are plenty of restaurants and bars to sit down in and have a coffee for a drink,
nicest view over Budapest centre. There is really not much to say but that the view is beautiful, the castle hill has its own sights to offer and you should plan to spend a day up here.
Lovely walk. It's just really nice. There are photos going up the hill which show how Budapest has changed, grown and developed over the years.
Worth a visit. Castle Hill is an interesting site. There is an excellent museum in the grounds, also an art gallery.

Breathtaking!. From the top of the hill you can look out over the whole city. This truly is a moment where time stands still, the view is breathtaking. This is an excellent spot for keepsake travel photos!

Brilliant view. Well worth the trip up for the view back down the danube. The big statues are very good and the trip up pretty quick. Budapest is a lovely city and so many places to go for a small fee.

Views . Excellent views of the danube, especially if you like taking photos. We only found out once we got there that the museum and attractions are usually closes on Mondays which was a disappointment but worth for the walk alone.

Beautiful view. Worth the stair climb, what an incredible view up and down the Danube. One can see the Government buildings, almost all of Pest and the ferries travelling the river. As well as the view the architecture of the palisades is a marvel. The tour busses stop here as well you can take public transit quite easily. There is so much to see up here I would recommend doing some research before visiting.

Best View in Budapest For Free!!. By far the best vantage point in Budapest to view the Parliament and surriounding buildings along the Danube for free. You can walk up the hill to the castle, or take the Funicular. The walk down is not that bad either but views from the top are outstanding, especially on a clear, sunny day!
Must do!. Take the fabulous funicular up to the top, a great attraction in itself. The buildings and views are spectacular. Take a day to explore this part if Pest, a great day out.
Outstanding view of Pest from Buda.. Castle Hill is worth a visit for the view, museums, and dining. The Hilton on Castle Hill is a nice hotel.
What a view!. You have to take the tram to the top of the hill on the Buda side of Budapest. The view is spectacular
Birds eye view . You can find a good birds eyeview to the city. The guards walking was very attractive. Good place for find Pest
Citadels. .... Perfect place but only for having pictures of the view and the statues on the sides not from the main center one....

A definite tourist spot.. Go up castle hill....its worth the trudge. And the view from the top is breathtaking. Seeing all those stately buildigs in the background, and all those bridges, one can onlt imagine what life must have been like before WW11.
Breathtaking views. the city itself has awesome views, but this is the place to be for a interactive history lesson and great cultural intake.
NICE CASLE ON THE BUDA SIDE. A very nice castle on the Buda side, went in the morning when the breeze was in full swing, you can have the full view of the entire city of BUDAPEST.

No need to climb; take the Funicular!. You get some fantastic views of the city and the river from the top of Castle hill, plus there's much more to see from the castle itself (where they had a wine tasting festival) and Turul the Eagle etc. Plus you don't need to climb, take the funicular aka the film Grand Budapest Hotel

Stunning View. Any visit to Budapest must include Castle Hill. Great for pictures! Lots of places to walk around and get different perspectives of the city. You can view most important ;landmarks for here.

Brilliant views of Danube and Pest. Take the Cable car up (at least). It is a steep walk. They had a changing of the guard ceremony at about 10.00am. The views from the top are excellent if the weather is good.

nice place to take pictures. we took some great pictures here as you have a wonderful view over budapest (the best view you would have from Gellert Hill). Here you can also visit a historical museum and find ruins from the destroyed castles (as it was destroyed 3 times and always rebuilt).

Castle Hill Was OK. The Castle Hill area in Buda was very confusing to say the least. It is not well appointed and hard to find certain buildings you want to visit. Make sure you have a good map before you go and plan to stay all day because there is much to see.
Characterful and quaint old village. Beautiful views across the Danube toward Pest and the Parliament. Make sure you visit one of the little wineries for some authentic Hungarian refreshment.

Magnificent views , history and architecture. It is well worth the while to walk up to the top of Castle Hill to experience the fabulous architecture of so many buildings castles , Presidents residence , churches etc . There are the usual tourist trap shops and restaurants so would suggest you avoid buying anything there or eating there as the prices are inflated . I would also suggest a guide to learn more about the history and to cover the area in an efficient manner .
Fantastic view. fantastic view to the Danube, the bridges, the parliament and more. Also the palace, churches and all other great buildings are very impressive.

Beautiful architecture. Budapest travelers should check this out. A very good place for sightseeing and walking. The details in the buildings and path are amazing. It also provides yet another majestic view of the Danube and city
Quite the view. Take the funicular up to Castle Hill. It's got quite the view and full of history. Learn about the Turul bird, see museums, churches and galleries. Take time to walk the streets.

Post card view with side benefits. This view captured here is one featured on many promotional pieces from cruise lines to travel agencies. You can spend a day here touring one of the most famous churches in Budapest, museums, several excellent restaurants, gift stores, antique stores and don't miss the pastry and hot chocolate store just down from the Saint Matthias Cathedral, and not to be missed take in a concert in the church.
Nice views, laid back strolling. That's it really: nice views and laid back strolling. And one magnificent church. I was pleasantly surprised by this side of the city :)

A nice view of the Danube River from up high. Was fortunate enough to get there at noon when there was a changing of the guard next to the capital. Many shops to see and lots of restaurants available.

Must go!. I love Budapest but I adore Buda Hill! Trinity a Square, Matthias Church, the Fishermen's Bastion, Buda Castle The National Gallery and the little streets and restaurants. The view is great. It is a very romantic place. We were lucky our hotel was there and it was so nice to walk those streets very early in the morning or late at night when most of the tourist weren't there. I would go back in a heart beat.
Will be good pictures . Hope for good weather and you will get beautiful photos of the city. Take a rest on the top and sit down for a coffee or beer.

Stunning views available here - visit during day or at night. Strongly recommended - there are stunning views of the city available here, both at night and during the day. Lots to do up here, restaurants, crafts, etc. etc. - but walking around and looking down at the city is free.
Great Visit. We took the funicular up the hill and walked down, well worth a visit, lots to walk around at the top
Amazing. If you are going to Budapest, this is a place to if you are in the area. Its an amazing view from the top.
A great walk. We took our time and explored the whole area. The views incredible and not too busy in October. Alot of history and area to cover but certainly worth the climb.

Plenty to see - Great views of Pest. When in Budapest, you have to do Castle Hill. But don't be fooled - there is NO Castle - well not as we know it! There is the fabulous Matthius church, Gallery, Fisherman's Bastion, lovely narrow streets to stroll around and good cafes such as Var Cafe which was excellent for lunch - no castle - but there is a palace. We missed the palace because we were looking for a castle! You could easily spend a half day up here and then get the Funicular down to the Chain Bridge....

An interesting place to wander.. A good place to spend the day, wandering around all the streets, shops, and old buildings. Tons of places to eat, but hold off on all the crowded main ones. Check out some of the smaller, more uniques places further in. Better service and better food.

So much to see and do.. Beyond the castle, the hill is amazing as it houses an entire “old town”.From the castle, to the church, the grounds, the views and even walking around the old city, it was just great fun.Of course, you’re subjected to souvenir shops and overpriced restaurants, but if you go for a walk beyond (West of) the church/bastion area, you’ll find a great and quiet neighbourhood with lots to explore.
Excellent views. Make the effort, great photo opportunities of river and Parliament buildings. Wide range of interesting architecture. Spend some time here and soak in the atmosphere and history.
Castle Hill. We were part of a Viking tour. Lots of interesting sites, buildings, views of Budapest all steeped in history, stories and folklore Lots to see and good places for a snack
Breathtaking. The views from Castle Hill are breathtaking, the walk up is not for the faint hearted, very popular with tourists.
Very nice area in Budapest. This area is surrounded by old buildings. The streets are wide and clean and restaurants are every where.
View!! View!! Panoramic view!!. Dont go on a rainy day... Anyway it's amazing even in october!! Beautiful scenery!!!do not even miss that in budapest!!!

So much to do - do not miss it!. With the castle, Fisherman's Bastion, Matthias church, the hospital in the rocks, Uri utca (a cute little street lined with shops and cafes), it is so worth the trip.We went on a Monday and the funicular was closed. There was a street on the left of the funicular office box to walk up which took us up one side of Castle Hill (we came down the stairs located (on the right of the tunnel). It was an easy walk up and took about 10 minutes even with us stopping to take pictures and look at things along the way. Once you make it through the castle, there are signs that help direct you around.

So Close to So Many Things.. Castle Hill is on the Buda side to the Danube and provides easy access to most of the attractions which a tourist would want to visit. Buda Dream Apartments is about 15 minute walk to SPAR -- the grocery outlet, 20 minute walk to Fishermans Bastion, and at night it's quiet

Must do in Budapest. Coming to Budapest and not seeing Verhegy is like going to Paris and skip Montmartre. Apart from teh views and the location itself, the galleries underground are definitely worth seeing
Great place to wander around. Lovely place for a gentle stroll around and plenty of photo opportunities with stunning views.Wear comfortable shoes as the cobblestones are a bit sore on the feet.
Must visit. You can go by bus up the hill to the castle. Cars need to pay an entrance fee. Restaurants and restroom available Stunning views on a nice day. Recommended MeuterMedia

Pleasant place just to stroll. Visited as part of an Imperial City tour organised by Rail Discoveries of York. We drove up by coach and made our way through the complex past Matthuis Church to Fisherman’s Bastion. Very busy with tour parties, but without going into any buildings it is a very pleasant place to stroll around.

Great views of the city. Well worth a trip up to the Castle Hill on any trip to Budapest. You get great views and loads to see and do once you are there. You don't have to visit the museums as there is a lot to look at as you wander around the outside. Try and be there for 12 noon as this is when there is the changing of the guards at the Presidents residency which is a great spectacle and worth waiting to see!

Buda Castle Hill NEW Royal Gardens' Stairways. Avoid long queues and expences at the Funicular, use this new way to get up. Use a glass elevator, than escalator and 100 m walk up to the National Gallery and Royal Courtyards.Enjoy nice rose gratin and parks with breathtaking view to the Chain Bridge and Danube.No cost, all free.Not recommended for people less walking capacity.

Charming Buda. Enjoy a day walking through Buda streets, visit the Budapest History Museum and the National Gallery inside the Castle buildings. I wish you it's a crisp day,the view completes the picture.
View is wonderful. We traveled by bus to Castle Hill. St Stephen's, Fisherman's Bastion are all there. Out tour guide was excellent and gave us plenty of time to walk around and take photos.
Great views if the weather is clear. Worth the climb. There was a queue for the funicular so we walked. It's a very gentle slope with great views on the way. Well worth the climb.
Beautiful. Beautiful castle and interesting place to visit. Even at night, it was nice to see from the boat. One of the place you must visit when you go to Budapest.
Touristy but pretty fun. Two things I really liked -- Matthias Church and the Hospital in the Rock. The views are good, too. It's really touristy, though.

This is a must do. The views from here are absolutely stunning. It is a must do when going to Budapest. Would have liked to see it at night but ran out of time. Beware the bar "Palinka Terasz" though. There were about 12 of us. We ordered wine and beer. 7 of us had wine and got charged for 14 ! The waiter said he asked us if we wanted large or small (no mention of sizes in the menu). He definitely did not.

worth the walk for the view. we walked as opposed to queue for the train. If you are fit enough definitely walk - its not that bad! No one wants to queue unnecessarily! there's a quaint little village at the top with some cafe and a few shops. The highlight is the view for sure!
Buda's best attraction!. During the day, the views from here are spectacular, and the lights at night are a must see. Once there, the site is fully walkable & another of Budapest's must see.
Great view of the city.. Don't pay for the Fisherman's Bastion wall, it's free in the evening, and it's really romantic at night...

Most impressive. After crossing the Chain Bridge you can either take the funicular or walk to the top to the palace. This in itself if impressive enough but add to that the 'changing of the guard', the view and the lovely 'village' feel with nice restaurants to chill out at all add to a full afternoon's visit.

Do not miss this!!!. Make sure to leave a lot of time for Castle Hill in your Budapest schedule. We did Fisherman's Bastion, Budapest Castle and Gellert Hill in one day and it was a fantastic one at that. Queues for the cart to take you up the hill are long at weekends so if you can visit on a weekday. It's only a short walk up some stairs to get to the top which is easily achievable. Walk through the castle gardens and have your camera at the ready for plenty of photos over Budapest and the castle itself. Should take 2ish hours to see the whole castle and its grounds.

There is so much to see and do plan to spend a day.. This is worth a day of your time. The palaces, fountains, museums, shopping are excellent. We enjoyed it all. Take a cab to get there. Wear good shoes and have a relaxing lunch outside in a cafe the pastry and coffee is a must. Most everyone speaks English.

Walk Across the Chain Bridge to Reach the Steps/Funicular to Castle Hill. A pilgrimage to walk/take the funicular to after crossing the Chain Bridge! We took the funicular R/T. Beautiful views. We saw the Castle lit up as we walked back across the bridge in the early pm.
Castle Hill . Make sure that you schedule lots of time in this area. There is a lot of beautiful things to see. We ate at a small restaurant close to the military museum that was excellent.

Among the Best Views of Budapest. We spent half a day on Castle Hill and totally enjoyed the outing. We walked from the Pest side across the Chain Bridge and took the funicular to the top, to avoid the 100's of steps going up. On that Saturday, we took in a crafts fair at the top and also enjoyed sampling different foods and drinks at the dozens of booths next to the crafts fair. We then also toured the Palace of Arts. We would recommend the entire experience.

Great area to visit on the Buda side of Budapest, the west side of the Danube. Great tourist area! Ride the funicular up the hill, visit the old Castle grounds, walk up to the Matthias Church area, come back along the west side of the hill and see the open Roman ruins. View from around the Church is neat as is the local streets. At night can go up for a view on the Pest (west) side of the river, will all the beautiful lights that are simply stunning in this wonderful city.

Beautiful area of town to stroll. We took the funicular up the hill to this area. What a lovely area to walk around and take pictures of the Pest side. The buildings and architecture are fantastic and there are some great shops and restaurants. A must see when visiting this area

the reward after the effort !. After a hard climb on a warm sunny afternoon, you arrive to the top, and get the reward to your efforts and energy you left : a stunning view over Budapest, the parliament , and the Danube. This is a moment to remember, and that is what veryone comes to Budapest for. It is worth the perspiration !!!
Amazing views. Best views of Budapest and Danube, but it can get a bit chilly in October. Expends the weather to be a bit colder and windy. Lots of stuff to see also.
AMAZING SIGHTSEEING. It's worth walking til the top although there're more than 300 steps... You can pick the trolley bus to go up and then you can go down walking. The views are amazing.

Takes you back in time. It was worth every minute spent on the castle hill. The view of the city from the hill is breathtaking. So are the breathtaking surprises at very nook and corner as You explore the place. Take the path least taken, get away from the crowd and find your own gifts in any direction you take. It is a photographer's dream come true.
Amazing area.. Well recommended and the funicular is a must. It was on the doorstep to our hotel so our first point of call on arrival. Lovely buildings and shops. St Mathias church is stunning.
Fantastic views. A must see for visitors to Budapest. Easy to get to via Bus or funicular. The best views of the city.

Nice overview of the city!. The Castle Hill provides an extremely nice view of the Buda side and the Pest side. The view will be even excellent if it is on a Sunny day! My friend and I went during the day where it was cloudy, but then again, the view was still very impressive!

Beautiful view. We used the Hop on Hop Off bus to get to the top of the hill to see this view. You probably can take publci transportation too. It is a beautiful view and well worth coming up here to see and take picutures

Nice views of Pest. If you do not visit many of the buildings but just admire them and enjoy the nice views, you are done in few hours. I would recommend trying the restaurants and cafes there, excellent.
Castle Hill. I just really enjoyed all of Budapest that I got to see, can't wait to go again and castle hill was the most visited area by me and my mother, beautiful at any time of day.
Magical. I suppose the posh side of the river with wide streets often tree lined. Lovely views across the Danube

Sunset view with a glass of wine & beer was the perfect happy hour view!!!. We walked here from our hotel Charles. (20 min walk) what a beautiful view across the river of the Parliment and Chain Bridge! We walked up to the top of Fishermans bastion to get great views!!!

No crowds and learned a lot. Great history museum and art museum. Make sure to go all the way through the history museum and into the really old part way underground. In the art museum go to the top of the dome for the best views.

Castle hill. Great views from up on the hill. Don't waste your money going into the castle , there's nothing to see and the audio guide is a complete waste of time, The staff are no help and I think are there since the communist time.

Great for an evening, wonderful views. Castle Hill is a wonderful place to spend an evening along with Fisherman's Bastion. The hill as the name suggests is where the Buda castle is situated and one can visit the museum and the gallery situated here. During our stay in Budapest they had the Palinka and Sausage festival and hence we couldn't enter the grounds but we spent time on the other side (facing the river and Pest) and took in the wonderful views of Pest and the Parliament.
Must see. The whole area is very interesting with great architecture. The views over the river and Budapest are great.

Visit in sunset for great pictures as lights come on the bridges and Parliament. We spent an evening at Castle Hill at sunset as the lights were coming on the bridges and Parliament. We really enjoyed walking around Castle Hill, taking pictures and watch the day slip into evening. A must see in Budapest. We stayed in Pest but it was easy to get to Buda on the tram.

Nice views. It's a pretty long walk to the top b it lots of places to stop. The views are amazing. Along the way are no restrooms. On top is a monument and a nice left over building from a few ages ago. The building wasn't open so I didn't see the inside.
Worth the trek!. Beautiful, can spend hours walking around the old castle in the mini gardens. Amazing views of the city. Highly recommend :)

Some exercise for the day with the reward of good views!. Well worth climbing to the top for a beautiful view of Budapest. There is a good path and stairs, so if it's not terribly hot, it shouldn't need too difficult to get there. We walked from the Hotel Gallert.

Foothill of the Alps. Beautiful for photos and just walking around. We took the Funicular up then walked down which was easy. You can climb up further if you want to take the steps up in the Matthias Church well worth the view. The Chain Bridge is just below the funicular so as you go up you can take many different pictures of it and the surrounding area
Nice view. A nice place to see the city form above. The castle is nice, and the area around is beautiful. The only thing is a lack of signs.
Magnificent view!. This view is magnificent! And if you have the time , take a strolling walk down to the city again. That is very refreshing and interesting. Get a guide!
Amazing views. Stunning views across the River Danube, with the sun shinning it really did look blue! Easy to get to on the hop on, hop off buses.
beautiful view. Be careful, there was a loooooot of tourists! Better climb up from south side, than walk down through north stairs..

The Great Castle Hill And Danube Cruise. If feels wonderful be able to explore and adventure the great Castle Hill Budapest. Your best option is to walk along the cobblestone streets and discover Castle Hill at your own pace. Take your time, as there is a lot to see and do, and exploring Castle Hill can take an entire day. If you don’t have much time, visit Trinity Square,Matthias Church (Mátyás templom) andFishermen’s Bastion (Halászbástya). Various events are held at Castle Hill year round. Our Castle Hill walking tourincludes all the major sights, as well as recommended cafés and restaurants to stop for some refreshments. To get an insider's look into historic landmarks and learn about the past while strolling along (and beneath) the cobblestone streets sign up for the Mysteries of Castle District Tour.Hoping that will inspire and give aspiration To the visitors more about Budapest. Regards,John De Ignacio.(Kota Kinabalu, Sabah East Malaysia).
Worth the crowds!. Be prepared for the crowds but don't let that spoil your enjoyment of the gorgeous buildings and fabulous panoramic views.
Worth a visit.. A good place for an afternoon walkabout. Lots of good picture opportunities. Can be chilly if there is a wind blowing.

Budapest - Lots of Old World Charm and Things To Do. Dinner cruise along the Danube is highly recommended - the lights of the castles, parliament along both sides of Chain Bridge are gorgeous at night. We also toured Hospital in the Rock an amazing structure which played a surprisingly important role during WWII and that which had been updated for a possible nuclear attack much later. The wax figures really brought it to life. The Sights and Bites tour of Budapest offered by Urban Adventures (get Agnes for a guide if possible) is a wonderful combination of tasting traditional and new dishes of Hungary as well as learning about the history and many neighborhoods throughout the city. It starts in a huge indoor market and then trails throughout the city where old and new sights are highlighted. The guide offered many insights into the culture, politics and current life in Hungary. Also don't miss the free outdoor live listening and viewing at the Opera House when an opera is scheduled. The huge outdoor screen and speakers are possibly even better than sitting inside.
Wow! . A beautiful castle!!! Maybe one of the most beautiful castles I have ever seen!!This site is a must see when in Budapest!

not very easy to climb up but worth climbing. the view is good from here. not very easy to climb up. u must take water with u if u try at summer. located in the heart of the city on the edge of the river. u can relax here for soem time.

Worth the effort if you can manage the short climb up the hill. Took a day tour out of Vienna. The views and the buildings on the hill are quite stunning. We were fortunate to have a local guide who explained quite a lot about the history as well as giving us time to take some amazing photos.

Beatiful historic area for a great walk. The Castle sits high up with commanding views out over both sides of the city. We didn't have to climb up there, so I can't say how much effort that takes. But once there, we really enjoyed exploring all the beautiful old buildings. The big church looks like an amazing wedding cake! There are good walking paths around the edge. Also lots of great restaurants up here.
Must do attraction. An absolute must to do in Budapest. Visited it twice because there is so much to see and do. Stunning views of Parliament building, Chain Bridge and Danube from ramparts.
avoid. avoid going with bad weather ruins everything very cold and not good. but with good weather there is lots to check out

Increbile views. Incredible views of pest and the danube. On a good day you can see all the sights. Avoid asking the official tourist advisors for business, they are disinterested at best and actually tried to discourage us and others from venturing into the old town, glad we ignored them as it great!
amazing view. the blimb to the hill is not easy at all, but it worth it for the views! you can see all og pest side of the city.

You can reach by public transport 16 and with 16A roam around the hill. Do visit early morning as it will be less crowded. Go up with bus 16 and roam around the hill with 16 A as it is quite huge.
Lots of nice photo shoot points.
Do NOT buy anything on hill including food , as all is expensive.

Make Your Way to Castle Hill for Amazing Pictures of Budapest. Definitely go up to Castle Hill for spectacular views of Budapest. It's easy to get there by tram, just watch your step when stepping down inside the tram. I recommend going at night when you can get some amazing pictures.
worth the trip. Great views, use the cable car thingy easily accessed from the city have some thing local to eat at the top

Walk up through the gardens!. Spectacular views all through the gardens, nice places to sit, stop rest or take a photo. The views of the castle and river are equally spectacular and the various lifts and elevators are free if you want to use them. Best of all the entire grounds are free entry including the terraces and battlements, the presidents house and music hall are also up there as are tea rooms etc.

A much recommended walk:. Get up to Castle Hill using the funicular ("Sikló"). The white building on the right is the presidential palace, Sándor Palace. The guards put up a show now and again. Continue past the National Dance Theatre, via Dísz tér square to the Holy Trinity monument, in front of the Matthias Church and next to Fisherman's Bastion. Go straight away to the ticket office on the square and get tickets for a visit to the Matthias Church tower (great views, but very steep climb). Next (with the same ticket) visit the Church inside. Take a break before visiting Fisherman's Bastion: walk down Szentháromság utca some 200 meters and have a coffee (and pastry) at Cafe Miró. Head back to Fisherman's Bastion. It can get overcrowded, but the views and the building make it worthwhile. You can get a ticket to visit a small part of it that is not freely accessible. We visited and it's not really worth the fee.Next, walk a few dozen metres into Országház u. and visit the House of Hungarian Wines (Magyar Borok Háza): there's wine tasting and some snacks included.Continue on Táncsics Mihály utca past the Hilton (former Dominican cloister). Continue on this street and you arrive at the Vienna Gate, a small church and the beautiful large building of the National Archives. Turn into Nándor utca and arrive almost instantly at the Magdalena tower. You can go up the stairs (free of charge).If you next go down Nándor utca, and take the first little street on the right (Lant utca), and you arrive at a chill walking promenade (Tóth Árpád sétány). It will bring you to the Royal Palace, where you can admire the Matthias well and the large courtyards. If you choose so, you can visit the Hungarian National Gallery, or the Budapest History Museum.Take the funicular back down, or just walk down to Clark Ádám tér square through the gardens (easy walk).Congratulations, you've had a great time! Count on 4-7 hours, depending on if you visit the museums and climb the towers.
Climb It and Wait. What a view, what a sunset. Simply beautiful photos with a panoramic overlook of what you have or are about to achieve in your stay. Loved it.

Great place for a walk in sunset time. Big beautiful area.The best time to go there is sunset time, you can combine it with the fisherman bastion and the king castle which is close to eachother. Use the 16 bus line or walk up the hill. Try the ruszwrum bakery when you are there. Many times there is special festivals at the castle, such as chocolate and wine festival

Easy walk up for great views . As other reviewers have mentioned, the line for the funicular is often very long. However, there are a few easy ways to get up the hill. You can easily walk from near the funicular station up a path that will get you to the top in 5-10 minutes. Alternatively you can walk south (left as you face the funicular station) on the flat street that runs along the Danube for about 5 minutes. Immediately after the grocery store in the building with arched doorways, either enter the elevator at the parking entrance and take it up, or walk up the pathway and into the beautiful garden. Once there, you will see a very long escalator that will take you up the hill. The view at the top is worth the effort.

GET OFF THE BEATEN TRACK TO SEE SOME REAL HISTORY. We didn't follow a tour or even have guidebook and most importantly we didn't just look at the main attractions but walked right round Castle Hill then through all the little streets and found another side of this area. Quirky shops, romantic looking hotels and cafes, wine bars, beautiful houses and right in the middle, a startling memorial to the dark days of WW2 when Hungary fought on the German side, specifically, against the Soviets. Outside the ruins of the Church of St. Mary Magdalene on Castle Hill, large boards describe the devastation of Budapest after the war (or the fights as they call it) now I thought I knew my history but I never heard about the Siege of Budapest,a 50-day-long encirclement of the Hungarian capital by Soviet forces towards the end of World War II. During the siege, about 38,000 civilians died from starvation and military action, about 80% of the buildings were destroyed; when the city fell, the victors initiated wholesale theft of anything they could lay their hands on, random executions and mass rape.Years of Soviet occupation then brought it's own terrors.Some reviews have said Castle Hill was a bit unreal, a bit false and that's probably true but then you have to realize that most of the area has been rebuilt after the almost total destruction of Budapest and they've done a great job. Other things about Castle Hill: it has restricted vehicular access so it is much quieter than Pest. However, look boths ways when crossing roads as I saw cars and vans reversing back up the one way streets. You can get one of the smaller buses (number 16) up the hill from the roundabout by the Funicular Railway (tickets from shop near bus stop). The changing of the Guards in front of the Hungarian Presidential Palace (at the top entrance of the Funicular Railway) usually every hour is well worth watching, very interesting footwork!

Perfect location for views of Pest. We went up on the spur of the moment because there was no queue for the funicular when we passed by - a rare event by all accounts.We were lucky with a sunny evening in late September and had wonderful views of the Danube and of Pest from the terraces outside the building which was originally a palace (now museums).A short stroll took us to the Fisherman's Bastion and the wonderful church.The number 16 bus took us back down to the city centre with no trouble.

Feel the history!!. This place just blew us away...very gothic, historic and awe inspiring place. Get there early as this is one of those places that fills up quickly. September seemed to be less busy and the temperatures were still great. Very pricey area for tourist food and souvenirs.
Such a beauty!.... just so beautiful to see this place from the river. and also to go for walk, we loved it, when we visited Budapest!...

The Annual Wine Festival in Budapest. Each year in early September the Budapest Wine Festival takes place in one, large area in the Castle District. It spans five days and nights, and visitors can either buy a daily ticket which allows them to enter the festival as many times as they want for one day, or a pass that is good for the entire festival. In either case you are given a souvenir wine glass to be used to sample wine and a pouch that goes around your neck to hold the glass.There are over 200 wooden kiosks set up one, for each vineyard participating in the festival, with about a dozen dedicated to food. Most of the food venues are prepared food where you can buy sausages, sauerkraut, red cabbage, etc. and eat at large, family-style benches. But there are also a few stands where you can buy a variety of cheese, sliced meat, peppers, and olives and have a small picnic at one of the tables set up around the grounds.As you visit each stand you can ask for a sample of the wine, either a small, quarter sip or a larger half sip, generally ranging form 200 - 600 forints. If you find something you particularly like you can buy a full glass to take with you as you continue to stroll. You can also ask for just a taste of wine which will be given to you for free. And you will be able to purchase bottles of wine from each kiosk to take back with you, either single bottles or a sampler pack.The festival is very well organized. There are stands where you can trade you glass for a freshly washed one, places to replace a broken glass, continually cleaned bathrooms and a place to wash your hands. You can spend an afternoon sampling wine, leave the festival, then come back that night to continue with the added bonus of having the lighted city of Budapest below you.If you are visiting Budapest and find that the festival is going on, it is well worth a walk or bus ride up to the Castle District for a visit. The best day is the last one where there is the parade of wine-makers, and local folk singing and dancing. Or, like us, it would be worth planning a visit to Budapest to coincide with the entire festival.

Stem back in history.. The history of the Hill goes back to about the 13th century. Well documented evidence is the church near the Holy Trinity square. Near by is the St Steven statue, and the famous Fisherman's bastion.The palace on the S side of the Hill is currently a museum that a must see venue. It will take a minimum of 2 days to see all what the Hill is offering to the visitor.
Good views. Amazing views of the city and quite a lot to see up on the hill. The art gallery can take a whole day. We visited on a cool breezy day - wear something warm
A Great place to hang out. Stunning views, great little restaurants, lovely small boutiques. I have spent many hours just walking admiring the old buildings, fountains and open spaces.
Panoramic View. An amazing panoramic view you can see, with a nice shop there having every nice artistic Hungarian segments you need.

Castle Hill district in the heart of Budapest!. There is little space here to describe the many attractions, venues and sights to see in this district. It will take most of a day but possibly two, to see and absorb most of it. Do see it from early morning to late at night when all lights are on both sides of the majestic Danube..... The scenery, the people, the architecture are all reflection of a proud people, the Magyars.... Almost guaranteed you will come away with AWE!!
Star on BP. place from where you can see hole beautiful city. Plus funicular was simply awesome. Plus park under it is beautiful too
Enjoying the exploration. Budapest historical sites are indeed well worth seeing. You can see as far as the eye can from this vantage point.
iews. What an ideal place just to sit and look across the Danube at the wonderful city of Budapest, take in the view and also watch the ships and boats on the river

Love love love Budapest. We came for the Christmas markets ( which are awesome by the way, some of the best in Europe hands down) and simply feel in love with this city. This area was something special with awesome views obviously but also with the street artists and liveliness of it all. My 5 year old got to hold a hawk under the eye of a lovely patient man who spent ages building up her confidence and making sure we got some awesome piccies which I will treasure forever. We had a lovely lunch looking out over the city from the ramparts and were serenaded by a musicians on our walk back down the hill. A truly magical day in a wonderful city

A beautiful view. Well, Castle Hill is one of those places that everyone goes to see, for good reason. It's practically the "centre" of Budapest. From here, you can see all that needs to be seen and of course, the medieval kings thought so too. Don't miss it.

Adventure to the top. A must see n Budapest, views are great, shopping okay. One very nice restaurant that was cafeteria style that was reasonable. Try take the tram , bus, or Metro then bus. It's really easy and fun.

Fantastic spot for photos. A lovely spot for photos of the Danube and across to the Pest side from this Buda side.The castle is a lovely sight too. Ground are huge so if you are planning on walking, think again. Don't let anyone talk you into doing a walking tour as it will just kill you. Yes it may only be 30 mins walk to the castle but they fail to tell you that there's more walking around the grounds. We hired a bicycle and covered so much ground without tiring our legs. This is the way to see Budapest. The battlements wind up and around through the cobble stone paths and we saw so many older folks walking uphill through the winding paths feeling sorry for themselves. We just wiz pass them on the bikes.Don't pay for a 2 way funicular ticket as you will walk to matthias church and probably walk down from there instead of walking back to the funicular as this walk will take you to the bridge near the Parliament which is on the other end of the castle and battlements.

Great views. We visited the castle hill twice on a hop on hop off bus(red one) on which you can get off on top of the hill, take pictures of the beautiful views of Budapest, have an ice cream and then walk downhill. St Stephen's Bascilica is also around there. We enjoyed our visit to this place immensely.
A great view of the city from atop.. A great view of Budapest from the top of the hill. The stautes erected during the Russian occupation are an interesting visit.
Views all around. Interesting & impressive architecture also a good vantage point for city views - one of numerous not to be missed places in the city
With the visit for the views. . Walk all over the area. Gray views of Pest. Mathias church is a trest. WWII photos at Mary Magdalena church ruins are incredidible. Don't eat up here, very expensive.
Fabulous view!. When in Budapest you have to take a trip up to Castle Hill. The view of the city and the Danube is just spectacular!

A wonderful viewpoint of the whole city. Besides being beautiful by itself, the castle is a wonderful viewpoint of both Buda and Pest. Don't miss the eastern part where you can see structures from the Roman time and before.
Excellent Views. Well worth a trip. Try the funicular to get up and down to it. Really good to walk around. Nice cafe at the top.
Great views. This was very good you get lots of really good amazing views and it is really good to go and have a walk up there.

Beautiful . Best to take pic of it at night from pest when eliminated
It's enough to enter the free sights
Gives a good view over the city

Gorgeous views of Budapest. Incredible views of the Danube & the Parliament building.
AMAWaterways provided a great tour for us.

Amazikng views of the city. Lovely area to spend the day. Fishermans Bastion has great views of the city. There are many restaurants. Walk down to the Danube to Chain Bridge is a fairly easy walk. When you reach the bridge there is a snack bar to have a cold drink.
The beauty. This is a must do in Budapest. It is a easy walk up and doesn't take to long. You could make it a 1hr activity or and all day thing =)

Amazing buildings and views!. We went along Castle Hill on our first day, it was just over the river from where we were staying. The architecture really is absolutely beautiful and the views of the river and of Pest and the Parliament that you get are unbeatable! Absolute must-do for Budapest - I would recommend paying for the lift to go up but then walking down because then you really get to enjoy the views!

Great Views, Good Walking Visit. Used the hop on hop off bus service to get here. As advised by many travel blogs walked around but did not pay for any admissions. Great views, lovely grounds, little shops and outdoor cafes. Found the cafe prices reasonable and typical food for cafes. It was a beautiful day and enjoyed our visit.

One of the best castles in Europe.. Not sure which was better, the castle or the views from the castle. Anyone trying to defend this place and survived would at least have retained some great memories.
Walking tour up the castle!. We took a walking tour up the castle and while the journey was long, the views along the way up was fantastic! Kudos to our guide!

In top 5 visit place in Budapest . Perfect Budapest view and historical place together, must visit if you go Budapest. Dont but return ticket when you use elevator since you will wait around and will not use it probably
Must see. The best view to the city. Must go and must see. Nice walk from palace to the churches. Few city buses are operating to the top.
Beatiful birds eye of Budapest. From this location you get the birds eye perspective of Budapest and Danube. Strongly recommended and a "must see".

Relaxing. Nice area to walk around and enjoy nice views of the Parliament building and Pest side.
Definitely good idea to come here at night for magic views of the city.

Budapest tour romantic night. Trip interesting and very well.In the evening a romantic and magical trip.No parking cars in the evThere are beautiful views of the river and the city.ening .We public transport.

Take a day and explore the Buda part of Budapest. Take the funicular railway up to Castle hill where there are immediate museums for you to visit. Further along the top of the Hill is the Maygars church and the Fisherman's Bastion. To see everything you will need at least two days but excluding the museums you can explore the area in just one. Everything is walkable and this part of Budapest feels very different from the flatter, busier & more urban Pest part. Funicular railway tickets, which will take you all the way to the top, are about £5 return and in 30C heat it's definitely worth it as the castle area is hilly and the attractions on a massive hill but you can walk up. Expect a queue and the inevitable slow ticket service. You can walk down at a leisurely pace and buy a single. This side of Budapest ( formally Buda before Buda and Pest became one city) is hilly and green and well worth a days visit if you're staying in the ( formally ) Pest part.

Great views. Took the lift up, was a long wait but better than the hill and steps and was very cheap.Great views of Budapest from the top so is a must if you have the chance and a few good cafes up there.

The view of Pest is amazing, night&day. When I go to Budapest most of the times I spend my nights taking a walk to the Castle District and there the view of Pest is really nice, whether you go on day time or by night. There is almost no traffic, being the place a restricted area for vehicles, and this makes it very quiet and pleasant.

Fantastic.. What a fantastic place to visit. There is so much to see that it took us two days. The views over the Danube are spectacular, especially at night. The No 16 bus from Deak Ferenc will take you up there. There's the Buda Castle Museum, the National Gallery, the Hospital in the Rock, the Matthias Church to name but a few. The architecture appears to be mainly 18 & 19th century with the majority of the medieval buildings in ruins, but this is clearly indicative of it's turbulent past. We took the Funicular up there which was fun but the bus is quite acceptable to get up there. I'd recommend it as a must see if you're visiting Budapest.

Taxi is the way to go. We took a $12 taxi ride form the Marriott Hotel and were dropped off next to the Church at the Top. Much easier than taking a Bus, Funicular or walking up the hill unless one wants extra exercise. My FitBit told me I had wlaked over 25,000 steps the day before so I was happy to take the Taxi. We were there on a Surday of a Chocolate Festival on the Museum gounds. We just got lucky, I guess. We spent half a day there and had lucnh al fresco at a cafe there. Lucnh was the most expensive of our week ther. It was OK but nothing great. The highlight was tasting all the chocolate at the festival. Certainly a sight seers "must" if one is in Budapest
great views. Great views of the Pest side. the castle was actuall hosting a wine festival when I was there so you had to pay to go on the grounds. a bit of a bummer but still nice.

A Must See Free Attraction. With Free Budapest Walking Tours, we were lead up to Castle Hill. This small hike allows views to all of Pest, the flat, city side of Budapest. We ventured into a wine festival going on during the weekend and had a splendid time, despite the light rain.

Best place to view Europe's prettiest city!. Wonderful viewpoint for this beautiful city! Definitely visit the Church which has outstanding architecture. Locate the paper car the communists foisted on the Hungarians on the road to the cathedral.

A Must See!. If you only have a day in Budapest, you would be hard pressed to find a better view than from Castle Hill. Besides the amazing view of the city, the quaint streets, shops and restaurants make it a charming little piece of Budapest all its own.

Great anytime but especially during the wine festival!. We went to Budapest especially for the wine festival at the Castle Hill. The festival is really worth a visit but also the castle itself. If you don't like to walk a lot, the buses go all the way up to the castle.

Typically Tourist !!. A "must" for every visitor to Budapest.......typically tourist, but not to be missed. Full of places to explore and heaps of galleries and museumsBring plenty of cash for the WC's !!

World heritage site, must see. Your visit to Budapest is not complete without going to castle hill. It's a beautiful area, the fisherman's bastion, Matthias church, the royal palace, are all beautiful, majestic and not to be missed. The views of the Danube & the entire city spread below are fabulous.  There is a photo opportunity at every step. Maybe that's why the area is pretty crowded with tourists from 9 to 5pm. But late evenings & early mornings are the best times to go,

A great View of Pest!. This is not just one attraction but a whole day of things to do and see.The tram ride up the mountain is an attraction all by itself.When you get to the top there a great view of Pest and great photography.When you get to the top there is the castle but don't stay just in that area. There is a town where people live, shopping areas and a famous Fisherman's Bastion.There is lots of side streets to wander down and to photograph.My wife and I spend a good part of the day on Castle Hill and we enjoyed every minute of it. The next day we went back up on a tour but the tour was not long enough to see everything. I am glad we went on our own the day before.
Best place on town to see the city. Beautiful views over the city and it is worth to walk until there. You cannot go to Budapest and not visit this place

Great view point. Excellent point for photographs of the Danube and parliament buildings. Military muse also adds considerable interest to this site. The national museum could have had more material to show.Changing of the guard may also be take in.

You need to visit. You have to go to this part of the city to enjoy the wonderful views, but also to walk around its ancient and narrow streets, you'll feel as if you'd traveled in time!!!!! One of the best parts of Budapest.
Fantastic sights and wonderful views. Amazing views over Budapest, worth the climb up from the bottom or take the funicular or the escalator located directly below the castle.

Room a the top. The views from the castle area are breath taking. The area has plenty of tourist shops, restaurants and histirical buildings. We got tge funicular train up and walked through the area to the only remaing gate at the other side and back down into town. A very pleasant morning in the heat.
Great views. Beautiful building and gardens. The view of the city from the grounds is quite impressive. The vertical tram is a nice way to travel to and from.
absolutely beautiful. the views were fantastic of the entire city. It is a walking area only so the buses drop you off about a 15 minute walk from the castle.
Nice views. Lovely views and worth the steep walk up. There is a park about half the way up the hill where you can get a break from the heat, if it is too hot.
Beautiful. Fantastic and beautiful, spent half a day just to stroll around and enjoy all the great views. A bit pity that everything cost money.

Wow - a must see. Our Vantage river cruise bus, took us to the top of Castle Hill....as did every other river cruise and land tour bus. Fisherman's Bastion and St. Mathias Church are both located here. Fisherman's Bastion is a must see...I thought it was almost like looking at a huge sand sculpture - it's pretty incredible. St. Mathias Church would not let visitors in at the time we were there since it was a Sunday morning and Mass was in progress. But it is a beautiful church from the outside and I especially was taken with the roof...beautiful! The views from this part of town looking down on the Danube and Budapest are terrific.After leaving this area we wandered by shops and cafes to enjoy before heading back to our bus pick up stop. The entire Castle Hill area is a World Heritage Site.

Don't miss castle hill. This is a must see on your trip to Budapest. We walked to the top, rather than waiting in line for the funicular. The walk was not too strenuous and we would recommend it as there were many beautiful places to stop on the way to take some pictures. You can easily spend a good part of a day in this area as there are many buildings to see, a museum, restaurants and shops.
Breathtaking view. Wonderful view of the Pest from the hill and a nice place to have picnic at.Maybe a bit harder to get to but the view is worth it

JUST ANOTHER CASTLE. So as castles go this one was okay. I like the ones with furnishing and armaments of the period. This one has charts, and pictures and a few artifacts, but compared to others I have seen in Ireland and Spain, it'sOnly about average

Amazing views of Danube. This is one of the most important places one should visit when in Budapest. It is not difficult to find, and you can take a bus which will take You almost to the top. So almost no effort to climb needed. Views were amazing, lots of tourists though. There is a park where You can chill.
Good!. There are some absolutely beautiful views, though it can be rather crowded as it was when I went. Worth getting the train type thing up the hill.
Extraordinary views. This was the highlight of my stay in Budapest. The views just makes the hiking up the hill worth it!

Nice view!. Try the funicular to climb up or the stairs if you're more in shape! The view when you get there is very nice and other must-Watch places are nearby such as the fischermen's bastion or the Matthias church.
Worth the Effort. It is high - very high - and needs a lot of stamina to get to the top, but it is worth the effort to get the best views over the Danube and Budapest.

The Best View Of Budapest. This is the amazing location if you want to see the whole Budapest with bird-eye view. When you reach there, you may feel that don't want to leave because this is the best place to view Budapest day or night.
Adventure Budapest. The whole area is well worth the visit. You are stepping back in time. It is just gorgeous. It is hilly but taking your time it is doable for most people.

Great view of the city. This is over the river and will give you great views of the city, especially the Parliament and market areas. We first viewed this area via the Hop on, Hop off bus tour then decided to return on foot. It can be quite a walk from the city side of the river so beware.However you get there, you will need to walk up a pretty steep hill to get to the top part for the best views. Well worth a visit.
