The Buda side. Great history. Great museum. Great views. Great beer. Great wine. Great food. What more to say. Spent several hours at the Hungarian History Museum, particularly the Castle Exhibition.
Seeing Landmarks. Beautiful view of Parliament from Castle Hill and Fishermen's Bastion which were also beautiful and historical.

Budapest concentrated. Castle hill includes Buda Castle, Fisherman's Bastion Mathias Church and breathtaking views of the Danube, Buda and Pest. You can easily spend a whole day there but plan at leadt several hours. The Palace is in the area which is mow a museum.

More than the views...you could spend a long time here. The cobbled streets abound with quirky little shops, restaurants and souvenir stores. There are great views everywhere. We came here for a couple of hours and could easily have stayed longer. Definitely worth a visit!

Essential to visit. There's loads to do on Castle Hill, from wandering round to visiting museums. The views are breath taking over the city.There are plenty of options for food and drink as well as shopping for postcards, etc. It takes as long as you are prepared to spend to go round and is a very rewarding experience.

Good place to visit. We were visiting the castle and afterwards wandered around Castle hill. There are a wide vaiety of shops, restaurants around. The restaurants range from family run affairs to very oppulant affairs.We always walked up here but if you don't fancy the walk there are buses that come up from the main town.

Similar in feel to Prague's castle district, but not as old or as good. But still worth a visit. As the whole placd has been destroyed by conflict several times, nothing you will see here is very old by European standards. Prague's castle district wins hands-down on that score. Nevertheless, it's worth a visit for 4 reasons:1) Mathius Church is unusual in its interior2) There are good views to be had of Pest from many places3) The fernicular ride up & down is fun & also offers good views4) The "Hospital in the Rock" museum is interesting if you are into war-related history (see seperate review).
Great Views.... You have excellent views of the city from just about any place here. The Castle is expansive though somewhat plain from the outside. Lots of food and souvenir shops dot the area.
Views!. The views up here where brilliant, it was also a great place to have some food and some beers. I caught the number 16 bus up to the top then walked back down.

A must for Budapest. Castle Hill dominates the Buda side of the Danube. It is the location of many of the monuments of Budapest, and provides the iconic views of the city. The hill can be climbed by a paved but relatively-steep pathway (20-30 minutes), or by Funicular. This is a MUST for Budapest.

Remarkable night at wine and folklore festival on September.. Dont miss it at night. There are festivals every day and if the weather helps, you are going to have an astonishing experience! Very interesting and cheap meusems also.
Charming part of Buda. Castle Hill is a charming place to visit. Beautiful views of the city and Danube River. Be aware that most restaurants near the castle close early than at least we expected.
the climb up is strenuous but worth it. we went in august and did the climb up in 40 degrees . its a little demanding . when you finally get to the top the view is absolutely breathtaking

Wonderful aspect. I managed to do this on my last morning and am so very glad that I did. The funicular is just gorgeous, and there is so much to see at the top. The views are amazing, as are the two palaces. But go early, when I came down at 10.30 the queue for the finuncular was very long.
Amazing!!!!!. Take a walk in the Castle District, it is an amzing historic area of Budapest! The Buda Castle is just amazing and the panorama to the whole city is breath-taking.
The jewel of Budapest. A jewel in Budapest start from bottom to the top and all along the narrow streets you can find here everything, culture pleasures beauty views and more
a breeze through castle hill. we had a few minutes here to enjoy the view and take a few photos, but the stop was worth it. we took fantastic photos here.

Don't miss the castle area of Budapest. A truly spectacular group of buildings in a wonderful setting with panoramic views over the Danube and the city.
Why would you visit Budapest without visiting the Castle area with its churches, museums and cafes?

Another must!. Visiting the Castle Hill may easily take a full day. You may even need a second visit. So, it is better to have a clear plan of what you want to see and do. Hiking up is not challenging, if you prefer you can ride Bus 16 (shuttle-like buses, tend to fill up) which you can catch in the Buda as well as the Pest side. The National Gallery is amazing and huge, one can easily stay there for a few days and not finish seeing all the exhibits. Better to visit when crowds diminish, that is starting September.

One day is not enough. This is a breathtaking view. I was only going to stay a day in this area but it ended 4 days later. Its a good hike up and worth every step. Being the pre Christmas time of the year with the hot red wine makes this place magical

Beautiful site. Prepare for your while body to hurt if you choose to climb the stairs. There is also a lift that will take you up to the top. We chose to walk and take in all there was too see and there was tons. Beautiful architecture. .a museum. .views of the river. .food. .street artists from paintings to musicians.

Stunning views. We attacked the hill from the front, Suspension bridge side. A series of very steep paths and steps takes you to the top. Plenty of seats and stunning views along the way. Hardly saw another person, so was surprised to see hundreds at the top. Then noticed all the buses that had brought them up the road at the back :)
Majestic!. It is worth the trip to Budapest, the history is unbelievable. The view of Budapest is amazing from the top.

Great photo spot across the Danube and around the castle. We enjoyed our visit to Castle Hill, arriving by a hop on-hop off bus tour. It was a bit confusing at first to find out exactly where to enter the castle, though. The grounds around the castle had an interesting fountain (hunters and dogs), old canon balls, ivy covered walls, and great views over the Danube. Great photo ops abound.

Picture perfect view. The view is amazing and really makes an impression. I sat on the steps and just stared out for 15 mins and felt so content. Maybe you'll luck out like me and have a violist playing classical music in the background. It set the mood and transported me back in time.
Great views!. Amazing views of the city centre, photographers paradise!! The castle itself is well worth a visit as it is one of the landmarks.

Fabulous Day Out. Set aside an entire day. Its definitely worth it. We walked there from our hotel on the Pest side and up the hill (in 37 degree heat). The lookout from Buda Palace is beautiful, then we walked to the Matthias Church, enjoyed a half an hour sit inside to soak up its beauty and to cool our steaming doles. Fisherman's Bastion next, then the National Archives Building, had cake at Ruszwurm Cafe (Hungary's oldest cafe) and walked down through the historic lanes, several of the homes built here are from the 1300s. Every direction you face on Castle Hill is steeped in history and stunningly beautiful.

A PERFECT POINT OF VIEW!. Castle hill is a must. You will visit art, cafes, pastries, the Bastion, and the church. But the view from the hill cannot be beat. Spend enough time to take in this beautiful scenery! Take a stroll through castle hill and walk the medieval streets. The houses were built in the 13th to 15th centuries. Most houses have a plaque reflecting the century it was constructed. There are tunnels under the hill that you can tour. It is a World Heritage Site.

Wonderful Views.. This was a wonderful experience and a must do when in Budapest. The views over the city and the Danube in particular were superb. It can be accessed by funicular No 16 bus which is always packed or by foot if you are fit. it is certainly worth the effort whatever means you choose to get there. There are also a number of shops for the ladies to browse in near the top.

Do not miss out!. You can either go up the hill via funicular (rather expensive) or on foot. The hike up the top is rather easy (even my not athletic 55 year old mother did it and was fine). It is definitely worth it! We visited around sunset and by the time we got to the top point, it was dark. It was magical- try going up at that time of the day. It is rather calm and peaceful for a tourist attraction, especially when you're not on the top point (where the castle is). An unforgettable place I'd love to go back to.

One day tour in Budapest . The magical city, Budapest.. Cross the river to rich the castle district.. It worth every minute here.. Many attractions to see.. When you are tired.. Take a fresh juice in a coffeeshop over the rooftop of the fisherman bastion.. I love it

Must see the city from here, or Gellert Hill. This photo was taken the first time we were in Budapest. We spent one week there in 2014 and enjoyed it even more. We walked up to Castle Hill from a tram stop, not sure where we got off but it was a lot of climbing. It was late afternoon, there were a couple of weddings so lots of people at that end. We strolled along, stopping to shop and have a glass of wine. Very pretty, and not many people away from the church.
lovely lovely Castle hill. Though I came here during the day I also did at nightime.Narrow cobbled streets,lovely lit buildings,cosy looking shops and restaurants and lovely views.You must go there

nice district to walk around with great views. We walked around this district and visited the buildings. The church is beutiful and there are some other good buildings as well. There is some history about the damage caused to the area in worl wqr two at the bottom of the tower. You get good views of pest and buda from various locations. We walked up the hill which takes 10 minutes as we are reasonably fit and so we saved moneyon the fanicular.
WOW!!. Best to allow a lot of time here, lots to see. I think better to see in spring or fall without the large crowds and heat. Views are amazing as are the different places to visit!

Lovely . Castle Hill is a lovely place to visit, especially on a sunny day! The climb up was fine so we didn't feel the need to use the funicular when we went the second time, and you get a brilliant view of the Danube and the rest of Budapest at the top. Only complaints are that the souvenir shops are a bit expensive the further along you go, you can tell that they are a real tourist trap once they start advertising everything with prices in Euros. Also the museums were unfortunately shut when we visited, and there didn't seem to be any explanation as to why!

Best views of Budapest. On a sunny warm day, it is a fantastic place to visit. All buildings and attractions were well sign written and restored. Great view over Budapest from the Fisherman's Bastille. A "must see" but perhaps not on a cold and windy day as it's a very open area high up on a hill. Or simply rug up well because it would be shame to miss out on this special spot in Budapest.
Superb view over Budapest. Super view over Budapest and Danube, goog for photography day and night.Attention at the parking, do not stai over time you pay!
Take the bus. Beautiful views across Budapest. Good place to visit, put it on your list. Lots of restaurants & shops
Great experience. Incredible experience in Buda - the views are to die for, and the area is a history and architecture lover's dream. Even good restaurants.

Stunning Panorama of Pest. On the Buda side of the Danube, this spot has beautiful panoramic views across the river to Pest from Fisherman's Bastion. It's a World Heritage Site. Great architecture, quaint cobblestone streets, and beautiful Matthias Church, one of the oldest buildings in Buda is over 700 years old. You can easily spend several hours roaming these pedestrian-only streets.

Do not miss it!. A tour over Castle Hill is a must for every visitor in Budapest. A walking tour takes about 2 hours. (bring water on warm days). The city view is just fantastic. From here you really can see the beauty of Budapest!!
Amazing panoramic views. Honestly one of the best panoramic views I was able to encounter yet! The view of the city was beautiful.

Never get tired of this place.. I went up four times by different routes up and by day and evening. It has different views and perspective each time i went up. Some times it's romantic, others inspirational.

Absolutely Gorgeous. Castle Hill, on the Buda side of the city of Budapest, is a must see. Stunning architecture, and amazing views to the Pest side of the city. It is a fun day to walk around and explore this side of the city. On weekends it's a busy place, and despite what guides say, everything is open. The Funicular was not running on the day we were there, so we took the 16 bus to the top of Castle Hill (we are glad -- there were many steps as we saw on the way down). You can definitely spend a day winding through the charming streets, taking in the views, and stopping for an ice cream or coffee.

Budapest Nightlight. Castle Hill is absolutely amazing. Budapest is one of my favorite cities and unique in that it is completely flat on one side of the river on the Pest side, and Castle Hill on the Buda side is almost a mountain. The view from the hill is worth the climb; you get the most beautiful views of the parliament buildings from the hill across the river. You can take the Funicular up if you cross at the Chain Bridge or hike up the excellent trails by crossing Elizabeth Bridge or Liberty Bridge. Visit the church and the Art Gallery on the hill. We stayed in Budapest for two weeks in an apartment on the Danube and we called Castle Hill our "Budapest Nightlight", because they were our view out the window every night.

Well worth the climb.. Don't bother to pay the rip-off fare for the funicular, just walk up the steps! When you get to the top the views over the Pest district are stunning. The whole Castle Hill area repays a couple of hours wandering around as the architecture is excellent.
My Second Visit and Still Spectacular. Great views over the city Castle Hill has lots to offer. The opportunity to walk and take in the sights, museums and places to eat and drink and people watch.
Not new. enjoyed our trip to the castle district. the area while interesting had been maintained, rebuilt, renovated or restored to almost look new. Lacked the feeling of being an old environment.
Just do it. A nice view, worth the small walk to get there, I would highly advise not to pay for the journey in the cable car. A must do in Budapest.
Stunning at night. Make sure you visit during the day as well as the night as looks different at night when the city is lit up

Buda hill old toewn and Danube views.. Castle hill or properly Buda hill rises from the Danube and was an old fortification. It is now the most prominent tourist precinct in Budapest and provides a variety of entertainments. There are the historic castle, cathedral, Fisher bastion, cafes, restaurants, gardens and old town buildings. It is worth wandering around the hill by foot for a couple of hours, more if you want to take lots of photos. In the summer there is impromptu entertainers.
Great day. Lots to see and explore, excellent views throughout the area. Also several great parks and green areas around the palace. This is a must do activity in Budapest.

Do not miss a visit to Castle Hil. This is a must see. One of the big reasons to come to Budapest. We were there on a particularly warm day with many people. It was a four day holiday in Budapest so the crowds were out, however, it is a wonder place to visit. Many little restaurants and shops to see. Also St. Mathias Church-careful though, on weekends you will run into weddings and the church is closed to visitors. The views from Castle Hill are amazing and a great spot for photograghs.

Tourists Delight. The Castle Hill area is the most visited & definitely a spectacular district in whole of Budapest.As it has in one small area of Pest hill a heavy concentration of the tourists attractions.Its ancient narrow,steep twisting streets & lanes include the Buda Castle Royal palace with its museums,library,Matthais church,Fisherman`s Bastion,Many statues including St Stephens church etc & many sights to be visited.The views of the Danube with its many beautiful bridges & the bustling Buda town more than compensate for the climb up!

Budapest History Museum. We would recommend Budapest History Museum which is at the end of Castle Hill. It is a lovely building, formal and plush on the main floors, but atmospheric and rather rambling on the lower floors.

Fabulous Views and Great History from this Wonderful Vantage Point. For spectacular views of the Danube River, the beautiful Parliament building, and the Pest side of Budapest, do visit Castle Hill. While there, take a look at the historic and breathtaking Matthias Church. If you can spend a day here, do so, because there are several fascinating places to see. Not only is there the view and the church to marvel at, there is also a network of underground caves to check out, which was used right up to the Cold War era. If you can get a guide to take you around, that would be helpful, otherwise do a little reading from guidebooks before visiting the place because it's so rich in history encompassing the Middle Ages to the twentieth century. And don't forget your camera because you'll be taking lots of photos.
Must do in Budapest. This hill has a beautiful view of the city, and many cool things to see as well. Worth the walk up the hill. Plan plenty of time (1/2 a day) to see all there is to see up here.
Enjoyable . Went for a wander round the city - this was my highlight. Great views, nice atmosphere. Would recommend heading here to see all of Budapest at your feet.

One of the most popular tourist's attractions. Very nice view from the right river side - Buda offering the left one - Pest
You can use a cableway which costs approx 4 €

You can spend a whole day here. The compound can be reached with the tourist bus or a funicular. The bus is better. The funicular is good for children only IMHO. There are good restaurants and many museums and sights there. I'd recommend the military museum and the palace park.
Make sure you make the effort to visit. Fabulous views across city ,saw the fireworks display across the river from here and wow it was well worth the walk up .
Enjoy the castle district in the evening.. Spend some time here in the evening. It's quiet, but you may find some special musicians playing, and can enjoy the views of the city.

Climb the Hill. Today we decided to walk over the Chain Bridge and go onto Castle Hill by the vehicular railway but the queue was so long we decided to walk up. It was a hot day and we are in our 60's but made it up to the top but you do need to be fairly fit to do this. We were rewarded along the way with terrific views over the Chain Bridge, the Danube and the city of Pest. The views from the top are even more spectacular. We walked towards St. Matthias church and after some light refreshments caught the No 16 small bus back to the centre of Pest. It would appear that this trip can be done in reverse although we don't know exactly where it starts from. It maybe worth finding out if you don't wish to climb the Hill!
Brilliant view . Up here is a great view of Budapest. & on top of the hill is a beautiful part of Budapest also. When we went there was a little street market with amazing food
Must visit. Castle and old town on the hill. Superb views of the rest of the city. Many attractions other than the castle, cathedral etc.

You'll go there whatever I say!. It takes some time to explore the whole hill but there are treats along the way, views, restaurants, a music museum, galleries, cafes - a special experience of old Hungary.

Great view. Its steep walk to the top, but you can use the funicular which is cheap and fun, it takes the strain out of it. The views are breath taking and panoramic especially on a clear and sunny day. Once you arrive at the top there are plenty of things to keep you occupied for the day.

Central Spot for a lot of sightseeing.. Near the Church and Fisherman's Bastion. Definitely worth going to, if you're going to see the rest of the sights that I mentioned. They do the changing of the guard every hour, after 12pm, and it's definitely interesting to watch.

Must see part of Budapest.. Plenty to see. We spent a whole day on the hill visiting the various sights and attractions. Lots of Information plaques scattered about so you constantly know where you are in the streets.
Great views and attractions. A must. Castle hill offers great views of Pest and some of the best attractions e.g. the Matthias Church, Fisherman's Bastion and Buda Castle.

Beautiful castle and fab view. The castle atop the hill looks like it is straight out of a fairytale book, it is just so elegant and beautifully constructed.. what a treat for the eyes. The church is very traditionally made, but we couldn't go inside as it was closed. The views of the city from here are also fantastic and an added bonus.Lot of photography options here no doubt and worth spending a couple of hours. That included in the labyrinth, which is a series of underground tunnels that will take you back to the days of Dracula...
Budapest Hill. Fabulous views of Pest from the Buda side. Can be quite a walk to the top but well worth it! Great historical photos on walk up to the top.
Take a taxi to the top!. Very nice view, I decided to take a taxi to the top and walk down. Definitely worth the view. I can recommend to everyone.
nice view!. Short nice walk with great view from top over the city. Further, there are many touristic places, cafés, souvenir shops etc.
Excellent view of Pest. It is located in Buda, and you can have the best view of Pest. If you want to walk, go up with the funicular but go down walking, so you walk through a nice park.
Great views across the city. Easily reached by bus, the views across the Danube and the city are stunning. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby.
A must in Buda. This venue is a must during a visit to Budapest, the views are great the history fascinating, and the food great. Try and go on a clear day to get the most from the visit

Very impressive even in the bad weather!. Had a very enjoyable afternoon on Castle Hill, we took the funicular up to the castle, the queue was around 20 minutes, but you can also easily use the walkway, which we took on the way down. The weather was pretty bad but we were able to walk around the castle and went into St Mathias Church, which has been beautifully restored, and Fisherman's Bastion which had some great views over the city.

We climbed all those steps. Must do when a tourist in Budapest. Take the funicular or a bus tour as the steps are a killer, especially in the heat of the summer. When you get tired of crowds, take a beeak on the city side of the hill and relax on one of the benches under shade trees. We needed to do this after climbing up all the steps.

Amazing views.... Stunning vistas across the city of pest, a fantastic area to wander round and enjoy. Make sure the camera is charged as you will get some amazing snaps. Nice and easy to get to just use the hop on hop off buses.

Lovely views. The queue for the funicular was long and boring and hardly worth the wait. Skip the queue, keep fit and walk up ! Pleasant to stroll through the old streets and admire the old architecture. Most people congregate around the church. Views out over the river and Pest and very good.

A view from the top.. Castle hill is a must do for tourists and is easy to get to. We walked over the chain bridge and then took the funicular to the top. It's worth the trip just for the views of the Danube and the city.

Worth the walk. Great Budapest views from Fishermans bastion. Lots to look at and see. Can get public transport but see more if walk from below and include walking along river and up to citadel as well.
Fascinating history with incredibly beautiful views.. The views from here are amazing. The history of the Freedom - Liberty statue/monument, the old citadel and the history is fascinating.

Lovely Views. There are a lot of interesting places to see on Castle Hill, including the Fisherman's Bastion, nice shops, and the Buda Castle. It's also a great place for photos of the Danube and Pest across the river.
A must see. It is just a must see in Budapest, with a great view over both sides of Danube river. You can also take some time for relaxing and just enjoy the breeze.
Worth the effort. Easy drive up here from where you have excellent views of the river and city. There is no fee and parking may be a challenge but it is worth the effort

Brilliant views, architecture, buildings. We had a half day coach trip here. An interesting and cheaper alternative would have been to take the funicular from the Chain Bridge, but that would have missed our guide's local knowledge and explanations of many smaller points, eg the bullet marks from 1945.. There are great views across the Danube from Fisherman's Bastion, great architecture of St Matthias Church inside and out, especially the lots of little twists among the roof line. Good cafes and shops, at very reasonable prices for this type of area. Plus castle, cathedral, museums.
Love the back streets.. Stayed at the Hilton. Loved this area. Lots of tours around during the day. Had lots of fun prowling the back streets where there were little shops. Many restaurants.
Good view. Worth a trip up for the view alone. If you are not up for walking you can take the little cable car.

Nice place. Nice place, nive view, yet crowded. Little expensive to visit. There are some food places among the small streets. We'be been there during a tradition festival and we ate some very good langosh.
Nice little old town with great views. Nice little old town. We had refreshments atop the small hill restaurant opposite the Hilton that had great views to offer.

My dream place. Feels like being in a fairytale. The place was awesome with a great view. It has become my dream place, if I could i would have my wedding pictures there! One of the places i will not forget!
***. it was our number one destination on our arrival and it was worth it. you must visit the museum which is quite big
Panoramic view of Budapest. Stunning view of Budapest and the Danube. A Overly area for hiking or picnicking . Bring water bottles and sunscreen.

Castle hill you have to visit. Very nice view to all Budapest, and way with historial cableway to up the hill with Magyar National Gallery and nice streets ont he top of hill. Buy return ticket with cable way :-)

Stunning Views of the Danube and Pest. On a Sunday morning we walked from the Budapest Marriott across the bridge and up to the top of castle hill for stunning views of the Danube and the Pest side of the river. (The line for the tram was at least 30 minutes long and the walk took about 12.) We walked the outside of the Castle, walked thru the center courtyard to the Matthias fountain but did not go into the museums. From there we walked to Matthias church and then to the Dracula caverns. One warning: Take water with you - it's at least double on the hill!

Start the tour with a great view....... We started our tour of Budapest with a splendid view from the Castle Hill. Assisted by a guide, this will give you an initial overview of what is principally two cities. Take your camera but you might find it quite congested with other tourists. If not pressurised to get back to a coach, take a walkabout.

Great views + impressive art gallery. Travelled up the hill via #16 public bus. Spectacular building housing the national gallery. An impressive gallery spread over several floors covering many genres of artwork so something for everyone. It was interesting for me to compare with Great Britain what was happening in Hungary during the same periods in history. Depicted through art are subtle details of life and things that were important at the time. I am glad we visited the gallery, an enjoyable morning for all.

Get out of downtown. Met a nice girl yesterday in the pub and want to move to the next base? Take her out to the castle hill, take a bottle of wine and two glasses (and please make it glass, not plastic!) and if you finished just walk to the other side of the hill... If you don't succeed, it is definitely not Budapests fault ;)
Incredible Views, Incredible Crowds!. Understandably everyone must end up here: Spectacular views! But get your pic and get going. It's packed up there. But it's free!
House of the Hungarian kings. Come here to see the historical castle and palace complex of the Hungarian kings first completed in the 13th century. A magical view of the city is waiting you.

Good views of the Pest side.. Good views of the Pest side, but swarming with tourists. Just one of the places to tick off the "oh I've been here list". If you follow a free walking tour, you'd probably end up here.

Magnificent views of Budapest. Magnificent part of Budapest to visit, it's a small village in it's own right. Take the funicular if your not inclined to use the steps, either way the views over to Pest and the Parliament Building are magnificent.

Breathtaking View of Budapest!!!!. What a beautiful view from Castle Hill!!! Walk around and see the merchants, cafes, hotels, architecture, statues, the river,the bridges and boats!!! This is a good way to get a panoramic view of Budapest!!!

Unrivalled views. Well worth the effort views fantastic and it's FREE. Can walk up or take the funicular railway and walk across when up there you have the royal palace, Fisherman's Bastion (always worth a visit) and the statue of liberty budapest style.

Stop here on the way to the Fisherman's bastion. Nice views of the chain bridge and Pest. Buda Castle is worth looking at from the outside, but as others have stated, it's not the original, so don't go inside unless you have time to visit the museum.You can take the Funicular up from the Buda side of the Chain Bridge, then walk to Fisherman's bastion on the other side of the hill for more views and Matthias church. Count on spending at least half a day on the whole thing.

Incredibly views!. The views from the top of castle hill are well worth the trek up on the massive steps - if the funicular is crazy busy with tourists skip the line and walk up - the views overlooking the city and the Danube are beautiful and make it all worth while - skip the castle - its really not worth it.
Great Architecture and food.. There are many attactions at Castle Hill: fisherman's Castle, Mátyás Templom, and Buda Castle. One can easily spend 4 to 6 hours in this area.
A Must!. You have not been to Budapest until you have spent hours wandering this amazing place enjoying the museums and restaurants whilst taking in breath taking views of the city!

first attraction spot in the city!. Can't be missed. Tremendous views of Budapest and the Danube River. Lot of history packed into any tour to this place. Shops and attractions surround the area. One can not come to the Budapest side of the city without going to the castle. I recommend a visit.

Impressive scale & great views. On an amazing scale with great views across the city.
We lucked out and happened to be here for the national holiday weekend and were able to enjoy the amazing folk art & craft fair.
Lots to see and do in the area. The Castle Hill is a huge area. It is worth the money to walk to Bastion and see the views of Pest and the Danube!
Beautiful area. A beautiful district of Budapest with lots of historical sites to see. Take a walk over chain bridge to this area. Great views.

The Castle & Breathtaking view of the Pest. We went to The Castle using a Hop on Hop off bus to see the view of budapest. We walked around the castle & had an ice cream break. It was very hot, so we didn't wander very far.

Iconic. The Castle Hill area is an icon of Budapest and is a must visit while in the city. I would recommend walking up rather than taking the funicular to save money as the walk is not too long although is quite steep in places.
Know your history then visit this site. Overlooking the Danube, there are many sites to see and share. Auerbach's tavern is here, where Faust conjured. Read The Redemption of Faust for more details.

Beautiful!. It`s only recommended to see the castle from the outside cause the inside had suffered constructions and know it is a museum. And if you`re thinking about going to the museum DON`T go cause they changed the exibhition and didn`t upgrade the audio guide which is necessary to visit this cultural site.
nice view. Nice view on Pest side and especially the parliament. You can go up with either bus tours or you can take bus to Buda side and walk up the hill. It's good exercise

Best view of Budapest. The best place in Budapest to take a picture. Don't forget your camera! At the top, if you are lucky, you will see the guards change.
As you go down the castle, you will be able to find several places to eat or drink a cafe.
Castle Hill. Another must do purely because the view from there is a must see. Also lots to do and see from that side.

Hope your tourbus will take you here!. Due to its location, it is a must go-to place if you are in Budapest. The easiest way to visit is by taking the Hop on, Hop off tour bus (there are other companies also and they all go here as well).

Good view. Worth a visit to see a lovely view across Budapest. Busy and touristy as expected. The railway up is expensive for Hungary and walking up is pleasant if you can manage it. Restaurants and cafes on the hill are charging considerably more than in other parts of Budapest. Go up and see the view and then have a drink somewhere else.

Amazing place!. Budapest castle hill district was always a terrific place to visit but the area has really been spruced up over the past few years. Visually, its cleaner and more vibrant than it has ever been. The district can be easily accessed using public transportation, various sets of stairs, taxi or car, however you will have to pay for parking. Although a popular tourist attraction, the very short ride funicular railway ride to castle hill doesn't warrant the long lines in my opinion. The area itself is free for visitors but the Matyas Church and Fishermen's Bastion have fees for access to some specific sites. The view of Pest from the bastion is amazing! There's plenty to eat and drink available but for quality fare rather than tourist items, head toward the north end of castle hill near the military museum. There are several quiet, sit-down restaurants there. At the quieter end of the district, have stroll and see the military museum itself. Small enough to keep it fun, brimming with history, and no crowds!

Ironman 70.3 Budapest. This was part of the cycle route on Ironman 70.3 Budapest - the only but none-the-less daunting climb on the route. What made it special on race day, is that the road was closed so we had it to ourselves.Walking over the route the previous day meant we had time to stop and admire all the nooks and crannies - of which there are lots :-)

Great views. . Amazing views of Budapest. Worth a visit and a drink. Quiet pricy though. Steep steps and a long walk from the centre. Get the metro to deli maybe the better option and walk from there but still some steps to climb.
Very nice views. Very nice views of the Danube and the city. Quite a few steps to climb but it was definitely worth it! My friend and I enjoyed walking around this area.Recommended!Elisabeth

Lovely castle, excellent view. Now if you are in Budapest, you cannot miss going to the Buda Castle hill area. situated right accross the river, sits the mighty castle up on a hill. you can take a bus to it or a better scenic option is taking the funicular. this will take you right to the castle. once there you can stroll around and take pictures. You will get to see some good views, gardens, architecture etc. The view of the river from the castle is also spectacular. Behind the castle is a place for snacks and drinks. In case you want to sharpen your archery skills, you will find an archery stall at the back area. For a few euros you get to shoot around 6 arrows with a bow. than as you move out of the castle area and walk out, you will come to a nice old bazaar, where you can buy a lot of souvenirs. A good shop to buy is owned by Zsigane Piroska. She will also give you a little bit of discount. Further down the street you arrive at the old church than fishermen's Bastion. Good place to walk around and enjoy the scenic view. a Good place to visit.

The views make it a must. The views during the day are really nice but at night everything changes. A romantic place to see the city below. At twilight you can see the dramatic change from day light to night time with the setting sun as a bonus.

beautiful view. I never imagined Budapest to be a such a beautiful city. The architecture of the buildings on either side of the river Danube are simply stunning. We were on the river cruse and the director reminded us to watch the night scenery as we were leaving. Just breathtaking!
The view!. Worth it just for the view alone. You get a real sense of how the city is laid out, and the Parliament looks so great!

Best view of the city. We went twice, in the heat even though we took the little bus up the hill in the morning - it was still hot and really busy! Then we went back in the evening to watch the sunset (and enjoyed a cocktail on the Hilton afterwards) Absolutely worth it and costs nothing apart from the bus - unless you want to walk. We walked down!
On the hill. We were there several times. Amazing view of the Pest side and the river. If taking pictures, is Better at sunset but it worth it no matter the time.

Excellent views of the city. Very interesting & cool place to visit not only for the WW2 historical significance but also for the excellent views of the Danube & Budapest. Would recommend going up in a taxi but walking back down.

Wonderful view. Great spot to have a look on the stunning city of Budapest. We didn't enter to any of the museum, and even if you're not planing to as well it still worth climbing up, wonder around, have a drink and a joy the view.
A must see. nice, busy...pleasant walk...excellent views...cheap restaurants...impressive art gallery, spacious and elegant..easy to get up and down by walk...recommended to visit...

A Must Do on Any Visit to Budapest. A must see. There is so much to see within the castle on the Buda side but the best reason to visit is the view across the Danube looking at Parliament and the rest of Pest.

On of my favourite places in the city. Castle Hill is just amazing. It is a little town inside fortified walls where you can find lots of attractions like museums, restaurants, churches etc.
Even if you don't enter any of the buildings I would still recommend the visit :) We really enjoyed walking around the streets of Castle Hill.

Fabulous Scenic View of Budapest. Best way to get to Castle Hill is by the Funicular Railway. The view of Budapest is spectacular on a clear day. There is a beautiful view of the Hungarian Parliament and Chain Bridge.

A Royal View of a Great City. Spent several hours here roaming around.the castle exterior and the fortified walls. Castle Hill is on the Buda side of the Danube River and we had great views of Parliament House and other architectural wonders on the Pest side. We could see Margaret's Island in the middle of the river.On the hill itself was St Matthias' church, an amazing structure. We found a few good cafes nearby and had lunch in the neighborhood. Lots of tourists and street vendors which is to be expected in such a historically important and visually beautiful place.

Good if you have a Budapest card. The museums are really interesting and worth a visit if you have the Budapest card as they're free entry. There are plenty of restaurants near to eat suiting all budgets, A lovely view of the city from the Fisherman bastion. We got to the museums for their opening (via the funicular railway), had lunch and looked at the shops nearby, and then got the tram down to the river to visit the Lukasz spa. A great day out.

Good view nothing else. . We took a taxi to there. It is very cheap in Budapest , paid about 2500 forint from the centre of the city. It has very good view but nothing else. We spend only 20 min were and took 20 min walk down to the streets. One time visit place.

Great view to the Danube River and the city. This is an area from where you can have a very nice view to the Danube River and to the city. There are also some other touristic attractions here as well as cafes or shops with local souvenirs. Walking in the area is relaxing if you reached the place by bus or funicular.
a must see. the view from the castle hill is superb. provides a full view of Budapest and the river with many restaurants providing ok food

Must do. you can spend the day on Castle Hill. Lots of eating places, very cool narrow streets to walk down as you explore, fantastic views, quiet !! - yes peaceful in spite of the crowds at Fisherman's Bastion.

Good historic area. An area for exploring the old part of Buda along with the palace ( museums) and Fisherman Bastion. Very hilly side but worth exploring. One can see the beautiful Parliament house, chain bridge, and liberty bridge at night time.
Landmark of the old empire. We did not go inside the castle, but just to view and walk around this historic building commanding a beautiful view is great.
Great views!. Great views over the Pest side of the city. We travelled to the top by bus & you can see all the significant sights. the cafes are expensive here.
Stunning views. Beautiful views and a completely different feel to the pest side of the river. Definitely worth the effort
Great views. Lovely views from the top, use the funicular to get there not very expensive. Lovely restaurant at the top too.

View could be better. If you walk all the way to the top from the Danube side, the walk is quite exhausting - and at some areas you can smell horse poo that gets disgusting. When you get to the top, you'll find several attractions that are listed separately. There is also a funicular to use if not interested in walking.The view could be nicer, since now the thing that catches your eye first is the Marriott Hotel on the other side, which seems to be in really bad condition on the outside. The Marriott and the Intercontinental Hotel next to it block most of the view to the other side of the river.Unless you have something to go to up there, I don't recommend going just for the views, there are a lot of better viewpoints around.I was surprised that the cafe at the top was really cheap, expected it to be really expensive because of a special location near tourist attractions.

Great view. It offers a great view of Budapest - better than the Citadella, even. Easy walk up - not worth taking the funicular, you can just take a stroll and reach the top. Amazing at night, with the city lit up.

don't miss it. Beautiful view of the Danube or of the Buda hills depending on which side you're at, free of charge, full with cute little shops, cafés and lovely old buildings. As a student attending school nearby, this was one of my favourite place to walk around or sit down (yes, very good location for a romantic date too). At sunset or evening it gets even more beautiful. Entering the castle district is free, but there are also churches and museums, and even the dance theatre to visit, not to forget the various festivals and markets held there every now and then.
The views... Enough said. It's free to walk around this area and it's easy to get to, so it is a great way to spend a few hours, in my opinion.

The Hills Are Alive with Castles. Budapest is the city of hills and plaines. While Pest is the flat seat of commerce, Buda on the other side of the Danube is a land of rolling hills and castles. Sprinkled among the castles are parks and restuarants dotting the hillside. Whether dining Al Fresco in one of the many cafes or partaking in fine dining at the many gourmet eateries, you can enjoy a breathtaking view of the Parliament, the Market, the Churches, and the bustle across the river. Tour buses stop at many places on Castle and other hills. Whatever your pricepoint you can find a quiet place to eat and reflect on the history across the river.
So much history and sheer beauty. Definitely plan to spend a full day on Castle Hill. You won't regret it. There is so much to see and to do, you may decide to go back a second day
Breathtaking view. Beautiful view of the Danube river and the Parliament from the hill. A very good walk to the top and down...

Impressive, free access. Visitors are free to wander around in the complex of buildings, which are very impressive. There are charges to enter Matthias Church (sep. review), and the castle ramparts – the latter only 700 Forints, under £2, well worth it for the views over the city.
Views are amazing. The views over Budapest and the Danube, from here are amazing. Well worth the visit even when the temperature was 99F

Beautiful views. It didn't take long to climb the hill to see beautiful views across the city. The buildings up the top are stunning.....it was soooooooo hot but there's plenty of cafes and restaurants to keep you hydrated.
Breathtaking. One of the best of europe. Very nice views of budapest city very relaxing and very pleasant. Every1 visiting budaoest should do this for sure.

architecture and views are magnificetn. We only had time for a tour of the cathedral and the surrounding grounds, but the church by itself was worth the visit. The view from the hilltop is, like so many views of Budapest, wonderful. Go early to avoid lines, no shelter from the elements while waiting to enter the church.Extra hint- the pharmacy near the tour bus stop is well stocked with helpful English speaking staff
Lovely day spent here. A slightly steep hill with a tram to the top which is worth the money to save the steps! Lots to do on the peak and quaint houses though the streets.

Enjoy the Walk From Pest. Walk across the famous Chain Bridge to the funicular up to the Castle and other notable stops including the Bastion and Cave Hospital. There is much to see for people with a variety of interests. It is easy to check out many sights in a small area.

The Changing of the Guard was good to see.. When visiting the Castle Hill, we stumbled across the Changing of the Guard outside the President's residence, by chance. Therefore, I do not remember what time exactly it was, but it was close to midday.

Steeped in history. No funicular ride to the top for us mountain goats! Charge ahead and hustle up the path which, by the way, is a long, long way up. But if you don't walk, how can you possibly appreciate the "bones" of the castle? The stone walls are medieval and the Baroque Buda castle creation sits atop the ruins. Integration of the eras is evident in the color, type, and structure of the stone remnants.At the top, the grounds are extensive, lots of statues, a great art museum (Hungarian National Gallery), and truly awesome views. A really fine bronze statue of formidable soldier-King Savoyai Eugen (1663-1736), done by artist Rona Jozsef, was a reminder of the rugged type who fought the battles which shaped Budapest (and all of Europe).There's a cute little cafe not far from the Palace and it seems to be less impacted with crowds like one finds near the Fiherman's Bastion.Strolling near by, pedestrian traffic leads to Sandor Palace, built in 1806, and presently serves as the residence of the country's President.
Great views of Budapest!. Best views in the whole city followed only by the Liberty Monument at the end of the ridge! You can also see the furthest down the Danube from the Liberty Monument.

Beautiful Budapest!. Must see if in Budapest, we took a tram from central Pest but on other occasions I have walked across the bridge and meandered around the lovely cobbled streets to Fisherman's Bastion and Buda Castle and beyond, beautiful place just gorgeous.

What a view. A breathtaking view of Budapest. Expect a LOT of people, fighting you for a spot, though.We got there by buying a 48 hour ticket at around $40, from one of the bus tour companies, that roam the city.Buying a ticket from them, give you 48 hours use of their busses and boats. You can get on and off whenever you want, for 48 hours, which is a GREAT way to sdee the city.
Gorgeous. If you like trekking or something, yoı should definetely walk, if you hate it, find a bus, rent a car, get in a cab but do something and get to that roof, view is wonderful

Amazing views of the Danube. We went up the funicular to the Castle area - It's a must see!!! We just wandered around up to the Fisherman's Bastion -truly gorgeous! There are some amazing little shops and a great self-service restaurant. Don't forget your cameras!! You don't need to be on a walking tour just get the tram to Margaret Island and walk the rest. We got a cheap taxi from the Castle to take us to the Citadel.I highly recommend that you get over to this side of the river!
View!. Beautiful view of the whole city-worth going up there-probably should have spent more time there enjoying the sights!

Not just about the view . Great place to wander about after pulling yourself away from the view. Wander past the church and the crowds disappear.We waited 20 minutes to take the funicular up but on walking down realised it's not very far or steep. I'd recommend the walk. Had a relaxing drink at Pest Buda cafe but was not impressed with the 13% service charge for two beers. I suppose it's typical in tourist spots to get fleeced.

Beautiful area. We stayed on castle hill and live the quaint feeling including all the nice restaurants. The evenings were great because most of the tourist buses leave the area and it is quiet and lovely to walk around. Get up early and take pictures of all the locations ((without people) befor the buses start arriving.

Get away from the crowds. It's obligatory to visit the Castle Hill in Buda on any visit to Budapest, if only to look at the view over the Danube and Pest. The hill is full of interesting places to visit. the old royal palace is now the national art gallery and the terrace in front of it offers more great views over Pest but you do feel that every tourist in the city has had the same idea. You can walk along the pretty narrow streets and admire the colourful buildings as you make your way to the Fishermen's Bastion. This is a 19th century folly built to take advantage of the great views toward the Parliament building. It can be rather crowded with tourists all trying to take the perfect photo. To get away from the annoying throng just keep on wandering down the street, past the church and it becomes much quieter. There a few tourists but e buildings are still pretty. There is also the national archives building at the end of the street and near that the military museum. You can loop back a long equally quiet, pretty streets where you will pass several embassies. There are also small restaurants round here that are not too busy even at lunchtime.I would absolutely eco end a wander around the back streets of Castle Hill to get a flavour of Buda and to get away from the madding crowd.
Great views. Prepare for a very hot walk if you are traveling in the summer, but the view over the other side of the city.
Stunning Budapest. Catch the Funicular to the top of the hill then wander across the top to see amazing building and stunning views of Budapest.

Intriguing history. An interesting tour guide visit of this fascinating city prior a Scenic River Cruise. Would have wished to see more of Buda-Pest. Only issue was the paid entry to toilet block which required certain currency to use, hence lineups.

Nice views, Great walk from here to the Fisherman's Bastion.. Nice views of the city. Take the Funicular to go up and then walk across the top of the hill, through the old town of Buda and reach the fisherman's bastion and St. Stephens.

Amazing castle at night and day. The castle looks amazing in the evening from the other side of the Danube, when it is beautifully lighted.
At day you can come here on foot for free, on bus or on funicular.
The greatest thing is changing of the guard at 12.00 It was interesting for adults and kids

Worth a quick tour; authentic handicrafts shops.. Worth a quick drive through and a brief stop. Very scenic. Not at all crowded (although we visited during a heat wave), with handicrafts shops along the way. We bought some trick puzzle boxes and the owner carved our name into the handmade boxes- he is quite a craftsman and the prices very reasonable considering the amount of work to make them!
Great views. Amazing views across the Danube, allowing you to view both the Buda and Pest parts of the city. Would recommend Korona Cukraszda nearby for refreshments.

A nice park and interesting buildings. A nice park and interesting buildings. A nice walk up the Embassy avenue to get there.We didn't enter any buildings, only took photos of them.Visited the Hero's Square on the way.

Must see-Castle Hill area. This is a heritage site and seen from river Danube bank from pest side. It consists of beautiful buildings and cobbled roads. We were in Budapest during 2015 Easter period and on the second day we planned to visit this after seeing Chain bridge and then zero point. We took Bus no 16 from the zero point, just crossing the chain bridge towards Buda side. However the bus originates from Deák Ferenc tér near the yellow line metro station and going to Donáti utca.There is a funicular service available from that point for going to top of the castle hill area, however that appeared too costly for us as the fare was 1400HUK for return where as the bus fare was 300HUK(as we took a block of 10 tickets)It took 15 mins to reach the top of the hill, stoppage named Dish Ter. We walked along the cobblestone streets and explored the area at our own pace. We visited Trinity Square, Matthias Church and Fishermen’s Bastion . We took lots of photos from the area of river Danube, chain bridge and Parliament and then proceeded to other attractions.

Two brilliant cities: Buda-Pest. Absolutely magnificient view of Buda and Pest. Its worth the walk or take the funicular up if walking isnt your thing. Take the time to walk around while on Casle Hill. Simply wonderful views of two cities.
A lovely peaceful location. lovely place with fantastic views of the city. A great place for walking around and taking in the atmosphere

Great view. This is the best view in the whole if Budapest. A great place to see the imperial palace, chain bridge and parliament. It is a bit of a hike to get to the top but it's a goo walk and rewarding at the top.
Stepping back in time. The castle was a modern look at the past way of life in Buda. Views of the city across the Danube were spectacular and the Mathias Cathedral is fabulous!

beautiful view. amazin place with beautiful view
there is no fee at enterance
you can walk all the way to the top of the hill
dont forget to try traditional cakes,they are aweeeeeesome

A must-see for all visitors to Budapest. Very interesting to see the Buda side of the river and Castle Hill will surely be on most people's list of must-sees. Wonderful views across to the Pest side of the river.
the best view. if you want nice foto of Budapest you have to reach this hill. in front of you is whole city. you can see river, bridges parliament and other nice buildings.
A nice walk through history. It will be quite a draw for history enthusiasts. A lot of walking required, give the funicular a miss, take bus no 16 instead or walk up/down the scenic pathway.

A must for visitors to Budapest. One can easily spend a day on Castle Hill. We visited the cathedral first and then Fisherman's Bastion to enjoy the view of the city. We had lunch at Café Pierrot which is also highly recommended.
Scenic views. Visit Buda Castle while on the hill. Take the viniculture for something different than walking to the top. Great views of The Pest side.
Another good viewing point in Budapest. We visited the top of castle hill as part of a city tour. The hill provides another good viewing point of the Danube and Pest in Budapest.
must visit, or you will miss half of Budapest sightseeing. great view. whenever i visit Budapest, icome up here. this is the best and only place (for me )worth to visit in Budapest.
Lovely setting. This is a lovely area to walk around, there were some nice shops and plenty of places to ear. It was a shame we didn't have enough time to do it justice
Stunning view, must do in budapest. we caught one of the hop on hop off buses and stopped here which gives an incredible view out over the Danube and Budapest
wonderful views of a great city. Great culmination of your hike or funicular ride. Good weather provided us with an unforgettable and panoramic view.
A must see in Budapest. This should be one of your first stops in Budapest. Although it is a bit of a challenge to climb (if you go on foot), but then the view definitely worth it.
Must see magnificent bldg. Very opulent ,magnificent place. You have to tour the inside to really appreciate. Lots of history. There is a nominal fee for the tour . It is worth it

Must go. Castle Hill stands out when you are in Budapest especially when you take the river cruise. I don't believe that anyone visiting Budapest will give this place a pass. We have the Hop on Hop off ticket and so taking the bus to the hill is easy. Here at the castle, you will get a stunning almost overall view of Budapest and the Danube. Great for picture taking and orientation of the city.

Viiew of Buda. During a viking trip we visited castle Hil, which is in the Pest part of Budapest. First the amazing church and than the walls and other buildings. From here you have a wonderful view of Buda.

Are you ready to sacrifice the classic pictures of yourself from Budapest? ;-). If yes, don't go there. Otherwise, place yourself somewhere in the corner of the picture so that others to see the great city.Actually, it's advisable to go there as a first site to get - apart from stunning views - some live (that's off-line :-) orientation of Budapest.Prepare to walk much, have comfortable shoes.
Amazing place. This place is an important part of Hungarian history and well worth a visit. The view over Budapest is breath taking. Dont miss it.
brilliant worth a visit. Brilliant views of the city and castle, such a beautiful place, breathtaking views and the little tram up to the castle is great although paid for
The best view over Budapest. This is the most spectacular view over the city, and you can enjoy the impressive royal castle from the Austria-Hungary empire

Beautiful sunset!. We visited here twice, once in the day and once at sunset. At sunset it is beautiful! You get amazing views, and also can see the sky very clearly. It's well worth the walk up to the top!

Superb views, HAVE YOUR CAMERA READY!. Fabulous place, a wow photo opportunity at every turn. You really don;t need a guide -it's all very easy to follow if you want to read the posters.Nearly all are in English as well as Hungarian It's all about the buildings and the views Then continue to Fisherman's bastion. Do the walking, much more satisfying than going by bus. Everything in Budapest is walkable.There are parts where a small fee is payable but most is free.
Great view of the Danube. Wonderful view of Pest and of the Hungarian Parliament Building, and of the Pest side of the river, as well as St. Stephen's Cathedral.

Amazing view. If you're looking for a great way to spend an afternoon in Budapest, there it is! Castle Hill is probably the best attraction there is in Budapest (aside from the parliament, which you can see from Castle Hill! Bonus points to Castle Hill.) So yeah, walk all the way to the top, where you will find many attractions (such as Buda Castle and St-Mathias church) and where you will have the most beautiful view of Budapest and the Danube River (it all makes beautiful photos). We went there when the sun was starting to set, which made the view even more spectacular!10/10 would recommend!

Great views and a lot to see. great views of Pest across the river (looking rather flat compared with the rolling hills on the Buda side. Well worth fitting into a sightseeing schedule as there are multiple sights to see (church, bastion, castle etc) whilst enjoying the views
The views!. Beautiful views and a wonderful, though rigorous, walk up should you choose to experience it. One of the highlights of our visit.
Great Views. We did the free walking tour up to Castle Hill. Great views and definitely worth the hike... We went back the next day to explore because we didn't do enough wandering the first day.
A dream. This place is more than beautiful in Budapest, this is a must to see place!! I recommend to walk up via Várkertbazár and go down by the sikló !
Well worth a trip.. The Castle Hill area is a favorite tourist destination for a reason. It has many beautiful attractions and a great view of the city below.

Must Visit Place!. If you go to Budapest you need to visit Castle Hill. You get some great views of the Danube and beautiful views of Budapest and you can image the deep history of the area. It is a slight hike up to the top and if you're not in shape you need to pace yourself. We visited in the daytime and there were lots of travelers and families up there and we always felt safe. You really need to take your time to stroll and visit -- we took about four hours and we still could have used more time.

Great views and cozy area. We walked around here quite a bit and got some great photos of the city and the Danube slithering its way through it. We were even lucky enough to capture a rain storm sweeping in across the city which turned out awesome in the photos.

Amazing Views of the City. Well worth going up to Castle Hill just to see the amazing views looking across the Danube to Pest. Great views both day and night as the Parliament building looks awesome lit up at night. If you use the Hop On Hop Off Bus Tour it will take you up to Castle Hill with the long climb by foot.

AN INCREDIBLE VIEW OF THE DANUBE AND PEST. This is one of the highest points in the city and provides an excellent view of everything below. We walked up from the bottom and it was quite a haul under the hot summer sun.
Amazing view of downtown Budapest. I would recommend visiting castle hill as it is a really beautiful area with an amazing architectural design. Moreover, the view of downtown Budapest is to die for.

high point for great sights. Good place for panoramic view of the city both day and night. A highlight of the trip especially at night when the lights of the city is breathtakingly beautiful and spectacular.
History revealed. The history of modern Hungary reveals itself here. Art, military and governmental existence is expesses.

Beautiful castle hill.. Must see, the best views looking down on Pest are from here. Stunning site. There is a whole little town with shopping, eateries, and the Main castle. See the change of the guard Do it with a tour guide to get the most out of it.

Great viewpoint and place to walk. Went up the hill by the little funicular, had to queue for a while but a fun thing to do.The views from the top across the Danube to Pest are outstanding and the area is pleasant to walk around, but can be very busy and does have that just for tourists feeling, complete with shops full of tacky momentos but the view is worth it.

There's so much to do up here. There's the castle, the old funky funicular, the roman ruins, the fisherman's bastion, the shops, the gelato... yes. The gelato. Not to mention the views of Budapest. It's worth the trek to the top for that alone.

Symbols of Budapest. Várhegy rises 130 meters above the Danube. From the Castle and the Chain Bridge offers breathtaking views of Pest, and they, along with the Statue of Liberty on Gellért Hill are regarded as symbols of Budapest. This panorama is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Amazing view. Enjoy!
Amazing!. Loved walking there, amazing view, gorgeous buildings, real feast for the mind and eyes. It is definitely must in Budapest.
Fun. Very nice views over Pest side, loved the atmosphere. If on a tour bus (hop on hop off) be prepared to walk a moderate distance to get the best views from the bus stop.

Best part of Budapest. Castle Hill has the best views of Budapest in the whole city and its a beautiful hike up to the top. There are a few short cuts up to the top and some ppl took buses but highly recommend the walk as you can't beat the views. The top of Castle Hill also has great restaurants and shops as well. Again, bring your camera as every way you turn is an amazing photo!
Beautiful site. Great view of river and Pest, plus some interesting buildings but the Castle, rebuilt many times was not outstanding

Lovely views. Lovely views over the city (especially to the Pest side of the city) and to the Hungarian Parliament Building. A little tough climbing up there especially on a hot day but definitely worth it.

Lovely area. A really lovely area to walk around with wonderful views of Parliament, the Danube and Pest. Excellent pictures from Fishermen's Bastion but as pointed out by another reviewer, you can access the higher level on the left hand side in front of the Hilton Hotel for nothing. Nice looking restaurants although we didn't eat there

A little Haven. A wonderful village type atmosphere, with plenty of cafes, bars, restaurants and souvenir shops. Just a short walk from the bus to St. Matthias Church and the Royal Palace, not to be missed

Best view in town. Castel Hill is a public space that includes a number of both public and privet buildings, including the presidential place and armed forces building, fantastic cathedral, fisherman walk or lookout and several small (bit expensive) boutique hotels and restaurants. There are also a number of little shops around the area that sell both (high quality/local) traditional and modern arts and crafts, as well as a few that sell the normal tourist crap. The best thing about the Hill is its stunning views of the river below and Pest side of town, also trip up or down the funicular car is worth the trip on its own.

wasn't very interesting. There wasn't really much to see. Would rather spend my time doing something else. It was boring. The Pest side of the Danube was where all the real action is. We did have lunch in Buda & enjoyed that.
Breathtaking view of the city. We enjoyed walking around the historic castle and exploring the Matthias Church. The architectural styles reflect the thousand-years and more of Hungarian history.

Make it one-way!. The hill is definitely worth a visit, not just for the churches, small town, and "castle", but also for the views. Unless you are into hundreds of steps, take a taxi or tour that will drop you off at the top, do your visit, then walk downhill, and across the Chain Bridge back into town.

Check out the changing of the guard.. Not the biggest changing of the guard ceremony you will ever see, but it was a nice ceremony and the crowds were not large. Nice place for a stroll, but little shade on a sunny day.
Great views. We stayed at the Hilton here, and the views were awesome. This area is lovely and very pedestrian oriented

Great history and beautiful overlook of the city. A great place to photograph parliament, the Danube and Pest. There are many things to see on the hill while you are there. Transportation is easy and takes you to the top. If you are up for the climb, you can also walk to the top and have some great vantage points on the way up.
Finest View. I happen to take the Big Bus tour where they took me to the Castle hill the place has a great view...You Get the panoramic view of the city
Worth the walk uphill for the view. Although the temperature was 42C we decided to walk up. The path is a gradual climb and luckily mostly in the shade. The view at the top is really lovely
Must see if you are in Budapest. Colorful buildings and nice views if you like architecture and photography, so don't miss it be ready for history from 1030 years....

Stunning Views. Visited here during our recent city break in Budapest. Stopped off as part of the Hop on Hop off bus tour. Stunning buildings, fantastic views over the Danube and Budapest. Several places to eat either formal or informal. Whilst there we were fortunate to see the changing of the guard. Great place to spend a few hours walking around the Royal Palace, the Fisherman's Bastion and Matthias Church. Highly Recomended.
Must-see. Crowded with tourists and hot in the summer, but worth fighting the crowds. Amazing views of the city, and host to many of the city's major landmarks.
Go, go go !. Such a great walk with beautiful views at the top. I would definitely recommend walking up rather than getting the bus up as it really is lovely!
Great walking tour high above the city.. From the Fisherman's Bastion you get a expansive view of the city and the Danube River. Coble stone streets and good restaurants add to the experience.

One of my favorites.. I spent many summers in Hungary as a kid and it was 16 years since I was back and as soon as I seen the hill it all came back it truly is one of my favorite places in the city. I love to stroll the streets take in the views eat ice cream every few 100 m :). Stop at cafes and just relax. I don't recommend dining on castle hill except for lunch at Var Bistro a cafetiere style place with good food at a fair price. they have a amazing ice cream and coffee shop next to it also. I will warn travelers who have never been bring comfy shoes and be ready to do some stairs (Allot of stairs). You can get a taxi up and just run around the top but I feel you miss many neat shops and sights that way so I encourage you to walk it but please be prepared for it. I have a few photos attached of great spots and little things some people may never find. Let me know if I can help at all if you are going over.

Staying of Castle Hill was lovely. We found that staying on Castle Hill worked well for us. While nightlife on the Hill was quiet, there are plenty of eateries if you don't want to go to the Pest side. Transportation to the Pest was easy and reliable when we wished.

Amazing view. You can use kind of train to go up or walk.We did walk and it was not hard.There several sightseeings such as museum,old structure of old building ,cathedral etc.Museum building is kind of new so don't expect old building and ild decoration but paintings in there were amazing.More amazing than arts there,is staff.THey are the nicest I have ever seen.Cathedral is great next to cathedral there is a kind of gothic style wall with the view of city which is great.
Worth the walk to get the view!. When wandering around, wander up the hill. It's not a gentle walk, but it's not like you need hiking shoes. Great panoramic shots of the city.

Beautiful views of the dirty - even in the rain!. Definitely worth the walk up. My daughter and I visited Budapest for a long weekend, walked very where, saw everything, even got the subway out to the huge open air spa. Definitely make the trip to the top, walk through the park if you can, yes it is a little steep in places but easily do able!

Favourite part of Budapest. Beautiful area to explore, maybe go with a tour guide or book one day then come back and explore by yourself. There's a bombed out church on Kapisztran Ter that we saw which had photographs and information about WW2 in Hungary, hardly anyone else there.
Wonderful Views. It is certainly worth the hike to get this view! Sure, there is public transportation as well, but either way, get to the summit.

Beautiful viewes of the city. The Castle Hill and Buda Castle offer beautiful grounds to walk around and really nice views of the city (the only place higher with better views is Gellert Hill. The museum was ok.

Buda. Definitely place to visit-whole area is very interesting. From Castle to Fishermans bastion to Cathedral and oldest cake shop. Could easily spend few hours in area- its huge.Best view back to Pest.

What a view, what a place.... Crossing the bridge, up in the cable car and you find yourself in a magical toy town world of buildings, soldiers and architecture to delight. Take in the breath-taking views and a coffee along the way. has to be done and experienced.
Historic. A beautiful side of Budapest, great to overlook the city! We took the hop on hop off bus to get here, really easy. Just take some time to walk around and enjoy the views/surroundings.
Fun. I really enjoyed roaming around the old buildings and visiting the shops. It was like walking through a painting. I'd like to visit again.
Danube Waltz. Wonderful hike up to the castle complex. Nice afternoon spent wandering around. Beautiful view, great pictures and a cold beer. A must ride down the funicular.
Castle Hill - fit for a King. The history and the location deliver a double whammy - it is all truly excellent. The Matthias church is a jewel. And, you must try the "Siklo"!

The best of Budapest. All attractions of Buda is at one place...on the castle hill. The Royal Palace, Mattias Church, Fisherman's Bastion, Savoyai Terrace and the Mattias Fountain. The views of Pest, parliament and the chain bridge are the best from the Savoyai Terrace (outside the Royal Palace). P.S.: We didn't buy any souvenirs up here thinking it would be cheaper in downtown Pest, but on the contrary the best souvenirs was in the market located on the right hand side outside the Royal Palace going towards Mattias Church and at best prices. You can also haggle a bit here.

A good walk. On one side there are a lot of steps and a steep incline to get to the hill .... there is another way in which is just a gradual incline which is the easier route.Worth the walk either way .

What a view!!!. The Castle District is a must if you visit Budapest. Buda Castle, the Hungarian National Gallery (wow), the Matthias Church, the Fisherman's Bastion are some of Budapest's top sights in an area with an amazing view to the city and theDanube... If you go there by getting the Castle Hill Funicular (which is recomended), take the first carriage for the best view

How Amazing - attractions, food and a view. This area is spectacular and an absolute must do while in Budapest. Every turn has yet another wonderful building or view. It has great restaurants, lovely hotels from The Hilton to smaller boutique options. It can be reached by a local bus, furnicular and a walk or a steep walk. It is also only a few Euros from the town centre by taxi. We stayed I this area. I initially thought it was out of the way and we would need to travel constantly. That was not the case. Attractions include; Fishermans Bastion; Matthias Church; Museum of music history; the Royal Palace and much more.It is beautiful during the day or in the evening as the lights come on across the Danube.

Relaxing, quiet and beautiful views. There are some beautiful views of Budapest, albeit they're slightly interrupted by the huge hotels! It's a really relaxing place to wonder round. We walked to the top (a really gentle walk) and visited the castle before getting the funicular back down. I'm not sure the funicular was worth the money but it was something to do! There are also some museums within the castles of which at least one is free to enter with the Budapest card.
Beautiful view. Photographers this place will give you breath taking views of Budapest. Lot of places to eat around. Make the most of it

Beautiful views, worthy attractions, definitely a must-visit. Budapest is an old city with a history of over a thousand years. So it's no surprise that the highest part of the city, found in this corner of Buda, was the natural site for a defensive castle to be built. These days, the entire Castle Hill district is a tourist attraction in its own right and should not be missed. It's most well known for the Fisherman's Bastion with grand views of the Danube and Pest skyline, Matthias Church, and naturally the castle itself. But what I also enjoyed were the quiet streets that sometimes intersect at odd angles, as well as the old but well-maintained buildings that give the outskirts the air of a pleasant country town. I didn't stay till after sunset but it's seemed a lovely place to have dinner at one of the nicer restaurants.There are several ways to get to Castle Hill, the easiest of which is via the funicular located directly opposite Chain Bridge. I chose to take the route recommended by my guide book - M2 subway to Szell Kalman ter station before walking up Varfok St to the entrance to Castle Hill marked by the stone arched gateway that opened into Bescikapu ter. In reality, it was a little confusing finding the right road to follow after exiting the station and climbing the pedestrian steps as directional signs weren't very obvious, and I did resort to using a map app on my mobile phone to make sure I was going the right way. Climbing the slope in mid-summer was a rather hot slog; on hindsight, I should have taken the #16 bus and saved myself a lot of sweat. After visiting castle hill, I opted to descend via the scenic way by taking the funicular ride.
View. If you love great views, you should go here. We went quite late in the evening so we could see all the city lights. Amazing. I really love stuff like this
A strenuous and wothwhile walk. Stunning scenery and beautiful views along with a wonderful museum makes this a must see. Make sure to explore all of the nooks and crannies!

Crown Jewel of Buda. We stayed in this section, so got to enjoy it when the buses were finished disgorging hundreds of people each day. Despite the periodic crowds, it is immaculate and beautiful. Great restaurants, good little shops, kind of like another village within the city. It is walled and car traffic is limited. Buses empty and then park down the hill. So it is quite pedestrian friendly and is the access to the castle itself, several beautiful churches, and the labyrinthine series of caves under the hill.
nice view. be sure to take the hop on hop off bus. Even then expect to walk a lot to see what is on top. On a hot day go prepared with good walking shoes and water.
What a view!. Glorious panoramic views of river Danube and Parliament building. A must see if you are visiting this beautiful historic city. We enjoyed our whole day out.

Great option for walking. Castle Hill is wonderful and is extremely walking friendly. Take the day or two and enjoy the sights. Wear comfortable shoes and bring some type of camera. From the Fisherman's Bastion you can get great photos of Parliament. There are also some wonderful walking paths that offer great views and photo opportunities of unique Budapest offerings.

The Castle District should not be missed!. It rained the morning we walked the streets of the Castle District past the beautiful homes, restaurants, and shops. The streets were spotless, there were many dining options, and the views were phenomenal. I also appreciated the architecture and the attractive colors of the residences and shops.
