Much better looking at it from a boat ride.. We went by this during one of the "hop on, hope off rides". There were a lot of tourists so we just looking from the fringes. But, at night on one of the dinner cruises the place looked amazing!!!!

Great place to see a great view of Budapest. Great place to see a great view of Budapest From up there.
Really a perfect place to take pics for memorizes.
Lovely views. Fantastic views over the whole area and panoramic views of river Danube and Parliament building. A must see/visit ! Enjoyed the whole day out on double decker in 28 degs sun.

Views to die for!. It's quite a trek up this hill but absolutely worth it once you see what lies at the top - Budapest looks incredible from up here!You can also visit other sites nearby including matthias church and the presidents house.

What a view and great walking tour.. In you are into walking, cross the bridge over the Danube and take the funicular up to Castle Hill. Great views and interesting historic area. Oh, yes, lots of local crafts and souvenirs. And, English spoken everywhere.

A long walk but amazing views. I walked from Prague central, it did take a while and the hill is a beast to tackle, but it was lovely at the top, amazing views and inside the castle and surroundings it was really pretty. There are little souvenier shops and small cafe's to sit in.

A hill t of Budapest with bonuses!. Bonuses, beacause not just one of the most historical point of Budapest but instantly you get two visitors' task ticked: Strolling round The Castle; almost the best Sightseeing point (overlooking both Pest and Buda's city Central including the Parlament!).There is much more to it though. Beneath you (inside the hill) there is a maze of caves. This has a built bunker which now functions as a Bunker-Hospital Museum >> worth seeing too and entry is cheap. This gives you a good insight of what a treasure is still hiding beneath the surface of the castle. Who know maybe even a movie-like super modern bunker for ...Here you can find probably the oldest houses too. In fact the part of the governament plans to move its bases there (stylish idea).Here its worth to spend a good part of thge day at any season! There is also museums, parks, strolling paths with many benches to use, cafes, festivals if your timing is lucky too. Ouh and there is a special transportation to move up on the hill if you "can't" afford walking - you will find it:).Enjoy!!

Only positive feelings. Castle Hill in Budapest is the place where you can spend days - like we did. The view from the hill is spectacular. You can use a bus #16a which passes very often and it will take you in a minutes from city centre to the hill and back. The changing guard ceremony was really good experience - you can take amazing pictures if you are ready. Have fun!

Nr1 historical touristic attraction of Budapest. There are so many things to see! So many old buildings, some ruins , etc..You can pend several days to see everything but minimum a day is required.I dislike that the local municipality is probably against the growing tourism, there for the area is not alive any more, many restaurants closed down, no shops, etc...I remember that some Years ago we went with all our guests to the Castle Hill for dinner or lunch!Now after visiting the Museums and old streets with nice houses there is nothing to do!Even transportation is difficult, with cars and buses the entry and parking is difficult!

The crown of Budapest!. Budapest was the termination of our river cruise, and we arrived early on a fall morning. The hills of Buda and Castle Hill were amazing from the river, and we had trouble deciding whether we should focus on Parliament or on Castle Hill. As it turns out, our ship was docked on the Pest side with a breathtaking view of Castle Hill, especially at night when the structures are lit, and the graceful lights of the Chain Bridge frame the view. It was fun viewing the hill from the Danube, and we made 2 separate tour visits plus a taxi ride up to the Budapest Hilton that sits immediately behind Fishermen's Bastion and next door to the cathedral. Just a fantastic experience all the way around. Parking, however, would be problematic if you tried to drive up on your own, and parking is strictly limited on top of the hill. Take a taxi, or enjoy a bus tour and see it all.

Castle Hill. I really enjoy Castle Hill in Budapest on the Buda side. It has wonderful views over the River Danube and interesting shops and eating areas along the historic streets. Spend time exploring on foot and you also see views over the other side opposite the Danube. Well worth a visit with museums and roman ruins and old palaces and churches. Public transport (buses) can take you to the area.
castle. Beautiful stunning place well worth seeing. Stayed in this district exceptionallly clean would go back to budapest definitely.

The Blue Danube at its Best. Our tour bus from Scenic Boat Cruise took us up to this viewpoint over looking the Danube and Budapest.. Besides the very picturesque view, we also could see our ship the Scenic Jewel.should you be thirsty or hungery there are plenty of vendors waiting for your Euros. Of course, there is an abundance of vendors selling souvenirs of your stay in Hungary.

Best views n Budapest. The views are spectacular over the Danube from Castle Hill. Well worth taking a slow stroll, or even a jog along the pathways winding up the hillside. Stop at one of the many viewing points to take photos, you will get wonderful shots and memories.
Worth a visit. We took the funicular to the top of the hill and walked down. Lots to see at the top of the hill and well worth a visit.

Buda Castle. The location and the preserved structures / castle as a whole. The changing of the Guards ceremony, the view from the top and the surroundings there itself - all very good. The alternate to the expensive venicular could be the local buses.

Interesting bus ride. St Matthias Church is worth looking into and then walking up through its corridors and spiral staircases. The area around the piazza and the Fishermans Bastion within the castle walls is visually interesting. Unfortunately, St Matthias is not on the Budapest card free list, so you have to pay - but not a lot. Transport back down was a problem. We got on a 16a Bus when we needed a 16 - both go from the same stop. This took us down the hill and round to the wrong side, so we had to wait for another 16a, to take us all the way back up again and then find a 16 to take us back down to the Szechenyi bridge.

The main attraction of the city. This is in my opinion the epicenter of Budapest in terms of history and tourism. The presidents office is located here was well as the largest of the museums for the history of the city. The old castle walls and peaks are still there which you can go up and explore. The medieval district is here as well, we went early to avoid the tour buses. Can either take a ride up on the funiculer or there as multiple climbing stairs if don't want to pay. The church is located here, also they have plenty of places to eat if need a refreshment why you are there.

Love this area. We stayed in this area. It is a great area to wander around in and enjoy the sights. There is plenty to visit and see. The views of the parliament and the river from here are stunning.
Awesome Views of Budapest. Castle Hill provides awesome views of the city and is worth the visit. I was able to see it during a scooter tour of the city and took some great pictures of the city.

Take your camera, lovely views. Great views. Easy access by bus. Try the cable car, we used it to descend. You can wander around here for at least a couple of hours. Eating is not expensive, there are lots to choose from.
Loved the old town!!!. We thoroughly enjoyed the area!!!! Always love the older parts of a European city!!! We walked around and had a nice lunch and the beauitiful cathedral there.
Castle Hill. Great place to visit for photos. There are also museums. Take the trolley up to the area. The shops are expensive so you may want to just loo. .

PERFECT. Absolutely perfect place to stay and see the dawn, sunset, midday, anything... the surrounding area includes the wonderful church of Matthias, the Buda Castle (which hosts the Hungarian National Gallery), the Fishermen's Bastion, etc. The views are formidable, too.

Great views! Make sure you walk up. This site gave phenomenal views of the whole city! There is stairway off of the road where you can walk up and stop on viewing platforms. The workers for the mini trams will tell you it is a long, hard walk up, but it took less than 10 minutes! Don't pay for the tram up. I recommend the cafe at the top!

Great views, and changing of the guard. The old castle on castle hill in Buda is now two museums (closed the day we were there), and the offices of the Hungarian President. There is a formal guard at each entrance, and a regular schedule changing of the guard (I think hourly, but definitely at 11:00 am) which is fun to watch with all the pomp and ceremony. The historic structures are interesting, and the view over the Danube and Pest is certainly worth it. If not on a tour, you can take the #16 bus to the top of the hill (steep walk otherwise), or you can stop at the bridge below and take the funicular to the top of the hill (a pricey option). If you walk around the Danube side of the old castle, you can see the medieval foundations and walls which still lie beneath the modern structure. Be sure to pause and take in the several fountains, as they are charming (especially the hunting scene with 3 very intense hunting dogs - if you like dogs, that is)..
Best part or Budapest. Don't miss this, fantastic views of the city and lots to go and see and do up here. Particularly beautiful in good weather. Easy to reach via the metro and then a short walk.
A must do. Even without going into the art gallery we spent the best part of a day wandering around the area and soaking up the ambiance.
beautiful. View and apple strudel. Take you time and wonder around. Try the less crowded evenings and the fisherman's bastion is free.
Scenic. I certainly recommend a walking tour of Castle Hill. Quaint buildings, shops with handicrafts, Matthias Church, and scenic overlook of the city. Well worth the visit!
Photographers heaven. Not to be missed. Wonderful buildings and affording magnificent views across the Danube.Do not forget you camera.

Old Empire architecture and many restored buildings. Nice historic area with the massive castle, Matthius Church and other nice places to walk around. If one is in descent shape, walking up the stairs is no big deal, but in the summer best done early in the morning. Unlike much of other parts in Buda and Pest there has been significant restoration done in this area, and it is missing the Soviet era ugly architecture that pops up in so many other places around Budapest.
Great place from near and afar. The views and the atmosphere are wonderful. Use the funicular if you don't fancy the walk up. Visit early or late for free access onto the Fisherman's Bastion.

We did not spend a whole lot of time, but enjoyed the view. We did not tour the whole grounds but did enjoy the views from the top, took the finicular up and walked back down over the bridge. It was nice just to walk around up top, no need to go into any of the exhibits.

Buda side of Budapest. Wonderful view! The Buda side of Budapest is quaint and lovely with amazing views. Nice walk from the Fishermen's Bastion to the Royal Palace. Everyone visits Matyas Church, which is splendid, but don't miss the ruins of Church of St Mary Magdalene!

The views!!!. We took a hop on, hop off tour which was perfect to orient ourselves to both sides of the Danube. There are 2 places you can get off to see the views (from the hilltops) of the Castle, the Danube River, the Parliament house, the bridges and the city skyline. Don't stick to one side but see both sides of the Danube as they are both beautiful! Try to walk both sides of the river at night because the major sites are lit up, including the castle, the Parliament House and the bridges. We did not have a tripod so we used the walls along the river for some great night pictures.
Views. Wonderful views of the whole area and lots to do and see photographs from here look splendid, could spend all day here easily
Lots to see and do. So much to see and do in this area and easy to get access via the hop on, hop off bus. You could easily spend a whole day and more exploring.
A must see. Very nice buildings, very nice view of Pest and Danube. It is a must see place in Budapest. You can walk up or take Funicular

Exceptional views of Budapest.. This is the best view you will get of this incredible city and it is definitely worth taking the time to come up here. The facilities at the top are good too - local artists selling their wares and a very good cafe that allows you to drink Champagne whilst drinking in the vista.

Castle Hill. Great place to visit. Go when you have some time to explore at least a half day as there are wonderful sites to visit, shopping and great views of the city. If possible check it out both day and at least the night views.
Castles and Churches. Amazing Views of the city. Great day excursion. Buda is wonderful. The difference from Pest is obvious as a hilly suburb of the city. Great history. Put your walking shoes on!

Beautiful but you cannot enter. Actually you can but it is an art gallery now. From the grounds you get a terrific view of the city and the Danube. You walk past the presidential palace, where we saw the guards singing to each other as they stood at attention. It is a little difficult to locate one's self but anyone will help you.
Best view of the Danube and the Pest waterfront. We stayed here during or recent visit to Budapest. The variety of monuments makes this district truly special.

Include this in your walk around Buda. Lovely cobbled streets, and some lovely old buildings, although some still in need of quite a bit of refurbishment, although lots of activity going on which will improve the aesthetics of the area in the long term.

At the top of Buda's hill!. This is a large area high above Buda with a wonderful view of the entire city and the Danube. There are many large, beautiful buildings to view at the top. A variety of areas also exist where you can just hang out and enjoy the view. A nice variety of small restaurants are also present. This is a good spot to spend a couple of hours wandering. You can walk, take a bus tour or ride the funicular to reach the top.
Best view of the city. The walk is long but worthy. Take your time to stop in some spot because the view is just amazing. And bring water.
Relaxing Day out. There is a lot to see in this area and we found it a very relaxing day. there are plenty of views of the city to be seen and there was a lot of street entertainment when we visited.

Take your time, don't rush. Castle Hill is a wonderful place to roam. It has some lovely restaurants and the best views of the city. Take your time to walk around the perimeter and watch the magpies playing amongst the archeological ruins. They have a small yet interesting changing of the guard at the palace. Before the castle is a music hall, there is a plaque that states that Beethoven had played there. Fascinating stuff!

Lovely sights . Take the funicular up there so you see the Pest side while going up on the Buda side to get to Castle Hill. The floor is rocky with heels, so wear flats! And the shops and people are so friendly.

Breathtaking vistas of Budapest from castle hill. There are so many beautiful things to see in this area...the royal palace, cathedrals. The shopping is wonderful and the street vendors were willing to bargain with a great sense of humor. The restaurants are also very nice.

Not to be missed. We strolled across the Chain Bridge but ignored the tram and came up through the winding garden which had an escalator and elevator. We enjoyed walking along the top of the wall toward the palace and museums. We have some lovely photos from that walk. It was easy to spend a day up there seeing everything - Fisherman's Bastion, the church, the old town hall, and marzipan museum, eating ice cream.

Like a fairy tale. Wonderful view from the bus on the Buda side from a Hop on Hop off bus tour in English - a good way to get there for the tourist. Some of our group cycled up there in the rain. Ours was the better choice I thought!There are bathrooms at the top - always a consideration inn Europe.
Amazing view!. Amazing views of the city. Lots of little stalls selling scarves and trinkets. Not that busy either but I was there in low season.

Stunning!. Aside from boasting the most beautiful views over Pest, Castle Hill has some of Budapest's finest attractions, churches, museums and even a decent selection of restaurants. On the one hand it is considered by locals as a tourist trap, on the other, it is a wealthy residential area. It is kept immaculately clean and groomed, and a pleasure to navigate through. Whether visiting an attraction or just going for a stroll without a particular purpose, it is thoroughly enjoyable.
Castle Hill. Spectacular view of the city....truly amazing. Take the hop on/hop off bus.....takes you up to the top.

Beautiful architecture and view of the Pest side!. Visit the Buda side at Castle Hill and see the beautiful St. Mathias cathedral. Take pictures of the Parliament building across the river on the Pest side. Make sure you go on a nice day...kind of dreary when it's raining and not a lot of covered space. We held out and our 3rd day the sun came out and we got beautiful pics
Castle Hill. One of the must sees in Budapest. Nice views of the city. The church there is lovely to see. It is easy to get to.

Best part of the Hungarian history, one must not miss it. The "civil part" includes among others medeval dwelling houses in romantic streets. The "palace part" houses (besides the Presidental Seat, a theatre,etc.) the National Gallery and the Historical Museum. Best panorama of the city!

Better to walk up rather than take the funicular. Lovely walk up a gently hill. Can stop at regular intervals on the way up and take in the spectacular views over the Danube and Budapest . We spent 3 hours walking around and having a lovely lunch up there. We witnessed 2 weddings in the church whilst we were up there. Could loll around all day. Visited the underground caverns. Very scary and dark. I bumped into a wall. Did not go into palace. Great views from palace walls. Free to walk arou d the grounds. Burgers type vans around the back of the palace which made that side a bit tacky. Overall a great walk and a lovely half day. Two lovely churches on the hill and a disney-style castle wall around this castle hill which resembles a walled citadel (a city within a city).

Everything you want. Old walls and Middle Ages gates, bastions and towers, big impressive castle, old city with narrow streets, wonderful view over the Danube. What else you can want, it takes whole day to walking and watching everything.
Scenic. Stunning views all round from this hilltop location, with the beautiful Parliament house and river at your feet.
must see. The best views of the city are from atop this hill. There are also several interesting buildings that cannot be missed.

Amazing view. If your lucky enough to walk the hill on a sunny day, you will be amazed wherever you look. The beautiful Danube with it's stunning buildings on both sides is just perfect. There's an amazing castle on the hill. It's just an unforgettable stroll.
Can't miss in Budapest. The hill offers a lot for tourists - magnificent cathedral, fisherman's bastion, Buda castle, and a view of the whole city.

Great place to explore. Many paths to take with different views and surroundings, we liked it a lot. We went up with the elevator, but there are possibilities to get into the palace area without that.
nice city, nice food :). lovely city, lovely people, lovely place to go and go and go again.... hope to go there soon for another nice time.

A Special Area. Castle Hill is a lovely historic district in the hilly Buda part of Budapest. Museums, churches, restaurants and shops and other places of historic value abound. My husband and I stayed for 3 days and walked everywhere. Some of the inclines and stairs will be a challenge for people who are mobility impaired, but otherwise this is a quieter, less hectic part of the city. Lots of tour groups but you can avoid them fairly well if you want a quiet stroll, or if you like to be around more people when in an unfamiliar place you can do that, too.

in love with the Castle. Totally in love with the architecture, perfect! Stunning view and amazing historical background. It has a unique vibe, that i've never experienced in my life. A must see in Budapest! :)
Magnificent Architecture and Views. This is one of the most impressive sites we've visited in European cities. The grandeur is incredible and the views over the Danube are amazing.

A great view. Do not miss a tour to the castle hill because the view from up here is unlike anything and the cameras just love the place. Splendid and breathtaking and it also provides you with the royal history if you make it to the castle or simply wander around these areas to take in the best of Budapest.

Great views. It's a hike up the steps (like 200 of them!) to get to the castle hill from the lower area but it's worth it. You can also take a bus, or the funicular (though our guide didn't seem to think the wait time or cost of the funicular was worthwhile).
Great views of the Danube, Parliament, St. Stephens...
Pleasant. You must pat a visit to castle hill lovely place to see and to hop off the bus and have a stroll. Lovely views from here

Take the time.. .. will find it VERY worthwhile..era will find it VERY worthwhile. If you have the time to view this area.. please do.. you and your camera will find it VERY worthwhile.. This area is hard to believe unless you can see the it was "GOOD TO BE KING!!".. Must be seen if you have time......
Beautiful view. A beautiful view, you can take the cablecar up and down though walking is easy, and there is a nice museum

Well worth a visit. Take a walk up to this side of the river for amazing views of the castle district and also the views of budapest and the view of the other side of the Danube. The steps up are steep but you need some good exercise on holidays to fight off the beers and food etc. The castle area is touristy but that's normal. You can't really visit much inside the castle either but it's all good fun. The view over the bridge and to the Parliament on the other side of the river is fantastic. You can take the funicular up the hill for a price if you cant walk up.

Beautiful view of the city. There is not much to see on the top except a beautiful view of the Danube and the hungarian parliament. At the most a hour there would be great the enjoy the view and take some pictures.

How much time do you have. Perhaps the only thing that could spoil your enjoyment of Castle Hill is Shortness of time.There is the Palace Fisherman`s Bastion and Matthias Church to start with. Wonderful Views,several cafes,shops plus people live there. You need at least 4 hours to do it justice.

Filled with great activities for a day or two, but don't spend all your time here.. A lovely place to visit for the afternoon, and definitely hit up the famous Ruszwurm Cukraszda, one of the oldest bakeries in BP. It supposedly has the best kremes in the city. Definitly visit the fisherman's bastion, and maybe the Rock Church or the Cave Hospital. Definitely visit the museums in the Castle. But after you've spent a day or two here, move on! There is so much more to see, either in Buda or Pest. Castle Hill is tourist central, and although it's beautiful, there are more edgy and interesting places to visit in Pest.

Breathtaking. It is absolutely beautiful especially when it is all lit up at night. There is a lot to see so give yourself enough time to do it all and also to have a drink at one of the outdoor tables and people watch.

Many sights in one . Castle Hill is a great area to do and see a lot of things in Budapest. First and foremost, don't waste your money taking the tram up the hill. It's a short 10 minute walk with amazing views as you make your way to the top.
A must-see..and never see it top many times. Love Budapest.. One of the highlights of Budapest, if not THE highlight. Wonderful architecture. Wish visitors could see more.
Views to die for!. Castle Hill is a must when visiting Budapest. It's a bit of climb, but you can always take the Funicular up and walk down. The views of the Danube, and across Pest are stunning.

Great views & history. The views from up-top and the history lesson is worth the visit - it's almost unavoidable. Apparently at certain times of the year they have festivals / markets and things which would be worth it i'm sure.
A walk into the history. Very mice place to visit. Take good shoes on you. There are lots of places to visit on th hill and the view is spectacular.

Wow! Beautiful sights of the Danube!. Well, this is in fact one of the most beautiful spots to check out a perfect scenery of the Danube! If you're fit, go up the hill. If not, you can always take the elevator (funicular).

Enjoyed. Liked the Ambiance of the place, an Impressive Church with very different colorful roof with designs made from locally made ceramic tiles by a special process, Overlooking the highly impressive Parliament it also has lots of history as we understood when we took a walking tour. Also good cafes, excellent dessert cakes and shopping. Great.

Completely different to Pest. After easy public transport there (and back), I spent a couple of hours just wandering around and discovering all the little shops (albeit tourist-orientated but with a very good art gallery Kiskep Galeria in a back-stree). And of course stunning views of Pest as well as the surrounding areas.
great view. you can walk with a great view over the city.Many restaurants. you can go by stairs. The Mathew church is very beautiful but you have to pay to go inside and closed at 17h
Worth at least half a day. Shame old castle was destroyed through war,but nethertheless this area well worth a visit.We enjoyed also visiting the old Church.The views across the Danube are very nice.

Must-do. Great views from Castle Hill of Pest and the Danube. We did the 'BigBus' free walking tour of castle hill on our first day in Budapest! (Free when you buy their 2 day ticket - highly recommended) Excellent way to view all the best bits of castle hill. Castle Hill gives great panoramic views of the city - great for getting our bearings on our first full day!
Beautiful grounds. Very beautiful grounds with a great view of Pest. Nice to stroll and see the statutes and fountains.
Lovely Views. Great views of the rest of the city from this location. If you want to get up there by the funicular railway then it is quite expensive. The walk isn't too bad at all and much nicer.

Nice view of Pest. Although I didn't visit the Buda Castle or the museums there, the Castle Hill still offers a nice evening walk, From the Fisherman's Bastion you can see a panorama of Pest across the river and there are many nice buildings too around St.Matthias Church.
Brilliant view of the Danube and Pest. Loved the views over the river and the Parliament in particular and the castle and churches and streets at the top of the hill were quaint and interesting.

Night time visit - great views and miss the crowds. We had a tip to visit the Castle Hill at night and we had a great experience. There are few people there later on and the view of illuminated 'Pest' is great.

Castle Hill. This is a stunning place to visit; the mechanised link to get there is expensive and the queues can be long but the views and amenities at the top are well worth the effort. For those reasonably fit people the walk takes around 5 - 10 minutes and is not too strenuous

Take the lift!. We made the mistake of climbing the hill from the back of the castle, and having to do a lot of steps and slopes, without much of a view. However, at the side which faces the river there is a lift service which will take you all the way to the top where there are great views.

Buda of Buda-Pesti!. Welcome to Budapest!Today is a very HOT day, 35 degrees centigrade,i made a mistake of staying in Budapest for the weekend because it's a very Hot weekend and i don't like hot weather.Nonetheless i braced it,i wore a baggy pant with scanty T-shirt and did what i haven't done for almost 10 years.Hopefully i will do it again in the fall when i am in Budapest and the weather is a little bit colder
Spectacular!. The winding cobblestone streets and small shops will make you think you have been transported back in time.
walk on the romantic hill. A very romantic place....easy to reach, not so expensive the way to. You could even think to stay on a movie....

A great introduction to the city. Worth getting out to castle hill at start of holiday to soak up the history, with great views over Pest. Lots of beautiful old buildings and good places to eat, drink, and people watch

Gorgeous Views!. We walked over the bridge from our hotel to do a walking tour of Castle Hill We did not take the tram / funicular up. If you're facing the funicular...take the road to the left to go up. About half way up the first section, we noticed this metal structure on the right hand side (like maybe it took you to a museum or something). There was an elevator...so we took it and popped out at the top and saved us the long walk. We saw lots of gorgeous views, a bicycle exhibition of trick cycling, the changing of the guard, the prison that "Dracula" was kept in (you can climb down to the lambrinth and see enough without actually having to take the paid tour), Matthias church, etc. As we only had a few hours, so then walked down the hill, crossed over the bridge near the island, saw the Parliament building and the moving Shoes on the Danube monument. A wonderful way to spend an afternoon. We spent maybe a total of 3 hours roundtrip from our hotel, including tons of walking. If I would have had more time, it would have been nice to do it at a more relaxed pace and visiting/touring the actual buildings.

Worth a long walk around. I spend the better part of a day here. Very nice to walk around and visit shops. There are several museums up here and some nice restaurants. Very cool to be here at night with the views.

Fantastic views over the Danube and Pest. Best way to get there is by the funicular, or tour bus. Can get very busy, but worth the views. Mostly cobbled ground, and some steps, so not very wheelchair friendly, however possible. Toilets available at a charge (like most places), and a restaurant. Stall selling Transylvanian Funnel Cake, which is yummy!!
For the history and the views. Take the funicular up the hill and start walking don't miss the museum and don't forget your camera.

Lots of Walking. Don't miss the changing of the guard which happens ever 30 minutes, or so! Take the funicular round trip to avoid all those stairs if you want to save yourself for all the walking you will do at the top! Enjoy some of the wonderful pastry at the café! Take lots of pictures, you will thank yourself later!
Beautiful Area. Fantastic area to visit, located on the Buda side. Beautiful buildings set high above the City. A must when in Budapest.

Beautiful area. 100% worth the visit! the views are stunning, amazing architecture and history! We spent about 4/5 hours there and didn't have time to go inside anywhere, we were just looking at the scenery
Stunning views. Fabulous history and stunning viewsof the city and the river, lovely alleyways to explore, a definite must do for any visitor to Budapest
Special views at night!. The castle is Buda's best sightseeing. It includes the palace, Fishermans bastion and Matyas templom. Try to visit at night for special Danube views.

Don't miss this!. The castle Hill district is not to be missed. Spend the entire afternoon enjoying unusual sights...the view across the Danube, Parliamentary Building on the other side, and of course, the castles themselves. There are benches for those whose feet have had enough, but you can spend hours just strolling along the walkway.
Yes that was my impression Norman Wallace 2005 visit. Visited in 2005 It is a very impressive Country. They have had a tough History but have survived just the same. Good Vacationing Country

Exceptional views. Great half day or more. Tour options available including Castle, Matthias Church, and Fisherman's Bastion. Good experience even if you take no paid tours but just look at the stunning view of Pest across the Danube.
I would rate this as essential for a Budapest visit
Fairytale castle. A lovely hilltop area to walk around and has fantastic views across the Danube to the Parliamentary buildings and Pest.

A must to see. There is so much to see up on Castle Hill ! Do slot in enough time as, otherwise, like us, you feel you did not do it justice ! We used the funicular - no queues in May ! Please note - just to the left of the ticket office is an ice-cream vendor that sells DARK CHOCOLATE ice- cream - the best ever !!

Beautiful and historical area with amazing views. Gorgeous architecture, beautiful views, a great (though touristy) area to spend a sunny day. Take time to explore the churches and the museums and walk all through the castle area.

Fantastic. Take the bus 16 or 16 A and walk the almost flat hill, all the attractions are right there, funicular lines are long and I don't like waiting, great restaurants, walk past all the main attractions and get to know the beautiful buildings
photo point. Can be accessed by foot, train or by bus. We did not go inside castle. From outside, we get nice view over pest area of the city.

144 steps but so worth it!. Had to mount 144 steps to arrive at Castle Hill (Buda side). Or, could have taken the funicular (very touristy and cramped), or the bus 16A. Steps were the best way, worth the near heart-attack feeling, lol. Many sights and photo ops!

Such a little hill yet so much to see and do.. No trip to Budapest is complete without a visit to the Varhegy (castle hill) area. Allow plenty of time, however, because there are so many things to do there. You can tour St. Mattias Templom, take great photos from Fisherman's Bastion, overlooking the Danube & Parliament, enjoy a sweet & coffee at the historic Ruszworm Csukraszda or see an exhibition at the Hungarian National Gallery. One of the most interesting things to do is to take a tour of the Hospital in the Rock, a remnant of WWII that was still kept in readiness well into the mid-20th century. It is not the cheapest tour in Budapest but is well worth the price of entry. Tours leave at set times, so check ahead to time your visit.
Beautiful view overlooking the city at night. Beautiful romantic walk up the hill at night with incredible view of the whole city lit up. Don't miss it!

Great day!. We spent the day at Castle Hill and it was a beautiful part of the city do not miss this. We were lucky to see the changing of the guards of the Palace (wright behind the funicular exit), it was 12H00 when they started (if I can recall well).Some nice places to have a bite/drink, walk around and a lot to see.
Fabulous overlook. Cannot see Budapest without Castle Hill, amazing how the areais within the hills and so much to see.

Don't miss out on the view!. This is a must when going to Budapest, but be prepared to experience it with many other tourists. The view is stunning and so are the buildings, and it's perfect for just walking around exploring. We never went inside any of the buildings, but it took all day anyway. I highly recommend it if you enjoy architecture and sightseeing.

Spectacular views. Very interesting cluster of old buildings in a superb location. It is very busy: we had to queue to go on the Fishermen's Bastion and there are a lot of souvenir shops and fast food stalls and so on. It may well be better to go at night but our schedule didn't allow that. That said, the views are spectacular and there is a little cafe under the bastion where you might just be lucky and get a table with a view of the city and the river below. Don't try and sit there without ordering at least a drink. He gets understandably cross. The church is impressive in size and layout but nothing seems to be original. Access to the bastion seems to be by steps only and there is some pushing and shoving to get the best views once you're up.

Don't miss the view from this location..... even if you don't want to wait in line for the ride...... Beautiful both during the day and during the evening hours.... Budapest shines with glorious light at night, but even in the rain it was stunning.... Guided tour helps you know what you are seeing.... we walked here alone and with the Free Tours folks.....
Old World Delights. The castle is worth the visit for the view though no contents left. A couple museums and we attended a wine festival.

Plesant walk around the hill. When visiting the Buda Castle you are up on Castle Hill. Starting with the castle and all the various areas around it you get a good view of history - and of Budapest. Outside the castle is a still active residential area with shops, homes, a large church and other sights. Its easy to spend a good part of the day exploring this area.
A must see. the castle area on the Buda side is full of history you will need a full day to see all the museums, restaurants and views
Amazing views. Visit at night - better than daytime for the views - far less pesky tourists. Budapest lit up is amazing

What a view!!. There are spectacular views from Castle Hill of the fantastic Parliament Building plus the rest of Pest. In addition, it is interesting to see the Bastion and Matthias Church as well as the other old buildings in the area. You can easily spend an hour or two wandering the streets and popping in and out of the shops.

a must go see. don't leave Budapest without taking one of the frequent tour buses up the hills on the Buda side to visit the ancient but no money spared castle / museum / church and lesser advertised Labyrinths featuring its links with Dracula who was imprisoned her for 12 years

I wish I had more time.... Everything is so well taken care of: the streets, the gardens, the cafes... And you're near Matthias Church, Fisher's Bastions and Buda Castle! Wow, just walking up and down the streets is fantastic.
Wonderful views at night. A must when visiting Budapest especially at night which is very different. If unable to walk across get on a tram.
A quiet spot. Nice to get away from the hustle of Pest, this place was really beautiful with great views. A peaceful strole through the park here is great too.

Fabulous city. We just loved Budapest. Travelled here by train from Glasgow in Scotland and stayed at the Hotel Gellert. It was my husband's 60th birthday present from me. Travelling about couldn't have been easier as there is an integrated public transport system and the trams and underground are fast and efficient. A must visit is to the hot swimming pools in the park!

Walk up Castle Hill. We took a walk up to the top of Castle Hill (halfway up we found an escalator that would have saved a bit of the journey, but no matter!!) The views on a sunny clear April day were breathtaking and well worth the walk. A definite must!
Good exercise. Beautiful, real old and has a lot of history. And the best thing is a lot of stairs to climb up. Good exercise.

Romantic Budapest. Budapest is the most romantic city in Europe today! All the restaurants have trios or quartets playing romantic music. It is like time stood still in Budapest. The Castle Hill is no exception. Had a wonderfully full and historically interesting day there! Plus a fantastic meal! Walked home down lonely streets, but never felt unsafe! Don't miss the incredible city
Magnificent. Another place where you can see the whole city from the hill. The structures in general in Budapest is amazing.
Great Historic Walk. A great way to spend 1 - 2 hours to take in the sights of old Budapest. Great views of Pest from the top of the hill. Lots of interesting buildings & sights.
Was ok. I was a bit disappointed in visiting the caste area. Not a whole lot to do once there. Gave a very nice view of Pest and the Danube though.
Music was great. The seemingly impromptu music at various places was beautiful and much appreciated. Lovely buildings and very pleasant and clean

History, View and City!. Budapest is an historical city with very nice bridges and buildings. Here you are right place to see the whole city and take nice pictures. Better to go in Spring or Summer to avoid the cold/windy weather! You might take long walk to the castle and visit some museums on the way too, enjoy!

Old Budapest. Take the fenicular railway to the top then walk around the old part of the city. Easy to forget that it is a city where people live and work. Feels more like a town specifically for tourists. Interesting buildings - national gallery and library, presidents palace, underground hospital and many lovely shops and eating places.

Worth going up. We went up for a few hours. We took the funicular which was fun and pretty cheap for a return. There are lovely views up there. The castle is pretty and the church is fantastic - whose idea was it to build the monstrosity that is the Hilton next door to it!!. My favourite bit was the guards doing their little routine. They kept laughing at each other - certainly wouldn't get a job outside Buckingham Palace :0)
Lovely area to explore. This is a lovely area of old houses, alleyways, and some small museums. A great place to walk and wander.

Beautiful views here at night.. Went here for a photo opportunity and the views are stunning, especially at night. Budapest is alight and glorious at night, every building and bridge is aglow. Would love to be there on New Year's Eve with fireworks, what a sight that would be.
Stunning View. An absolute must if you are visiting this city. The views are fantastic especially if the weather is good.

Don't miss it. Castle Hill is a unique place full of beauty and history.It is a wonderful place to walk around and explore. rab a cup of coffee in one of the cafes with a view and you will think that you are in heaven.
Absolute best views of the city...Period!. We took a bus to the Castle Hill and the views are simply stunning. Wether day, evening, or night it's an unbelievable view. You must stop for a look see.

Much that is unremarkable. We put aside a whole day to 'explore' the Varhegy and ended up a little disappointed and felt we wasted some of our holiday. Other then the fisherman's wharf area there is nothing of note to see (most of the Varhegy is residential and is not untypical of any reasonably dull middle-European town)- the National Ary Gallery (at the opposite end of the promontory) seems to be well worth a visit but was shut when we ventured up. The view of Pest is the main draw.

Cellulite, what cellulite!. Beautiful climb, spectacular view of the chain bridge, Parliament building and the Pest side. If you look up to the right you can see the Citadel almost above the castle hill. Hop on down the hill and take the tram 19 to catch bus 27 to got to the Citadel.

Not just for tourists.. This attraction might be a little over touristed but it definitely packs a punch. Just try to remember people live here too. Best time to visit is possibly late afternoon. In the morning most of the tourist groups arrive so it's worth saving for a little later in the day. Taking the funicular railways is fun too.The views are spectacular and it's really unnecessary to spend money to go onto the Fisherman's Bastion when the views are just the same wherever you go. Also a word of advice, pick your footwear carefully for an excursion up here, you'll probably walk a lot further than you anticipated and there are a lot of cobble streets.We particularly enjoyed sitting in the shady beer garden opposite the St Matthias Church listening to a very talented couple on piano and violin playing everything from Hungarian folk tunes, through to operetta and show tunes. Surprisingly soothing. You can also get ham hocks, the ever present guylas and hungarian sausages in a bun, not to mention pastries etc,here if you're up for a snack to keep you from flagging.A note of caution, we had intended to have dinner on Castle Hill before returning to Pest but decided against it after being treated quite off-handedly and almost rudely by waiters at the Arany Hordo Restaurant, 9 Tarnok utca. We also paid more for a beer and glass of wine there than anywhere else during the whole of our visit although their meals didn't appear to be particularly expensive given their location. Buyer beware.

Well worth the walk. We walked to the top but many take a tour bus up the hill or the Funicular tram , whichever way get there it's a great place to wander around the historic buildings, gardens etc,and the views out over the city and Danube are breathtaking.PJ Barker author of the novel Changing Pillion.
Beautiful. Feels like you are walking back into time. Beautiful area, great pictures opportunities, restaurants and cafes.

Worth to see. It's a historical site and also part of daily life. The castle itself houses the National Gallery (and during the renovation of the Museum of Fine Arts also shows their pictures as well). It has a small but nice yard where you can often find fairs and craft-markets (entry fee then!). It's a nice view to the city from the castle yard. You can also try the funicular if you want to go down from the hill, but you can also walk - then you will see lots of old and new, nice houses.

take part of a beautiful sight over Budapest. It is a beautiful place to walk and enjoy the view of the whole city. I was lucky, beacuse I could take part in a food exibition and I could eat and drink tipical Hungarian food

Stunning. Such a beautiful place to spend a while. We passed it on our hop on hop off bus tour and didn't think we would have time to get to it but having a few hours to spare the morning we were leaving, we decided to go. I'm so glad we did. The walk up and around it is beautiful and the views from various levels are fantastic. The day we were there, they had a market on in the courtyard which was lovely - various bread, pastry, trinket stalls. Don't miss this

Beautiful, a bit touristy, but worth the trip up the hill. Castle Hill holds some amazing architecture. There is Saint Mattyas Church, restored castle battlements that offer amazing fews of Budapest and the Danube River, and the restored Royal Palace. I would say plan to spend a couple of hours at least if you can. Avoid the gift shops--there are better places to find hand crafted souvenirs.

Flasher alert !. One Japanese girl walked up here alone and a man jumped out from a tree and pulled down his pants to flash at her. The incident caused her to leave Budapest the very next day although she had planned to stay longer. So ladies , though the view is fantastic, it is best to hike up with a companion.

Picturesque and beautiful setting. It's a bit of trek but once you get there you can enjoy some of the best views over Budapest as well as some great local food. We had a 3 course hungarian set menu called 'The Pest Menu' for £9 each with drinks. Bargain!
Fab views. This area of Budapest is very pretty even in the rain. Views over the city are fab and there are some lovely places to have a drink or bite.
Go at night.. We had a guide take us at night around 9pm, it was just the 3 of us and a couple of attendants. The night lighting makes it very romantic and highlights the beauty of the architechture!

Castle Hill and the view of the City. Castle Hill is the the gateway tot he Hapsburgian Castle and a very charming setting for a gentle walk. The District is reminiscent of a a village and sits inside the city therefore it is a calm haven in the hustle and bustle of the city£. It has kept the most of its classical architechture aside from some of the newer hotels. The majority of buildings are classical Viennese town houses or low old fashioned hungarian houses.Althought there are tourist traps such as the expensive little market on the corner near the castle gates, even this is relatively cheap compare to other cities. The restaurants and cafes are not too overpriced and tend to be of good quality.

Tourists galore!. Maybe I was in a bad mood. Maybe it was too hot. Or maybe it was the tourists, tourists, tourists. Being a professional tourist myself, I tend to assess my fellow tourists and in this case it resulted in tourist indigestion. I won't say more, except that too many big monuments (rebuilt in most cases) and big beefy faces being stuffed at overpriced tourist trap restaurants put me off my feed and I fled the area after a couple of hours.
Step back in time. Ridiculously clean, beautiful architecture, great history. Maybe felt a little bit like an attraction park.
what a view!. got off at castle hill.fantastic view of the river and the city.wander around the buildings.takes a lot of time.then proceed to fisherman's cabin.great for an evening out.radha aiyar.

Walking up is hard work but worth it for the views.. We crossed the Elizabeth Bridge towards the statue of St Gellert, then south and upwards, ever upwards. It is a long hard slog up to the Liberation Monument and the Citadel but it is ultimately worth it if only for the views across the Danube.We carried on north and eventually came into the Castle District. We entered the Royal palace by the back route and found the rear of the National Gallery which was just about to close.We admired the Matyas Fountain and the Lion Gate before trying our hand at archery at a stall near the back entrance.All in all, a lovely walk, not for everyone, it was rather tiring for us over sixties but we enjoyed the day.

Wonder around history. The museums presented the history of Buda, Obuda and Pest in logical sequences including art from the different ages.Matyas Church is not to be missed. It has an incredible history-destroyed and rebuilt so many times. We also like just walking around finding some homes and buildings dating to the early 1700s.
Nice view - superb art museum inside. Don't miss the art museum inside the castle. Superb works. Wear comfortable sneakers as the cobble stone walks become uncomfortable.
Viewwwww. Spectacular view of Pest, very beautiful the whole hill. Great and grand place with many sights and shops.
Wery nice. Panoramic view of the entire Pest. This place certainly must visit if you are traveling in Budapest.

Gorgeous views, beautiful building, great museum inside.. There was a fair when we went, all filled with food stands vending typical Hungarian foods, beer, delicious desserts, local produce and more. There were some dance performances with folk music to entertain us, while strolling all along and admiring the amazing view of the river and the city below. The main building is grandiose, with all the statues and fountains. We found out that there was a Museum inside the main building and proceeded to visit all the exhibits. Do go to the Archaeological section, Pre-Columbian artifacts displayed and simply amazing.

Fantastic views. worth the walk over the river. Only 5 mins to walk up the hill if the queue for the cable car is long. You can come down on the cable car instead. Beautiful gallery in the castle, and changing of the military's guard at midday. Sensational views back over Pest from the top

Lovely place to walk and people watch. We enjoyed all the sights on Castle Hill using Rick Steves self guided walks. We visited many of the sites and enjoyed the sweeping views of Pest, as well as the Buda "Beverly hills" neighborhoods. There is much to do up here, museums, palaces, and much more. Good for a whole day, maybe two if you want to see everything including the Hospital in a Rock.m
SPECTACULAR VIEW. The view overlooking the Danube, Parliament building, and the Pest side of the city from the Buda side is spectacular, especially at night.

So much to see. I would leave plenty of time to explore this characterful area. So many little alleyways, bistros, and sights in this great part of Buda. A real gem and enhances your visit to this beautiful city.

nice place to walk. we went by cable car to the palace and as on the other areas you had a wonderful view of the Danube as well as the city.The only problem: the stones in the road/foot path we very difficult to walk on but it fits in the structures.The trip with the cable car is unfortunately short.

Castle over the capital. Great views over Pest and Buda, must see museums, fantastic medieval buildings, cool labirynth. Good restaurants (my personal favorite is Baltazar and Csalogány 26 nearby). An almost real time travel.

Lovely Views!. We decided to walk up so we could make the most of the views, only took around 10mins and we are not walkers generally! Lots of Tourists help points/Cafes/attractions at the top as well as the beautiful views from the castle. A must see!
Great views. Great views fro the Buda side looking across the Danube to the Pest side. Worth a walk up herr and although high up was a nice gradual walk up the hill.

What view from Pest. We took the funicular railway to the castle and had a tour of the of the grounds and buildings . Before we left we visited the Budapest Terrace for drinks ... lovely venue but dreadful service and expensive !!!
Lots of work going on to repair and renovate a treasure .

Great view - main attraction, but far from the best in Budapest. Enjoyed castle hill, the walk and the views. GREAT sights, but the best in Budapest is beyond the main attraction. Enjoy the view, but save time for many other sites.
Stunning view. View of Budapest from Buda side was breathtaking. Hilton Hotel very well situated . Would highly recommend upgrade to executive floor .
Impressing view. A must driving up the hill for a good view over the town and the Danube. Not really much to see inside.

A walk through history. I spent an enjoyable walk through the Castle district. There are many sights hers like the Matthias Church and museums. I did not eat at any of the restaurants or do any shopping; they were a little too touristy for me. This is an area that shouldn't be missed though!

Lovely views and pretty. This is definitely worth a visit.
Really beautiful views across the city and also beautiful architecture to see. You can't really come to Budapest as a tourist and not come here.
What a view! . Again, like most of Budapest, this place is so beautiful! The views over the Danube and the city are incredible! A must visit!

One of the Best Tourist Areas Anywhere. The Castle District on Buda Heights is a wonderful tourist area. With easy access by public transportation, clear signage and wonderful buildings, monuments and public art, you can easily spend days exploring. I was glad to see that the final remaining examples of WW II damage had been repaired and the area is just glorious. There are plenty of cafes to provide the weary tourist with a rest and refreshment. And for the budget conscious, you can see almost all of it for free.

Worth the walk.. Although we visited on a Sunday, and therefore very busy, this popular look-out was well worth the trek from the bus, with fantastic views over Buda and Pest. A great guide gave us lots of interesting bits of historical data to make it a day to remember.
Great. Great views. Great restaurants. One of the best parts of Buda. The castle on top of the hill is must see. Can take the hop on tours to know the place and choose which you wanna actually visit

Quite nice. The castle hill is nice, especially the view from Pest at night. But what I want to do most of all now is review "Budapest as a city". I am a city traveler. I just like the history and culture of cities. Budapest is a city with beautiful spots, but I need to rate this city in it's totality as "Poor".I have never before experienced so much rudeness from the locals and it annoyed me so much that I cut my stay with two days and went to Vienna earlier (where I felt like in heaven due to the contrast).There is something 'in the air' that I can only describe as arrogance and rudeness. Of course I met friendly people and that was every time a joy, but overall ... no!

A real fairytail place. One of the most romantic spot of the city! A must go! The backyards of the castle at night with the heavy sweet flower smell on a summer day is amazing! Especially at night when city lights are on! Just dont go to the turisty restaurants!!! Check out the wine fest in early fall if you have a chance!

Take the No16 Bus to Castle Hill. We travelled around Budapest using a very reasonably priced 3 day transport pass we bought for the purpose. Sadly for us, it was not until the last day that we ventured up Castle Hill on the No.16 bus. Here we found delightful streets and squares with many cafes and bars and the most breathtaking panoramic views of the city below. Castle Hill is now a World Heritage site, heavily bombed during WW2 and now extensively rebuilt with well worth seeing key sites within it such as Mátyás Church and Fisherman's Bastion.If we visit Budapest again we will ride on the No.16 bus sooner - and I recommend you do so also!

Unmissable. Castle Hill is really an unmissable experience in my view. The views from a number of different spots are magnificent and it's a gorgeous area to walk around. Yes, it's busy with tourists but worth weaving around people. On the day we visited there was still plenty of space to wander around and see the views. The area is great to walk around, packed with historical monuments and the national gallery.
one of my favourite areas. lovely area on the Buda side....worth spending a day here with lovely restaurants and some small shops

love the smaller city atmosphere. While the "castle" is now a museum, visiting this area of Buda is must! Some of the architecture is fun, the views of Pest from the hill are amazing. And walk the streets of the city enjoying the smaller city atmosphere and little cafes and history on this side of the Danube. I will definitely spend a day here the next trip.
Castle Hill. Take the time to walk all around this amazing place. The cable car wasn't working when I was there however the walk is well worth is. Beautiful architecture and mosaics

Excellent area to explore. We spend 3-4 hours (including lunch) in this very Nice area. We strolled around looking up, admiring a lot of exciting architecture, enjoing the view over Buda, and off cause the splendid view of the Danube/Donau river and Pest. Take your time and buy access to the Matthias Church and the Fishermans Bastion, it's Well worth the money. Also explore one of the many restaurants, where several can be found in the Michelin guide as Bib Gourmande.
Great views. Great views from the Castle over the city are fantastic. Easily accessible via the hop on hop off bus, local bus or funicular. Changing of the guard is at 11am.
worth the walk. You can stroll through the gardens and look down on the spectacular views of the city below. It's a great walk for exercise and seeing the sights.

Best of Budapest. Castle Hill area was definitely the highlight of my visit to the beautiful city. After a fun ride up on the funicular, I happily wandered, admiring the grand buildings and the delightful residential area. Reflections in the mirror windows of the Hilton were amazing. It seems that few bothered to venture past the main buildings. A shame indeed.

Another great point to view the city. If you can get up there, you will find some great views of Budapest. To get there you will need some mode of transportation because the hills are steep. However, once you get up there, you know it is totally worth the trouble to climb the hills!

Beautiful, peaceful place to stroll around. After visiting Mattias church we were slightly surprised to see very few people strolling round this beautiful and peaceful area, which is in complete contrast to busy and bustling Pest. The many old buildings have wonderful architectural features. Rather than take the tourist bus, it's easy to walk over the chain bridge and take the wonderful Budavari Silko (funicular railway), which starts opposite the other side of the bridge, to the top of the hill.

Beautiful walled city. The location of the Castle is amazing overlooking the Danube. The cobblestone steps, Fisherman's Bastion, even the Hilton which blends in with the old world in beautiful. A must see.

Good thing I live here now. So much to see here. I live here and can revisit. And I will. Watched the changing of the guard and strolled around the back streets. There was a festival and crowds of people. Ducked into the National Gallery. Wow. Loads of fun. What a fabulous museum. Take the funicular train at least one way. The views are spectacular.

worth going. Went up there on the big bus well worth going amazing views over the city very oldie world lovley smalls cafes went to a cafe called Osbudavar i one of the side streets try it you wont be dissapointed the food is great and not expensive and lots of it.

Budapest spread out before you. Don't be lazy, you can walk through the beautiful gardens to get up to the top. Once there the whole of Budapest and the Danube is spread out beneath you. its just one of those things you have to see.There are plenty of places to enjoy once there, museums, statues, views and cafes.

Beautiful to Walk Around. Budapest is one of this places that you can just walk around and explore and the Castle Hill district is one of those places. We thought it was filled with Castles but it's only just 1 big castle, but it's beautiful!

A Vast Area For Strolling And Views. Go up on the funicular. Turn left at the top and go through the elaborate gate, opposite the Presidential Palace, guarded by soldiers. You can eat at a basic cafe there if you like, or just have a drink. Walk around the castle and museum and have a go at the bows and crossbows on the rear castle walls!Then carry on north (another nice bar on the way to the Matthyus Church and Fisherman's Bastion) where there are restaurants and shops. Allow at least two hours up here.
Another view from our hotel room. Not only did we have the view of the castle from our room, visiting the castle was even more memorising.
Worth to see. Worth to see. When You go on the top the view on Pest is soooo beautiful :) And the market place - unique shopping ;)

Outstanding views. This is a 'must visit' in Budapest and this was my third visit. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and its history even goes back to Roman times. The whole area is clean and well maintained and this was the first time I had seen Mathias Church fully restored. The Fisherman's Bastion affords outstanding views.
While away some time here. Lovely area with a lot of history. nice to walk around and check out churches, castle walls and coffee shops. good views of the river from here
Stunning . This whole area is just breath taking. You cannot visit Budapest and not come up here. The architecture and the views are just spectacular.

Loved it!. After walking up many many stairs I reached Castle Hill. It was definitely worth the walk! This area of Budapest is a true joy to immerse yourself in. The whole area is well maintained, safe, beautiful and has many areas of interest to explore. I walked all of Castle Hill through it's historical streets enjoying the stores, architecture and the history that permeates throughout. Don't miss this fabulous section while visiting this vibrant city!
a lot to see in a nutshell. all close to each other: the railway, the museum, the castle with its guards, the fisherman's quarter, it's all there in one long walk

The place to visit in Buda!. Took the funicular up to Castle Hill. This so-called hill is a beautiful area on its own - a grand castle district that leads to other attractions as well. Great view, great place to walk around. One of the key highlights of Budapest!
great location. The view from the front terrace on Danube.Visiting the interior part only paying too early time of closing, at 18.00

Prepare To Get Lost In The Beauty Of Budapest!. I spent so much time up here on Castle Hill! Take the tram up for a fabulous nostalgic mode of transport and the views will leave you speechless! Stepping out onto the cobblestone streets you'll feel like you've stepped back in time as you wander through the Museums, shops, cafes, churches and many other sights. So much beauty and history can be found on Castle Hill. I would allow a good day to wander around and see it all...in saying that I went back up for a second day because I was so captured by it all. Go down and see the church - it's one of the most beautiful ones I've set eyes on thus far.
Castle hill district budapest. This is a must not just for the castle whole area is lovely would definately recommend restuarants good selection views are amazing

Best view. This area is the best place to see the view over the Danube river with the Parliament building front and centre. Fishermans bastion and the church are beautiful. Good place to spend half a day.There is a less advertised museum called Hospital in the Rock which is at the back of castle hill. It is a hospital inside the caves used during WW2 and the Cold War as a nuclear bunker. Very interesting and if you have medical ID take it with you for a discount. Well worth the visit.

A must to enjoy the fantastic view of the Danube, Buda & Pest. We were lucky for the sunshite and blue sky. The view was breathtaking and certainly worth the trip and walk up the hill from the car-park
Visit at night- all lit up with amazing views of the city. Fantastic- fountains, statues, and just beautiful . Try and visit at night as well, it all looks stunning.
Beautiful Walk from River. While it might seem like a hard walk up the hill, it is well worth going up on foot... beautiful views throughout!
Another Must. You must visit this to appreciate the views of Budapest. Breathtakingly Beautiful. The views of The Danube are spectacular as the rest of the city
Amazing view. Amazing view if you want to see budapest from upper level but dont play a cards with strangers there its a mafia and ur money not get back

A must-see when in Budapest. A lovely area, incorporating a number of things to see, a beautiful cathedral, Fishermans Bastion and nice little eating places around the main square. We visited it during the day and at night

Lovely place. The whole castle area looks like a different town, separate from the rest of Budapest. There are a few of interesting buildings like the castle, Matthias Church and Fishermen's Bastion.Nice music played by some musicians in the park made my visit even more enjoyable. The views are no so good like from the Gellert's Hill but still impressive.

Exploration = worth it. The first time I stopped in Budapest I missed an opportunity to explore the city The castle was beautifully lit up at night and I promised myself next time. Two years later I was able to fully explore and it is definitely worth the experience. The museum, vistas and history are very interesting.

Sights to die for. Great views over the city, old architecture, photo opportunities aplenty and some nice little value eateries. There are some tourist traps, but which tourist area doesn't have them? Well worth a visit and make sure your camera is charged

Well worth the walk. We started our day at St. Stephans Basilica on the Pest side, then had a nice walk across the Chain Bridge, and took the funicular up to Castle Hill. This is a great spot with wonderful views and several inviting cafes. We partook of the National Gallery which features entirely Hungarian art. This is a nice departure from more traditional Western European offerings, but you are in Hungary afterall. St. Matthias church should not be missed, and Fishermans Bastion is an architectural confection nearby which overlooks Budapest's iconic Parliament building. Don't miss Castle Hill!
Worth the walk. A lot of steps!You can take the tour bus to the top if your not quite up for the climb! Excellent views of the Chain Bridge!
A must. Amazing views of the city, impressive buildings, pretty scenery. Well worth to spend a few hours there.
Panoramic views!. Sat in a lovely wee restaurant on a gorgeous sunny day and were serenated by musicians!! The views were stunning. Great memories!
A good view point. We came up here on our first day. A steep climb but good views of the old town Buda and views of Pest.
Go at night. The lights bring some amazing views of the city. It is a beautiful walk and take your time to see the details of the bridge and castle. Loved it!
Nice place and nice view!. Recommended place to visit when in Budapest! The view is nice, although from the Gellert hill it is better! :-)

Budapest "must do". A "must do" on your visit to Budapest. There is a wonderful view of the city, it's surrounds and of course The Danube. Allow a couple of hours for exploration and of course photos. With moderate fitness you can easily walk up to appreciate everything along the way.

Amazing history and views. We were fortunate enough to stay at the Hilton on Castle Hill and loved walking to all the different shops and cafes. It is a very unique place to visit and the views of Budapest ate unparalleled.
Well worth a visit. Fabulous place. Quiet, peaceful, stunning in beauty and very clean. You need at least half a day to do it justice.

Re: great view. We took the bus from the Pest side together with Kati, our tour guide. We had a great view of the river and the Pest. We had the chance to watch their version of "changing of the guards".

journey to the past. small streets , buildings from the XIX.century, nice panoramic view to both side of the city - restaurants are vary but pricy - worth a big walk arround - completely can take even 2-3 h.
There is a long cave and tunnel system in the hill - also interesting to see it

Great views. Beautiful views over Budapest from up here. Plenty of space to wander and take photos.I walked around Castle Hill for the better part of a day. Lots of shops and restaurants to visit, plus Matthias Church and other cultural buildings on the hill too. You can either ride the funicular up the hill or take the path/steps.Can't be missed if visiting Budapest.

Paradise Balcony. The view is magnificent, gorgeous at day and night! You can watch the landscape for hours on end, and you want to take lots of photo.Parliament Bulding can be seen more sumptuously, beautifully.In order to reach there, you can use Historical Funicular, although there is sometimes queue.
Really nice view. We liked the square and the church, the view was amazing and everything is very clean and tidy. Bar next to the church has very nice waiter.

Great Views of and from this Hill!!!. After crossing the Chain Bridge, there is a funicular (wasn't working the day I went) or a nice path up the hill. Not too difficult and worth the climb.Fabulous views from the top overlooking both the Pest side and the rest of the Buda side toward the hills. Went in Spring as all the trees were blooming...spectacular!!

Walk thru History. Great views on the Buda side. Contains three museums, but the stroll around the grounds is sufficient if you're pressed for time or not into museums. Several prominent sculptures on the castle grounds. Make sure to go around back and see the Matthias Fountain.

majestic view over the danube and the city of pest. such a majestic castle with so much history behind it. hapsburgs kings of hungary and so much more. you can see on a clear day far . . . and also looking towards pest you can see all of the wonderful buildings. go and see. it is so great a sight that i guarantee that you will go back for more.

Excellent.. This is well worth a visit. Beautiful architecture, views, little market area, some shops, several cafes and restaurants. Art galleries. The almond trees were out in profusion and the area is very well kept and clean and tidy. Steep climb up and down unless you have transport.We were lucky to see the changing of the guards at 12 noon. It was quite an elaborate and interesting affair.
Really nice castle. Lovely building with medieval architecture although it was a new building. You should buy the ticket for the 3 exhibitions inside the museum

A place we do visit every year.. The castle of Buda is one of those places you visit again and again. After having visited the fortifications, you can always sit in the little garden and just stare at the Danube. It is quiet and beautiful. We visit Budapest every year and never miss a morning at the castle. We top it with a visit to Ruszwurm (3 minutes walk) with the best cakes and pastry in Budapest.
Lovely view. Lovely views. Got some great photos. Spent about 1 1/2 hours walking around and enjoying the sights.

A must visit if only for the views. A great part of Budapest and gives a fantastic panoramic view of the Danube and the rest of the city. If the funicular isn't working its a steep climb but ok. Lots to see Royal Palace, Mathias Church, Fishermans Bastion and Hospital in the Rock amongst a few all worth seeing.Try restaurants away from the main sights less expensive.

Jennie and Elliot in Budapest. Great view of the Danube and the Pest side of the river, the Fishermans Bastion is an interesting to walk around and there are many small shops to look through, it's very busy and the road up packed with busses. The funicular is not operating at present so the only way up is by road.

Perfect location. Stayed at the Hilton on Castle Hill which was just steps away from loads of sights. Buda Castle, funicular, Fisherman's Bastian, Matthias Church, restaurants, and beautiful views of the area.
Castle Hill. Come here to do some walk and got spectacular view of Pest side from this area. Lot of people just sit here to enjoy the view and the weather.
View of Budapest. Best view of Budapest from the top of the hill,can take beautifull photos from here for the surroundings.
A wonderful Sunday Trip. It needs time to see all the interesting things in and outside this wonderful building.Especially enjoy the view to the danube river.

Breathtaking view into Pest. Strongly suggest you consider Grand Circle River Cruise of the Eastern Europe to the Black Sea as I did.Many people are not aware Buda is on one side and Pest the other. From the Castle Hill lookout you can see the Parliament building across the Danube.People weren't that friendly, and shop owners were stand offish which surprised me. I just kept going into stores and when I found someone who was friendly and wanted my business; I gave it to them.

Breathtaking view. It's a pleasently surpising walk with lots of details and spectacular views of the Pest side. You can see the entire city- parliament, chain bridge. It's lovely with lots of history.
Amazing View. The place has an amazing view to take picture of Budapest, and photo of your self with the beautiful view.

Make some time to visit here. This must be the premiere attraction in Budapest for photo opportunities with views over The Danube, Parliament and all of the city. The funicular was closed when we visited but the easiest way to get there was to stay on the hop on bus and get off at the top, saves you money too if you have previously bought the ticket. At the the top you can walk towards St Mathias and Fishermans Bastion which are not to be missed. We had a nice reasonable priced lunch in a self service restaurant before exploring the area. There are many interesting artisan shops and ice cream shops along the way. We spent the afternoon there enjoying a welcome seat and a glass of wine before hopping back on the bus back to Pest. This can be a very busy place at times but much of it looks like a set from a Disney movie and is a great place to spend your day.

Great views from here and wonderful historic streets to wander.. The Castle Hill area warrants a slow meander, perhaps lunch in one of the many and some very fine restaurants or a beer or coffee in one of the several cafes. The houses and museums and outlooks are all fine, many fully restored so that this World Heritage site is worthy of the name.
Beautiful. A truly magical spot with unique architecture. Can be busy at certain times. Lots of little shops with original items for sale. Breathtaking church and Disneyesque buildings.
Photo spot. This place has a great view to take photos. You can reach at the hill after a short finicular drive and enjoy the view with drinking hot vine.

The place to see Budapest from above.... The place to visit for the best (?) view of Budapest...There is a nice cafe on the top to have a relaxed coffee...also nice area to have a walk to the castle etc...

Interesting to see. Nice view, but you need to climb up there, and might not be too easy, the Palace is definitely nice to see, but not a real must if you are for a short time. It has lots of museums, galleries inside. And you can start your walk to the old town from there.

Best view of Budapest. The castle hill view gives a panoramic view of the city and the Danube. If you are lucky to see the guard change it is also one of a kind. The long walk along the side of the hill gives different views of the Danube and the rest of the city. This location is a kind of a summary of Budapest.

Best view of Budapest. Budapest has wonderful parks in the middle of the city. This amazing park is on the Buda side. It was a great walk up the hill. The view is worth the walk up the hill. The views of Budapest are amazing from up here. A must when you are in the city.

Beautiful views of the city.. Very picturesque part of town, lovely to stroll about in spring weather enjoying the sights while eating a lovely ice cream. Beautiful views of the city from such a high vantage point. A lot of steps to climb so be aware.

walk around. Castle Hill is mostly just a location to walk around. You can go into Matthias church and Buda castle are art museums now but mostly it's just a historic walk. That being said, it's a very nice walk! Great views across the Danube to the Pest side and historic monuments.
Phenomenal. It is an incredible place , with much history , there is a very small show with changing of the guard
a beautiful view of Pest and of the Danube. There is a nice walk from the castle to the St Matyas church, with a beautiful view of Pest and of the Danube.

Very pleasant circular exploration.. Some very good restaurants are available.
We ate very well in Pierrot, out in the back garden, and found a music museum.
Easier walking down to the city.
Worth a visit. Well worth the climb as when we were there the funicular was under repair. Could spend all day up here exploit the streets, cafes and view from the bastion.
Crown attraction.. The most beautiful tourist attraction in the town. Evening is extremely pleasant. Spending half -a day is worthwhile.

Village on top. The whole area of The Var is like a little village for tourists, very picturesque with plenty of lovely places for coffee and cake! Fishermans Bastion, The Palace, and the little streets around it are pretty. A good view over both parts of the City and all well signposted with wall plaques commemorating famous people etc.
