Must visit. its almost feels like a village up there. The views over pest are incredible. There is lots to see and do. Personally I would not recommend going to the labyrinth. We were both looking forward to going down there, but in our mid twenties with a phone flash for a torch we were both petrified.
Great views. The castle area is great for a pleasant stroll, pottering in and out of the shops and most of all for the excellent photo opportunities.

Nice place for a walk!. It is a very nice area where you can walk on narrow paved streets, you can visit a lot o places and eat good ice creams. You should not miss the Marzipan Museum (which is actually a shop).

Take in the magnificent views. The memories of Castle Hill are ones that you will keep for a lifetime. The views of the city are phenomenal, and nothing compares to the sun setting over the Danube, except when the lights go on at night. The city lights up like a magical fairyland. Wear your walking shoes & be sure to bring a camera: Everywhere you go is a photo-op from walking through the streets, enjoying the architecture, visiting the little shops and museums. Be sure and have a map of the castle grounds so you don't miss a thing. There is something there for everyone to enjoy. There is no fee to walk about the grounds, bring change for the restroom, and there are fees to access the museums etc.

Take the time to walk. Take the time to walk up he ramps to castle hill and explore. There is very little signage (in fact none that i saw) but I enjoyed just wandering around. There are a number of steps that are unavoidable so if you are less mobile beware.

It's worth the effort.. I loved Castle Hill it has stunning views and each approach to it is different. On a night time it is lit up and looks magical. There are so many interesting museums and houses/buildings. The views virtually all around are lovely.
Day and night with excellent view!. Castle district is very beautiful to walk and admire the view of the city! A walk there is something you need to do when you visit the city!
brilliant veiws. brilliant views of the city, gorgeous for a day of walking and discovering. Bring change as you have to pay to use the toilets.
Lovely view... Visit at sunset for the most beautiful sunset and also to watch the change of guards ceremony in the evening.. Take the funicular up the hill for stunning views of the chain bridge.

Wow! Well worth the uphill trek. I recommend taking the M2 to Szell Kalman ter. I had a great slice of Hawaiian pizza right outside the metro exit. It is an easy walk uphill. I passed an old Trebi in great condition on the way. You'll pass into the Castle hill by the statue of the Angel with the cross next to the National Archives. The building is fabulous, but I have never made it inside. I think there is an Army museum nearby with cannons outside. The main attraction is the church and the Fisherman's wall which are well worth the price of admission. I continued to the National Gallery and then back downhill.
All about the view. The view of the city from the top is fantastic. We were lucky to have clear blue skies so we could get some great photos. Not really much else to do there though.

Castle District. You can either take the funicular, walk up the hill or take bus number 16.
From here you can visit other attractions like Fisherman Bastion, Budapest history museum & there are many statues to see.
Try to see all the statues: Matthias Fountain, fountain of the fishing children, Prince Eugene of Savoy, Mac Tower.

Beautiful View of Pest and the Danube. It's a hike to the top, but really not bad at all. Not much to see except the exterior since there were no tours of the inside. It is basically office space for the government officials. There is a changing of the guards that is interesting if you have not seen that elsewhere.
The View. It was rather cold and windy when we were there but a great view Very popular area so timimn is important
Nice area, but not to exsiting. Nice aerea with a nice wiev. It is best when the weather is nice. There is a lot of museums teher, but I did not visit any of them.
Magnificent!. Stunning views all around. Beautiful buildings and architecture not to be missed! Brilliant photo opportunity. Highly recommended.

Castle Hill. No trip to Budapest would be complete without hiking straight up from the river to enjoy the sights at the pinnacle. Be sure to go inside the cave church, visit the Gelhert Baths, and take in the shopping ops.
lovely hidden sights. it is worth the tiring trip up the stairs to have a look at the views and find all the hidden bits of architecture and corners. great fun
Can't Miss!. Was by far my favorite part of the city. So many adventurous nooks and crannies to explore in this area, beautiful architecture, awesome restaurants and stunning views all around!

Disappointing visit. We enjoyed the pleasant, almost innocent atmosphere of Budapest, however we were disappointed by the castle. To begin with, the cable cart to the top was overpriced and the queues long, once on the top, although the views were interesting, the whole district seemed to be a trap to fleece tourists, which we had not encountered in other areas of the city. The tourist market sold the usual souvenirs, but the stallholders were friendly. Should I return, I will definitely give this district a miss.

A Must Visit Budapest Attraction. Stunning buildings, architecture and views over the city and the Danube. There is so much history and beauty in the buildings it is surely the must see attraction in Budapest. it is easy to get there but a guided tour provides an orated history of the area that enhances the experience. We would highly recommend this to all visitors to Budapest.
Palace.... More like Palace Hill but ok... best views of Pest, parliament and amazing it self with Palace, gardens, cable card and much much more.

Only wish it was Summer. Fantastic view of the city. Going up to see the Liberty Statue was quite something. Really worth the hike up the hill; if you go during the summer, don't even think about doing this without a bottle of wine so you can take a break and enjoy it. You can make it to Buda Castle & the old town in another hr or so from the Liberty Statue, though I would suggest resting at a restaurant between the two locations and grabbing a bite to eat and some wine.

Don't pass up Castle Hill while in Budapest!. The Fisherman's Bastion inside Castle Hill is worth the trip alone. Castle Hill offers a few bistros and restaurants, lace and art shops, and coffee houses. Don't miss the Labyrinth (aka Dracula's Chamber), an underground tunnel system complete with historical artifacts. Enjoy a leisurely stroll through Castle Hill today!

Fantastic views and historic buildings. The whole castle district is full of old buildings and lots of history I would recommend having a tour guide to rake you around as otherwise unless you can read Hungarian you are not going to really appreciate what you are seeing from a map of the area
Not a castle but still interesting. Its a palace so no battlements or towers. But there is a cool cathedral up there and also the palace contains the national gallery (entrance ~1700Fl)
Which way next?. Stunning place, could have done with a few more sign posts, we (and others) walked around not sure where to go. Well worth at least half day lookaround.

incredible views during night. personally I think you have to go up once during daytime with other tourist groups, and once during nighttime to see the city lights and the Danube.. be careful the lights are off around 1am

Beautiful Views of Pest!. It's not a long trek up the hill, and I recommend doing the short little hike rather than taking the funicular. There are so many different ways up the hill that you can explore before you even get up there! We followed a self-guided walking tour, courtesy of Rick Steves and had a really great time. A MUST DO while you're up here is Hospital on the Rock, an amazing hospital bunker that runs underneath the hill where they kept injured people during WWII and the uprising against the Soviets. We went in March and the weather was a little overcast, but nice for the most part.

great free entertainment. I think I was up here for 2 hours and spent 100Ft (to use the public restroom). There are ladies on the street selling their embroidery, shops to browse, people to watch, the gorgeous Matthias Church to marvel at, and of course, the view! Budapest is a beautiful city and this is the spot to see it from.

Buda Castle Labyrinth at night. After 6 p.m. you can go into the Buda Castle labyrinth with oil lamps in complete darkness. We (especiall I) loved it. The maze is quite huge and with the oil lamps it gets a creepy feeling to it. I wouldn't recommend going alone, it is quite creepy to be there all on your own without light. Especially great was the artificial fog, and the creepy stuff in Dracula's /Vlad's dungeon. I didn't really understand the opera (or theater) play related stuff in the dungeon, but the rest was great.

Lots to see and do!. This place is a must to visit when in Budapest. There is no end of things to do and see when you reach the top. It is an unesco world heritage site and it is easy to see why. I would recommend taking the steps up to the top instead of the tram. One of our personal favourites was the Dracula dungeons.

what a building. it was fun getting to the castle from the Funicular and it took all morning to get round just half of the fabulous paintings, more great views and lots of nooks and crannies to explore

Nice historic district. Pretty nice historic district with good views over Budapest. Some nice historic buildings. We went in March, it was cold and cloudy weather which takes a way a bit of the charm of this district I guess.
Breathtaking views.... This is 'THE' place to visit while in Budapest.Breathtaking views of the city and of course not to be missed 'The Castle' itself is gorgeous.I could spend the whole day here.
Great view. This region is pretty good, when you walking trough the village you can find very good restaurants and there is always greta views of Peste side.

Breath of the past. The whole facility is an unique mixture of old fortifications and leftovers of originally old palace with newly built palaces of Empire times. Every rock piece is so full of history, you could feel pulse of time.

A must in Budapest. If you are in Budapest and you can visit only one place, the Castle Hill should be it! Gorgeous buildings, where important historical events took place. Also, a number of great museum are here, including the Budapest History Museum and the National Gallery

A nice place to spend a day. We returned here the day following a tour to explore in more detail. Nice shopping and cafes and the view over the city is worth the climb. Give the labyrinth a miss though! Boring.
a must see. going up the castle hill was just wonderful.the castle itself is just wonderful to look at.a must see

Must see. This one of the best bits of Budapest. We used a hop-on/hop-off bus (the Big Bus) to get up there but then wandered around on foot to enjoy the pretty (restored) old buildings, Matthias Church, the Fisherman's Bastion, Buda Castle and the art gallery. Well worth a few hours and allow time to relax over lunch or a coffee.

Best view so far. We crossed the Chain Bridge and took the funicular up to Castle Hill. It offers some great views of the center of Budapest. There is a pier-like platform that takes you to a monument but it also has one of the best views from Castle Hill. My children - ages 2 and 3 - loved this area. There was a fountain with statues of dogs, and my girls thought it was one of the best things they saw all day! Definitely a must see and adventure around. We also saw the changing of the charges in front of Sandor Palace. My girls loved watching the charges with their guns and knives and listening to the music they played as they marched.

Fantastic!!!. All the castle block is simply amazing, my suggestion is:go there on night time (meaning when it's dark), you'll be delighted by a wonderful show of architecture and lights... Breathtaking!
City Views. Great place to overlook Budapest and the Danube. Some interesting sights also with the Matthias Cathedral, The Labyrinth, and the Castle itself. The Funicular ride is also quite good.,
A hill from another age. I went there at the morning and left almost at sunset this place is great. There are many places to visit there. You should get to the hill and find it's hidden treasures ;)

breathtaking site unbelievable view's.. Situated directly behind our hotel ,CARLTON,we toom a walk up the castle step route for a nuce enjoyable couple of hour's. The walk up is very nice,the March weather being particularly hot,clear blue sky, sun out absolutely fantastic, glad we had our cameras with us.The lovely streets up gere are awesome, the nice little cafe's just so nice,make this a very pleasant walk.Some of the site's here are fabulous, FISHERMANS BASTION ( HALASZBADTYA ), MATTHIAS CHURCH (MATYAS TEMPLON),TRINITY SQUARE to name but a few,a photographer's dream. The view's of CHAIN BRIDGE and the DANUBE look picture postcard perfect set off against the clear blue sky meant we could get some brilliant photographs. If the walk is a bit much for you there are various ways you can get up to here.1-Bus number 16 from DEAK FERENC TER.2-Varbusz fron MOSZKVA TER.3-Funicular,great fun but ultimately not worth the money. 4-Organised tour,most hotel's will offer a service operator. This really is a must go destination on any trip to this wonderful city.
Walk around at a leisourly pace and enjoy. The view and the cobble stones streets, enjoyed a meal at an outdoor restaurant service little slow but that is usual for the small restaurants in BUDAPEST

Restoration and views. We used the metro and the bus to get to Castle Hill. We enjoyed a couple of sunny hours wondering around this historic part of Budapest. Some lovely old buildings, architecturally interesting details and amazingly colourful roofs on the church. Much of the area has been restored so it is bit " chocolate box". I would suggest that footwear with a good thick sole is worn as the cobbles are hard on one's feet - I was very glad I had my winter boots on.

Don't take the gondle. Great place with a beautifull lookout over Pest. I would highly advice against taking the overpriced (5? oneway) gondle up or down though. Walking up and down the hill barely takes 15 minutes and really adds to the experience.

Wonderful vistas. Castle Hill offers the best views of the River Danube and Pest. There is so much to see here. Take the funicular to the top and enjoy. We saw the changing of the guard and enjoyed the many sights available here. Be sure to bring your camera, as the visuals are terrific.

stunning. a beautiful area, lots to see and do. very picturesque. Highly recommend the Guszwurm cafe, the biggest variety of delicious cakes and drinks! Only downside, couldn't find a restaurant serving vegetarian food..

Visited on March 15 national holiday and captivated entirely!. Excellent views of Budapest below with the Danube and Parliament. Fisherman's Bastion and Matthias church along with National Gallery will keep you enhcnated for hours and hours easily! You cannot seem to get enough photos from atop this Buda hill.

Castle Hill. Lovely architecture and fantastic views of the Danube and surrounding area. Take the rail up to the castle and after walking around it follow the path to the Fisherman's Mission. A great day out.
Must go. Really its very good place to see it and see amazing views of budapest from other side.i recommended it but must take your camera with u.

The Historical Museum a Highlight. I highly recommend making your way through pre-history through gothic through modern age Hungary at the Castle Hill History Museum. With your Budapest Card (BKK), your admission is free. There is a small 800 HUF for photography pass.
Very informative and interesting!

Lovely walk - stunning view. We didn't bother with the tour. Just had a wander and in no time were at the top.Maybe it's the time of year, but once you're up there, I hope you're not thirsty or in need of a wee as there was nothing open despite there being hundreds of tourists. I've never been anywhere where there are so many tourists and some local is not trying to sell small bottles of water for 1500% of cost. So there is an "in" for someone if they fancy it!Some interesting stuff to read about the history of the place. All part of a lovely weekend in this beautiful 2-city City!
Worth climbing. Wonderful view all around. Not hard to climb to. Not so arranged environment on the way up but anyway. ..

breath taking. The view of the city from this location is absolutely stunning, the area itself is also beautiful between the church and the palace is a small village which is very pretty with small shoos and waljibg tiurs available. Castle hill is very easy accessed by many if the bus tours
Great panoramic view. The views across the city are fantastic on a clear day. Great opportunity for photos and in March not crowded. To get there used a hop on hop off tour bus
Great views. We took the trolley up (kind of expensive for a short trip). We took a bus back down as we had metro passes. The views are amazing. It's beautiful up there and worth a stop.
Great view!. Well worth the trip up in the funicular to see the beautiful view. We happened to be there just before 1pm and witnessed the changing of the guard.

Took the trolly up!. What a beautiful view, and for the cost of the trolly up it was worth it! We really didn't feel like walking up all the stairs, and you still get the incredible view, you can see and feel all the history in the area! Worth it for sure!
Love the atmosphere. A bit of a museum, largely re-built after the second WW, but the atmosphere is still there despite a bit too many souvenir shops and restaurants for tourists.

The Best Vantage. You could find no better point of view to see the heights of Buda, and the city of Pest! The Walking Tour guide did a fine job of explaining what is was that we were seeing. It is a bit of a hike across the Cable Bridge, and up the many steps. Save your money, and the time in the line, and walk! It will do you good! And I do recommend that you enlist some form of guide, as this will give you a much better appreciation for what you are seeing.
beautiful castle and view. I liked the view and surraundings.we watched Danube River and Pest side of the city.We walked around and made a little shopping and then walked to Matyas Temple

Beautiful part of the city. Really gorgeous architecture, cobbled streets, a fantastic church which is being restored, great views and quirky shops. A great place to wonder and loose some hours. The restaurants are rather expensive in this area, though.

Amazing View. This must-see will kick-start your Budapest sightseeing, offers an incredible panoramic view from Budapest and the Danube. You can go there by fonicular, bus even walking. I definitely suggest this place.

Walkable, easy to get to. I went up by the Red line -> 16 Tram -> The 16 bus into Castle hill from the Pest side. Once through the gates, the complex, though large and sitting along the ridge top, was easy to walk and navigate. There are plenty of color coded signs in multiple languages (Hungarian, English, German) to help guide you to what you may be interested in.The architecture is beautiful and well maintained, and the views from the top looking toward Pest are fabulous. You don't have to spend money here - you can just walk and enjoy. However, if you want to spend, there are plenty of museums, attractions, restaurants, and cocktail places along the route. Word of advice - pay for everything in Hungarian florents - if they offer to let you pay in Euro, it will be a poor exchange rate - and often cost a few euros extra rather than what the actual exchange rate is.
Amazing views. Took the funicular which was cheap and saved a bit of walking. The views across the river to Pest and along the river are simply amazing.

Lovely. The Castle Hill is lovely, it's not very nice in a rainy day, but still beautiful. The view is superb and the attractions are very worth it. You have to get the funicular to go up and enjoy the ride, otherwise it won't be the same. The St. Mathias church is awesome, the most amazing church I've ever seen. Lots of souvenirs stores and restaurants. Another Budapest "must-see" attraction.
A Must do. There's a lot to see and do up here. A must go on your trip to Budapest, Hit the Labryinth, the Fishermans Bastion, and St. Matthias too!

For the views. Did the trip using one of the hop on hop off bus companies, and it worked very well. The citadel is 'closed' so all that's left is to take in the extensive views of Castle Hill, Pest and the Danube.
Worth the visit.
Take time walk around. We took time to just stroll around and explore the area. In that way we could see more of the area in our own time and find spots otherwise missed.

Fantastic sights by day and night. A lovely place with lots of atmosphere and amazing views. The castle is stunning and really special to see at night, when there are hardly any people around. Went here a couple of times and even in the mist, really enjoyed it.

Devote half a day here. Some people walk the Chain Bridge over and ride the funicular but another option that we did was to call an uber and take it directly to the Hungarian National Gallery. It cost us under $4 US. I feel that the National Gallery is worth your while to view the 15th century winged altars and also learn about the realism painter Munkacsy who lived during the Impressionist era and was more famous than they were during the late 1800's.Walk to Matthias Church and buy your ticket to tour the beautifully ornate church. Make sure you go into the Lorento Chapel and learn the significance. When we were there, the Fisherman's Bastion was free. There are so many beautiful photo opportunities at the Fisherman's Bastion of the Pest side.We ate a wonderful lunch at 21 Magyar Vendeglo which is located a few short blocks from the Hilton Hotel. It is located at Fortuna Utca 21. They have the best weiner schnitzel.The three of us did pre book a wine tasting at the Faust Cellar. It is a small area under the Hilton Hotel. We thought the wines were good, not the best we had in Hungary. It is a fun experience but a person definitely needs to pre book.We did not go to the Hospital on the Rock.

Stunning views....bring your camera. Take the funicular up to Castle Hill. It's sweet & old-fashioned. We enjoyed a cup of gluwhein while taking in the gorgeous views. Even on a dull day it was beautiful. The changing of the guard is nothing special but added a bit of fun to the trip.

Beautiful. Fantastic View absolutely must see panoramas from this hill, you get to see the beautiful parliament building and Budapest's many bridges and you get to watch as life goes on in the city from the calming look out areas. If you get the chance be sure to try the funicular at least once as it offer great views as well although it is just a short ride, there are sometimes fees to go up to the look out of Fishermen’s Bastion however it is worth the small sum of roughly £2, (although it was free when I visited), on top of the hill there are usually many markets and souvenir stands with many yummy things along the hill, there is also a free bus that can take you up and down from the hill and get you back in to the city although it is very busy so be aware. Buda Castle and its many courtyards host several festivals and events all over the year including an international wine festival, a beer festival, and a folk art festival. (I visited the folk art festival) which was great fun.Additionally if you wish to get around the city I highly recommend the public transport as it is SUPER easy to use such a breeze, you can purchase day/ week cards / even monthly should you need it. You can use for trams, buses and the metro, if you don't want to buy a ticket from the ticket office go find a BKK ticket machine where you can handily purchase tickets in your respective language. Additionally buses metro trams and all public transport have built in screen of up coming stops and conveniently announce where you can change for metros and different popular areas in English and Hungarian, so if you do plan on taking public transport it is all good.To sum it up excellent experience at this attraction.

Magnificent view. It's easily accessible with public transport (bus no 16) and it's a place that shouldn't be missed. You could spend a whole day walking around, enjoying the view and the surroundings and taking beautiful pictures of course~~

Nice day out. Me and my wife visted this attraction. We went up in the cable car (a must for anyone) you can bye a return ticket which is valid for 12 months. There are some lovely views of Budapest and great photo opportunities.

Photo Ops Aplenty. For the seasoned traveler this may be a bit too touristy but how can you visit Budapest without taking the time to see Castle Hill? Some interesting things to find here including the Castle (of course), Mathias Church, Hospital in the Rock, the National Hungarian Gallery and the prerequisite rip-off souvenir shops. Good for photo ops & great for people watching too. There is a funicular for those unwilling to take the time, (or who are unable), to walk the winding paths and stairs to or from the streets below.

history museum and gardens. Take the cable car up ! Gardens are lovely .Be warned this is a lot of walking and up and down steps ! I walk a lot and found this hard.would be very hard with small children or if you have problems walking. The museum is interesting but not well signed in English.

Wonderful Views, Great Shopping and Dining. We so enjoyed our day here! The castle tour is wonderful, and walking around the hilltop area, so full of small interesting shops, restaurants and bars, is great in daytime as well as at night. At night the views of the lights are incredible. We also had sunset drinks up here--highly recommended.

"Bor" or "wine" festival. Having visited the Budai Var (castle) during a wine festival, I recall the visit with pleasure: hungarian wines are often excellent - sometimes pricy too... - but it is a delight to discover them at Budai Castle and its superb views on the Danube and the city.
What a view. On our bus tour we stopped up at Castle Hill and the panoramic view over the River and the city is a must see for any visitor to Budapest.

No Funicular. Having been to the Citadella and walked back to the waterside the funicular seemed a good idea but it was out of action for repairs. Interesting walk up but would have tried a different mode of transport.

beautiful all round. The views from all the sides of the castle hill are amazing. The walk itself is long from the Gillert side, but its worth while, especially if the weather is good. The sculptures and monuments are amazing. The museum closes early, so check the time of visit. There is also a parade for the king, which happens on particular times, did witness that as well.. there is also a small market one end of the castle hill close to the bastion..

Worthwhile. We walked all the way from Gellert Hotel to Castle Hill. It's worthwhile despite the long walk. By the time we got to Castle Hill, it was dark and the lights were on. A great view of the city from the top. We went to a cafe at the top. It was lovely to sit, relax and admire the view. Hungarian red wines are excellent! We took a bus downhill (16 I think) to the last stop. There was a metro station & trams there to get to your next destination.

Beautiful. Standing up by the castle at night looking down over Budapest is breathtaking, it also reminds a lot of Prague. beautiful view, and fun to walk around a little bit, but it is not very big so it doesn´t take too long.

Stunning Views. We were fortunate that our hotel was situated very close allowing us to choose quiet times to take advantage of all that was to offer. As the day went on this area was very crowded as there were a lot of coach parties. The views from the Fisherman's is not to be missed or a trip to the Hospital in The Wall. If you have the time just walk down some of the side streets and you upon the most stunning views.
Romantic. Beautiful view of Pest, especially for couples. The walk is really nice and there are lots to see. Great walking exoerience both during the day and when the sun sets.
Beautiful. Wow, this castle was so beautiful. We went with friends who were from there who told us of the history. It is a lot of walking but well worth it!

Buda Hill Area. We stayed a week in a hotel on Buda Hill as my husband had a conference to attend for a few days in Pest. We could have stayed in the conference Hotel, but were glad to have done something different.We were there in March, and it was a peaceful area with little traffic and not too many tourists.We walked different routes up ad down the hill to the city at least once a day, -and saw beautiful architecture and sights all the time. Also reasonable contribution to our daily exercise regime.The Hill area has a number of attractions, -none of which we entered, -too busy drinking in the local life. It has quite a few restaurants, -can definitely recommend Baltazar. But give a miss the pretty looking Italian place on the Square with arched ceilings -that seemed to produce bland ready-made food.I can imagine it's heaving with tourists in the Summer

Great views across the city. We made our way to Castle Hill as part of a free walking tour which was a great way to see all the main sites and hear some history about this area of the city. A must see when in Budapest, allow a good few hours to wander around.
Excellent views. Great place to visit , very unique place to see, beautiful church you have to see. Great views of Budapest , bring a camera

Stunning!. This area is definitely worth a visit. We could have spent longer here but sadly ran out of time! I preferred this side of town to the Pest side as it has less traffic, wonderful views over the city and amazing architecture. We didn't get to the Citadel sadly which is on the list for our next visit!

amazing views. Enjoyed the castle area the views are breathtaking. Matthias church is good not the greatest church we've ever visited but ok and the same with the national gallery good but not great, but still a lovely area with plenty to do and lots to see.

Amazing Views. You can either take the "lift" to the top or the stairs. We took the stairs and as you climb up the views across the Danube River just gets better and better. Amazing view pest and surrounding once you are at the top. Loads to see at the top too and few places to eat some good food.
Great View. lots to see,many places eat, must visit the labyrinth, great view, great photo opportunities from the top, very clean, very gothic
If visiting Budapest, a must see. Did not have enough time to see everything but enjoyed what I did see. Great views and several museums to see. Lots of History!

Great view across Budapest. Take bus 16 from the bridge below. It takes you to the top. Fantastic views across the Danube river. Quiet residential areas to walk around. You can visit the Royal Palace museums.

Do you like good sights? Go here than . Just to correct my title castle hill is not only about sight. Of course once you made it up either by foot or by the funicular is the first thing to notice, but you can get better on the top of Gellert hill. :D to go up to castle hill I recommend the route through the Castle Garden Bazaar an amazing construction. Once you up keep an eye on your watch because every one hour there is the guard change in Sandor palace just next to the funicular. Once you are in the castle district you basically have access to all attraction but if you have a little bit more time go and look around, it's such an authentic place do not stick with the original tour, explore a bit, you won't regret it !

Place must not be missed. Though there were million of people, buses, tourists, locals, everyone...it was nice a nice walk over the chain bridge and then to take a taxi up to the Castle and to spend couple of hours just wondering around from one building to another, enjoying great December sun

Fantastic views, historic setting. Such a pretty, historic area. The views from the fishermans bastion is unparalleled, really. Everyone should experience it if visiting Budapest. Had a nice coffee and strudel then walked around to check out the view. There are several restaurants around also, although they seemed pretty basic to me based on the menus I read. The cheese strudel I had was great, the view really topped it off!

Wonderful Place. It´s a wonderful ancient village. I Suggest to visit the St. Matthias Church and the fisherman bastions. The landscape over Budapest and the Danube river is very suggestive from there! A must visit.
A must. Fantastic views of the city and lots to do here. Can however get very busy with bus parties. Try to pick a bright dry day.

Have To See It. Great views, lots of old churches, and of course a castle. It is not overly difficult to get to, but you may want to take a car. For anyone traveling from the United States, you will be amazed by the beautiful old buildings. I would say this is a must see for anyone traveling to Budapest.
Fantastic views. Can get very busy but the view is wonderful and a good walk around is a must to see all Castle Hill has to offer.

A must do when in Budapest!. I cannot imagine visiting Budapest without a stop up top of castle hill. The view if the city is amazing, as are all the historical buildings on top. It is also where you can take a tour of the underground caverns.
Lots to see. This area is worth visiting as there is a lot to see and do and can take half a day to do it justice.

Walkable area. Whole area is walkable once you ascend the hill. Taxi or funicular is best way but there is bus service from central pest as well. Great area to explore on foot and there are numerous cafes in the area.

Interesting but disappointing. Vies were great but unfortunately the caste is no longer. They have ruined the main building by replacing the windows with modern day windows in white that look totally out of place. Castle is no longer but to me this is not made clear before you go there
Good walk and amazing view. All the castle neighborhood is nice, there are good options of restaurants and the view is really nice. If you can plan, avoid snow days..super slipery ;)

Easy way to spend a few hours.. There are a few sights to see up here - the Castle itself, Matthius Church and Fisherman's Bastion to name a few. Definitely an area you have to visit on a trip to Budapest. The walk up there is really quite easy, much easier than the Prague Castle. I enjoyed my few hours spent strolling around the grounds appreciating the view and the history!
Castle Hill. Castle Hill was a nice stop on our Budapest tour. The area itself was easy to navigate. It made for some great scenic views and a chance to chill.
Nice view. Easy walk to the top. When the weather permits the view over the main landmarks of Budapest are excellent.
Worth Seeing. Good views and a bit of living history. Don't buy overpriced knick-knacks there, take a tram to the covered market hall at Fovam Ter.
Magnificent view!. Historical monument, a must at a Budapest visit, beautiful building with great view. Nice places around but a bit touristy.

Good Hike and Views. This is a can't miss when you go to Budapest. The view, in my opinion, is only second to Matthias Church. It's a fairly quick walk up the hill and the castle architecture is fascinating.
view from the hill. nice view from this point and the history of this castle is worth visiting. The hop-on-hop-off brings you at this point

Another great view. Fantastic views from here, and a nice walk all around the grounds, there is also a museum here & the changing of the guards outside the palace. you can take some good photos from this point again. we changed money in the castle area & got a very bad rate so try to change in town its much better.
Great scenary . You will get nice photos and atmosphere up on this hill. A panoramic view of the 2 cities and great history of the place.
A must see in Budapest. Budapest is a great city with tons of sights, but the castle is a definite must see to get a bit of the history and an amazing view of the city and the river.
A Must for All Visitors to Budapest. A lovely walk to the top and excellent views and plenty to see when you are there. From here you get a marvellous view over most of the city.

Beautiful. lovely experience
Go up to castle hill via the sikna!
Views are incredible and definitely worth spending half a day or a whole day here

Great views. If you are on one of those walking tours or a solo 2 hour stroll along Danube, Castle Hill becomes a non-negotiable spot purely because of the views it offers. It is quite taxing to reach the top though and if you have come from the city center, you might want to take a bus back. But for shutterbugs, this is absolute heaven. You get a full view of the Chain bridge and the many other magnificent bridges and full view of Buda.

Beautiful and romantic. Definitely worth a visit - this beautiful land mark is exquisite and special - fantastic views over the city, gorgeous backdrop for photographs. Really special. Great for couples but equally worth visiting as a family or on your own. Wandering through the streets, and the coridoors of the Fisherman's Bastion makes you feel like a real life fairy princess!

Great views of the city. Definitely worth a walk up castle hill (mound) to see the Stunning view of Pest. Best included as part of a free walking tour so that you can get some info on the local attractions at the same time!
A must see. Everything closed on a Sunday and MondayLots to see but usually charged a small entrance feeRestaurants tend to be more expensive in this area
Fantastic. Walked over the chain bridge and chose to walk up to Castle Hill. It was a clear day and the views from here were amazing!
A nice walk up to the Castle. First a nice walk up to the castle. Then waiting for the dark and see the Chain Bridge and Pest lightning up
Interesting but not much atmosphere. Interesting area worth visiting but not much atmosphere.good views of city. Do not bother with funicular railway if there is a queue as it takes ages.

Another "Must Visit" Place. It's really difficult to describe what it feels like to visit Castle Hill (Varhegy). When one thinks about the history of the location, coupled with the scenic vista, it almost becomes overwhelming. Please do yourself a favor, and visit. I promise, you will enjoy it.

Interesting castle and wine festival. We have visited Budapest during autumn and winter. During autumn, we went to the wine festival held in the castle. Excellent festival, good wine, many variety. The view from the castle is just great. You can see the Danube river and Pesta. Interesting to be visited also the castle inside, a lot of art work and Hungarian history.

Great Views. Took the hop on hop off tour bus up to here, great views from both sides of the hill and good cafes for food and drink. Make sure you watch the time for the return bus as there can be long waits if you miss yours.

See forever. A great point from which to see either where you have been or where you can go. Access is a breeze by the bus services available and once there there are a number of places to visit and sources of food and refreshment
Amazing area and view. Amazing area and view over the city. Coffee and cake at Cafe Ruszwurm is a must. - This is the oldst café in Budapest - small but beautiful!! :)
Amazing views. This place offers the best views of Pest. Definitely worth venturing up even in cold and windy weather. Must do in the city.
Photo opportunity. Wonderful views from Castle Hill, looking over City and River Danube. Use bus to help get you there, otherwise a long steep walk up.

The nicest part of the Buda part of the city. See my Review under the Fishermen's Bastion section. When you tire of touring busy city streets on the Pest side of the river, take a bus up the hill toward the Bastion. It feels wide open up here and the views of the river are fabulous. Lots of places to tour too, so make a day of it. There are cafes, restaurants, fast food etc. up on this hill so you won't go hungry.
Great Views. Breathtaking views of the entire city and some nice places to eat. Do yourself a favor and walk around the entire hill

Stunning Views. To get stunning views of Pest, you find it hard to beat. Take the train up from the Chain bridge and get your camera out. Beautiful buildings and loads of charm. Watching the change of the guard is also quite entertaining. Definitely worth a visit.

Beautiful. We stopped on our hop-on hop-off bus tour at the castle hill area and it was lovely! The sun was shining which definitely helped but we walked around for around 3 hours before getting back on the bus! There weren't many people around either so you could really go off and explore without feeling like you were part of a tour which is sometimes the case in places like this. If you are in Budapest you have to visit! There is a hill train for people who don't want to walk up but the views are stunning and you can take your time so we didn't use this.

A walk along the top of this hill is a must. Although the hill itself has little to offer, a walk along the top of the Buda hill from the Castle area through to the Matthias church is a great way the spend half a day.We went up at the Castle end (opposite the Chain bridge), meandered along the area (don't bother with the castle unless your a Hungarian art lover) behind the Presidents residence (the guards guns are not real), going in and out of interesting streets, visited the Matthias Church and didn't start to descend until we got to an old building with a colorful roof that is the Archives Repository. This brought us down near the next bridge.The buildings and the view are spectacular and the exersize will take care of the calories of the famous cream cake in the cafe halfway down the street away from the Matthias Church - it is very popular and is amongst a few souvenir shops.

Stunning Views. simply, superb views. When one thinks that 80% of this city was levelled in WWII it's renaissance is amazing. No better place to look at it than from here. In addition the whole area that one looks at the city from warrants a couple of days rather than the 5 hours I gave it. Truly remarkable
quite and clean. Views over the river are stunning . Museum well with a visit .we stayed on castle hill so all was close by but if you are staying in pest there is a regular bus run
Great buildings. Fabulous views across the city. The buildings are amazing we also had a little drink in the bar overlooking the city as the sun went down, beautiful!

Nice walk and views. Our bus tour offered a free guided tour of Castle Hill, but we just struck out on our own. Great 360 degree views. You can take the stairs, the funicular, or get dropped off on top by one of the many bus tours. Lots of good restaurants and sights.

Worth the walk. I would say that if you want to make this walk up Castle hill i would look at doing it early in the morning because the later you leave it the more busier it becomes but this is like anywhere you go. The views are breathtaking and you will sure get some amazing photos. I was told to watch your belongings when in this area because with so many people around there are lots of pickpockets so just be aware.There is Wonderful architecture and statues around this area and a beautiful church but i think only locals are aloud in because we saw people getting turned away.

A really wonderful place to visit. Castle hill in Budapest is a real gem and every one visiting this city must definitely visit this place. From the President's Palace to St Matthias church and Fishermen's Bastion you can spend a whole day going round the place. There are also some wonderful restaurants as well.
Amazing views at night. Make a trip at sunset and stand at the walls either facing towards Buda or away the views are spectacular.

Great for a walk. Walk around and enjoy the amazing scenery of Budapest! It has a great view of the whole city from different angles, as the castle hill covers a big area!Be aware that this is the most popular attraction, so the prices of the little shops around are sky-rock in comparison to the rest of Budapest! Also it takes some time to hike up there so wear comfortable shoes! You can easily spend a whole afternoon walking around!

Good Place to start. The Castle Hill area is a good place to start a trip to Budapest. Not only does it have galleries/museums and the lovely matthias church at the Fisherman's Bastion end, it also has a 'cable car/victorian lift' experience as the best means of getting up the very steep hill and is generally a nice area to walk around with nice cafes/bars and a little market area selling souvenirs and incredibly cheap fur hats/mitts etc.. Added interest was the 'changing of the guard' outside the palace.

Great hike for brilliant views. Brilliant, I loved this city and the height gave for beautiful view over Buda and pest! Before you go make sure to check the localTourist information. We spotted that there was things going on all around

breathtaking views. beautiful area of Budapest. make sure to plan enough time to explore this amazing district. definitely a place not to be missed on your first trip to Budapest with lots of view points across the Danube. i would highly recommend to go in the evenings too when all the bridges, the Parliament and other buildings are beautifully lit up.when you are in the Castle District make sure to also visit the oldest café in Budapest, the Ruszwurm. it's near the Matthias Church &has been there since 1827. Sissi (the Austrian Empress & Queen of Hungary) used to send couriers to get cakes for her breakfast. really delicious cakes.

It's worth it.. You don't have to take the stairs, but if you want some exercise it's worth it. The whole castle hill is great to explore. Lots of things to see and museums to visit. A great afternoon.

MUST VISIT. I absolutely loved the castle hill, one of my all-time favourite spots in Europe. Visited it during my one month interrail last summer. Everything was just so beautiful there, all the monuments, the churches, the buildings in all different colours... Wish I could be there again. You need to spend at least one day on the castle hill, there are so many things to see... And don't forget to take sunset/nighttime photos of the Danube river and the Parliament building from the Fisherman's bastion!!
castle hill tour. Did the guided walk that was free from one of the bus tours. Really learnt about the history of hungry and Budapest from it

Nice views of the Danube and Pest. Plenty to see on the hill. Easy to get to with mass transit. Take the small little bus from the subway stop to the top of the hill for nice vistas of Pest and the Danube River

Such a wonderful area with lots to see and do. Make sure you take the lift carriage at the foot of the Chain Bridge to explore a wonderful area of the city with so many places to visit, including churches, museums, Fisherman's Bastion, and a nice selection of bars, restaurants and coffee shops etc. This was such a great experience and provides so many view points across the Danube, which is especially atmospheric in the evening when the buildings are beautifully lit up...!! I thoroughly enjoyed walking around and taking in so many of the sights, chilling out with a coffee and cake and looking at the striking statues dotted all around the area. This is a must see for anyone travelling to Budapest - make sure to wear comfy warm shoes with a bit of grip if visiting in winter

Trams were interesting. Staying at the top of the hill, we took the tram up and down a couple of times.There are some good sites in Castle Hill. If we had more time, we would have liked to have done the segway tour of Castle Hill.

Lots to see. There's a lot to do around here (get a guide book!) and you really need the best part of a day to see everything properly, particularly if you want to spend time at the National Gallery. Its easy to get to either on foot or by public transport and the walk up isn't that bad unless you're old or sick, and the funicular railway isn't value for money at all.
BIRD WIEW. Realy fantastic wiev and panoroma of Budapest from the top and enable to visit every part of wonderfull Budapest so amazing the words are not enough to tell just go and visit....

Breath-taking. Going in January meant there was still snow on the ground.
The view of Buda, Pest and the Danubee was beautiful.
Castle Hill is worth a visit, particularly for photos.

Get up here for the view. The castle area as such was not very impressive, at least not in January. It seemed a bit like the entire area was closed for the season. The view over Pest and the Danube was really nice though.There is a funicular up to the castle, but I recommend to walk instead if you are not only looking for the funicular ride as such. The tickets are really expensive and it takes just 5 min to walk up the hill.
Great view. Got up there via Budapest Castle Hill Funicular well worth it. Spectacular view rom atop over The city of Budapest. It's free to walk around the castle which should be done.
Great views of the city. A must do to enjoy the best views of Budapest. On Buda side, we did a free walking tour, guided by the lovely Judit. Unmissable.
I will never forget!. Budapest is one of my favorite cities. And of course it is necessary to look at it from the Buda Castle. The magnificence!

Interesting and great church. The ONLY reason this was not excellent is because it rained (a lot) but was interesting and views would have been better if the mist had gone. The inside of the church is a must to see though

Beautiful history. Even by foot or even by funicular, this tour is amazing! You can see the most beautiful part of the city! Than on the top you can meet the former royal castle, now it's the national library. There are exhibitions too.The castle can take your breath away! It's free to walk around.There's fee to exhibitions, to the library but it's worth it! (not too much)

You can walk up easily!. A nice start to view the Pest side from the Buda hill around the castle. There is a tram going up there and the hill looks steep. But there is a fine paved walkway up and for most people it is not an effort. The tram was way to expensive I think for the short ride. Unless you like trams that is. The castle is nice looking but pretty young and rebuilt I believe. We did not go in to any of the museums but you should keep on walking along the hill to the old parts where there are nice cafes and restaurants and houses to visit.
Beautiful setting to explore. Use the funicular to get up and then walk your way down. Beautiful view every where you look. Even though it was december the weather was sunny, luck was on our side!
superb architecture. Really enjoyed the mooch around Castle Hill so much to take in - would recommend for those interested in buildings and history

Beautiful!. The views from the hill over Pest are fantastic and the castle buildings themselves are equally stunning. We explored the area in the afternoon/evening and when the buildings lit up it was fascinating. We will definitely return on our next trip to Hungary!

Castle Hill BUDAPEST. Best part of Budapest. Expensive to go up and down the FUNICULAR, though we did it. The following day we used the Metro and bus. (Via a Budapest card-good value). Be careful at the Airport- 2 desks next to each other, Just get the Budapest card, not the Transport card - We bought both, but the the Budapest Card covers you for transport and some free Museums. Magnificent views over the city.

STUNNING VIEWS. View of pest and the parliament were stunning in good weather! Had a nice time walking around the castle hill - quaint little streets and not too crowded nor touristy. Highly recommended!

Stunning. This is an intriguing and stunning area - the weather was terrible while we were there so we didn't spend as much time wandering around as we'd have liked, but it was fascinating. The views are great, and I'll definitely come back to explore again when I'm next in Budapest.

First day Itinerary. I think is the best things to do in budapest and must do in first day of visit in a good weather, cause you will have a nice Panorama, and you will see the PEST part. Walk around the REAL PALACE, National gallery, National Librery, St. Mattias church and every thing you want exist. nice streets and shops.

The view and the area itself. One of the Days we had a private tour (Sweet Travel Private Tours - highly recommended!) who took us up hear and showed us around. It was a good thing, we got to know a bit more about it and had a good chance to see the view. The other day we took the funicular up, not too expensive, and a fast easy way to get up. There is the option to walk, which we would ahve done if it wasn't so Cold and a bit windy. The other option is taxi or bus.

Great Views. Worth making the trip even just for the views. There's not much more to say about except that if you time it right, you may catch the changing-of-the-guard ceremony at the presidential palace. The best ways to access the hilltop are via the funicular railway, or by walking. There's no charge to walk around Buda castle, so don't forget to take in those views as well. The hilltop (i.e. by the Funicular) is well located for further exploration, eg. the National Gallery, National Library, Budapest Museum (all in Buda Castle) and other museums and attractions in old Buda.

Nice , but probably nicer in spring. Quite impressive even in winter time, though I guess it is much nicer when all the trees are green.The site itself could be better kept, the paths quite run down.Nevetheless, the site is a "must" to visit.

Any tour of Budapest has to include the Castle Hill.. Budapest is unusual in that it is a city of two very different halves: Buda which is the ancient castle are on the imposing hill (almost a mountain by some standards) on the Western side of the Danube and Pest which is on the basically flat plain on the East. This means that from high up on the Buda side you get a spectacular close up panorama of Pest. Budapest was a twin capital of the Austro-Hungarian Empire and the Hapsburgs made sure it had an impressive array of imperial buildings - it's not Vienna but it's still pretty impressive with an extraordinary Parliament House the match of the Palace of Westminster (not a great Parliament in terms of what was done inside but a great building). Anyway any tour of Budapest has to include the Buda Hill.

"Breathtaking Views!". Probably one of the best views in Europe! The views are breath taking! The long steep walk is definitely worth it. An amazing medieval walled city with cobbled streets with so much to see!

Wonderful Walking and Running area!. Cross the famous Chain Bridge and scale this beautiful hill! Ideal for a morning run (before all the people begin to arrive) and wonderful adventure for you and your significant other to walk and explore. You can ride the funicular up if you aren't up for the ascent--but it really is not nearly as taxing as it may look. Beautiful statues, monuments, governmental buildings adorn this entire area. The view across the river to the Parliament Building and of the Danube River is stunning! It's all free and a great way to burn off a few calories. Don't miss out on this experience.

You must do this. This is definitely THE thing to do in Budapest. If you are familiar with Prague Castle then you will find that this is similar. It is a basically a large historic area that has many amazing things to see in it - churches, gift shops, restaurants, museums, etc. I took the funicular up, but it seems there is a lot to see if you don't . If you have all day I would suggest walking it. I spent at least a half a day up here and I saw everything.
Amazing view. Walk the castle and all its surroundings. There's plenty to see and the view is totally worth it. It's easy to get there by trem

Mesmerising!. A beautiful palace with a nice collection in the museum but above all, the view of the Danube river and the city of Pest were absolutely breathtaking. Plenty of things to see and do around the area too.

Hike the hill. The best way to get an understanding of the hill is to first understand its signifigance to the city and its history and then hike up the hill on the paths from the Elisabeth bridge. That way you will probably be tired and really pick up on the hills signfigance to the city when you see the fort and the magnificent views from the top in all directions up and down the Danube. There are some vendors selling souvenirs on the road to the fort and if you take the streets down it will give you insight into the neighborhoods in the area. You can walk down and head right over to the Palace area .
Breathtaking . Amazing amazing, words cannot describe how btf is up there and how stunning is the view... Try to go before 6, Cuz everything close so early in the surroundings. Can't wait to go back!
Beautiful. its one of my favorite place in Budapest! Even my kids were in love with this place! the view is awsome and we got wonderful pictures to remember our visit.

Castle Hill Visit. Castle Hill is must see place at the bank of Danube river and I reached there by walk after crossing Danube River Chain Bridge .There is ticket counter and you can buy ticket to go on top by Train .It is nice walk and you can also take support of some walking tour group moving around to enjoy it

The Must-see Spot in Buda. You've got to give credit to the People of Buda for restoring this area after the devastation of war when so many landmarks are being demolished in other cities. There is just too much here to talk about ,From the Funicular that climbs o the top of the hill to the picturesque views of the city below. The National Gallery was more than I expected . I was able to view traditional works at a leisurely pace because it was not overcrowded.The food service within was also a pleasant surprise, a contrast to the "gotcha" attitude of New York museums The changing of the guard at the Presidential Palace was an unexpected surprise. I was most impressed with the ongoing restoration of the Medeval castle works.Roaming the quaint streets after dark and selecting a cozy cafe was also special.
Worth walking up.. We walked up the hill and enjoyed the views and ambience. Some interesting shops and lots of places to eat.

Big hill, great view. It is a tough walk up to the top of castle view but you get an amazing view down onto the city, especially the government buildings and the chain bridge too. Well worth the trek up and a number of cool little shops and restaurants up here too.
nice climb!. A bit of exercise to take in the view of the entire city. Visited in winter but imagine it a very popular place in the summer months.

Nice area to stroll around. This area is very nice to stroll around.
The view from the top is very nice and it was followed by the nice architecture and buildings in that area as well.
We take bus from Szell Kalman to this place and walk around 2 hrs in this area.
wedding anniversary. an amazing place with spectacular views,historic buildings, old style streets with traditional shops, taverns and reteraunts.you willnever get bored with castle hill.

fantastic views and free to visit. The hill overlooks the city and on all sides the sights are incredibly beautiful. It can be reached on foot, from near metro station gellik or take the bus 27 from the next metro stop. A five minute hike to the top but the views are worth it!

Some delights, mostly typical, but not to miss. Castle hill is fantastic to look at from far away. Get your views from the other side of the city or from up at the Citadella. Up close and inside I didn't find it too special. Fisherman's Bastion was excellent, and worth the trip all by itself. There are a lot of museums up here, just walk around and you'll find them. I didn't have time to do any of them but the Labryinth (which there are signs so you'll have no trouble finding it). If you want to walk around and just see the place, plan for about 1.5 hours. There are big, helpful maps at key tourist points.

The nicest place in Budapest... Go to this hill and you will get a deep Budapest spirit. The view over the city is absolutely spectacular. Also, there are so many touristic attractions, which offer a nice concept about the history of the country! A must-go in Budapest ! There are many ways to go to the top of the hill from the city centre (the other side of the Danube) One of them is the funicular. Just cross the Chain Bridge and you'll get to the station. Also, another good and efficent way to get there is to use the underground( from Elizabeth Squaare to Moscow Square). From Moscow Square, there is a 500 metres walk to the Castle.

Great place. Go here both at night and during the days for some spectacular photo opportunities. You can take the funitel up, or a taxi. But if you're in good shape and need some exercise, consider walking

Great view of Pest!. Best view in all of Budapest because you can stand with your back to the monstrosity of the Hilton hotel and not have it disturb your wa. Note; once you head off down the hill to the north towards Buda commercial town centre its a bit of a walk until you get to cafes and food again so if you're dying for that caffiene fix, get it before you stroll off the heights.
Castle Hill is beautiful. Must see if you visit Budapest! Take time to walk around in the little streets and have a coffee in a restaurant terrace. Beautiful architecture, special place.

great view!. Great view, you have a lot of things to do there. good place to start your trip .Amazing place to take a surreal photo.
Start with some Gluhwein and then proceed to some of the best views of Budapest !!
Great sights, poor signs. A very impressive area though there needs to be better signage. Almost like a movie set it is impressive from all angles.

Get the overview. Great overview of the city, from the parliament across all bridges
Little bit windy in December and really cold so be sure to bring good clothes

Outstanding Views. Castle Hill has the most spectacular views in all directions over the city and Danube River. We were very happy to see our driver took us to the top as we'd had a great day sightseeing and not ready for another lot of steps! On the walk back to the meeting place for the coach we browsed the unusual variety of little shops. Also bought a much appreciated ice cream!

Enjoy the wonderful views!. The Buda Castle and the fortified old town are strategically located on the top of Buda hill; to reach it, I recommend to go through the Chain bridge and take the funicular (Budavari Siklo), just in front of it. By spending 1100 Ft (about 3.50 Euro) for a one-way ticket (1700 Ft, in case you choose the two-ways ticket), you can reach the square in front of the Castle entry gate.The Castle complex is very huge and many architectural styles (Medieval, Baroque, Modernist) can be noted, since it developed through six centuries, starting from the XIV one.We’ve been there on 1st of January, and Castle and all the annexed museums were closed; nevertheless, we’ve enjoyed anyway the walking paths running around the Castle, getting the chance to delight our eyes with the wonderful views of river Danube and Pest town. The very sunny day (even if freezing) played a quite important role in enjoying our panoramic walking.An arcade passage leads to the Castle backyard, where the Matthias fountain (probably the most photographed subject of the palace) can be found; there, a hunting scene is represented with great realism. Very huge and wonderful is even the inner courtyard, which arcade internal entry sides are decorated by two roaring lions.From the wide backyard area, the old town can be reached through a short walk; several shops, bars and restaurants are there, hosted into the old restored colored houses.Going straight, you’ll find the Matthias Church (it absolutely worth a visit) and adjacent Fisherman Bastion, which gives a view on Parliament and Pest new town.Whether you like to walk, climbing down to the Danube requires just 10 min; once down of the hill, we moved from Danube bank to the Parliament through the Margit bridge. Recommended.
Great night visit. Must go at night. Beautiful view for miles. Golden lights and surreal photo opportunities.Start with some Gluhwein and then proceed to some of the best views of Budapest !!
Beautiful view. There is a beautiful view on the city from the castle hill. Thanks to our budapest card we could visit the national gallery and it was very interesting.

Lots to see; Great View. This place captures the grand Hungarian it spirit and spirituality. A huge church, a statue dedicated to the Holy Trinity, equestrian statue of Istvan and the arcade of the Fishermen all come together in this hill.There is no shortage of people trying to sell you stuff. Unless you are used to dealing in forints be sure to bring a calculator if you buy something. This is a popular location. Be ready to expect it to be full of people. It may take some patience to take the picture you have in mind. It is not so crowded that you can't get about.This is not a flat area. There is no strenuous climbing once you reach the top. If hills are an issue for you try to park as close to the top as possible.

Fabulous view and Witch place!. Bus ride starts at the Cable car near the Chain bridge. The ride is uphill.You will reach castle hill in less than 30 mins.The view from Castle hill is what tourists die for. You can see a whole of pest from the hill.Danube looks like Python and disappears. You see the parliament and many other important buildings of the city from the top. The Hill is the best place to get your best photograph to share facebook and instagram!By the way, you will also find beautiful tourists from all the world!!Overall... No one can miss this place!

Amazing views! . We visited Budapest in December and Castle hill was among our to see list as it was near our hotel. We enjoyed wonderful views over the Danube and Budapest iconic buildings, strolling around the hill you can see a small Christmas market at this time, wonderful small restaurants or cafes to keep warm during cold weather.

Spent a day walking around Castle Hill. This is one of the nicest city strolls that we have walked on vacation. We started out walking the Szechenyi Chain Bridge, then took the Funicular up to the top of the hill. Lots of photo opportunities to be had on this walk. We walked around the Hungarian National Gallery, but didn't go in. Make sure to check out the Matthias Fountain as it is beautiful and illustrates a nice story. There was no water running through the fountain most likely because it was December. Behind the Hungarian National Gallery, we enjoyed a Kurtos pastry from a little stand. Kurtoskalacs is a delicious dough wrapped around a wooden dowel and roasted over wood coals while being turned constantly. If you find them, during your travels, you must try one. They are so very good. Also, in this same area, we came upon a man dressed as a knight selling the opportunity to shoot a bow and arrow, a crossbow, or throw a spear for a nominal fee. My husband jumped at the chance to do this, even though "tourist" was written all over it. We had a great time, but I am apparently not a good marksman. My husband fared much better at this and came close to hitting a bullseye. You can also dress up as a king/queen and take a photo here, but we did not do this. We continued our walk and came to the Golden Eagle Pharmacy Museum. I had read that this was a great little museum and we were getting cold. We had an interesting, quick look around with a brochure explaining everything in English.We then searched out a recommended cafe called Retesvar from our Frommer's guidebook. It took us a while to find it, so look for the naked woman statue near the pharmacy museum and the cafe is right down the little avenue. We had some delicious cherry, apple cinnamon, and traditional poppyseed strudels (they call them retes). We also had a little savory pizza-like pastry with hungarian salami. We sat outside in the tunnel-thoroughfare with our strudels and cappuccinos covered in red blankets set out for their customers. The guidebook stated that this cafe makes the best strudel in all of Budapest. I am not sure about that since we had some great strudel, but they sure are delicious.We then went inside the Matthias Church and had a look around. Directly outside of the church is Fisherman's Bastion. Some of the terraced areas were roped off for unknown reasons, but there were plenty of other lookout points. We came upon this area right at dusk and it was nice to see the Pest side of the city start to light up. We continued walking through the area until we found the Hospital in the Rock. We had a bit of difficulty finding the stairs that lead down to the entrance because of some construction clutter. The tour was given in English after a brief movie and was very interesting. We had planned to taking the nice terraced walkway back down to the river to go over to the Pest side of the city, but after emerging from the Hospital in the Rock it was dark so we took the Funicular back down. We were so glad to have spent the day on Castle Hill. We saw a lot, but only scratched the surface. Another great day spent in Budapest.

Wonderful view. A must. Wonderful views of Budapest. We were here in December and it was not very touristy but still felt crowded. To go here in the middle of the peak season had probably meant that we had a less positive experience.
Fun and Educational!. We enjoyed Castle Hill. Watching the changing of the guard was surprisingly surreal and the entire event, dignified.

A must go, must see!. If you go during the winter time dress warm and take the stairs up! It worths every breath! The view is amazing and there are tons of things to see while you walk around and you need at least 2 hours to do so. There are statues and musiems and it would be great if you had someone who knows the sites and their history or better...a tour guide! It was a big help for us! You can see the entire city from up there with all the bridges and the astonishing churches in the center. If you get tired and need a break there are some cafes so you can recharge! A must go!
Ken Kleins' Review of Castle Hill. Magnificent Architecture and breath taking view of Pest below across the Danube. Plenty of "Kodak Moments" picture taking.

A really nice castle "town" area. Besides the fantastic views you get to the Danube, the Castle in itself is really nice and the town area next to it is surely worth visiting. It is easy to access by foot up the hill, or a funicular train going up if you are not into walking. Or you can take a bus.

Great views at night. The views are great during the day but if you can go up at night. The parliament building and the chain bridge are spectacular when lit up at night. A lovely area with a number of good restaurants. Get there by bus 16 which run every few minutes and walk back down to get the atmosphere (easier than walking up). A real contrast to Pest
Lovely. Very pretty buildings and lovely to walk through the streets. There are little places to eat and endless photo opportunities.

Unbeatable View. Go here for amazing views of the Danube & the rest of the city. There are lots of shops on Castle Hill, as well as the castle obviously. There is a strange feeling of Copenhagen up there. 100% spend an hour here.

Must See in (Buda)Pest. Absolutely Stunning Views which can not be missed at Pest Side. I suggest not to waste time (30 min wait) and money for funicular. For 450 HUF (£1.10) jump on the bus 16 - stop is located opposite funicular station and drive to the top. Alternatively use the stairs - it is max 10 min - much easier and quicker than it looks!

Chilly wait. Castle Hill was worth the half hour wait for the funicular. After leaving edgy Pest Buda is like a very pretty toytown from whose mini spires you can view the grandeur of Pest's municipal buildings on the opposite shore. The cafe at the top serves great cakes.
A beautiful historical place. It's very nice to walk on historical grounds and see a lot of old buildings and roads in Budapest. Also very nice place to look down to the city. Very beautiful.

Full of interest and old buildings. This peaceful hill is full of interesting buildings. The Fisherman's Bastion monument and the St Matias church are here also. The palace and the old baracks are lovely buildings and there is much to explore in this old, previously walled, citadel.
A Must See. Great views from here. If you want to take amazing pictures of the Pest side this is where to get them. Get a visitor day pass and use the bus to get you up and down the hill.
View pest fromBuda. Magnificent breath taking view from the high Buda.the sky was clear, though cold which allowed us to enjoy the scenery and take beautiful pictures

Beautiful view. If you go to castle hill you'll be rewarded with an excellent view of budapest. There you can see the fisherman's bastion, Matthias church and also the National Gallery. I would recommend going. you can go up on foot, by car or with the funicular.

Different perspective on Budapest. Most of our exploring in Budapest had been on the Pest side of the Danube until we came up here. We walked across Chain Bridge, got the Funnicular up the hill (good fun but be early to avoid queues), visited Fishermen's Bastion (great views) and the museum in the Castle (well worth a visit to learn more about the history of Budapest). The whole area had quite a different feel to Pest.

Castle Hillo. OK so this is something you must do when visiting Budapest and providing you pick a day when it isn't crowded it's great. The section of the castle overlooking the river is pure fairy-tale and a photographers dream since as the sun moves light and shadows charge markedly. As for the rest of the area on the hill top it's a bit boring in the town area but the views can be spectacular on a clear day. There are also some beautiful buildings to explore in the old palace area.

Castle Hill review. We are all aware that the sights are spectacular in and around here - however I would like to add a few words about the dozens of small craft shops which abound one or two streets over from the main touristy 'drag'. I bought some lovely hand made ornaments - with a twist, original paintings and glasswear, at very realistic prices (although not cheap). Really gorgeous, almost Gormengasty in their difference. Keep up the good work all those of you who strive to make something a little different.
Picturesque and not that crowded. Historically significant to the country. Great panoramic views from the hill (on the Buda side) overlooking the Pest side across the river. Nice all around
Go here. Well worth the visit, lovely views back over to Pest side of the city. Lovely old town in and around, including bars and restaurants.

Diamond Above Budapest. The most well known attraction of Budapest, lies in Buda part and can be seen from several points of the city. Got a long historical background. A must see for every tourist I presume.
Go for Picture taking. This is the place to go for taking pictures!!! Take the number 16 bus from the metro center station for a quick trip up the hill and back.

Beautiful vistas. Although we didn't go into the castle, the area was so beautiful looking out over the Danube and Pest. A definite stop even if not enough time to visit all the castle area. I wish we had time because it is an incredible looking palace and grounds that seemed to wind forever along the hillside!
Interesting aspect to Budapest. We visited the Castle Hill complex and aviled ourselves of a local guide. Quite an interesting history played out in Budapest.

Great view of the city. The castle shows the real view of the city. It has a great view of the parliament and the bridges. When you arrive up to the castle you can take a tour of the National Gallery which is beautiful. I would definatley visit the castle at night to see the city lights. It is definitely worth a visit but don't rush because the tour of the castle takes time.

Worth a visit . This is the other side of the river from Pest The cable car up to the top is ok but if there is a long queue I would save your self the time and the money and walk around It is a good view point to have a wander round and worth timing it to see the intricate change of the guard

Great views across the city. A definately must while in Budapest. Awesome views of Pest across the Danube.We accessed Castle Hill via the Siklo ( pronounced 'shiklo', more commonly known as a funicular). With only a day up there we limited our time to visiting the National Gallery, the Labrynth (very interesting Vlad the Impaler history). We also visited the Fishermans Bastion then had a very good meal.A very pleasant day out!
Great view of the city. It's a must to ride the cable car up to the top of this mountain for the view. you need to go up here to see the Fishermans Bastion also.
Wonderfull. the panoramic view was amazing, our family relished everything there, we took long walk around each building and we did enjoy the sunny day

Great Views Great Open Space above the City. Visit here and you will see the City from a completely different perspective - looking down upon the vast area of Budapest.
It is a lovely clean area and has quaint shops & coffee bar areas.
Well worth a trip up to here if in Budapest.

Wow what an amazing place. The hill is on the Buda side of the city and can be reached in several ways,But the nicest way Is to take the Funicular from Clark Ádám square.Hill's main attractions:1.Budapest Castle2.Fisherman's Bastion3.Matthias ChurchBut there is much more to see, especially the city view that is amazing.You can walk from site to site. This is a place not to be missed.

Spectacular in the sunshine!. Walked the length and breadth of Buda, choosing not to take the funicular but zig-zagged through the gardens. Managed to catch the guards parading (all wearing standard issue sunglasses!) before heading over to St Matthias church and Fishermens Bastion. Superb views of Pest (Parliament) but also the fairytale Fishermans Bastion is delightful and not too be missed...
easy and beautiful. you can go by walk and enjoy the historic past of the city. Very nice view of the city from the top.

Must visit!. This is a must see - even though you will spend most of your time on Pest, be sure to get over to Castle Hill for a few hours or so - easy to walk and see everything here and there are some tours offered - so glad we didnt skip it even though weather wasn't the best the day we went over - also amazing views of Pest side from Castle Hill
Amazing view. Be prepared to walk up some steps, but it's not too intense, once you make it up there it's amazing...
Wonderful Stop. Be sure to spend some time here--it has fabulous views and some interesting architecture. Plan on spending an hour or more to enjoy all the views and buildings
