Must visit!. When you are in Budapest you simply can't miss the Castle Hill. There are lots of things to see and the view is just amazing. I personally reccomand to go there by day and by night. It's awesome to see the city in different moments!

Town within a City. We went up the hill expecting to see a castle. The walls and ramparts are there, but inside, it turned out to be a town in its own right, with the magnificent Museum Building at one end, and the Fisherman's Bastion, Cathedral and Records Office at the other, with lots more in between. We had lunch at a self-service restaurant near the square, which was one of the best meals we had during our visit. Views from the hill are beautiful. The Funicular is tiny, and not worth the money, especially as there is generally a queue to get on.

One of the best places to visit. Amazing place - look like something out off a fairytale. Please visit the painted church as it is so unique. Lots of lovely cafes and places to eat. Lots to see. We only intended to stay a few hours but ended up staying most of the day. It's on the tourist bius route but try the funicular railway. Fantastic experience
A must place in Budapest. Takes about half a day to cover it all, very nice views and architecture , and nice desert restaurants
Panoramic. A long walk but worst every single steps. It so beautiful up there and you see the best of Budapest when the sun set.

What a view. The view of the Pest side of the City was thrilling, and seeing the Parliament buildings across the river was superb. The walking tour of the area is full of surprises, and well worth the trouble to get up the hill to the top.

Fabulous view of the City. A nice and comfortable walk and even great in winter when sunny.Among The best views of the city are from here. Could spend a lot of time looking at the sites and chilling or can be a quick stop but a must do I'll say.

very interesting. Castle Hill is just like the name states. It a hill in Buda overlooking Pesh across the Danube where the castle and the royal palace is. Great vistas old ruins and a very photographic area
views and buidings terific. loved the views and buildings took a tour bus up but you can walk but its steep there is a lift thing marvellous

Nice View. You just can walk to reach this hill. There are some steps to lead you to the top hills. But, if you're so tired, the funiculars are also available. It can bring you to the top only in few minutes. The view is amazing and spectaculars.

Nice view and totally worth the "climb". We walked and to the top there is around 200 steps. This really shouldn't be a problem for anybody that is healthy. And on top near the funicular stop there is a perfect view of Pest side (nice view of the parliament). But we got a better view when we traveled with a public boat. I really recommend that too.On the hill there is presidential palace and one of the museums (that was really not recommended to visit, so we didn't=)), you can also walk on the other side and see the Buda side. If you walk a bit further there is the Matthias Church and Fisherman's Bastion.

Spectacular view. Although it was a wet, grey day, we enjoyed looking at the old buildings of the Palace and walking through the very atmospheric streets of Old Budapest. Give yourself plenty of time to wander around. The views across to Pest are amazing.

Big again.. Again, access by hop on/off suggested. Simply vast area at the top of the hill (by castle standards) with a whole community within.Site of relocation of the capital due to indefenceability of previous site on the plain against Eastern dvisors
Old Buda. This part of Budapest is very quaint, and full of interest. Well worth visiting. Needless to say, excellent views over the river to the Pest side.
most amazing place in budapest. this is the most beautiful place in budapest. the streets looks like a scenery from an historical novel. there is a lot to see, you can spend two days there.

Good views. Main attraction for me on the hill are the views of Pest and the Danube. And the main building on the Pest side which one would not be able to miss is the grand Parliament building. Besides the view, there are several rebuilt buildings such as the castle & church. I reckon it would be a really nice place for a good stroll for spring / autumn. There are several options to get up the hill. By foot, funicular or bus. We took the foot option up and down and it was easy enough.

castle district.. well worth a visit, top of a steep hill, funicular railway available fee payable be prepared to queue, or follow the path to your left were there is a free escalator that takes you nearly to the top . Lots to see when you get inside the castle area, very clean & tidy, toilets available.
History and gorgeous setting. You can take the funicular up the hill and you'll find a lovely setting with caste, fisherman's bastion, church, cafés and old town. Lovely views!
Stunning !. This place - in Buda - reminded me of Prague. The castle, cobbled streets and general atmosphere is just stunning. The view is amazing - especially of the four bridges that we could see.

A beautiful pkace. On a lovely sunny day, we found ourselves in Buda on Castle Hill. Fir breathtaking views over the Danube and Pest, it cannot be beaten. The pretty town that surrounds it also contains Fishermans and St Matthias Church. Choose a clear day to visit.

A grand day out. A great day's sightseeing starting with a walk through St Stephens square down to the Danube and across the chain bridge. We didn't take the funicular up to Castle Hill as is very easy to walk up and with great photo opportunities - the Castle is good to walk round though we didn't go in, more impressed by Matthias Church and the Fishermans Bastion just further down the hill- very fairytale. We went into a lovely traditional cake and coffee house just off the square down a side street opposite. A wander down through the old town is well worth it for the wonderful atmosphere and quaint old houses - a wander back across the bridge to the Xmas market in St Stephens square for a cup of mulled wine completed our day
Day Trip. Lovely place to do a bit of sight seeing and walking, followed by a bit of lunch and a drink. Easy walking with a few steps and some slopes.

Wonderful. The views of Budapest are beautiful, there are many things to see in Castle Hill, here we find the the monuments, museums and medieval buildings, most important of Budapest and it's Heritage according to UNESCO.

Don't Miss. We took the funicular to the top of Castle Hill. It was a lot easier than climbing. The views at the top are unbelievable. Make sure you have your camera to capture all the beauty before you. There are many different areas to view the city below and the Danube.

Great view. Must visit. I love the view of the city from up here. The church and castle are stunning. Be careful with the crowds. Walk downhill and you'll find this coffee shop. Ice cream and coffee in the evening are perfect to compliment the view.

Nice view, worth a walk around. I love the Castle hill not only because of the architecture, but also the multitude of options it offers. From just strolling around to visiting the museums, it also has a lot of bars and restaurants with scenic seating, especially in the summer. If in Budapest, a must see!
What a view.. A majestic site. If you are not impressed with the size and appearance of this Castle something is wrong. Both at a distance and up close it is a must see location.

Photographers Dream. Spend the day up on Castle Hill so much too do and the views from the top over the Danube is well worth the effort too go too the Castle Hill its a lovely gentle walk up too the top and so worth the effort so go and enjoy
Must-see. Interesting architecture and history as well as great views back to the Pest side. St Matthias church is most attractive. We took the "Free" walking tour and enjoyed the commentary.

do not miss. the sight from up the hill is amazing on both the pest and the buda side , if your coming from chain bridge you can ether use the cable car to the top ( which is a nice experience itself , personally i suggest going down cuz the revealing of the view while going up the stirs is awesome ) you can take both paths from left and right of the tunnel that goes under the hill and when you get on top you have a whole area to explore filled with amazing buildings and sights
Must be seen. Use the train at Chain bridge very clean plenty to see and investigate. Look at the benefits of the discounts from the travel cards.
Beautiful place.. Great views. Not as expensive as many tourist places. Not too crowd. Must to see in Budapest. Means of transportation to go there :)

Splendid. Splendid, we spent the afternoon but really needed a couple of days, so much to see and enjoy. The first shop where the taxis drop off on the left is very expensive compared to the city prices.

Lovely area with lots of little shops and restaurants. Came up here with a walking tour and it has nice views of the city as well as some nice little shops to check out and some great architecture too. I highly recommend walking up rather then taking the funicular. By the time you buy the overpriced ticket and wait for it you'll already be up at the top, it's a short, unchallenging walk up.
Go for the view. Take a taxi and have the driver wait. The view is worth the cost. Try and get there at sunset for a fantastic view of Pest.

Great Views. We went to the top of the hill on the vurnicular and the views were great. It was a colder, overcast day, but still offered a very picturesque scene. There are some other sights to see if you walk around the area, but the best part for us was definitely the view.

Spend a day wandering around Castle Hill. We walked around Castle Hill for the better part of a day. Lots of shops and restaurants to visit, plus Matthias Church and other cultural buildings on the hill too.You can either ride the funicular up the hill or take the path/steps. We took the steps and it wasn't that bad. Benches and flatter parts to help you catch your breath if needed.A must-see in Budapest.

Great walk. This is wonderful place to spend a half a day. The views are magnificent and it is so pleasant to walk around the area visiting the shops and taking everthing in all around. You can also visit museums or have a meal in a number of the restaurants. There is much to do and it is not be missed.

Authentic Renovations!. It is well worth going up here and it is a lovely place to wander around. We took the funicular up and walked down. The views over Pest are wonderful - especially from Fisherman's Bastion. Matthias Church is almost psychedelic inside and great to wander around. The oldest piece of sculpture in Budapest still in its original place is in here. The old streets of the town are clean and neat and filed with pretty buildings.BUT but but - it's all a repro! The area was devastated in 1944 -5 and only 2 of 200 buildings were still habitable afterwards. It has been recently "restored" and looks charming and clean and attractive.
Worth climbing for. Beautiful views over Budapest from up here. Plenty of space to wander and take photos. Bus from metro takes you up if you don't fancy the walk.

Phenomenal views.. Even though I was seeing the views at a time of year when the weather was not so good I still thought they were fantastic. You can easily walk up if you are even only moderately fit.

A must on a visit to Budapest. An absolutely excellent way to spend an afternoon, meandering down the picture postcard streets. Fishermans Bastion gives a great view over the city, and is an excellent Photo opportunity.

Good Walk. We downloaded an app for walking tours (Pocket Guide Budapest) and it provided a great walking tour of Castle Hill. There were so many other buildings and things to see up there. On a few streets that we walked down to see the sights, we were the only ones on the street. Very neat to get into the local areas but still have a map from the app to get us back to the castle area.

Very Pretty - except for the souvenir shops. The entire area is indeed beautiful; historic - worth seeing. However, there are many, many places to shop for everything from really fine china to refrigerator magnets - and it - to me, detracts from the experience. But - that's just me.

Danube overview. there was nothing to dislike about this visit. The Castle area was spectacular and we were fortunate to see the changing of the guard at the Office of the President. The view over the Danube and Parliament Building was fantastic. Easily got to by the number 4 or 6 tram and link up with 16A bus.
Interesting. Beautiful views.Went to the History museum rather than the Art Gallery and spent ages there. Fascinating

Goodview from top. Good place to be , esp for people who love history.Very good viewofcity frm top.Also inside archi and the roof design marvellous.Knitted women cardigans are available from women on street ( bargaining can be done)

Interesting. This is where the Palace is located. Beautiful church here also and shops for souvenirs etc. Great for taking some stunning photographs. There is a labrynth here where supposedly Dracula was held. One descends a lot concrete steps its like entering caves. I recommend you wear or bring something warm to throw on like a cardigan or sweater cos it gets very chilly down there. Interesting. Outside there is a plaque telling about Dracula. The girl in the tourist information office is extremely nice and helpful and this is where we booked our cruise on the Danube. You can arrange all tours and sight seeing trips through here.

Castle Hill Budapest. Castle Hill on the Buda side of Budapest is an excellent site for getting one of the best views of the city. The castle was started to be built after the Tatar invasion in 1241. It was taken (with a trick, without a siege) by the Turks in 1541. It was reconquered by the Hungarians with Austrian help in 1686. The next fights took place in 1848/49. The last siege was in 1945. The castle was (almost completely) rebuit and now houses several museums (the National Gallery, the Budapest History Museum, the National Széchenyi Library). I hope it remains as it is for a long time (hopefully the few remaining ruins will be rebulit). So besides the view of Budapest there are plenty of places to visit on Castle Hill (besides the mentioned museums Mathias Church and the Fishermen's Bastion, to mention a few).
Wonderful views from the top. Excellent local guide walked us around and gave us a lot of info - although there was construction going on we still managed to get around very well.

Nice view over city. The view over the city from this position is really nice. You can see all the bridges over Danube, the Danube itself, the Parliament, the streets are nice and you can visit also the Fishermen's Bastion.
Beautiful Overlook. This is a vantage point in Budapest that on a clear day you can see much of the historic city. We highly recommend this be a stop on your visit there.
Great View of the Danube & the City. We enjoyed the sights of the cathedral and walking the streets. Our favorite was Fishermen's Bastion, with its unique design and breathtaking views.

A Treasure Around Every Corner . This is a great place to start exploring the Buda side of the Danube. There are lots of attractions within spitting distance, the Castle, National Gallery, History Museum, lots of beautiful statues and sculptures. The Matthias Church and Fisherman's Bastion are a couple of minutes away and a couple of minutes beyond those is Maria Magdalona Templom (best seen under illumination at night as are most of the other attractions). The views from Casle Hill are spectacular day or night particularly of the Parliament building. A must see - spend the day there lots to do and good restaurants nearby
Fairy tail. it was cold but still so gorgeous like time had stopped . the streets the buildings the little shops the cafes all was perfect
Beautiful. Amazing views of city, chain bridge and parliament buildings. Castle district has lovely cafes and stalls with hot whiskeys, coffees and mulled wine! Lovely walk up aswell

Good walk, worth the views. Decided to walk here today in the rain. The walk wasn't to much of a problem but due to the poor weather the veiw wasn't amazing like I have seen in books/brochures, which was a shame. However we spent a good few hours up at the top of Castle Hill, but we did get the bus back!

Fantastic, must visit!. If you want some of the best views across Budapest then you must visit. It isn't too bad of a walk to the top, but if you don't fancy it you can always hop on the funicular. The views are outstanding, my partner and I spent nearly a full afternoon just soaking up the views. Can't be missed if visiting Budapest.
A Must Visit. There is much to see and do on Castle Hill. Was great to just wander through the grounds. Definitely do the Underground Labrinyth where Dracula was imprisoned for 15 years.
amazing. If you are in castle hill there is patiserie called Ruszwurm. 100 m from Matthias church.. Need to try Cream Cake :)

Excellent place to visit. Yes, there are loads of tourist things to do in Budapest; but, a visit to Castle Hill really should be included. Loads of pinteresting historical sites, places to eat, and GREAT views of the Duna and parliment available from the hill.

Large Museum Structure & Great Views. Take the funicular up the hill. When you exit, the residence for the Hungarian President is on your right and the museum complex on the left. There is a pricey but scenic cafe located near the funicular. A popular spot for wedding couples to visit for pictures.

Lovely views. We walked here from our hotel and went up via the funicular.once at the top the views are amazing across to the pest side of the Danube .The palace building is lovely and every hour you will see the changing of the guards.from here it's a short distance to the fishers man bastion.there are lovely souvenir shops and nice little cafés to relax in.

outstanding veiws. great neighbourhood little market there and views are spectacular well worth a visit need at least 2 hrs here go early if possible can get busywe used the red sightseeing hop on hop off bus to get up there if you barter with them should get good priceas a guide we got 48 hr pass including boat trip for 4500 huf around £13.50 each well worth the money
nice walk, wonderful panorama. nice walk, great panoramic view over the danube and the parliament. walk further to st matthias church and the fisherman bastion

Very pretty to walk- go during the day. Went on the Big Bus hop on hop off ... very good use of this ticket to get up to the top and meander down. There are lots of restaurants (toursity of course) and souvenir shops. Have a wander for a couple of hours and take in the views of Pest.

GREAT view of the city. A must see with a terrific view of Budapest !!! We loved it and enjoyed a lovely sidewalk café. Make sure to see the churches and many stores. Public transit with your Budapest Card is FREE.

Very pretty area, nice for walking. Nice area to visit in Budapest and reminiscent a bit of the castle hill area in Prague. There are limited areas you can view, but the overall area is very pleasant and has great views for photos.
unique. while traveling on the Danube you see many castles all have a distinctive flavor and this is no exception.
The view. The view is superb. Overlooking the city . The vastly itself is also nice but it is mostly the awesome view

Castle hill visit. Spectacular views of Pest from up thereGoing back tomorrow for another look well worth the trip and time we used the red hop of hop on bus barter with them they will come down and get the free boat trip then and see greatest views from the danube river

worth the trip uphill !!. It was fantastic walking around the edges of the castle district - takes about 30-40 min. on the old walls of the castle district ! Great views of the area below and overview of the other side of the donau

Panorama perfect.. When we hopped on the big red bus, we were clueless where it would take us. It was a dull day, so even if we only gained orientation of the city, we'd have been happy. When we got off at Castle hill and saw the almost 360% panorama, the budding amateur photographers inside us did cartwheels. A stunning enough place to walk around but it's this unique perspective of the city that's unmissable.
Great things all together. Must see venues, good restaurants, good hotels, spectacular views all together - what's not to like?

Beautiful Area. A must see when in Budapest. The architecture at the top of the hill is beautiful, from the white spires of fisherman's bastion that overlook the city to the beautiful colors of Mattias Church. Great area to explore; with less tourists than equivalent Western European attractions. Personal tip: If you are physically able, skip the tram up the hill and walk the winding path. It provides good views along the way.

Well Worth The Walk Around. Simply a great area to spend time just walking around. You can get sweeping views of Pest and the attractions are well worth a few hour's visit. Also, its visibility from the Pest side of the Danube is amazing, especially at night.
history. very nice place with a lot of history.climbing up the hill was a good thing on its own.loved the nature there.

charming part of town. Castle Hill is on the Buda side of town and on this hill are many sights. Fisherman's Bastion, Matthias Church, Buda Castle to name a few... and a lot of shops, restaurants and cafe's. This area of town is a little slower paced than the hectic city vibe of the Pest side.
Awe Inspiring. Breathtaking sights. I attended this location on several occasions during festivals. Great venue. Good shopping for artisan crafts.

Great views of the city. The trip up on the steep rail elevator was a pleasant way to reach the hill. The area is large and covered in stone balconies overlooking the Danube River. You can go on Segway rides, which is a good way to get around. There are shops and minor attractions, but I would go mainly for the view of the river and city. It's worth a morning or afternoon visit. It should not be missed by anyone visiting Budapest.I skipped the pseudo-Gothic Church as it was charging an entry fee and that, to a Catholic, just doesn't wash. You give alms, not entry fees, in genuine churches.

beautiful esp at night. we loved it especially the fishermans bashion at night it just looked so special. We had got the hop on hop off bus and it left us right there and it was great to wander around and take fab pictures of the city from a height
Amazing. The pnorama from the castle is great, you can see the whole Budapest with the River Danube. The fishermens bastion is amazing, I dont know any similar building.

Beautiful views (on a clear day!). We went to this on our second last day of holidays. Our hop on hop off bus ticket brought us to this area. Unfortunately, the day was a little foggy so the view wasn't what it could have been but it was still lovely. Lots of different nooks and crannys to take photographs. Definitely worth a stop to get off and walk around. Wish we had spent more time there.

Don't miss the church of coronations. Castle hill merits a bride walk around and stroll through fisher mans bastion, which is only a place to see a fabulous view of the Danube and city but the best attraction is the lovely church where so many of their kings and queens were crowned.

Nice place to get a great view of Pest and for a walk!. Nice place to get a great view of Pest and for a walk! It offers great views and walking around it lets you nicely look at the city you are visiting.This was one of the more interesting walks I had on my solo trip in Budapest in 2006. A good photo opp by the way!

Interesting history, great architecture and views too!. We had the benefit of a local guide who explained the history of the area and how it had developed as part of Budapest. The area is busy, but there is a vibrancy about the whole area. There are also plenty of places for photography. it helped us to learn a bit about the layout and location of other places on our itinerary, as we came here as our first stop in the city. This is a real must see location.
Very atmospheric. Choose it as the location for your afternoon stroll and have a bite to eat at one of the many restaurants. Pest Buda cafe was our personal highlight

Beautiful city splitted by a river - Danube. View from the castle hill...well - breathtaking. Everyone must come and see Hungary and Budapest. History and life all over the city. Budapest used to be the shinniest city if Europe before the Soviet régime. Come and look around. My picture was made from a beautiful river restaurant on the opposite site of the Castle Hill with a great view on it.

Panoramic view to the Pest side of Budapest. I came here as part of my free walking tour, it was a decent hike up, but the view at the top was fascinating! Luckily for us, it wasn't too smoggy, so the photographs turned out nicely. If you want there's also a tram that can take you up and down the hill.

Must see. A beautiful place to spend some time and just relax and admire the buildings along the danube. One of the must see attractions of Budapest full of impressive monuments. Strongly recommended walking unhurriedly through the outskirts of the castle and also make a visit to the Buda Castle Labyrinth.
Great Views. Only had a short time to view the Hill but it was worth every minute. Great views over the city of Pest. Plenty to see and do on the hill with the Rock Hospital the highlight.

Budapest one of the cities you need to explore. If you ask me to choose between Prague and Budapest, than I prefere Budapest this city has a wonderful atmosphere and a huge to see. Wonderful building Nice restaurants and for the ladiesnight good shopping.
great place for a stroll!. Some beautiful buildings to admire , great atmosphere of the quiet old town. Plus great views of the city from the towers.

fall in central Europe. although it is the end of the fall season with winter at the door the place still looks amazing and with a stunning view of pest on the other side the Danube at its feet it really is magical
nice walk. absolute Worth the long walk,stunning view..We walked over the bridge from the city and up here...The brigde was also magnificent...

A very nice part of Pest!!. This surely is one of the must see attractions on the Pest side. You have to climb a bit, and once you arrive above, you see one of Budapest most beautifull historic monuments. You also have a terrific vieuw above Buda, and you can walk in the Castle for a pretty long time! Don't forget to go thrue to the old town if you pass to the Verhegy!
Stunning Buda Castle, Fishermans Bastion and churches,. Walked across the whole area of the castle, St Mathias Church, Fishermans Bastion, a great day with lovely cafes and sights.

Budapest Tuk Tuk. Had originally been in a smoky tuk tuk in Bangkok. This one was clean and quiet. Cold, cold, cold this time of year but views are better than in a car. Not too experienced yet as it is a new company, but would try it in the SUMMER

The Place To Go For A View Over The City.. We were here for a couple of hours and the view over the city of Budapest can only be described as fantastic. There are also several small cafes and gift shops.If you have the time do not miss this photo opportunity!
As beautiful as pictures you've seen. This is a mandatory stop for anyone who goes to Budapest.From that side of the city you can get an amazing view of the city and river.

stunning views. You can see everything from this area. The palace and the castle ruins, the church. There is a bar made in the castle ruins which you can sit and enjoy a drink and a snack and take in the panoramic views.

A beauty undergoing some treatments. On a sunny clear day,Castle Hill is perfect for great photo opportunity. You will be able to see a wide spanse of the Danube and city pest with all the bridges. On a crowded day you will be juggling for a prime spot. There is reconstruction around the hill. The only building you would be able to enter is St. Matthias church, few shops, and the Hilton. Most tour bus either drop off passengers either midway or bottom. There are a number of steps down to reach bottom.

Photo Op. This is a must for anyone wanting to get the best photos of the Pest side from this vantage point. The views are spectalar from all sides. Interesting shops and a great walk down the hill to the baths att the bottom. Castle and Bastion are wonderful backdrops for photos. Do not miss this.

Scenic and historic. You can spend the whole day on the Buda side walking from Gellert hill all the way to Hilton and beyond or down to the Lukas bath at the bottom. Shop for trinkets along the way. Prices are same as elsewhere but there are some pieces you may not find elsewhere. The church was okay. St Stephens in Pest is lot better and free.

Magnificent. Part of Budapest's UNESCO World Heritage Area. It's a huge complex, about 1.5km long and 500 metres wide. It includes Fisherman's Bastion, Matthias Church, Royal Palace, Budapest History Museum, Hungarian National Gallery, National Archives of Hungary, Hospital in the Rock. And many other sites. Be sure to catch the changing of the guard in front of the President of Hungary's Office at noon - it's a real show. Great views of the Danube and the Pest side of the city. Looks spectacular lit up at night.

The most beautiful place in Budapest. Visiting Budapest MUST include a visit to the castle district. A very beautiful area, with many monuments worth seeing, and an even greater place for a walk...Fishermen's Bastion, St Mathias church, everything takes you back in time and makes you breath the air of a really Royal city

You will not get a better view of this beautiful city.. Apart from the dysfunctional Hilton, you will not get a better view of this beautiful country.This is a lifetime experience, so take it!The only thing wrong with this beautiful city is the people.Their arrogance outstrips their competence. But they do have a beautiful country.I really don't understand why the Hungarians treat the British tourist in such a bad way.I will make sure that we reciprocate.
Great. Very hilly, would appreciate maps or signs posts in the park as it's very easy to get lost , brilliant views at the top. Lovely to see the castle.
Amazing views of the city. You can take a funicular or take the hop on hop off bus to get up to the hill. Here you can also visit Buda Castle and the old town of Buda. Lovely place.
Much improved. Visited this area a few years ago and found it rather lacking in atmosphere. That has completely changed and well done to the local authorities for their hard work.
Awesome View. Set high on the Buda side of the Danube. Provides a beautiful view of the Pest side. The cathedral is amazing.

Royal house. The place that reminds that it was an one of two capital cities of a great empire.The castle is on the top of the hill in Buda, so there is a excellent view of Buda and Pest parts of the city. Budapest name came from combining the names of the cities Buda and Pest to become a single city in 1873.

Historical castle and old city. Castle Hill is the site of Buda Castle and the old city of Buda. It can be reached by funicular from Clark Adam Square by the Danube, or by taking a bus. Well worth visiting, to get an idea of the history of Buda and of Hungary.

Take time to meander. Take a gentle walk up - it's really not so bad - I promise. Gorgeous views. Take time to meander through the narrow walkways, interesting barogue buildings, let the cobblestone streets lead you long. Wonderful views, restaurants, churches. Head down the stairs to Hospital in the Rock - insight into how dreadful things used to be ....

Magnificent. Very few countries have historical structures like those in Budapest. No bombs have destroyed this magnificent, historical city. The Castle looks over Budapest and the Danube with a dominating presence. Beautiful, impressive and full of history the Castle District provides a look into the past.
Peaceful & panoramic views. Photography is superb from here! Lovely walk and best at night time when everyone else went hone. Saw a party of politicians arriving too!
Good. There was too much tourists for me, but you can see castle guards in action, some history. You are on the hill - so view to the whole Budapest. Few restaurants there.

Amazing Views.... Breath taking... Best way to get up there is to take the busz from Szell Kalman Ter this has numerous stops in the Castle Distrct or the Funicular which places you at the Var (Castle). Once up there, make sure you check out Matyas Templom (Matyas Church) Halasz Bastya (Fisherman's Bastion) and the Var (Castle). The Var itself now is an art museum. If you have the time, take a look. Mostly HU painters. Walk and stroll the grounds. Cobble stoned streets, make sure you have sensible shoes for this. Definately come back for some night shots from here. Wow/

Magnificent view. We chose to walk up instead of taking the tram to the top. Quite a walk, but very enjoyable. Wear comfortable shoes and watch your step because most of the way is a cobbled path.Plenty of choices for cafes/restaurants up there. On a clear day, the views of Budapest from the hill were breathtaking.

Not for the faint hearted. This is quite a climb and will take a good half day to go up and explore before descending again. That said it is totally worth doing - the views are spectacular and the architecture and statues are wonderful.

Amazing. Its a huge castle, gives a panoramic view of Pest and the Danube river. Definitely a Must Visit. I used the tram/train service to reach to the Castle and would recommend others to take it too.
Castle Hill. Always an interesting place to visit and lots to see. Several good restaurants and coffee shops as well as Szent Mattias Church, museums, etc. Worth the time.

worth a visit. The trip to the Var, and the Var itself is beautiful, with unbelievable views, although I will say the the price of drinks and food is a little heart-stopping - maybe because I live here! A trip to the ,military museum is also WELL worth it, with some beautiful souvenirs at a sensible price

Must visit in Budapest. Center of history, center of best views, center of many traditional events, a very romantic walking area, the remarkable Mathias (Matyas) Church (cathedral), the Fisher Bastion, the Royal Palace and many more.

what a surprise. We were very lucky since we were given a sunny day when we made the visit to this castle. Each and every detail is amazing, it is a neverending surprisingly experience and I will do it again without a doubt, having the Danube River as the backstage for all photos. Superb!

Well worth the hike! Do it!. AH-MAY-ZING! Seriously, this has to be the best location in Buda to get a great view of the Pest skyline!For all of you that already know that, here's what I have to add:******The Climb: Ok, not going to lie, it was a bit of a hike to get to the top. I want to encourage folks to do it! I went by myself, at about 10:00pm in the freeeeeezing cold (I'm not kidding). I crossed the chain bridge, had some awesome photos of Buda castle on the way. The uphill climb after you get off the bridge is a mixture of steps/incline, I'm a pretty fit person, and I was a tad bit winded by the time I got to the top. Takes about 10 minutes (at a good pace). **Tip for solo travelers, if you go at night, stick close to others that are going up as well, because the trail is a bit dark and surrounded by trees and nature. I probably would have been a bit freaked out if I had to do it alone (maybe I've seen one too many scary movies). But at the top, there will likely be castle guards and random other people, so fear not!*****Don't Forget: DO NOT JUST STAY AT THE CASTLE!! Venture around once up there! The view of the Parliament building is soooo much better if you walk down to the church (Matthias), climb the stairs...you will thank me (check the photos). There are also a bunch of cafe's, pubs and restaurants in the area, but depending on when you go, they may not be open...including the funicular (if you don't want to take the hike, you can take the funicular and cheat). Also, make sure to catch a glimpse of the castle wall that they preserved with the bullet holes in it from the war...it is easier to see (and find) during the day, but it can give you a little bit of insight into what the castle looked like prior to restoration. *****Verdict: To get those photos that will undoubtedly make everyone jealous, this is a must visit location on the Buda side when visiting the city. Don't let a little climb rain on your parade (don't even let rain, rain on your parade), it is absolutely worth it!!

Prepare to be scared. We visited the Castle Hill Labyrinths which are about a 5 minute walk from St Matthias Church. This was listed as a children's attraction, but certainly wouldn't say it is such. The tunnels are around 15metres below ground and run for approximately 1000metres. The tunnels themselves are around 1000 years old and as you would imagine are steeped in history (Dracula was imprisoned here). At first all seems fine, until you can't really see much and the temperature drops and the directional arrows get fewer. I am a grown adult who doesn't scare easily, but it took about an hour for my heart rate to slow after I made it out.Not for the faint hearted, but for 2000HUF (abut £4 by our exchange rate), would say it's a MUST. A lot of fun.
great views over city. Castle hill dominate city with Church and square and monument and Bastion all together. Do pay to go in to church, well worth it
Old style and charm. Castle hill was full of old style and charm of budapest. Definitely worth a look and leave enough time to stroll around the lovely back streets and sample the goulash.
Scenic place. Lovely scenic views across the danube and beautiful buildings.We were disappointed that the famous church charged an entrance fee, but wandering around this area was very enjoyable.

Cable Car, walk or bus. No private cars are allowed on Castle Hill. There is a gate which only allows authorized vehicles to enter. The cable car is expensive, to walk is for the young and healthy so we took a bus. The area is small enough to walk around and see the sites. Fisherman's Bastion, Matthias Church, and the Royal Palace. The Germans held this hill for a month in 1945 during WWII. Do not miss it.
Beautiful and historic. Must place to visit for historical and architecture junkies. Many important buildings and places. The best way to get up is with funicular.

must see!. After a walk on the Danube side, you can easily reach the Castle Hill, using the funicular. When I got up, just changing military guard ... very interesting. It is a place full of history and culture, which I consider to be visited if time allows. You can visit the Hungarian Art Gallery, where you can stand two or three hours without you realize how time passes. Not far is Matthias Church, which is an emblematic building. Labyrinth, Buda's Castle, are also nearby. Besides the tourist interest objectives, easily find restaurants with traditional food, where you can take a break to rest and eat. I recommend a coffee, and a mulled wine for cold days. Full of tourists, especially as the day I visited Castle Hill was celebration in Hungary, the entrance to the Art Gallery was free of charge. I think that you need to allocate a few hours to visit and enjoy the interesting things in the area.

Not to be Missed in Budapest. One of the unexpected highlights of this major Budapest landmark was watching young ladies posing with a handsome soldier on sentry duty at a military building! But the majestic scale of the buildings, the many statues, the outstanding views from the hill and even the tourist shops are all very appealing, so don't hesitate, catch the funicular up the hill and enjoy!!

Breathtaking. Beautiful architecture and stunning views across the Danube to the Parliament building. Take the funicular up to the top and take a lazy stroll around the complex. Don't forget your camera.

Worth the visit. Beautiful churches and palaces, especially at night. Parking can be validated from a restaurant or hotel and access to the lower city is easy with the numerous buses that run into late hours of the night.

Beautiful part of Budapest. Castle Hill is a great place to start a trip to Budapest as you can see most of what there is to see from there and the area its self is spectacular.It is a UNESCO World Heritage Area and it is easy to see why. You can spend several hours walking around looking at the various buildings and just generally exploring.
Sensational place. This is one of the great places in Budapest. The views from up here. The vast amount of history. It is certainly worth the time to come and see

Worth a visit as a one off. We caught a local bus there and then a ten minute walk around the walls to the entrance. The central area within the castle walls is very attractive but has numerous overpriced gift shops and eateries, catering for the many guided tours visiting. We headed to the end of the castle area which was much quieter but there is not a lot to see, the buildings are very much the same and it felt a little too sterile with no character. Back through the crowds we went to the cultural area where the museums etc are. Nice to walk around. We enclosed the views of both Buda and Pest and returned to the riverside by the short but pleasant funicular railway. Pleased we went but wouldn't return.

B-e-a-utifull!. The Castle Hill district is full of cultural, historic and architectural Hungarian Gems. Though everything is rather new (the originals did not survive Ottoman rule, WWII or the Communist era), it has been rebuilt or restored in the original style. Most recommended: church of St. Matthias, The Fishermen's Bastion (great views of the Danube and Pest), Magdalene Tower and simply a stroll down the main streets on the hill). Don't miss it!
Worth the climb. Wonderful views. The funicular railway was out of action and would have saved the climb. There is plenty to see and do up there.

Beautiful view. Any of visit to Budapest cannot be complete without Castle Hill! Beautiful view & great place for pictures! Busy with tourists place but worth it to visit.The buildings are wonderful and the views to the opposite side are worth the trek. This is by far the most beautiful part of the city, and the Castle is pretty much in it's very centre. Not much to say here, cross the chain bridge, climp up, and absorb the breathtaking view and the palace.
Little Town. You wouldn't believe that there would be so many little shops and things going on up there, it's amazing and cute. It also provides a very nice view up here! (:

Worth the climb.. Worth the climb to see this still being worked on old palace. It is a great view from up there. You can catch the funicular or there is a escalator about midway along the front but it only takes care of about a third of the climb or you can simply walk as we did.

Nice views. We loved the view from Fisherman's Bastion despite the rain, but it was not easy to figure out where to go on our way down the hill. We did some shopping, took a wrong turn, and missed a lot of the castle. Disappointing.
Good shopping. There are lots of little shops up here to roam through. There also have great authentic hand embroidery here.
Spectulars Views. Spend at least half a day here... the "castle" itself is nothing special, but the Mattihais Church,the Ruszwurm Pastry Shop, and the Hospital In The Rock are worth your time.

Always a Treat to walk the Hill area. If you want to see many other tourists walking around, this is the place, and good but somewhat expensive eats, too, in several restaurants. The buildings and museums and vistas are what I go for, as well as the August 2o National Arts and Crafts Festival. Go see the new museum exhibit regarding Zsolnay Ceramics, right across the street from the last stop of the 16 bus, on Disz Tér.

Nice views, lots of tourists. The castle hill is a must. Beautiful view of Pest esp. the parliament. The Mathew church is on what interesting, but the ticket desk at the moment is a pain. The National museum is excellent also. Too many tourists and lots of restrictions on where you can walk. Plenty of coffee bars and restaurants, somewhat overpriced. No cars in principle but public transport (bus 16 from Deak) and the funicular is open again. The casle itself is alo very interesting. Overall not to be missed.
Walking. enjoy walking around the castle and enjoy sightseeing of the city,dont go restaurant on the hill and use tram to/from

worth a day. a really beautiful area with many attractions and worth allocating a full day walking round to see everything. Also some good restaurants so if you want to extend to the evening and enjoy views of pest it is worth the effort!

A “must see” attraction in Buda. No visit to the Castle and surrounding area which makes up Buda could be complete without going to the Hospital in the Rock.A very well presented secret hospital buried under the castle rock which has a fantastic history throughout the troubled times in Budapest & Hungary. After the initial introductory video presentation we enjoyed an excellent 1-hour tour through the labyrinth of rooms that were created from the caves. Our female tour guide spoke excellent English very clearly and definitely helped to make our visit so very informative and memorable.

Must See. This area of Budapest is excellent. It is like a small town. Take the Funicular up (Adjacent to Chain Bridge), but walk down after your visit. The area consists of the old palace (now a museum), the president's offices, cathedral, shops and cafes/restaurants and tidy streets with Viennese architecture. There is a small cafe next to the funicular with superb views over Budapest. Also hidden down a side street is a 1km underground passage - worth a visit as Vlad the Impailer (Dracula) was imprisoned there.

It is a complex of many buildings. It is a complex of many buildings. These are Fishirman's Bastion, Royal Place, Matthias Church, etc... All of them amazing and must see. Especially at nights, matthias church opens it's lights, and looks beautiful.
Wonderful views. The buildings are very impressive here and the views across to the Parliament building and the Pest side of the city are really fantastic.

Lovely. Castle hill is a great way to begin a tour of Budapest. The area is surrounded by an old city wall and sits atop one of the highest points in Budapest. Visitors have a great view of the surrounding city. This is a residential area with some nice shops.

Best view of the city. A must if you are in Budapest. I was lucky to stay in a hotel at the castle district so i had enough time to go around. You will take a lot of pictures for sure and spend some time to go around wandering in the small streets with the cafe shops and the restaurants.Prices are a little more higher than the centrum but its OK. If you are going to stay at the area you must know that after 18:00 everything is very quite.If you need night action this is not the place.During the day time the place is full of tourists who come with buses for the daytour. you can go downtown from the stairs in about 10-15 minutes or you can take the bus No16 that runs every 2-3 minutes.

Walk it for the nicest experience. I'm not a big fitness person, but I walk a lot. A very nice walk, there are hills and steps, but a person in moderate shape can do it. Best way to see details and little vignettes that make Budapest the special place it is.

Amazing views of the city. A great way to spend at least half a day if not more, The views of Budapest are superb and there is so much to see and do around the Castle itself, before wandering into the lovely old streets of the area. A must on a visit to Budapest.
Lovely to see. Went here during a private tour and both my husband and I very much enjoyed the scenic view and the beauty of this place.
Stunning. THE view of Budapest! Well worth the walk up and the grounds are beautiful. Sunshine makes a difference :)

Beuatiful Site. We have been in Budapest three times and absolutely love Castle Hill. Whether strolling the narrow, cobble-stoned streets or viewing the lights from across the river, we never tire of it. It is an iconic site and one of several "must see and do" places (probably over and over) in Budapest.

A must see, Twice: day and night. We visited the castle hill twice and each time was quite different.During the day we took the funicular (one way ticket recommended) from chain bridge to the top.View was amazing and lovely. Pest looks charming from up there and the atmosphere is great also. many statues, a restaurant and much more. If you walk across the hill you can get down just near the fairy's stop. We did that and took the fairy (included in travel cards) to the other side. From there, tram no. 2 will connect you to major metro lines.During night funicular doesn't work. It takes around 8 minutes walking up the hill (you the staircases for shortcuts). Don't miss it! If day view is great than night view will leave you speechless. Take your camera's tripod and you could take astonishing photos of the pest, the bridges, the ferris wheel and the Hungarian Parliament.Too bad there's no funicular available for those who cannot walk up hill.
Must see. The first sight we decided to head on in Budapest and it was worth to visit, great view over the city. Short train journey up the hill was also worth it.
Lovely to walk round and see the spectacular views. We went on a lovely sunny day - had a walk round - you get wonderful views of the city from being so high up. Certainly worth a visit.

Lovely Views Over The Danube. Go up the Funicular and enjoy great views , you can freely wander around the hill area. As the sunsets it illuminates the many roof tops of Budapest. Quite enchanting before the sunsets and the city lights up.
Amazing views. We were here during the day and came back at night so that we could see everything lit up. The St. Matthias church is worth seeing as well.

What a nice afternoon. The Buda castle hill and district is a very charming area with great museums, nive streets where you feel the atmosphere of the old Buda and empire times. Nice restaurants around. Beautiful ST Matias church. And incredible views over the Danube river and the Parliament. All done by walking. Easiest way to get there is to take the Buda funicular just next to the Chains Bridge.

Great location for hangout. You could hangout here for a long time as there are lot of things to spend time. Also, you have an awesome aerial view of the city and Danube river from some of the viewpoints.

Great Location. A very interesting visit - good weather makes a huge difference! The current renovation work make this an exceptional experience. There are many photographic opportunities from the happy snapper, to the keen enthusiast
must to see. One of the greatest city in Eastern Europe and from here one of the best view over the town. Magnificent, and also recomened by night.
Colourful. Very colourful part of Buda, you can go up by funicular or by stairs, this part of town is very photogenic, pitoresque and there is also good view on Parliament. Good restaurants.
Views glorious views!. Free panoramic views but walk if you can as funicular railway not worth effort as not able to see any views unless in first carriage .

Surreal. The Castle Hill is very well preserved and this creates an illusion that you have entered another time and place. A time when the Hill was the home of the rulers. It's like a little town on the hill when you enter the gate, and all of the buildings are beautiful and charming. You can get there with the bus 16 or the funicular from Clark Adam ter (the Buda end of the Chain Bridge), but we walked and I would highly recommend it. It a steep claim, but worth it. Visit the market on the Hill as well, especially if you are a paprika fan.

The castle district has been totally renovated. It is a beautiful area of Budapest almost totally renovated with a beautiful church .There is the best pastry shop in the city by the name of russwurm.Do not leave the castle district out of your Budapest trip
Bupa and Pest. Going over to Buda was lovely the Castle district is lovelyThe palace is huge and split up into museums and art galleries.loads to see...
Stunning views. The views from the top of the hill are stunning. You can get some fantastic photos of parliament and the chain bridge. It's a must see on a trip to budapest.
What a view. Recommended for any visitors to Budapest. Great views from the top of the hill. Don't get the train up. Have a leisurely stroll. It's extremely rewarding
Beautiful to visit and wonderful views of the city. Wonderful views over the river and city. Beautiful area to wander through. Go there by Hop on Hop off bus - worth the efforst

Beautiful area to walk. Castle Hill area offers the opportunity for you to visit the Royal Palace, Matthias Church and Fisherman's Bastion. The area sits high on a hill on the Buda side of the river and offers quaint walks through the streets with ample restaurants and shops.
Must see. Any trip to Budapest cannot be complete without this! Beautiful view & great place for pictures! Busy tourist place but worth it
Latte on Castle Hill. We loved having a latte outside and looking at the beautiful city from high atop Castle Hill. Definitely a place to visit.
Go there!. I guess this is one of must-go's in Budapest. Especially, if you walk around there and don't stay only at touristic points.

Gorgeous. I loved the castle and the views from the castle and within the grounds. I just wished the main area still had more of the castle's past intact rather than an art gallery. Although some may enjoy walking around looking at art, I was hoping to catch more than a glimpse of an old Budapest.
Great views. On a clear day the views are spectacular. We took the funicular going up (in retrospect, probably not worth the price, however).

Fantastic Views. The views of the city were breathtaking! Great photo spots with the castle/gardens & city views. Nice to walk and see the beautiful castle and art museum. Definitely worth the trip, we took the funicular to the top.

What a beautiful place. Castle Hill is where you can get a glimpse of how Europe used to be. The Palace is the centrepiece but there's so much more to see that it's easy to spend a whole day just walking around the place. There are classic buildings everywhere with plenty of restaurants and other facilities to add to the mix. There are at least two museums that we saw, plus churches and gift shops, together with magnificent views over the river and towards Pest. There's even a theatre where Beethoven is said to have performed in May 1800, as well as numerous buildings housing offices of high-ranking government officials and departments. It's even more amazing to think that most of what you see has been destroyed and rebuilt. A feast for the eyes and camera-wielding tourists. Get a good map of the area and be prepared for lots of walking.
Nice. The castle i saw it during the day, try to go taking the tour bus, it´s better for an overview of it.
Spend a whole day here. So much to see and do. Stunning national art gallery worth visiting and mediaeval houses are as cute as the choad number 16 bus is hilarious. Brill.
5 Nights in Budapest. Great historical areas with fine views over the city. We went up on the funicular railway which was an enjoyable experience.

Great restoration. Considering the level of destruction this is a fabulous restoration job. The outsides are great but it is such a shame the insides could not be recreated. The grounds and the building are very impressive but the view from the top has to be the star. The national gallery in the Castle is worth seeing but I did find a lot of the Hungarian Art a bit dark for my taste. There was a special exhibition on while we there around the history of cubism, Dadism and surrealism which I very much enjoyed. While in the Castle be sure to walk all the way to the top and get out onto the Cupola circuit for the best view of Budapest.The pizzas in the café by the door of the Castle were very good and very reasonably priced and I would recommend eating there. Be sure to walk across to the church and Fisherman's Bastian and then down the hill to the Danube and then walk across the chain Bridge.Very worthy and do not miss the funicular railway to the top.
Buda Castle. Wonderful, historic location with funicular, driving, or walking access. Great museums and beautiful St. Mathias church. Moderate entrance fees to exhibits. Well worth the trip.

Lots to see. The castle hill can be accessed by a tour bus and should be in your list for the simple reason that there is a lot of see at the place from the fisherman’s bastion, the castle, Danube and whole lot of shops and restaurants around. The views are just splendid and makes for great photographs.
Beautiful. One of the most beautiful places in Europe. The view of the hill as well as from the hill are amazing.
Historic great views. Perched on a hill the view of the Pest side is great for photos and shopping and strolling..you can visit the castle, the church or just amble about and find a nice cafe

Great views. We visited on a guided bus tour from our Viking River Cruise. Our guide showed us the sights and left us some free time for shopping. Must sees are the Matthias Church and Fisherman's Bastion. Of course, the views of Pest and the Danube are great.As far as shopping, restaurants, etc., we found ever so much more variety and quality on the Pest side of the river.

Scenic and totally worth it. The Castle Hill on the Buda side of the city is steeped in history with a number of landmark buildings to see. It also incidentally has the finest views of the entire city from top on. There are a number of ways to go atop the hill - you could either take the funicular which costs 5 Euros for a round trip, or you can take the buses which start from the base of the hill just next to the funicular or you can walk it up. We preferred to walk it up and I must say we loved it absolutely - the walk isn't tiring at all and can be easily done in 15 mins max - this is when we had a 5 year kid with us as well. There are roads right till the top and also stairs so whichever you prefer again.Atop the castle are a number of shops, restaurants, bar etc. apart from the museum, president's residence and not too far Mathias church as well.There are a number of look out points made atop the hill from where you can see the entire city of Budapest and click some of the most amazing pics of the Chain Bridge, Danube and the parliament building.A visit to the castle hill is an absolute must, once you are in the city and would easily keep you occupied and interested for at least 1/2 a day if not more.

A must stop for every visitor. If you aren't staying here, you can easily get here via one of many hop on/hop off busses. Things to see include Matthias Church, Fisherman's Bastion, the Palace, statues, sculptures, museums, shops, restaurants and a fabulous overlook of the Danube below.

Worth a visit. We stayed in Pest so visited Buda. Took the train to the top, which was a nice experience. This part is quaint and well maintained, unlike some other areas of the city, which needs some TLC in parts.

A lovely historical area. It is well worth exploring the Castle District on the Buda side of the Danube.Steeped in history with lots of great sights, lovely cobbled streets and some nice bars and restaurants. Matthias Church is a must see. There are also some great views across the river to the Pest side.

A good half day trip. We walked up from the terminus of tram no 4, which took about 10 mins. The whole area is very pretty and there are plenty of shops, bars and restaurants to stop in along the way. The views over Pest and the river are lovely on a clear day you will be able to take fantastic photos.

Well worth a visit. I would suggest to everyone visiting Budapest to reserve a lot of time for this area. Of course St. Matthias Church , Fisherman's Bastion and Buda Castle are the stars and must see points but there is so much more to discover in architecture and history. Not to forget the great view and pastry shops . End your visit with a walk down to the Chain Bridge and cross the Danube on it.

Lots of steps but well worthwhile.. This is a 'must see'.
The buildings are wonderful and the views to the opposite side are worth the trek.

Great views. What a magical view. Take the tram up the hill for about £4.50 each return, well worth it. Once up there then you have all the attractions to visit so give yourself plenty of time depending on what you want to see and visit.
Beautiful. This is the scenic part of Budapest. Its not easy to walk this part but taking a tour with stops at various places is the perfect way to see this part.
First thing you do in the evening!!. Wow what a view! Magical to say the least. There was a wedding at the time we went in August . Take the tram up the hill for about 5/7 euro, well worth it!

Fantastic. This is by far the most beautiful part of the city, and the Castle is pretty much in it's very centre.
Not much to say here, cross the chain bridge, climp up, and absorb the breathtaking view and the palace.

beautiful views everywhere. The castle hill area can take up a whole day of activity depending on what your interest is. The St. Matthias Church ( now home to an ecclesiastical art Museum) and Fisherman's Bastion dominate the top of the hill with beautiful views of Pest and the Danube river. Take the views from the different towers of the Fisherman's Bastion then walk around the castle perimeter for more 360 views. The gardens and walkways are beautifully maintained throughout.

Beautiful but very tourist orientated. The castle hill holds the principle buildings of Buda, however they are relatively modern in character having been rebuilt following the reconquest of the area from the Turks.Well worth a visit, if only for the spectacular views over Pest and the Danube but be prepared to pay a premium price for refreshments, use of toilets and just about everything else.

an architectural collage. so many historical buildings of different styles... and the Hilton's clash there!Although most of tour guides don't mention it, the nearby Hospital-in-the -Rock deserves a visit.

Lovely place. We visited the palace when there was a chocolate festival on 21st September. A bit of a shame as you had to pay around £5 to get in and no freebie since inside! Didn't go inside but the gardens were nice to walk around and see people get excited over all the sweet things on offer.
Fantastic. One of the nicest spots of Budapest. Historical and sometimes it hosts various events . Great place to take pictures, awesome view and absolutely stunning architecture

Fantastic. What a beautiful area, very quite at the top , no tourists but after a short walk, there were lots of tourists in groups having mini tours, the area is definitely worth visiting, no traffic, but busy

Grate city view. It is perfect walking inside the castle and drink or eat at Fisherman Tower.
You can go there using the tram instead of taking a taxi.
wonderful walking. lovely area with a great view of Pest. small curvy streets with great tike work or ornate roof tops. very pretty

Old Buda on the Hill. Get here from Pest across the Chain Bridge then take the funicular or steps (actually the steps aren't too many!) Lots to see up here as the guide books will tell you - esp St Mathias Church. Good views across the Danube to Parliament. Take coffee and excellent cakes in Ruszwurm cake shop / cafe est. 1827.

Quite the views. Such a romantic and beautiful area. The views from the hill allow a wonderful outlook of the city and of the Danube. A must see area of Budapest. Of course, I am always impressed with views!
beautiful. A beautiful place with and extraordinary view, you should not miss it. You will not be disappointed.
What a beautiful area. We really enjoyed walking around this area.. It seemed like its own little village. St Matthias was beautiful as was the Fishermans Bastion. Wonderful lunch!

A Wonderful Vista. While it's a bit of a climb (although there is a funicular or you can take a bus), the castle hill offers incredible views of the city itself and of the Danube as it flows off into the distance in the east.
Quite OK. The place is quite OK but much less impressive than similar sites, such as the Hradjin in Prague. If you are in Budapest anyway, definitely worth a visit.

Holiday in Budapest. This castle is nicely restored. I visited its Muesums, you can easily spend 1 whole day at this place. It has several muesums and galleries put together. I was there when they had a chocolate fair, so i paid quite a figure on this visit. I don't know the regular rate.
Recommend to visit if you are in Budapest
The best seen. You can see all Budapest from there, it is very nice historic place, very recommended. You need tp prepare yourself for long ditance walking
Good view. Worth a climb!! Not as high up as it looks really, and can climb down on other side near to turkish baths and cave church.

Stunning views from the ramparts. The Castle is in Buda and affords spectacular views across the river into PestThe walk up is strenuous so take your time, it's worth it. There is an elevator that will take you up if this is neededEnjoy a refreshing drink overlooking the City at the tower to the West of the church in the Square at the top

To be visited. Take the funicular, take your time to walk around the Castle District. It is a gem hidden away from downtown Budapest. I left this attraction for last to savour in the whole experience. It was a good decision!Shops are quite touristic but the St.Matthias Church and behind in, from where you can see stunning views of Budapest makes it very worthwhile. In Sept 2014, visiting hours were restrictive so I didn't get to see the inside so do check properly when planning.Tip: Walk around alone, free of tourist guides!

Outstanding view in Pest. The best thing about Castle Hill is the views of Pest. Stunning! Unfortunately, it's also very crowded with tourists. The #16 bus from Pest is the best way to get there as if leaves you off at major drop off points in the Castle Section. The buses, however can be very crowded.
THIS IS NUMBER ONE ATTRACTION. This is THE must see in Budapest. More a village than a "castle." Palaces, old streets. The sprit of Budapest.
musy be. You can't be in Budapest without going to this place, Have time!, Eat an apple on a hill, Let yourself walk around, take beautiful pictre :)

Brilliant views of the city. If you want to take lovely photos of Budapest, visit Castle Hill. In addition to the views you can also visit the wonderful Matthias Church - stunning - and see some of the other sites up there. It can get busy so try to go fairly early to avoid some of the many tour groups.
We saw this from a boat and the free walking tours. It look elegant and worth a walk up to the top but we were too tired.it wasn't so far from the hotel where were were staying 'colours'

Worth the walk.... Or taking HOHO or funicular. We did not go inside church or castle. We just wandered around the area for a few hours. The views are fabulous, the fishermans bastion is worth seeing. The best part of Castle Hill is walking around the area behind the church/hilton. It was like being in a different town! Quiet streets, local folks...and away from the hordes of tourists on the church plaza!

Up, up and up. We took the funicular the first time just for the experience. We walked up and down the other times. Good work out. Nice little shops around it. Quaint neighbourhoods. Nice churches. Excellent views from the hill for picture taking.

Dramatic. Simply, historic and one should learn of its history before visiting.
Wonderful views from the Buda side.

Budapest Castle. Delightful area of Buda on top of hill, overlooking the Danube and Pest - great views! The magnificent Royal Palace also houses the Hungarian National Art Gallery. Matyas Church is very well worth visiting. Plenty of restaurants to choose from.

Lovely Buda. You can't really visit Budapest without a visit to Castle Hill. Great views over the river Danube and towards Pest. The whole area by the castle is beautiful and you could quite easily spend a whole day just walking around looking at all the lovely buildings.

Brilliant. Best part of a day trip if you do the Citadel and Castle Hill together. Get there by Funicular, Tour Bus or walking. If you're walking, you can actually go straight up (facing the Funicular, take Fo U. on your right, turn up Jegverem U., steps at the end. Alternatively there are winding paths.

Great Views. This place is a must visit whilst in Budapest.
Offering stunning views of the city.
I used the funicular to get to the top and back down. Costing 1700 FT return for adults.

Beautiful. A must see while in Budapest. We were recently at Castle Hill and enjoyed our day. Unfortunately, the wine festival was in town when we were and it limited our access to see castle hill. We did attend the wine festival and did not think it was worth the money spent.

What a view !. The view from Castle Hill over looking Budapest is amazing. Enjoy the changing of the guards and the beautiful old buildings. Visit the shops, cafes and restaurants.
The walk takes you all the way to the Matthias Church and the old Castle. There is a variety to see and do, so make this adventure a must.
Gorgeous on a sunny day. Take the funicular up and walk down. There is so much to see and do at the top, including shopping, restaurants, history and a breathtaking view.

A great a Castle District. Beautiful castle district. Lots to see, the cathedral, Roman ruins, Presidential Residence with a changing of the guard, art museum. The underground caves and the Hospital in the Rock are also worth a see.

The place to be for the best views across the Donau/Danube. This place is one of a kind. Combining the best views of the city with some of the most stunning architecture and historical monuments that document the path of the Hungarian people, the Castle Hill is a must visit for anyone going to Budapest. Lots of beautiful spots (and photo-ops), great and grand architecture and wonderful restaurants that serve up deliciousness all around. Spend at least 3-4 hours there to take everything in a stride at the slow pace this place deserves. Best to visit at dusk when the sun illuminates the Buda side of the city.
Beautiful view. Got up here via the hop on hop off bus, loved the views, great photography spot. You can walk around have some lunch and enjoy the scenes.

Fantastic Area, Spectacular views. No trip to Budapest should be considered complete without visiting the Varhegy Area. It is easily accessible by bus from a metro station if you do not wish to walk or take the funicular. Once up in the area, there are many wonderful historic Churches, Monuments, Statues, Restaurants and Cafés to visit as well as the Palace and surrounding grounds. Make sure to have your camera and charged batteries as you will be taking many pictures of the views from this location as you look across the Danube. It's hard to take a bad photo!I'd suggest giving yourself 3-4 hours to wander around this area as there always seems to be something interesting as you casually stroll around Castle Hill.
Explore the area!. Take the funicular up and then walk back down. Changing of the guard every hour, on the hour at Presidents palace. Beautiful buildings like Corvinus church

Fabulous View of the City. This is an outstanding place to view the city below you. Make sure you bring your camera and watch out, it may be windy here. There are numerous people who have also been clued in to the view so be patient and you will be rewarded as they move on. A must stop in this wonderful city.

Beautiful safe historic walk. Great architecture, interesting shops, museums, plenty of restaurants, and amazing views. What's not to like? Remember to bring local coins with you when you head out for the day. You can walk for hours in Budapest before finding a toilet that is free of charge. Hint: try the museum cafe - they don't seem to be enforcing the "free toilets with paid admission" rule ( at least not when I visited).

Great to visit. Not only do you get great views over the Danube, but there are also lots of things to see and do. Also, on the hour, you can see the changing of the guard at the presidential palace. The walk up the hill isn't too challenging but those with mobility issues should take the funicular.

Worth the walk up. You can take the funicular, but don't be afraid of the walk. When facing the funicular, there are several routes you can take. One is to the left, through a doorway in the wall. The other is across the street. If you take the walk through the doorway, you will reach a point where you can walk out over the funicular and watch it (and the people) go up and down. The funiculars leave at the same time so as to counterbalance each other. The Castle Hill area includes the Castle, a museum, the Castle District, and the Fisherman's Bastion. You'll have wonderful views, and get a taste of the old Buda side.

Don't miss it.. I can't imagine anyone going to Budapest and missing this extraordinary place. Not only is the view a spectacular as promised, but the buildings (even the dwellings) are a journey unto themselves. The castle speaks for itself and doesn't need to be sold by me, but I urge visitors to set aside a few hours or even an entire day to explore the environs surrounding the major attractions. My friend and I walked for miles on a high walkway that afforded a view into Buda on one side and a veritable parade of the most intoxicating of homes on the other side. It felt like a walk in one of Woody Allen's recent romantic comedies, with then emphasis on the romantic. A perfect place to linger, relax and contemplate. I saw a couple of houses for sale and the fantasy of living there still persists.

A peak back in time. I had a great morning at this attraction and you can spend an hour or a whole day . If you are fit , walk up to Castle a Hill and down , but you can drive, take a bus or the cable way . It's easily walkable once you are at the top and though some parts are quite crowded with tourists it's still fun for young and old. You can wander through the various attractions , as well as the cobble stone streets. Grab a coffee and admire the amazing view from the castle walls or shoot old fashioned bow and arrows . There are loads of photo opportunities so don't miss this sight .

Must see. Better to have a car to take you up the hill, quite a climb.
Amazing though and worth the work to get up there.

Spectacular. Unbelievable views of Budda and Pest from north to south of the river Danube you can see for miles my advice would be to go in the evening and take some shots then ahve a walk up the back of the castle to the Church and try one of the many restaurants then come back when its dark and repeat your shots..... Dont forget your camera ..

Nice enough but not Wow!. Ok, it's pleasant to stroll around and some of the buildings are quite nice. As for the views, they're handsome but better ones are from Gellert Hill. Eating and drinking here is hit and miss with prices geared to mass tourism,including surly waiters who told me at one cafe that they stopped serving Frappe at 11.00am! If you want views, the Castle District looks spectacular, especially at night, from the Pest side of the Danube near Erzsebet bridge.
Lots to see and do. The Hungarian National Gallery and the Budapest History Museum are both worth visiting. Great views from Castle Hill too.

Lovely views. Budapest has some really gorgeous buildings, and you get a great view of most of them from the top of this hill. Definitely worth making your way to the top - with Hungary being such a flat country (apart from this hill!) you can see for miles and miles as well.
A great day. This a great place to spend a day there is so much to see and do. plus plenty of places to eat. We were able to take great photos of the Pest side from the castle.

The best view of the Budapest. A "must see" place; you'll not find better view to the Pest and Danube river! And it's completely free of charge. Be ready to mount high on the top of the hill, but you'll be rewarded by stunning views.
Great views. Crowded but worth it. It offers fantastic views of both sides of the river. It's a bit touristy, but still worth it.

Fabulous views. Great panorama from above Buda Castle across the Danube to Parliament and the "Pest" bank.There are several key 'photo' points - just follow the crowds.Walk across one of the famous bridges and walk back on another. Try to visit both morning and night for different panorama...and of course view back from Pest to Castle Hill is special.
Beautiful even in the rain. Spectacular castle grounds and building, beautiful St. Mattyas church. A little touristy, but for a good reason!

Beautiful View. It is very interesting to walk around and admire the architecture. You don't get a better view from the city than from here. There are shopping sites available but we did not find them very friendly or accommodating. The view at night is spectular and should not be missed. There is a ledge that some say gives you a better view of the city but you must pay for it. The view is only a few feet above the site you can see for free. We did not pay for this view. It is also disappointing that most every restroom facility charges you a fee.

Beautiful View!. Beautiful to walk around & see the city views around. A very nice place to take photos and to enjoy quality time. We did not go in the castle opted to walk around it & around the piazza instead.
Great view. This is an excellent location in Buda overlooking the Danube and Pest. It was overcast on the day of our visit so the view was not as amazing, but even then the panorama is breathtaking.
nice, but not wow. I thought it was nice but you don't have to go up there. I mean it's not necessary - but it is pretty there.
Beautiful view of the city. We went to the international wine festival on the grounds of the castle. Great views of the city, good food and many great wines enjoyed

Fascinating!. History, but still comfort. Very interesting to go into the cellars. Also the guards change gives you a fresh impression. The exhibitions inside the palace are interesting to visit. The view from the top is breathtaking.

Beautiful views and architecture. We caught the 4-6 tram to the end of the line and walked to the northern end of Castle Hill (five minutes). It was the best discovery! The views are lovely and the atmosphere is peaceful (even when bus loads of tourists arrive, it somehow maintains its calm). You really have to come here if you want to get a good sense of the beauty in Budapest.There are lots of lovely little outdoor cafes set up under umbrellas for you to get coffee/food from. For families with toddlers: this is NOT a pram friendly expedition for the solo adult. Make sure there is two of you because it will take both of you to lift the pram at certain parts, but it is well worth it.
