take a few hours to walk around. Stunning views all around, and a stiff walk up the hill, but the castle is well worth visiting, it's undergoing a lot of renevation at the moment, but a lot of the key features are well maintained, and you can dissapear into many quieter areas to escape the crowds
The view from the Hill. From the Castle Hill you can see all of the Pest side of Budapest and have a wonderful view of Parliament.

Nice Spot. This place is just walking distant from the downtown, just walk over the bridge and you also can take either funicular or by walk. I would recommend you to take a walk since you won't miss nice views.

Varhegy. Take a trip over to the Buda side of the river, there is absolutely breathtaking views over to Pest including Parliament (which when lit up at night is out of this world!)
Definitely the best vantage point in all of Budapest, bring your camera!

Best panoramic views of the city. I must have went to the top two or three times for its magnificent views. You can reach the top by bus, funicular, or good old fashioned walking. A panoramic view of the city awaits you at the top!
Stunning views. amazing views and lovely little streets, alleyways etc. Nice little cafes with inexpensive food, ice creams etc. A lovely experience
A must when visiting Budapest. Great walk, beautiful architecture, great panoramas. Take at least 2 hours for a visit. Doesn't make sense to pay for fisherman's bastion visit.

Beautiful Budapest.. Budapest is one of the most beautiful cities in Europe due to its location and the grand views from the castle hill on the Buda side of the city. To climb there use either no. 16 bus, or use the stairs (if you are in good shape- That for free) or take the funicular. A two minutes ride and about 4 euros and you are done. The view from above is stunning. Do it on day time and evening.

Best Views of Budapest. If you're hiking up, there is no point to stop and take pictures at any point on the way up. Wait until you're at the top, as in, on one of the viewing balconies of the White Castle. The pictures from these spots will trump anything taken along the way. While it IS super-touristy, this whole area is so beautiful you won't care; character and charm still intact!Great place to walk around at any time -- if you want to take it easy, wander around and see everything, I would plan several hours and make a day out of it. Hike up early, enjoy the views before the sun is baking. While the sun beats down, explore the labyrinth and other indoor sights; have lunch. Wander the streets at a relaxed pace, have a coffee or ice cream. If you want to enjoy sunset up here, perhaps walk up after lunch instead. Must-see, especially if it's your first time in Budapest.
A great tourist trap. St. Matthias Church is fantastic.Fisherman Bastion is lovelyBut the jewel in the crown is the Royal Palace / National Gallery.

Take your time here.. Take it easy and walk across the bridge and up the hill then walk along through the bustle and down the other side. You will lose the crowds as you approach the Hilton hotel. There are many touristy shops and cafes but as you walk on there are buildings to admire and part of the original city wall to see.
Interesting. Small food market on while we visited. Would have eaten if we had not had big lunch. Bar the most expensive place we visited. Service charge added for a round of drinks

Wow. Take the funicular up the hill and explore. The weekend we were there the castle hosted a food fest. The castle is beautiful and there is so much to do in the Castle Hill area. A must do in Budapest

Beautiful location to view Budapest. Love the architecture , some great antique shops.
The view , the Museums. The siklo that takes you up the Var. Markets . The great photography.

Castle views. On the Buda side of the river ( use tour bus or metro)Plenty to do there. Mathias Church and castle plus Great views across to Pest especially if you like your photos. The castle is impressive and for about a £1 you can walk the basilicas or for a bit more go into the church. Dracula's tomb (Labrynth) and the hospital in the rock are both here.

A Budapest "must see"!. No trip to Budapest can be considered complete without visiting the Castle district. The area is one of the most historic and important in Hungary. There are museums to visit, such as the Military, and galleries, such as the National, and the "Matthias" Church. Before you go to eat anywhere make sure you check the reviews as this is the premier tourist area in Budapest, and that is reflected in the prices, which sadly do not always match the quality. I have been to the castle district many, many times and still love to wander the streets and look at the architecture and look down upon the rest of the city. If you have a good guide book then a lot of information can be gained on the various buildings, some of which have "interesting" pasts to say the least.

same city - different atmosphere. If you want to relax and take a deep breath from bustle of the Pest, you have to go to Buda. It's a completely different expierience and additionally it is a beautiful place!

Nice historic walking area. The whole place is a tourist magnet. There are several museums, big and small. Lots of souvenir shops, and some good restaurants too. The Mathias church and the palace museums are the biggest draws. But it is a nice are to just walk around. If you are visiting from pest side, you can use the number 16 bus from deak ter. Th ebus stop is right outside the le meridian hotel. This bus takes you all the way up and around the hill. You will save a small fortune by avoiding the tourist trap funicular. The best views from the hill are towards the river.

A village within Budapest. Set on the Buda side of the river, this area is like a little village in it's own right. Enough to do to spend a whole day there. Museums, little shops and cafes, Mathias Church... best of all, great views across to Pest, particularly of the parliament building.

Beautiful Views & Delicious Local Foods & Wines. My wife and I went up to the hill by cable car. We waited for taking cable car for 20 minutes.On the hill, there were a lot of tourists and shops for local souvenir and foods & alcohol.We enjoyed the local foods & drinks and the traditional dances performed by about 10 ladies wearing traditional aristocracy dresses. Also, the views from the hill to PEST side and Danube were very beautiful and picturesque.We could stay on this hill for 3 hours including the lunch in the restaurant.

Beautiful views, gorgeous buildings and fountains. Especially interesting Underground hospital.. I enjoyed exploring the many historical and cutural landmarks. It was hard to find a path to the Elisabeth bridge so I gave up.
Wonderful views. The views from the top are stunning. Make sure to save some room for the food vendors cooking fresh meat dishes and veggies.
cultural place. Beautiful place, which includes the castle and the library. Fronts for the Pest side and Budha, is a place with a comprehensive view of the entire city
Fabulous history and views. Castle Hill provides a glimpse of life under the Austria Hungarian Empire. You can wander the streets and enjoy the marvelous views of Pest and the Danube.
Great history and views of Pest. Lots to see in the Castle Hill area of Buda.Some of the highlights were the Royal Palace,Matthias Church,Fisherman's Bastian and Hungarian National Gallery
a view to be seen. its a must too see this view of budapest from the gelert hill it will stay with you a lifetime make sure you take a camera to capture this stunning view at night is the best time
Citadella is amazing. well worth the hike up the hill to visit and see the amazing views of Budapest, if you dont like walking, you can catch the bus to the top.

Spectacular views over Budapest. Take a trip up the hill on the funicular and you are rewarded with spectacular views of the city.
We didn't visit the building itself but walked around the gardens and terraces. There are some ancient remains here too.
The place is peaceful, despite the number of visitors.

Important advice! . Not much to say about so many reviews but we got one tip from the tour guide which made our experience better.Due to the movrment of the sun, Its better to visit the castle in the afternoon. This way sun is behind you when you look at the Pesta side city. Otherwise sun will be in your eyes and the view will not be the same.

Very Interesting. Happy to see that the European Union is doing a good job of helping to restore this area that was destroyed during the war. Visit the stalls where locals are selling thei handmade crafts and foods.

A tranquil oasis with great views. The Castle area has something for most people. At one side is the hotel area with some of the best hotels in Budapest, quiet streets allow one to wander and relax. Then there is an area where roman remains are being excavated. Then the impressive castle itself with terraces that give superb views over the city and the river Danube.

Beautiful. A place you must visit whilst in Budapest. Fantastic views overlooking Pest, and its very easy to stroll around and spend a relaxing afternoon here . We had lunch in a delightful restaurant as well.

Take the free walking tour!!. It'll save you time and will let you mingle with fellow travelers who, if you're smart enough to take the time, may give you interesting tips and even go out with you for some beers afterwards. I was lucky to see the guard change which is a nice little ceremony to mark the end/beginning of every shift, the view is quite impressive but the best part to me was going downhill through the alleys and getting lost with my new made friends in the middle of non-touristic Budapest.

Quiet, a pleasure to wander the cobbled streets. Castle Hill is a wonderful place to spend an afternoon. You feel quite separated from the rest of Budapest. There are no brash shops or noisy traffic, just historic buildings in pastel shades. You can climb the hill a number of ways, there's a Funicular railway at the end of the Chain Bridge, or you can walk up the architectural wonder called the Fisherman's Bastion. There are perfect views across the Danube from the Bastion. There are a number of top rate tourist attractions once you are on the hill. At one end St Matthias Church, at the other, the green dome of Buda Castle. The Castle houses the Hungarian National Gallery and the Historical Museum. If you have a Budapest card you can save on entry to both of these. Between the Church & Castle is a large lawn and some shattered remains of buildings obliterated in WW2. It's shocking to see how much was destroyed.
beauitful. breathtaking views! so much history to learn about, and amazing buildings to get lost looking at :) definite must when hitting budapest

A must. Although here on business - I always try and get out and see the city and the old town is charming. Great views of the Parliament in Pest. If walking, it is quite a hike. Lots of photo ops. Too much to mention but well worth a visit.
recon ongoing but well worth it. great city views and architecture on top of the mountain. renovation yielding good results... go up by train and down by walk...

Come here middle of August for Folk Art Festival!. The Buda castle was the perfect frame for hundreds of craftsmen and women during the Folk Art festival 16-20 Aug 2014. Great variety of crafts, and most of them were being demonstrated. Activities for children and adults. Recommend to come to Budapest in the middle of August to catch this festival. The best I've ever been to!

Nice hike across the bridge. The 3D tour about the building of the castle was nice. We took the tram up and walked the streets by the castle area. There were a quite a few tourist shops hawking standard tourist stuff which one can easily avoid but the church and the museum were worth the visit
A walk in the past. My litle daughter felt like a princess stroling around ,marvellous view, a lot of things to see and take photos

Breathtaking View. An absolute must, regardless of how much time you have to spend in Budapest. The view of the city of Pest is amazing and, in particular the view of the Parliament is unparalleled. If you have any sense of photography, you could spend hours her alone, taking picture after picture. I spent several hours just exploring, and didn't enter the art museum. That was a factor of time. Between the castle, the church and the town, it was a full visit just to explore on foot. Make sure you take the funicular at least one way. It's worth the ride.
Nature. It's a whole complex of sights in Budapest part over the dunab nice place nice view interesting sight

A Must See. We found the Historical Museum within the castle to be fascinating. You can wander and practically get lost in this hulking fortress. The archeological materials are really incredible and most are well interpreted and easy to understand.

Breathtaking view. Take the Funicular to the top. Museum,food stalls restaurants, public sculpture and restoration of the old city is underway. We saw the changing of the guard ceremony outside the Governors Office a Building.

A splendid day. The museums are both excellent. The site is amazing, especially after you see what the area looked like at the end of WWII. We spent a half day there. To do it justice one needs to give it a whole day. More of the time needs to go to the Budapest History museum

Take your time!. Must visit in Budapest. Keep for you enough time, at least couple-three hours to go all over. If you are on car - go up till is allowed, in general the parking is not expansive, so it is worth to come closer. At 12 afternoon there is guards change (near president residence) - very nice experience. From the president residence if you want to continue to the fishermen bastion - go down a bit, through the park and not through the parking lot.

Like the TV advert. As well as being the place for views of Pest on the other side of the river Danube, castle Hill looks lovely at night when it is illuminated. The best view of it is from the riverside in Pest. I suggest between the two main bridges where the river cruise boats dock.

Totally worth seeing. If you're not interested in visiting the Hungarian National Museum I still recommend a trip to Castle Hill. The views are wonderful and if you're lucky you can see the changing of the guards at the old palace (now home to the Hungarian President). The funicular is a very easy and quick way up.
beautiful. + Beautiful views, interesting military museum, a good place for walking, direct bus- Expensive souvenirs, long queues for individual monuments
wonderful area. lovely area, breathtaking views. Wonderful buildingsGood places to eat. A visit to the underground hospital a mustwhilst in the area.

Walking legs needed!!. Cars are not allowed on Castle Hill, so our coach dropped us off a little way from it and walked the remainder to the Royal Palace. I didn't realise just how close it was to The Chain Bridge which would have been a bit of a climb but within the ability of most reasonably fit people. Plenty to photograph between buildings and statues. There is a cable car which runs from the river side too but it comes at quite a cost. It offers some mazing views over the river and the city of Buda. There are quite a few places to grab a coffee and cake, we stopped off at Korona Kavehaz and had some great strudel with coffee.

Worth the walk...stunning views over Budapest. The first day I walked the path to the top after seeing the huge lineup for the Funicular, the next time I went with my partner on the Hop On Hop Off Bus (great choice). I was told there were 2 options for walking up...one was steps, the other a path. I chose the path as I have joint issues, but found after the first small section, it became steps also for much of the way. I would advise using sunscreen and a hat if walking, and a drink from the shops or vendors at the bottom. The good thing about walking it is you get view all the way which encourages you to go further. It is not well signed, so is easy to find you have followed a path which ends nowhere and you have to retrace your steps...also many places without handrails, especially on steps. Hopefully as they are doing more restoration work, rails will be included. Apart from the history and architecture, the views from the top are stunning and make it worth the climb. Amenities are a bit pricey in comparison to other places. There are cafes/restaurants at the top. You can also walk back down the hill a short distance to the fantastic Fisherman's Bastion area, and from there down the footpath to the bottom again.

Beautiful place with a great view. The funicular is always very crowed take the stairs. Very nice building with beautiful architecture. To get here you just need to pass through the chain bridge, then you can wait on a long line and go up on the funicular or on the right side you can see some stairs with trees all over. After all the stairs just go 2 times left and you are in the castle, its about 15 minutes, so its way better if you dont want to way for the funicular. The views from the castle are very nice, you can see the bridge's, buildings, boats etc. A really good place to take a panoramic photo.

Awesome! Get Rick Steves' book for his tour.. We walked this area twice....one evening looking for dinner (and we eventually gave up at finding signs of life, and went back to Pest for dinner)...and the following morning, when the area was teeming with visitors. In the morning, we brought along our Rick Steves travel book and read along the guide for our tour. It was awesome! One of our favorite parts about Budapest, and it capped off our vacation very well!

Definitely do not miss. Great views. Absolute Travel walked us up there. They took us along the side of the road so we wouldn't have so many stairs. We also avoided the long lines of the costly funicular. Very easy to get up to. Don't miss it!

Fabulous. Fabulous all around for history, culture, attractions, great views, good shopping, eateries, old city streets and medieval buildings, we took some amazing photos as we walked around this area. The attraction is the side overlooking the Danube but if you walk around the backside of this area there are some amazing views of the actual city from the back side as well. A nice area, one of the highlights of our city tour.
History and beauty. Really nice setting, the streets are lovely to wonder around. Lovely castle, churches and great views.
Must go. As a tourist, this is a must go in Budapest. Beautiful place with a good view for some photo taking. We went during winter , but it was sunny, so was really cooling to be out and about.

Beautiful location. i loved walking around the castle district and seeing the changing of the guard. The shops offered tourist souvenirs. There were some nice cafes for refreshment and a break from the heat.

Don't miss the change of guard. You'll get beautiful views from here. You can take the tram to get there, which is a bit pricey but makes a nice ride and takes only a few minutes. While you're there, don't miss the change of the guard, which takes place around noon.

What castle?. A lovely place to visit and view Budapest. Lots to see up there even if there is no longer a castle. The Palace is very grand and the Coronation Church is magnificent but it was lovely just wandering about the streets.

Nice place to walk. Great place to have a wander around or sit and watch the world go by whilst having a drink in a cafe. Visit the art museum and try to find the caves to experience a walk in total darkness which entertained. Great views of the city below also.

Worth your time. I never get sick of the beautiful architecture and sights around the castle. We walked trough all the sights, and we didn't get tired. But bring good shoes to walk in. There are small restaurants and shops around the area. Be sure to charge your camera and take a lot of pictures. You can decide yourself if you want to spend money while you are there. If you bring water, food and go without a guide you don't need to spend any money.
Great place. Castle Hill is a great place to visit. The walk up the hill along the trails was nice and the views at the top are amazing. The cannons and attractions at the top add to it all.

a good morning stroll. get to the funicular early and you can walk straight on (later you have to queue as limited capacity), we then walked around the palace gardens, and then along to explore more of the hill - some really good sites and views over the city and easy to mosy around all morning. We went in the 'pharmacy' museum; small, cheap and quirky and some interesting bits...
Beautiful view. worthwhile stop on your trip to Budapest! The view from here gives a great overview of the city! See Mathias church and eat at Halaszbatstya restaurant - so good!
walk around. Lovely views, Palace and church to explore. We went up in the funicular as it is a steep climb. A good area for to spend an hour or two. places to have a coffee and admire the view.

The must see for half a day. The whole complex from Fisherman's basket to the President's residence is worth a good few hours just walking around. National Gallery, Museums if you are that way inclined, but we went to see the underground hospital, classified as secret location until 2008, well worth a trip and guide in English available. Very well reconstructed after being battered in the siege of Budapest in 1944

Worth it!. we only had a morning to spend walking around. Strolling the grounds of the Castle Hill takes you back in time. We even had the experience to see the changing of the guards. Impressive all around.

Picturesque history. Wonderful views and a lovely place to spend half a day. The automated funicular is fun and very quick and easy, but bring a hat in high season, it can be quite a wait to get up there at times.

Must see in Budapest. Great place to go wandering through magnificent buildings and spending several hours. Lots of tourists but not crowded, we were here on a sunday with beautiful weather. A must see while in budapest!

So much history.... I suggest you walk all the way up to the castle hill where you can first come across with the outstanding Liberty Statue and walk through the streets to the Buda Castle. This historical castle and palace complex carries more than 800 years of history starting from the Middle Ages to the Nazis occupation, and although parts were destroyed throughout the centuries, it's still there...! Worth visiting!!
Full of attractions!. The hill is full of various cultural and unique attractions. It needs at least two days for visiting most of them.
A Must see. The castle of the Hapsburgs on Castle Hill is magnificent on the outside though the inside is today bereft of any significant examples of how royalty lived.

Great View. Amazing view of the city and the walk is not too difficult. There are several fountains where you can refill your water bottles, including one with mineral water, so make sure you save your bottle!

Great views. We visited here late in the day, and it was the perfect time. This attraction is always busy, but less so in the evening. We were able to enjoy the amazing views, and to just wander the streets. It is quite a steep climb up, and the tourist buses do come up here. But climbing up, and just discovering was wonderful. We visited the next day by bus and it just wasn't the same.

Great Place to Walk Around. Great area to walk around in. Something interesting around every corner. Be sure to venture beyond the tour bus area, and do some of the promenade on the "back" of the island.Tip: if you want to see the changing of the guard, avoid the massive crowd in the plaza in front of the Palace. The guard marches out from the side of the building, and also does a brief change ceremony at the guard box on the side, too. There was hardly anyone there for that, until a bunch of tourists came and barged into the middle of the ceremony. (Sheesh, people! Have some manners when you're in another country.)

Historic Budapest at its best. The castle hill in itself is home to numerous attractions like the Buda Castle, Royal Place, Matthias Church, Fisherman's Bastion etc. Therefore, it automatically qualifies as a must see while visiting Budapest. The view of the Danube with the chain bridge is a photogenic one.

Culture and views. Castle hill offers a lot of different things, you have the obvious cultural-historical buildings (the castle, fisher's bastion, some churches) but you can also walk about the 'village' which offers a lot of different things, café's, some restaurants (though not many) and the labyrinths where Dracula was imprisoned!

Great afternoon walk. I really liked walking around Castle Hill, the views are awesome and the historical aspects and architecture is excellent. Lots of small cafés and restaurants give you places to relax and take a break
Beautiful. This was like a fairy tale - just beautiful. There was a great view of the pest side of the river and the parliment building.

Great place to wander. The Castle district is one of the best attractions in Budapest. Plenty to see and eat. Taking the tour of St. Mathius' Basilica is worth the $4 admission. Stop and have a pastry at one of the many shops. Truly some of the best pastries I have eaten.

Many things to see and do. Take the funicular (1.700 return ticket) and go to the St. Stephen's Basilica, the Fisherman's Bastion, the Museum, and just walk around the streets or get a refreshment in one of the many cafes and restaurants that are around (which are admittedly pricey but picturesque and some with greate view). You can take beautiful photos and perhaps some souvenirs if you like that sort of thing. It's like taking a walk in history. Almost all of the attractions have entrance fees that vary from 1.200 to 2.700 HUF.
So much to see. A microcosm of Hungarian history, go early in the morning before the crowds. Fisherman's Bastion is beautiful, and views theough the pillars over Pest are amazing!

Allow some time to walk around!. We took a tour of this lovely area and knew we had to come back. The tour was interesting and informative and we learned a great deal about the area. However, we wanted to walk around, visit St Matthius church and have a less rushed time to enjoy the views. There are plenty of places to have a coffee or glass of wine or a bite to eat, shop, and just stroll the lovely quaint streets. I would recommend a taxi to the top. The funicular lines are long, the steps are tiring and the taxis don't cost too much!

Castle Hill area. This area is below the Prague Castle. A nice play to walk around, but a guidebook or guide is required to appreciate the history. Some quaint streets, courtyards, and government buildings. No real shopping here though - just tourist stuff. Not a must see but if you are in he Castle, a short walk down the hill. From here, a short walk across the bridge to the Jewish area and additional places to see.

Absolute must do in Budapest.. Visited as part of an organised tour and enjoyed ourselves sufficiently to visit privately the next day. The are, naturally, plenty of places to eat and lot of souvenir shopping opportunities, but don't let that put you off. The views from the top of the hill are stunning, and photos from the Fisherman's Bastion are a holiday essential (a small admission charge). If you are over 65 you can get on the small blue and grey bus for nothing and that will take you a bit further up the hill if you aren't able to walk from where the bus drops you off.
Excellent. Worth the walk. I suggest you take the stairs instead of the funicular as you can avert the queue and you can see the amazing view!

A view fit for Odin himself. Went here as part of a free walking tour, and the walk is a slight hassle, but man, oh man, was it beautiful. UNESCO has it down as one of the world´s best views, and they hit a home run with this beauty!

Quiet a walk but worth it.. Quiet a walk but worth it. So if you have knee problems...not the best idea. But aside from that its an excellent walk that is historical. You can see the Danube and Pest. loved the ice cream as a reward for the walk!

Top Views of the City from Pest.. Part of our walking tour:Best views of the city,but, the walk up is a challange. If you have mobility issues, consider one of the bus tours to get to the top of the Castle District.There are several options to do this,so, check it out.
stunning place. stunning place! highly recommend to walk around the hill through living quarters and historical buildings, the Basilica and Bastion; very touristy though with mega crows;
Great views looking over to Pest. The views are exceptional. Worth the trip up and to admire from Fishermans Bastion of other vantage points the Danube and Pest.

Great views.. Best views of the city. Museum and inside areas closed on Mondays which is not mentioned in any of the brochures, do we couldn't go in. But worth the visit for the views. Take the Siklo or funicular to the top to avoid the climb. If you are doing the Hop on Hop off bus tours, the buses take you to the top . Most of the tours include a night trip as well and the views of the city lit up are breathtaking. ( TheThey also include a boat cruise as well, so it's really value for money.

City tour. We had a city tour which included the castle hill. The views from the top across the Danube and Budapest are amazing and make the trip up the hill well worthwhile. There are plenty of tourist shops and cafés as well. Also do visit St Matthius church with its amazing ceramic tile roof.
Buda to Pest. The view you have come to see is this one. Plenty of opportunity to see the view with out spending the extra euros.

Great views, a bit crowded. This is a great place to visit: the views of Pest are breath talking, one can fully appreciate the architecture of the Parlement across the Danube. The walk from the Chain bridge is easy - just up several flights of stairs to get to the palace and the Fishermen bastion. There was a lot of construction all around the hill at the time of our visit, so we probably did not have the best timing. The grandeur of the Castle hill is undeniable - the Matias church and the Fishermen bastion are one of the best Gothic style ensembles: the only building that is totally out of place is the modern Hilton hotel - it is truly inconsistent with the architecture around it and detracts greatly from the beauty of the whole Castle hill area.

Commanding views, excellent place . There are many places in Budapest from which you can get a brilliant view of the skyline but none more so than this. It's less hard to walk up to than the Liberation Monument and the views stretch further down the Danube, allowing you to see the Parliament better for instance, whilst the whole complex has something for everyone. Food, drink, views, history, old winding streets and beautiful architecture, it even boasts an art gallery which, whilst not really for me, I have to say objectively makes the place even better. Simply, on every count, it's a must if you're in Budapest and, steeped in history as it is, is fundamental to understanding the city.

Amazing. A must see when you are in Budapest. The views are amazing views looking down at the Pest side of the Danube. Buda is the high side of the city and Pest is on the lower side. You need a tour guide to get the full benefit of this attraction. Be aware that there are a lot of people visiting this site daily so expect massive crowds. Number 16 bus also does the trip up the mountain and leaves from the big wheel regularly.

A piece of history. Until you visit here you do not realise how big this area is. Indeed, we spent some 4/5 hours wandering around here and taking in the sights - firstly, it's the view over the Danube and Pest then there's the actual Castle (now mostly museums and galleries), the Castle Theatre, Trinity Square, Matthias Church, the old Town Hall, the Vienna Gate and the old houses preserved to show what the area may have looked like in the middle ages. Lastly, have a coffee and the sour cherry tart at Ruszwurm Pastry shop.
changing of the guard. Travel up on the funicular railway, we were lucky to time it so our arrival coincided with the changing of the guard, great show very hungarian !

A majical place set apart from the city. We stayed at the Hilton on Castle Hill and was able to enjoy the sites without heavy tourist traffic (9 a.m.- 6 p.m.). If you aren't staying on Castle Hill I suggest you come around 8 a.m. and enjoy the beauty as well as explore all parts of Castle Hill. If you're in Budapest, this is a must location to visit.

city tour. The views are out of this world, amazing. The view of the Danube and the city are outstanding. The buildings and the churches are amazing. The people, the food all great. The drive up and down gave great views. Tour guide very knowledgeable. Needed to spend more time up there.

It's okay. Castle Hill itself is a little underwhelming. I mean, if you've got time and you're in the city by all means go and have a look. The changing of the guard is pretty interesting.
Mostly theres an amazing view of the city from atop the hill. Perfect for photographs!
Sunscreen is a must. Make sure to wear comfortable soes, hat and sunscreen on a sunny day. Loads of tourist and superb view.... lack of public restrooms and it irkes me to have to pay for the toilet.
Beware sun. If it's hot, take a sun-hat. The area round the old palace and the presidential office, etc (where the guards wear wrap-round ray-bans!) is very exposed.
A must see in Budapest. Go to Castle Hill for the views of the Danube and the City! As part of our City Tour we stopped here. The views are the best in the city! Historic sites.
Loved it. Fantastic place with great gothic architecture. Some jaw dropping scenes with magnificent views to river Danube. Romantic.

A must do in Budapest. The view was fantastic from the top of the Hill, the castle and the fishermans bastion and the labyrinth are all situated on the castle hill. Lot of steps to climb to get to the top, but you can use the funicular rail.

So much to see and do................. Castle Hill has so much to offer. We accessed it by the Funicular Railway-another must do-and visited the National Gallery and The Hospital in the Rock.Allow lots of time to explore this area. The grounds are beautiful and it is very pleasing to see the vast amount of restoration and upkeep.

Oh, Come On! This is a Must!. We did this the first day in Budapest--using the Rick Steves' guidebook, we felt like we had a good overview and introduction to everything on Castle Hill. Pay attention to the suggestion to walk out on the Promontory sticking out from in front of the Royal Palace for good views of Pest. We took the #16 bus up there, and spent about 2 hours, walking around, touring and going through the Matthias Church (fabulous, but crowded and you have to pay to get in). The views are great.

Rich history, unbelievable view. Beautiful old houses, the coronation church of St. Matthias, the National Gallery of Art, the Fisherman's Bastion, National Archives Building, etc... all in one area. Gorgeous!

Worth a visit for the views!. The views from up here are spectacular! And while there are museums, shops, restaurants, Fisherman's Bastion to visit, the Palace interior was destroyed by the communists so don't expect a beautiful palace tour. St. Matthias church is worth a visit, too. You can easily walk up or down from the hill on a footpath that starts by the funicular station. It's an easy 15 minute walk. If you want, take the funicular up and then walk down. Great statues, fountains, architecture to see!

Definitely go. We really enjoyed the experience. I thought we would only spend a couple of hours but ended up spending most of the day walking the town. We did not go into any of the museums, but if we had this was easily a full day or more than a day visit. It's very interesting up on the hill and plenty to explore.

Medieval Budapest. The area was restored after World War II and is high in the center of Budapest. As you walk along the cobblestone, narrow streets you can imagine living during this medieval period. Don't miss the monument to those who died during the Black Plague. Shopping and photo shots can take as long as 2 hours.
Castle Hill. Take a morning or afternoon to walk around Castle Hill! Great views of the river, as well as, attractions within a short distance from one another.

Enchanting. Yes, join with the thousand other tourists and make your way up the hill. The views, architecture, Church, gallery, shops (dont buy anything-terribly overpriced up here), and overall feel of the area is great. We caught the funicular up and wandered back down under our own steam on our departure. You could easily spend the best part of a day moving from place to place, and taking in the atmosphere. Just apleasent place to spend time in Budapest-put this on your must do list.

Great place to spend half a day in budapest. Castle hill is located on the buda side and it has the Mathias church, Fisherman's bastion, Castle, Gellert hill, CItadel and Hilton hotel. The views of pest from Castle hill are great and walking around the castle hill and you should take break at the cafes and the restaurants are wonderful

Picturesque area with stunning views. Take the funicular to Castle Hill for stunning views of the River Danube and Budapest. The remaining buildings are well preserved and beautiful. Many now house museums and the area is host for different events; Beer Fest on the weekend we visited.

Spectacular views with fascinating buildings, museums, statues, shops & restaurants.. My wife & I visited Castle Hill as part of a walking tour on our first day in Budapest Saturday 5/10. We were fortunate that the weather was sunny & warm. Our time on the Hill was an orientation followed later that day by a bus tour - not as engaging - of the flat Pest section on the east side of the Danube. We were enthralled by the many sights & attractions. The views were spectacular from many locations & angles. We recommend that you plan a full day on the Hill to visit some of its many fascinating buildings, museums, statues, shops, restaurants........ FYI: You'll find elsewhere on TA my reviews of Matthias Church, Fisherman's Bastion, & Cafe Pierrot.

Great view of the city. Thronging with tour groups of every description and serious repair and renovation work going on. None the less it's a must visit while in Budapest. Offers an excellent perspective of what was previously known as the city of Pest, the opposite side of the river.

Gorgeous scenery. We walked up rather than pay a fortune to take the funicular. It looks like a daunting climb but when you pause a couple of times to admire the view, it's lovely.Definitely go up here, the view is outstanding and the second best in the whole city (the best faces this amazing hill so you can see it)The toilets cost money, however they are well maintained so worth it.

A must see bit of Budapest.. With it dominant position on the hill to the west of the Danube this is the tourist trap of Budapest. Expect lots of coaches and battalions of tourists being led by their guides from all corners of the globe. Most spend their time at Matthias' Church and the nearby Fisherman's Bastion but there is plenty of interest in the adjacent streets and a gentle leisurely walk will be well rewarded. There are many brass sculptures to see most of which have a great sense of drama about them and not just memorials to long since dead and forgotten men. Find the ruins of Mary Magdalene church and look for the nun flying through the corner of the house at first floor level on the building on the northeast side of the square. Its a nice bit of fun to brighten your day.

Old Budapest. Sitting overlooking the current city centre, this is the medieval centre of the city and a great area to wander around and explore. With the palace, museums and bars/ restuarants, it's easy to spend a day up here.

A must-see: you can spend an entire day here !. When you cross the Chain bridge from the Pest side to the Buda side of Budapest, you have two options to get up Castle Hill: you can take the Siklo (= a cog Railway), or you can walk. Although the hill is very steep, the zig-zag walk throught the park gives you the opportunity to take pictures of the Siklo in motion, of the bronze statue of the Turul bird above and of the Chain bridge below.Once up the hill, you see the Castle palace, with the Hungarian National Gallery, the Viennese gate, the Matthias fountain, the Lionsgate and vestiges of the old palace buildings and walls.In the National Galery is a café where you can grab a snack, and outside next to it is a restaurant. After your visit to the Castle palace, you can take a 2 to 3 hour walk through the Castle Hill quarter, where you can see amongst other things the Sandor palace, the St. Mathiaschurch, the Fisherman's bastion, the small pharmacy museum, the old jewish quarter and several baroque buildings.Don't miss out on an icecream of Konditorei Ruszwurm, they taste excellent !
Best Views of Budapest. Take the funicular and visit the grounds of the former palace (now national art museum) and. Best views of the Chain Bridge and the stunning Houses of Parliament.

fantastic view of Budapest. If you want to see a fantastic view of Budapest, Castle Hill is the place to go! It's clean, large for many areas to take some beautiful pictures of the view. Whilst walking around we met a gentleman dressed in Ye'Old clothing and was hosting Archery and Crossbow. I would most highly reccomend taking part in this, as the guy was lovely though he didnt speak much english he was friendly and taught me well for this was my first time doing archery. There is a lift up to Castle Hill which you can pay for however we walked up a different route which was longer and a steep walk but worth every step.
What a view!!!. The views you get from Castle Hill are just stunning.There are so many parts to wander round, definately worth a visit.

everyone is up there.... On the Buda side, The castle site is a must. The cave hospital is a close walk, The view of Pest is lovely if the tourist would only not enter my camera view from stage left or right or in front of me.... There was a beer festival going on when I arrived. When an activity like this happens, go. The cafes are not nearly as good as the Pest side and are more expensive. Save appetite for Pest. But everyone needs to visit the Castle Hill or one cannot say they visited the city!
Beautiful Views. Along with the parliament building, these buildings ARE Budapest. A must for pictures and exploration.
Last day trip. We had one day left of our trip to Budapest and decided to do a trip to Castle Hill. We went there with a bus and returned by walking. Nice view but that's about it.

Amazing!!. This was delightful! We walked from the bottom right up to the top and was so glad we did. My boyfriend loves photography and got lots of great shots of the amazing views on the way up to the top. There are plenty of stops along the footpaths for photo opportunities. At the top is a world war 2 bunker which was brilliant history and fascinating with a lot of the original features still in tact! I would recommend this to everyone!
Lovely Castle and walks. The castle is very impressive and has lots of interesting and fascinating sights. Take the day to see the citadella and the fishermans bastion.

Something for everybody. The best part about Castle Hill is that everyone can enjoy it. You can just walk around outside and enjoy the views, visit the museums, sit in a cafe, go explore the cave under the castles, visit the churches and even shop. You can easily spend the whole day here.
good history and views. We went up to castle hill as part of a free walking tour. The history of the palace and cathedral are interesting and the view is spectacular!
Nice views, looks older than it is. Looks all very nice, it has all been rebuild though around 1900 and after the war. Quite a steep walk up and down to Pest, but worth it.

Another great viewpoint. This is an unfinished fortress designed for defending the city of the Turks attacks. It is on a hilltop of the Buda side of the city. The bus goes to the top and you can reach it by car (but beware very few car park spaces). The fortress is nothing special in design but it offers terrific views over the city.

Best place to take a view of the city.. The name of the place says it all. Its a castle on a hill. Its overlooking the Danube River looking out towards the Pest side of Budapest. If you are a photographer, this is a must place to go. Even if you are not, just looking over the view is spectacular. You can take the stairs to get up to the top (there are several) or you may choose to take a short Funicular train ride to the top. Once on the top, you can walk around the grounds of the castle and enjoy a view. Several eateries and cafes on the grounds.

Beautiful castle area with an extensive museum. We went up to the castle with the funicular, a cable-car that runs at the river side of the castle. The castle area is big itself. You can see the changing of the guards and the many statues around the courtyard. There's also visible the ruins of the old Budapest castle. Do take a visit to the Magyar Gallery in the castle area. The collection of art in there is extensive!
Quaint...fun to explore aimlessly. Best gelato I have ever had is just steps away from Mattyas Templom (Matthias Church) on Szentharomsag ter.
Beautiful!. A beautiful area and more quiet than rest of the city. Amazing buildings and views! Easy to go there with the bus and then just walk around having an ice cream.

must-see. an amazing view of Budapest, we didn't climb but used some kind of a train, which was very cheap and enabled us to see more views. There are lots of places to see there and it's very close everywhere, but take something warm coz it was windy up the mountain :)

Amazing!. A beautiful place to visit during the day or at night. Me and a group of friends sat in front of it and spend hours and hours just enjoying the view and the good vibration it emanates. I so recommend it! Take a sandwich and something to drink, sit there and enjoy!

Great view. This is a stop on the city bus tour there are cafe'sgift shop, and of course loos , a lovely place to stop and one of the best views in the city , it was a lovely sunny day when we went and thoroughly recommend

Castle Hill. This was part of our city tour. We walked round this area. The views over the city were very good.
it was reasonable accessible for me in a wheelchair,
Castle Hill. It was a wonderful site to view the Pest side. Take the funicular to the top and enjoy the experience.
Great views of Budapest from Castle Hill. Would recommend the views from Castle Hill. The hike up was pretty, but the views at the top were great.

A must see. We hired a guide from our hotel to take us around Budapest on our first day to get a good overview. This was one of the first stop and was well worth it. The fabulous views of the city and the river would be enough but also to tour the castle and the town adds to the visit. We spend a good couple of hours here and could have stayed longer.

Panoramic. We spent time walking around that part of Budapest and ended up at a corner cafe\bistro for a glass of wine and munchies. From the outdoor tables one offered a good view of part of the city and the Danube. Nice wine and noshes.

What a view!!. We were there on Sunday, had wonderful pastry in a small cafe and managed to catch the changing of the guard at the "White House". There are many things to see so save time to see it all. Tea at the Hilton is always a fun stop as well.
nice view. Nice view - you can see all importaint buildings, bridges and both sides of Budapest- Buda and Pest.
Castle Hill a must see. good view from the Fishermen's Bastion and lots of history. Wonderful architecture, plus museums to visit

Make this your first stop on a trip to Budapest.. This is the way to get a feel for the geography of Budapest and enjoy the spectacular vistas of the Danube and the Pest side of the city from the hill and castle in Buda. The buildings, old and new, are spectacular. We also went in to see the lobby of the Four Seasons Hotel and the outside garden built around old ruins. Bring your guide book with you so that you can identify the structure and location of major buildings and areas on the Pest side of the river.

Truly Stunning. This view is a must see, its free and only a 1km walk a hill. There is paid transport for those who wish to get there the fast way. It is truly breathe taking and I would highly recommend it.
A must at dusk. Buda is lovely during the day but you must visit the Citadel in the evening for a breathtaking view of the whole city with all the bridges lit up and reflecting in the Danube
Do not leave Budapest without seeing it. The place to be in Budapest. Impressive buildings, great view to the city. Do not leave Budapest without seeing it

The west end best. Get away from the crowds and coaches walking around the deserted streets and pedestrian promenade and you will be rewarded with a better impression of the district and stop off for a lunch at very good restaurants.

Not to be missed. The 16 bus goes very near the castle from Pest. If in Pest, and nearby, you can also take the short and lovely walk across the Chain Bridge. We took the funicular after crossing the bridge. Round trip was about $7.50. It's pricey, but it was an experience (a very short one). As so many other reviewers have noted, the view from the courtyard is breathtaking. We spent several hours walking around the castle and museum area, but it was so lovely outside we didn't want to visit any of the museums. There are some very nice cafés as you make the short walk to Matthias church. You can easily walk down the hill, take the funicular, or the 16 bus if you are heading back to Pest. Don't miss this on a sunny day. The views are great. There are also lots of public toilets in the area that have an admission charge of about $1. I used a couple of them and they were very clean.

Confusing. We thought there was a castle to see and so did many others rummaging around trying to find the entrance. This is just a hill. Now there are other attractions on it and there is a view, but do not read into the name that you will visit a castle, just the outside. If you go inside anywhere, you will be visiting one of two museums housed in the complex. I hope I have saved someone's itinerary from allotting time for something that isn't there. Enjoy the hill!

Great day out not spoiled by rain. If you're looking for great views and an insight into a bit of Hungarian history, this is the place to go. The architecture is spectacular and there are lots of things to see and do once you're inside the citadel, including restaurants and museums. The only downside was that all of the galleries and museums inside the palace had quite hefty entrance fees. I still think it's definitely worth a visit. As far as getting there is concerned, my friend and I walked up the steps on our way up, which didn't take us very long at all, and hopped on a bus down as we had public transport passes. Overall, a nice day our.

Walk, Bus or Funicular. There are 3 ways to get up the hill, by walking, taking bus or funicular. The funicular costs around 1100 Forint. Personally, i think the funicular does not worth the money because the funicular ride is less than 1 minute. If you happen to have a ticket for public transport, bus 16 will take you up the hill and stop right in front of the Fisherman Bastion. Walking up the hill took us only 10 minutes (to be fair, we were more like jogging than walking) and if you are travelling in a limited budget, walking is an ideal way to get up the hill. The view from the top of the hill is amazing. You will be able to see the Pest (eastern side of Danube). Watching Budapest from Castle Hill during night time is indescribable.

great view, very nice area. if you are into old buildings, and great food, and amazing view don't miss this place, we were there for half a day, it's very easy to get there by public transportation, there is nice local restaurant down the road when you go back.
Beautiful, must be there. It was really nice to go there, then you take the fantastic view of Pest side and surrounding on the Danube.

Romantic stroll. After a walk across the chain bridge, and a little hike up the side of the hill, a long leisurely stroll in Castle Hill was just what I needed. We found a nice cafe and toasted each other while enjoying the view of the Danube and Parliament. Its nice to get a chance to survey all around you. Not something to skip. It is possible to take a funicular up if you don't want or cannot walk.

Beautiful and worth the visit !. One thing about this place that is absolutely amazing is the view of Budapest and the Danube ! Also, all the castles there have amazing roofs. When I went there, there was also a man that was carrying a hawk that you could touch and take pictures with. It was really nice and definitely worth seeing!

Must See District in Budapest. You can walk through history here! Castle Hill is where the Royal Palace is located. It rises above the city and is visible from almost anywere. Housed within the Palace now are three museums including the Budapest History Museum. The views into Pest and the surrounding areas of the city are stunning from the Palace grounds. Also on Castle Hill is Sandor Palace, the residence of the President of the Republic since 2003. If you are timely, you can watch a changing of the guard, which happends every hour. The top of the Funicular Railway (the second in Europe) is also located next to Sandor Palace.

Must do in Budapest!. A lovely, lovely spot! It is essentially a whole little town on top of the hill. Mattias church is absolutely beautiful, and so is the Fisherman's Bastion. Wandering around the Castle complex (with church, bastions and so on...) itself is not going to take more than half a day, but it will take longer if you decide to visit the Hungarian National Museum. Too bad there currently are some work in progress in the main square, but the view from the top of the hill is beautiful. Do not change money anywhere there, is an absolute rip-off. Getting there by walk is a bit of a mess, especially if you are coming from the other side of the river (Pest), but there is a funicular service as well as a bus. An absolute must-see!!

A must see. This is the one must see for any tourist visiting Budapest. Castle Hill has all the major attractions you would want to see including Buda Castle, Matthias Church and Fisherman's Bastion.You can easily take a bus or funicular up but the walk up is only 10minutes. Great views and stunning architecture once you reach the top.
A tourists 'must see'.. Delightfully restored buildings including the Royal Palace and a stunning church ,Fisherman Bastion and Castle District.The views over the City and River are superb.

Allow at least a whole day here. I actually spent two days in the Castle Hill area, as there was so much to see with all the various museums. A funicular takes you up the hill and there are plenty of cafes and restaurants for when you get hungry or tired. There are many photo opps of the city across the Danube and the Chain Bridge. Wear sensible shoes as it is all cobblestones.
Worth the effort. Lots to see including the Second World War hospital under the castle.Avoid the self service café up the hill in the square, food very bland.

Exhilarating view. The view from Castle Hill over Budapest and the Danube must be one of the most spectacular urban landscapes in the world. Take the shuttle bus up to the Hungarian National Gallery on a nice day and feast your eyes. Admire the landscape, as well as the old buildings and terraces around the Gallery. Then enjoy the wonderful collection of Hungarian art in the National Gallery itself.

Nice place to walk around and view the city. We went to the castle hill on a Monday when all the museums were closed, but the hill still offered very good views of the city and beautiful buildings. Especially around the Fisherman’s bastion the prices are at tourist levels so a beer or even going to a restroom there will cost you a lot more than in even the other side of the castle hill. Without going to any of the museums a couple of hours is enough to see pretty much everything from the outside. The Hill is easy to reach from the Széll Kálman tér metro station.

Great views, plenty of history. You can get to the top of the hill by funicular, or walk up as we did. At the top is the royal palace which houses the national art collection, St. Mattyas church and Fisherman's Bastion, all of which are well worth seeing and have great views of the Danube and the city.

Must see Changing Of The Guards at President's Palace. Castle Hill is a wonderful site to stroll. One should really take the funicular to go uphill!The palace, the museum, the streets, the caves, Fisherman's Bastion, Matthias Church, so much to see and do. And wonderful views of the city's Pest side.A must see is the incredible show of Changing Of The Guards at the Presidential Palace every day at 12.00 noon.

Don't miss it. Wow it's to much to describe just go and enjoy, Take the Hop A Bus, It's the best way to see the best in a short period of time, by a 24 hour pass at least, and get of at a stop if you see something nice.
Well worth an afternoon. Travel up the hill on funicular, visit the Castle and Royal Palace and Museums (mostly free). Labrinthus under Buda Hill is cool, literally and as a fun experience!
great views. Its a must visit place offcourse in Budapest. It offers great views from the city and the Danube! Oldest part of the city.

A Must Visit Historical Site, Great Views. Castle Hill is a very interesting site with a lot to see and in my view can be considered a historic center of the city. Despite being a major tourist attraction the place is very tranquil, where you can just relax and enjoy numerous panoramic views of the Danube river and the city.
Great Views. It was an effort to walk to the top but worth it in the end for the views of the city. I would recommend walking up to watch the sun set over the castle.
Great view. Grate view and many wine festivals. It’s a must see attraction. Inside gallery is nice as well but you have to have a guide

Great views - museum decent. The views are great from the castle hill - but it is quite a long distance to walk internally. The musuem is great if you like self-portraits (as there are tons of them). There are tons of other artifacts from B.C. era to date. Nice walk through history.

Splendid Panoramic View. Although the Citadel was closed to public; that did not prevent us from enjoying tremendously the superior Panoramic views of Budapest and the main attractions of both Buda and Pest; the green Buda, the Danube and its magnificent Bridges, the Parliament, St Stephen’s Basilica, St Matthias Church, and many other beautiful locations.It is a must visit to all photographers and scenery lovers.

City view. This place gives a good view on the city. The way up is not too hard, but it's a small hike. From the top you'll be able to see the city. It can be very crowded with tourists, specially during summerime. It's nice to go in the evening, when the sun is less bright.
Don't miss it!. Great views of the city, historic sights, cafes, shopping and St. Mattias Church. Would definitely go back!

A beautiful place to visit - Castle Hill Budapest. On a holiday trip to, inter alia, Budapest, our first place to visit was Castle Hill. And what a place to visit. Sitting atop Budapest, it offers of panoramic view of the city and its surroundings. Most breathtaking is the view of river Danube and the Pest side of the City, which is virtually on flat grounds. One can see imposing parliament building on other side of the river, as also several modern building, many of them 5 star hotels. The castle and church on the caste hill are very impressive. All in all, one can easily pass 2-3 hours enjoying beauty of the place, surroundings and breathtaking brid's eye view that the place offers. Full marks for the spot.

Stunning setting and view. Whether you want to tour yet more castles and churches or not, you must head up here just for the spectacular view of Budapest from the Buda side. it is really exceptional. There is also a cafe located up top with a stunning view as well.

Castle Hill Budapest Hungary. I'm glad we had a bus ride up the the castle on the Buda side of the Danube. There are steps you can climb if you are young and in shape. I am not. The magic of the Castle Hill area is dreamlike. The ties on the castles roof glitter and reflect an era of opulence we can only dream about. In fact if you walk around the town up there most of the old building have been there for generations and you can envision life back centuries. There are shops and restaurants in the village. The most exquisite sight though is from the overlook at the back of the castle. You are high above the Danube and can see all the bridges including the historic Chain Bridge and you can see all of Pest. This trek up the Castle Hill is well worth the time but see if you can get transportation to the top.
Great view of pest. Just returned from Hungary. I have to say I was impressed. Parliament is actually miniature of london parliament. Great architect all around the city. Must visit.

Dominates the city. From the Pest side of the Danube, the view of the Castle is wonderful...even better when lighted at night. One in the Castle area, one gains a real sense of what it was like when this was the seat of a substantial empire, not just Hungary.

Worthwhile trip to the top. Castle Hill is definitely a must-see for anyone visiting Budapest. It offers great views as well as a very pleasant walking experience with beautiful buildings and scenic open spaces. You can walk up or take the funicular. It’s a bit of a steep climb to the top but it’s not that taxing and you can take some pretty pictures along the way. Don’t forget to treat yourself at Ruszwurm café once you’ve made your way to the top!

Best views of Pest. The castle hill itself is a wonderful little quiet space where you can wander around to enjoy the nice castle and it's surroundings. The main draw being Fisherman's Bastion, which along with the Parliament, are Budapest's most recognisable feature.Also from the hill you get lovely panoramic views of Pest and Margaret's Island.
Great views. Great place for taking photos. Views of the city are breathtaking from this height. Not to be missed. You can grab the Hop on Hop off buses to get up as it's quite a walk

Best View of the City. It is definitely worth your time to make your way to the top. We walked up by taking the paths and the stairs. It is not an easy climb, but it is very rewarding to reach the top and excellent exercise. There are also busses that travel to the top to make the trip easier. Once at the top you can view the Statue of Liberty close up. The statue is easily visible from just about everywhere in the city so it was neat to be able to view it so close. At the top of the hill lies the Citadella. We did not go inside, but walked the perimiter and enjoyed the most amazing view of the city and the Danube.

Must See in Budapest. Walk past the sweet little shops, wiith great views of the Danube, and then the stroll around the castle provides so many picture taking opportunities which make a stop at the castle hill a must for a comfortable evening well-spent. We took bus number 16 to this spot and took the same bus back to our hotel, so you don't worry about parking.One thing is for sure, there will be plenty of ice cream!
beautiful. I am originally from Budapest and this is a must see site. You can never get bored of the view and it truly is beautiful.
Do you like to explore?. You could probably spend a week in this area and not see it all. There is an abundance of shops and restaurants and historic sites, all easily walkable.

Amazing View. A trip to Castle Hill provides a scenic and unique view of the Pest side of Budapest. Once you wind your way up the hill, you can walk to the Hungarian National Gallery and other museums at one side of the hill top. Walking through a small village with restaurants and shops for tourists, you'll come to the church and Fisherman's Bastian and can look out over the Danube River, the Parliament Buildings, and much of Pest. Lots of tourists from mid-morning to late afternoon, so if you come early or later in the afternoon, you will have fewer tourists around.

Lovely walking. Walked around the palace in brilliant sunshine, what an amazing place. Saw the changing of the guard at midday which is a lot more entertaining than the one in London. Lovely walking around the area and some good cafés too.
Nice historical area.. Great views of the city from up here. Lots of shops to look around. Nice quaint architecture. No actual castle. Check out the church and the ruins behind the hotel.
Amazing!!. Amazing place to visit !! Unfortunately, the day I went was rainning, but still a good place! Amazing view of Budapest

Lovely views with lots to do . Great walk to up the hill from just by the fenicular railway. Great views over the city with lots of history around. We decided not to go in the buildings (they all cost) but just walk, which we both enjoyed. Very touristy but clearly a lot of rennovation building work going on which will make it an even nicer place. The paths on the walk up could use some general maintence or weed killer!

Put on your walking shoes. You can walk along the cobblestone streets & thru alleys & squares & imagine what it must have been like before WWII. Beautiful area worth spending the day, taking pictures, shopping & stop for coffee & a pastry.

Beautiful views. A major tourist spot, so don't expect it to be too quiet, but lots of opportunities to walk around and get good views, see the inside of Mathias church, go to the Hungarian National Art Musuem and more. Step off the main streets near the church into the little side streets and it changes

Touristy - better places to discover the city. Well worth a walk around the cobblestones and to see the views out over both sides of Buda, but nothing there that you NEED to do, and certainly leave this part of town eat! Tourist trap central!

Walk it.. Although steep, it is not a very long walk to the top. My wife and I are around 60 with some medical issues and we did it. Don't wait in line for the funicular or take the bus. Enjoy the climb.

The photo shot everyone wants. Easy to access Castle Hill via the funicular. Once you're up, you can stroll around the castle, or head over the St. Mathias church. you get the best panoramic photos of Budapest, including the parliament building. Add it to your list, it's worth the short wait in line for the funicular.

Lovely view!. In a sunny day you can have the view of the bridges. If you come from Pest side walking through Szechenyi Bridge (that has a nice view of Danube river), you can take the funicular up. The common transport pass is not valid here, so you have to buy another one. There is also the tram #16 that goes up and uses the common transport pass.

Vantage point looking over Pest. This is on the higher side of the river and goes up a winding road to the top of this ancient area. Wonderful view over Pest and nice little cafe where you can get an excellent coffee and pice of cake. Make sure you have small change for the public toilets which are very clean. You may get the chance of seeing the eagle which is sometimes here with it's handler. The money changer gives a reasonable rate for Euros or dollars.
worth a visit!. Lovely view! We walked it and it was abit or a trek but worth it for the magnificient view. I totally recommend it.
great vews beautiful. definitey get up there and see that side of Budapest as part of your trip - buda side has more scenic architecture vs Pest which is more food/bars etc

Fantastic views. I took the funicular up to get to the top of Castle Hill, at a cost of 1,100 HUF one way (the return is 1,700 I believe). Once up there, it began to lightly rain, which was disappointing, but I still walked down so I could see Pest. The view from here is great, and if you have the ability to take panorama shots on your camera/phone, this is the place to do it from for sure.I didn't visit the actual castle as I only had one day in Budapest, but it looks like an interesting place to visit if you have the time and interest. There were some souvenir stands right near the castle which sold typical souvenirs like postcards, magnets etc. Do not feel pressured to buy something that you see here, as there are many other souvenir shops as you walk further into the castle district, and some of the shops are much better priced than these stalls.

grate view. One of the best sites in budapest to enjoy the view of the hall city of Budapest ,you can also walk around the old village with nice traditional houses and some interesting restaurants and caffes especially in the summer time

Probably the most important monument in Budapest. You can walk up castle hill once you arrive it has a medieval feel from the beginning, the views over the Danube are incomparable and worth the effort alone, this monument was settled in the 13 century and has significant meaning to the Turkish, Germans and Hungarians. There are many statues and fountains be sure to bring your camera. It's mainly a walking area with limited traffic access, you can take a bus up and back if you wish. Do go if it's raining as you won't get the best out of your day.
Worth seeing for the view. A visitor to Budapest should go to Castle Hill for the view. But there is so much more to see in this magnificent city.
A must!. Spectacular views! A really superb area to visit. Don't miss it when you're in town. It should be at the top of your list.
plenty to see. We spent quite a few hours at Castle hill, the views were spectacular, and there is lots to see. This is a must do in Budapest.

Must see while in Budapest. The castle and adjacent old city on the Buda side are utterly charming and very different from the larger city on the Pest side. On a clear day the view of Pest is magnificent.

Amazing Views. The views of the Buda Palace and the city are amazing and a photographer dream!!! (both amateur and professional) I was disappoint to learn that the castle was destroyed in WW2 and even though it has been rebuilt a library and art museum are the only things inside so you will mostly just stay outside to photograph the view.

Wonderful view on a clear day!. This was well worth the walk to the top. You can take the cable car but there is usually a long line and if you are able bodied the walk really isn't that hard! You get brilliant views out over Budapest and get to see all of the landmarks that make the skyline UNESCO listed!

Excellent view and encompases other attractions. We took the funicular up to the top because we already made the hike up Gellert Hill that day. The funicular is a short ride and a little added expense, but saved our feet from more walking. The hill provides excellent views of Budapest and the Chain Bridge. On top it is in close proximity to other attractions (art museum, Office of the President, multiple statues). It is a great starting point for a trip in the Castle District (Buda Castle, Fisherman's Bastion, St. Mathias Church).

Definite Must See, including the entire Castle District. After walking across the Chain Bridge, we walked up a winding staircase built into the hill, and ended up in the Castle District. You will need at least 1/2 a day to cover this entire area. More if you plan to go into buildings for tours. It was my favorite day in Budapest! Beautiful churches, castles, quaint places to eat and enjoy a glass of wine, and many wonderful small shops with genuine locally made items. Be SURE to bring local money with you for bathrooms. There are NO free bathrooms in the area at all, unless you are eating somewhere.

Lovely. The Castle Hill was lovely. There were ruins up there, which were interesting to see. You also get a beautiful view of more of the Buda side. The castle was lovely to walk around, as was the Mathias Church. There are a few huts selling souvenirs which were the cheapest in the city.

A must see. This is very historic part of the city with the national art gallery, which a must for the artist. The paintings tell the history of Hungary, which is amazing, this is in the permanent gallery. Take the funicular up to the hill , or take the bus 16 which leave you right on the hill.
Excellent!!. The Castle hill with its magnificent castle and the smaller architectural wonders scattered all across is a must visit for any tourist to this city.
Gorgeous view. Amazing view of all Budapest. St Mathias church is very interesting, specifically for the painted interiors
great views of pest. great views but nothing really special looks better lit up at night lets you get your bearings of were things are in pest

Busy with tourists, but worth the visit. We were lucky enough to see the changing of the guard, which we heard was once an hour - worth seeing if you're able to.
The area was, understandably busy, but also great for the views across the river. Worth a a visit.

Beautiful. After 7 days of lousy weather we caught a nice one the day we visited Budapest. Took the funicular from the base of the chain bridge up to castle hill and then just strolled along with a guide pointing out the historic significance of all we saw. Will probably forget much of the info but the images and photos up there are plentiful. Great views of Pest and the river from many vantage points. It's a must see in Budapest. A very interesting city by the way. Invaded by the Nazis, liberated by the Soviets and then chained up by its liberators, Budapest is working hard to shed the remnants of the disastrous communist system and the damages inflicted by WW 2.
amaizing. the day we visit the castle it was extremely windy, but the view is incredible, and the museums are really interesting, you must not miss it

Lovely walk. We had a one and a half walk around this place. There were small shops and cafes. The buildings and statues were quite picturesque. There were some construction going on but the place was kept clean and relatively serene. The water closets cost 70 cents per person.
A pretty spot. Wander around beyond the touristy areas and see if you can stick your nose into a courtyard or two. The medieval buildings are unusual for Budapest

Fantastic area. This is Budapests very own old town and I loved the atmosphere. we took the funicular up and down overlooking the beautiful Chain bridge. Walking throug the cobbled street, looking at the souvenirs, eating gulasj in an traditional Hungarian cafe... we loved it!!

fantastic. This is not what i expected at all, its a little village inside! shops, resturants and bars lots of attractions to see, perfect scenery, a very steep walk up though but there is a little mountain train that can take you up and down for about £3 so not too bad we walked and were ready for the drink on the top! Lovely 2 course meal with a drink for about a £10 basic but ideal for what we just needed! You need to see this place to appreciate Budapest in its glory fab views all over!

Walk up, its not that far. Although it looks far from the bottom, the walk up is quite pleasant following paths and steps with lots of stops on the way. Just wander around when you get there. There are markets, shops and sights galore.... enjoy the view.
Beautiful view of the river bank, good for evening. Went during the day. Minimal line. Beautiful view. A must for Budapest. Could be even better to go in evening if you're into evening photography.

What a vista!. What a great place to take in the wonderful panorama of Pest. The Danube and the city stretch before one and the beautiful buildings and cobblestoned streets and the turrents of the castle make one feel as though we are in a fairy tail.
Stunning Views. Very touristy but worth the walk across the Chain Bridge from Pest and up the hill. The views from all aspects are incomparable. Took the funicular down.

Interesting. Need to spend a full day here such are the attractions. Many and diverse , especially Budapest history museum, the cares etc are a bit tourist priced so take a picnic lunch. Great views across the river and it is easily reached by public transport
Interesting walk through cobbled streets. In the oldest part of the city there are many great views and ancient buildings many of which were restored after the war. Lovely street cafes and shops

Easy Viewing!. Everything around here is compact and accessible by foot, although we weren't sure how to get here from the square as it wasn't clear - keep walking you will stumble across it!!! (Don't take the funicular railway as you see much more on foot!!).

So crowded. We went up the hill in a bus and the area was so crowded. You could get a view but there was no ambiance at all. There were also road works happening. We wandered down the road trying to find some quieter areas but really felt this area was crazy. It's not even peak time yet.

Great way to spend the day!. We walked from the Pest to Buda side in the morning. The line for the lift up the hill was pretty long, so we walked up Castle hill. It wasn't a bad walk at all. It was a beautiful day! The view is amazing. There is a lot to see on Castle Hill. I recommend making it a leisurely day; take your time, see the sights, and take a lot of pictures.

Great place to stay. Amazing place to stay for your visit to Budapest. Although it was VERY busy during the day with all the tourists, it quiets down at night and offers some of the best views of the city. The city center is a quick bus ride away (15 minutes on the 16 day bus or 916 night bus). It is a little more quiet, laid back and romantic than Pest.

Must go! wether it's nice or bad weather:). Of course all of the outside places are much better to visit and see when it is shiny and warm. But on this side of the river you can first of all see a beautiful castle and secondly admire the view where you can see an amazing panorama of Budapest

Walking and viewing. Castle Hill is a great place to spend a part of a day on walking, visiting monuments and enjoying the stunning view on a city. It's a must-do in Budapest! Even if you don't want to enter museums and attractions (all paid) it's worth just taking a stroll because it's a lovely place where you can learn some history.
Beautiful panoramic view. We took the red hop on hop off bus line to castle hill. Most beautiful part of Budapest ... Incredible view of Pest...Took the Fanicula down from the castle...

A place you want to be in a good weather. Budapest has a lot of history buildings. Most of them are well impressive at day time, others at night. Castle hill has both. Bus 16 climbs the hill and after a short walk you get to the the city like a bird, wide angle whole Budapest and the Danube river. Do not miss a visit in St Matthias church! Relax, enjoy the view, take photos or pay a visit in one of the restaurants in the Citadella. We had a good goulash soup with the Hop on hop off coupon +excellent desserts (in full price-reasonable prices).
