Worth a day of visit. Castle hill has the castle and other museums. Just walking around the area is pretty, nice forested pathways and buildings. Do take a stroll while visiting castle and the other monuments.If you are looking at a map and thinking this place connects to Gellert hill, you are mistaken. Not easy way to go from here to there other than going back downhill to the Danube, or walking all around it.

A highlight of Budapest. Beautiful area, lots to do whether visiting the castle itself, Fishermans Bastion, St Matthias church or just wandering around the area and taking photos. Worth visiting bit hat day time and at night. We had a Hop on Hop off bus ticket, which took us there - first time on the whole tour, the second time we walked across the Chain bridge and got on the bus at the stop at the bridge. We would have liked to try the funicular but there was a long queue - and no point in waiting when we could go for free on the bus.

Gorgeous. The view of the Castle from the Pest side is astounding, but the view from the top of the Castle Hill is breathtaking. I would highly recommend taking the funicular to the top! The walk up is doable, but I would pay the small fee to take the ride up. My travelling companion and I did not do any of the tours in the castle, but just walking around was worth going. If you want souvenirs, the little "market" (like 10 stalls) behind the castle is good and CHEAP! If you're going to Budapest, it would be a shame to miss Castle Hill. I would also recommend going at night if possible, because the view of the city/bridges with all the lights on is gorgeous!

The view and the WW2 history. I took a long walk to the Gellert Castle, the park down the hill is nice and not that hard to climb. Of course, you can take the funicular, that is another interesting, singular experience.I liked the view over the Danube and Budapest and the history surrounding the castle and its role in the second WW. You can still see bombs marks on the exterior walls.It is very touristic and therefore it has that kind of gazebos that make the place look cheap but I guess it is inevitable.

Historic Buda. This is one of my favorite places to visit in Budapest and I have been living here for 5 months! It can be overrun with tourists, but there is so much history here that it is worth going up to walk the streets and look at the buildings or to go one of many museums. Stop and have a coffee and something sweet at Ruszwurm which dates from 1827 and is not only charming, but has wonderful, in house pastry at reasonable prices. The views of the city are postcard perfect. If you want to get away from the crowds, walk along the fortress wall on the west side of the hill. It is a pleasant, peaceful walk where you can experience the area's feeling without the crowds.

Living history. There is so much history. Much is reconstructed because of previous wars, but they did a good job. There is a great view of the Danube and Pest from here. Fisherman's Bastion is a short walk away.

You cannot miss visiting the Castle Hill District. A pleasant though steep walk up to the castle via a series of stepsdand winding pathways leads you to the Castle district. The area has many old buildings and narrow streets and includes many of the key historic sites of Budapest. The views from the Castle over the Danube and city are fantastic. The Castle itself is an important art gallery. The area is naturally very popular with visitors and can be very busy with large coach parties arriving constantly. Even so worth a visit and a stroll through the historic district.
:). you can have one of the best view of Budapest. And you can also taste delicious home made bakery around the castle ;) :)

not a steep walk at all!. I walked from district XII to the top of Castle Hill with a broken toe. With each slight incline- the view got better and better. Luckily there were alot of steps, not just a climb, but there were also busses from somewhere to the front of Buda Castle, for those less enthused by walking. All the shops, cafes, and restaurants around are reasonably priced, a small surprise for a tourist attraction.
Great views. At the moment this is all being improved and the road works were a bit of a mess. The view is good,so it is still worth a trip but it will be better when it;s done.

Wonderful!. My best friend advised me that this place was probably not worth seeing. Was he wrong! The views of the Pest side were unbelievably beautiful (both day and night), and the castle area itself was quaint and picturesque. The streets were quiet, with well-maintained houses, restaurants, and other buildings. The best stuff was located right together: St. Matthias Church, Fishermen's Bastion, and the statue of St. Stephen. If you want to go on the upper rampart of the Bastion, however, you will need to buy a ticket at the church cashier's booth across the street. (I do not know the price, as we went up there at night after the ticket-taker had left.) You should definitely be there at night! All the main structures of the city are illuminated and beautiful to see: parliament, bridges, St. Stephen's basilica, Gellert Hill, St. Matthias church, etc. There are a number of good-to-excellent and reasonably-priced restaurants in the castle area as well.

Impressive. One of the most famous places in Budapest, this place is a tourist paradise with lots to see and learn and lot of historically important sites all around. The hill provides with the view of the Danube river, Hungarian parliament house and lots of shops and cafes around. The place is also crowded but is a great experience to be around.
walk on the buda side. castle hill is a nice walk to do, a little bit touristy, with a gift shop at every turn, the view to the danube and the hungarian parliament is the best part

Essence of Budapest. Going to Budapest and not going up the hill would be like going to London as a tourist and not going to Buckingham Palace. Impressive buildings, great museums, panoramic views, welcoming cafes, and a history lesson all on one site. Catch the funicular up and walk down. Don't miss it.

Don't even bother to go there. The Budapest "castle" is just a reconstruction, because the whole place was bombed during the WW2. So don't expect any history, don't expect anything, just crowds of people and a poor reconstructed castle and very cheap copy of a church, which looks quite nice from afar, but when you come closer, it is really terrible. And the Hotel Hilton stands right next to it.Every restaurant in that area is overly expensive and the place has no history in it. It is just a cheap coulisse for tourists.Don't even bother to go there. Just visit some place else and don't waste your holiday time.

The Palace. Wonderful architecture and statues around this area. The views across, up and down the Danube present great photo opportunities.
There is a steep climb from street level up to the top of Castle Hill. However for those of a less physical disposition can get to the top by using the funicular railway.
what a view !. it is a bit of a walk but it's an easy path with very few stairs . it is worth the effort , the view is absolutely stunning !

Great History Lessons. Great history lessons to be had, changing of the guard at the presidents offices was interesting, great views of the city but I cant help but be reminded of the square from Chitty Chitty Bang Bang the movie when the kids where kidnapped.
Amazing View. Took the Funicular up to the top and what a site it was, fantastic views over Pest and the architecture of the castle was simply a joy!
Sterile reconstruction and terribly twee.. Full of coach parties, devoid of all atmosphere. Lovely view of the Pest though. Toilets are hidden behind the ice-cram palor should you need them.

Great Views. You can easily reach Castle Hill on foot by crossing the chain bridge. The climb up the hill is a relatively easy one, as the trail slopes up slowly. It gives great views of the Chain bridge and of the Pest side of Budapest.
Fine but not much to see. There are some good views but overall the place was bombed so much during the war that much of the soul of the hill has disappeared

Beautiful area but avoid the touristy/overpriced restaurants. Enjoyed walking around the Vár castle district area for a few hours. There are plenty of beautiful buildings, statues, green areas, and cobbled streets to explore - not to mention the stunning view from both sides of the hill (both facing Pest and the other way!).Try to cross on the Szechenyi bridge by foot, and walk up the hill by the path on the right off the roundabout (opposite, on the right, from the hill lift), through the leafy side of the hill. There is a path of stone steps (quite well-maintained although no banister) leading all the way up to the Palace, via a viewing platform - much better than queuing to get up the hill lift!Beware that (as with all of Budapest) many explanatory/information signs are just in Hungarian though, so you will need either a good guide book, or to take part in a walking tour, if you want to know more about what you see.Also, if you're travelling on a budget, I'd recommend bringing a picnic (preferably from an eatery in Pest before you cross the Danube), as *everything* is way more expensive in the castle district - easily double the price for the same food/drink.

Romantic!. Now I know where Disney got there castle idea. Beautiful and wonderful preserved. Take a walk through the local pebble stone paved village. Wonderfully manicured, every turn is a wonderfully quaint surprise. The views of the Danube and Buda side of Budapest are spectacular.

Lovely area. I was lucky enough to stay in the Hilton on Castle Hill. This is a lovely area with several attractions that are worth seeing. Definitely spend at least an afternoon wandering around. Mathias church, Fishermans Bastian, Hospital in the Rock, and of course Buda Castle are not to be missed. Also check out some of the dining options, including a few that are Michelin rated!

One of the best places to visit. If you only have a couple of days in Budapest, this should be the top of your list of places to visit!
There's a lot to do here, with plenty of restaurants, cafes, shops and museums. It's also easy to get to, and from here you can see some great views across Pest.

nice place. the area is so lovely, you must see and you can have a short walk there,
i went to the area using the hop off hop on and it was nice experience

Beautiful. Lovely places to eat and drink.
Loved the place, would recommend to visit. Great views and opportunities for photographs
A must-visit. Lots of things to see and do. Go early to avoid tourist crowds, or after sunset for beautiful night views.

Nice city view. Once you have climbed the castle hill you have earned yourself a nice view over the city and the Danube river. The streets up there are ofbetter quality than anywhere else in town. One reason for this might be the bus loads of tourists who march through the streets, however as this is one of the top attractions there is nothing else to expect. Walking around is still fun with the superb view. There are many restaurants on top so you can dine while enjoying the scenery.

Beautiful area. The Castle Hill area of Budapest was particularly beautiful. We took the short funicular ride up to the Castle, which saved many steps. I suggest good walking shoes up in this area as cobblestone streets are abundant. Beautiful at night, less crowd.
Nice area. This is a wonderful place to spend the afternoon. There are cafes, restaurants as well as great places to walk and take in the sights

Good views and lots to see. A lot to see up here, it is possible to get up without using the funicular but where is the fun in that?! Amazing views of Pest from here too and a nice walk around the old town.

Several things to look at. We went here not really looking anything up before, and is was a nice experience. There are several things to look at while up here, and great views to be had. You can take the bus up or down, we walked up and took it on the way down again.

great place, where just to walk and enjoy the views. there are many ways how to get there, but i would like to recommend to walk-up by stairs and have longer stroll through the Castle territory and suroundings.
Add to your tour. Visited while on the Geenline Hop on Hop off bus tour. Take time during the tour to visit and pick up a later bus. Need a minumum of 2 hours to appreciate the area.

A 'Must-Do' in Budapest!. Don't miss this wonderful half - Buda - of Budapest. Full of charm, lovely old buildings and cafes it is definitely a must-do. You can enjoy the very best views of the city from the Fisherman's Bastion then visit the Mikhael Church. Have lunch at a restaurant with outdoor seating or have a snack and coffee at the little coffee shop on Tancsics Mihaly utca. Admire the old doors and painted stucco of 18th century houses built on cobbled streets.A truly lovely place to visit...try to go early if you can as the area can get very crowded later in the day, especially around the Fisherman's Bastion.
Wonderful castle village. Quaint village with fabulous view, lovely church, and great cafes. There is a national gallery, paths for walking or running, and very friendly people!
Great Buildings to see. Great Buildings to see on castle hill another beautiful building to admire in this wonderful historic city

The house on the hill ,. This is one of the best places to go and see the two halves of the city. It is the centre of the old town with wonderful restaurants , coffee houses and quaint little shops and cobbled streets and a magnificent church.
Great day out. Great day spent touring the Castle and Fisherman's Bastion and the Mikhael Church. Castle Museum and History tour give a good grounding in the history of the area
Amazing view. View fro here or from St Stephen's Basilica tower. Both great Places to eat or drink with a view. Loads of tourists!
Hill in Budapest. It is a great view point, i hope yopu know your buses because it is a long walk to get there. I liked it.
Enjoy the Castle Area. A beautiful castle, with art gallery, museum and library. A wonderful view across the Danube to Pest by day, and even better by night. Great places to eat and enjoy.

Castle District - Many good attractions and excellent views of the city. The Castle District (Verhegy) is an important historical location upon the top of Castle Hill on the Buda side of the Danube River. There are many attractions found here that make this an area well worth spending a few hours if not the better part of a day during trips to Budapest. Most notably Buda Castle, also referred to as the Royal Palace can be found upon the hill, looking down upon the city and the Danube River. Here you can visit the very good Hungarian National Gallery, Bratislava History Museum and nice grounds surrounding the palace building. Nearby is the Sandor Palace where you can watch the changing of the guards. Further into the Castle District, you will find the very good St. Matthias Church and Fisherman's Bastion, both being amongst our favourite attractions in the city. Many minor attractions, restaurants and cafes can be found and explored atop Castle Hill as well. We enjoyed seeing the Vienna Gate, the ruins of St. Mary Magdalene church as well as the medieval streets lined with colourful buildings and houses. Historic Cafes like Ruszworm Cafe, found near St. Matthias Church, are also worth visiting and you can find souvenir and craft shops throughout the area, including a line of vendor stalls near the Royal Palace. You can ascend Castle Hill via a funicular near the Royal Palace or by simply walking the series of paved footpaths nearby. It is a leisurely approach up the hill and isn't particularly taxing on your legs. A similar uphill approach allows you to access the hill via the Fisherman's Bastion area, this is a nice way to enter the Castle District if you want to start your visit at or near St. Matthias Church. Outstanding views of the city are afforded visitors from several places on Castle Hill. We most enjoyed those found from right in front of the Royal Palace as well as at Fisherman's Bastion. Overall, we enjoyed our time in Castle District during our recent trip to Budapest and would purposely revisit to explore the area further and to revisit some of the attractions here. It is highly recommendable for first-time visitors to spend some time in this area of the city when visiting Budapest.

Not Just the Castle. Lovely area and a great place to walk and enjoy the views. The changing of the guard is always good to watch and the funicular was a great way to come back down the hill. Worth at least an hour or two when you are in Budapest.
Beautiful. The views were out of this word. Worth the walk, and a lovely bar at the top with decent prices. Perfect.

Once in a life time. My brother was in Hungary for 2 years. During his stay, I visited this hill. It was beyond description. I went to famous cafe and ate icecream. It was so good that I went to the cafe one more time.I felt great when I saw the view from the top. The river looked gorgeous and you can see the whole city! It is definately worth visiting.

Budapest's best scenery. The Castle Hill offer a perfect view of both Buda and Pest. Architecture and streets organisation are different on both sides and it is very interesting to see all the differences. Great place for food also and if you are going at the right time, there is a wine festival directly on the hill.

The Best Place to Saty and Visit.. We loved the Castle District. Cars for the most part are restricted and makes it a pleasure for strolling around this Wonderful area.So much to see and do. Starting with the Fisherman's Bastion, The Castel, The shops and the Restaurants.
Amazing view. Beautiful view of the city and the river!! Great photo opportunities!!! Also great shops and sightseeing in the upper area...

A must if you are in Budapest. You can have one of the most beautiful views of Budapest from here.Go for a stroll on both sides, and enjoy the stunning buildings and views.Don`t forget to reward yourself with a cake or an icecream in Russwurm afterwards.

a must do. a beautiful place , approach from the chain bridge and climb the steps or catch the number 16 bus up once at the top its left for the castle or right for the matyias church area both need visiting the museums are great the views over the city of pest and the parliment building are fabulous especially from the fishermans walls area which houses a fabulous restaurant inside the turrets, its certainly a must at both day and night
Great views. Lovely views of Budapest, again lots of stairs to get to the top but well worth it!Lots of opportunities to take panoramic

Nice place for a stroll and history. The architecture and landscape here is beautiful. My couchsurfing friends brought me here and told me about the structures and their childhood and I had a wonderful time. If you have the time, be sure to swing by!

Beautiful and characterful . This is a beautiful and deeply characterful area to walk around and explore. There are lots of attractions to see, gorgeous views both over Buda and across the river to Pest. There is also no shortage of options for a drink or a meal, from cheap casual canteen style dining up to high class hotels and quirky independent restaurants. If you're in Budapest for your first time, or as a tourist, this is a must.

An Often Overlooked Opportunity. After walking around Castle Hill and visiting its attractions, do walk down the walkway adjacent to the funicular to the base of the Hill. It is an easy and picturesque walk -- all downhill -- that gives you a different vantage point for Parliament and the Chain Bridge as well as for sights looking back up the Hill. There is no cost for the walk. There are a few stepped areas, so it would be problematic for strollers or wheelchairs. If you have a few minutes give it a try. From the base of the Hill its an easy walk across Chain Bridge to Pest.

Outstanding views and charming architecture. Do this when you first arrive to get an overall view of the city. We walked from our Pest Hotel over the Chain Bridge and yes up the hill on our own two feet as the funicular railway was being serviced. Very managable if you have a level of fitness. Lots of cafes with views here. Beware paying the fee of a few dollars to walk up on to the wall though because if you head to the parliament end you can walk up for free! We then walked down stopping to walk over the Vienna gate and old city wall...down lots of stairs to the river and return...this took about 3 hours with stop at Central Market for a snack. Lovely sunny day...nice for a walk.

best place to have overview of budapest. this is the best place to have a overview of Budapest, river and all bridges, specially chain bridge. there is also castle and statues, best time to the hill is in the evening.

Wonderful walking place. One year I lived just below Budavar and several times a week would walk up the steps to the Var--often for a Kremest at Ruszwurm, where it was the best. My first visit to the Var was marred by many loud tourists. I left. But this year they were quieter--even the tourist groups were quiet. I liked best wandering around, looking at door knobs and windows, at the design of doors, of the careful incorporation into newer structures of very old elements. Restaurants here are expensive but there is a small supermarket where you can get sandwiches, at Disz tér I think. Go inside the Mattias templom to see the incredible imaginative paint work everywhere.... There are cheap souveniers and expensive ones. If you have the time, come more than once.

Another Great Tourist Attraction. Another wonderful place to stroll, visit, watch the changing of the guard and there's an outdoor restaurant overlooking the river that serves good food at a reasonable price. Really enjoyed it.

Stunning views, and stunning buildings. Castle hill is one of the "must-sees" when in Budapest. The Palace itself is a beautiful building, and the views from atop the hill are stunning. Take time to walk around all sides of the hill, for amazing views of both Buda and Pest, on a clear day the view seems almost endless. A funicular railway can take you to the top, for a fee of around 1100HUF (as of March 2014), or you can do as I did and go on foot, a relatively light 5 minute climb up a footpath that gently winds its way up the hill.

Lovely springtime walk. I would advise anyone to head out early to this district especially at a weekend as it got busy at about 10 - 11 o'clock. Approach from the northern side (Viennese gate) from the M2 metro line and take a stroll through the old section. Beautiful and peaceful. If you want the special green marzipan topped cake, get there early to avoid queues.
a castle. A nice place where to see the view of Pest and perhaps better to see the castle from the outside only.

A must!. Castle Hill is a major tourist attraction that lived up to our expectations. We walked over the bridge from Pest and decided against using the overpriced lift and instead walked up the steps to the top. Keep in mind it’s a long way up though. Once there the views are spectacular and the district itself is picturesque and pleasant to walk around. Surrounding sites such as the Palace, Hospital in the rock and Matthias church make a trip to Castle Hill an absolute must for any tourist in Budapest.

Must see!. Brilliant! The view was phenomenal, breath taking. It's a nice travel to get there...but really beautiful. Not too crowded. The village is wonderful and people are friendly. Plenty of places to eat.

Spectacular Views. The whole city sprawls out in front of you from castle hill. The beautiful blue Danube river serpents its way, separating Buda and Pest, and the Parliament building stands as an exclamation point. Great way to get a look at the city. Worth the time to go an see.

It's a wonderful view of the city. Take the little tram to the top to enjoy the beautiful views of the cities of Pest & Buda, and the sweeping Danube river. There are vistas and terraces along the cliffside, it's lovely up there! The entire district is wonderful, go wander the little cobblestone streets and peek into the shops, have a bite at one of the restaurants off-the-beaten path. If you time it just right, you can see the changing of the guards ceremony. We went several times, enjoying both the day-time views and the city lit up at night.

Great view to get Oriented to the city. This is a great site to see both sides of this city. A great place to grab pictures of the Danube and of the parliament building. Go up don't just stay at the river level.

Great Views Of The City. For views of Budapest, this is a great place to visit. There is quite a lot going on at Castle Hill, so you won't be bored. And while it's on a hill, the stairs are reasonably easy to ascend, and there are plenty of opportunities to stop to catch your breath.Once every 3 hours (6am, 9am, 12pm, 3pm, 6pm, etc) there is the changing of the guard at the white house - it's worth timing your visit so that you can see this.
a fairytale place. Very impressed with the castle hill in Budapest, weren't expecting much, but it was a great experience especially if the weather is sunny!

View from above. Breath taking views over the city. Castle hill has such a great history and a stroll is a must do. The Danube river is at your feet and you can have a good look at the market hall and parliament
Worth the climb. The best thing about this is the view over the city from all directions. Its a steep climb from The Gellert Hotel end but the rewar is superb. We didn't bother looking in the fort.

A great introduction to Budapest. We wee lucky with the weather , but this is a great first days sightseeing. Fabulous views of the city and great to look around. Combine another time with trip to Citadella to get different view / perspective of this wonderful city.
Beautiful view. Fun getting here on the funicular railway ( though it's v short) and the views over budapest were amazing! Well worth a visit
Great view and interesting history. Walked along the Danube, across the chain bridge and the. Took the funicular up. Views are amazing. Read up before going to make the visit more meaningful.

Really nice place to wander around. We got the funicular up and that was very good for the views and saving the legs! We were approach by a slightly touched and persistent 'tour guide' at the hill entrance of the funicular - but he did eventually move on to other victims. The Palace and surrounds are really nice; spend a morning or afternoon here.

Overlooking Danube and the city sights!. The approach to the hill is brilliant. I recommend taking the funicular although walking up the stairs has its own fun. The view of the city spread below across the river are truly breathtaking. Must visit during your trip to Budapest.

Nice Walk leads to rewarding view. Walk up from one side and down the other. Stop for coffee/tea/cake in the fort 1200 noon onwards. Stayed until 6pm twilight to walk down enjoying view over Danube and bridges

You must go. The view of the city is awesome. You can walk upstairs or go up by the funicular.
I enjoyed a lot visiting this place.
There is a museum at the top and there are many souvenirs shops.
Nice walk. Nice walk in the castle area. We did not visit the art museum because of lack of time, but for art lovers this might be well worth spending some time.

Its A Must Do. Our tour guide made a point of us getting to the Castle just before the changing of the guard which was excellent.
Recommended

One of the great vistas of Europe. We didn't go in any of the attractions on Castle Hill so can't comment on those. We spent a couple of hours just strolling around between St Mathias church and the castle on a lovely sunny Sunday morning. Enjoy, it's free. The views are as spectacular as everyone says, and that's enough reason to visit the area. There are plenty of kitsch craft stalls if you're into that kind of thing, and even I'm happy to stroll around them when the sun is out and I'm on holiday. The castle itself has been destroyed by war and rebuilt many times, so don't expect a medieval castle. What there is is a grandiose and beautiful building that easily rivals Versailles, the Alhambra and Windsor.

Only on a clear day. The main purpose for this walk is the awesome view, although on a poorer weather day there is always the restaurants, fisherman Bastion and the Cathedral. but the view from here is fantastic and a must see. The hop-on Hop- off bus goes to the top but beware of the schedule, the timing is determined by traffic not the written schedule. the views to the bridges,parliament, and beyond makes great photographic memories. there are often hawks flying overhead.
outstanding Views of the city. Go to Castle Hill don't forget to bring your telephoto lense you will never get photos like this again.
Best view.... ...of the city. It's a place where you must go. Budapest is a very beautiful city and River Danube is something unforgetable.
lovely. lovely area spent ages just mooching . They were busy filming something up there but never saw anyone famous!
Impressive. A must see visit also incorporating Fisherman's bastion. Wonderful views. Changing of the guard at 5pm was interesting but not up to UK standard as spectacle!

Gorgeous view. This area of town had the best view of Budapest! It's a great place to wander around and take photos and has a lot of atmosphere with tourists all around, photos with beautiful hawks and eagles, food and drink and of course random things like a bubble blower! A great place to visit for free and good views!

Very Interesting. On a three day trip and unfortunately the day we went up to the hill was the dreariest day of the trip. Saying that, only the weather was dreary , thoroughly enjoyed the walk around the whole area but can't help feeling the photo's would have looked so much better with the blue sky we had on the other days.

Beautiful View. My wife and I spent a couple hours touring Castle Hill as part of our river cruise stop and tour in Budapest. There were many sites to visit at Castle Hill and the views were stunning. Pictures really can't fully show the panarama that we had overlooking Budapest. It was a great visit.

Beautiful, if you have the weather for it. On our final day we had seen most of the sights we wanted to see and had some lovely weather - so we thought we would explore and walk up to the Citadel. Absolutely amazing views and really nice walk. Went down through the park on the read side too, which was lovely.Well worth a visit if the weather is nice and you want a nice walk with lovely views.
Castle hill. A very pleasant place to walk around with good views and some nice bars and restaurants to suit all pockets

Best place in Budapest!. The castle district is like being a world away! It's so lovely and there are gorgeous restaurants, cute shops and up in one of the bastions is a bar with stunning views as well as the wonderful Halaszbastia restaurant which I have reviewed separately. Definitely worth a visit for a few hours! I think there is wheelchair access via the Funicular but you will need to check with the Funicular for this.

A must see area. Castle hill with the old town, St. Mathias Church, the statue of King Steven 1 and the castle which houses the Hungarian National Art Gallery is probably the most important tourist area of Budapest and is certainly the place to spend a day of any visit to this fabulous city.

Walk up from the Gellert Baths side of the Hill. Excellent Views of the CIty, also if you walk up from the side of the Gellert Baths, you will come across a church that was created in a cave, it's worth a visit, even if your not religious. The history of the HIll from a military history point of view make sense once your on top of it, also there's several Hot Wine Vendors, a bonus for a freezing Feb morning

The views from the Hill are Spectacular!. Nice walk or funicular up the hill, restaurants, pretty area...but I prefer to stay on the Pest side across the river and come here for half a day since it's much quieter and less to do.
A Must Visit. If the sun is out, then this is the place to be, great views, restaurants and lots to see and do. Used the fenicular to go up and a steady stroll back down.
Fantastic views. Had a really good view out over Budapest so brilliant for pictures as is the Citadel. Really easy to get to if you use the Red sight seeing bus.

Perfect for a walk. Castle hill is nice and open for the perfect walk on a nice day. There are a lot of people around, but people will be people, and the hill is spacious enough so that the people are not that big of a deal. Takes a fair amount of time to really enjoy it, but it's worth it.

Castle area. Lovely area to visit. Nice shops and cafes. Easy to get to. Regular buses. Also can see rhe palace area with all the musuems. St Stephens church is definately worth a visit as inside is beautiful. Great scenes over Pest and the Danube from here as well.

Nice coffee shop come restaurant. It was raining so we popped into and had sanwiches and coffee but tea was more expensive ,if you want extra tea bag you have to pay for it ...so take your own teabag for that extra taste

Great place to wander around. this is a great are of Buda to wander around, with lots to see and lots of history in the place to read about. I recommend taking the walking tour of the area, as it was extremely interesting and informatiive

Lovely Views of the City. We came up here at night and it was totally worth the trek. We decided to walk up from the bottom which took us approximately 10 minutes although there is also a funicular that brings you to the top for 1700 HUF return. Once up there you have a great view of the city that looked that extra special when it is all lit up at night.

Beautiful historic area with a fantastic view. The view over Budapest alone would give this place the four star rating. But the buildings and the historic aura of the place is just amazing.The royal palace is an absolute must see and also the Fishermens Bastion is quite amazing.Furthermore, it can be recommended to explore the streets of the are a little for small cosy coffee-houses etc.Don't forget to use the funicular to get up there, instead of climbing the steps.

Stunning, stunning, stunning. We took the funicular up...Which seemed pricey but was an experience the children really enjoyed.
Once there, just WOW. An amazing part of the city with so much to see I highly recommend the trip there.

So much history and wonderful views across Danube. We spent several hours just walking the whole length - seeing the Castle Palace, Matyas fountain and History Museum at one end past Matyas Church and Fisherman's Bastion to St Mary Magdelen Church and Vienna Gate at the other end. Most interesting and time well spent.

wonderful views. It is worth taking the venicular lift to the top (or the stairs if you are really fit) to see the views of the city and the ruins from the 1945 siege. There is the gallery too but we did not do this so cannot commment we just enjoyed the outside scenery and walking around the area. There are public toilets at the top and in the gallery cafe which you need to pay to use.
nice place. very nice place, too bad the inside of the castle was raped to be made into a art museum. outisde very nice, inside ugly!

lots to see. Great way to get views over the city, places to visit include fisherman's bastion, Mathias church, palace and presidents house, couple of markets and a loverlky cake shop!funicular is worth trip leads to chain bridge.

Amazing!. We took the funicular up which was fairly cheap and quite quick too! Don't expect to see much though, once up you're in for a treat especially if it's night time! The views are amazing of Chain Bridge and Parliament building, a 5 minute walk will take you to Matthias castle.
Wonderful view over Budapest. A trip to Budapest would not be complete without a visit to the castle district. Not only is the area beautiful but the view over the city is breathtaking.

Quite a surprise.. We took the 16A bus from the Buda side of the city from the second last Metro stop on the red line, stop after the parliament. Within a short drive we were amazed with the structures and setting behind the walls. So we jumped off the bus and wandered all over the hill, Great views and a wonderful church at the top. This was a bit crowded compared to the rest of the hill. But lovely to see and be there. Good starting point if you want to visit the Hospital in the Rock, the Palace and much more.

Steady walk. amazing view from the top as well as a gorgeous church.. got up there whilst sunny, had a bite to eat on the top, then went down at night - the view is worth taking the walk up there. could also get a cable car.
Great views. We enjoyed walking all around Castle Hill and taking in all of the sights that the area has to offer. Very impressive.
Worth going to. We went up the vehicular railway to the top and were luck enough to see the changing if the guards when we were at he top. Well worth a visit.
Best view of the city!. Definately a place to visit whilst in Budapest. It was very cold when we went and it was a bit overcast but the views were fantastic!
Day trip via finicular railway. Lovely views of the Danube and City of pest.lovely monuments and gallery. Changing of the guard can be seen here.
Must go.. Good view over the city and gives you an idea of the Budapest's history . Make sure to use funicular to get there. Castle was basically (re)built after WW2.

great taste of history. since we were there for the first time we decided to take the funicular (which costs 1100huf for one way and 1700huf for two ways), it's nice but after we finished and went down we discovered how much of a short way it is to get up, we made it downhill in less than 10min and it was a little slippery from the icy ground otherwise it's 5mins tops!, but being up there is amazing, so many beautiful scenes, beautiful buildings and we caught the guard change at 10am which was cool. it is a place you have to visit for sure if you are in budapest!

Allow two or three trips here. We did two trips, and might have gone for a third. We printed a guided walking tour and followed the route. You can stop off at the toursit bureau and pick up one of thier maps, but we were glad to have done our research by looking on the internet and using two guide books.We wanted to visit the Spy Museum, but it was closed for a few months. We enjoyed two other museums.The views from up there are lovely, even on a cold grey day, there is plenty of atmosphere.First visit: we took the vernicular up. Actually - it isn't that much of a climb, and I would say that you could walk up one of the routes and enjoy it. My guideline is this: if you normally would not want to climb four flights, then take the vernicular up. It is higher than four flights, but that's just my guideline.Second visit: we walked up, and down.Note that the bus/tram/metro tickets don't work for the vernicular. You buy them separately from the cashier at the vernicular entrance. Round trip is cheaper than two one-way tickets.

Breathtaking view. You can go up with the funicular or with mini bus 16A from Batthyany ter metro station.The view is simply amazing!Budapest is a beautiful city and you should enjoy this part of the city. Do not miss the fisherman's bastion, the towers seem to be taken from a fairy tale! It's like waiting for Rapunzel to appear from one of the windows!Simply magical!

Wonderfull View. I really enjoyed the view especially at night! The lift up to the top is defiantly worth it! I would say one thing, over the right hand side of the hill there is some market stalls. Try not to be drawn in too the stalls.
well worth a visit. a lovely place to visit. take the tram if you dont want to walk. visit the old town while your there

If you go early in the morning you have it all to yourself!. We got up and out of the hotel early (7:30am), walked across the bridge, and took the funicular up to Castle Hill. We used Rick Steves self-guided walking tour and enjoyed learning about the sights and the history of the castle and the surrounding areas. We were the only tourists on Castle Hill for the first few hours, then around 10:30-11:00am swarms of tour buses and tour groups started to arrive...which was perfect because we were just finishing our sight-seeing up there. If you go early, you will be the only people on Castle Hill and can enjoy the magic of the place and be done just as all the other tourists arrive! Also, there are many nice coffee shops up there as well as public restrooms that you can use for a small fee.

Amazing views but some problems. Just wandering around is all you need. We chanced upon the changing of the guard at midday on a Sunday. Wander from here down Lord street and then back along the walls.

Go on... Walk!. We walked, it's a nice easy walk, it's lovely watching the views change as the path meanders around. You can get lovely photos. Lots of places to visit in the castle hill, or you can just walk round a take in the views!

must see. This was our favorite bit of Budapest. It was a bit of a hike to take the stairs, but later we took the bus and that was convenient as well. There are some nice little shops up here as well as historic buildings.
Wow, most interestng. Easy to get to, but be prepared to walk. don't even think about driving a rental car in this area. Many neat things to see and do. Well worth the time to explore.

Take a walk!. Castle hill and the whole area around fishermans bastion, the palace and the museums is, just like the bastion, a place u will visit when in budapest, everybody does it, bus budapest just isnt complete when u havent walkep up en down the cosy streetn seen the buildings and enjoyed the views, u wont be alone out there, nor the first tourist ever, but there are many reasons for that. Just walk and enjoy the vieuws over the donau and budapest

History, fresh air and perfect view in any weather. The old city of Buda is a must see in Budapest, view from many places and many tourist activities if you come on a normal time, but the prices are really high comparing to the city center (where you can find the same things). Highly recomended for any sort of visit!TIP: on Monday the museums are usually closed in Hungary.

Best part of Budapest . Going to Castle Hill for me was the best part of Budapst. If you like history and views then this is the place. I also at in castle hill some traditional food which was average but the whole experience was really enjoyable and would say its a must of Budapest!

what a view!. what a spectacular view! once we had reached the top we were taken back by the view of the city below us. we decided to walk to the top and my goodness it was a hard walk and a lot of steps, but rewarding and amazing none the less. once you reach the top you feel rewarded by the breath taking views and scenery. wonderful

such history. The old city is steeped in history and walking through the streets you are transported back a few centuries. The Palace now includes the national Art Museum of Hungarian artists which is well worth a visit.

Brilliant . Castle hill is a must see when visiting Budapest, the castle us in as fantastic location a stones throw away from parliament. Would recommend to visit the Buda part if the city a day can be made of it as there is an abundance of restaurants and chic cafes to dine in!
Good view. You can use the funicolar to go up, or if the weather is not too hot it is dell worth to climb up. The view over to Danube and to the old city is very nice.
Amazing sunset. One of my favourite spots in Budapest. better go on foot and have a walk during the sunset - night so you can appreciate the ski colours and the city and bridges lights.

It is the views you go for. Like many places in Budapest, you get nice views of the Danube and Parliament from here. However, I prefer Fisherman's Bastion to this area. It is a nice area to walk around and get pictures if it is a warm and clear day. In the winter, it gets very foggy and just too cold to be outside for long.
What you'd thought it should be. Great area of hotels, restaurants, attractions, shopping. Freindly people. Easy to walk it. With amazing view of the Pest side.

Best views of the city. This would be a great place to spending many hours wandering, but it was such a cold, bleak day and the winds from the artic. Expensive taxi ride from St Stephens Bascillica, and then down to our hotel.After a quick walk round, and taking some great photo's we went into the only restaurant to get warm. I am sure this is a better place in the summer months.
castle. beautiful area with lots of interesting history . Fantastic views from the ramparts over all of Budapest.

The Views Are The Star. The entire castle hill area is quite a pleasant place to spend a day, but the views on the river side are simply spectacular. They are some of the best city views you will see.My girlfriend and I were fortunate to be in Budapest during the International Wine Festival (Early-Mid September), and there is simply no better value to be had than the HUF 2,800 to have some wine in the evening looking out across the lights of the city.

Amazing view.. We spent about 30-40 minutes only taking photos of Budapest from the hill. The view is really amazing.You can get to the top by funicular, but it will cost around 4 Euro for a minute of ride. It is better to go there by foot.

Great view of Budapest & Danube. There is a great view of Pest (Budapest) from the Hill, especially at sunset. There are also many historic houses, many cafeterias, and a very nice historic church up on the hill, as well as the museum. You can go up by the funicular line, there is no need to buy round ticket, just buy one way so you can easily walk down the hill.

A definitive must. You will not go wrong by taking a half-a-day to a day's walk at the Castle district. Take the old funicular up and than walk down at the right side of the hill. Start at the castle (= a museum and a gallery) , see the President's residence and walk through the pedestrian streets of the district to get the feeling of it. Do not miss the Mathiass church, the Fisherman's Bastion, the War museum, City gates and the ruined churc of Mary Magdalene.

A great way to view the city. We took the funicular up to Castle Hill and walked the grounds from there. I did not get a chance to see it at night, as the rain and the rising water prevented us from doing more. I will go back.

Nothing special. It is ok although we were expecting more things to see from there
It is a place you can visit but do not expect great things to see

Some unsympathetic changes. The castle hill site in Budapest is a main focal point for the city and contains and enormous Palace/Castle complex. There is really on the basement of the old castle remaining but a trip through this is well worth it. The rest of the complex is a large castle which on the outside is very impressive but has changed from its original form and its current incarnation appears to be more from the late 19th century. There are two excellent msueums - one a museum of Hungarian Art which offers an impressive collection but unfortunately the building has been gutted (perhaps from the war) and the interiors are actually fairly ugly. The other musem interiors are more intact and this is a history of Budapest Museum and the artifacts are splendid and the interiors more original. It is also located near the old town and can be accessed either by walking up the hill, bus or by a funicular or small train that takes you right up the hill to the castle entrance.

Beautiful area. Castle hill on the Buda side of Budapest is a beautiful area. My husband and I went on our own here on the hop on hop off bus. Be aware that the last bus leaves at 5:00 p.m. There was so much to see here that we went back the following day and this time, we went there earlier. There are narrow winding streets lined with medieval buildings that are now souvenir shops. On our second visit, my husband and I were going to see the interior of the castle but on the castle grounds, they had a wine tasting festival. We bought tickets for this and were pleasantly surprised at how delicious Hungarian red wines are. Their cabernets were full bodied with very smooth tannins. We could not finish all the booths as we were beginning to feel our wine. We wanted to buy a case of some of their wines but none of the wineries exported their red wines. The few that did export to the States only exported sweet white wines. So, we just bought 4 bottles and carried those in our luggage for the rest of the trip They also had some food stalls here and they sold Hungarian food. One was like a pizza only done Hungarian style. It was delicious. I would recommend spending 1 full day here or 2 full days depending on how much exploration you want to do.

Another Budapest Highlight. The whole Castle Hills area is a must see. We took the funicular up the first time...nice but expensive. The second time we took a walking tour with Absolute Walking Tours (free with the Budapest Card) and our guide, Brigit, was great. You'll see a few things you wouldn't have found without a guide. This area includes the new palace, the ruins of the old castle, Fisherman's Bastion, Mathias Basillica, some upscale shopping, lovely homes, and a couple of good restaurants.Getting there is UPHILL, but not too bad.

A worthy walk. We always tend to walk up whatever happens to be steep near by... It's hard not to with its imposing view over the city. Take at least half a day to wander up on a clear day and get some if the best views of the city.

Beautiful walks, romantic views!. Walking through the gardens and the patios of the Castle, travels you back in time! Beautiful gardens and really great views to both sides of Budapest (both Buda and Pest sides)!We also found an activity in one of the gardens, where you could take 5 shots with a weapon of your choice (bow, crossbow, spear)! Really unique!

Great views. It is a must to view Budapest. The best time is after dark, for a great view of the city lights. As the paving works around the Parliament are still in full bore, it is really the best place to see the building.

Beautiful area of Budapest. We took the Funicular up to the Castle Hill district and the bus back down. The views are amazing. We watched dignitaries, clothed in fur and dripping with gold, go into the President's palace, with all their bodyguards complete with walkie talkies, for a New Year's cocktail party - how the other half live! The whole area seemed magical in the icy mists. There was a stall near the Palace selling beautiful photographs and books of Budapest - all taken by the stall holder's photographer husband. We stopped for mulled wine and goulash soup in one of the little restaurants on the Hill. A truly beautiful memory.

Stunning at night. We went there at night, walking up the hill to reach the castle.The castle as stunning, with the lights shining on it. And you can get a great view of the lighted up Parliament and of the famous Budapest river area from the castle grounds.We didn't think to go back again during the day to visit the attraction. For me and my partner, the walk up at night and taking the sights of the buildings and surroundings were splendid enough.
The best views. The best views of the city in a lovely setting especially at night. Don't go to budapest without a vist to the fishermans bastion.

THE MOST BEAUTIFULL HILL I'VE SEEN. take a walk, coffee-cake, walk through and you will realize you neeed an hour at least to take pictures of all, experience all etc..it cannot be descibed it can just be seen.

Worth seeing in the day and also the night. To see this properly, you need to visit both in the day and in the night as the views change. While most people will go to the Castle, it is well worth walking the walls, visiting the Lutheran Church and exploring the streets and their beautiful buildings. All in all, in my recent stay, I walked about the Castle Hill three or four times, every time seeing something new.

Great view! :). This is a must visit in Budapest so you can see the view of the city below, most importantly the Parliament. As the Parliament is under construction, this view is the best you'll get and it's a pretty impressive building!As for the castle itself and the church, I didn't get inside to see them but it's a beautiful area with lots of options for eating and drinking and getting there is pretty easy via funicular, bus or just walking which is what I opted to do! My suggestion would be that, this time of year (winter), you venture up around 3pm so you have the daylight view but then also have a night view of the city below after 4pm...I regretted not being up here to see any of the night views!

Budapest Highlight. This area is the highlight for the city for me. The crowds are big but the architecture and the history, with the amazing views across the river make it worthwhile. I spent countless hours seeing all I could and then enjoyed the walk back down. There are plenty of options for food and drink there to so allocating a day here is easily done.

Lots to See and Do. We took the Funicular up. The view at the top was amazing. The whole City unfolds before you. Lots of shops and street performers. We visited on a Sunday when they had a great food market. There is a little bar on the large turret that some call the "Disney Castle". If the weather is nice, it is a great place to have a drink and overlook the City.
Great view. Amazing view from here. If you walk to the village there's a few small shops. You really only want to go up here for the view.
very nice view. the castle hill is one of the great and famose attraction in budapest . you can spend the all day by walking and rest in lovely cafe with great cake

Not what you think. Castle hill has some nice views of the city, but for the most part it just shops and a couple museums. St. Stephen's Basilica is the only real site worth seeing in the castle hill district.
Fun funicular ride and worth it. Great view of Budapest once you are on the hill.It was freezing when we went but the view and Fisherman's Bastion was well worth it.

A fantastic view. We visited in September during the wine festivals by coincidence, and it was fantastic. Great view at sun down, and Hungarian gypsy music in the back ground completed the atmosphere.

If you can walk, go up on foot. We joined one of those local guided tours where there's no fixed price but you donate at the end of the tour. The local guide was very knowledgeable. We walked the hill on foot and saw and listen to the history. Another fascinating sights to enjoy in Budapest.
nice place to have a walk through.. very nice place to have a walk through and view budapest from the top. nice coffee shops with an amazing view.

A Must !. We went up the steep hill via the funicular which was quite dramatic.If you are in the car closest to the bottom you can look back and see thecity vanishing behind you....a powerful experience. We took the bus back down to Pest after touring. The area at the top includes, among other sites, a gracious museum of Hungarian art, and the cathedral (an amazing riot of colorful designs in the interior) as well as shops for gifts. Our friend, who bought colorful blouses for her grand daughters, did find them for less money in town. It might be worth it to bargain. The views in all directions are wonderful, and we felt the three or so hours we spent up there well worth our time.
Afternoon Adventure. Very good use of time and also close to the art exhibit!It was a chilly afternoon and fortunately we found some hot wine near by.
Amazing panoramic views. Superb buildings, magnificent views and efficient transport - not sure if funicular is worth the wait. Very crowded after 10.
Nice place. Was a nice place to visit but there is a lot of things you can do there. We love the view of the Danube river
stunning. the views were stunning the church was beautiful and the walk was enjoyable so much to see we ran out of time - cant wait to go back!

Stunning. A beautiful must-visit part of Budapest located on the Buda side of the river Danube.Its about 1.5 km walk from bottom to top but well worth it. Stroll up the little cobbled streets enjoying little shops, markets, & maybe stop for mulled wine or palinka. Walk past the old Castle cut into the rock & arrive at Fisherman's Bastion & St Mattheus Church. Spend a while looking over to Pest & enjoy the amazing views. You can go in the Church which has been restored many times & has hosted Royal weddings & Coronations. An atmospheric gorgeous place to visit day or night.

Amazing view over Budapest. Amazing view over Budapest ... don't miss walking and taking the stares and enjoy the artistic statutes of the philosophers-garden , the cave, the statute of Buda and pest history

Buda Palace etc. Easy to access from Chain Bridge and then the Siklo, great views of the river and Pest side of Budapest from the top. You can easily spend all day at Varhegy walking around all it has to offer; castle, labyrinth, cafes, St. Mathias church, Fishermans Bastion, Hospital in the Rock (although this was approx £11 entrance fee - tours on the hour)
Great views from here. Well worth a trip up here if only for the view! There is plenty to fill a day here including great restaurants and market stalls (maybe only in December)

Changing of the guards was a great thing to see. We went luckily during the changing of the guards at the palace and it was quite a show they put on. The views from the palace are great across to past and all for free

A scenic walk through history. There is so much to see here. Just start at Buda Castle and walk your way through to Fisherman's Bastion. It's a beautiful walk with many interesting places to see along the way. There's Sándor Palace, the National Dance Theater, Mathias Church, as well as many other interesting buildings of historical significance. A building that was once the Ministry of War is now an empty shell, but still shows the bullet holes from WWII. There's even a nice park where you can sit, relax, and soak in the scenery around you. You'll be rewarded at the end when you get to the Holy Trinity Square. The amazing & beautiful Matthias Church coupled with the stunning views of the Danube from the terrace of Fisherman's Bastion make it all worth the effort. It's totally worth it.

Great even in a windy winter!. Liked: Overwhelming view over Danube, fairytale atmosphere! The best pictures of Parliament and Pest must be taken here. Walk around - amazing restaurants and cafes with a good service. It takes around 10-15 min from Vaci ut. to get there, so the Hill is good even for a short stay in Budapest.Disliked: I tried to remember some wake sides, but it hasn't.

Fantastic view. Take the small trolly or walk as we did as you can stop along the way and enjoy the fantastic views. Beautiful church at the top with a small entrance fee. Make sure you visit the museum inside the church which can easily be missed but well worth taking the time to do so. Beautiful church.

A must do!. My husband and I did this walking tour as we do everywhere we travel and it was great. Its about 3 hours and see both buda and pest side with a knowledgeable guide that speaks English. At the en d they give you all types of tips and know-hows about the city! It is free and strictly off tips!
Belle vue. We didn't get in the castle cause it's now a museum but you can still walk around. And the church is nice on the outside but too many people to get in (groups of tourists)
Nice view. Citadell, green, castle district is awesome! National Gallery is up there as well! nice walk down, but to go up, take the funicular

The oldest part of Budapest. The Castle-area is the oldest part of Budapest, where you smell history... Museums, cafes and restaurants, the first international branded hotel with scenic view - all of them you can find there. You can spend even days there just walking and entering the inner yards of historical buildings.

A wonderful area to explore at your leisure. I loved the heritage feeling of the area & couldn't get enough of the gorgeous buildings! The nighttime view of the Pest side do the city is worth waiting for.

You can not miss it! Romantic, interesting just lovely!. I love everything about the whole area Castle Hill and Castle District Buda, it`s the perfect place if you want to relax a bit, there are some nice parks where you always find a lonely bank to sit on, the view is awesome and cozy little coffees worth a visit! Avoid the restaurants they are just too expensive and offering typical hungarian dishes but most of the time they are not that tasty and the price for it just too much..

Well, it's a hill.... If you haven't visited any other historical cities in Europe, you will enjoy this. And the views over Pest and the Danube are spectacular. If, on the other hand, you have already walked down the hill from the palace in Prague, or in the old town of Tallinn, or in the Gamla Stan of my home town Stockholm, you might find other parts of Budapest more interesting. It's sort of touristy and still a bit "dead" this hill...

but there's no "castle". Don't expect a castle to tour, it is a museum of old Hugarian paintings, the building was ruined by the Nazis and rebuilt by the Communists. Instead go to the St. Mattias cathedral, which is gorgeous inside, and see Budapest from the Fisherman's bastion. Eat pastries at Rozwurm nearby.
Nice romantic, historic walk!. Great place for a walk with your loved one(s). Nice restaurants, too! Lots of road works ongoing when we were there (late October '13).

Very Beautiful. Amazing , clean , beautiful area with beautiful buildings. Beautiful view all around. Pricier than Pest side. I did not like the fact that cheeky waiters putting 15 to 20 % service charge on every bill.

This world heritage site is an absolute must if you are in Budapest!. Over the Chain bridge and up the funicular- it was very easy to come to this beautiful place!There was much to see: The national gallery (with a wonderful Chagall exhibition) the stunning Matthias church and the absolutely breath-taking view over Budapest from the Fisherman´s bastion. This is a place we had not heard so much about before we went to Budapest, but it was certainly one of the top experiences.
Castle Hill - Budapest. Castle Hill is a beautiful location to take in the amazing views of the city. It's a lovely and pleasant place to walk and has endless photo opportunities!

AN ABSOLUTE MUST!. The area - which can be reached from the Chain Bridge either by bus, on foot or (as I opted for) the funicular railway - is delightful. The views of the Pest side of the river are stunning (even on a cloudy day) - especially from the Fisherman's Bastion. Matthias Church is well-worth a visit if only for the beautiful stained glass windows (1000 HUF admission fee). There are also plenty of bars and restaurants in the picturesque streets.It is worth having a coffee in the Hilton café which overlooks the inside of the ruined chapel (around which the hotel was built) - with the Parliament building as a backdrop. If you walk to the back of the Hilton, you can also go inside the chapel remains.In short, allow at least half a day - longer if you want to visit two or more of the museums in the area.

Amazing view of the city. If you don't want to walk/climb all the way up to the citadella, at least you should go to castle hill. Take the funicular at the bottom of the hill for 1000HUF (£3) and enjoy the view of the city opening itself in front of you. By coincidence, we arrived at the top just before 12.00, and I'm not sure if it is every hour or not but at 12.00 there is the change of the guards. walk your way around/in the castle and museum and then walk toward fishermen's bastion.The castle is still under construction from its near destruction after WWII and the communist era. people there are making an incredible job in order to restore it the splendour it once had.

A treasure of the world. Just amazing!. Budapest is a wonderful city from many aspects and Varhegy (Castle Hill) is right in the center of it. Great views of Pest, the Danube and Buda with some beautiful historic sites like the King's Palace, the Fishermen Bastion and the cave hospital. Lots of small cafes and restaurants to eat and drink. You can get there by a a bus or can walk.

Interesting. There is lots to see on Castle Hill. The palaces, quaint streets and cafes will all keep you occupied. If you have time I suggest you will need at least four hours to be get value from your time there. Take the funicular to the top as this is the most interesting way of accessing the hill and visit the bar in one of the towers on the Fishermans Bastion.

Great view. To see the best of Budapest its worth the climb up the hill, or ride on the Funicular Railway. On a clear day the view is superb, looking out over the Danube to the rest of the city and beyond.

Must visit!. A Must visit on the Buda side of the river as all the history of the place stems from here. The church and monuments and castles etc are all worth a look. And the views from the top on both sides are spectacular.

be sure to wander around Castle Hill.. Plan on spending half a day, at least, wandering the entire hill, not just the Castle and its museums, Fisherman's Bastion and Mathias Church. There currently is an outstanding Chagall exhibit at the castle. Arrive early, the funicular starts running at 9.

Perfect location to visit Budapest. We stayed at the Castle Garden hotel in the Castle District, and glad we did. The Castle District of old Buda is incredibly picturesque and walkable. From the amazing Fisherman's Bastion to the Buda Castle, to the shops and restaurants, this is a must-see on your visit to Budapest.

Great to Wander... all around these hills and to enjoy the spectacular views from here. Many quaint streets and walkways lead to nice parkland. Fisherman's Bastion and the grounds of St. Matthias provide great photo ops. Some nice eateries here, as well. Take the funicular or tram as it's can be a bit steep.

Beautiful views. It's a long walk uphill to get to Castle Hill but it's well worth it. The views overlooking Budapest are spectacular. You can walk all around the grounds around the castle and take pictures. There are a lot of picture opportunities up there. There is also a restaurant overlooking the city as well as a couple of other food vendors if you don't want to spend the money in the restaurant (fairly expensive in there). There's also a gift shop where you can stock up on souvenirs.

The main attraction in Budapest but will get bored after 4 hours. Castle hill sounds like te main attraction to Budapest and it is rightly so. However, do note that most of the buildings are reconstructed buildings especially the palace, presidential office as well as te castle. The only authentic part of the area is the church of st mathias which has some very nice frescos and a pretty interior worth visiting. That is probably the only paid attraction I would spend and find it worthwhile. Te other attractions are way too inauthentic and not worth the admission fees as there are much better museums outside of Budapest that are a few hours away by train. Enjoy the stroll through the castle hill and visit St Mathias- after tat, the castle hill area is dead at night. Stay in the pest area.
Don't miss this. Nothin original to say. Everyone has clearly shared all the finer points for this one! The view is simply fantastic and even better at night all lit up

beautiful view. we walked up to the top rather than being ripped off by a taxi company.....we were on a river boat cruise so the boat was docked fairly close......leave lots of time to wander and enjoy a cafe at the top of the hill....

Beautiful place and great view. The castles and other buildings have been reconstructed since they were destroyed in 1945. They have done a lovely job and it worth going to Buda and up the hill to see them. Allow plenty of time so you do not feel rushed.

a visit in a different time. perserved in its old structure, visiting the castel hill gives the feeling you live in a different time.
The old buildings, everything is excelent. The view on the city is also great from the hill.

Great views. Good for museums. Had some great views from here overlooking the danube and pest. Lovely cobbled streets with range of cafes and bars. Didnt fancy the museums or the palace but plenty here if thats your thing.

Gorgeous views. Definitely worth the walk up, or the funiculaire but honestly the walk is not strenuous at all!
Walk from the castle to the Bastion or the other way around and really take in the stunning views it offers
The best part of the city. You must visit it. For me it's the best part of Budapest. Great views. Try to visit it by funicular, it's the best way to go up.

Another great attraction, will be better when the repaving is finished. Currently marred by extensive repaving taking place in the streets close to the castle, the views, galleries, museums and shops mean that you could spend more than a day here. As with the rest of the city, there are food and drink vendors catering for every price and taste. One of the highlights of this great city, and access via the funicular highly recommended.

Go here!. The view is obviously fantastic, you can see superbly Pest and you can also take some really professional photos with the buildings here. During the night, the view is even more spectacular. Probably it is the best attraction of Budapest.
splendid. We thought it was picturesque, filled great views, and very photo worthy. It was very crowed. This is a not to be missed sight.

SIMPLY GRAND!. We did this over a decade ago and still the grandeur of this impressive series of structures on top of Buda's hills managed to lure us back. This is clean, inviting, and not overly "cutesy"... it feels much like a cleaned up version of what it was back in the day. We went back the next morning to finish the section we had missed on our shortened first afternoon. DO go ... and take your camera for the views!

Go at Night. You wouldn't, couldn't go to Budapest and not check out Castle Hill. We arrived in town in the early evening and headed up to the castle as it was getting dark. We rode up on the funicular, which was a great way to see the river and the city. It's cheap and right at the base of the hill. Once we got to the top we were treated to great views and broad, clean squares and streets. This area of town is scrubbed clean and so pretty and well-preserved. Lots of great restaurants in the area and on an October evening, not a lot of crowds. After dinner we wandered around some more, checking out the huge church and the Fisherman's Bastion and just gazing out across the Danube at the buildings lit up and sparkling below. So glad we didn't wait till daylight to treat ourselves to this sight.

Best of Buda. The Castle Hill was very close to our hotel. I love this place, its historic with beautiful buildings and wonderful tiny streets. The view is also wonderful from here. Perfect place to have a wedding :-)

Perfect Photo Opportunity. We caught the Hop on Hop Off bus here tho there's public buses to the top.What a view! As many others have said, this is the perfect photo opportunity for Budapest and the Danube.We visited the National Art Gallery which was very interesting. We took advantage to see a Monet and Chagall exhibition showing.The buildings on Castle Hill are beautiful and well maintained which is pleasing as so many in Budapest aren't.We strolled the cobbled stones streets, had lunch, and then enjoyed more views on the other side of the hill from Fisherman's Bastion, and St Mathia's There's lots of open spaces for the kids to run off some energy before entering the Gallery or other buildings.Depending on your interests, you could spend an hour here, or the whole day.

Historic buildings and panorama - nice combination. if you are in Budapest and think about missing something, it should not be considered! absolutely a must!you can come up by walk, taxi, public transport (less good), but the best probably is the funicular train.then you can walk around visiting the Palace, Halászbástya, National Gallery, Church... you can also have a wide choice of restaurants (also some really good - but expensive).finally just walk around, see Budapest from a hill distance. especially fancy by Night! safety is not an issue, so do not worry... just enjoy!
must visit. its a very nice place with wonderful views. there are many restaurants inside and also a small cafe where you can have a drink and watch the whole city.
Fantastic views. Lovely architecture, though did not go inside the buildings since most were closed. The best part of this area is the panoramic views over the river and into Pest.

Worthy experience. Historical lifting vehicle take you up to the top- view from here is spectacular. Location too is quite locatable. We reached there on a hop on hop off bus which was convenient. There are many things to watch out for including different shops, historic ruins, castles, museums et al. A walk at the top is definitely recommended. On the way to Matthias Church, there is a lovely pastry shop which serves some nice creamy pastries. Truly enjoyed the evening.

The castle on the hill. The castle area was beautiful and the surrounding views were incredible! Budapest lays at your feet. The architecture really fascinated me. Don't pay for stunning photo ops. Just walk down the bastion area and you get almost the same opportunites with no fee.

Great View of the Danube. From the top of the castle hill, you have a beautiful view of the Danube and the Pest part of the city, including the parliament, the chain bridge, and St. Stevens. The Hungarian "white house" is also accessible and interesting. You can climb stairs to the top of the hill, as we did, but there is a bus that makes the trip from Pest.
worth the visit. Well worth the time to visit this area which we found most interesting The green areas are so relaxing to find and a pleasure to visit

Lots to See. The Castle area is being rebuilt after the war, but there are heaps to see, great museums etc. The funicular was packed and had to queue so we walked over from the Fishermans Bastion, walked around the castle area and then walked down the hill back to the hop - on - hop off bus. easy walk down and not crowed.

Wonderful Views. We had crystal clear blue skies the day we visited. So beautiful and historic! Wish we had time to visit the gallery at the castle. The changing of the guards was great. Loved walking by the ruins being excavated.
Palace Area. Historic, Scenic and fantastic views. Take the No.6 Bus from the Deac Ferenc Tere Square. A free Walking tour is available with a Buda Card and leaves from the statue in the square.

Good day out. Walked over from Pest over the Chain Bridge. Used the funicular up. Small queue but would imagine would be horrendous in summer but lots of buses or walkable if fit!A walk round the ramparts is excellent followed by the obligatory church which was fantastic and town walk returned by walking down and returning over the Elizabeth bridge altogether good excercise to walk of the massive meals they think you need! Views superlative
Very interesting!. As to take a leap in to the past: historic buildings, a magic fountain, unchanged atmosfere of old time, fantatic views.

Great View and history. Budapest is a city with plenty of history itself, and the castle hill has some nice ones about the old city. There you will have gorgeous views of the city and when you arrive at the top of it, the castle itself and the buildings sourrounding it gives you the idea of being in a middle age town centre.. You also might wanna check the Grute Church, which was built inside the rocks in a perfect mix.
One of the sites. Great view of the city. Went at 10am and walked up after catching the local bus to the final stop just before the hill.
Unique among giants. Nothing like this place anywhere else in the world. The architecture rivals that of Barcelona and the view down to the river and the Parliament building are unrivaled.

Castle Hill (Varhegy). We walked up across the Chain Bridge and spent 3 hrs on the hill the Mattias Church was beautiful and the views of the city amazing.We were lucky to catch site of the Changing of the Guard which was impressive !
Great views!. Nice area to walk around and get awesome views of the Danube bank, liked the views, we had great weather too. Try the kurtoskalacs if you are there! Hungarian style doughnut.

Great walk and great views. Great walk up to the top with lovely views looking across Budapest at many points. Good spot for taking pictures. There is a little stall at the top if you want a drink or icecream for a bit more money than you would pay at the bottom but well deserved after the walk up.

Go if there is a festival. There are 3 main festivals held at castle hill and if they coincide with your trip you must go. The castle is usually a nice walk by day but the festivals are held at night and the atmosphere and view are wonderful. I went with my kids to the wine festival in September and they enjoyed running around and we enjoyed eating at the food stalls too. All in all the entrance is not too high and you can buy any glass of wine at a max of 2 euros. My husband has gone to the beer and palinka festivals and enjoyed those too.

Great view, take your time. This was a wonderful walk, but there is no need to rush!At the top there are places to eat and of course, the cheesy tourist carts ready to sell you things made in other countries. Make sure you get some photos- you'll have the best view of Budapest from this look out spot!The church in the rock (Not sure if that's the correct name) is at the bottom and there is a famous bath house across the street- although I read online that it's an older crowd there. I'm 32... so we're talking 50's and 60's. My friend and I stopped by another bath called Szechenyi baths and it was a crowd closer to our 30's and 40's ages.

Great venue. Castle Hill overlooks the Danube, on the Buda side across from the main part of the city on the Pest side. The Palace, Fisherman's Bastion, and a nice little "village" are situated on the top of the Hill. A great place to spend several hours.

Impressive view from here. It is certainly a nice walk up the hill from the Chain Bridge to the hill. Lots of interesting architecture to see here.The souvenir stalls up here are a bit cheaper than the one in the city centre.A must see in Buda!
Nice walk up to stunning views. As tempting as the venicular is. Take a nice slow walk up to the top. Many great photo opportunities on the way and not too strenuous a walk.

Interesting Neighbourhood - not amazing. Worth a prowl around the area but don't get you hopes up. It links up nicely with the Fishermen's' Bastion area. Dont forget that the whole area was badly damaged by the 1945 German Army vs the Red Army 'liberation' after which Hungary fell under the Communist Yoke for 50 yrs or so..As a consequence both Helen Mirren and Debbie Harry are younger, more attractive and better preserved.Good views.
