worth the trip. Great views, beautiful buildings, a few shops ,a trip on the Funicular railway, sunshine and a lovely Kafehaz next to the bus stop made for a leisurely afternoon
Beautiful View. Castle Hill is spectacular ..The most amazing view of Pest .. Had such fun walking across the Chain Bridge and then taking the funicular up.. A must do in Budapest ..

A terrific place to visit. You can walk up or take the funicular, but however you arrive, this high up Buda view and complex offers a great variety of things to see and do, from museums to churches to great vistas and lovely cobblestone streets.
Wonderful panoramic view. Must seen place, great architecture and beautiful panoramic view.. and night seeing at night is a must!
Gorgeous views. Beautiful church and center! Cute coffee shops in the area and great views for picture taking! Def a must see
Best of views from here. Take the bus up to here( hop on, hop off) and just linger. The scenery is amazing, the city is laid out for you like a tapestry. In May, the area was jumping! Loved it.
Beautiful views. Nice view looking from Buda to pest. Enjoyed wandering through little streets. Interesting shops . Nice relaxing way to spend a day.
Beautiful architecture. The building are a recreation, and beautifully done. It's worth walking around the grounds if you're heading to the Sechezny Baths or Heroes Square.
Beautiful view. Walk around old castle buildings and enjoy the beautiful view over the city. A visit here should also include a stop at the Mathias church.

On a clear day....... Stunning views from both Castle Hill/Fisherman's Bastion and Gellert Hill across the city and the Danube and it's bridges. We visited in early October on a gloriously sunny day and could see everything laid out before us in glittering splendor with views to the far off hills and the Danube disappearing into the Horizon. Equally spectacular in the evening with the city all lit up beneath.Obviously in different weather, the view may be different but probably equally atmospheric from pictures we saw of the view in fog/snow etc!

Delightful. On the Buda side of Budapest this lovely, but very busy tourist site is well worth a visit. We waited for about 15 minutes in a queue for the funicular and the short ride to the top gave us some great views over the city. The day we went there was a brass band playing, a man with an eagle to have your photos taken with. We visited the lovely St. Matthias church and the Fisherman's Bastion, wandered around the cobbled streets, had excellent coffee and cake before strolling over to Buda Castle where the annual Palinka and Sausage Festival was being held. Palinka is Hungarian Schnapps, and the sausages were fab!

worth the punt!. although it looks like a long hike, get the metro to the old district, get off at the terminus and walk up from the rear, the views are amazing and you'll deserve a hot chocolate or naughty tipple when you get down the front side to the river

Beautiful!. The Castle Hill is an interesting place to visit and take photos, especially when it's sunny. The hill offers excellent views over the Danube and the Pest side of the city. You can visit the hill for free, but you can also spend some money on cute souvenirs if you want to (the prices are not so high).

The Best View of Budapest. We rode a motor coach up the hill but then had to hike an additional 1/4 mile to the foot of the freedom statue (worth the hike just for the statue) for phenomenal views of Buda & Pest.You can see St Stephan's, the Parliament, the Palace, the Danube - you name it!We visited on a sunny bright afternoon - perfect time to visit, nearly everything is lit by the afternoon sun. (Photographing the statue is a little tricky, but you can't have everything!)Definitely worth hiring a cab or riding the Hop On - Hop Off bus up.

Top of the world!. Castle Hill on the Buda side of Budapest is a spectacular experience. It overlooks the entire city, with panoramic views, iconic structures (the Castle, St;. Matthias Cathedral, Fishermen's Bastion) and quiet lanes and lovely restaurants and small shops to explore. If you are not with a tour group, go to the funicular at the bottom of the hill next to the Chain Bridge, and take the ride to the top, running every ten minutes. You will need at least two hours to explore thoroughly,

Loved it.. This is a must do. I was lucky to have a warm, sunny October day.Beautiful views and lots of places to visit. Went up on fenicular railway and caught bus back. This is a bonus compared with getting up Gellert Hill.See the Castle and National gallery plus much more.
Great. It is great to go all the way up and very romantic if you get a cabin only for tão people. Amazing views and cheap price. Totally worth it

Much to see and do on the Hill. During the day, the crowds are unbelievable along the overlook down to the Danube (the Fisherman's Bastion), but it is worth fighting through to get your own picture of the Parliament below. It's even better to do this visit at night, when the crowds thin out and the lights along the River below are so overwhelming. There are lovely small and large museums, great boutique hotels (see my review of Buda Fashion Hotel, for one), and nice restaurants, and the meandering streets are just fun to explore. Do walk through the Hilton Hotel to see how they have preserved the remains of the monastery when the built this hotel--very interesting.

Great views and atmosphere. The funicular is a bit expensive, so take it up and then walk back down the hill. There are lots of museums, shops, and places to eat. It's a nice area to wander around in and enjoy the surprises around each corner.

Lovely, but construction is everywhere. We are staying here in the castle district, and it really is very pretty. However, a lot of the charm is lost in the fact that there is major construction practically everywhere. This is the case throughout Budapest, but is most evident in the castle area. Do come and visit, as there is so much worth seeing, but don't expect quiet charm. You won't get it.

Spectactular Views across the city below. I've taken the funicular (cross from the chain bridge on the pest side), taken the bus (via fishermans bastion), and once, walked from the Gellert pushing a double pushchair. Once at the top, this is truly spectacular. Undergoing some reconstruction at the bottom, which will be fantastic when completed. This is a must do. The whole area is notably older, has some great shops down side streets, well worth a visit, book shops, cafes, art shops and more. The streets were undergoing renovation (summer 2013), but there is no restriction on access, and so many things to do, it's a must visit on a stay of 3 days in my opinion
A fairy tale castle.. Brilliant, and particularly liked the amazing views as you're so high up. Some very nice restaurants there too in the surrounding roads.
First class touristic attraction.. Reflects the grandeuse of the hungarian empire. Will be come The main attraction in europe in a year's time when restoration is complete
Panoramic Budapest.. We have used the funicular to reach the castle district.the view is breathtaking.the musicians playing at the restaurant near the church added to the atmosphere.

Very special view. Getting uphill by historical lifting vehical was fun. But the impression from walking along the both sides of Castle Hill district was not just fun - it was kind of majic. It is really a sort of special atmosphere there. As if you are walking on some higher meta level than both sides of the city below - old Pest and new blocks (exellent views). And of course the Castle and the Temple are fairytale as well. Really romantic!

Perfect place for making photos. It is a really beautiful and interesting place, you should be able to devote to it several hours as it worth long and slowly walk. There are also a lot of buildings, statues and views which you'd like to photo.

Great views. It is well worth making the effort to go to the top of Castle Hill. The views over The Danube , Parliament and the city are really good. There are a number of building to view on the hill and a great little community to walk around.

Views. The views of Budapest are excellent from this point .We visited this area on one of the many hop on hop off buses, so you can stay as long as you want. There are some souvineer stalls on the outside path. There is a lovely cafe/restaurant just outside the castle where you can gaze at the beautiful view after a refreshing lunch/coffee or your favourite tipple ? .

Perfect sightseeing spot. From the Pest banks, it's the most striking attraction you can see up in the Buda hills, and it's well worth the seemingly steep but relatively quick walk up through a shaded walkway to reach the summit. On a clear day, the expansive views of the whole of Budapest are a sight to behold, and it's well worth heading up there on one of the free walking tours to get the truth behind the castle's current function, and why the guards are not strictly necessary...

Beautiful place. The castle hill is a beautiful and historic place and makes an excellent walk! There is a lot to see, with historic ruins, castles, shops and museums. A definite must when visiting Budapest!

Romantic and Historical. Love to walk around the cobble stoned streets and soak up the atmosphere. Most buildings have the date they were built over the door. There are many commemorative plaques siting famous people or events. Wander the full length from the Vienna gate to the Palace.

Lovely Relaxing Day. Tons to see. We made a mistake by walking a fair distance beforehand, without breakfast, and stopping at the very first place we saw. There're tons of lovely restaurants further in! At fisherman's bastion we had a drink, overlooking the Danube, and were surprised when a trio of classical musicians (with a wide range of contemporary music too) began playing.

Good to go in six months time. Very nice area on the Buda side. Great views, the Matthias church, Fishermans Bastion and plenty of tourists. A little disappointed as there were roadworks and restoration being carried out. I know it has to be some time................
A nice view. There is so much to see in Budapest and this is one place you would enjoy if you have the time. You can reach the hill on the Hop-on Hop-off bus

Worth it for the View.. Well I thik you have to go really. We went as part of a free walk round Buda and Pest. Quite a climb, 250 or so steps, but you can take the funicular for about a £5 I think. The view from the top across the river is superb, the PArliament building looks frillier than Westminster, because the Pest side is so flat you get the city laid out in front of you and can see all the landmarks. Great for taking photographs of course, and lots to see as well. Pretty busy, but wandering around you can some great statues, architecture and what out guide called their "White House" well guarded by soldiers. We intended to go back but didn't make it, I would have liked to see the Hungarian National Gallery.

Number one place to visit. Museums, galleries and we visited also the Wine Festival in September. If there is a festival, do not miss it, there is fantastic atmosphere, you will feel yourself like a queen or king.
Excellent. A lovely little walk to the top and some great views. Especially at the back at sunset. My partner proposed at the top so especially special for me, but still recommend it to everyone!
Beautiful. The view was beautiful, the sites were amazing, walkable around the entire area. Definitely a recommendation for friends and family to visit.

Good way to spend several hours. A visit to Budapest is certainly not complete without going to Castle Hill. Matthias Church, Fisherman's Bastion and the castle museums are terrific. Its a bit disappointing that the castle itself is not of great interest, but since no royalty ever lived there, the space is used to house museums. We saw an exhibit of Chagall's work while there recently and found the exhibit space to be gorgeous. All museums should be that accommodating! The space was large and allowed even a crowd of people to view the works as they deserve to be viewed. Don't miss the pastry shop/cafe on the street leading to Matthias Church! You can't miss it -- there's always a crowd sitting outside enjoying their sweet treats.
Faiy tale land just like Disneyland. great palce to walk round. Make sure you are there on the hour to watch the comedy which is known as changing the guard.

Definitely worth a visit.. Although one can "bus" it up, it is quite exhilarating to walk up the steps from Miko Utca and finally come out on the top!There is so very, very much to see. It depends on you as to whether you would prefer a guided tour or go it alone; there are more than enough plaques and bits of information available in English to do your own tour. So many beautiful buildings and so much history.It is really worthwhile climbing up to the "battlements/tower" because the view over the city and, in particular, of the Parliament Building on the opposite shore, is probably one of the best in Budapest.I wish I had had more time!
Fairy Tale Castle. Great photography opportunities. The architecture of Vajdahunyad Castle is a collection of Hungarian styles through the centuries. Lovely clock tower.

What a view. Get there early so you can enjoy the light and take time to rest after the steep combing. We had problems getting in the museums as there was an event going on and the event staff were extremely impolite.

Superb views over the city. Where there are arguably the best views over such a beautiful city, it's going to be touristy! Lovely (restored) buildings and fortifications give you an amazing view over the city. Don't bother paying to go on the 'viewpoint', but just walk a little further and there's a view just as good where there's also a little bar/cafe for a drink for the same price!
Nice Place to Wander. A nice place to wander around but also "home" to the cathedral, art galleries and museums. Don't miss the little Pharmacy Museum.

Wine Festival. We were lucky to go to Budapest when the Wine Festival was on in the castle grounds. A great event with lots of food outlets and plenty of wine from Hungary and the rest of the world. Entertainment provided and a wonderful view over Pest to boot.

Wait Till They Finish. A lot of construction on Castle hill, new cobblestone roads and renovation of historic buildings. The museum is undergoing major changes and when complete will give a real perspective on the history of Buda and Pest. Great views from many different points on the hill. We were there on a bright sunny day and the views were spectacular. Took a walk across the "Chain" bridge then up the funicular. Spent the day exploring then walked down from the Fishermans Bastion.
castle hill. everything we liked. I constantly marvelled at the beautiful architecture in Budapest. Did not dislike anything.

Go for the view, not the castle.... The so-called "Castle" area of Budapest offers great view of Pest and on the outside, many of the buildings are quite impressive. That said, for those looking to visit a "castle", castle hill is more a series of museum in a castle and other like buildings than your typical "castle" visit or tour. It is a busy area of town with a couple of interesting sights and things to do (and probably a must for the museum fan). I was lucky enough to see a "change of the guard" ceremony while I was there - while nowhere near what someone would experience in other major European centre with such event, it was still interesting to see this much lower key event

Fantastic Views-Do not miss this place.. We took the hop on hop off bus to Castle Hill and hopped off at the top .I wasn't prepared for the views ....oh my word it was a clear day , lovely and warm and the views were totally stunning.Amongst the beauty the guns pointed toward Budapest were really sobering .One of my friends was suffering a tremendous hangover (Oooh those ruin bars !!!) and a couple of hours here in the clean air and peace and quite sorted him out good and proper .
A quaint town in itself. A nice place, with a church, a castle, and wonderful views of the river and the twin city on the other side.

Breathtaking view. A visit to castle hill will be the highlight of your trip to budapest. The view over the danube river and the parliament is breathtaking and the little village packed with restaurants is just too cute. Walk from mathias chirch to the castle and enjoy every minute of it

Wonderful vistas and much to do. This is a delightful section of Budapest where one can spend many hours wandering, enjoying the stunning vistas, visiting church and castle. The construction is crazy right now. But frankly, we were glad, as it suggests finally there are resources to rebuild. This can be a very sad, grey city in context of its history and Castle Hill brings one back to the sheer beauty and magnitude of the city.

Great views and lots of sights to see. Lots of things to see on Castle hill, sadly lots of road works up there at the moment but they are working quickly. Avoid the "craft" market - it is very overpriced. Lovely place to stroll around and the views are great.

Good timing. Hiked up castle hill and was able to catch the Chagall/Amos between wars exhibit which was beautifully curated and a great way to be introduced to a Hungarian artist to which I was not familiar
Must see.. Do it, stroll around, enjoy the views. It's lovely at dusk. Take your camera. Capture the moment. Pray their is no rain that day so you can see all the views. ;)

castle. Nice castle where you can spend half a day enjoying all the sights of the city as well as activities around the castle, all of which cost you money. There is a church as well you can pay to go into.You can take the Hop on Hop off bus to get there and it comes back every 20 minutes or so.

Things to do when in Budapest. Although the weather was not too good when visiting the Hill and Fishermen's Bastion, there were still some great views over the Danube and city. St. Matthias Church also looks fantastic after its full restoration.It is a pity though that there is considerable disruption due to continuing road works.

A view from above. The perfect way to get a feel for the city and it's appeal. This vantage point allows you to take photos that look like postcards. It shows the layout of the city not to be had any other way.

Castle Hill. We walked across the "Chain Bridge" to take a cable car up the hill, the views of the Danube and Budapest are just beautiful. We took photos with the guards in front of the Palace. You can see the Matthias Church and we strolled around and saw some historic houses that were adorable.
day at castle Hill. Well worth seeing. A lot of tourists in Sept. so expect a lot of crowds .There were a lot of vendors selling tourist items.

Breathtaking experience. View of the Danube River from Castle Hill's look-out point is breathtaking. The paliament looks stunning and the city overview is so beautiful. It's a windy day up there when I visited, so my picture is not that great. But I love it anyway.

Take the time to come and have a look. There are a lot of places to visit in Budapest, this is another. The views, the history, the cable car if you are too lazy to walk up the steps. You don't need to long a time here, but you need to come and see.

Underwhelming and Expensive. We went during the wine festival which seemed like a good day to go until you find out you can't get near the castle at all without paying to go the the festival - £8pp not good if you didn't really want any wine.The view is beautiful from Fisherman's Bastion but not worth paying for as it's the same as the view 5 foot under the building which you can easily get to.It works out quite expensive to see everything as rather than one ticket price everything is individual which soon adds up as nothing is really under £5pp which on the surface seems ok but there are so many buildings there with this charge.

Touristy But Worthy Of Time Spent. Wonderful views of Pest and the Danube. Great location for photos. Intriguing architecture. Cobblestone and cement walkways. Nice gardening. See the changing of the guard at the President's Office. View the reconstruction of the castle and many buildings destroyed by war and neglect. Clearly, Hungary intends the site to become a world class tourist attractions and it is well on it's way. The signage, however, was sparse. While it was relatively enjoyable looking at the various buildings, it would have been superb had there been signs describing the building,it's history,etc. The same goes for the excavation sites on which the buildings no longer exist. Clearly,there is a rich history on castle hill. Given more time, and I am hopeful the historians will address this shortfall. A must see,however. Access is limited. Not good for folks with challenges walking distances on an uneven surface and climbing stairs.

Enjoyed the sunset on the hill. Two days' out with friends, Budapest is a city with interesting history and the cosy and relaxed feeling on Castle Hill is just what we want. The architectures are amazing and the atmosphere is pleasant.
What a view. Budapest in one stunning view. Along with many historical sites and of course a church. From here you can take in the many sites and feel the storied history of Magyar.

Bit touristy but important historically. Lovely area with important monuments, important because of its historical significance, and the views are breath-taking. Unless you want to prove something, take the 16 bus up the hill. Museums aren't worth any time; a real disappointment. Recommend you get away from the crowds and walk some of the small streets west of the main attractions and the Hilton; there are small hotels and restaurants that will make your trip to Castle Hill particularly memorable. We especially recommend Pest Buda Bistro for lunch or dinner.
Worth spending time. It's a beautiful location that gives you a bird's eye view of the city. The castle is worth exploring and so is the Fisherman's Bastion. The Matthias Church is breath taking.

Should be ranked #1 in Budapest. We've already visited it twice and will return. The first time we climbed it by the West side where you can find covered stairs landing in the middle of the hill, near Mathias Church. We walked all the streets from one side to the other, unfortunately the church was closed (Sunday). The bastion is my preferred spot with the great views it offers. At 2pm there was the change of the guards at the Sandor Palace.The second time, we went for the wine festival and visited the history museum.Next time, we will visit the national gallery!
Great views. I took funicular to Buda Caste. It was fun experience. The views are just awesome. I recommend you to go there.

Great views over city. Great views over the city. Interesting for a stroll around. Went in September and visited the area three times - first on Tue evening by taxi to a restaurant at the west end of the hill, and was surprised that there were few people. Went back on Thu eve up the funicular and found more at the Castle end, though not huge numbers. Finally visited on Sun pm when it was sunny and pretty busy.

Awesome view from the river. What a grand!!!!! castle !!!!, did not get a chance to visit the insides as it was a public holiday as all was closed, but the grandeur to be admired from the river and more so at night, very special illumination done that your eyes just get glued....

Not easy but fun!. The climbing up the hill caught us in a sunny day (21 degrees), so we got up there a bit sweating, but happy! The challenge was a pure fun, plus you get the best view over the city (Pest).

Another "must see"!. The walk around Castle Hill offers some of the most magnificent views of Budapest looking over the Danube and towards the Parliament Building. The road winds up towards the fairytale-like structure built to honor the fishermen who defended Buda from the Turks during the Middle Ages. The white structure is filled with turrets and ramparts and looks much like a Disney castle! There is a large horseman statue that stands near the entrance. This area is very crowded with tourists, but is oh so beautiful!!
Beautiful views stunning buildings great atmosphere. This cannt be missed its the oldest part of Buda the start point for a visit to the city plenty of walks things to see and great places to eat

A Nice Walk In a Nice Weather. It was a nice walk in the Castle Hill .The beauty of the place was in the night .The light on the castle was beautiful .There are several shops and restaurants around .Try the Hungarian cakes and ice cream.

A feast for the eyes. If you like walking this is a wonderful place to walk. This area contains Budapest's most Important medieval monuments and museums. If you don't wish to walk so much then take the funicular railway up or back down or both. Great experience
great views. if you have time and the weather is nice you will love the views! stay away from the standard tourist traps

On the top of the hill. The fishermans bastion was very interesting and gave great views of the Parliament House and the city. Very friendly camera/souvenir shop assistant who was very helpful. Loved the Herends shop assistant and the medieval houses. Well worth the visit.
Great views and stunning architecture. This is the main reason one goes to Budapest. The views from the hill are stunning back across the river, and some of the architecture up here is unparalleled.
Architecture, view.... There was nothing to dislike, except the rain. The sculptures, the architecture, and the view from different points...I wish I could spend more time!
the view. I couldn't tear myself away from the view, had to come back and see it at night with the lights - it's swoon worthy.

Fantastic views, great architecture. Castle Hill is a fantastic place to walk around and enjoy the old architecture and the grant views on the city. From here the Fisherman Bastion is also easily reached. You can walk up the hill, but for a small fee you can go with the old cablecar, which is quite cool!

way to go to citadel and statue of liberation. We walked across Elisabeth bridge from Pest. Than went up a very steep hill, but enjoyed the walk. The view of the Danube, historic bridges, Buda castle, the Buda muntains and Pest was unforgettable. There is also St. Gellert`s monument on the way.
You can take a bus but we preferred to walk.

Great visit. Caste Hill is the place if you want to see the Palace, museums, Hospital in the Rock and Fisherman's Bastion. We spent 1/2 our day just touring this section of budapest. Well worth it, places to eat all around as well. Great views!
Castle Hill. Beautiful area. Lovely views of the Danube and parliament building cobbled streets, lots of character.. Nice restaurant

Full of tourist.... ...and for reason. Great view over the Pest and Donau. Several beautiful buildings. Really impressive Mathias Church. The Castle. Lot of live activities like several types of music, at least on beautiful summer day. Don't forget to visit less popular northern peak, with its Vienna gate.

Spectacular View of the City. On the Buda side, the whole area is full of history and the atmosphere is wonderful. If you go in the spring/summer, you will see beautiful gardens and a spectacular view of the Danube River and Pest on the other side. You can take the funicular to get there or walk for about 15-20 minutes.

Beautiful view on the city. Beautiful gardens and view on Pest on the other side of the river.
You can take the funicular to go up there or just walk for about 10 minutes.
Excellent Place for Photography. This is great place to take photos. make sure you go early in the morning or late afternoon - else many nice angles are in the shadows.

A different face of the city. Visiting the castle hill and Buda -side of the city is definately worth it. It shows you a totally different Budapest from the busy Pest -side. The atmosphere is a bit like Riga or Tallinn old town with nice terraces and less cars. Also nice views to Donau and over the rest of the city. Check out the Mathias church.
Great area to walk around in. Grand buildings - grand views - easy enough to walk up from the river - continue walk to take in the cave hospital and church

Castle Hill Beauty. It's a must visit place in Budapest. The views from top of the castle are just amazing , overlooking the Danube river below. The castle itself looks so awesome, that you just want to sit there for a while observing the beauty of it. Some people like to have their weddings atop this beautiful place and I fortunately got see one Hungarian wedding. There are many other sight seeing places on the castle hill and you can take a bus if you are too tired walking by the foot .

Castle District. A must for visitors to Budapest. Being expats in the city we always take guests there. The only drawbacks are too many tourists at times and it is much pricier than other parts of Budapest!

Ambience plus history and views to die for!. The Castle Hill is an essential part of the Hungarian, and the Austro-Hungarian, historical experience. The use of stone similar to that lining most of Washington, DC's buildings, gives a fresh look to historic buildings and the crenellated fortifications that encircled this part of Buda. The alliance of Church and State is everywhere evident and the omnipresent cobblestoned streets lend not only authenticity but a literal feel to the ambience. The old merges with the new in hotels, restaurants and residences and, if you're lucky, you'll get a glimpse of ultra-private courtyards should the stout doors be opened momentarily. In short, the combination of views and history make this an essential part of your Budapest experience.

Fairy tale looking.. Must visit, it has stunning views overlooking the river Danube. There is an art gallery up there with the castle and if you time it right you may get to see the changing of the guards.

a must walk to. Walked from the Pest side of Budapest, across the Chain Bridge and up to the Castle Hill area....quite a walk especially when you cross the Chain and have to go "vertical"! The Castle area has many sights to see and several really nice pubs/taverns to grab a cold one and light lunch.
A must in Budapest. National gallery, st Matthias Church, a very nice view on the Pest side, nice little terrasses, ... On the whole a must do in Budapest

Worth to visit. What a beautiful place to see over the Danube river and City of Best. I've been there in Budapest on 8 times, and every time I have also visited the Castle Hill. Some good little cafes and stores.

Beautiful and lots of history.. It's a shame the Nazis and USSR destroyed much of the grounds, but what remains is till very impressive. Read up ahead of time and read the various signs around that tell about the long history, including the Celts, Romans, Huns, Magyars and a host of others that have built on this ground and you'll have a much richer experience. You can even visit the underground caves which have been in use since the paleolithic ear. There is a nice fine arts museum in the "castle" and the fisherman's bastion is a short walk away.
Peaceful area. Very beautiful site. Many interesting and authentic buildings, streets, cafes etc. Peaceful views to Pesht side.

view from Castle Hill. great view of the Pest side of the river. Lots of shops and coffee shops around the Castle Hill, cathedral and lots of people!It is a beautiful city and if you are in shape you can climb to the top of the hill.
The Buda side of life.. Give yourself an afternoon...wander, lunch, drink and soak it in. It is not a place to pass by quickly.
Super city views. We climbed up the hill instead of taking the little furnicular. It's an easy climb and worth stopping at various points to look back down the hill to the river and beyond.

The Oldest Part of Budapest. This place is the oldest part in Budapest. If you will visit Budapest in the future, allow 6 hours for the castle district, this place should be on your priorities. You will enjoy the panoramic view of Pest from there. There are many historic buildings and churches. There is also a nice cafe which overlooks Pest. To get up there, you can use the "Siklo" which is a small train that you can use with a fee. I prefer this option rather than walking to the top of the hill. Save your energy to explore the district. There are souvenir shops which I found their prices better than anywhere in Budapest.

Beautiful views, neat architecture. This is pretty much everybody's tourist stop, but it's worth it. Take the fenicular up and walk down. The old city and palace area are picturesque, the views of both Buda and Pest are lovely and there are plenty of places to snack, eat or buy knick-knacks. You can easily kill a couple hours on this selfie tour, even if you don't go inside buildings.
A must for snappy happy people. Gave amazing views of of Buda and Pest with the Danube running through. A lovely place to go in the evening for couples as very romantic

empire strikes back. one of the greatest post-imperial sights, where you can feel what was budapest's ambitions - i spent almost the whole day there, it's almost renovated or being renovated, great city view.
Great views. You get up on the Funicular railway(note it doesn't run on Mondays) or take a bus up either way once there it is like being in a small village lots to see and fantastic views.
Exquisite. Beautiful architecture and statues, most especially the hunting statue including the dogs. Beautiful views.
Picture postcard views. Depending on parking availability, it can be quite an uphill hike. Be sure to have your camera ready!
Excellent sites in BUDApest. Excellent location of great history, food, and travel sites. Lots to see and learn on castle Hill overlooking the Danube from the BUDA side of the river.
Nice to walk around and discover some of the hidden museums.. Try to avoid eating here since it is expensive and not very good. It is a delight place for a stroll in the early evening.

Great views but access limited when the folk fair is on!. We went up to the top of the castle via the funicular railway following one of the walking routes on the standard Budapest maps. Queues at the railway were short - it was about 9.30 in the morning. Views at the top were excellent and it was nice to walk around on our own rather than as one of the many tour groups. Sadly we could not walk down through the castle as it was closed for the fair so we walked down the steps. Worth watching the changing of the guards on the hour.
Beautiful!. Beautiful view over the city. This is a must if you are visiting Budapest! You can get here by bus 16.

Great views, a Budapest "must do". Castle hill has galleries, museums, tunnels, cute houses along cobbled streets and fantastic views of Budapest and the Danube. It can get crowded and hot in summer and, although there are plenty of bars, restaurants and cafes, they can be significantly more expensive than most other parts of the city. My benchmark is goulash soup which is standard/cheaply priced at around 990HUF (about 4.75AUD/USD) across the city rising to about 1795HUF in more expensive places. On Castle Hill it can easily and often be over 2000HUF. You will still not want to miss this area. Don't go hungry and bring your camera!
Nice view. The castle is very nice to visit. The outdoor view is better than inside and you have to pay to get inside (not worth it for me)

Pretty, but not old. I was surpised to learn how "new" the buildings are here, and throughout Budapest. I guess you really can't blame them for war damage, but it was a lot less impressive once i learned it wasn't too old or historic.

choose a hotel nearby. We stayed in a hotel nearby on Hegyalja way and it was really fantastic. You can walk up to the Castle hill and you can enjoy the beautiful historic area. I prefer this part of the city, it is cheaper, nicer, calmer, safer...
Superb. You have to go. Its remarkable with a beautiful view. Visit Budapest at mid August to enjoy the festival of folk arts as well!!!

Most important to see. The castle hill area is nice, old part of Budapest with wonderful buildings and lot to see. Check the Matthias church, the Fisherman bastion and the Buda Castle. Do not forget to buy some souvenirs :-)

beautiful and great vista of Budapest. It really is very beautiful up the hill and the view over the city is incredible from up there. The streets up there are so pretty and the Fishermans Bastion fairytale-like. There is a funicular cable car if you don't fancy the steps, we always take the steps.

Take the Funicular.... ...unless you're a teenager.
It is a long, steep climb up the "hill" from the Danube bridge.
But either way it is well worth the effort.

Excellent!. I loved everything about this area. Its beautiful to look at
and easy walking. The only thing I dislike is not enough
public restrooms.

Worth the long climb. We were here just before St. Stephen's Day, so many roads were closed to traffic. That meant we had quite a climb to the top of the hill. The weather was quite warm and there are many stairs, so take water to drink and wear sturdy shoes. It is not handicapped accessible. The views from the top are amazing, so it was well worth the trip. Wonderful views of this beautiful city.

Don't come by car. This is a wonderful site to visit for half a day. Come by street car, tram, or get off the Hop on, Hop off bus but don't drive. The first half hour is free but after that it's $25. Ouch! and they don't accept credit cards.

best view of Budapest. You have to walk a lot of time on a really slope trail but finally when you get on the top of the hill you will have the best view of Budapest you can find. I reccomend it to everyone who visit Budapest
Castle Hill. The Castle Hill area is really nice area to just walk around. Beautiful buildings and a few nice places to get souvenirs.
Lovely area of historic interest. pleasant and interesting area to explore and enjoy. Lots to do and see in the area - highly recommend it!

Great Grouping of Attractions. There are so many attraction a top the hill that it definitely is worthwhile trying to spend a half to a full day up there. I would also recomend walking up the hill from the Pest side if that is where you are staying. It is a bit of a hike but coming across the bridge and then taking the path that begins near the funicular allows you so many sights both of the hill and down from the hill. Plus you arrive on the top of the hill in a quiet spot beside the President's mansion which adds to the mystic of the place.

Amazing place. It was way too hot for comfort but still worth the trip. Travelled up the hill by tour bus .. gasped at the views from the walls, had a drink in a cafe, walked the UNESCO protected streets of the town. Lots of restoration going on which makes one feel the locals really care about their history and are making a great effort.

The starting point of the city. We didn't take the funicular but even the walk up there is worth the while. We saw the changing of the gardes (the funniest thing ever) and heard many stories about the origins of the city up here. Nice place to go!
Best part of all Budapest. Wonderful views of Danube and Pest from Castle Hill especially at night. Much history in this area and many attractions to see.
The best of Budapest. This is probably the best Budapest has to offer. Great views, gorgeous buildings and lots of good places to have a drink and a bite to eat.

Great view. I liked the city better since there's more vibe to it and you're not missing any hungarian architecture anyways. but IT IS a unesco world heritage site for a reason. I found that the view was great, the fisherman's bation and matthias church very interesting too. An afternoon well spent! Oh and get a map before going!!!
Beautiful and packed with history. This previous Royal Castle was really great! Amazing architecture and the view of the whole city! Highly recommended!

Magnificent View. Great view especially from the Fisherman's Bastion and cafe overlooking Pest. Service is slow, but the breeze/shade and accompanying view is worth the price at the cafe.
If you're a history buff, this will mean even more to you.
Night time iconic views of Buda across the Danube. Took a short stroll with friends after a meal, and very much enjoyed the views on this clear and warm summer night.

Construction site..still good viewing!. Navigating through the construction site is challenging but will provide you with a spectacular view of pest. People with walking challenges will find getting around difficult. Taking the lift up is nice but long lines. One can walk from the bridge up the hill in about 30 minutes, going at night can be rewarding. Several coffee shops at the top but the one just past the church offers drinks, music, shade, and great site lines.

Go at night!. We spent a couple hours on the hill around sunset. This offered incredible views of the city after the lights came on. We had great views of the Parliament building, St Stephens Basilica and the Chain Bridge among other things. Definitely a good spot to spend an evening!

Best place to stay on the Buda side. Our hotel was located on the Buda side and we enjoyed it very much. It is a wonderful place with plenty of old houses. The view is beautiful from here and it is close to everything. The best tourist sights are all located here, plus it is also cheaper and safer!!!
Picturesque. The castle area is very beautiful with picturesque views over the danube with great buildings very clean and nice places to sit and relax

Great view over Budapest. The historical castle is the must see in Budapest. It offers a great view over the Danube and of the entire city, of which the Parliament stands out spectacularly. The historical roads are full of medieval flavour, it has great gates and here are a few interesting museums to visit, especially the military museum.I have to say the most impressive entrance is through the Fisheman's Bastion and get right near the Matyas church.
beautiful district. The nincest historic area of Budapest. It's free to walk and look around. Do not miss Matthias church and Fisherman bastion.

Short walk avoids the Funicular. Take the steps - pathway to the right of the tunnel for both a good viewpoint half way up and a way to avoid the long wait for the funicular Not too strenuous 7 mins to top alternately a no 16 bus - part of your days public transport pass comes every 15 minutes and takes you to the castle square at the top of the hill
on the hill. The sailor's memorial is below the site of the castle. Nearby are building still showing damage from the German occupation until 1944.

Palaces, Churches and Breathtaking Views. Do not miss a trip up here to marvel at its beauty, its history, the lovely wee cafes selling great food and drinks at sensible prices. You can walk up from the promenade, take the funicular or the bus. It is work it and do pay that wee bit extra to walk around the walls of Fisherman's Bastion.
Beautiful view. A must see while in Budapest. Cute little village area and a beautiful castle to view. Lots of history and charm.

Lovely area to explore. We took the funicular to the top and walked down later in the day. It was very to spend hours and hours taking in the scenery and enjoying the atmosphere.Great views across the Danube to Pest. The Parliament building stand out like some amazing palace, a beautiful and impressive building. Much of the area was still in ruins from the war which I think adds another perspective.We enjoyed a lovely lunch waiting for Matthias Church to open to the public - what a spectacular building - absolutely a must see and worth the wait. Fishermens Bastion quite beautiful also.I'd recommend exploring the area beyond the main attractions as there are some lovely homes and restaurants scattered around.

Beautiful. What an amazing place. A must see in Budapest. Do the free walk (find online) which is about 2 hours long.Amazing views and history. A big variety of things to see.DO NOT take the funicular (rip off) walk up the lovely paths (unless you are very old or unfit)

Wonderful Site with Great Views. Loved seeing the palaces, cathedral, and especially the Fisherman's bastion. This place also had great views of the Danube and Parliament. This is a can't miss site if you are coming through Budapest
Beutiful view. It was too hot day to enjoy it enough. Just looked around, took photos. Siklo wasn`t working, so had to walk down on a very hot day...
Great views!. Loved the views - definitely worth a hike up the hill or simply buy the cable car pass! Also there are a few restaurants at the top with a view (very expensive though)
Stunning castle and views. Great views over the Pest side of Budapest. Romantic atmosphere, particularly at sunset. Worth the hike up the hill.

Wonderful view day and night. From here visitors can have a panoramic view of the city especially the Pest side of it. It is worth staying here until the evening to hace a beautiful night scene.Walking up there may be difficult for some people, so take the No. 16 bus.

Nice views over the city. Nice views over the city and castle itself is quite massive and hosts also national gallery. Some medieval sports can be tried (shooting with bow & crossbow, throwing spear etc.) on backyard. I would recommend visiting this with some Hop on Hop off bus with audio since history of castle hill involves many interesting details.
Beautiful at night. It is a hill so you will either be hiking stairs or up a long cobbled road but it is spectacular at night to see from below or up close.
Castle Hill Visit. Great day spent walking around. The only negative is having to keep change on hand to use the WC. Highlight was the Medieval Synagogue.
WONDERFUL HISTORY. We had a local guide take us up Castle Hill. The views of the Danube and Budapest were spectacular and the little stalls in the village captivating. Don't miss this
Scenic walk. Nice village walk between Buda Castle and Matthais Church. Many restaurants and beautiful buildings to see

Best View of Budapest. The Castle Hill area has some of the best views of Budapest. Start with the funicular at the based of the Chain Bridge because it is a steep climb, and later take the steps down when you return. As you ascend in the funicular you will get great shots of the city as well. Once up there, you can tour the castle, home of the National Gallery of Art, as well as walk around to see the Fishermen's Bastion, Matthias Church, lots of shops and restaurants. Stop for a drink or coffee at the Hilton Hotel, built on the site of an ancient monastery, part of which has been preserved.

Wonderful , full of history. Visiting Budapest u cannot miss the castle, it's the most beautiful place in the city!! Check with ur travel agent maybe ur visit will coincide with some festival up there ( beer, wine, palinka)!

Castle of Buda Hill. Its a great trip to Castle of Buda, wonder around in Castle district and visit many historical places. There is a magnificent view to the Houses of Parliament and river Danube...its awesome, I would highly recommend...

Worth the trek. Castle Hill was gorgeous. It's a little bit of a trek to get to the top, but it's worth the day trip. Keyword: day trip. There is so much to do once you get to the top of the hill. Wonderful view of Pest and Buda is just beautiful. It's a little hot in the summer, so be sure to bring water with you!
You can't miss it and you shouldn't. All those superlatives. Loved it although July was too hot. Not sure when would be good. Probably may or September otherwise too cold?
Many things to see and great views. This is amust do for budapest, escp. the fishermans bastion, where the view is magnificent towards the city, Many of the sightseeing busses stop here.
A city of its own. You could spend a whole day exploring all the museums, churches, views, the castle and labyrinths. Take the funicular up and walk down. Much easier that way.
Great area. Amazing views over Pest not worth paying to enter Fisherman's Bastion as most of it can be walked round free.The area can get very crowded as lots of tour buses arrive.

A must see in Budapest. This was our first stop while in Budapest and it is lovely. From the old buildings to the statues along the way. Take some time to leave the castle grounds and possible find a nice restaurant to eat at.

Castle Views and Area. What a lovely area to walk and view. The palace and museum ( closed on Mondays), the Fishermans Bastion, the cafes and restaurants, the Grocery Store is good and stays open until 8pm except Sunday when it is 6pm, the Matthius Church. Great area day and night..Regards Gary Saunders

Best views in Budapest. This was a really good find walking distance from our hotel; beautiful views and try the mezze & White wine; overlooks the best views in Budapest you can make out the Hungarian Parliament; the Bastilla on the Pest side. It a great place next to the River!
Article. Not bad ,not good.Just sightseeing.need 30 minutes enough.

Relaxing. Very nice to walk around and take inthe views of the City across the river. Relaxing atmosphere (largely traffic free) and some nice churches/bars/restaurants to see.
We walked up and down which is actually quite easy and has great views along the way. Alternatively take the Fernicular which i thought was a bit overpriced at 3 euro's a trip

Must See. Great place, fantastic views and excellent photo taking opportunities. We found a very reasonably priced bistro nearby for dinner. We took the funicular up which cost a few pounds but was very good fun!

Castle hill. Great tourist place, fantastic views and some reasonably priced restaurants for lunch. Be prepared for a stiff climb if you choose to walk up, but we used the old vehicular which was a little pricy but worth it.
Must see. Lots to see and do up there! Take the tram round trip and save your energy for the museums and walking around in this fascinating area. Also, we found it to be the best shopping area.
Wonderful views. So much to see and so little time! We had lunch at a very nice restaurant on a terrace overlooking the river.

Special place in the heart of old Buda. The Castle District provides an opportunity to view all of Pest from a high vantage point, visit the historic Matyas Church and the underground passages that once connected all the important houses located here. There are some lovely cafes in this district, and we took full advantage on hot days to enjoy Dreher beer, the local brew, at these places along with wonderful food. The views from the castle parapets are breathtaking. We also enjoyed watching the changing of the guard at the Presidential Palace. The funicular, which transports you from the Castle District to the foot of the hill and the Buda side of the Chain Bridge, was also a fun experience. Lots of souvenir shops for those so inclined, and also a marzipan museum.
Great Panorama. This is must be place in Budapest. Amazing views from the top! You will find also nice chillout coffe places here.

Amazing views of Budapest, don't miss out on this!. The Castle Hill area is a really beautiful area that should be on every visitor's must-see list when visiting Budapest.Although very touristy, it's worth a short trip up the hill to see Matyas Church, Fisherman's Bastion, and experience the amazing panorama views of Budapest and the Danube from this location.There are several cafes and restaurants in this area where you can enjoy a meal or just have coffee, a pastry, or ice cream. A warning: PLEASE DON'T GO to the Korona Cukraszda at the end of the main street. They are known to have some of the rudest, unfriendliest staff and no service to speak of, as well as the highest prices to be found anywhere in Budapest. There are so many better places to go.You can go up to the Castle Hill (Varhegy) area by the small public bus #16 or #16A just off of Szel Kalman Ter on Buda. You won't be disappointed by the beauty of this area and the views!

Lovely place to visit. We walked throughout the grounds and castle. Allow 3-4 hours to visit this area. There is a hotel on the grounds that would be wonderful to stay at and spend a day or two leisurely walking through the shops.
Shady walk and good view. Visited Rock Church, Cool shade walking through woods to Liberation Monument. Slightly disappointed with Statue of Gellert as run down with graffiti

A must see. This is one of the most beautiful parts of both Buda and Pest. You can climb up the stairs (it takes about 10 minutes) or take the cable car. In any case, the view from above is stunning and the place holds quite a lot of fun and beautiful attractions.Make sure you eat a dessert at Ruszwurm (between András Hadik's sculpture and the cathedral).
Great place. very impresive altaugh under renovation.Do not buy a funicular ticket 2 ways as bus is cheaper and drop of in the center.

Lemons to Lemonaide?. I was sold a lemon! I thought Castle Hill had a castle, but it doesn't!!! However, the castle town, churches (especially Mary Magdalene) were lovely. We enjoyed walking around and took lots of interesting pictures.

A must see but only for a short while. There is too much to see in Budapest to spend more than two hours checking out the castle area and the views. I recommend walking as the funcular is expensive and short. The changing of the guards is a tourist exhibit not a historic enactment!

Worth the climb (or bus ride). If you want to see amazing views of Budapest this is the place to go. If you have time, and are fit, then you can walk to the top...if not the city has a "Hop on-Hop off" bus that is reasonably priced and takes you right to the top. Budpest is a beautiful city and if you want to get a great panorama this is a must.
Castle Hill. . Lovely area in which to walk around and have a magnificent view from high above the city. Wonderful view of the Danube and Parliament Building.

Wonderful views over the city. OK you really get to feel like a tourist in this area but it's worth it for the great views over the city. Spent a whole afternoon just wandering around - and sat in one of the many pleasant cafés enjoying the first bit of sunshine we had after two miserable days.

Stepping back in time.... What a pretty place, full of history and things to see. If you hate the beaten path this isn't for you, but if you like seeing what's important no matter what, you cant pass this place up.
Great half day trip. Once you get past the bastion it's very serene. If you walk way past the Hilton to the gate that goes back down the hill, there is a small shop with cheap water and soda, etc.

So nice to walk the streets of this historic place!. My Budapest apartment was located at the district so I've enjoyed it as my first thing in the city!Explore the streets and go to the castle's garden for lovely pics!:)

Varhegy Vista!. Take the funicular to the top of Castle Hill for an easy ride, or you can take the steps, but be sure that you have proper comfortable footwear and water. In my opinion, it is better to take the funicular because you can relax a bit while enjoying the beautiful views of Budapest as you ride to the top of the hill. Once at the top of the hill, plan to spend a bit of time taking in the different views of the city and taking photos!

Crowded but worth visiting. We did not do the tour since we did not have the time, but took a driving tour and it seemed very interesting. There is a lot to see and do - and you could spend a whole day. Too many visitors and the place can get crowded with busloads

Lots of construction. Since there was lots of construction around the palace, we didn't spend much time there. In addition, since it really isn't a palace, we passed time in the old neighborhoods. These were much more insteresting.
Amazing view. We took the Hop on and Hop off Bus tour but they did stop on Castle Hill. The view from the top is amazing! A must see.
Beautiful. We took lots of photos, enjoyed the view to Pest across the Danube and had drinks at a lovely cafe with beautiful views.

Most Impressive City view I've ever seen!. I can't think of a more inspiring place. So easy to get to and well worth a few hours taking in the view if not eating in the restaurant. The park nearby is a shady place to sit for a few minutes before trekking even higher up the hill!

Amazing views!. It's easy to go up the hill - Either take the Funicular or take the bus no.16 from the Chain bridge (It will take u all the way up) or else you can walk too.The views are spectacular from all points, the Bastion being opposite the Parliament Building and the Castle is opposite St. Stephan's Basilica. There are a few museums there as well :)

The best spot where to enjoy the stunning panoramic view over the city. No doubt it is the most beautiful area of the whole city, and for the artistic beauty to the magical panorama that you have the whole city of Budapest.It's a ''must'' getting here and visit this beautiful castle and its surroundings.Reaching it is easy and simple, there are two options, the first one is the faster and easier through the funicular that takes tourists directly up the hill in a short time, the second one (my choice) is following the path on foot, definitely more tiring but I love to struggle when I travel and then passes everything in the background.The journey takes about 10 minutes.Once you get over the show is nothing short of exciting.
Don't miss it during the day AND night. Enjoy the historical sights during the day and the well lit views and wide choice of restaurants at night.

Definitely Do This. Castle Hill was wonderful. It includes the Castle, the Matthias Church and Fisherman's Bastion. While you are walking Castle Hill there are many places to stop and take wonderful pictures of both Buda and Pest. It's a wonderful place to get some exercise and see some very beautiful places in Budapest. I highly recommend walking around the Castle Hill area and stopping for a sausage and a beer!

Must see when you are in Budapest. The Castle Hill is a highlight of Budapest. It s a wide compound with the Castle, Matthias Church, Fisherman's Bastion and the sculpture of the majestic Turul bird all within walking distance. Great scenic photography opportunities everywhere and there are some stalls selling Hungarian souvenirs as well. In particular, we enjoyed taking pictures of Buda and Pest from the Fisherman's Bastion. The hilly side is Buda scenery, the flat side is Pest, separated by the Danube river. We were there on 11 June 2013 and because the flooding waters have not totally subsided, the Danube river cruises were cancelled. However, that did not spoil our trip there as the walking views were just as captivating.

Just stunning. This is truly a stunning location. Try and visit at night when the lights are all on. Travel up on the funicular, walk around the beautifully restored Fisherman's Bastion, churches, palaces and grab a bite at 21 Restaurant for good traditional Hungarian fare, then walk back down the hill and across the Chain bridge. Stunning night out!
Great view of pest. Loved the view of pest from here. Took the bus up to the castle district. The fountains are nice to see.

Great to visit once (Make it the first)!. Beautifully located at the heart of the city. A little bit of walking is there. Getting there: You go on this elevated lift which is like a tram. It takes you up a short distance from the main city area to Castle Hill which is elevated on a mountain top. I woud say that this place is a must-see in your entire itinerary of Pest. You should do this site first because there are quite a few shops which house expensive goods (no deals really!), a nice atmosphere, and great views of the city. Great to take some good photos with the family!
Great views. Enjoyed the views and small shops. Try the pastry shops and check out the beautiful architecture. A bit quieter than on the Pest side, but still a must see for visitors.

Spectacular views. On the Buda side of Budapest, Castle hill is well worth the visit. From providing fantastic panoramic views of the city for photographer's to viewing some of the older 500+ year old buildings, you will enjoy this trip. Be aware though unless you get dropped off by bus, there is a little steep walk to the top, but don't let that deter you.

Outstanding views....lots to see. The Castle hill has lots to see. The museums in the castle, the Matthias Church, Farmers bastion for the best views of Pest, the labyrinth (boring), and the funicular to take you up from the chain bridge. Besides there are cafes and shops as well. This is one place that is a must see if you are in Budapest. Depending on your interest you can decide what to do. Dont miss the farmers bastion for the best views.
Beautiful. Lovey to walk round & the views were lovey, defiantly worth a walk round. We stopped & had ice cream & coffees in the little coffee shop where the hop on hop off bus drops you off.
Beautiful Views. A very nice view of Budapest, very pretty buildings. We walked to the top, which was a little too much on a hot day. Would recommend taking a bus.

Take your time here--so much to see. Don't miss a trip on the funicular after you walk across the Chain Bridge. Take in the changing of the guard, the museum, and don't miss the views from Fisherman's Bastion. Good restaurants near the church, too.

Centre of everything. Our hotel(Hilton) was on a Castle Hill and it was great, because there you can find most of the main attractions from Buda Castle to Matthias Church. to Fishermans Bastion. There are lots of
restaurants and bars and fun way to get down to riverside is Funicular.

Main point to visit in Budapest. Very Crowed place, you can find there a lot activities such as maze, museums and others. I sugest go there early at morning or evening during the day you can have problems with mobing around hill.

Very pretty. We really liked it here, it was very peaceful and pretty (although freezing in December being high up!). I would recommend it but would not recommend getting the cable car to the top as it's very expensive compared to other places in Budapest and you are only on it a minute if that.

Magical. The Fisherman's Bastion and the Matthias Church are so pretty at night as the whole area is beautifully lit and you get wonderful views across the Danube to the Parliament building on the Pest side of the city. Well worth a visit! If you follow the road up it's not so steep as the steps.

I love this area. This area is a "must to see" thing in Budapest. It's very nice and there are lots of small, nice shops and restaurants / pastry shops. There are lots of museums, and special Hungarian folk-shops too. I love to walk here and just look around. :)The best way to get here by taxi / local bus. (the local bus starting from the Szell Kalman place). If you like to walk, you can walk up to the Castle Hill via the Ostrom street (just opposite of the Mammut Shopping Mall). While you are there, do not miss the "Halaszbastya" Restaurant (Fisherman's Restaurant). This is a fine dining restaurant and it has incredible panoramic views over the Danube and Budapest.
great day at castle hill. Was like a fairy tale palace. Easy to walk around and great cafe above supermarket. No 16 bus.Great views.

go at the right time!. I think Aisling Mel's review was for 'Gelert Hill' ............ when we walked down from Gelert Hill we walked over to the rear of Castle Hill and took the elevator ( 200HUF ) up to the main Castle level ( Level 5 ) - there is a welcome small cafe near the elevator and it is a welcome pitstop .....we were fortunate that we arrived just before noon as there was a ceremonial changing of the guard at the castle and it was very interesting ...... finding our way down the hill via unmarked pathways was a bit challenging and it lead us to the Chain Bridge ..

Amazing View from the top. Me and my boyfriend walked up the hill, the view from the top is amazing its just a shame about all the graffiti on the way up the hill. I would recommend to walk it rather than to get the bus as you appreciate the gorgeous view from the top more when you finally get there rather than taking the bus.

Be Sure to Ride the Funicular from the Chain Bridge to Fishermans Bastien. We took the #2 Tram to its northern end and then walked to the Funicular. The view from the top is great. We were there as the sun was setting and the lights of the city were coming up. A lot of walking, but worth it.
Very charming, worth an hour or two strolling around. Many beautiful old buildings, and great views over both sides of the Danube. A bit touristy, but not too crowded on my visit.
This is the cutest little castle district I've ever seen!. nice churchs and shops and eateries and ruins and a great view of the Danube from here and beautiful castles!!

Breathtaking views. We stayed in the Castle Hill area on a recent trip to Budapest. The views over the Danube and " Pest " area of the city are amazing. Walking over the cobblestone streets seeing the many statues, fountains and churches is awe inspiring. I recommend taking a guided tour of the area to really appreciate the history.

A view to die for!. My daughter & I took the funicular up to the castle area, where we enjoyed the fabulous views across the whole of the plain of Budapest to the mountains beyond, where it meets with Asia .We very much enjoyed visiting the church where the restoration is almost complete. Every detail was meticulous, including the restoration of fabrics in the Oratory. How sad that so much was razed to the ground during the war, but how wonderful that so much throughout Budapest has been restored to its former glory. How resilient the Hungarian people have had to be throughout its turbulent history. At the Fishermans Bastion we were treated to an impromptu violin performance by two elderly local men, clearly enjoying making their music. What a wonderful treat.We were able to take the number 16 bus from the church area to Pest - me travelling free as an EU senior citizen! ( I don't even get this privilege at home)
Beautiful views. There are many things to do on Castle Hill. The beautiful church, the stunning views of the city below, statues, fountains, and wonderful cafes and shops to browse through.

Do not miss the SPY MUSEUM next to the castle. It is somewhat hard to find- of course. The guides are wonderful and you will learn the history of spying - see the machinery that was used- radios- direction finders, etc. By the way- the walk down the hill from the castle is 10 minutes and lovely- you do not need the funicular. The 16 bus on the opposite side of the chainbridge will take you right to the castle. Nobody tells you this in your hotel.We found the Budapest card worthwhile.

Take your time wandering. A very nice area to walk around with some brilliant views. There is a funicular up the hill, but the walk isn't difficult. There are really beautiful buildings, plus Fishermans bastion and Matthias church. Don't buy food in the area, its way too expensive.

Beautiful View, worth the walk I promise!. The cable car had a huge queue so we walked up the hill, it wasnt that bad, didnt take very long really, and so worth it. If you head towards St Matthias the views from there are fabulous!
:P. I did a walking tour of Budapest... we went up to the Castle Hill area, you get fantastic views looking back to the Pest side of Budapest. Made a good photoshooting up there :P

Must see. Great views. Take the little tram/train up but not down as the walk is pretty intense especially when its sunny! Cafes are ridiculously expensive so take your own refreshments if you can, but worth visiting for the beautiful views of Budapest.
As pretty as expected. If walking around the old town go early, otherwise you will have coach loads of Asian tourists trying to take photographs of everything, including you

Old world. I loved the contrast of Buda and Pest during my time my Budapest. Buda was the old world cobblestone street quiet side (at least what I saw) and Pest was its lively cousin. Loved walking around Castle Hill, it reminded me a lot of Prague.

Nice. During summer there are lots of tourists and it is very crowdy, if you have the chance go before the mid of march!
But the view is very nice, you have a good view to the parliament and best is going in the evenings when all the buildings are illuminated.
Feel the history. Being at the top is alwary good, bu the castle hill is giving you a sense of the historiy. It is pretty and nice.
Great to visit for a few hours. Be sure to get away from all the tourists and wander where people live. There is great gelato with a view of the city near the entrance to the hospital in the rock.

Wondeful way to spend a day. The grounds are beautiful; the castle museum is nice to see. We were fortunate to see the changing of the guard and a once a year international presentation of guards from 4 surrounding countries. A real treat.

A must do. A great excursion. We walked the entire way up. I wouldn't recommend it. Take the vernacular train and enjoy the view or get one of the site seeing buses. Great opportunity for photographs at the top. Go early in the morning to avoid crowds. Bring some lunch if your on a budget. Everything on top of the hill is expensive.

Castles & Cobblestones. Stonework, churches, cobblestones and small shops - a wonderful way to spend a few hours. Throw in incredible views of the Danube and the Pest side of Budapest and you have fairy-tale scenery. Worth a visit while in town.
So much to see. Not only was the castle interesting but walking around all of the cobblestone streets was worth the visit. The views were spectacular.

Lovely old area. I did a walking tour of Budapest and we went up to the Castle Hill area, you get fantastic views looking back to the Pest side of Budapest. The streets are cobblestones so a bit hard to walk on until you get used to them. It only took about 10 - 15 mins from the bottom to walk up, there are a couple of different ways you can go but both ways had some steps but mostly a path which made it quite easy to get up to the top. The area is quite nice with lovely old buildings everywhere. They have guards at the Castle standing out front and I saw them doing a changing of the guards which was good, I think it was 3pm so maybe they do this every hour.

Train trip through Switzerland & Austria. Enjoyed walking around on Castle hill and reading some of the history on the plaques. Observed the noon changing of the guard at the presidential palace which was interesting. Not quite like Buckingham Palace but interesting to watch anyway.

The view is amazing!. The Castle Hill or Castle District area is filled with historic sights and attractions like the Royal Palace, Matthias Church, medieval houses, museums, souvenir shops and charming cobble-stoned streets lined with some good cafés. The view of Budapest from the top of this area is stunning and really takes your breath away. Anyone visiting Budapest must visit the Castle District! Just spend time walking around and enjoying the sights!
Great views, walks, restaurants. Spend a day if you can - take your time - enjoy! Liked restaurants away from main area, the views were beautiful, take the vehicular!
HISTORY OF BUDA.... the changing of the guards, the panoramic views down the funnicular...chain bridgethe royal palace and museums.. matias templom/church and fishermans bastion

Don't miss this, it's lovely. We took a taxi from our hotel to the top of the hill. Only taxis, buses and the Funicular train car can take you the top. Otherwise you walk. Given how much we'd been walking and how tired our feet, knees, backs were we decided to start out with the taxi ride up and save our energy and muscles for the walk around the top. It was a great decision.The castle was largely destroyed during WWII and the revolution, so it's a modern rebuild that gives you the feeling of what it looked like before. The white stones they used are lovely - it gives it all the feeling of the Lord of the Rings "The White City" (or Minas Tirith for fellow geeks) - the City of Kings. Very photogenic reconstructed area. The views from the castle area across to the Parliament and down the river and up the river are fabulous. There are fun souvenir shops, lots of restaurants, and lovely buildings everywhere. We walked the entire length of the hill in each direction and enjoyed all of it. We watched the guards at the top of the Funicular march and change positions. Very cool. We didn't go into the museum but we did enjoy the garden and walking around around it. We rode the Funicular down to save the impact on our knees of going downhill by foot. Then walked across the Chain Bridge and back to our hotel. We spent about 4 to 5 hours (including lunch break) enjoying the whole hilltop. Just delightful. Part of it reminded us of smaller and less commercial version of the Royal Mile in Edinburgh. I took lots of photos of the lovely architecture, doors, etc. My husband had the macro/telephoto lens and got gorgeous shots of Pest side of the river as well as of the hilltop. It'll be fun combining and seeing what we got. The walking is mostly on cobblestones so wear appropriate foodwear.Overall: Don't miss this...it's a lovely outing. Allow time to really savor the feeling of the beautifully restored hilltop.

Fab Funicular and views!. We went up to visit the Buda Castle but before taking the funicular railway I needed the loo. There are toilets but you have to pay 150 Forints! We took the railway because being British we luv these little seaside things! At the top were some soldiers on guard outside who looked very pleased when my daughter stood next to him for a piccy and did some changing of the guard display which was cute! the grounds are beautiful there is an amazing fountain and my son got to try some Medieval Sports,archery,spear chucking etc which he loved. We walked through some lovely cobbled streets where the buildings riddled with bullet holes were still standing along with areas where buildings had been levelled in the 2nd world war bombings! The restaurant opposite it was a lovely place and served a mean egg mayo baguette! You can use the toilet in the restaurant but if you are not eating there it costs 100 HUF .Photo opportunities are wonderful.You can then walk along to the Fishermen's Bastion .Well worth a visit!
Another great view point. Wish I had more time to spend here as it was a beautiful area. Views are wonderful second only to Citadel. Worth a visit.

what a great lookout. Amazing the amount of restoration that has been done up here.In WW2 nearly everything on this top was destroid either by the Germans or the Russians, then more damage during the revolution.Now so many things have been rebuilt or restored, it is a show peace of free Hungary!!!!!!
Budapest Castle. Worth the trip - we used the tour bus and also walked up from the chain bridge. The views are fantastic.

Beatiful historic buildings. great little antique shops, good service, not too expensive a good place to spend a day. Wander the back streets a bit away from the main tourist areas, explore the little antique shops I found some beautiful old estate jewellry items there which were not at all too expensive.

Castle with great views. Well worth the trip and best to use the vehicular to the top. When you get to the top the views are spectacular across the Danube and if you get the timing right you can see the changing of the guard
Worth visiting. Great views of the city from the ramparts of castle hill. Architecturally interesting collection of buildings, archeological sites, cobbled stoned streets and museums.

Awesome panoramic views for photography, history and quaint Midieval feel. Located on the Buda side on a hill overlooking the city, the Castle Hill is a must on a clear day. You can walk the shops and cafes on the way to the top where the St. Matthias church is and also a castle wall area that you can walk across at your leisure and get great panoramic views of the major city landmarks.

Great place for a full day walkabout. There is a lot to see on the Buda side of the river starting at the base of the Chain Bridge. Not really worth taking the funicular as the walk up the hill is hardly strenuous. And once you have seen the Castle there is a ton to see as you walk along the top of the hill. Lots of restaurants too. Definitely a good day trip.
Wonderful scenery. This is a must see/visit. High up in the old town offering spectacular views over the city. Many visitors yet strangely peaceful.

beatiful view, nice walk, well you cannot leave Budapest without it. this can get real crowded so plan your visit. you climb up there with a nice cable gondola, you have a beatiful view on the Danuba, the bridges and the Pest part of the city. you can have a relaxed walk in the old castle and its suroundings, avoid the close by restaurants which are tourists traps and just enjoy the beatiful scenary.
It doesn't get more beautiful. I had no idea of the beauty of this country until I saw it with my own eyes. Beautiful! A walk so be prepared, but it's so worth it.
Astounding view. big tourist destination to take fabulous pictures and see scenic views of Budapest. shops, food vendors ( I had an incredible poppy seed strudel) Don't miss it.

Spectacular Architecture and Beautiful Views. No trip to Budapest would be complete without a visit to Castle Hill. Stroll the streets, visit the cathedral and castle and drink in the views of the Danube and Pest.

Great views of the Danube and Pest. There is lots to see on the walk around the Castle Hill; we caught a wedding going on and that only added to the enjoyment of the experience. It was a lovely day weather wise which also helped. We stopped for something to drink in the courtyard that overlooks the river and Pest and if you can get a table close to the outside with these views, be sure to do it.
Interersting. Lots to see and do. Time it with a festival and enjoy local cuisine. You could easily spend most of the day there.

Spectacular views!. This is the best place to see the Pest side of the city. Castle Hill has some of the most breathtaking views of Parliament. It's just amazing. I can't explain it. It seems like you are looking at a postcard. We were lucky, because our Hotel was located right across the street from the church, part of the castle wall surrounded us. It is VERY touristy mind you. If you are not wanting there to be TONS of tourists your best bet it to get there around 7:00am or 11:00pm if you want to take pictures without other people being in the way. Any other time than that there will be BUS LOADS of tourists. This is one of the main attractions on the Buda side of the city. However, it's worth it to plan it out and try to make it at those ridiculous times. Castle Hill itself does not have an attraction fee. If you decided you want to go into the Castle itself or any of the castle's little buildings surrounding the castle you will have a fee. Also, if you are DRIVING there are fees to go up the hill, like a toll. There are no people manning these tolls. I believe you can pay with a credit card.

View of City. Lovely views of the river & City very historical site it is an easy walk from the Buda side opposite the Chain bridge, tour and local buses also go there. There are lots of reasonable places to eat.
