The changing of the Guards is very nice to watch when we were there there were men in local costume with beautiful birds of pray to see close up and have a picture taken. it was very busy even though it was bitterly cold but the views are worth getting off the bus for.

History of Budapest. It's full of stuff to see and you won't get bored at all up there, I think I spent 3-4 hours and this without entering the main tourists attractions. Also the view from there is absolutely amazing...

Fantastic. The Castle Hill area was spectacular; from the Palace to the Cathedral to the Fisherman's Bastion, all were beautiful. We spent several hours on two afternoons visiting the area. The views of Budapest from the Fishermans Bastion are a must see on any visit. Also a ride up or down on the Funicular should be included in your visit.

Museums recommended, the rest is very touristy.. There is a Budapest history museum and Hungarian art museum which contained some very well put together displays. Note that the History museum ticket should get you into Aquincum as well.. which we didn't realize and ended up paying twice. These museums are in the quieter palace section of Castle Hill. We spent best part of a day there.I found the rest of it a bit crazy with tourists, and tourist shops, but it was still nice to have a quick look around and take photos of the views. Food around the place is also more expensive than it should be. There seems to be a rejuvenation program going on which is half finished. It will be very nice when that is complete. Some of the pictures of the devastation during WWII were very moving, and some area of the hill still seem to be active archeological excavations.

The Castle. This was a good area to spend a few hours. My suggestion is to visit it in the morning during the summer as it is cooler, there are some nice food outlets and many attractive souvenir shops offering some traditional crafts.The table cloth designs can be hand crafted and show great skill. Many different sizes are available. A nice stall selling leather belts and wallets can be found on the main walkway to the castle.
good. good view the city, there is a entrance near the train that is perfect to take pictures from the bridge

Amazing views. Stopped off here on the bus and had a wander round, the views were stunning and found a lovely café which served cakes. Sitting in the sunshine people watching it couldn't get much better than this.

A great way to pass a day.. I went up on the funicular - a great way to start. Then the guard outside the Presidential Residence were fine upright young men, totally undistracted by the tourist attempts to disturb themOn the walk right round to the Church at the other end, there is a terrific shop for blouse, shirts, souvenirs that I go back to every time I am in Budapest. The staff are very helpful and they remembered me from 12 months ago. Made welcome as soon as I walked in.

Loads of tourists, but worth it!. Must visit! Try and plan your visit early in the morning. After 11 it really becomes a tourist-place but still a great place nonetheless. Beatiful buildings and lots of history.
lots to see. there is so much to see you need to take a day, take the little tram up and enjoy the view on the danube

Well worth the visit, views are ace.. You can see all of Budapest from here - both sides of the river.
At the Castle there are 3/4 attractions - definetly at least half a day here.
Nice walk. We get to the district by the bus 16 and since it was perfect.. The castle and its surrounding was really nice, a lot to see,nice view.

Spend some time over here. It's a good little hike to get up here, but there's plenty to do. I didn't go into the museum, but St. Mathias is beautiful on the outside- the architecture is amazing! There's plenty of shops and restaurants around to get a bite to eat or get some souvenirs. Take the time to go to the hospital cave too if you have time. The outside also gives some good photo opportunities of the city, so enjoy!
Great Place to Take Pictures!. We stopped at this cafe for a drink and were serenaded by a violinist. The architecture is beautiful! I would suggest taking the funicular instead of the stairs!

A Must Visit. This is the fairy tale part of Budapest. The best views of the Pest side are here. The castle is no longer there so don't go looking for it. The buildings are now galleries and the home of the president but still worth the visit. Lots of improvement work going on in the area but it didn't spoil things for us. The area will only be better for it.
Beautiful area. View was beautiful, area very historic, great day there. Prepare for walking but enjoy all. Visit as much as you can.

Spend a day here, you need it!!. This place is a cultural theme park...great food (resturants and cake shops), beautiful churches, other sights obviously the castle (a couple of hours), labyrinth, hospital cave, museums. Get the Funicular to the top if you're legs can't take the hike!!
Hill with fabulous View. If you don't go anywhere else in Budapest make a beeline for the Castle district, WOW! what a view! The changing of the guard is different with the addition of drumming!

Nice stroll to the castle. Some options are available to go to the castle : take the bus - nothing spectacular will happen, take the funicular- rapid, old, authentic or stroll up (or down) to the castle - easy, plenty of time to enjoy the views, cheap, healthy. Do it if you have time. Choose the funicular if you are in a hurry.

Excellent view. great panoramic views overlooking the Pest side - we travelled up in the Funicular railway - only lasts few minutes but good views and you arrive at the top with breath left to appreciate the architecture and views.
Well worth a visit!!. My friend and i had a great time exploring! The scenery from the castle overlooking the Danube was absolutely stunning!! Not to be missed!!

Nothing special. Maybe I'm a little jaded about this place because I live in Budapest, but I don't think it's particularly wonderful. The best picture photo-ops of it are from the across the river, and of course it makes a dramatic sight from the shore. Nevertheless, actually going up to it is not that special of an experience, unless you're really into museums (which is what the castle now is). The views are nice, but the ones from the top of Gellert Hill are much better, and the surrounding shops and streets are much like anything else you'll find in the overpriced, touristy areas of a lot of European cities. And speaking of tourists: Castle Hill is definitely where you'll find them. It's overrun, even in off-months. However, I will admit that the interior of Matthias Church is kind of cool; that's the only reason I'm giving this hill three stars instead of two. When I saw the church, there was a lot of construction going on, but it was still pretty cool and I imagine once the construction is done it will look even cooler than it did then.

Beautiful. I would recommend visiting this area of Budapest. The view is stunning and the streets, restaurants and bars are all amazing, there is just a general feeling of calm and everything is so picturesque and quaint. Loved it.

Better outside then inide. Not worth the money to go inside.I liked the surroundings and the view (outside). But inside is not very special if you have visited beautiful churches. This one is a bit odd, and that's it.
Well worth a visit. I was hear in February and it was quite overcast and was snowing so couldn't see much but on a good day this would be the prefect spot to look over the hole city.

Good day out!. Beautiful views of the city and lots of stores and restaurants to visit. There are around 5-6 sites we visited during our day here including the cathedral, the palace, and some of the key lookout points. Really good place to spend your day!

Must Do. If you're in Budapest you have to climb up the hill and look over Budapest. The castle is great, and the architecture around the little castle town is typical, classic Europe. Plus for your whole stay you look up at Buda Castle on the hill, it makes you realize how high up you are, and everything you can see.
A must see. It's a vast area with beautiful views, old historic buildings, cafes. We had a very relaxing walk and felt the atmosphere of an old town.

Beautiful. Mathias church is a must see. Children will find the labryinth fascinating,where allegedly count Dracula was imprisoned .Walk in the lanes which lead to hospital in the rock, very picturesque.

Be sure to go with a tour guide. The castle and surrounding area is really beautiful. I would recommend to go there with some tour guide. I joined a free tour guide. The guide definitively will explain the historical significance of the area.
PS people say that there is a bus. I didn't see it. Thus prepare yourself for an extend up and down hill walking experience.

nice. It's a large area, but it wasn't cosy. We liked the view on Pest. You can go there by cable cart or bus 16 or walk.The Budapest history museum is very nice, the National gallery was a disappointment, very small inside.The changing of the guards at the presidential residence was nice.The Mátyás church is very beautiful, but there was a reconstruction going on, with a lot of noise. The Fisherman's Bastion has a nice view on Pest.
cultural indulgence. Churches, museums, galleries, intriguing streets, grand views over the city and curious courtyards; a veritable feast to delight and satisfy even the most jaded tourist.

A pleasant and informative day out. My husband and I spent a whole afternoon in the Castle Hill District which is located on the Buda side of the Danube River. It offers scenic historic walks. We used a Hop-on Hop-off bus to get there. The Castle District is a part of Budapest's Heritage Site. Castle Hill offers medieval buildings and Barogue cobblestone streets. There are great views of the city, the Danube, and surrounding countryside. This area was reduced to rubble during World War II and is now restored. While we were there we visited Matthias Catholic Church that we found worthwhile.We also got to watched the changing of the Guards at the offices of the President which was interesting and entertaining.
Visit to the castle. Fascinating buildings, museums, shops, eateries. Oh and hotels. It is like a little town. Fabulous views over to Pest the Danube is massive.
View!. Even though is quite high, the climbing is worth to see view of Pest. I think is wort to see during the day and during the night when the city is iluminating.

Beautiful area. Wonderful architecture surrounded by cobbled streets and amazing views over the city. Lots of photo opportunities. Make sure you have a good walk around and don't just stick to the main area by the Fisherman's Bastion. 'Eyewitness Travel' gives you a nice little walking route around it which pretty much covers it all. Had lunch at a nice little cafe on the defensive walls overlooking the city. A must see area when in Budapest.
Lovely views. We used the funicular to go up to the castle and then , having looked around the area we walked down through the grounds back to the Chain Bridge.

A Great Way to Start. Take the funicular up to Castle Hill. It's a great way to begin your tour of Budapest. Superb views, cobbled streets, quiet alleyways, cafes, bars and restaurants. Take a full morning to stroll around and soak up the atmosphere and the history of this splendid hill.

You should do it!. It is a very good experience and you should definitely go there. The view is amazing and there is also a nice cafe-bar where you can enjoy the view and also have your drink. It's on the pest side and you can either take a small like monorail which you have to pay or just go on foot.
Another great vantage point. More history for those who are history and political junkies. The view from here is without question a must see

nice views. Take a walk around. The funicular was being serviced when we went so we walked up and down. Take the little doorway on the right as you walk up for the short cut. Walk down the long route.

Must Visit Area. This is a fascinating area to visit, full of history and yet lively and full of fun. The castle itself has been destroyed and rebuilt on more than one occasion. A visit to the museums will take you on a journey from the first settlement on the castle hill to present day. Walking along the quaint streets will allow you to find and explore lovely little shops and there are many bars cafe's and restaurants to cater for every taste.
great city views. We recommend going early to the castle district before the tour groups arrive. The tour of the Hospital in the Rock was the most interesting attraction.

Amazing views - great bus service. The best thing about Castle Hill is the views, both towards Pest across the river, and across Buda, and at night the vista is different again when the prominent buildings and bridges are floodlit.To get up to the Castle area, the 16 bus is excellent. Although small, it runs frequently, connecting Szell Kalman Ter (Moscow Square), over Castle Hill, and Deak Ferenc Ter (where the three metro lines cross).

Interesting restorations. I liked that they used old material to reconstruct the buildings and mixed he old and new. Prices were higher than at he central market, but we found a delicious pastry shop.
Touristy. Very pretty, but beware of the prices. Whilst not expensive by London standards, it was more expensive than lower down. Public oilets expensive.
So nice. This is my favourite place in Budapest, my home-town. If the weather nice I always go there with my girlfriend to just hang around.

So much to see and do!. We spent a long leisurely day in the Castle District visiting the Castle, Palace, Fishermans Bastian and the Ruszwurm - the Oldest Coffee House in Budapest! So much to see and do, fabulous views and a really interesting visit.

Timing is everything. First time we intended to go up it was a Saturday. Long queue for the railway and crowds at the top and bottom put me off so we went and found something else to do. Went back again about lunchtime on Monday and got straight on the train and were at the top in no time. Being pressed for time we gave the museum a miss. Pleasant views over the city if you want to photograph the chain bridge or Parliament from another angle but, in my humble opinion, nothing to rave about.

Hapsburgs abound. Very impressive building and well positioned. A very nice break from the hustle and bustle of Pest. We walked the little enclave from the castle to Matthias Church. The only building definitely not belonging - was a Hilton Hotel, right next to the Matthias Church. Definitely out of place. How could they allow that?

Great view and lovely location. I recommend to everyone to have a walk around the Buda Castle. Its worth the trip, you can see whole Pest and enjoy the sunny weather on the terrace of the lovely restaurant :) U can also try the Siklo to go up the hill.

Spectacular views, for free!. There is so much to do up here. We found a lovely book shop which sold English titles (towards the military museum), a very nice chocolate shop, and the market of traditional Hungarian and Magyar gifts and wares. There is also the Parliament building, which has some very nice gardens overlooking the Danube and the rest of the city. You can also explore the caves under the hill, and there are numerous small museums and quaint little shops down the quieter alleys.

Fantastic View. Wunderschöner Blick über Budapest, hochfahren am Besten mit der Zahnradbahn, Rückweg zu Fuß durch die Altstadt. Perfect View, very nice. Take the way up with the cog railway. On your way down the hill discover the city around the castle by foot.

Free, lots of tourists though. Lots of tourists there, pick-pocketers are there as well for sure... Nice Hilton hotel on top :) Free to look around in a very nice area, you can go there easily by bus 16 from Deak Ferenc ter.

Great views. Lovely views over the city. Paid for the Fisherman's bastion towers but views didn't really seem any better there than elsewhere. Some nice architectural features also.Very crowded though so maybe best to go early.

the best view of Budapest, not to be missed.... Charming view, the Danube river, with its bridges form an outstanding picture. Try to have a look from different points, you will see so lovely sites of the city. It is so interesting to wonder around on the hill, a lot to be photographed every where. Prepare yourself for a long walk on an uneven land, but it is so wonderful place' that stays in the memory, because you can get the geography of the city from that high point. Have a good day.

Beautiful, but crowded with tourists. Of course this is a must on a visit to Budapest. The colorful, restored buildings are beautiful, the cobblestone streets amazing, Matthias Church breathtaking. But the tour groups jockeying for position can make it a little overwhelming in the daytime, and it is filled with tourist trap shops and museums instead of the more authentic offerings you can find by roaming the Pest side of the city. If you're not with a tour group, try visiting early in the morning before the crowd descends, or else close to sunset for a spectacular view of the Parliament building. Nighttime also is a good time. The church and the Fishermen's Bastion are well-lit, and you can still get outstanding views.

Very Good Views. As other have said, you can get quite spectacular views and photos from up there, especially on a nice day. Although we were there towards the end of March and it was very cold, we were lucky enough to stop up there on the Friday, when it was nice and sunny. We managed to get a good few photos for our collection and would advise that you make the effort to get yourself up there, during your visit to Budapest.

Another nice view of Budapest. This provides you with a viewpoint of Budapest like you will get nowhere else. However, this is all that is here. I travelled in March 2012 and Budapest was covered in snow. This was lovely, however, walking or climbing to the top of the hill was quite something. Across Budapest the roads and pathways were kept in incredibly good order by the local authorities, however, the hill side steps to the top were quite dangerous. Furthermore, the walk is not easy going. I witnessed a few people taking breaks while others trudged up step after step. You will be glad to know you can get a cab, or a bus to the top of the hill which will be necessary if you find walking difficult.
Fabulous views. Well worth the walk up to the Buda Castel and Fishermans' Bastillion with amazing views across Buda Hills and Pest.
all tourist go here. its a nice place to see budapest from the top! You can walk it from the other side but its uphill. Best is to walk down to the river across.

Worth the walk up. the view from top of the hill is worth the visit alone, the walk up was energetic so was glad it was not overly hot, we started at the cave church which is also worth a look round, we then walked up to top of hill to take advantage of view / photo opportunity,,,this is likely the best best or Buda and the Danube you will get

Great Views, Shops and Architecture. All the locals will tell you that this is the best place to visit in Budapest, and they're right. Check out the Art Gallery in a former Castle, St. Matthias Church and Fisherman's Bastion. Shop around for some interesting souvenirs and enjoy the astounding views of the city!

Fascinating. This area of Buda was teeming with museums and lovely old buildings. St Matthews church is stunning. The only drawback is the shedloads of tourists in large parties - it must be a lovely place to be on a quiet evening, if there ever is one!

Interesting to walk around.. This was a fun place to walk around even in the snow but the highlights are definitely Matthias' Church and the Hospital in the Rock. There is a wonderful view back to the Pest side which is also well worth the visit. We visited during a snow storm so visibility was not great and the funicular was not running. The view must be really something on a clear day. The only negative was that we were accosted by a local who heard us speaking english and then told my husband to shut up and listen when he politely declined the man's offer of a tour...he went on muttering disparaging comments about Americans as we moved away. We were armed with Rick Steve's guide so we needed no guide for Castle Hill.

want to feel like you are in Prague?. Castle Hill on the Buda side of Budapest has a great feel to it. Very Prague like with Baroque architecture, great shops and places to eat. Dont miss St Steven's, the Castle, the overlook or the ruins, all well worth seeing.

Take time.... There are many tourist attractions on the hill but do allow time to simply take in the atmosphere and, of course, the views. There is a tendency to rush off to the museums etc without taking time to simply 'be' and enjoy. We visited in early April and it was freezing cold but even so, it was worth lingering awhile and take it all in.
Sure worth seeing. Very nice walk with great views at the city and a lot of sights on the way. We loved palace and Mathias cathedral

A lot to see, a lot of people.. Be aware of the scams! Don't buy anything up here as its all way over priced, as is everything on the Buda side. It is worth walking up there though and seeing all the cool buildings. Make sure you notice the plastic windows in the palace!

changing of the guard. went up to the castle hill on the hop on hop off bus and whilst looking around saw the changing of the guard ceremony and it is a very enjoyable show which you feel part of due to the proximity you find yourself

beautiful area with fantastic views (+ 2 yummy snacking tips). there are many great museums, churches and vistas up in the Castle District - you can easily spend a fun afternoon (or day) here. Litea is a lovely bookshop/conservatory/ tea house in the Fortuna courtyard, opposite the Hilton Hotel, where you can enjoy nice coffees and cakes. Also try the fresh-made, hot Kurtoskalazs (Funnel or Chimney Cakes) for sale at the CBA (I think that's the name of the grocery chain)

Little middle aged feeling. Bearing the history of Hungarians. Good choice for locals and foreigners to visit. Go to one of the museums, have a cake in Ruszwurm, a silent break at the Matthias church...walk around and take a rest in the Castle Garden. Maybe a performance in the Dance Theatre in the evening. What else you want for a perfect relaxing day?
Too many tourists. The hill was full of tourists even though it wasn't even the high season. Half of the hill is dull (although quite pretty) with embassies and such. The views are great, though.

Castle Hill District. Took a private walking tour through Castle Hill. It was very nice. I enjoyed all the information and history that the tour guide provided. It was a raining day but we still enjoyed our morning there.

Nicest when out of the crowd. This is a very pleasant place to stroll around, with ample space to get away from the inevitable crowds. My tip would be to have a drink in a café, such as the Walzer Café away from the main area, as you can use their toilet for free, rather than pay 200 florints for use of the manky public loo where the partition walls don't even hang together.

What a great view! Awonderful sight.. I liked the architecture' the wonderful view over the city of Pest' particularly the parliament building.I thing the visit inside thr Matash atedral is really unnecsssary,At the cafe on the corner you can get the best "Creme Shnitt"
Very cool. Im sure a disney princess lives here, very cute, better if it's not too cold , dont forget u should take bus number 16 from chain bridge, that way is easier for u too clomb the hill

Boring. I've been here three times, and I always aks my self, what is so special of this place. A few of (rebuilt) old houses, the rebuilt royal castle, souvenier shops, touristice restaurants (and yes, the view over the Danube and Pest).
great views. allow an hour or so to mosey around. well worth a look. The hilton has an amazing wine tasting celler below the hotel which is definitely worth a visit

Walk it! Great views. I liked the walk up the hill and the views are so rewarding - right across the river, Parliament and on the other side the houses and the hills. There is plenty of places to get food.
Magical. Fisherman's Bastion is like something out of Disney. Watch out for pickpockets at bus stops - they will take advantage of the crush of people trying to get on buses.

Beautiful view. The only regret I have about visiting is the timing, we managed to visit in the middle of a snowstorm. However, that is not the fault of this breathtaking place and we have many amazing pictures to remember it by.Simply stunning.Just don't forget to visit Fisherman's Bastion just down the road from the castle, possibly my favourite part of the whole trip.On a side note - ensure you either have change or ensure you visit the little room before you go!

Hiking up. It is a beautiful square up the hill, you can do a hike up starting from the chainbridge, it will take around an hour or maybe longer. There is also a bus going up full with tourist, once you are up there there is loads to do, and there are also little shops who sell tourist things, The view over Pest is great:)

Excellent view of parliament and danube and good place to walk around. Castle we took the funicular both ways which is very expensive there is also a bus going to castle hill ( I believe bus #16) that will be a cheaper option. But this place has many things to seeand must see

Stunning!. We walked to the funicular and took the trip up. The views of the city and Danube were fabulous and we were able to walk freely about, exploring the lovely old town. It's hard to believe this area was flattened during the war, but it was and the authorities have made a great job of restoring it to its former glory. Take time to explore the little shops and there are a couple of really good cares where food and drink are reasonably priced.
Great visit. Although in freezing temperatures, it was a great visit ! The castle has breathtaking panoramic views on Budapest and by itself is a marvelous place to visit.

Beautiful View A Must See. High upon a hill is Castle Hill, you get great views of the Pest side of the City, you are also right next to City Hall, there is also a restaurant there and vendors there. This is a great place to take pictures and a short walk will take you to Fisherman's Bastion.

Fantastic! ( plus a photo heaven, read a tip here ). You can't miss this. So many interesting things to see, so beautiful view, fantastic. One tip - use the Hop on Hop off bus system, so you can use one ticket to go around the city. And - after you see Castle Hill, plan to have the last stop on Gellért Hill and sunset, so you can take the most amazing pictures, take a look here!!

City Views. Choose a clear day to visit castle Hill for terrific views over the Danube and Budapest. The funicular is the best way up if you've crossed the bridge on foot and at 1000 HUF is worth it saving time and effort

Not to be missed. Very beautiful view of Danube and Chain Bridge from the hill.Lot of places to see on the Castle Hill.First there's Buda Castle when you climb up the hill.Then there are lot of nice statues,cafes,museums,souvenir shops,the labyrinth(which is among a row of houses/cafes..a little patience required to find it but not tough to find).Then there's Matthias Church,Fisherman's Bastian(paid if you want to go on terrace).All this you can cover on foot.But if you dont wanna walk back then you can take bus from the stop near the church, to reach nearest metro/tram station.

Excellent and breathtaking viewpoint. It's a beautiful viewpoint on top of there. My favorite was that there was some gentlemen with Hawks and Eagles and I managed to have one for a picture. It was very peaceful being up there seeing an entire city at work.

Castle Hill former Hungarian Royal Castle. One of the exclusively functional mass transportation in Budapest with scenic view is Bus #16 from Deak SQ to Szél Kálmán SQ or vice versa. Great way to the fairy tail.
Fairytale!. What a beautiful place! Lots of little cafes, shops, etc. Small country side town feel.Stay on the Pest side and visit the Castle Hill one day.

Worth the effort!. Worth the climb, if you are on foot. The area around the castle and Matyas church is well kept, with attractively renovated buildings. Some of these, including the palace, have been rebuilt. Although we did see locals around, you get a bit of a sense of it that it is really just serving tourists. However, prices in the local shops and restaurants are not out of the way.
Excellent view over the river and Pest. Nice to wander round through the streets and stop in the cafes, although this time we had freezing weather and strong winds, so this put a damper on things.
Beautiful. Fantastic city views, beautiful buildings. A must see, particularly St Mathias church! If you can, walking up the hill is also very enjoyable.
Great views of Pest. Visiting the Castle district in Buda is a must. Take advantage of walking around the pictoresque cobbled streets around the castle.
Lovely area to stroll around. Great coffee shop near to Hilton Hotel. Has exhibition of marzipan creations for just over £1 entry.
Views all over Budapest. Able to just walk along the streets stopping at cafes (Good one over the supermarket opposite St Matthias)

Very beautiful and a great stroll. Castle Hill is one of the most impressive parts of Budapest and shouldn't be missed. Walking around this part of Buda makes for a great afternoon. Bring a camera. Budapest is a very beautiful city
lovely. worth a visit have a drink and a cake in one of the cafes very cheap n nice. Lovely views. worth a visit.
Lovely sights. The views from the castle are wonderland. A place to visit. A must in Budapest. I would like to go again.

Lovely Castle, Great views. Great place to have a wonder around, fantastic views, take a camera!
Not to far to walk from the town center, its over a bridge and up a reasonable hill or you can take a ride to the castle up the old cable car.

Nice Walk. Castle Hill is a nice are to walk around, with some very good restaurants, a few Hungaricum shops, a nice park, and a wonderful walk along the (built to look like) fortifications overlooking the Duna, the Chain Bridge, and the Pest downtown. It's a great place to take pictures as well.
really enjoyable. overall spent a great couple of hours here was well impressed with all the fine buildings,loads of people there very popular.food and drink available,well worth a visit
turrets castle. looked like something from a fairy tale,and was free beautiful Mattias Church in grounds lovely mosaic roof.Attached to Palace so killed two birds with one stone.

Great views. Many museums and a few places to eat. We visited the national museum and the war museum. We also had dinner in the same area, and stopped in a small cafe. The architecture and feel of the area is great, almost no car traffic (so very walkable). Since it's located on a hill above Budapest, the view is great offering many photo opportunities.

Its good. This is a main tourist attraction in Budapest. It is fun taking the funicular is to the top, although it cost about 4 dollars to get to the top. It is basically like riding a street car in San Fran, you have to do it. We bought a one way ticket and walked down, which is what I would recommend. At the top you can get your photo taken with some Buckingham Palace style soldiers. Buda Castle is to the left, which is a museum now. The area in front of it has good views of Pest. To the right of the funicular is everything else. The only real things to do is the Cathedral and the Fisherman's Bastion. The Cathedral was being refurbished when we where there, which means you cannot see much of the insides, but it is a cool one. All the insides are painted in a way I have not seen in other European Cathedrals. Fisherman's Bastion is just a castle looking structures with good views of the Parliament. The walk down is not very tough, takes about 5 mins. Overall, I would not spend more than 2.5 hours here, but it is worth seeing.
Great views. This was worth the walk...spectacular views of Budapest from top. Take the elevator if you see it...100 HUF is worth it! Great shopping and cafes around as well.
Lovely!. The views from Castle hill are amazing. The structure is absolutely beautiful... pristine and glowing white above the Danube.

Like a fairy tale. There is nothing you can say that you don't like. Generally this part of the city is a must-visit. By visiting the castle and seeing all other buildings and sight seeings in this area you travel to the past. If you want beautiful photos that is the place.
For great views of Pest. A must place to visit. The views across to Pest are superb and there are so many streets to explore.
Wonderful view of the city. One of the most touristic places to go,but it worths it. You do not need a lot fo time and can combine it with Fisherman's Bastion

Best views plus great buildings/sites. This area has the most awesome views of Pest, including the Parliament building, all the bridges, Margaret's island, and more. The Matthias Church, Fisherman's Bastion are stunning. The small roads with private residences lining them were very picturesque. One could easily spend all day seeing everything here. The view of Buda from the other side on the walkway was beautiful as well.

Beautifully Kept. We statyed at the Buda Castle Fashion Hotel (see separate review) so got to know the area really well. I would recommend staying on the hill and heading off into town and the Pest side. Things look further away than they are. We could do Castle Hill to the other side of the Chain Bridge in 20minutes.It is beautifully kept. Tidy, all the buildings look fantastic. I would probably just suggest not eating on the hill. Bit of a tourist trap and incredibly inflated prices for rather average food.

Well worth the visit. You will need at least two full days for the Castle Hill area, the labyrinth takes at least an hour, the museam of the History of Hungry half a day (ask for the audio tour) the bunker hospital tour is another hour, we didnt get to do the Art museum as we had to decide which of the tours we wanted.

great views of Budapest. We were just going to stay for the morning here but there is so much to see, we didnt manage half of what we set out to, lots and lots of walking in this place. The fishermans bastion is a must see and the views from here are breath taking. Plenty a reasonably priced cafes we drank in one above the CBA supermarket a real gem with great rum hot chocolates.

Take your time. This is real picture postcard tourist stuff and if you walk around the whole thing and visit a couple of museums you need to allow half a day. Other reviewers have told you how to get there by public transport. The Funicular railway often does not run and when it does the queues can be very long. I prefer to walk, to the left of the Funicular there is a path which winds it's way up to the top. Periodically take a break and look around, plenty of spots for interesting pictures, especially on the bridge that crosses the Funicular, if you time it right you can get the upwards and downwards cars in the same pictures. If you have time you should visit the historic Ruszwurm Confectionery at Szentháromság u. 7. for a coffee and a cake. This has been open since 1827, has survived 2 sieges and the Russian invasion in the 1950s. Inside is cozy and the cakes are not for healthy eaters ;-) otherwise there are other tourist cafes around but they are not as classy. If you are at all interested in Military History the War Museum is a must, but when i visited 2 years ago very few of the displays have English descriptions. Even so it took me two hours to walk round, which bored my Hungarian girlfriend rigid, but a coffee and cake at Russwurm fixed that. The display about the defeat of the Hungarian 2nd Army at Stalingrad I found very moving. However she loved the Budapest Telephone Museum at Úri utca. 49 as she was a telecoms engineer and helped modernise the telecoms infrastructure after Communism finished. If you want to see "picture postcard" Budapest, this, and the Fisheman's bastion are a must. But the real history, in my opinion, is to be found in the old Jewish quarter around Dob Utca in Pest where the buildings are mostly unrestored. But that is another story.

Much more than the guidebooks say ..... We put aside three hours for this outing, in the end we stayed all day and still didn't see everything. The funicular is expensive but, hey, you're on holiday and once at the top the views are jaw-droppingly wonderful. The Fishermen's Bastion is lovely, the many cafes friendly and reasonably priced (the Goulash was invariably excellent everywhere - but it's soup, not a meal), the churches fascinating and the museums imposing and inviting. Give it a day and enjoy it all - or as much of it as you can.

walk. great walk and view when you get up there. take the fenicular railway great ride easy on the legs.
If you are into photography this is a must to get up there and pop away the views are breathtaking.

Budapest. Immense and a Unesco World Heritage site. Budapest and Pest are divided by the (blue?) Danube and each side is very different. The thermal spring baths are a must do thing and the one in the Central Park near Heroes Square allows you to wallow in the open air in 31 degrees of water. It is an ex communist state and the halls of Terror and candles of remembrance outside are a thought provoking sight.

Excellent view - a lot of construction work. If you stay on the Pest side, you must owe yourself this treat. Since it is on top of a, some would claim steep, hill, concentrate all your Buda-program on the sam day. Busses and an old cable cart (approc 1000 huf) can take you uphill, if you do not feel like stairs. This spring (2013) however, there is a lot of renovation going on. Skip the Mathias Church, as there is nothing to see beides construction.

Refreshing afternoon. Crossed the Danube over the beautiful Chain Bridge and took the old funicular to the top (do not buy round trip ticket). We started with a clam view of the Danube and Pest. We walked through the royal palace gardens on the southern end. The statues need maintenance badly as there is green rust all over. Than we walked through the interesting archaeological excavations without really understanding what was found. Next we stopped for a very tasty coffee and cake break at one of the famous coffee shops -Ruszwurm. The last leg of our visit was at Matthias Church and Fisherman’s Bastion where again one has great panoramic view. Going down we opt to walk the nice path leading back to the Chain bridge.
Nice. Would recommend a visit though in less you take public transport it is quite a lot of stairs to get up there. Not for people with buggys or the elderly.

Stunning Architecture, Ambience and Scenic Views. Don't miss this! We walked from the Pest side across the Chain bridge. The funicular was not running so we hoofed it. Not a bad walk at all. The old and worn but gorgeous achitecture and wrought iron is glorious. The views of the city are stunning. St. Stephen's Basilica, the statue of St. Stephen and the surrounding medieval castles were heavenly. We met a strolling violinist, had great experiences in the shops and restaurants stayed all day and had enough energy to walk all the way back. This is a case of a picture says a thousand words. Castle Hill was the most memorable point of our trip to Budapest. We retuned for dinner that night at restaurant Halaszbastya for a birthday dinner of a lifetime and a fabulous fairytale ending to the evening.
Castle Hill. Take bus number 16 from Deak Ferenc Ter to Disz Ter short wak to Castle. Short walk back from Castle to St Mattyas Church, Fishermans Bastion
As advertised. Castle Hill is famous for a reason - cracking views of the river and the city beyond, gorgeous old architecture and nice cafes to relax. A must for any visitor
Not very special. We went to the museums, but they are quite a different league than other famous museums. Especially the history museum is quite disappointing. It is closed on mondays.

Excellent panoramas and nice walk. I liked strolling on the castle hill because it's pleasantly green (well especially in spring), not too difficult to climb on top of it and it's rather small - you can take a tour in just an hour and see all the major sights it's packed with : the King's palace (where are located two main museums), the President's house, the Cathedral, the Fishermen fort and so on. From the Palace's terasse you can enjoy amazing views of Pest dominated by Parliament, Danube and its bridges. Don't miss it! What I also very much enjoyed was a walk on the city walls encircling all the castle area. I especially liked the constrast between the views of the very plain Pest District (from the Palace terasses or from Fishermen fort) and the hills of Buda and Obuda you can see from the other side of the Castle hill. And one final recommendation : if you are not extremely tired, there's no need to take the funicular, it is rather easy to climb on top of the hill enjoying the changing panoramas as you get higher..(and the ticket is anyway quite expensive for the two minutes you'll actually spend in the funicular).

Castle Area with a view!. We only did half of what could be done there! It probably needs a full day...with no rain.
We went to see Mathias Church and the Hospital in the Rock. We didn't go into the museums, as the wait was too long and it was too cold. I would recommend this for sure!

A must in Buda. Whether you climb or get the funicular up to the top, you must come here when in Buda. Stunning views, beautiful buildings, just make sure you keep walking to see Fishermans bastion and Matthias Church.

lots of things to see. A lot of beautiful things to see, all nearby. The change of the guards, Matthias Kirche, Fisherman's bastion, National Gallery, the oldest coffee house, ... pharmacist's museum, enough to spend the day!
Like Trumpton!. A great view worth the climb. We saw a mini changing of the guard! Great architecture too. A very good way to check/ get your bearings.

great view. Up in the Castle Hill, the view from the other side of the city is amazing!
Instead of going up through the Funicular, it's much cooler to do it on foot, although it might take 5 more minutes, it is totally worth.

Worth the trip. A must see - take the funicular up to the top and walk around the castle grounds, on to the Fisherman's Vastion and St Matias Church. Views are stunning. Whole area has a village feel to it and snowing when we arrived so looked magical!

Wonderful views and atmosphere.. Definitely worth the climb. The views over Pest are fantastic and the Var area is atmospheric and lovely to wander around. Don't bother paying extra to go to the highest level of the Fishermen's Bastion.

Everything is beautiful. Just Go and explore all things but i love Castle hill .
We didnt see the zoo but its in the summer maybe a great place to visit too .
Our holiday was in febr so we saw the ice skate center and it was very romantic with the castle view .

Nice view. My friend and I chose the Castle Hill to visit. The elevator towards was a special experience. It was quite cheap. You could spend a half day up there. The castle is worth it and the overcity-view too. There's a little market and some restaurants. After all it was worth it. Personally I think this experience is best in summer or when it's snowy.
Brilliant views over the Danube from Castle Hill. I enjoyed the wonderful views over the Danube, looking back towards Pest from Castle Hill. It was especially picturesque in the snow.

Fairy tale magic. We visited here on our first full day and walked over the chain bridge to the funicular. We went up on the funicular and then walked around the castle area before moving onto the Fishermans area. We walked back down the hill taking in a great bar and a restaurant called Lanchid which was a really retro music place. So pretty at the Castle very disney like.
Nicest part of the city. Quaint, and spectacular views across to Pest. Lots to see, and has places to eat. Just the right side of touristy.
Well worth the climb.. Great architecture, brilliant views of the Danube and Parliament building, the church is well worth a visit. Visit the little market for some mementos`.
Beautiful. Beautiful and wonderful views. Views of parliament and views of Pest skyline are the best and even though very cold it is worth it.

Discovered these sights by accident.. How do you visit budapest and miss a visit to the castle area - one bit of advice DON'T. great views, lots of interesting sights, plenty of bars and cafés. Reached by either metro, tram, bus, on foot (for the energetic) or via the vehicular railway.There was a really interesting hungarian guy offering a guided tour at the royal palace... take it or leave it, he was a funny guy.
Great view and more. Fanastic view with buda castle right there. Plenty of Good food choices around and some small craft markets.
Great views. A very nice walk up to an area full of history and great views of the city. Try the self service restaurant for lunch - cheap and good!

stunning views. good to walk up the hill..and its worth the effort...the fisherman bastion is not very far from the castle and is also worth a visit...the highlight of the walk is the stunning view of the Pest side - the parliament building and the chain bridge...dont miss it..

very pretty. Very nice walk up the hill in the snow, worth doing if you are going to Budapest, takes at least a couple of hours to make the most of it, although I think you can get there on the tourist buses

Atmospheric. Castle Hill in a howling blizzard is an exhilharating experience. I wish I could remember the name of restaurant where we thawed out over Gulyash soup, but it was almost opposite the church.

Such a beautiful place. This is like a film set from a Bavarian film! So very beautiful, the castle is awesome and so is St Matthias church. At night it just gets better. There's shops and restaurants so you can spend a good few hours here. We ate at a little pizza place called Osbudavar, very reasonbly priced and great pizzas, quite small with only 4 tables but great service comes from this.

Views galore and much more. . Beautiful area of the city with fantastic views. Well worth a visit both during the day and at night as the views of the parliment building all lit up is a real photographic opportunity. Lovely restaurants.

Magnificent panoramic views accross the city. The Varhegy is the hill on which the Buda Castle and Halaszbastiya is built and offers really nice views, both during the day and the evening accross the other bank of the Danube. When we visited it was snowing, it's a good place where you can stroll an hour of 2. From the chain bridge, there is a nice quiet road winding up leading you to some stairs to climb. But the hill can also be climbed from many other directions, like eg when you exit the metro at Batthany Ter.On top of the hill there are also a few very nice quiet streets with excellent restaurants

Snowy castle hill. Visited castle hill by the funicular train and it was snowing very hard! Walked to the fisherman bastian and it was so romantic! Drank mulled wine in ond of the turrets! Well worth a visit the castle area even in the snow!

Super views. Two options to access the castle hill: the funicular, at the end of the chain bridge, or walking up hill. I suggest taking the funicular up and using the west side to go down. The side streets are very romantic.The castle hill in itself is great, make sure not to miss the Matthias Church, the Fisherman's bastion and the hospital in the rock.

Beautiful views. You can either take the funicular railway up the hill (1700 huf return each) or there are 2 paths. One of them snakes around and takes you over the funicular. The other path (to the right) is more direct and takes you up to fishermans bastion. We went up there twice and used the funicular on the 1st occasion and walked on the 2nd. It was very snowy and slippy but only took us 10 mins. There are stunning views of the danube from the top and we certainly could have spent more time up there. Drinks are more expensive but there is a huge selection of bars and cafes. Definately worth a visit.

Great stuff!. Didn't particularly like the bunker tour but the rest was great. even the street vendors had jumpers for sale that , we later found out, were cheaper than in the shops in our hotel area.

Beauty of its own. The Castle Hill including the following sights: Castle Buda, Fisherman's Bastion, Mathias Church... some of them already reviewed by me. I recommend you to take a walk in the Castle, the small cobbled streets, passages, some very old buildings, it has a feeling, for sure!

Great views of the city. No trip to Budapest would be complete without a trip up Castle Hill, we took the small train up there for about £1.50 each and then walked back down. The views from the top of the hill of the Pest side as well as the Danube and chain bridge were great and provided some good pictures
Beautiful views. Definitely worth looking around this area - lots of gorgeous views of the city. Looks great from the river cruise also.

Just beautiful. We saw Castle Hill from our stay in the Intercontinental and it looked stunning from the opposite bank and we were not disappointed when we visited it. You can get the finicular railway up to it or walk which we did, I suggest the walk. You can also walk to fishermans bastion too which is very picturesque. We stumbled across the changing of the guard which happens at two different points and is worth seeing, I think it was about 2pm but dont quote me on that

Beautiful views and lovely buildings.. The buildings were roped off and there were police everywhere as there was a state visit happening on the day we went. The cable car was closed, and excavation works are ongoing, but it looks as though there will be more to see once this is complete - perhaps summer 2013?

The view is amazing. Seeing the Parliament building across the Danube is astounding. There is no view quite like it. From atop the Castle Hill area, you can find many unobstructed views across the river at this magnificent building. The area itself is also stunningly beautiful. World UNESCO protected the church, the walls, all the buildings are in wonderful condition and are open for you to walk around in and on. Climb to the top for a remarkable view as you get closer...or you can take the funicular if you want to do this experience in a quick way. Take your time up here and explore the back side, facing Buda as well - the difference between Pest and Buda really are showcased from this vantage point.

Budapest Castle and Fishermans Bastion. The views from the top of the hill are fantastic. You can get there by bus, tram or cable-car or hop on- hop off bus.. We took the cable-car up, but also did lots of walking. We spent a few hours in the castle and castle gardens. It was an extra, small fee, to go into the gardens. The garden wasn't in season yet but the frescoes on the walls were beautiful and we got plenty of exercise getting up and down the steep terraces.

The most romantic place in Budapest. I have to say that Budapest is very romantic city. I travelled with my girlfriend and we had a great time. We stayed in Budapest only 4 days but we have spend 3 evenings there just staring at the chain bridge and Danube. The view is outstanding and i really love it.

Nice view of the Pest side. Once you get to the Castle Hill you can enjoy the nice view of the Pest side and get a grasp of the size of Budapest. If you are lucky enough you might just see the changing of the guards also. Pretty nice after nightfall also as the lights do their magic.
castle hill. superb views, good architecture, excellent eating places.hot chocolate with rum is highly recommended in the winter

Nice Little Area. Great place to hang out for the day. I am not much for museums but this "little" hill has a lot of attractions. From the great Buda Castle, to Matthias Church, Fisherman's Bastion, The holy trinity monument, nice little shops. Be careful with the merchants in the center of town. Their prices are ridiculusly more here than anywhere I saw on the Pest side of town.

Beautiful area. This area is very beautiful. My partner and I took a trip to Budapest last month, and we thought that this was a wonderful area to walk around. We also went in the winter, and seeing the snow fall around the castle was a fantastic experience. Definitely put it on your to-do list.

Nice castle with great views. Really impressive location for a castle, and the views over the city are astonishing. The castle itself is not the fanciest around, but I guess that goes well with the modest Hungarians. :)

Must-see. What to see on one day trip to Budapest? Of course Castle hill. Splendid baroque(?) style, museums, churches. This + parliment are essence of Budapest. And this wonderfull landscapes after dawns...

Castle Hill. This place was really nice to walk around, had great views over the city and a lot to do and see around the area too! We went to some different museums and took a stroll around the grounds of the castle which was really nice. In the surrounding area all of the cafes, restaurants, etc. that we came across were expensive to eat at though, so I would advise eating before you get up there or bringing some snacks with you, so if you get hungry you don't have to pay extra just because you're in a 'tourist' area. We walked back into the city afterwards and went to a cheaper place to eat.

Stunning location and beautiful views of the whole city. I would spend a day wandering the streets there again. Very friendly people in the shops (many of whom spoke English). Loved the church, the Fisherman's Bastion and all the old buildings. A must-see!
History personified!. Loved the buildings - especially St Michael's church and the fabulous Fishermans's Bastion - views to die for

Great day of walking. I think there are a lot of reviews telling about the great views and restaurants on Castle Hill so I will tell you about a wondereful experience during our visit. We got to Castle Hill area during the annual Palinka and Sausage Festival...Palinka is a traditional brandy and if you think the Palinka you can get at the Central Market is what the average Budapest resident drinks you are wrong!!! The Palinka at the festival was so much better and you could get tastes at dozens of booths!!! I bought some of my favorites at the festival. The vendors were great!!! And the sausage was so good...wild boar sausage and so much more. Drank Palinka and soaked up sun!If you ever visit in the Fall and can get here...please do...almost a family experience! But with brandy!
Beautiful views. Take a stroll around the area! Wonderful music, local vendors, and beautiful views. Lovely attraction that's worth the visit.

Castle Hill. Great view of the city from here. We walked up, would be very difficult for some people who have walking difficulties or struggle with breathing etc but there was a local sightseeing bus which daily "drop off's" at this location. Great pictures from this location.
Beautiful view from the river bank. Beautiful architecture, nice view from the top and opposite river bank. Parade with guardians. Many artists playing medieval instuments.

fairy tale castle. A fairy tale castle, like the Disney's one, in the middle of a huge park, with the (frozen) ditch all around it. All covered by a thick snow layer. That was a sort of magic! A stone throw from Andassy Street and the thermal baths.

Castle Hill, Budapest. Matthias Church is superb. There was renovation work going on when we visited. However, there is still much to see and although it would have been better without the workmen etc. this was still an amazing visit to an amazing church.There are some beautiful views over the Danube to the Pest side. Especially of the Parliament. I would recommend going up Castle Hill during the day to visit the church etc. However, we made another journey up there when dark so that we could see the view of Pest with the Parliament all lit up. Also the lighting on Castle Hill of Fishermans Bastion and Matthias Church is beautiful.We went in the labyrinth and this is definitely worth a visit.

A great way to spend a day. Castle hill is a definite must do when in Budapest. So much to see, great views over Budapest. Heaps of cute restaurants and eateries. Clear a whole day and take the time to explore here.
Lovely view of Buda and Pest. Castle hill provided us with a beautiful panoramic view of the of Budapest and the Danube. Hungary has done a great job of reconstructing the area ravaged during WW II.

Good day out. Once up on the Castle district (you can use the Funicular or the number 16 bus from Pest, you will find the spectacular Matthias Church, The fisherman's bastion and super views across the Danube. plenty of other historical sites and museums.with plenty of restaurants and gift shops too.
Astounding. Spent a morning wandering around the various castles, and were amazed at the different styles and materials of the buildings. Attention to detail!!!

Worn proper walking shoes or boots. This area although compact has a lot to see and you can get lost walking in and out of the alleysways and side streest - I love to explore and wonder - but the views from the top are excellent and the gallery, cafe and castle grounds are interesting, we travelled up by the side cable car and walked down through the streets and alleyways - pity its winter and lots of plces closed in and aorund the area.

Wonderful view over the Danube and Budapest. From Castle Hill, you can observe all of Budapest and the Danube. It is a very nice walk, specially on a sunny day. The castles itself are beautiful, and there are restaurants to enjoy a good time.
Wonderful view. We can see the castle from our hotel room and today we went up there. We walked all the way and enjoyed the view over Pest. The castle is huge and with a lot of beautifully buildings.
wonderful landscape. it was snowing during my visit to the philosophers garden and I liked it very much- I loved the Cathedral and the castle
Looked beautiful in the snow. A great view of the city but very hazy when we visited. The snow however made the atmosphere so lovely

Take the walk. We visited Castle Hill back in November 2012 and very much a highlight of the weekend. Make the walk up and down, the cable cars always have a massive queue, it's not that far to walk and you miss the lovely sights and photo opportunities along the way in the cable cars. Once at the top there are even more views of the city below, lots of walks. There are cafes and mini supermarkets and some expensive restaurants and souvenir shops, but don't let that put you off. I would highly recommend a visit here. Enjoy!

Lovely stuff. Well worth a jaunt up the hills, have a walk over The Margaret Bridge & have a half day mooching around the streets & looking at the various ruins/monuments/changing of the guards ceremony. All in all, yes.

Beautiful Castle Hill. We were up at castle hill in the evening, it is just magnificent up there!! While none of the attractions were open, just wandering around was amazing and the way the parliament is lit up at night and the lights on castle hill are beautiful. It really is a must see when visiting Budapest
http://wanderlustmarriage.com/?p=1601
Beautiful Buildings. The royal Palace, The Hungarian National Gallery, The History Museum, and the Sandor Palace are here, all worth it to see. Beautiful views.

Walk up!. A good walk to the top of castle hill will give you exercise. Take the funicular if you need to- quicker but sometimes a queue. Good views of the city and worth a stroll around in the old town. Look for the Flying Nun on one of the building. Have a hot chocolate and strudel in a cafe before walking down.
Excellent view of Pest!. Its right next to the Prime ministers house, where you can occasionally see them doing guard drills, looks pretty good!
Collection of spectacular architecture!. On the map photo You can see all these beautiful historical sites - there's nothing to tell about - it must be seen as large as life;))
Bellissimo panorama. Absolutely stunning, a must visit ! We took the funicular up and walked back down the hill on the cobbled street, was very romantic.
Worth a bus trip, just for the view and a walkabout.. Great views, try the funicular railway. Nice to walk around the area.A few shops and restaurants but very touristy.

Beautiful view but closed. We went up to Castle Hill on a picturesque Monday but all of the sights were closed which was a shame. It does still have breath-taking views and excellent photo oppotunities though and was made better by the snow, albiet a lot colder! Take the hill tram down for the best was down.
Wonderful view in snow. We took the path on a snowy day. It wasn't very easy to climb up to the hill as it was slippery, but its worth. The view of the city was breathtaking.

plenty of history and great views. Once up on the Castle district (you can use the Funicular or the number 16 bus from Pest, you will find the spectacular Matthias Church, The fisherman's bastion for super views accross the Danube. plenty of other historical sites and museums. The hospital in the hill is worth a vist and includes a 1 hour guided tour explaining its role in WW2 and during the Russian conflict right through to its role as a secret bunker in the Cold War. period. plenty of rstaurants and gift shops up there too.

Impresive. Although it was a snowy day that we visited the Castle Hill, it was nice seeing the city being covered with snow and the vastle looked like from a fairytale. We didn't have much time to visit it the way we should/wanted because of the snow and cold. But even if you don't have much time, it worths visiting it, even from outside
Very romantic with the snow!. View of the Danube and Parliament, great atmosphere, very historic, we had a great walk through the snow
Amazing views. Dedicate half a day to this and you will not be disappointed. The views of Pest and the river Danube are spectacular from here too. Take the funicular back down the hill.

nice strolling/shopping area. Nothing too exciting, but very pleasant for strolling and picking up a few reasonably priced souvenirs. Beautiful views and a good place to soak up a little bit of the Eastern European feel. Enjoyed fresh kurtoskalaks and a cup of coffee while waiting for our bus.

Nice for a walk but nothing more.. We took the funicular up to the castle hill. We walked around a bit, enjoyed the view and had a drink on a terrace overlooking the city. The best thing in this area is the underground hospital. We didn't visit one of the other museums. So we can't comment on them.
Just 1 of the great sites. Saw this and other great sites on hop on hop off bus/boat tour. Great value valid 2 days. Great views from Buda side across the Danube.
Nice walk. If you prefer walk, definitely my recommendation, go up to the hill and enjoy the view of beautiful city.
Top attraction. If u are in Budapest u must go there! The parking is very expensive there, go by feet or by public transport!

incredible views. There is a lovely cafe on the hill by the church that is really old, from 1827 i think. they do amazing cake and coffee. The church is beautiful, and even more amazing lit up at night when its snowing!
Change of the guards. We saw the change of the guard at the Castle hill, nothing to see. We enjoyed a cup of warm red wine and it almost felt like springtime
Timeless. This area is magnificent! A lot to see, no matter it is cold something pushes you to explore it more and more and to come back next day.

Brilliant!. Best views in budapest! When you go up the hill and get to the top it's a little bit like being in the principality of Monaco - a small self contained little town, the castle walls and views are stunning so send half a day up there.
Castle district. Nice restaurants, beautiful Palace, Churches, Fishermans Bastian etc. Very interested learning the history. Great buskers!
Excellent area for a stroll. Lovely sightseeings at this area with castle, church and other great old buildings. If you are the walker type of guy, you should be there.
The view is best part about budapest. it is a good walk.....the old world charm and nice ppl.... the view is simply too good.... nice shops with curios and dont forget the fishermans bastion
Good place to visit. It is worth going to. Very interesting. Nice little shops and places to eat. God views of the area. There is a lot of historical things to look at.

Wonderful views. but I got a little bit disappointed with Castle itself - inside they only had art gallery, honestly I prefer to see oryginal architecture and how it used to look instead of watching paintings - at least they were painted by hungarian painters.The easiest way to get there is by bus 116, 16 or 16A - with it you will pass a beautiful small church next to (I'm not sure of that) Hilton Hotel
Very scenic. This is included in the bus tour. It is very beautiful with cobbled streets and gorgeous old buildings. Definately worth the trip
Great atmosphere. Great atmosphere with some excelent architecture. The views are fantastic. The labryinth is worth a visit as it is a bit of fun (not always historically accurate I suspect).
Castle Hill. Views and castle were excellent. Did not go inside and we were there at night so the lights of Pest wer incredible

A nice day out. Luckily it was a hot day when we went up to Castle Hill, so we were able to take advantage of the grassy areas for some sunbathing. The views were great - you could see the whole of the Pest side and the river Danube below. There was a bar there too which was quite expensive, you also had to pay to use the toilets up there. We went up on the funincular which was a good experience.
If you can, climb the hill. The climb is nice, albeit difficult. You can stop along the way and enjoy different spots to see the city. The view from the top is magnificent.
great views. Impressive scenery, noteworthy sculptures. tourist friendly, high atop a hill with the Danube glowing below.

Good for walking. Anywhere in the Castle district is at the top of the hill, we did a walk one day and walked up and down the hill which is quite steep that said the castle district has lots of cobbled streets and parks surrounding it which makes for a pleasant walk.
Castle Hill. The Castle Hill area is worth a visit. Pre book a walking tour before you set off, it lasts 3 - 4 hours - both informative and you visit the best places.
Lovely view of Pest. Castle Hill gives you a great view of Pest and of all its beautiful buildings, especially Parliament
Castle area. This is an absolutely stunning part of Budapest and sits high on a hill which can be seen from all over the city. Lovely cobbled streets and beautiful architecture.

BEAUTIFUL!!!!. Go join a night tour, its totally different from what u see during the day. Budapest is a BEAUTIFUL CITY, absolutely beautiful. Must go if you arw in budapest, be prepared to take lots of pictures!!!

A world heritage site. Castle hill is the first place to start when you visit Budapest. Located on the hills of Buda, there is much to see here. The funicular up to the castle is great fun and the only good way to get there besides climbing hundreds of steps! The museums are excellent, and it would require several days to see everything here.
Very good vantage point for the city and Danube river. Absolutely must. It is a large area containing various attractions and sights. Changing of guards at palace, funicular tram up to the hill, etc
Incredible history. Its worth a trip up here to get view over the city and an appreciation of its role in the history of the city.

Beautiful view. You should visit there if you go to Budapest!
It is amazing view with all cities and bridge!!

The best attraction in Budapest. I have visited Budapest with friends in December. It was quite cold but still the castle is attraction that must be visited. I was there for 2nd time so I knew what to see. I love most reaching the hill by the lift and after spending the time around the palace, to see the old town which is very nice too - plus there is a cathedral to see

Overlooking Parliament and the river.. We travelled around this area and stayed quite close, saw it during the day and early evening then wandered out of it after dining at night. From the balconies you can overlook all of Budapest which is lit at night. There are just so many wonderful buildings.This city in my mind personifies a fairytale city although its history doesn't quite bear this out
A must for Budapest. One of the best sights in Budapest. Try to visit it when the sky is clear to admire the other side of the city (Pest).
Worth a day trip!. There is a lot to do in a day and see on one hill! Even if you don't enter the museums and church there is a ton of history to see and the view is amazing.

Enjoyable views. Great views of the city - we didn't go in but it was great to go to the top on the funicular, and then walk around the top and see the views. A very easy walk back down the hill and into the city again. Highly recommended!

Great to see from afar, nothing much to do once you're there. The Castle Hill looks great from the opposite bank but once you are actually there there's not really much to see or do. None of the museums sounded very attractive so I just saw the buildings from outside. Plus the fact that the Palace was destroyed and rebuilt probably explains why the Castle Hill lacks the feeling of "oldness'' one would expect... Apart from tourists, the place seemed to have no "real" everyday life.

A mUST SEE!! Left a great impression on our kids too!. A must see in Budapest. Even my kids were amazed. Don't miss the views ofThe Danube at night. Amazing! We all came home giddy about our day that was spent at the Budapest Christmas market, all of old Buda and Castle Hill.
Charming. Great for a stroll and a view of the city below. Fisherman's Bastion and St. Matthew's church were not to miss.

Great Views. We walked up and it is worth the walk as the views are very good at the top. There are also cafes and resturants in and around this area so you can grab some food and drink too.
You can also get the Funicular up/down.

Beatiful. On first you need a guide..but it is very easy and cheap in finding one...they reach you just arrived on the top... The hungarian history is complex...do you mind the prncess sissy?. this hill with a good guide it is maybe one of the best place of the town

Beautiful for a visit!. A great place for a stroll and to take very beautiful pictures.
Great place to walk and spend the day
Amazing views. Worth the walk and the time. Enjoy the views and then enjoy walking around the shops and cafes when you are done.
Great view. It' s a must see. So much history and many wonderful buildings in that area. The view of Pest from there is magnificent.

A photographers dream. we took the funicular up to the the castle, The views from the Buda side across the river to Pest are spectacular. Tip - take pictures of the chain bridge when on the funicular.
Make sure you see the changing of the guard at 12.00 noon. Very camp ! almost theatrical, and so serious.

amazing view. Amazing view of the city from here. We were there in December so there was frozen snow lying which made it really pretty. The castle building is lovely with cobbled streets. You need to wrap up warm at this time of year. It is free to walk around the outside of the building.

Amazing views.. It's worth going to Budapest just to see the views from the hill. We only had 2 days in the city and we spent much of it on the hill exploring and just gazing at the scenery - watching the sunset is fantastic.
Its a must-go for any trip to Budapest!

This is a must see place. This was the highlight of the trip and the views are amazing. You could easily spend the whole day day here with lots to do. Museums cafes walls shops it had it all. Very old world and thoroughly enjoyed our trip
Beautiful. Love the beautiful chapel and the fishermen's bastion. But dread the climbing of the numerous steps to get to the area especially with a baby on a stroller

Definitely worth a visit. We found ourselves here twice, both days had lovely clear frosty weather and it's good to just wander around and take photos, stopping for a glass of mulled wine or hot chocolate. You get an amazing view across both sides of the city and up/down the Danube
Go up by Funicular.. Once you get across to Buda side of the river there is a funicular railway up to the Castle..pricey but a nice thing to do.
Nice to see, nothing special. Castle hill is worth of hiking uphill. Old town is nice but not special. Museums, labyrinth, church, restaurants..
Picturesque. Very interesting well worth a look. Easy walking once up the the hill. Got a number of bars and eating places. Some lovely views

Take your camera. Make sure this is on your list. We walked across the bridge and up to Castle Hill around the afternoon and luckily we grabbed a bite and stayed as the sun went down. Castle Hill must be seen at night! The view may be a little impeded but the castle itself and the lights of Pest are unbelievable - some of the nicest scenery you will see.

Beautiful Budapest. Castle Hill provides a commanding view over the Danube and the Pest-side of Budapest. In addition, the area itself has a quaint, village-like atmosphere perfect for an afternoon's wandering.

The best views of Budapest. Although the climb to the hill might be a bit steep, it is worth it. You can also take the funicular but it is nice to walk as you can already have a glimpse of the wonderful views. The view from the top is breathtaking.

Castle Hill in the snow and sun. Fascinating place, especially as the light was fluctuating between sun and laden with snow, dramatic effect. Seemed cleaner than central Budapest, but public toilets could have been better considering we had to pay!
Much more exciting than expected. Just don't walk up it. We did it twice and our feet are still hurting. But very beautiful. Much better than tour books (e.g. Rick Steves) said it would be.

Castle Hill--great place to walk around even in snow. This is a great place to walk around, even in the snow, although can be icy in places. Really enjoyed the hot mulled wine. Very walkable, and not too crowded with tourists on a cold winter day.
Beautiful, photogenic and historic. You can get to it by bus if you don't want to walk. Lots of coffee shops and historic buildings to keep you busy all day.
Do the package. It is very close to Faust wine cellar. So the best is to go there around 10 am, visit the wine cellar at 11:30 and end it with a fabulous lunch in the close by restaurants.
Stunning Views!. Stunning views. Expensive to use funicular railway but worth the walk (quite steady steps). Interesting area nice restaurants and shops nearby.
Beautiful view, but boring.. Nice place for a short walk. Restaurants close early. Almost no nightlife. The view on the Danube river was great.
Amazing. Must see!!amazing view!really romantic as well!It is one of the places in Buda you cannot miss!You would especially appreciate the great view it offers.

Castle area. A very nice place to visit. It is mostly for tourists, but the view was great. You need more than an hour to walk that place, but watch out for very expensive coffee in some of the cafes. Ask for the price before you order.
Best part od Buda. It's definitely the most beautiful part of the city. Great View of the Danube and Pest. If there's only one thing you can see in Budapest than this place i the place
Lovely old part of town...definitely worth visiting!. Took the metro to Castle Hill and spent the day walking around. Clean attractive streets with a view of the city.

Great view. Bit of a slog up the hill.. If you've got the cash, get the cable car - it was diabolically slippery after yesterday's snow and the steps are quite cracked and uneven and hand rails are nearly non-existent - you do need to get up there though, to appreciate the layout of the city.

Kings and Queens. This place takes you back into the times where aristocracy was leading. Wonderfull scenery and mythical luxury into one of teh best spots of monarchy in Europe. Makes you dream and see your self within the ballet nights , dancing waltz ....

The view is................... Probably one of the most beautiful sites anywhere (in my opinion) is the view overlooking the Pest side of the Danube.The Hungarian Parliament Building is the 3rd largest Parliament building in the world..............I have not seen many of the others, but this has to be one of the most beautiful structures anywhere. AND if you have the good fortune to see it ona clear night, it is exquisite!!!And, there is plenty to see on the 'top of the hill'.Budapest is a city of contrasts.......changing and improving over the years since their "emancipation" from Russia and Communism. One can still see the drabness of the occupation, but you also see many improvements to the structures of this historic city.
Castle Hill. Weather wasnt great when we went, although it didnt spoil our trip, it was rather damp. It would be nice to return perhaps in the summer.
Must see. Great views, especially after dark. But don't stay outside, visit the national gallery. Funicular is rather pointless unless you have trouble walking up hills or want fun for the kids.

Awesome views. I spent a good couple of hours wandering around the castle area of Buda. The view was magnificent and great photo opportunities for the whole of Budapest. There are a number of churches up there (most had weddings on given it was a Saturday). Lovely to walk around and see the period architecture.
Fantastic views across the city. A great viewing point for fantastic pictures of the city. There are some fabulous buildings, amazing architecture
great view. you have panoramic view of this magic city,the parliament is like a jewel of the town,i liked it very much
nice setting.. very easy to get to. nice setting, the views from the Pest side were excellent. would like to go back and visit again

Beautiful views, even on a cloudy day.. We were advised to take the number 16 bus to the castle, but were unable to find how to buy bus tickets. We bought metro tickets and walked up the hill. It's a long way! The Castle hill area is large, the buildings are beautiful and the views are amazing.
The best view. This part of Budapest is truly beautiful. Clean and cared for.On a clear day the view is spectacular

everything you expected. Simply beautiful!
If you have some extra money, try the cableway, it's really tiny and expensive, but it's nice and you'll really enjoy the way up watching the bridge at night :)
Castle hill. Fantastic place, a throw back in time, great views, attractions, go to the secret hospital. Lovely bars and restaurants, great views, walks and history, museums.
