take the cog railway and see all Budapest. Great views of city with splendidly restored buildings once devastated in WW2.Old town worth exploring as well as Royal Palace and Matthias church.Plenty of good cafes with delicious pastries,coffee etc.

Brilliant view. Excellent view from the top of this beautiful building. We didnt go in however since its the time of year enjoyed a cup of gluhwein instead! Threre is also the hospital in the rock which is a stones throw away. Lots of cafes around here too.

Spectalur view. You can walk or go by little train up on the castle hill, the best is on the top to get guided tour than you will learn about the history of BudaPest, that was really interesting and in the same time you visit the most important houses, like castle and the town (Pest).

A beautiful location to stroll around. Even though none of the buildings are very old, the (ridiculously overdone) architecture is still something to behold, and the view is great, both at day and at night.

Very nice place with good views.. Very nice place with good views although if you want to find somewhere to eat up there i would say reconsider and try places away from the river bank and the hill to find some real value for money.

You have not visited Budapest without a visit here. A very nice view over Budapest, a must for the tourist. The area have quite expensive touristshops, so the souvenires can you buy downtown. But I do really recomend to visit the Castle Hill

amazing view. You can take the little tram to go up but you should at least walk down on the way back to enjoy the view of the city. Very nice landmark with a lot to visit and probable one of the best view of the city. Try to go at night (or at dusk) to see all the lights!

Great to walk around. We went on a nice day, and there was a beer festival going on in the castle, what a windfall! We loved the stores on Castle Hill; especially the antiques, really unique stuff. We went twice, once for the Beer Fest, and the second time for Mass at Mattais church, which was beautiful.
Brilliant views. Lovely historic buildings and view of Budapest. Souvenir and food stalls along the way. Enjoyed changing of the guards on the hour. U can walk up or get a hop on/hop off bus up.

Views over a lovely city. Castle hill via the cog railway gave us a spectacular view over Pest on theother side of the Danube. The Fishermans Bastion, another interesting feature up on the hill was very poplular and again gave more views over Pest, where the Parliament buildings are. Adjacent is the Mathias Church but we refused to pay to enter so I cannot comment on the interior but the exterior is very colourful with ceramic tiles on the roof.

interesting and part of unesco heritage sites. The castle was destroyed by the Ottomans and rebuilt in a new Baroque style.The gardens are nice with good views of PestInside the palace there is the Budapest History Museum ( quite interesting ), the Hungarian National Gallery where you can find the Habsburg crypt (additional tickect fee ) and the Museum of Contemporary Art with works of non Hungarias artists like Picasso.Not to be missed

Fantastic views and good photo opportunities. Great introduction to Budapest. A definite must. The views are magnificent even though it was very hazy the day we went up. Lovely architecture and lovely to just amble around.

free site and great views. We first went to castle hill on one of the free walking tours and had a very informative guide. We returned the following by getting of the hop on bus and didn't fancy another 250 plus steps to reach the castle site. Very pretty area with excellent views across to the pest side. Would advice at least an hour and the walk back down of take the venicular railway back down the hill for 3 euro.

Picturesque with the best View of the city. Castle Hill is picturesque with the plus of the best view of the city. At least for us... Some might prefer the Citadella view of the city but we disagree. We used the funicular to climb and the price was around £3 (one way). The price goes down if you buy the return ticket at the same time but we decided to go up by funicular and down on foot.Traveling by funicular was the beginning of our picturesque experience. We reached the top quite fast and started enjoying our view of the city right here. It's a shame the funicular doesn't have bigger windows to enrich the experience but it was quite nice anyway.When you reach the top you have the Royal Palace at your left side. The building is very nice and inside you have museums and a library. I wouldn't recommend the Budapest History Museum though. It's not expensive (less than £5) but it's not captivating and has little information in English. I'll write another review for this one.Along the way you can enjoy the streets, buildings and walls along with the stalls with souvenirs.You'll reach a point where you have a nice view over the city, specially over the Pest side, including the Parliament which is a magnificent building.In this area I also recommend you to visit the beautiful Matthias Church. It's amazing!Have a drink in Halászbástya and enjoy the view. Quite romantic and excellent to read!It's likely you'll spend a while here so if you need to go to the bathroom along the way there's some but you'll have to pay a small fee. It's so small (around £0,30) that want hurt you. The other option is to have a meal or a coffee in one of the cafes or restaurants around.Don't miss it when in Budapest!
Nice walk. Great place to walk with wonderfull views of Pesta side, worth visiting. Also good for taking a lot of pictures, and spending some romantic moments.
stunning views. Quite a climb though you can use the funicular, but we needed the exercise so we walked. Stunning views from the top, lots of photo opportunities, well worth the effort.
Must go spot. a relaxing sightseeing spot to oversee the River Danube and Pest. You have to spend at least an hour to 2 for walking around, taking photos and savouring the atmosphere.
breathtaking views. Walk up the stairs don't take the bus unless you are immobile. It's a beautiful walk. Take hour camera as the views over Pest are beautiful.
Spectacular. The views were amazing and once up there you were spoilt or choice over what to look at next. Wear comfortable footwear as it quite a long walk back down the hill.

Magnificent views from the top of the Danube, chain bridge and Pest!. We took a relaxing stroll up hill which is not that steep or you could go up on the Fenucular railway (2 wooden cabins going up and down the hill). The views from the top are spectacular you can see along the Danube, chain bridge and over to the Pest side. We walked here from our hotel Continental Zara in Pest and it was very pleasant walk and there is some nice cafes, we luckily timed it well to see the change of guards at the top.

Awesome atmosphere. Castle hill for me is the best thing about Budapest, just walking and exploring it was amazing. Awesome old buildings, colours.... all great. Highlight was Matthias Church (absolutely beautiful building) and Fisherman's Bastion which, along with the rest of Castle hill offered some of the best vies of the city. Cable car on offer is probably not worth it, the ride is very short and the views will not compare to those on the hill itself. It is also a very comfortable walk to the top.

Fantastic View. Went up on the Fenucular railway which was an absolute delight, great wooden cabin with very shiny brass, amazing how it actually works. Great View on way up. When at the top, a couple of minutes, WHAT A GREAT VIEW!! Amazing over the Danube.
Good walk. Quite a steep climb to the top but well worth it. Did not fancy the cable car as too steep (and a queue).
Nice little stroll. We took Tram 4 to the end of the line and had a nice little stroll up the hill. Fanstastic views over the city, changing of the gaurds, fairy tale ramparts at the church.

Excellent. Beautifully clean buildings, interesting church and amazing views. St Mattias Church is worth visiting. Lovely surrounding area with cobbled streets and interesting architecture.watch out for dog dirt though - Hungarians love dogs but don't seem to use poop bags!

Beautiful views, but too many tourist shops for me.. Easiest way to get there is M2 to Szell Kalman Square (formerly called Moszkva Ter., then walk up about 10 steps behind station and take #16 minibus to anywhere on Castle Hill.

Good and will get better. It was a cold windy day when we went the 1st time but it impressed us enough to go back.The best way to appreciate the size is to walk up to the castle (there are several entrances). There are great views from all sides and lots of different things spread over the castle grounds so put on some good shoes and put aside some time.Museums and galleries arent the best in Budapest but dont cross them off. Fishermans bastion in impressive and the views are awesome but you can save money by walking to other parts of the wall. The architecture is varied and buildings being restored. The Hilton hotel is an eyesore and should be pulled down. There is an underground wine tasting bar but there needs to be more cafes, restraunts and shops to add some atomsphere. We will definatley be back
Views!. A beautiful palace on a hill overlooking the Danube...with Pest snuggled against the opposite bank full of secret streets and delights...
Beautiful views. Worth visiting at both day and night for fantastic views of the city. Take a camera and a good pair of shoes!
Inrteresting. Very interesting - Has a great History. Lots of tourist tack to buy, cheaper in the town, but did not get badgered to buy

Nice place to walk around, good photo taking. Although pretty with a lot of history, I definitely recommend taking a tour to understand the full history. There are a few cute cafes to eat at, and I recommend exploring the grounds the full experience.

A wonderful viewing area on the Buda side of the Danube.. We visited this area on our walking tour and were blown away by the cross-river view of Pest - the Parliament Building looking particularly splendid when illuminated at night. Ironically, this Buda side, which some regard as more upmarket than Pest actually has probably less to offer tourists and the cafes/restaurants seemed to be pricier, with no obvious added value.One venue that we visited which was quite interesting was the 'secret' hospital built into the underground limestone caves. A very interesting history that really began in WW2 but carried on into the Soviet era. It was closed for several decades but reopened earlier this century and turned into an unusual museum.

Castle Hill, Admiring View. Witness breath taking panoramic views of Budapest. The best views are from the palace! But, take a look for yourself. There are several locations for beautiful photo opportunities.

pessoal. Rising 48 meters above the Danube, the Castle Hill or Várhegy nevertheless dominates the city. This hill is the place where Budapest was founded. It is a small, densely built rock, with the Buda Castle as the most prominent building.Amazing place to visit. The architecture of the palace, its gardens, worth the visit.

Amazing. Castle Hill is a definite must in Budapest. The walk uphill could be challenging, but there's a funicular (1500 ft both ways, 6€). If it's too pricey for you, there's an elevator/lift for 100 ft. It is located on the opposite side of the hill (the one looking over Buda, not on the Danube side). Beautiful buildings at the top and breathtaking views over Pest
Views fantastic. You can relax & take your time to view the many features of this famous area. It's like going back in time and very different from the Pest side of the city

Lovely views. Lovely views of both Buda and Pest - worthwhile and definitely good on a day with clear visibility. It offers a great view of the whole surrounding areas including the main tourist sites. Definitely worth a trip.
Walk up the hill, Lazy!. So many people queuing for the hill tram - it's a gentle hill walk through a lovely park so don't be lazy!
Amazing experience. I love history, I love antiquity... I loved visiting this area. Old castle, old church, old streets, old buildings... just great character
Visit. The whole area is well worth a visit take the funicular to the top and take in the stunning views. There are nice coffee shops and the fishermans bastion is a very nice walk.

A step into the past. This place gives several attractions. There's a great view to the Danube and all of Budapest; the building in the castle area really gives you the feeling as if you're walking in ancient times...

Too expensive. Although the castle hill area is very nice to walk around, I would not eat or buy anything here. It is very expensive and over priced. There are a few art galleries worth looking. The hospital on the rocks is a must see.

Amazing views. The epic views of the city from above may remind you of Paris, with church bells ringing in the distance, and both tourist and working watercraft chugging along under the scenic bridges.We wished the fog had lifted sooner so that we could have lingered for longer, but now we have all the more reason to come back.Must be a very romantic view on a warm summer night...?

Charming glimpse into what was.... While not as over-touristed as other cities, thats not for lack of beauty. Castle Hill appears to actually be lived on by locals which adds to an atmosphere of authenticity. Walk up, and back down again... you'll get a better idea of just how pretty it all is.
wet and windy. When we visited as part of a city tour arranged by our river cruise ship (Viking Freya) it was wet and windy and so cold.

Beautiful Views of Budapest. This is a must when visiting Budapest. I visited the site during New Years day. It is very historic and a must. You have beautiful views of the Danube River as well as the parliament building as well as the rest of the city. It is pretty easy to get to. The funicular was out of service at the time, so my girlfriend and I took the stairs. They are not steep so it wasn't very hard to get up there. There are many opportunities to take pictures while climbing up but especially once you get up there.Definitely something you have to do while in Budapest. Such a historic city!
Hospital Under the Rock Museum. This museum, where 100 wax figures show how the hospital functioned during WWII, brings home in a gripping way how difficult world history has been for Hungary.

A Bit of a Disappointment. Compared to Prague, this castle was a bit of a disappointment. It has been destroyed and re-built over time and seems to lack the real history of other places in Europe. The area is nice enough but I guess we expected more. The Castle is an impressive buildin and there are some fine statues but the National Art Gallery is a bit overwhelming. St. Matthias Church was undergoing renovations during our visit and the price to get in was too high for what was open. Take the funicular up for a great view of the Pest side. Accesibility is not big in Budapest in general but certainly not here.

Walked to the Castle. We were happy to discover we didn't have to stand on the long funicular line that transport you up the steep hill to the castle. The winding pathway up and around to the hill was most enjoyable -- there are also stairs that offer an even greater short cut. I advise taking the stairs on the way down.
Lovely view and beautiful. Very clean,changing of the guards interesting.Shops here are expensive,wait for market hall for same stuff

Nice walk, fab views. Lovely Autumnal day made this a lovely walk out of the bustle of the city centre. Well worth the visit if even just for the views. We went on a Monday though and all museums and attractions are closed on Mondays.
Friendly atmosphere, small, cute streets. Matthias church is one of the oldest Hungarian churches, there is a stunning view to the city from the Fisherman Bastion
Must see in Budapest. Located on the Buda side of the city, with very nice view of the Pest side.Many museums to visit in this area.

What a wonderful location.. Viewed from Pest, especially at night, the Castle Hill is beautiful. It's even better to look down from the top at Pest, again it's magical at night with the famous Parliment and Chain Bridge illuminated. Is a " must do" for Budapest.
Visit October 2012. spectacular view of Pest and the Danube, the building still bearing WW2 scars after nearly 70 years.
A must see. Great views of the city, charming spot, Be sure to stop in the church being refurbished. There are great little shops to check out and prices are about the same as down in the city.

A must for the view. The caste is nice to visit but nothing more. The reason I give this attraction 4 stars is because of the view.
Take the funicular and you"ll see the view become more beautiful every meter.
Therefore a must be seen. Nice terrace at the castle.
Lovely historic area - with stunning views. We really enjoyed strolling around the narrow streets, stopping for coffee and lunch . We also visited the Underground hospital museum.

Beautiful but empty at night. We only had time to visit Castle Hill at night, in between some wine tasting at Faust Cellar in the Hilton at dinner at 21. We walked around a bit and it was stunning. We just wished we had more time to visit, especially during the day when I imagine the place is much more active than at night when there were few people walking around and few stores/buildings open (other than restaurants). Still, the buildings were beautifully lit up, making it extra special. This is definitely someplace we will re-visit if we get back to Budapest.
Amazing. View from this place is amazing and something you don't want to miss! You can see al the way across the river, the parliament and the bridges, really amazing!
what a view !!!. Is the best view of budapest !!!!I really recommend it to everyone !!!especially in april or may !is the first to visit in this city !
excellent views. What a lovely place to visit, a small town within a city is the best way to describe it and its free to enter. Beautiful views across the city and river.
a nice area. very charming and quaint, with a transylvanian funnel cake shop! Make sure you are wearing good walking shoes though and take the fernicular!
What a view!. Must see! The view is spectacular! You don't need to pay to go up one level. Best time to go by sunset - so you see it by day and night!
Great views. Fantastic views over the Danube and Pest. We walked up the hill, was a bit of a climb but well worth it. Tours are available with hop-on bus tours around the city
Matthias church. Matthias church, is one the most beautiful churches I have ever seen and also its history amazed me a lot.

magnificent views and cobbled streets. This has to be the best part of Budapest. The castle and the cathedral to the military barracks. Lovely streets with magnificent views over looking Pest across the Danube, and on the other side the rolling hills of Buda. Don't miss the chance to see the old hospital/bunker in the caves beneath. The finicular is overpriced for the tiny ride. Walk along the street a bit and take the steps that bring you out near the castle or catch the bus.

Lots of Variety. Used the bus to get up to the castle and wandered using Rick Steeves Eastern Europe book as a guide. Went from here to the cathedral and the Fisherman's Bastion so there was lots of walking.

One of the great views of the city. I believe the Castle Hill is the second best place places to view the city, only after the Gellert Hill. Going there at night allows you to experience the beauty of Budapest. You may as well stay a while and check the guards change, it's an interesting tradition.

Should be No1 on "Things to Do". We caught the furnicular up to the castle and walked around the old streets, the Fishermans Bastion with its marvelous view across to Pest and the Parliament buildings in particular, the Matayas Church (under significant renovation but still impressive) and back to the National Gallery. This all took a long morning but absolutely worth it

Fantastic Views. On the day we visited we could not access all of the Castle area as it was being used for location filming. However, well worth a visit the views are spectacular and the buildings are amazing. Lovely bar/cafe at the top with beautiful views.

An excellent place to meander. The wonderful collection of baroque and renaissance houses with their splendid doors makes this an excellent place to meander. Avoid the restaurants, as they are all over-priced and mostly of inferior quality.
panoramic view. budapest panaromic view and nice place for walking, nice and quiet place ,many hidden interesting places in small streets
Awesom architecture. Not only was the architecture something to behold, the views of the city were magnificent! We only had time to do the Fishermen's Bastion.
Wonderful views. Great views from Castle Hill and you should try to catch the changing of the guard ceremony which is more than just a simple guard change.

Beautiful - -. I liked that you could see the different periods of time that lived in and around the castle hill. It was quite sad, but interesting to see the before pictures of the hill and after/durring the WWII

A must. This area of Buda is a must see. Walk from Pest across the bridge then get the little railway or bus up the hill. In addition to the must sees I recommend the small antique shops in a courtyard diagonally opposite the church.
Castle fantasy. The castle looks a bit like an oversized Disney Castle but still beautiful. VERY busy during the day. Try late afternoon early evening for fewer crowds and great evening views.

Nice walk. Lovely walk-many things to see.
Clean safe and secure.
You can see from there Pest and Danube and also Budas Hill

The view is amazing. It is a trek up to the top, but the view is amazing. Night time is the best time to go, the city is washed in beautiful golden light! Historic buildings, the Royal Palace, Fisherman's Bastion and some very good restaurants in that area. Too many little souvenir shops. Some very interesting statues are in the area, a tram that goes through the area is easy to use if you have the tickets bought ahead of time. A few days in Budapest will allow you to know how to use the trams which are convenient for traveling longer distances, and going from Buda to Pest more easily. The old Matthias Church was being renovated, the crowds were thick so it was frustrating, but it is definitely worth a visit. You can take the funicular down to the Danube, and cross the Chain Bridge to go to Pest.

Great View. This is the place to go for striking views of Budapest. Matthias Church, Fisherman's Bastion, and Buda Castle are all here. And you can see Parliament across the river. It is one of the "musts" in Budapest.
Good Climb. It is a trek up to the top, but the view is amazing. Night time is the best time to go, the city is washed in beautiful golden light!

High above the city. Excellent panoramic views of the city. Also visited a WW11 bunker which was very educational. learned a lot about the sad history of the city and especially how the Jews were treated.Went there on a hop on hop off tour. best way to get there.

The Buda Side tour. About the only area you would tour on the Buda side of Budapest is Castle Hill. While most of this area is reconstructed after WWII, there are some magnificent views from Castle Hill overlooking the Pest side and the walking tour is worth the time. Because of it's commanding position overlooking the Danube, the constant archeological digs are well documented on the security fences and deserve your time to read them. Some of the sites are rather touristy, (like an opportunity to try your hand at bows and arrows), but overall the focus is on the history of Budapest.

Castle Hill. We did not spend a lot of time on Castle Hill, but enjoyed the view from there. We walked around the churce, but concentrated on other galleries & museums right in the city so did not visit those on Castle Hill
See it when the lights are on !. I is crowded during daytime , but when the night comes it reveals it's true beauty especially when you see it from the river.

Castle Hill and historical buildings. Historic buildings, the Royal Palace, Fisherman's Bastion and some very good restaurants in that area. Too many little souvenir shops. Some very interesting statues are in the area, a tram (number 16 and 16 a, I believe) that goes through the area is easy to use if you have the tickets bought ahead of time....a few days in Budapest will allow you to know how to use the trams which are convenient for traveling longer distances, and going from Buda to Pest more easily. The old Matthias Church was being renovated when we were there, the crowds were thick so it was frustrating, but it is definitely worth a visit.  You can take the funicular down to the Danube, and cross the Chain Bridge to go to Pest, where there is a huge market inside a building, with excellent rates on their paprika, tons of food items and great souvenir gifts.
Fantastic views. Wonderful historical place, but it was crowded when I was there. I found it was a bit hard to get there from Pest side.

Great Views. A visit to Budapest is incomplete without a trip (great place to start an itinerary actually) to castle Hill. There are no shortage of icons on the Hill and indeed you could spend the better part of the day up there and not be bored. But the view down over Pest is pretty special on a clear day - and yes they do happen regularly in Budapest.There are lots of small restaurants serving food and snacks (sometimes at moderately inflated prices - but this is a tourist district) and no shortage of venues just to chill-out and relax!

Really Nice. We went here as part of our tour with the Free Budapest Walking tour. It was a really nice area and offered a beautiful view of the city. Didn't go inside the castle but had a nice look around outside.

The most beautiful part of Budapest. History alive here - quiet but full of interest. Museums, galleries, coffee houses and the view! Also worth looking for the non-obvious places to eat in what look like front rooms and the bakery in the little alleyway near the statue of the horse with golden balls...
Wow. One of the best places to visit in Budapest, buda side. Great view on the river. A very lovely place to visit esspecially at weekends with the festival.
Beautiful Buda. The views across the Danube not to be missed.Including Parliament building, the many beautiful bridges.
Brilliant. A must see. Every where in Budapest was amazing to see. Take the little train up, just a little fun experience. The view at the top is unreal. Can see everything.
Beautiful views. Sadly we went on a rainy day but we still managed to get lots of lovely snap shots and have a nice mooch about.

Breathtaking and very crowded. The view from Castle hill is spectacular. You must be ready for the number of tourists. You will get your best pictures of the Danube from here. If possible see this site from the river at night. The entire shoreline is lit. Best view ever.

Nice attractions & sights. You can get there by walking, but I suggest you to take the funicular. From the hill youcan see whole Pest including the Parliment that looks great from up there. Up there you can walk through the castle yard, see the statues, you can practise archery and you visit some attractions, like an underground labyrinth, you can go see the church and you can eat in some nice restaurants. This is the main attraction if you visit Budapest for a day or two.
Beathless. the view from the Castle Hill in the night. The most beautiful Lady of European Cities. The bridges, the parlament, Visit "the Pierott" for the best hungarian Goulash soup.
Must see location. Come by bus at twilight. If you wa't good pictures take tripod. you can wait untill the sun will go down at the resturant.
Wonderful Views. This area is a bit touristy, but the views are well worth the effort. A necessary part of any trip to Budapest.

May just merit 4 stars.. Great view of the city. Beautiful gothic cathedral, one of the best situated Hiltons in the world. The Fishermen's Bastion well worth a visit, but the royal castle is an architectural monstrosity, even though they occasionally have good art exhibitions within. Also some good restaurants, albeit expensive. Best to get there by the funicular.

Must visit. the whole area from the castle, via the Matthias Church and the Fishermen Bastion is absolutely worthwhile visiting. Going up to the castle hill by means of the funicular is also a nice experience.

Beautiful view. Hungarian Ghoulash at Citadel is great. It comes free with the Hop on Hop off Bus tour. Don't bother buying souveniours from around here. It's better priced and more options at the Great Markt Hall.
Best view. Best view of Budapest. At day or at night, you get a magnificent view of the city at your feet. Just 80mts High, worth taking the stairs to appreciate the nature going up!
Chocolate festival. There was a chocolate festival at the castle when we were ther......never saw so much chocolate in my life.

wonderful Memories!. One of my favorite memories of Budapest was touring the Castle District, looking at the Danube and listening to wonderful music coming from one of the restaurants. A lunch guest dressed in a lovely hat got up and beautifully sang some traditional Hungarian songs with the violinist, all the while taking pictures of herself doing this...she was having so much fun and we did, too, vicariously!

Great views, with a lot of tourists and school parties.. We actually went up there twice, first time we walked, second time we used the Siklo. We basically wandered around using our guide book. We liked the labyrinth and Lords Street best but just walking around was very enjoyable. There is a nice little cafe/restaurant with fabulous views just next to the ornamental gateway. A must when in Budapest.
Our favourite part of Budapest . Lovely atmosphere bit touristy but hey we are tourists! Great walking between church and palace architecture was superb

The all-in-one experience. We were up here quite often, there is a lot to see. Matthias' church, Royal Palace, view of Pest. Also consider visiting at night since you have a nice view of the Dunabe, parliament and chain bridge.

Stunning. Rich in history and beauty. At every turn there are stunning views of the city, the Danube, and the city's fine architecture. One could wander here for days and never be disappointed. What a beautiful city.

one of the main attractions. just loved wondering round very much on the tourist map views are great.
Make sure you have sensible shoes on
Must See. Historical wonder! This is a must see if you visit Budapest. The panoramic view of the city from Castle Hill is amazing.
Don’t miss. Don’t miss, nice view to the city, take your time, don’t rush, try the local conditur Ruszwurm bakery shop.

Fantastic view. What a view of the city from here. Such a beautiful city but a different story in the Suburbs. Did not know it was such a nice destination to visit. But also expensive do not under estimate.

The Center of District I, with plenty of things to see. Probably the most toured location of Buda, the Castle structure holds the National Gallery and History Museums (check opening hours in advance!), great view of Pest. Make sure you take the Funicular from the Chain Bridge. St. Matthias church, Fisherman's Bastion, President's Palace, Labyrinths (Labirintus) and many others are just a walk distance... Enjoy !
Great panoramic view!. While travelling to Budapeste you should definitly go to Caste Hill and take a beautiful pics from there.
view. During the day there are so many people there, but in the evening, it quiets down. Reminds me of some old farrytails and their magical stories. Realy moves my imagination.

Take the Funicular. Ride the funicular and spend a morning exploring the area around Castle Hill and the Palace. Stunning views over the city and from the Funicular on the way up. Long queues to get on the carriages, but not long enough to detract.You won't be disappointed
Many places of interest.. Great to be able to walk round the walls and"dip in and out" of places of interest. We were lucky enough to see the Chamging of the Guard.

Interesting place. It's sort of a precursor to Disneyland -- a temporary show of building styles that everyone liked so much they were rebuilt in stone as a permanent exhibition. It looks ancient but in European terms it's a baby -- not much over 100 years old.
fascinating. we went up three times. late at night-the buildings all lit up. early in the morning-the sun rise, very quiet. afternoon for dinner. a special place.

Beautiful panoramic view of Budapest with the chain bridge. It's one of the highlights of our Budapest trip. Great view from the top. You can get there from hop on hop off bus, local buses, or take the cabe car lift up.

Venue to the campest changing of the guards and otherr delights. Arrived up the hill to the changing of the Guard. Myself and my companion independently thought it was something out of a Mel Brooks set. Lovely site with interesting history

A nice walk in the past..... One of the most beatiful part of Budapest from Matthias Church to Rondella of the Castle.The church is renovated and is great with the nice tiles on the roof. The Fishermens Bastion is a unique building with a stunning view to Pest. Some little, narrow streets with houses from the XVIII-XIX. century. Walking on, you can see the Sandor Palace, the residence of the President of the Republic. Some steps to the Funicular, which goes to the Chain Bridge. Walking on, we enter the Royal Castle and court. The Castle is the home of the Hungarian National Gallery and some other museums. In the evening the illumination is extremely wonderful and breathtaking.You can see almost every part of Budapest in floodlight.
Wonderful views over Budapest. An incredible birds eye view of this wonderful city! Take a day trip and book it via Viator. You will not regret it.

Great experience - but beware of the dragon. Loved the Palace and the beautiful Church. The funicular was great fun - but beware of the angry lady who takes the money - especially if you don't speak Hungarian.
Lovely View. We stopped here for 20 mins. on a bus tour of the city. The views were wonderful and perfect to take some great photos.

A Worthwhile Walking Tour. Our trip included a walking tour of the Castle Hill district that provided a good summary of Hungary's history. We also saw St. Matthew's Church with its remarkable tile roof and, parked down the street, what must be one of the few remaining Trabants in Budapest. Built in East Germany during the communist regime, Trabants rank among the worst cars ever built.

Go at night!. I had the privilege to visit Varhegy at night, during the annual wine festival! Besides the great drinks, the view is charming and romantic. The old buildings around are lit up and the experience was unique!

Lovely area and great views from here. If you go to Budapest then you have to come here. It's a must. We actually came here with a walking guide, and she timed it so that we could see the changing of the guards. The area is so beautiful and photogenic. You only have to look at other people's photos to see what is available here. Definitely need at least half a day to explore the area and a fully charged camera battery, mine ran out half way. Views of Fisherman Bastion and the view from there were amazing on the day we came.
Great area. Lovely area to walk aroundand spend some time. September is avery good weather though afternoons are hot !! Good cafes and lovely view !!
Fantastic!. We were really astonished by the beauty of this place!It's worth visiting!!IWe felt as we were in a fairytale) and the view from the Hill is breathtaking!

Historical and great view. If you are in Budapest, you can't miss Castle Hill. It is a wonderful place to stroll, take a million pictures, see the various sights, and see the other side, including the magnificent Parliament building. I would plan on a leisurely visit to savor the history and sites.
great views. While the castle isn't as regal close up, the view from Castle Hill across the river is amazing. You can walk up and down, take bus 16 or pay for the expensive funicular.

historic and beautiful view. We felt fortunate to have stayed up on the hill and walked all over it both day and night after dinner. the views are spectacular. I particularly loved looking down at the Parliament bujilding all lit up at night.

A nice stroll with a nice view, but nothing more. The setting and landscape is very nice. Getting atop by foot is tiresome and there are no benches along the way for older people. The other option is by a scenic elevator for which there is a cost and a long queue.The national gallery is very nice for a short visit and the price is low.

What a beautiful area. The Castle District is especially quaint and lovely. Beautiful views, cobblestone streets and a number of quaint shops. Used the hop on/hop off bus to get here, which proved to be a good idea.
beautiful setting. Well worth a visit to see the castle the Matthias church and fishermen bastion. Excellent views of city

Most interesting. One of the beautiful cities in Europe. Need to take a taxi if not in good shape. We walked up to the castle. The museum was also very interesting and the church was under repair but beautiful.
Top of Buda. Excellent tour with wonderful views. St Stephen's Church is beautiful. We enjoyed what we could see of the interior, though reconstruction is underway.
Love This Area. Every time we visit Budapest we ensure to get to this site. There is so much to see we find something new on every visit. I dream of living in an area such as this some day.
Fantastic view from up there, take a driver and enjoy !. We hired a driver who drove us around town, a great way to see town. The Castle hill is a must. Fantastic houses and a view to die for.

Budfest or no Budfest. That is the question? For about £23 you can get a five day ticket (single days cost about £7) for tasting all the wines from across the country - and a free glass and holder to drink them from. Go early in September. You get free access to two Museums as well. Excellent value. Also see the changing of the guard outside the President's residence (hats aren't as good as ours), don't forget to read up the historical notes on the bit they're excavating and renovating on the screens and boards. Their is a small market for souvenirs on the approach. We ate at the red coloured restaurant about 150 m from the castle and also the cafe on the corner about 100 m opposite and ate local food. They eat meat with everything: vegans beware!Catch a no 16 bus from the bottom of the hill or the main (Elisabeth?) Square over in Pest. Or Funicular from Clark Square.
Wonderful Museums & Views. As museum people we really enjoyed these museums and the view from the walls over looking the Danube River
Art, history and culture in one area.. Like the museum, the cathedral and the surrounding neighborhood. The most impressive view of the Danube River and Pest.
Spectacular views. Fantastic views over the city, lots to see, would say this shouldn't be missed. Big enough to get some great photos without people in it

Terrific view. We took the bus to go to the Castle Hill. The view on Pest and the Danube is terrific from there. A must to go. Nice place to walk arround even if you don't have time to visit the castle.
Beautiful. We toured the hill with a guide which is not totally needed. But there were details just as with any site that would probably have been missed without a guide

Splendid Area. Castle Hill is a beautiful historic area with many sites worth visiting such as the Royal Palace and the Matthias Church. Equally fun, is walking around, exploring on your own and discovering your own special places like Ruszwurm.

A critical part of any Budapest visit.. We walked up the trails to the very top. It was significant walk. At the top, the vista of Budapest is terrific and provides a visual understanding of this magnificent city. The shopping is ok, but it tis the beauty of the area that makes this an important stop.

International Wine and Champagne Festival. We were lucky enough to be in Budapest during Borfesztival and would HIGHLY recommend others do the same. The wine festival on the castle grounds was the highlight of our trip, with an outstanding selection of drinks, food and music in one of the most majestic scenes I've ever experienced.

Nice Restoration. Castle Hill is interesting. However, it is like an old brass lamp that was restored and all the aging of oxidation and ware removed so it looks new. There is no old world charm here. It is, ironically, a poignant reminder of the ravages of war and viewed in that light, an interesting visit.

Great neighborhood to explore if you know what you're looking at. I stayed at one of the few hotels within the castle walls (Hilton), and you can give yourself a great (and safe) walking tour at any hour, if only you know the history of each of the buildings. I'd vote daytime if only to see into each of the courtyards of these mostly private buildings (embassies and homes), nighttime to visit the Hospital under the Rock or attend a festival at the castle.

Beautiful. The castle and the area around it are full of things to see, explore and discover. Had we not had a long to do list of things elsewhere in Budapest, we could probably have spent an entire day here.
Take Your Camera!. Great architecture and stunning views all round. Get the No.6 bus from the base of the funicular just before the traffic tunnel.

Go early/mid September wine festival with amazing views. This is such a beautiful place. The outside is grand and fitting for a palace, whilst the inside has various art galleries We went whilst a wine fest was on. Good wine for as little as 60p with the most amazing views of Budapest. Changing of the guards is also a must see. You can easily walk upto the castle using the winding path below.
it's okay. I took a hop on hop off there. It has great views of pest and the dan'u from the top. The church on it was pretty.
Must see. Must see attraction, but cannot go in the castle except for the courtyards and museums inside. We went for the wine festival, fantastic setting to have a glass and enjoy the view!

Awesome walking site seeing area. After taking the fanicular (sp?) to the Castle District we saw the govenors building, walked the downtown area, took amazing pictures of the Parliament building and enjoy a festival overlooking the best views of the city. This is a must see stop on any trip to Budapest. There are some touristy shops but not many. We spent an afternoon in the district and it was just enough time.
Great views of the city. We got one of the tourist buses up here, and spent a couple of hours wandering around and taking pictures. A must to get those scenic photos of the river and Pest.
Wow. Simply gorgeous...a fairy tale come true...definitely worth a visit, and what a view. Romantic, historical, breathtaking and beautiful. Panoramic views do Budapest, it's definitely a must

Breathtaking Views from Castle Hill. Take a walk over the Chain Bridge to view the Danube, then get in line to ride on the cable car to the top of Castle Hill. Here you will see the Buda Castle, where the president resides, great views of the city, St. Michael's Chapel, Charlemagne's statue and the famous Fisherman's Bastion. It is here where you can walk down to the Chain Bridge within 15 minutes! Take lots of photos too!
dramatic. dramatic setting for the wine festival, imposing buildings and good views. A bit of a climb up the hill.

Worth a visit. Can't really go to Buda without a visit up the hill. We went via the 'back' entrance using public transport - they are repaired a section of the road which meant a short walk - but nothing strenuous. A bit touristy and relatively expensive, but great views.

Great photo opportunity. We took a ton of photos here of panoramic Budapest views. We also paid the 1200 HUF (about $5.50) to visit the WW2 bunker at the top of the hill. It gave a realistic feel for the grim realities Hungarians experienced during the war. Worth the price and time.

Fantastic Views. A must visit, lovely to wander around and have lunch in one of the restaurants overlooking Pest, the best views of Pest are to be had here. Can get funicular up but the path is not too steep and only took us 10 mins.
A great place. Well worth the walk. Loads to see and the views are fab over the river, and when you walk into the town theres even more to do. It all depends on what you like.
Good view. From here you can see the difference between the pest an Budapest sides of the city. A ver good view of th city. Make a promenade and eat in the restaurants they are very good
Great place. Fantastic view of Budapest from the towers. Royal palace great to walk around. Scaffolding as finding new digs

Worth the walk. Castle Hill was a definite highlight of the trip.
A fabulous world heritage site that was worth the walk from the hotel and over the Chain Bridge.
An absolute must when in Budapest.

Stop 11 'Giraffe' Red Bus Line (Hop On Hop Off). Could easily spend a few hours just browsing around this area.
Pretty street markets but be aware that you can buy goods much cheaper in the Market Hall, stop 10, Yellow Bus Line (Giraffe).

fab views. a great place as you look down onto the danube.
lots of pretty market stalls selling hungarian produce, the paprika is a must.

easy to spend a whole day-. lots of eating places with range of prices; main church under renovation though and so limited access. Museums have comprehensive translations into English of what is being seen.
Visit the castle that provides the view. Very interesting to visit the castle. But the view from the Pest side is what makes the castle great!

Lovely part of Budapest. Up on the hill is the Castle District, with its little cobbled streets, Fisherman's Bastion, Royal Palace etc. A wonderful place to wander, grab a coffee. Take the cable car up from across the Chain Bridge to save your legs going up. Coming down is fine.
Must see. If you are traveling to budapest, you cannot miss that place. It offers great views to Pest and the parliament. There is also a café where you can enjoy the great view.

spectacular, a must see!. we were on the hop on hop off bus, with the intention of staying on the bus, listening to the audioguide, and taking in the major sights as we were only here for a day. however, when we were coming up to the hill to the main area, we felt compelled to get off and have a look. the area is beautiful, as is the view of Pest and the Danube. the view is free, although u can dine at a little restaurant which also allows u to enjoy the views too, uninterrupted by tour guides and groups.
Over the hill and far away. The views are absolutely spectacular. It is not to be missed? Probably best not to visit when the weather is not good.

Tourist trap. more expensive side of the city. Some interesting locations (churches, presidential residence,....) you can also wander along little, quiet streets with pastel houses. Overall very clean site
Great for a stroll. Great views, interesting history, good for a stroll. Often the location for small-scale music and other events.

great view of Danube and Pest. the castle hill is great! the view of budapest is great, you can see the danube and some of the bridges linking Buda and Pest. in the area there are restaurants with great food.i reached the castle hill with the car, there is a paid parking on the hill from where you need to walk 5 minutes to the top. ( make sure that for parking you have forints , the parking machine accepts only forints)
Excellent view!. The view is absolutely fantastic! Crowded and hard to park... Definitely a must see if in Budapest! Avoid going in the weekends if possible...
Really nice place. Loved the energy on castle hill. View of Budapest is beautiful from atop Castle hill. Walkable from Chain bridge.
excellent views. great half day spent here but be sure to take your own water, we forgot and ended up paying 4x the normal price

Historical stuff asside- go for the guard change and the funicular ride. The view and the historical things are nice off course but a load of cities and towns have that including expensive beer and sodas that go with the historical monuments. But the guard change is unpretentious as they go it was a real treat so be there at noon. Afterwards go down by funicular just to escape the crowd.
The place to start your visit. With spectacular views of the city, castle hill is where it all started. Charming-- a great place to walk and enjoy a visit to the past.

Best view across historic budapest and an interseting old rail trip to the top.. Budapest has worked hard to resore some of the more interesting parts of the city and the trip to the visitor centre and gardens at the top here is a must. You wont get better views over the city and the rickety old rail trip up is good fun too. Watch out for pickpockets, but that is no different in any european city. Its just you are crammed in here so be careful. Once at the top take some time to walk around and enjoy the panoramas.
Beautiful views over Budapest. Great area with nice market, plenty of things to do and see, but the views over the river are the best part

Be prepared to enjoy the long and wonderful history and beauty!. Beautiful area with panoramic views of both Buda and Pest. Great history here, but you'll need to read before you get here to know what it's all about.
Beautiful. We only wanted to stay here a couple of hours but could have stayed all afternoon. The views are great and lots of museums. We really enjoyed it.
Try going in the evening. We went in August and we found the area very pleasant. There were musicians playing people dining in restaurants and of course those beautiful views over the Danube.

Lots of history here. Worth the trip. Take your time to walk around and see the castle. It's a busy spot but lots to see and lovely views from the top. We walked up and down rather than on the funicular and it was fine. Nice cobblestoned streets on the way and nice vistas.

Breathtaking view of Budapest. It's worth going up Castle Hill for the view alone (take the funicular, walking may be a bit too much, and you can always walk downhill), but there is much-much more to be seen there. Good restaurants (the Alabárdos got excellent reviews on Tripadvisor), the Ruszwurm cofectionary, the National Galery (Hungarian Painting), museums, shops, charming streets to walk around.

Breathtaking.. This is one of the most beautiful districts in Budapest. Situated on the Buda side, you can wander around the Fisherman's Bastion and over to Gellert Hill. The view is just stunning and the usual tourist prices don't really apply here. The most amazing thing is, it is all free to look at. Picturesque.

lovely views. nice visit, loved the church ( pity it was being renovated) and the fisherman's bastion.
One of the mandatory visits when in Budapest

Fabulous views and historic. We actually stayed in the Castle Hill district at the Hilton. The area is beautiful and historic. Everything within easy walking distance- Buda Castle Palace, Fishermen's Bastion, Matthias Church and more. Tour by day, but be sure to come back at night to see the lights.I didn't think Matthias Church was really worth the money to tour it- it is being renovated inside and there is a lot of scaffolding.You can walk around the area for free, but of course, going inside the Palace and Church are extra. Kids might enjoy watching the guards- they march around and change positions fairly often-

Absolutely great!. This attraction offers a beautiful view of Budapest! Perfect for a nice long walk. You can get some exercise as well ;) My friend and I bought food and had a picnic at the top while looking at the beautiful hungarian view!!

Interesting. Brilliant, nice Mathias church, beautiful architecture and structure, fisherman bastion very beautiful structure. Cave system, labrynth was very interesting and useful during second world war, Buda castle spectacular museum and library

Great all round views. Al ovely walk up the hill or use the funicular and the view changes with every meter you win in hight. Great buildings on the hill and an opportunity to see the "other" side of budapest which is usually hidden by the castle hill. crowded touristy areas as well as quiet pockets.

Attraction number one. One sunny Saturday in July we made a trip to Castle Hill and found some magnificient buildings like Buda Castle Palace, Matthias Church, Fishermen´s Bastion and Hungarian National Gallery. The view from this hill is amazing. You can see Danube with all bridges and Pest-side of the city. To get there you can e.g. take metro, red-line, from Dea´k Ferenc tér to Kálmán tér and from there by a bus that takes you up to the hill. This is worth seeing and you will meet tourists all over the world.
Beautiful view!. We loved the view - even on a dreary day - and enjoyed lunch at the restaurant at the top of the hill.

Great Views. Spectacular Panoramic Views, really beautiful buildings. This was my favourite spot in Budapest. Recommend walking up from the chain link bridge, walking around the old castle and seeing the church. From there the vista's over the pest side are the best!

Nice view over Budapest. If you don't want to wait 40 minutes for the train to take you up, you can take the stairs...It's a pretty long distance, but it's better walking than waiting in the sun, on 35 degrees, for that train to bring you up the hill... Castle is nice and if you are lucky, you can see the guard change (don't remember what time it was...). Nice atmosphere, with lots of small stores, where you can buy traditional food and art. Up here, you have a beautiful view of the Danube and of a part of Budapest.

Good photo ops. A nice area to visit with your camera. A fairly steep climb up but goos views of the city and Pest beyond. I visited in August and the streets were fairly quiet. Worth visiting for a couple of hours.

Breathtaking!!. We began our Castle Hill trip by walking across the Chain Bridge, taking the funicular ride up (a terribly short ride but great view of the Pest side (Parliament, St Stephen's Basilica etc) to the Buda Castle. Had a bit of a wander around the castle and it was nice that we started early at about 8am without the tourist hordes. Walked around the castle district, saw the amazing Matthias Church and walked through to the Fisherman's Bastion for the most spectacular view of Pest! Don't miss having some cake and coffee at Ruszwurm in the street right across Matthias Church, just ask and someone will be able to tell you. Very old world patisserie, great sacher torte and apple strudel and a wonderful surprise of an ice coffee!! Buda in the day is great , as was the Danube boat ride at night to see the wonderful lights illuminating the Buda and Pest monuments.
Amazing place!. Our hotel was on the hill. So we spent lots of times day and night on the hill. We did not get bored in a week of our stay there.

Above the city. The many steps climbing the hill were not as difficult as the guide made it sound. I'm an amputee and did very well, but there is a funicular if you prefer. Sites on the hill are far more interesting if you have a guide or some other background reference.

A bit chintsy for our liking. It is a very pretty area, without a doubt, but it was packed with tourists when we visited which made it feel a little like Disneyland. Also, the prices at the restaurants were very inflated as a result. Worth a visit, great photo opportunities, but we prefer the 'real' Budapest!

Lots of Photo Opportunities!. Beautiful views, beautiful buildings, beautiful sculptures. Varhegy is like a smaller Prague Castle Hill, make sure you bring your best camera! Funicular is available for tired legs. Do have a romantic dinner with your significant other here.Too many things to rave about, just check out the photo gallery!Conclusion: If you haven't been to Buda Castle Hill, you haven't been to Budapest at all!

Worth a visit. Lots to see and do, impressive Margit Bridge, Chain Bridge, you also get a great view of Parliament Buildings, if there had to be a dislike it would be the lack of information of how to cruise the river.
Lots to see. Wonderful place, lovely castle entrance, Mattias Church and the iconic Fisherman's Bastion is a must see.

Lovely for a stroll and the views. You must visit this area while in Budapest. You get a great view of the city, including the amazing Parliament building, and the architecture is great. A few notes: Avoid dining up there as the food if not very good and expensive. Don't be fooled into paying for the Fisherman's Bastion. There is a free version a few hundred feet past the one that charges admission. The church is picturesque from the outside but the inside is under restoration and not worth the admission price.
Excellent view. Great view of Pest from Buda. The night time illumination is awesome and great chance for amateur photographers to show their skills.
awesome view. Worth the few minutes to drive or get a bus/tour to visit.Beautiful statues and places to sit and stand. Was not overcrowded at all.
Nice climbing. Nice sightseeing and not hard to do. Pretty view from top.At noon you can assist to change of the guard. From the top you can enjoy spectacular sight of Danube and bridges.

Excellent view over the Budapest. The hill is an excellent place to have an overview of Budapest and Danube but I think that the Budapest and Danube landscape is more spectacular from Citadella hill. However, the hill resemble a mini town and there are many architectural building which must not be missed (Buda castle, Fisherman bastion, Matthias Church). I found the souvenir shops pretty expensive here (better buy souvenirs in town or from the Citadella hill).
Fantastic views. We spent a lovely afternoon sitting on the hillside with a bottle of wine, loaf of bread, and some great cheese. One of two great spots we hit that day to look over all of Budapest.

Neat buildings but we went too late. We went too late in the evening so this may not be a good representation of what was there. There were just buildings to look at. Not much going on. I thought there were be several things to go in and visit and people on the street performing or selling items.

Superb Views and worth the climb. The castle district in Buda is much more peaceful than the bustle of Pest - except that is for the tourists. The views from the Fisherman's Bastion over the Danube are superb and there a quite a few small bars and cafes serving quality, but low cost food.
Budapest - August 2012. A very pretty setting and the whole area is a must see...Give yourself at least an hour to wander around.. nice cafe for a coffee and cake
Great view. worth the hike to see the whole city. Awesome. We took our 1 year old and 2 year old by walking the whole thing. It is a hard hike but worth it.

A day in the castle. Went there with the castle hill funicular, isn't worth the money if your legs aren't in a really bad condition, the views aren't better than the ones you see from the hill and the staff isn't great. Went to see the National Gallery and the Museum of Military History, both were very interesting.

Stunning Views. From Castle Hill, you get the most amazing views of Pest. We chose not to ride the Funnicular up and walked instead. It was an easy walk and enjoyable views. We went early in the moringing and avoided most of the crowds.
Like it is ready for grand opening. Exterior looks so good it is like it has been recently built. Interior of the church was still being rebuilt though it could be visited.

A fairy tale place. A place where you feel like in a fairy tale, but too crowed.
The view from Fisherman' s Bastion was excellent!

Great vantage point.. WOW. the architechture is spectacular, and the view of Pest is awesome! We unfortunately didn't get a chance to go inside, so we can only rate the outside. We did witness the changing of the guard which was nice to see.

The View!!. The view is amazing from here and the history is immense. it is an uphill walk but if you’re not up for it there is a tram that takes you to the top with no problems, the only caveat is that the line can be long at times. Don’t miss this during your stay.

Great Views. If you have limited time in Budapest then this is definitely the place to visit.
Between the galleries and the Lords Street, this is an area with tons of history. Additionally, the views of the city from here are amazing.
nice hill. definitely worth a walk if you're in budapest, the sight over the city is impressive, even though the castle is not so impressive
Nice view over Budapest. Liked the view & buildings, the climb up to the castle is not far and easy to do (no need to use the "funicular")
A beautiful place. This is our favourite attraction in Budapest! A wonderful place to visit, the sight of the city is amazing from here. I recommend it to everyone

A must if you visit Budapest.. A must if you visit Budapest. The Panoremanic view from this location is second to none. If you are intrested in photography the building and the views are for you. If you are intrested in history then walking around this area looking at the buildings and going to the museum are a must also the changing of the guard on the Presidents Palace is worth seen.

A staple of any trip to Budapest. Most cities have a popular site (usually some form of castle) from which to view the city below you and this is the place in Budapest to experience the city from above. The surrouding buildings are beautiful designed and this attraction should feature on your things to do while in Budapest.
A must see. The castle hill is a must see on the Buda side of Budapest. It is very clean, lot's to see, a great view of Pest. It has a shopping area, restaurants, ice cream parlors and so much more.
Lovely historic area. Superb views and a very nice area for a stroll, meals etc.Very well restored after massive war damage.

Nice place to stroll. We walked up to Vienna gate, the main entrance to the Castle Hill neighborhood on a small cobbled stone street. We wandered around the area or a bit, went inside the underground Labrynth and looked out over the city. The area around Matthais Church was packed with tour groups so we didn't spend a whole lot of time there.
Good place to visit. Visited at part of the hop on and off ride very nice well worth a visit. Put it on your list of things to do

Buda Old Town. first travel to the top, via Budavari Silko (funicular] railway view the fountain in the grounds: Incredible views great buildings cafe bars good Try the Hadick Cafe for lunch .very good

Phenomenal!. Castle Hill has stunning views! The whole area is breath-taking. It's not too far from the City Center as well, so that's convenient. Be sure to visit Matyas Church, one of the most beautiful churches I've ever visited.
Castle District. Loved the history here and the views of hte city. Great restuarants in this area as well. wonderful to walk and bike

Hungarian History on top of the hill. You can at least spend a full day on castle hill, enjoy the museums, the beutiful views of and from the "Fischer-Bastei", the palace, the St. Matyas church and the palaces, or watch the turn of the guards at the president´s palace or just sit on a bench looking at Gellert hill.
Fabulous!. We really enjoyed our visit to Castle Hill--the area has wonderful views and Matyas Church isn't to be missed!
Well worth the climb. The whole area is well worth the trip as the views over the city and river are great. Just catch a 16 or 16A bus frm the city centre.

Phenomenal views. Matthias church was being renovated, but there was still a lot of detail to see. We paid to enter fisherman's bastion which was a waste, since you can see most of it for free and if you go to the bar at the top you get the amazing views.

Beautiful views from the top. Interesting buildings and gardens. One of the sights to see, which lives up to its reputation. If you have walking difficulties, take the funicular to the top, not the road! Incredible views from the top. We were there at 11.00 a.m. and saw the changing of the Guard.
Matyas Church being renovated. We were looking forward to visiting Mathias Church. However, it is currently under renovation - a bit of a let-down.
Castle Hill area. Although very crowded with tourists, a very nice area to shop and look around. Continually being updated and cleaned up.
Beautiful.. The most romantic image you imagine a castle to be, beautiful grounds and set in an area with lots to see and do.

So much people.... What a nice view over the town daytime and in the nights. Difficult to find parking due highseason for tourists. Take good shoes on you, specially if temperature passes 30 degrees and take a bottle of water with you.

September Wine Festival at the Palace!. My friend and I took a last minute mini break to Budapest a couple of years ago and I'm still raving about it! We were fortunate enough to get there the same weekend as they were holding their September wine festival! It was stunning... up in the hills over looking the city. Lots of concerts, food stalls, wine tasting,...etc! The atmosphere was fantastic...would highly recommend Budapest for long weekend break.
Must see on the Buda side. It can be viewed from the Pest side but is better to wander around on Castle Hill. The views of Pest are beautiful.

Must See!. This is the most beautiful place I've seen in Europe so far. The Matthias Church is amazing. You can see the Budapest areas for over 180 degrees of your view, including the Parliament building over the river. Lots of places to buy trinkets too!

Great walk and view on city. We took a walk from one of bridges to the top. Around caste you have promenade where see both sides of city with river Danube in the middle. It also has some facilities for taking a drink with a view.

Beautiful view of Pest - can be expensive. To eat in this area is expensive, but very good if it within budget. You can ride up in a tram of some sort or take a bus...the walk up is nice, but only if you are relatively fit.

Beautiful area!. Castle Hill overlooking the Danube is very scenic. Loved the outdoor restaurants and all the upscale neighborhood. Very safe area and so clean. I could not find anything negative about Castle Hill.

historic hill with great view of the city. There is a pay for trolley that will take you to the top, not the greatest view from the trolley, but its way faster than walking. The hill is pretty steep but accessable to most that want to walk it. Due to the amount of damage the sites have taken on during their history, the castle itself is really strange, now housing a library, museum and royal palace. walk the area, as you'll find a lot of hidden gems. There are also some current excavations going on for more ruins. Make sure to get over to the Matthias Church and Fisherman's Bastion too.
Amazing views..... Breath taking sights. A must see at night. For some amazing shots of the Castle go up Gellert Hill take bus #27 from Moricz Zsigmond Korter up to the Citadella

experience to remember. good way of exercise as i sweat a lot on the climb of the hill, i adore the church with very exquisite tile roof... amazing! and truly reflect the true custom and tradition of the place.
This is Must. The views from this area are amazing. Also, buildings are spectacular too. We recommend that you budget at least a half a day. Lastly, go at night.
Hungarian majesty at its best. Overwhelmed by the history and the views are to die for!Explore all of this area you will like it! Also explore the Pest side of the city well worth the effort.
What a view!. Fantastic postcard scenery, twinned with historic value and overall great area! Like a little village within a city!

Gorgeous night view, don't miss it!. Budapest is very hot and humid in the summer. When we arrived in the afternoon, it was 37 C, unbearable and difficult for us to do the sightseeing. We decided to see the city after dinner around 8pm. The Castle Hill was gorgeous at night! With the lights all lit up, it was beautiful and romantic. You can take pictures from almost every angle, it will all turn out very good. From the hill, you get a bird's eye view of the city: the parliament Building, the Danube river, the bridges.....We planned to take the river cruise after seeing the Castle Hill, but found it not necessary to do so, because we have seen all from the top. If you are to visit Budapest, go to Castle Hill after sunset will guarantee you an enjoyable and unforgettable time.

Must see. The castle building itself is spectacular, the views even more so. Our bus dropped us off near the old Ministry of Defense building (you can still see bullet holes) and we walked up the street to the castle area. You could spend 1 hour here just admiring the views of the Danube and the city.
Spectacular view of Danube and Peste. We used city busses to reach the hill. İt takes aprx. 15 mins to reach there from Andrassy Utca. A clearly "Must See" attraction of Budapest.
Castle Hill We always come back to.. Unsurpassed view, of course. This way you can see what you saw on your night time river cruise with the beautiful lights.
WORLD HERITAGE SITE. A great place to sight see during the day and perfect in the evening for a cocktail over looking the Danube or a Dining experience

Great views of Pest. Castle Hill was a lovely way to spend an afternoon. My husband and I used Rick Steves' Budapest book and followed the walk he has in there. There are gorgeous views of Pest from this side. We enjoyed going inside of the church and just wandering around the quaint streets.

Interesting area. My teenage daughter and I visited castle hill June 2012. We really enjoyed taking in all the sights, although we didn't go into any of the museums. We used the Rick Steves tour in his Budapest guide book to tour the area and found it really interesting. I don't think we would have got nearly as much out of just wandering around on our own.Funicular was fun. Views were amazing. While we were there a live band played in one of the courtyards to add to the ambience. The area around St Mathias cathedral and Fisherman's Bastion got quite busy with tour groups in the afternoon.We would recommend a visit to Castle Hill.
Great view. You can see most of Pest from the Castle.The bridges are the best at night with all the lights.
Very interesting site to visit. This is a place you must visit while in Budapest. We enjoyed the museums, restaurants and shops on the Castle Hill.
Must to see take a pleasant wlk around both side.. First District of the Capital of the Garden State of Hungary. Every and each Building represents part of History

Take the Castle Hill Walk. Hop on bus #16, #16A, or #116 to get to the top of Buda. Bus #16 drops you off right in the middle of town or in front of Matthias Church. If you want to take the funicular up to the top you can get off the bus stop at the entrance to the tunnel right across the chain bridge. The funicular costs about 1500 Forint (approx. $7.50) per person round trip and really isn't worth it. Once you get to the center of Buda you will will able to walk around the old town and enjoy lots of sights. There is an open-air Hungarian craft market in the square at Disz ter. It is the only market we found would bargain and they have very nice local crafts. Walk up the hill on Tarnok Utca and follow the sidewalk to find an old look at Buda. There is a Pharmacy Museum that costs 500 forint (approx $2.50) and has a cool collection of historic pharma and an alchemist's lab. The address is Tarnok Utca 18 and is closed on Mondays. Keep going and you will run right into Matthias church and Holy Trinity Square which is the main square in old Buda. You can buy a ticket to tour the inside of the church across the square at the ticket booth embedded in the wall. Cost about 1500 forint per person. When we were there there is so much construction going on inside the church we couldn't see very much so we thought it wasn't really worth the costs. The best part is the architecture and the exterior anyway. Once you visit the church you can't miss Fisherman's Bastien. It is right behind the church. Don't pay extra to go upstairs, the views are the same at street level. Go all over the Bastien as it is beautiful and you can get some great pictures overlooking Pest and Parliament. You will see street performers here and local musicians. Once you see all that there is lots more depending on how tired you are. You can find the 1976 Hilton Hotel, Hospital in the Rock, and the remains of St. Mary Magdalene Church.

Wonderful way to spend the day. We had a nice day strolling through the small cobbled streets...stopped at the Ruywurm for great scones...then returned to the gelaterie next door for gelato...the interesting and unusual fountain behind the national library is worth seeking out.
Simply fascinating. A bit of a climb if you walk up the Buda side, but well worth it. Views from the Hill are amazing.

Amazing. It is not too bad of a hike, but my 79 year old Mother couldn't have done it. We took a taxi. Our return taxi messed with its toll counter and tried to rip us off, so be careful. The buidings are amazing from the church, palace, bastion and humble row houses. Truely worth the experience to just walk around and see it.

beautiful with amazing biew. this was a very touristy place, but it was also incredibly beautiful and offered amazing views of the city, so it's understandable why most tourists go here. it's a bit of a climb up hill, but it's worth it!
Great Buildings. Great views.. I walked up their early in the morning to beat the tourist hordes. Great to have a leisurely walk around the old perimeter walls and get some brill views of Pest too!
Overview Budapest. It is a nice place ,you get a fully overview.Have a beer (bit expensive here)and enjoy life.Interesting area.
Impressive building, weak art museum. But the winged altarpieces by themselves justify a visit. Budget most of your time for the National Fine Arts Museum at Heroes Square.

Great Views from Castle Hill. http://gonewiththeguys.blogspot.com/2012/07/high-fives-budapest.html
I wrote this brief blog on the five best things to do in Budapest, I had Castle Hill #2!
Had a great time in this city..

Required when visiting Budapest.. You can get a lot of history, views, and culture all on one hill. It's walkable from Pest, and you can take the funicular to the top then enjoy a peaceful walk down. Visit the fishermen's bastion, see Mattias church, see the Royal Palace, and eat a wonderful meal. I read someone else's review which described it at the "Montmarte" of Budapest. It's sorta true. :-)

very beautiful. we did not go inside the musea but we walked around and the buildings and views were stunning. Ashame that the government doesnt take better care of these monuments and properties.For food, the hill is definately not the plae to be, only tourist traps. Food much better on the Pest side
Proposal. Great views, escape from the hustle and bustle of Pest to the peace and quiet of Buda and its castle! Perfect place to propose to your missus :-)

A "must" see" but crowded with tourists. Castle Hill includes the Matthias Church, Fisherman's Bastion, the Royal Palace and a few other sights. The Palace is not open for touring (at least as a palace; it does contain the Budapest History Museum is housed in the palace buildings), but it is impressive and the King Matthias fountain is nice. When we visited in June 2012, the Matthias Church was being renovated, so it was tough to see and appreciate. While there are great views of the Danube from Fisherman's Bastion, I was surprised that in the years since my last visit, a restaurant/cafe has been opened within the bastion, limiting options for viewing if you're not sitting in the cafe. It is for these reasons that I give Castle Hill an average - it's an important, significant sight and one should not miss it. At the same time, there are limitations as described and it is crowded especially in the mornings.
Castle with a big hill!. If you are walking around - good shoes and string legs, this area is not for the faint hearted

Fabulous view of Budapest from Castle Hill. From Castle Hill, you can have the best view of Budapest city, capturing the famous Budapest Parliament, Chain bridge as well as Donau lake into your camera.
Essential. Terrific views and History, the day we were there a troop of mounted cavalry in historic uniform filled past,splendid.Take time to wander around you will enjoy.{2006}
Awsome. Wonderful view of the city on both sides of the Danube.

What an awesome city!. I did not think I will like any city in Europe more than Paris. Until I went to Budapest. This is one of the must do attractions. Beautiful monuments, superb view of the city, charming shops and nice eateries. Don't miss!!!
beautiful views. loved standing on the Buda side looking down on the Danube
beautiful. we stayed up there at Hilton with a view of river and the church roof! Very peaceful and good restaurants to eat at.
Stay here!!. This was a wonderful place to stay! The area is quaint and very interesting. It felt safe and was really fun to walk around in the district. Stay in the Hilton here!!!
Castle Hill. The Castle, now a museum, is amazing, with fantastic sculptures and gardens outside. We didn't see much of the inside as time wouldn't permit.

Beautiful location for a leisurely stroll. I find this to be one of the more beautiful places in Budapest -- there is nothing like the incredible panorama of the Danube from Halaszbasztya or the quaint baroque streets. There are numerous museums -- all very worthwhile, the changing of the guards at the Presidential Palace (the parade, with the drummer, is like stepping back in time) and the underground abyrinths -- you can easily spend a day and the evening exploring the area. The sidestreets -- especially Fortuna Utca -- have some very good restaurants. Even though this is a touristy area, the food is very good. In fact, we had some really good pizza at one of the restaurants. One of my favorite pastry shops is the Ruszwurm -- enjoy some pastry, or ice cream with a chilled glass of champagne -- it's a nice way to end a day on Castle Hill.
Quite a typical castle town. Lots of beautiful architecture, sadly so few of them let you in. Definitely worth of a visit.
Good place to visit for the views. The Budapest castle hill is a good place to visit for the views. The Castle has been redone and not the original form. Very touristy.
nice place and wondwerfull view. nice place and wonderfull view of the city. interesting museum and very good pictures

Fairy tale little town from the 1200's. Loved the high quality shops. Wish it had not been so hot so we could have explored more. There may be a little walk associated with this since they don't allow a bus in the town.
Much to do. While here, don't miss the War Museum, the Telephone Museum, or the Pharmacy Museum. There are so many attractions on the hill that most people miss because of too little time.
Nice views . A nice visit, but one expects more of one of the main turistic places of Budapest. Mainly nice views, nice buildings, and the National Gallery.
