Nice but too many tourists. Go only if you have time on your hands... Quite a hike to the funicular and then up the hill. Not distinguished when compared to other European palaces..
great views of city. Wow factor kicks in at dusk. Views of Pest (especially Parliament) are breathtaking.
Beautiful panorama to the city and the danube. Beautiful panorama to the city and the danube, with many historical buildiungs
Wonderful Views. The views from Castle Hill are fantastic, and the history is wonderful.
Great. Fantastic site a lot of history, we had a very knowledgeable guide. Did lots of walking through cobblestones streets. Unforgettable view of Budapest.

Wonderful Views!. We took the bus up when we came (I don't think the funicular was even working that day), and it was fine. You can walk up, though, if you want to. Castle Hill was beautiful to walk around. We got some snacks from snack stands set up on the street. It was a lovely place to just look around and take pictures. The view of Budapest is just beautiful.
Fairyland castle. Beautifully lit and was magical to see at night. An absolute delight for every little girl to believe she can meet her prince one day!

A stunning view any time of the day. A visit to Budapest wouldn't be complete with a visit to Castle Hill. There are stunning views and places to see. You will have one of your best views of the Danube and Pest from this Buda side. There are a number of cafes and restaurants serving a range of food and beverages.

One of the great views of Europe. If you avoid mid day or afternoon during the main tourist season, the terrace outsdie the wonderful National Gallery has a sweeping view of the Danube, the Parliament Building and Pest. The restaurants (we found) tend to be rather expensive and - obviously - cater for the tourist trade. We were, of course, tourists, but as we have family in Budapest and visit often, we kid ourselves that we are not tourists but visitors!

Well Worth the Visit. When added onto the visit to the Palace it makes a good half day excursion. Great views of the city and some old world charm.Remnants of the WWII battles can still be seen mostly in the form of bullet holes on some of the older ramparts, or buildings. While some overheard comments say these should be repaired, to me it is part of the history that makes the place what it is.

Matthias Church - disappointment!!!. June 2012 - Arrival at the ticket office to visit Matthias church at 9:00am (normal opening hour), a sign in the window indicated that the it was closed until 10:00am and no tickets would be sold until then. At 10:00am, the sign was changed to say opening at 11:00am. Throngs of tourists were milling around waiting and many gave up and left. We returned at 11:00 and were able to finally purchase tickets and enter. Unfortunately, the church is undergoing major renovations and more than half of the interior was blocked by walled barricades and plastic. What a disapointment! Until the renovations are complete, I would waste my time or money visiting this site.
A must see in Budapest. There is much to see here - the National Art Museum, Matyas Church, Fisherman's Bastion, etc. The views of the Pest side are breathtaking.
Popular place for Tourists to visit. The castle is a must to see for a visitor of Budapest beacuse the castle is nice located on the Buda hill.
Great. next to the Matthias church there is a small marzipan museum, nice place to get a drink and relax
A walk around the castle!. Views excellent many sites to see. Set aside a day if you want to see all. A visit to the museum, particularly the basement. Value for money.
Stunning views & photo Ops.. Use the vanicular railway to travel up to the castle, some great views up there ! there are alot of places to visit inc. museums & huge gothic church.
Buda Castle. Very pretty, but you can not go inside the castle, They only allow you to walk around it. The church closed at 2 pm for a wedding so we did not get to go inside the church

Imposing panorama. Castle Hill lives up to its name except that it is grander than the pictures tell you. Be prepared to walk, climb, enter various buildings and ramparts, stroll on boulevards, chat with artists, pick up trinkets, and pay heavily for all tourist attractions. Rising from the banks of a quietly flowing River Danube, the Castle is actually a collection of old structures and vast open spaces. The church with its intricate tile worked roof will enchant a photographer but the history minded tourist may like to know the large extent of restoration in this and other monuments. The old political regime did not necessarily wish to preserve the signs of the aristocratic empires and many buildings were damaged by neglect or the war. Walking along the wide parapets one notices the strategic look out points by which the Castle kept watch over the bend in the river. Tourists today get a panoramic view of Budapest from here. Pretty restaurants open up in the summer so you can chat and take in the views over Hungarian snacks and beer. Even if you don’t have the time to visit other sites in Budapest, you must go to Castle Hill.

a little walk up in the hill. and you will have a great view especially at night..
the only unfortunate thing is, they turn off the lights after 1am.
Great view at the city. Very beautiful but only by day, the area is empty by night.
Castle Hill area. Take the finicular return journey. Great area to walk through and take a coffee at one of the many cafes around the area.

We enjoyed Castle Hill. We generally visit art museums where ever we go and have seen many of the paintings featured in art history or humanities books. It was very interesting to visit a museum to see artwork that I had never encountered in print before. My experience tells me that most art history and humanities courses completely neglect Central Europe in favor of Western Europe. I completely enjoyed the insights I got into Hungarian history and culture through the art. Also this museum has an extensive and wonderful collection of medieval altar pieces that are a joy to view.Also on Castle Hill, of course, are many other sights: Saint Mattias, the Fishermen's Bastion, and the 18th and 19th century "neighborhoods." There are many souvenir shops up there; it's a popular tourist attraction.
Beautiful spot. Lots to do and see there...even in the rain...plenty of places to eat and just walk around,

Tourist destination. This was a real tourist destination. Fortunately we decided to spend time in the History Museum which was amazingly interesting, especially the parts they excavated which date back to the 1300s.
okay. Not as spectacular as i was lead to believe, but nice.

Pure Transylvania. Fairytale village set atop a hill overlooking the Danube and the once independent town of Pest. The best views are gained from the Fishermans Bastion. (Small Charge). Delightful atmospheric place with the interesting church of St.Matthias in the centre.(Small Charge). Toilets available at entrance to Fishermans Bastion. (Small extra charge). Cool fresh air is a relief from the heat of central Budapest (No Charge)
Nice Place beautifull view. Raining a litte bring your umbrella o pay $$ for one small

A must-see. This is essential viewing - if you have not been here, you have not been to Budapest. A wonderful way to spend some time and get to know the history of the city. PS: There is no ATM here - but try the Post Office - excellent service with a smile and welcome! We also had a lovely meal at a small restaurant on the grass near the Fisherman's Bastion area.

You Should Make Time For This. Lovely Area of town. Yes, a little touristy, but quieter than Andrassy and sweeter. It is worth walking around this quaint part of town. We got up there too late to go into the church, but it looks spectacular. We took the cable car up the hill, and there is a way to do it with your subway ticket so it doesn't cost extra. You can also walk up the hill, but I understand it is somewhat steep. The good thing about going later in the day is that you get to see the city from above in the twilight. It was quite lovely. If you have the time, I'd say this was definitely worth it.
i liked it. It has a feeling, many building in a good shape from ancient time, great view from the castle,

Great view!. This is a good place to go to if you would like to see the town from above. If you are in good (or normal) condition I recommend you to go there by foot. I don´t remember how long it took, but it sure was a nice walk. Be careful though. On our way up there was a man trying to play a betting-game with us (coin under one of three cups, guess under which one?) and unfortunately I did not understand that he wasn´t playing fair and we lost a lot of money... The hill was great! :) (Dont forget WATER!!! It´s expensive to buy it on top of the hill!)

So much to see!. Castle hill really is the highlight of any trip to Budapest. From the palace to the Fishermans Bastion, The Labyrinth to the many restaurants, or just a pleasant night-time stoll with stunning views across the city. You could spend an entire week exploring this one attraction!
No 1 !!!. You should go in the first day, on a sunny day. And prepare your legs to walk a lot. But the view is worth the sacrifice. Definitely I will be back there.

Wonderful views. We took bus 16 up the hill from Deak Square. We weren't sure where to get off as it has been 30 years since my last visit. We got off the bus near the restaurants and, as it turned out, near the museums. We watched the changing of the guards and enjoyed the views, then walked to the nearby Matthias Church. As another reviewer mentioned, it is being renovated so just the altar is visible. We loved the Fisherman's Bastion and the views down onto the city and Parliament.

Take a different path...it's better!. One my favorite places in Buda. After seeing the trolleys go up the Hill and climbing up the steps to the first look-out point, we decided to take a path off to the left side of the hill and just started walking and climbing and had no idea where we will end. There were no tourists around; however, there was a local family (3 persons) ahead of us that we lost somewhere or perhaps they lost us. However, it was a scenic route with trees and foliage on one side and the residential apartment buildings on another. Castle Hill almost reminds me of Prague Castle though has a different charm with the little nooks and crannies with the unexpected view or a dead-end road. I like the mixture of the old and the new architecture. Well worth the trek up the hill!

Spectacular views. Enjoyed the journey up on the funicular railway. The views across to the parliament are very good. Matthias church is undergoing restaurant ion inside and hardly any of it can be visited.
Great 2 days exploring the castle hill area. Not to be missed. Great day out for all ages. We couldn't cover the area, so went back for another day's visit.
Beautiful views. Beautiful views, Friendly people. Got there just in time for the changing if the guard. Would recomend a visit while in Budapest
Beautiful view. Not much up there, but nice walk around learning the history.
sights. Very special atmosphere many attraction in one place
breathtaking views. So much to see from this hill top experience and I would recommend access via the hop on hop bus OR bus no 16 from the city.
Castle Hill district. The cleanliness and fantastic views. Use the hop on, hop off buses to get there. You will also get a book of vouchers that include restaurant discounts and river trips.

Disney land for adults....... OMG!!!!! amazinly breath taking. You just cant absorbe how beautiful a place can be . First of all its huge and your eye is pulled and dragged all over the place . Take a pile of snaps and videos as you ll want to share it with your friends and family. Do allow plenty of time for this area dont rush as there s loads of little back streets and corners to turn and find amazing eateries . Arrive hungrey and leave plenty of space for checking out all the cafes and resturants .Again you ll get all the direction s on your guide book which you can buy before hand where you live or buy there in Budapest . I suggest doing some homework before hand and get your bearings and decide before what you want to get out of Budapest . Its such a rich and diverse landscape that initially you ll be a little awe struck and may be like a child in a sweet shop. Enjoy
Great neighborhood!. Walk around this neighborhood. It's very colorful, and you'll get some good pictures for your photo book.
Great views. The views are great lots of places to get great photos,many resturants and shops

A must. Be sure to take the funicular up hill and then the Fisherman´s Bastion way down. On top of the Bastion are very good restaurants with live music and a superb view of the Parliament and all Pest.

Breathtaking views. Castle Hill gives you excellent views back over Pest. Exploring the town is a must and delightful little cafes can be found in the back streets. The Alchemists House is worth a visit complete with stuffed crocodile hanging from the ceiling and rooms that could have come out of Harry Potter
Wonderful walking area with great views. You can get here by funicular from Clark Adam Square or by foot from Matthias Church. The area have a amazing view to Pest. Don't forget your camera!

Beautiful views. When we visited this area in August 2011 there was a beer festival which was set in the impressive grounds. The funicular gave beautiful views over Budapest. Definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful sites. Great to see such amazing sites, the tram ride up was cheap and good.

Magnificent Views!. We took one of the open top buses, which is in my view the best way to see any city, and they help you plan what you want to go back and see. The views from Castle Hill are just stunning and there are many vantage points from which you can take in the views. Some great shops to see, and places to eat, certainly a must not miss when you visit Budapest.

stunning views. Come here in the evening to see the Budapest panorama with all the lights shining. In June many photographers come here to take some beautiful pictures. The funicular operates until 10 pm. It costs 1500 HUF round trip. It takes around 90 seconds to get to the top of the hill :-)
Enchanting. Castle Hill is where Disney got some of the ideas for the beautiful villages in Walt Disney World, I am sure of it now after seeing the town. Beautiful and full of history.
Great views. Take the fununclear (?) up and walk down. Great views of the city. Lots of locals relaxing here.

Relaxing, despite the crowds. Having spent a fortnight in Budapest, the area round Verhegy is my favourite. The buildings are older and not so ornamented, but the place is quieter and the air fresher.It's a lovely place just to stroll round. Try the Var Bistro/Restuarant in the town square for a self-service lunch, asking for the dishes of the day. Excellent value.
you can see everything there. amazing view for all city from the city hill with spring fresh air

Great to walk around, but don't pay.... Don't pay to go into the church or walk onto the Fisherman's Bastion. It's better to walk around and get a cheap filling lunch at the cafeteria on Fortuna #4 (just past the Matthias Church)
Amazing architecture. The architecture and history of Castle Hill was remarkable.

Beauty meets history. The entire Castle Hill area is worth a couple days in order to experience the museums, views and architecture of the area. Experience cobblestone streets, underground caves and the peace inside sanctuaries. A "must do" for Budapest visitors.

Standard central European 'old town'. It's quaint and pretty enough, but anyone who's been to any other cities in central or eastern Europe may be underwhelmed by the castle hill.
I also wouldn't recommend buying or eating anything up here - the prices are super inflated.

Awe inspiring views. Even though almost completely destroyed during WWII, one would never guess that this quaint & historic quarter was rebuilt & restored to it's former glory. The view of Chain Bridge & the 'Pest' side of the city are awe inspiring...especially at night.
Enjoy exploring. the castle is well worth the walk about, make sure you visit the labrynth - address 19?? ask if not sure - a warren of underground caves - superb.
Beautiful views. Stunning views from the top - and the walk wasn't too bad. You can get the fernicular to the top though if you need to. The Military hospital nearby is also worth a visit.

Amazing view over the city - very picturesque. We spent a while waiting for the Hop On Hop Off bus and the view was amazing so we got some good shots of Budapest from the top. There were also places to buy water a quick snack before moving on.
Castle. well worth a visit - dont bother with the cable car walk up its not far and the views all along the way are amazing

Impressive viewz. We bought a ticket for the hop-on / hop-off bus which was very handy as they also have a stop at the top. After visiting the castle we walked down to the Danube and accross the chain bridge.

Great view. It's something definitely worth seeing if you visit Budapest (can do it with a walking tour). It is a beautiful area but also REALLY touristy. There are museums to check out, the fisherman bastion, as well as many other attractions. It's a great place to see and do a few things and then go back to the less touristy areas.
Lovely views. Worth the hike to get up here. Lovely view. Did it as part of a walking tour so got a bit of the history associated with it.

A must do. This is a must do as the view of Budapest is spectacular. We expected to be able to go into the castle complex and see a lot of historic buildings furnished from the past but you can't do that - although at least one of the old buildings has been converted into an art museum.
Must see. We did this area on the first day, gorgeous area on the Buda side. A must see if in Budapest even for just a day.
be there at night. great during the day time, but make sure you visit at night

across the bridge. We walked across the chain bridge from Pest to Buda as part of our free Intro to Budapest walking tour. We walked up the hill, a hike that got my heart and my lungs asking for a rest, along a path and up a series of stairs. I was glad I had brought water and that I had dressed in layers. A couple people in our group found the climb to be too much and they went back down in order to take the funicular up instead. The views of Pest from the top were amazing! You can see for quite a far distance. Our guide from the tour was incredibly energetic, interesting, and knowledgeable. I wish I knew her name so I could again compliment her.
Best View. If you don't visit Castle Hill you'll waste your trip to Budapest. Grab a bottle of wine and head up at sunset to watch the city lights come on.

A Must!. This is a wonderful place to walk around. I spent about a week i Budapest and found that later in the afternoon the area is quieter. Tour groups seem to visit in the morning. There is a small changing of the guard at 8am and 10am (these were the ones I witnessed, there may be other times).

If you visit the Buda side, you can't miss it. Castle hill was mostly rebuilt after WWII but is a must visit if you are a history buff. Up on the top of the hill, Castle Hill provides a wonderful view of the Pest side. There is also an archaeological site next to it where there are excavating an old Jewish town.
amazing!. Went here on the FREE walking tour....it was great. The guides were friendly and very knowledgable
Top of the Hill. The Castle area is a mix of modern & old. It is all well preserved.
Beautiful area and the Cathedral is beautiful. Beautiful area and the Cathedral is wonderful and being restored.

Historic Castle Hill. A trip to Budapest is not complete without a visit to Castle Hill, which includes a historic neighborhood as well as the Castle, the Matyas Templom, and the Fisherman's Bastion. The hill and the surrounding neighborhoods afford a gorgeous view of both Buda and Pest, and strolling the tree lined avenues along the wall, or the city winding streets that make up this part of the city, is relaxing and allows visitors to soak up the atmosphere of this part of the city which is one of the oldest parts of the city. The trip is not complete with a visit to the Mary Magdalene tower which is all that remains of the Church of Mary Magdalene which once sat on site but was destroyed in WWII. From the Castle Hill area it is an easy downhill walk through the winding streets and stairways of Buda to reach the Moscow Square and the main tram line (4/6).

A majestic view of the Danube and Pest. Overlooking the 200m wide Danube the castle hill boasts a beautiful imperial palace a- a remnant of the Austro-Hungarian era. There are some fine sculptures, especially in the backyard. But the main attraction is the view of the river and the part of Pest. Next to the palace the little streets provide an opportunity of a gastronomic adventure

Good combination of views, museums, gift shops and restaurants. Reached either by bus, stairways or the funicular from near the west side of the Chain Bridge, old Buda is well worth a visit, despite having been rebuilt almost from the ground up after WWII.There are several charming souvenir stalls and many gift shops in the area as well as important museums, notable the Hungarian National (Art) Gallery in the old Royal Palace. Also there are plenty of cafes and restaurants in the three or four parallel streets which run along the ridge of the hill. We liked the restaurant called Speiz.The Fisherman's Bastion (rather like Sacre Coeur in Paris, but on a tiny scale) is perhaps over-rated as a view point since there are slightly better viewpoints in front of the Hungarian National Gallery.The St Matthias church is also modern, but built in an old style with typical coloured ceramic tiles on its roof. If you are there at the right time, you can see the 'changing of the guard' outside the Presidential Palace, just by the top of the funicular.

Best part of Budapest. Visiting Castle Hill was my favourite part of my trip to Budapest. The architecture is amazing, the statues are stunning (and I am usually unimpressed by statues), the atmosphere is great and you can choose between the crowded areas and more secluded streets. I wandered around for a few hours and saw the Castle itself, the Labirinth, the Mathias Church, the Fishermen's Bastion and the lovely streets and houses in the area. The view from the top alone is worth the trip.

Great Monument. the path to the top is quite wooded and we could see some used syringes on the way. The many benches in the secluded corners could be a lovers delight and we did see many couples cozying up.The victory monument on the top is great and the world war 2 bunkers are well preserved.
Excellent 4 days. We enjoyed the 'Hop on & Off Red & Yellow buses, good value for money & great to see the sights.
Don't miss it. A wonderful view on Budapest, the Castle and surroundings havea very special, old atmosphere.
The view over Pest in late afternoon is stunning. I had my Canon L 70-300 and the pictures I took are all awesome especially the one with the parliament building.

you have to go there. its really the must do for budapest,and theres a funicular to get you up there, so no need to climb. fishermans bastion is no 1 place to visit for the view, but theres a cluster of museums, the national gallery, some old houses, also some touristy restaurants

Wonderful Views of the Danube and Pest. Situated high on a hill on the Buda side, one of the first things you see is a bullet ridden building left that way to show the ravages of war. Very touristy area, most shops have the same souveniers. Touted as the "old city" it is very picturesque and of course a beautiful church. Walk to the courtyard for amazing views of the river and many bridges.
Views. Provides spectacular views of the Pest side of the city
Beautiful. Brilliant!!! It's a trek but well worth it. Bring comfortable shoes and a camera.
Wonderful.. The most fantastic views over the City. We stopped off here from the Hop On Hop Off bus. Very good as you can decide how long you want to stay as the buses come round every hour.
Wonderful day or night. Both times are great since Budapest is all lit up at night, prettiest city at night I've ever seen. Take the funicular if you don't wanna walk to the top, but make sure you go
Enjoy the trip. Great views and history, great place by day or night
castle view. definatley not a place to miss allow plenty of time lots too see
Brilliant. Dont miss it the views are fantastic well worth the climb if you walk up
great view. Very good view from the top, the national library is also there. HUge place to take long walks, easy to reach, note: funicular from Clark Adam square

Walk up for a delightful afternoon in the park. You can take the funicular up to the top (or the Hop On/Off bus) but we enjoyed a leisurely walk up the paved paths and stairs to catch the views from the Cittadella. There are souvenir sellers at the top. Also spend some time strolling the old town streets - the architecture is amazing! Don't miss Matyas Church.
Excellent free afternoon wandering around on a bright day. I found it free of tourists and was able to peacefully enjoy it almost by myself. Go before noon.
Beautiful. A beautiful area with a beautiful castle. Nice views over the city.
Worth the up hill walk. The view of the city is amazing once you get to the top!!
Beautiful city views. The overlook provides amazing views of a truly beautiful city.
a must when in Buda. crowds of tourists so go early or late afternoon. Take the metro around to back of Buda hill and walk up through old town, then walk down through Castle grounds
Great view of the city. The castle hill gives a great panorama over the city. A fair was also organized there and it was very funny and animated.
Breathtaking views. Castle Hill is an amazing district, which offers breathtaking views over the Danube
spectacular views. Do the 3 hour city tour as you do see the sights and then can choose what to re visit.
Busy place. Very busy and full of tourists but the view was worth it

Great for exploring and eating and drinking. There is a little super market opposite the cathedral the water was cheap as chips 1.5 litre of water was 99 HFL (30pence) so don't buy from the little cares or stalls.

What a spectacular setting!. This location is one of the rare ones where the views in every direction are amazing, but the destination is alive with so much to see and do. Marvelous St Matjas Cathedral, Statues and sculpture everywhere and magnificent, lots of shops, cafes, interesting nooks and crannies within the caves . A don't miss if you are in Budapest. Take the Funicular from the base of the hill just off the Chain Bridge.
Great views. So interesting and the atmosphere is wonderful, its possible to wander back down the hill from here
amazing views. best views of Pest and all the historic monuments of the city there for you to explore
Should see. We liked the view of the city and very tourist friendly with WC and many places to eat. The cable car ride is worth the money.

Gorgeous buildings/gorgeous views. I went to see this famous Budapest site with a friend. We wandered the area, saw the views, and enjoyed the beautiful day. Well worth a visit. The Church should be viewed; the National Gallery as well.

Wonderful Views. Take the funicular up to the castle. Allow yourself plenty of time to wander along the streets and into the castle complex. A pity that important excavations, covered over during the dark days of communism have not been restarted.

Must see in Budapest. It's great to visit this area. Lots to see here and the view from here to look down to the Pest side and also the river is very good. It's very touristy but definitely worth the time visiting.
Great view. We went up on a bustrip and had a great view over Pest
Very pretty. Great area to walk around in. You won't be disappointed.

Beautiful views from here. The castle district offered excellent views of Pest. We took the hop off hop on tour to the castle district. It is a popular hop off spot therefore the wait to get an open seat required we wait a few buses but no big deal. The area was easy to walk around.
Buda is beautiful.. It's a fabulous view, the tram wasn't working the day we went, but the walk is easier than it looks. Make the walk up the hill, it's beautiful and worth the small effort.
Interesting old area. So much to do and see in this area, especially if you get off the tourist route.
Excellant place to visit. We spent a whole day wondering about the streets and building on castle Hill,it is really well preserved
Best at night. It's far less crowded and you get amazing views over Budapest including the Basillica, Parliament and Chain bridge.
Gorgeous!. This was one of my favorite places in Budapest! The castle and the surrounding areas are really nice to walk in and great for taking pictures. You could easily spend 1/2 a day there.
Hill area. Very pretty little area to walk about in. Restaurants in the evening were very quiet though.
Wonderful views. Gorgeous afternoon spent on Castle Hill. Did take the funicular up the hill and wandered around the streets, St. Matthias church and Fisherman's Bastion. Beautiful.

Don't miss it!. The wonderful panoramatic view from the top of the hill, the splendid mosaic roofed church, a cosy little bar down a side street which seemed to have a football theme going on the quiet (think Ferenc Puskas era) and where snacks were provided to us weary travellers...
Castle Hill.. Absolutely beautiful buildings. Go up by the funicular which is an attraction in itself. Definitely get return ticket, the view coming down is stunning.

A lovely spot to spend an hour or 3. Very mixed style of building - lots to see - fabulous views - if you're lucky you'll see the changing of the guard. Little stalls selling postcards, souvenirs etc. Small stall for drinks and ice cream.

Good, not great. Well, its clear that hill has suffered during war. You can have good lunch of coffee, but I have one major problem. Lack of directions. Area is full of museums and you have to ask locals or book guide, because no sign will guide you. At all, its well renovated, but war took its historicality.
Another castle-spectacular setting.. Great view and another castle which doesn't compare to Catherine the Greats in St. Petersberg.
Take your camera. Beautiful old buildings with delightful views acroos the Danube
Views. Very nice. Got to see the guards walking. Would like to spend more time there the next time.
Scenic spot. Good place to shop - more scenic with little shops & cafes - slower pace, less commercial than Vaci.
Five star views. Brilliant city views, great architecture. Funicular good way to save the legs.
A must-see. Breathtaking statues and views from the ramparts. Lots of photo opportunities

Stunning. Everywhere you turned you had stunning views, spectacular buildings and little passages that opened up into shopping galleries.We went into a supermarket with a cafe above for a break and ordered cheese and ham sandwiches and a drink, this cost 900ft. The sandwiches turned out to be 2 baguettes each with fresh salad. As a bonus the upper floor next to the cafe sells the best selection of wines and spirits, including Palinka from the cheapest to the most expensive brands.We went at Easter and we found that the whole castle area was closed off unless you paid a fee to get in, but this was for rwo days only so was a minor inconvenience

Lots. Lots to see and do. Historical. St Matthias Church - beautiful on the outside, but interior covered in plastic sheeting whilst renovation work being carried out. Masonry dust everywhere. They don't tell you this when you purchase the tickets.
Crowded. Mid day lunch crowd. Saturday with loads of busses filled. Good for a look. Lots of stands selling expensive tat. Really detracts from the experience.

A truly beautiful area that delights at every turn. This was by far our favourite area in Budapest. We climbed to the top of the hill rather than take the bus and it was worth the effort. Every corner we turned produced another amazing building or monument to photograph. We were totally immersed in the wonder of this area for over 2 hours without realising the time. The views across the city were spectacular and this was a truly memorable way to spend our last day in Budapest. From the Castle to the Bastion and everything in-between it was a photographers delight. We did not pay to enter anywhere, just wandered in amazement and took lots of photos. Spectacular!!
Excellent. The Castle District was the highlight of our trip. It ia a very pleasant area with some beautiful buildings and the changing of the guard was very interesting.
Hill on top. Great view during the night...you can see the Budapest like it is on your hand...nice restaurant...and suvenire market
Lovely Area. We had a long walk around Castle Hill, beautiful area, stunning architecture, worth a visit.
Delightful!. A delightful area, full of history, with an almost fairy tale quality.
you've got to do it. Good views from there. Also, the art gallery is worth a look

Amazing. A chance to see a fairytale comes to life. This is the first thing you should see while you visit and don't miss out on the creme schnit cake at worrmit I think it's called which is a local family cafe just ask some locals they will show you.
Good exercise going up the steps!. Check out the buses available if you don't fancy walking up the steps - approximately 200! Plenty to walk around and see. Allow a full day if possible.
Beautiful. This area is peaceful and not as commercialised as Pest. The views are stunning.

A stunning Day out. A visit to Budapest without visiting the Hill which also holds the national gallery and Fisherman's bastion would be incomplete. It is a day out which is a different town to be honest. The views, walks, bastion, palace/gallery and cathedral are all worth a visit and there are numerous little galleries, cafe's bars and restaurants in the area. Take the cable about £4 return and just savour the day. Stunning.
Stunning views. A definite place to visit while in Budapest - stunning views across the city, the palace and lots of other attractions.
Fun funicular to the top. Took the quick funicular ride tothe top of Castle Hill. Nice view of the area, Danube.

Worth a visit. I recommend spending at least half a day on Castle Hill! The castle itself is amazing, but if you wander away a little bit there are all kinds of great shops and cafes, as well as some other important sites. Take the funicular up and walk back down.
A great place to spend your day. There is so much to see here and you do not have to spend money to see some beautiful and historic sights.
meal with aview. good food good quality could have a better variety,great staff,,with most amazing views..

Stunning views of Budapest. If you're visiting Budapest for even one day, be sure to get the little funicular train up Castle Hill and be prepared for stunning panorama of the city.Try to make it around midday to see the changing of the guard!One other tip is that things are a little bit more pricey on the hill so just be prepared for that. Take a stroll around the market and go wine tasting if you can! A great fun experience!Castle Hill holds a special place in my heart as I was proposed to here in 2005 and with such beautiful surroundings (and a wonderful man of course!) how could I have said no? Simply beautiful!
Scenery. Beautiful scenery and views across whole city. Lovely for a walk around

Green with envy. If I had the money I'd like to have a place up here. The Castle District is a bit touristy, especially around the Mátyás church area, but the little alleys and secretive courtyards have a rare charm and are immune to bus loads. Walk round the walls, you can go nearly all round on the Buda side and sty pretty close on the east as well. And go a bit away from the crowds . . . there is more than that peculiar atrocity of a Fishermen's Bastion.

History. You can reach the Hill by metro, and then walk to the hill. Ideal to have a nice walk, plenty of history. Now is a kind of close neighborhood, where the old buildings are occupied by particulars and different enterprises. You can find information of the historic places in Hungarian, but there is not any kind of information in English. Go down by foot or by the funicular (little expensive).

Were do you start. Went up on the old Funicular train, must be a hard walk, there is so much to see in this area its hard to give a small report but well worth a trip up there there must be two days worth of things to see.

Go up Castle Hill by foot via Chain Bridge from Pest is the fastest way.. Castle Hill is one of the places in Budapest to catch a great view of the city from the top. The compound is huge but small enough to be explored via foot; many attractions to see but you'll need an entrance ticket. Personally did not go into any of the attractions ($0 spent) but still already had many things to see & keep me entertained. Definitely worth a visit plus a place you can get very good pictures of Budapest.Tip: Visit Castle Hill early evening to catch a beautiful sunset from the top!
Views, views and more views. WOW, so beautiful and the view keeps getting better and better as you continue to walk up the hill. You can get here by public or any of the Hop on and off buses.

What a View. Unfortunately our tour bus allowed a short visit. We would love to go back (in a taxi) and spend time on castle Hill. Much to see and a great place to enjoy Hungarian Stew they way they prepare the dish.
The old town. Simply a beautiful part of Budapest, visit and enjoy

Funcicular Lift?. Hint - simply take the #16 bus - if you have your Budapest Transit pass this is a no-brainer, to the top and walk around. The lift is expensive and hardly gaining you much in terms of walking relief that the bus ride won't also give.

well worth a visit. The whole Castle Hill area is spectacular. You could and probably will spend hours just wandering around the old streets looking at the buildings. It is a well-preserved warren of old streets, with the spectacular buildings of the Royal Palace complex at one end. The views of the Danube and the city from various points are spectacular and worth seeking out. In between, there are lots of retaurants and coffee shops for much-needed breaks - your feet will appreciate the rest!

A nice view, horrible disturbed by communist and Hilton architecture. If you ever see Mr. Hilton, torture him till he admits to demolish his stupid ugly awful Budapest Hilton Hotel at Castle Hill. It is a crime to humanity that such construction is even in someones mind. If you have plans to stay there: demand another hotel and let Hilton pay for it. It is simply criminal to stay in such building with completely no respect to history. It is disgusting and if you staid there, you should reflect on your own ethics.The rest of Castle Hill is in general very nice, nevertheless the ugly communist style buildings in between. It is for sure worthwhile a visit and has a nice atmosphere, although I missed the real historical spirit.
LOVELY AREA GREAT VIEWS. Nice part of Budapest you will see a differant side of Budapest on the Buda side
Fishermans bastion. Stunning views across the river to Pest,the city in all its glory.
History museum very interesting. Worth a visit if only for the views of the city. the history museum was definately worth the visit though
Sight to visit. Make sure you give a day to the Buda side of the river, to the Castle in particular, it's worth visiting!
History and Excercise. Yes, it is totally beautiful, take along your comfortable walking shoes, there are no rides.
Wow!. This was a highlight on our visit. What a beautiful well kept site. Was interesting to see the guards doing their ceromonial bit.
Castle Hill. Interesting. The architecture is amazing. The view is outstanding (overlooks the Danube)
Views from Castle Hill. Wow, beautiful in the day and wonderful in the night. Very romantic if you're a couple and ace if you're a photographer!
Beautiful!. This is definitely a must see when in Budapest. Our Budapest Free Walking Tour ended here.
Lots to see. This area is bigger than you might first think and includes the original castle area and area near hotels and the old church.
Castle Hill. Great views over the Danube, Buda and Pest. Well worth the trip

Beautiful Buda. The Buda side was a bit busier and slightly more touristy than the Pest side but had a very different flavour than the Pest side but definitley in a positive way. The palace, matyas church and fishermans bastion can be seen from the Buda side and we spent the day walking around the various sites and streets, there are also several cafes and markets too. The top of the hill can be reached either by the Furnicular or a fairly short walk up the hill which is a nice walk to do when the whether is good.
Highly recommend. The view is spectacular! The Danube with the view of the Buda Castle belongs to the World's Heritage-I'm not surprised...
Castle hill. Up the furnicular train, don't worry there's plenty of walking once you get up to the top
An interesting place. Lots to see and do, with plenty of cafe/resturants

stunning views. One of the best ways of spending a morning is to stroll around the castle district.. beautiful area, watch out for loose cobbles and holes where cobbles should be. you need to be looking down as well as looking around
Romantic district. Loved the architecture, the little streets and the views.
A must see. This is a must see when you are in Buda. We did this on the walking tour and on the bus tour if you are not fit I would suggest the bus tour only.
Castle Quarter. Very picturesque - looked like a scene out of Chitty Chitty Bang Bang!
Amazing view. Amazing views and lots of monuments and museums. Well worth a visit.

Nice for a walk. Good place to go if you're interested in museums, then you can spend literally hours on Varhegy. You can either take the Sziklo up, or just walk by yourself, it isn't that steep. I'd really recommend wearing trainers or flats though, as the cobbled walks are not the most comfortable thing to walk on.

Very beautiful, with nice view over the town.. Perfect place for having coffee with a girlfriend in the evening. You can take a ride in Funikular - somehow similar to one you have in Hong Kong on Victoria Hill.
Very interesting. There are so many momuments around that we felt that we really should immerse ourselves in the culture. I appreciated the tour guide we had
A lovely area for a stroll. This was a lovely area to walk around with many interesting sights.

Castle district...super views!!. The castle area is stunning! Fishermans Bastion, some remains of the castle and a lovely old church..St Matthias. There are some fabulous views to be had of the pest side and super photo taking opportunities abound!! Although, it is supposed to be more expensive, we didn't find it really overpriced at all! We stopped at a cafe and had coffee and the most wonderful cake!!! The castle district is a must see!!
must see but not in the heat. be early bird or wait untill 4pm - do not go under heat when it's most crowaded

Magnificent!. On castle hill you have a magnificent view of Budapest, blended with the old castle and village around it. You find some museums here too. The best thing to do is take a walk in the small village after visiting the castle.
great views of pest. we climbed to the top on foot because the weather was really clear and bright however you can catch a lift on the tour bus.There are a few market stall there.
Excellent education. The museum is an excellent education on the fate of the site and helps explain the German, Soviet and Hungarian relationship over the past 100 years.
Just wander at random.. What a beautiful place to just amble, there is a delight around every corner and behind every door. So glad we avoided the crowds in Summer even if it was a little bracing!
Awe Inspiring. Go buy mulled wine on top of the White castle, the view is unbeatable.

A must for a beautiful view of Pest and to see Matthias Church.. This hilly side of the Danube is very different from flat Pest. It's a very touristy area but I'd recommend spending a few hours here on your visit to Budapest. There are several museums here but my favourite parts of Castle Hill was the Pest panorama, the old Ministry of War building that is full of bullet holes, and Matthias Church. It was inconvenient that you had to pay to use the bathroom (even in the supermarket cafe). There is a funicular that can take you from the Buda side of the Chain Bridge to Castle Hill and back but it's pricey (about 3 € one-way and about 5 € roundtrip) for a three-minute ride. You'll be better off walking (5-10 minutes) or taking the #16 bus.
Best viewpoint. Interesting buildings and fantastic views over the city

Varhegy Negyed offers a unique medieval flavor not found in any other European capital. It also provides a magnificent. Varhegy contains a rich medieval flavor not found in any other European capital. It also offers a grand view of the city.

Really nice to walk around. It's a really nice area to walk around because it's protected by Unesco. There are a lot of options to get to the castle. First you can by funicular ( until 22.00H!). There is also a busstop near the castle. In my opinion is the best way to get up by foot. It's really not a long walk but the view was amazing. The Castle is really beautiful and there are a lot of narrow streets in the area to walk around. The buildings are really amazing. The best thing to do is to bring an information book with you, because there are no english translations.
Lovely view if it hadn't been snowing. I went up by funicular. Unfortunately it was snowing heavily so the view was obscured. Still enjoyable though.

A must see!. You can't visit Budapest and not come here - admittedly, we visited in mid-February, in a heavy snow shower, but it's magical. The buildings are lovely, and just strolling round the streets was great.

Picturesque; a pleasant walk. This is the the most quintessentially historic and picturesque part of Budapest. A lovely area for just a walk as we did. We travelled up by the funicular which goes from the bottom of the chain bridge. There is also a path just to the right of the funicular if you want to walk up.

Good for a walk. This area is good for a nice walk - after the walking tour! Without the information about the area, you'll really have no idea what you're looking at. Also, the main palace is now a museum which you must pay for! Just as a heads up: no public toilets in the area and no real tourist info at the site!
More impressive than Prague. I was always very impressed with the caste area in Prague, but this blew me away at night from the river below. Beautiful...
Take your camera. Great view and lots of character. Be prepared to walk around, or sit in a cafe to stay warm!

Breathtaking views of the city and the river. There are many great things to say about this historic site. The great vantage point atop the hill overlooking the river and the palace across it. The interesting architecture and walkways. The falcon owner selling a picture chance (that was memorable). All in all an uplifting and refreshing experience.

Lots to see. We enjoyed climbing up to this via the funicular railway. Once on the hill, there was so much to see within a short walk: beautiful architecture from several different historic periods. There was also a wonderful cafe near the medieval remains, which served wonderful cakes and hot chocolate.
Castle on the hill. The views over the city are worth the walk. Could do with more information in English,

Pleasant. This is a pleasant area to spend a couple of hours but apart from the impressive history/architecture I was a little disappointed in the overall ambience of the area however it was good not to see too much tourist tack.

a must see. It is my favorite place in Budapest. You get an amazing view over the city. Beautiful in the day and in the night too. Perfect for a relaxing day with long walks and nice photos for later.

Best views over Pest. We went in January. It was cold and only a few tourist. It was perfect. Take time to wonder around. We also had a lunch in Pest Buda and it was one of our best meals in Budapest. Go to the Faust Wine Celler for wine tasting (takes about 3 hours).

Stay at the Hilton to see the castle district. We so enjoyed being in the heart of the castle district. We were next door to Fisherman's Bastion and it was very scenic. Great restaurants. Very pleasant.

Nice representation of History. As much as this area has been rebuilt, it is still worth the visit. It provides a great view of the city and the river. At the time of our visit, they were digging out old parts of the castle area that are underground. It provided an interesting perspective. One thing worth checking out is the History museum in the area.
All the way up. Make sure you take the long way up the hill, after visiting Taban.The view from the top is well worth the effort.
Matthias Rex, my Son's namesake.. My son loved the physical connection to his heritage and name.
impresive building. the castle and the surroundings is just great with a superb view over Budapest. To bad the basilica was closed due to renovation. Very nice place for souvenirs.
Beautiful!. Overall this area in Buda is amazing, it is a MUST see when you come here!

Picturesque Area - Lots of Beautiful Buildings and Monuments. I walked across Chain Bridge and up to Castle Hill. It is an oasis of peace and quiet with cobblestones and pretty squares. It also has the striking large Castle which houses two museums, the huge Turul Bird statue (significant in Budapest folklore) that can be seen from the Pest side, and some nice statues. There is also the ancient St. Matthias church with its frilly Neo-Gothic spire and the Plague Column beside the church with the fairytale like Fisherman's Bastion on the other side of the church. The views of the city across the Danube from Castle Hill are breath-taking and had me taking many pictures.One can spend the better part of a day on Castle Hill. I saw much of it but would like to go back and explore some more - so much to see and so little time!

Wonderful view right across Danube. Wonderful view right across Danube . Don’t miss the underground hospital/bunker! Very moving and made alive with the wax statues.
There you will find a lot of interesting information on the History of Hungary.
Very friendly staff as well.

Beautiful, BUT.... This turned me into an idiot. You're looking for a single medieval building until you realize that the whole district is a castle, and I've heard that a lot of the physical castle was brought into the museum in the middle, but it was closed. Go to the cafe on the sharp corner, and get a cappucino and a piece of cake-you will be very glad you did. Saw this in January 2008.
Spend the day on Castle Hill. Everything, it was captivating. The church there is unbelievable, it was once a mosque so the old colors are still visible.
Good strategic view. Good strategic view right across Danube toward Pest with the best part of half a day there a nice village within a city
wonderful. I liked everything, castle, museum, Mathias templom and its concert, Halaszbastya, Litea library, the siklo, the view on the town, by day and by night

Wonderful view!. If you go up there don't miss the underground hospital/bunker! Very moving and made alive with the wax statues.The visit with a guide gives a lot of interesting information on the History of Hungary. Very friendly staff as well.
A beautiful area to look over the city. A great place to wander around and wonderful views of the city, especially at night to see the amazing lights

Well worth a visit. We took the funicular rail to Castle Hill which provided a great experience and wonderful views. The Castle itself is huge and needs several hours to explore properly. There are incredible buildings and the views over Buda and Pest are not to be missed.
Great view. Well worth a vist on a tour bus. The view is great!
Very interesting. Expensive furnicular up the hill but very interesting historical museum when you get to the top!

Away from the bustling crowd. After a day of sightseeing in the Pest side of Budapest, it was so nice to come back to a quieter Castle Hill. It was so enjoyable to be able to walk the quiet streets in the evening. Being by the beautifully lit St. Mathias Church or over looking the Pest city lights is so enjoyable.

beautiful view. Castle hill is awesome and give you breath taking views of Budapest, Featurning buda, pest and the beautiful Danube. It also has a lot of suvinor stores up there that has great prices.
Castle Hill. brillaint views across the city and to the hills, great little tea shop nearby and choice of walking or using funicular to go up and down
Pleasant walk. View from the hill is very nice, but a lack of good dining option nearby is a little disappointing.

The place to visit in Budapest. If you have limited time in Budapest then this is definitely the place to visit. The architecture is stunning and there are breathtaking views over the river towards the Parliament Building and Pest.
So beatutiful!. The view was awesome! We went there in Sept and it was during the Art and Wine festival. It was so fun and would recommend this palce to everyone!
A Polinka Festival. We could try different types of Poliinka. Between my husbnd & myself, we got to try 8 different kinds.
Nice area. You can see the beauty of Hungary's architecture, and great view to the city from above, on a foggy winter , it was so mystical.

Fantastic. Great place to visit to get photo's and a fantastic view of the Danube and the parliament house in Budapest. I would take a full day to see it all at least, I spent 4 hours and ran out of time. Enjoy!

A must for the view. For any tourist, the Buda tour starts here with the breathtaking view over Pest. There is no real castle to look at, but a it's a good start for walking towards the Fisherman's bastion and the Mathyas church.
Awesome!. Saw it with Free Walking Tours. YAY! go with them or by yourself. It's amazing!
Lunch on the Lawn. Biked from hostel and grabbed lunch from the little market in castle hill and then sat on the lawn and had sandwiches, fruit, chips and a local beer. A fun little bit of history.

Beautiful Royal Complex and Great View on Pest Side. Easy to reach from Danube (abt. 15 min easy walk). If you're lazy for walking, you can also take the cable tram. Castle hill is full with nice buidings from XV century. Very interesting touristic place in Budapest. From there you can find wonderful view on the city. The castle is divided in two parts: Royal district and living one.For the visitors who plan to celebrate New Year eve and are looking a place for good view on the city, the Castle Hill is the best location.
Castle hill. Splendid surroundings, with a nice view over Budapest. You can take the funicular railway at Clark Adam tér,
Beautiful district. While windy and cold, Castle Hill provides great views, shopping, and historic sites

not to be missed. I wasn't sure what to expect from the journey up to Castle Hill but it is definitely a place where you can spend an entire day! do not miss the Hospital in the Rock. It was fantastic. and the church is something to behold. We did not get into the gallery but the outside was stunning! Funicular was cheap and quick!
amazing view. view is everything. get well dressed as it is very very cold in December and January. Local tour is good, the one for three hours.
Beautiful place. I visited Castle on the evening, it was amazing to see! Wonderful statues, great atmosphere.
Wonderful views across the river. Great area with some real history but it didn't seem particularly well explained anywhere.

Historic Site wourth a visit.... The architecture was exotic.. i visited it on a foggy day so could not see much but the views from this place must be really great... would do it next time.... i wish some more english descriptions were there....

Lively District. Easy walking area with beautiful views of the Danube and the Pest side from virtually all locations. Lots of little stores, and the market selling Hungarian crafts was an added bonus.

Fabulous.. This is an interesting area to explore. Whilst not as impressive as the castle in Prague, it is still a good place to visit. There are some interesting statues, and some excavations going on, and there are some little stalls and shops to look around.

incredible views, amazing architecture. We walked the hill up to see the most amazing views ever. Do not miss this experience. It looks magnificent from below, but is huge once you get up to the Castle Hill area.

Awesome views of the city and tons of history. Between the galleries and the Lords Street, this is an area with tons fo history. Additionally, the views of the city from here are amazing. Take the Funicular up (walking down was OK) and be prepared to spend a couple hours or even the whole day.
Many attractions. Liked that everything was close together. Go early and avoid the crowds and afternoon heat. Before 10:00am is good and take your time. National Gallery is disappoiting.
Great Views. Take a cliff railway to this castle hill and enjoy the view of the city.
Really, really pretty!. Just a great area to walk around and soak up the atomosphere!

Beautiful. The side of Buda is absolutely beautiful and the views overlooking Pest is well worth the stop. I wish we would have had more time to hire a guide to fully understand the history. Well with the stop.
lovely views. nice views very little traffic,lots of restaurants

Nice walk and view. It was very nice, after having been in the Gellert baths early morning to walk to the Varhegy hill, we took it from the side of the city Buda (not the Danube side) and the walk is smooth and easy.Once on the top we walked to the Basilica and enjoyd the view of the city, do it!!!! I do not recomend any restaurant there, just walk down from the noth entry and look for a restaurant on the way down to the Danube...
Excellent views of Pest. Nice view of the Pest side. At night the Parliament buildings are well lighted and is very brightly seen from the Castle Hill.
Well worth a visit. Interesting to see and brilliant views over the city
Very nice. Everybody have to take a look in the famous castle of buda.
View. Realy beautiful. Reasonable hike up the hill. Impressive views from the top.

A castle in The Air. Very interesting despite the climb to it, we were lucky there weren't so many people around, in summer the crowds could be a problem. Plenty of eating places though some were empty, was this a signal about the quality of the place? Also, make sure you visit on a clear day, if not, the views over the city are non-existant
Walked Over the Danube to Pest. Breathtaking views of the Buda side, the Danube and Parlament.
The best place to walk around. This is inside the castle you can feel ( and walk on ) history. Buildings are amazing nice. Went there many time summer and winter time to walk

Worth the Visit. Although it's pricey to take the lift up - about 1500 for one return ticket, I wouldn't recommend walking since you're going to do lots of walking when you get up there. I went when it was foggy out and it made for some very unique photos, especially with the cathedral rising from above the fog. I wouldn't recommend eating or drinking there - too expensive and tourist traps. Also the museums were not that special. But the views were worth the return ticket. Also the streets are charming to stroll down.
Take Bus 16 from Deak Ferenc subway station.. Lots to do up here. The easiest way to get there is Bus 16 from Deak Ferenc Ter (the main subway station).

The best part of Budapest. This is the best part of Budapest! It has an excellent view and it is very beautiful to have a walk in the little streets of the area. You can also have a coffee or a wine over there.

Try Ruszwurm cafe.. We did the Castle Hill walk in the Rick Steves Budapest book. Skipped the pricey funicular and took the #16 bus from Deak Ferenc Ter up to the start of the walk. There are several spots for great panoramic views of Pest: outside the castle and Fisherman's bastion. The excavation of a Jewish cemetery en route back from the castle was interesting. Skip the tour of the wine cellar unless you have a high level of interest and knowledge of winemaking. The Matthias church was closed to the public because of a wedding, but was still a nice view. We finished our walk with a stop at the Ruszwurm cafe, which served gingerbread back in the medieval period. It still serves great desserts, and we enjoyed the elegant decor.
Funicular.. Funicular made walking easier after uphill trip. There is so much to see, our 4 day stay was too short.

A Great Day TRIP. Depending on your physical limits, you can do a self-guided tour using the Hop-On/Hop/Off bus or the Funicular. We opted for a guided tour provided by our River Cruise Line, AMAWaterways. A lot of history has evolved here. Also a great place for photographs of this location plus the area surrounding the "Chain" bridge linking Buda and Pest.
Great view, beautiful buildings, nice atmosphere. Here you have the best view of Budapest, when wondering along Castle Hill and the Fishermans Bastillion. Cosy, beautiful and genuine.

stunning night views. great for walking around but weren't sure which buildings were which..that said, the view and how it was lit at night was absolutely STUNNING!!..and the view of the river and city are not to be missed
Very impressive. The views were unbelievble, we went on the hop on hop off bus this saved us a walk, he sights from there were beautiful
Budapest, Hungary. The views, cultural quality, architecture and historical value are excellent and need to be seen and enjoyed.
Great location overseeing Pest. I was able to take cracking pictures of Pest, you could easily spent there hours exploring the site, castle and museum
Great views. Easy access from the Buda side of the chain bridge, not a tough climb and well worth the effort.
Beautiful. Nothing to dislike about this. It was utterly cold when I visited, and worth every moment.
Must do. Fantastic view, lovely medieval streets, impressive buildings, great atmosphere
wine heaven.... go there during the wine festival it's astounding and the quality of the wines are excellent..
always very nice. likes evrything, with wonderful weather for november
Great views and interesting buildings. From St Mathias Church to the Fisherman's Bastion to the views of Parliament and a funicular to ride, this area has it all!!,

Very pretty place. Very unique and pretty place.
Make sure to visit the art gallery and try shooting some arrows from a custom made bow outside the castle.

Beautiful. The Castle Hill was very close to our accommodation, Gold Hotel Buda, so we visited it on our first day. It is a wall surrounded area with beautiful old buildings. The Castle hosts a gallerie with nice paintings. The Matthias Church and the Fisherman Bastion are also nearby, do not miss to visit them. The view is also beautiful from this point of the city.

Nice ambience and views. We walked up to the Castle at night, and found an elevator that took us the balance (for a small charge, but worth it). The inner courtyard is magical at night. There was a musician playing, and a number of couples strolling around. We did not return during the day, as the museums were not places we wanted to go to, but we enjoyed it for the night we were there.
Walk around to really experience to neighborhood. Stop by the shops and restaurants, look out over Buda and Pest and the river. Get great strudels in the bakeries
Beautiful view!. The view from this place is just magnificent. Full view of the city and the Danube river.
Amazing views. Take the cable car, only a minute long but worth it. Views are beautiful but nothing until you go at night, then it is amazing. Take the time to wander around when it's quiet.
A must see view. The view from the hill is spectacular and not to be missed. The Castle Hill area is very pretty.
looks good but a bit polished. This particular site looks good (fisherman's bastion and such) but also a bit too clean (recently renovated). I think that spoils teh authentic look a bit.

Walk for the exercise. There is the funicular that will ride you up or down the side of the hill but if you have the stamina and want adventure and romance that the natives find, take the paths from the bottom of the hill and enjoy the view all the way up to the castle district. Then you can turn around and take in the view and feel you've earned the pastries you will (should definitely) enjoy at one of the oldest pastry shops in the city - Russzwurm. It may sound funny, it may be tiny and crowded, yes even more expensive than other places - but that is the only place I'll eat a "kremes" Napolitan to the rest of you. Absolute perfection and worth every blessed calorie.
Lovely architecture and views. We went there on a nice sunny day. We got to see some beautiful views of Budapest and of course got great pictures.

You can't miss this beaing in Budapest. For me attraction nr 1. For the beautiful architecture. For spectacular view from there. And for the incredible climate of the place. I was so lucky that my hotel- Burg hotel was located just in front of St Mathias church so I could admire this place even from the hotel window. The view of Budapest with Parliament from there is awasome during a day and night as well. You must go and see this. You can take a bus nr 16 from Deak Ter or the other stop near the Danube river and bridge if you want.

Amazing architecture. Just amazing place. Definitely everyone should visit. Stunning architecture. wonderful view. We spent more than 3 hours there and it wasn't enough. lots of people though and part of the castle was in reconstruction. But still we could see a lot. I will definitely visit again.
Must go. One of the places you must go to in Budapest. That whole area is not to be missed

Castle Hill is the Center of Old Buda. This hill overlooking the Danube is the historic center of Budapest. It was bombed to rubble during WWII, but it has been lovingly rebuilt. The views here at either day or night are magnificent.
Gorgeous sight!. The Fisherman's Bastion is my favorite! Be sure to visit the area right before sunset!
Beautiful. Beautiful views. Lovely area with a number of museums.
A Must See!. Beautiful views! This is a lovely place to go for lunch and to spend the afternoon. There is plenty to see. My favorite part of Budapest!
Must see. Castle district, St. Matthyas church and Fisherman's Bastion are a must for any visitor to Budapest. Very beautiful at night when lit.
great view!. Very well kept, and imposing as architecture, truly an attraction! The view is excellent, by day or night !
Excellent views from here. a lovely sunny day helped just took in the views, could have done with more places to sit, visit to Tourist information really tried to sell a river dinner cruise,

Majesty and beauty rolled into one. The architecture of the place is stunning and you understand what an important city this would have been when you take in its imperial grandeur. The views from the place are to die for. Get yourself acquainted with the place before you go because there is so much to see that you can get confused. You need to search for the toilets however, and it's not free.

Awesome view in the night. Worth the quite long walk and climb, The Buda Castle offers a magical feeling and views in the night. Though very crowded, we had a great time hanging around the walls and enjoying the city's panorama.Some things were in recontruction still but globally the site was in excellent condition.
Panoramic. Worth a visit. Lots of different things to see and do in this area of the city. The views were impressive.
hill without an obvious castle. worth a visit to the area.cafes take advantage of the tourist area with pricing
A must. The view and the history are worth the trek and a well-guided tour guide makes the visit very enjoyable.
What a view. The history and the views of the castle hill make this a must see on the sighseeing trip

great views. We took a metro, tram, & the funicular up to the top of the hill - we thought it enhanced the trip! We were lucky enough to arrive just before the changing of the guard, then enjoyed a stroll around & the great views across the river. It has a very different 'feel' to the Pest side, & well worth a visit.
Very nice. Excellent location , should spend atleast half a day here, Can see the roman excavasion near to the big palace.

Must-see, preferably after dark when the city lights are on!. This wasn't my first trip to Budapest, but whenever I go I try to take time to visit the Castle Hill. Walking around the castle and the Fisherman's bastion after dark is one of my favorite things to do! It's not as crowded as during the day and the view with the Parliament building and chain bridge lights reflecting in the Danube's water is great!I'd stay away from the Furnicular, though unless you're really short on time or have restricted mobility. It's much more interesting to take a walk down the stairs near Fishermen's Bastion - as for going up, if you don't feel like walking you can just take the "Varbusz" (16, 16A). The bus stop for this route is across Széll Kálmán tér metro stop. (Széll Kálmán square, formerly known as Moszkva tér). You need to go up some stairs and cross the street towards the Castle Hill and there's the bus stop! The sign for the stop even has a little image of the castle showing which bus takes you there.
Stunning view.. Well worth the trip up. View is stunning.We went on bus up..
Little bit too touristy. Pretty, but much more expensive than on the Pest side
Castle. Great views from here, of the city itself, and The Danube, stretching into the distance.

very close to Gold Hotel Buda. It was just a short walk to get to the Castle hill from Gold Hotel Buda. I liked the wonderful buildings, the Fisherman bastion, the Matthias church and also the beautiful view.

Castle Hill. Fisherman's Bastion and St Matthias are a must see. The church is amazing. Visit the patisserie Ruszwurm in back streets - the oldest bakery and well worth a visit for coffee and cakes and the building itself.
Great views and lovely buildings. Great view of the Pest side and also to the Buda hills.

Wonderful way to spend the better part of a day. The views from Castle Hill are stunning and we spent the greater part of a day just wondering around admiring the views. Did of course stop for coffee and cake at the Ruiszwurm Coffee House. We also visited the Matyas Church and the Fisherman's Bastion. We took the funicular railway up and jumped on the local bus to get back down. Castle Hill offers much more of course - an excuse to go back maybe.
view amazing. Amazing view - recommended for sure. make sure you go up when it is nice weather

Fantastic View from High Up in Buda. This is not only an interesting area to explore, it also gives you fantastic views from high on in the Buda area.The castle area is hard to believe. That is, it's hard to believe that people actually loved that way back in the times of the emperors. The emperors had so much wealth they lived high and surrounded themselves with tradesmen and craftsmen to help maintain their comfort.Don't forget to check the old police building that was used by the secret police during the communist years. It still has the bullet marks on the front from the revolution.
Not a must-do. Not so interesting - a small micro city with the only real castle attraction being the church. The St. Stephen's in Pest is better.

Breathtaking view. This is well worth the hike to the top. There are some steep parts but after we got up there it also seemed there is a road you can walk that doesn't have so many challenging parts (but obviously would be a longer walk.) Regardless the view of the city and surrounding area is amazing.

Nice place.... My first impression after visit...this is a huge place and you have to take at least few hours to see whole castle.There is kind of different monuments and you need a time to enjoy in every of them.Also,there is some good Hungarian food to try if you are hungry and drink during the walk especially in summer time.There is no fee for entrance,just for elevator if you came from Citadela hill side like me and it is only 50 cents...

A long walk but worth it when you get to the top!. We stayed on the Pest side of the river and wanted to walk right to the top of Castle Hill, it was a bit of a trek but well worth it! there are some steep steps toward the end of the journey but by the time you stop and take a look at your surroundings you realise how worth while it was! Breathtaking scenery of the Pest side and definitely the best view you'll ever get of Parliament!At the top there was quite a few tourists and we did feel like we were battling our way through to get the best photos, but this is to be expected at such a beautiful place.They were quite a few entertainers dotted around including musicians, jugglers and for a small fee a chance to hold a bird of prey (which i did and got some amazing photos!)You really can't visit Budapest without visiting Castle hill!

Best view in Budapest!. From the Castle Hill you have the best view over Buda and Pest! The Castle and the Parks are nicely maintained and it's a perfect surrounding to chill out and enjoy the view. It is also possible to buy souvenirs and go to restaurants up here for reasonable prices! If you are in Budapest: Visit this place, it's one of the must dos!

A must when visiting Budapest. We stayed at the Hapimag Resort in the Castle Hill (Buda) district of Budapest. We used our Diamond Resort points to stay there and were very happy with the place. It was clean, pretty and the staff was very helpful. The Castle Hill area is charming. The architecture is mostly a re-make of the 18th century styles recreated after WWII. The Halaszbastya restaurant in the Fishermen's Bastion section of Castle Hill was the most romantic and expensive place we ate in. The restaurant overlooked the Danube with the Pest side of the city beyond. The food was remarkedly good. It didn't have to be because we would have paid just to sit and look at the scenery. It even had a three piece combo playing gypsy music! On the other hand, a place to avoid was the Pest Buda restaurant on Fortuna Utca. It was a rip off.

A Great Stroll. Castle Hill is a must on your trip to Budapest. It can easily consume half a day of strolling, sitting in a cafe, walking through the museum and just people watching. Accessible by bus. Breathtaking photographs and a good location for a relaxing unwind drink in the evening.
Fantastic. My wife's relatives lived right next to the Hill, so I walked up twice early in the morning. Its really nice up there with no traffic. The views are great.

Could spend all day there. Beautiful! We walked around to the Hospital in the Rock the first time up, and took the Siklo another time. Plenty to walk around see, musicians in the square, cafes and shops and a great view of the city!
Great views!. A must see but get there early before the buses desend! We got there at 10 and it was already busy!

Far more to see than we Expected. We took the travelator located by the Chain Bridge to the top. It is a much bigger area than we thought and there is so much to see. Alot of people go to see the Palace, St Mathias Church and Fisherman's Bastion all of which are very impressive and you are only scratching the surface of all the attractions there are to see. It is like a small village up there with several cobbled streets with nice restaurants and pubs.It was quite busy with lot's of tour buses and I imagine in Summer some people would be put off as it is to busy. However, if you wander a couple of streets away from the major tourist sites it is not busy at all.We spent two full day's there and enjoyed every minute of it.

Castle Hill Budapest Hungary. This is an amazing site to visit. Spent 2-3 hours and could have stayed longer. Views are not to be missed. Be sure to take time and walk the entire area, to get the best impressions of the buildings and community. St Mathias Catheral is excellent. Fisherman's Bastillion is good also. Take time to relax and have a drink while watching the Danube.

Great view but too many daytrippers...... We got the funicular up to the castle district and it was a pretty speedy journey. At the top, we simply walked around, checking out the atmosphere. The buildings were pretty impressive but, because we had little time, we weren't able to go inside any of them apart from the Matthias Church and the Hilton hotel.There are magnificent views from both sides of the castle district so it's well worth going up there. However, I would choose the timing of your visit very carefully. We went about 11'ish to discover the area, especially around St Matthias Church, totally inundated with daytrippers off the river cruise boats. Fortunately most people respected the silence within the church itself which was a joy and a pleasure to behold. A very stunning building and well worth a visit. We also popped into the Hilton because of rave reviews we'd read - it's OK, pretty modern, with great views from the restaurant which was closed for a special event. Rather than take the funicular, we walked down the stairs (located by the toilets near to the church) - and it was a very pleasant walk, discovering parts of Buda which normally the daytrippers wouldn't get to see.

Absolutley gorgeous (Astronomic cost of coffee and cake tho !). We spent a very pleasant afternoon wandering around castle hill in late May 2011. The whole area was far more gorgeous than we were expecting. The Palace area is breathtaking - imposing buildings, loveley fountain and beautifull gardens. The Old town area (which - like all of the area - was actually rebult after WW2) is delightfull and manages a real medieval feel. We simply hadn't allocated enough time to see the whole place and expected to spend an hour or two here - it was a bright warm sunny day and we spent 4 ! View down to the Parlaiment building is impressive and indeed the view of the whole city is good.The only caveat is the cafes. We had a small coke / coffee and 2 small cakes - almost £20 ! Loads of extras loaded on already hefty basics so its possibly wise to eat elsewhere !

Nice visit for first full day in Budapest. We took the metro to Moszkva Ter and walked up here after arriving the day before. If you're a tourist this is one of the main places to go. We enjoyed walking around looking at the different buildings, the view over the Danube and having a couple refreshment stops at the outside cafes. We walked down the hill and enjoyed seeing the Funicular and our walk accross the Chain Bridge back to the Pest side.

A Very Picturesque Area - Filled With Character. The whole area of castle hill is a very picturesque with things to see at every turn; For a wheelchair user it is a little difficult as there are so many cobbles and some of the paths/roads are not well maintained so easy to get stuck in ruts or divets.
